reviews.review: Beautiful . See the Chain Bridge both during the day & at night. It's beautiful plus you get great views of Buda & Pest, plus the Danube river.

Nice at night. Busy bridge, heavy traffic but beautifully lit at night and of historical importance joining Buda and Pest. To cross is essential and come back over at night time to see it at its best.

Key piece of Hungarian history. Please make sure you take the time to do a little reading about the bridge before visiting. The significance and the history of this piece of engineering helped shape the Budapest we see today. Fantastic photo opportunities and wonderful views of both Buda and Pest.
Lovely views. The views of Castle Hill are great as you are walking over this bridge, equally if you're walking to Pest you can see the lovely Parliament building

Well designed and beautiful bridege. This may be THE bridge you must take to reach Buda Castle from the east bank. The architecture of the bridge was beautiful and the view from the bride on the Danube toward ever direction (especially the both banks) was excellent. It was an enjoyable walk going to the Buda Castle and back to the hotel.
Like a little Paris . Short bridge, some love locks, great views, nice hike up to castle since tram not in service . A must.
Very pretty. Walk over it, see it from both sides of the river, take a taxi ride on the Buda side, through the tunnel and out across the bridge - it is a super cool sight.

Stroll across this beautiful bridge. This bridge links Burda and Pest and is especially beautiful at night when it is wonderfully lit. It provides a great way to see the wonderful lights of the Castle Hill, Parliament and more. It is a popular night time stroll and I felt very safe by myself. Stroll across one side, loop under on the Burda side and back the other side. Take your camera!

Beautiful walk. Whenever I see a bridge I have to cross it. Fortunately Hungary has several ! You can check out all of the beautiful buildings , parks and squares, walk along the Danube, have a drink at one of the many restaurants along the way.

Fascinating bit of Engineering. The Chain Bridge is easily accessible if you are staying in the central districts of Buda or Pest. It is a fascinating bit of history that allows you to walk across the Danube. I would not recommend doing this since public transport is much, much faster.
Beautiful spot. Make sure to walk across the lovely bridge at day and night time for optimal views. If you have time, walk across some of the other bridges nearby to fully appreciate the Chain Bridge

Great place to take photos from. This is a pretty iconic bridge shown on many of the magnets and pictures of Budapest sold around the city, and its main attraction is the photo sights of Budapest you can snap from here. You'll probably be crossing this bridge a lot from Buda to Pest and back. It's greatly lit up at night, and very pretty to stroll alongside. You can hear the travelers that pass you by speaking many different languages as you take your billionth photo of Parliament from here.At least I did. :D

A bridge full of history. Another historic place that was destroyed by the Nazis during the second world war and was rebuilt to remember the importance of this bridge in Budapest. The main way that communicated Buda and Pest and still remains very useful.
Family trip. Very nice bridge, one of the Budapest symbols. Recommend to take a walk from Buda side to Pest. Very beautiful at night.
Nicest bridge. The chain bridge has some striking lion statues at either end and looks really great when lit up at night. It's worth going for a photo!

Lovely Photo stop. This Bridge is stunning and the views are amazing , day and night, it's iconic so the perfect place for a photo stop. Its facing the funicular railway so a good place to get your bearings and a lovely crossing from Pest to Buda across the Danube( which is green btw!). A must to see when in Budapest .

Beautiful bridge, especially at night.. Stroll the bridge, taking in the view. Take a picture with the lions at either end. But, whatever you do, find time to see this bridge at night. Magnificent, along with other buildings in the area that are lit up at night. Just gorgeous.
Wow. You cannot visit Budapest without crossing this bridge it is so majestic and at night is even more as it leads to the castle from pest

Beautiful historical bridge day & night. Look out for Budapest pictures and you'll notice the outstanding and beautiful Chain Bridge. you can walk safely across the bridge from Pest City to Buda City and vice-versa. This is one of the most famous and visited bridges by the large number of tourists visiting Budapest. It's located very near to the House of Parliament, Shoes by the Danube, Margaret bridge and Margaret island. While walking across the bridge, which is very safe,you can enjoy the surroundings and all the majestic buildings and monuments.It's impressive during the night because it is lit up with hundreds of lights. The Chain bridge is guarded by two large stone lions on each side of the bridge.Watch out for cruise ships and other boats crossing the danube and sail underneath the bridge.

Over the Danube and up to the Castle. Not a pedestrian bridge, but has separate walkways. Provided it's not too windy or raining, it provides a nice stroll from Pest towards the funicular railway up to the Castle complex. The chain aspect has historical interest as a suspension bridge.

Lovely and romantic. The chain bridge is especially beautiful at night when the lights on surrounding structures are illuminated. This combined with the buzz from the excited tourists and locals makes this a must do in Budapest!
Magnificent Bridge. It was a must do, to walk across this bridge during the day, but if at all possible go at night as well. The lights really make its magnificence stand out.

Historical Bridge. This is an important bridge . It was completed in 1848 & was the first permanent crossing between Buda & Pest. It is a beautiful sight at night because the towers at either end are illuminated. In Summer, the bridge closes to vehicular traffic to host cultural festivals.

Memories of Home. The bridge is beautiful in its own right, either walking from Buda or Pest. Elevated photos from Furnicular( sic) or at night a must.
As a New Yorker many similarities to Brooklyn Bridge.

You're not a true tourist if you don't walk across this iconic landmark.. This is the famous bridge that appears on many photos of Budapest. Go for a walk, if only to say you have seen the 'imperfect' lions....
Good for a pic. Crossed on it to get to Castle Hill Area. Good for a nice city pic. At night it is lit up. During rush hour gets congested.

The beautifull Chain bridge . The chain between Buda and Pest. At one side you will find the Parlement and the other side the Buda palace. It gives a nice feeling and view when you walk over this bridge.
It's a bridge. Yes it's a bridge, but it's a very splendid one guarded by lions and spanning the huge Danube. It looks impressive at night all lit up.
Walk the bridge. Walk over the bridge for some great views. Easy and safe walk - great on a fall day. Excellent photo opportunities.

Crossing from Buda to Pest. If you visit Budapest you pretty much guranteed to cross this bridge whether on foot, bus or car, but the best way is to walk. The walkways are wide and seperated from the road traffic. You get fine views over the Danube and to both Buda and Pest. Enjoy the views of the parliament building and castle hill. Watch the boats pass underneath. At night it is lit up and takes on a whole new light where you can see the lights reflecting in the river underneath. It's free too.
Beautiful Chain Bridge. Be sure to walk across the Chain Bridge, the views are incredible. It is an easy walk and once across you can take the funicular up to the Budapest Museum1
One of the highlights of Budapest. Definitely the place to start your Budapest trip from, this is the first bridge that connected the two cities.

Walk over the Danube on this fabulous bridge!. The Chain Bridge connects Buda with Pest. It's a beautiful bridge and provides a view of the Danube River as well as both sides of the city. An early morning walk provides spectacular views and great photo opportunities. Just watch out for the bicycles and skateboards. But don't miss this great Bridge. The Four Seasons Hotel meets you at the Pest side. If you are lucky to have a sunny day and the sun shining on the hotel in the late afternoon, the gold leaf on the building will shine back at you for a great photo op.

A must "walk"!. That is if you want to get from Buda to Pest or vice versa. Or drive I suppose but walking is more fun! It is particularly beautiful when it is lit up at night with the buildings on the Castle Hill as a back drop!

one but not the only. One of the five bridges in strick center. His cousins are not very outstanding but this bridge has a history, You have to seen it on postcards but it is nothing like have a walk thrue and also great view from St. Gellert hill.

The first permanent stone-bridge. The first permanent stone-bridge connecting Pest and Buda. It is one of the symbolic buildings of Budapest, the most widely known bridge of the Hungarian capital: the Chain Bridge.The view is fantastic!

Beautiful Bridge . This iconic bridge is beautiful at night all lit up! We used this bridge many a time during our visit, seeing both sides. There is many great photo opportunities along the bridge of both banks and of the bridge itself. A must see at night!

That view though. Crossed it at least 10 times during my 4 day visit. Marvelous structure with vldifferernt scenic views in either side of it. Loved how the pedestrians are separated from the vehicles.

Nice bridge to look at. This bridge goes across the Danube connecting Buda and Pest. It has interesting architecture and a long history. It was originally opened in the 1890s, but the Nazis blew it up in WWII, so it had to be rebuilt. The good news is they had the original plan and photos, and the bridge is essentially identical to the old one, and it also has pedestrian access for great views of both sides of the city.
Danube Bridge. This one of the many bridges around the area but it leads to many attraction places where one would discover from just overlooking from the road side.
Amazing views. It was a nice walk on chain bridge. You can see nice views of the river and other bridges. you can cross the bridge to take the funicular and go up to castle hill.
Landmark of Budapest. One of the most beautiful bridge at Europe. Really close to the Buda Castle and the city center. At night, the view is amazing, showering with light.

Beautiful bridge. We got some great pictures from the Buda side of the bridge. There's a circle on that side that's easy to get to and allows for some good pics. I found the Pest side better for night time pictures of the bridge but its a bit dangerous getting over to the walkway that gives the best pictures. Cross carefully!
a Budapest landmark. You can see this gorgeous bridge either by walking to it or by riding the Hop-on Hop-off bus. Get there and see it!!!
Magical City.. Beautiful bridge with spectacular structure. Just crossing the bridge itself, you can sense the history. Amazing to see at night with all its lights on.
See it at night!. OK, it's just a bridge, but when lit up at night it's magical. Well worth the walk across and back. But you must see it at night, with all the lights on!

Lovely views. Lovely views from the bridge and the city of beautiful so worth seeing.
Great bars on both sides of the bridge.

Beautiful at night. If you only get one chance to see the bridge, go at night. It is beautiful at night as is the entire vista of the Danube through Budapest. It is not so much something to do as it is something to see. We did walk across it several times to get to the other side but it's primary attraction is its beauty at night. It was busy with both foot and car/train traffic. It does provide great views of the Danube through Budapest. Viewed from a riverboat all of Budapest including the bridge are spectacular at night. Make it a point to take a river cruise/view at night.
Very romantic place!. Very nice place to have a walk! You can see both parts of the city. Amazing view can make your day joyful no matter what is the weather outside.
A nice morning walk. We took a walk from our hotel to the Buda castle via this bridge, some really good views on what was a crisp October morning. I will return to Budapest.
Walk. Nice walk on a fine day. Lovely views along the river and a good spot to linger to boat watch as long as it's not too crowded.
Walk across chain bridge. After visiting Buda we walked across the chain bridge into Pest. A beautiful structure amazingly rebuilt after its extensive destruction in 1945. Stunningly lit up at night.

Beautiful bridge. We used this bridge many times whilst in the city, as we were staying on the Buda side and most of the things to do are in Pest. Both in the day and at night it's beautiful, a feat of engineering indeed. Whilst we were there they closed it for the Budapest marathon, so we got to walk on the road part and see all of the bridge from the very middle. Definitely worth seeing.

Great Bridge. As one of the main thoroughfares between Buda and Pest, the Chain Bridge is a great draw card for people and cars. We walked across it 5 times during our stay here and enjoyed every time. With great views up and down the river, it provides great backdrops for photos. A must see and visit if visiting Budapest.

One of the must sees of Budapest. A beautiful bridge well worth walking across as there are wonderful views from both sides. The bridge was closed to traffic when we visited because of the Red Bull Air Race and when the pilots are flying it is closed to pedestrians as well. There was no flying under the bridge when we were there as there had been a lot of rain and the river was very high. We had excellent views of the demonstration flights from Castle Hill. Be warned - the Hop On Hop Off buses do not go to Buda during the air race but will give you an extra day to make up.
Nice walk. Nice walk alonge the river, near is Mark. You can walk, ride a bike. Nice panorama. We love that place

Famous and crowded. This bridge connects Buda and Pest side of Budapest passing through Danube River. On each end, there is a spot where many people took the picture and on one other side you can find the Funicular going up to the castle. I would recommend walking from the Pest side to Buda then take a funicular up to Buda castle.
Interesting story behind the bridge. Best accessed through a walking tour so you can understand the story behind the bridge. It is a beautiful bridge that gives you a great panorama of Budapest.
So Nice.. Really nice to watch this beautifull bridge with my boyfriend.Easy to find.Nice to walk.In the evening the lights go on, then it's also very beautifull. You have to do this when ur here.
View of bridge from our room. We enjoyed a spectacular view of chain bridge from our room at the Soffitel . Bridge connects Buda & Pest.....nice engineering.

It's a bridge. This bridge is a pleasant way of crossing the Danube.lt's easier than swimming and warmer this time of year.Nice views of the river and looks nice at night. Mostly rebuilt.,and after all it is only a bridge

Our Boat Docked At Chain Bridge. Our Trip started in Budapest so we found our River Boat Cruise when we found the Chain Bridge . It was a great landmark for us.The bridge goes from Buda on one side of the river to Pest on the other side.
It's neat. Not much to see, it is fun to walk across but the Charles Bridge blows this away. Still worth seeing though as it is very beautifully made.

Budapest - Hungary - Chain Bridge - Great bridge but not my Favourite in Budapest. This Chain Bridge, designed by Englishman William Clark was the first permanent bridge connecting the two former cities of Buda and Pest together and was opened in 1849. The bridge spans the River Danube and is about 375 metres in length making it an ideal distance to cross on foot and admire the design. It is a great bridge and so historic for the city of Budapest and something everyone should see, but there are a number of other bridges which are impressive and one other which I like more. The Pest side of the bridge runs from Roosevelt Square and outside the Gresham Palace across to the Buda Hill Funicular on the western side of the Danube. Its great seen from all angles including Castle Hill, Fisherman's Bastion and probably most impressively from a river boat on the Danube.
Great attraction. Walking across the bridge give a splendid insight to how this engineering piece was done. You can see the details of the bridge including the reason for its name

Nice reminder of Indian movie shot. Chain Bridge is one of the biggest attraction at Budapest. Passed through it allmost four times. Twice in a bus once in boat and once walking while illuminated in night. Everything a different feeling addition to attraction. Famous handi film song HUM DIL CHUKE SANAD pictures Ed on this bridge.
Connection between Buda and Pest. We stayed on the Pest side and crossed the Chain Bridge to get to the cable car. It was a pleasant walk as you see the Danube river.

Free walking tour over the Chain Bridge is a must do.. On a recent city break in lovely Budapest we went on the free walking tour which took us across the Chain Bridge from Pest to Buda. Very enjoyable with wonderful views and an excellent guide.
ideal in evening when its lit up. close to intercon hotel you can walk across to the other side and watch numerous cruise along Danube
Historic. We were on a Vicking Cruise and the River Boat was parked next to it - wonderful. If you are in Budapest you will not miss this - a nice walking tour is wonderful in the day or night.

magnificent construction works. We had planned to take a taxi across the bridge one way, but when we saw the queue of cars, we chose to walk, although there were small children in the party. We do not regret that choice, it was an experience to cross the bridge as "guarded" by lions.We took a trip up the Buda side with Funicular, it was also an experience before we walked over the Chain Bridge back to Pest side.

Interesting . For bridge lovers, this is a lovely old bridge. Destroyed during the second world war and rebuilt in the same style after the war. I assume it is called the chain bridge because the steel plates that support it are linked with pins and do resemble a chain.

A must visit. A must visit, you need to cross the river to get to the funicular railway anyway. Beautiful architecture, the character of Budapest. However, don't forget to bring your life jacket as it is rusting through all over the place. You can see the river flow by looking through the metal plates, what is left of them. This is a real demonstration of how poor Hungary really is. Keep visiting them to keep their tourist numbers up. Long live Hungary and the Chain bridge.
Wow. Old and historic lit at night worth walking over just to do it the first bridge linking Buda and Pest

Perfect!!! Must!. Just go there and walk!!! Don't talk the bus or taxi or whatever! Walk! It's so damn beautiful... we actually walked twice on the bridge and twice with the Hop on Hop off bus, but walking is way better. It's absolutely amazing, we took our time there and took some really beautiful photos. It's a must!!

A great bridge with great views. The Chain Bridge is one of several bridges across the Danube River. It is the first permanent bridge between Buda and Pest. We were told it opened in 1849. We walked across the Chain Bridge. It is a magnificent bridge – picturesque. I took several photos from the bridge. Great photo for photo taking.
Romantic scene!. Beautiful and classic bridge! One of the gems you can see for free in Budapest! Great on evening too when the lights are on
Walking on this bridge from Buda to Pest is amazing. Perfect bridge for pictures. Lovely walk from one side to the other of the city. Its usually pretty crowded but definitely worth a visit.
An interesting landmark.. What can you say about a bridge. It is an interesting piece of engineering, it was destroyed in the war. It looks quite pretty.

Great "link" between Buda and Pest. I walked back and forth over this bridge multiple times. It is an excellent link between the major tourist sites....historical buildings...and gives fantastic views of the Danube. Quit a stunning landmark.
Lovely bridge. One of many bridges in Budapest. Looks lovely when all lit up at night. Can get very busy and crowded at times (mostly with tourists taking photos) as it is very scenic

Must attraction. Must attraction to vist and to cross the bridge from one side to other .
Good point to take photos on the danuba.
Great Bridge. Great Bridge structure and access to Bude. Very nice looking sculptures of lions. Very impressive and safe to cross.

Very nice bridge... A well maintained & beautiful bridge..
There is no point of coming here with no guidance.. It's a bridge...
Cross Over The Danube. A walk across Chain Bridge gives one a sense of the power and volume of the Danube as well as great views of the city whose history is intertwined with the river.
Lovely Bridge with Great Views. We walked across many bridges but this one was a favorite. Beautiful views of the city and castle hill.

Outdoors . Beautiful walk. Picturesque. Lots of photo opportunity. We were lucky with weather to walk. There are lots of opportunities to catch busses. You can plug your head phones in on the bus, to hear the history. Greet meeting area for tourists information.

Wonderful Historic Chain Bridge. The chain Bridge over the Danube shares it's design with several other bridges such as the Clifton and Menai Bridge suspension bridges. Wonderfull to see at night from the River when all lit up.
Swindon visits the Chain Bridge in Budapest.. OMG, what a fantastic bridge over the widest river I've ever seen. Took about 7-8 minutes to cross. Big drop.

A quiet day on the bridge. We were lucky enough to visit the city during marathon weekend and the bridge was closed to all vehicle traffic, leaving it free for us to walk down the centre.
A very attractive and historic bridge with great views of the river and palace.
Impressive bridge. While walking across Danube this is one of the best choices. It offers view to Parliament houses and other great buildings in Budapest. It's also beautiful in the night.

Chain Bridge-Great Photo Opportunity. We had the luck of visiting Budapest during the Budapest Marathon. The Chain Bridge was closed to cars, so we were able to walk across it in the road. Even with the cars, you can get great photos of the Danube and the two cities. Beautiful example of old architecture!

Good walk and great photos from Széchenyi Chain Bridge.. Bridges are interesting and many have fascinating histories. This suspension one spans the River Danube between eastern Buda and western Pest and was the first permanent bridge across the Danube in Hungary. When it opened in 1849 it was thought to be one of the engineering wonders of its day. So yes, worth a walk and a great spot to take some good river and city photos.
Must see. This bridge has a fascinating history. I think of all of them in Budapest this is the most famous. Must visit, very touristy!
Locals love it - ....... It really is a point of reference between the two parts of the city. Easy to transfers on foot. Also this is the area where Viking River Cruises docks. Wonderful cafes close.
Must see. It's right at the center of all the action in the downtown area, so I guess you've got to go there anyway.

Scenic and breathtaking. The first permanent bridge between Buda and Pest, opened in 1849. Standing at the Pest side, one can see Buda castle and the other attractions on Castle Hill. Walking along the bridge to get from the Pest side to Buda is an enjoyable walk, viewing Margaret bridge to the north and Elizabeth bridge to the south. Do look out for the pairs of lions at each of the abutments.

Walk to Pest.. This is one of the many bridges which connects the two parts of this city. Designed by William T. Clark it took ten years to build and was considered to be an engineering wonder of its time in the 19th. century.

Main bridge linking Buda and Pest. We have the chance to pass by this wonderful bridge a few times, both day and night, during our latest visit but have no time to cross such this time. You could have beautiful views on both sides of the bridge and it was highly recommended to others to come and visit this bridge while in Budapest.
A highlight of city tour and walking on bridge.. We enjoyed seeing the Chain Bridge and hearing the history. The next day we walked the bridge to take some great photos.
Beautiful Bridge-see it at night. Beautiful bridge across the Danu (Danube) in Budapest. Landmark for the city, and one of the beautiful sites to see.
Gorgeous views. This bridge is lovely too look at and has gorgeous views of the danube, Only down side is it can be pretty windy in the winter months so take a jacket!

The famous bridge of Budapest. One cannot miss this wonderful bridge connecting Buda & Pest, I recommend you cross it at least twice on foot at different times it is also very beautiful to walk at night when it is nicely lit.
Perfect spot for the sunset. People grab drinks or dinner and hang out on the bridge to watch the sun set over the Danube. Such a beautiful place to enjoy Budapest!

Takes you where you want to go. This is one of many bridges that cross the Danube to get you between Buda and Pest. It's an easy walk from one side to the other, protected from traffic. On the Buda side, the bridge ends right at the funicular that takes you up the hill to the castle and all the Buda sights. At night, it is one of the many illuminated structures that make Budapest beautiful.

The Chain bridge. You can walk across it from Buda to Pest and back. Clark Ádám square at the Buda end of the Chain Bridge and Széchenyi Square – the Four Seasons Hotel Gresham Palace at the Pest end of the Chain Bridge. Nice at the day and the night time.
Beautiful at Night. Well worth walking over at night to the Pest side. Lite up like a Christmas tree. The pedestrian walkways are nice and wide so easy to walk over.

Beautiful sight. This bridge is really huge and long and has one side for pedestrians. One can see complete stretch of Danube and it looks lovely. One one side is the newer town and on the other the charm of old town

Beautiful day or night..... The chain bridget connects the Budda and the Pest side to each other. Our last night on the Viking Tour we enjoyed a night time view of the Danube in lighs. Among the other buildings and structures is the Chain Bridge. It is beautifu by night, but equally impressive by day. We crossed it several times going from either side of the Danube. It is the most widely known bridge of the capital. If you are close tot he Danube this is a must see, especially at night under the lights. A sight you will not forget. One of our lasting memories of Budapest.

The Chain bridge. Opened in 1849, its main support is anchored on the Pest side of the City. An attractive link between Buda and Pest. The marvellous work of an English Engineer - William Tierney Clark.
A must do. Was an amazing experience being able to cross this wonderful bridge, worth the visit to Budapest on its own.
Amazing view. So well worth a trip up to see this. lovely views and stunning walk down. we took the lift up but decided to take a stroll down to appreciate the scenery.
Wonderful to see. What a beautiful structure and full of history. An impressive site by day and even more beautiful at night being lit up . So beautiful site
Loved it. We really enjoyed a nice walk on our way to Buda hill and took some awesome pictures. Definately a must
Nice scene. This bridge connects the city of Buda and Pest. Short walk from the Buda hill funicular. It is a nice place for photography.

Iconic view. Walked across on a warm autumn day enjoying the views.
Some excellent photo opportunities.
I'm sure this would be great for a stroll after dark too.
definitely worth a walk over the bridge. There is a really nice sidewalk on the bridge. You can take beautiful pictures of both sides of the city. And the Duna (Donau) is really broad.
Budapest must-see. Convenient for sightseeing by walking. Budapest number one on the must-see list. In the centre of tourist attractions.
Nice views up the river both day and night. Nice little bridge worth the visit, especially if you're going to climb the hill. Visit during the day and night, but watch out for lumps.
great bridge!. we saw the bridge from the top of the hill! it is a real vocal point of budapest and a great thing to see!
Pause on both sides to enjoy the view. Make sure you cross this bridge on both sides to enjoy the River Danube view from each direction and, then don't forget to visit at night when it's lit up.
Beautiful at night. We viewed the bridge at night from a boat. It is truly amazing and compliments the other views that are lit up especially the parliament buildings. Very romantic.

Worth a walk - - with your camerra. Cross a historic river on a legendary span that was rebuilt in its original style after being bombed into the water during World War II.
A funicular near the Buda side takes you up to the Castle District.
Scenic view. Beautiful bridge with scenic view. You can cross by foot and get some nice photos of the Danube River.

Lovely Bridge. I had the opportunity to walk the bridge and see it from a distance during the free walking tour. Although it was not a spectacular tour but she did gave some interesting info as we walk along. The lions guarding both sides of the bridge gives it an imperial feel to it from a far, up close its still well preserved. The bridge only has a short span (compared to the Brooklyn bridge), which makes it manageable to cross. The bridge walkway is a bit tight so there is really not much time to linger. I like that the traffic exits on both sides is less crowded and landscaped. The beauty of the bridge is viewing it from a distance and at night which gives it a romantic and old world feel. Enjoy the transition from sunset to nighttime as the bridge is finally lighted ...just lovely.

Iconic Budapest landmark. Iconic Budapest landmark. It Is absolutely beautiful at night. We walked over it during the day when you get some great views of the Hungarian Parliament building on the Pest side and the Buda Castle on the other .A bit of history: the bridge was blown up in 1945 by the retreating Germans during the Siege of Budapest, with only the towers remaining. It was rebuilt, and it reopened in 1949.
The Chain Bridge. The Chain Bridge is a pieceof art.Although it is called a chain bridge it actually is constructed from special steel plates.
Nothing Spectacular Here. It's a bridge, nothing special. You can walk across it and get a nice view of the Danube but I can't say it's any better than any other bridge in Budapest
A stroll over the chain bridge. This is a beautiful bridge with a lot of architectual detail. A beautiful view of the river and surrounding area. A must!
A brisk walk across thee Danube on the Chain Bridge. Passing the lions (without tongues) take a walk across the Chain Bridge which crosses the Danube (which was not blue when we were there)-
Impressive. One of the most beautiful bridges I have ever seen in my life! It is stunning especially during the evening with the lights.
50th birthday. Walked over this tonight it was well lit and the Danube all lit up The bridge is linked to a bridge near Marlow in England pretty cool
A great place to aee. The Lanchid is one of the icons of Budapest. It is beautiful and very impressive. Best view is from the Royal Palace. A must see place if you are in Budapest.

An amazing bridge with great history.. Great bridge, with amazing history behind it. If you're visiting Budapest, read up on this before going over it. It will give you a different perspective of just another bridge.
Lovely bridge especially at night when lit. This along with all the other bridges and buildings looks fantastic at night when reflecting in the Danube.
Impressive!. The most stunning of Budapests many bridges! Lovely landmark, day and night. It's definitely both seeing
Nice but not that special. Sure, it is a nice bridge but there are many bridges in other cities that are more spectacular. You get a good view of the river from the bridge though.

JOIN THE MANY WHO WALK ACROSS THE BRIDGE. This is one of the several bridges that traverse the Danube between Buda and Pest. A leisurely walk across the bridge gives opportunity to observe life on the River as well as having views of the dramatic buildings on both sides of the river. The history of the bridge's construction features in bus and river cruise commentaries.

A visual treat at night . Crossed this bridge a few times on our trip to Budapest. It offers beautiful scenery of the Danube and is a visual treat when lit up at night. Well located bridge which offers a subway to cross busy roads at either end.

Impressive bridge. . Can't really say much about a bridge. It looks good and connects Buda to Pest . Fully operational with pathways both sides. There are beggars on both sides. Impressive that the road parts were destroyed in the siege and were rebuilt. The main supports are original
Budapest's Landmark. One of the most famous attractions of Budapest! I recommend going there twice because it looks beautiful both in the morning and at night!

Walk over this bridge, enjoy the views, admire the construction. There are many bridges accross the Danube in Budapest. All very impressive, and we walked accross three of them. This is the one that the guides and guide books speak about the most.

Best Bridge of the City. EveryDay you can cross the ChainBridge. Day and Night.
Its free..and you start your way from the Famous Gresham Palace (even at night when it has awesome colors, especially for photographers) and entering to the Buda Tunnel at other side. The only Bridge at night for the best Pics:) Its value!

Impresdive. Very impressive! Very different buikt accross the river danube. The view on it is breathtaking!
In the evenings all the lights from buda and oest side nake it a more preffered place to stand around

nice. Me and my friend went for a nice stroll and walk across the bridge and a nice walk it was. Also a good place to get good pictures and a great view to see across the water. Well worth it if you got time on your hands.
Pretty bridge with nice views. A very pleasant bridge to cross on foot with nice views over the water to the Buda and Pest sides. Worth including on a walking tour.

Simply Beautiful. The bridge is one of the most beautiful I have seen. It looks even more beautiful at night time. Do take a time to walk on it morning and at night time. The views from it are also quite beautiful. you can have very good views of parilament, buda castle and danube river from this bridge.

Even more beautiful in the nighttime lighting.. The most central (but not the only) bridge that links the western Buda side and the eastern Pest side, spanning the Danube River. It was rebuilt after being destroyed by the Germans in WWII. It's an easy walk on either the north or south side of the bridge. Don't worry which side of the bridge you traverse, because at either end there are walking tunnels to take you to the opposite side of the bridge.
Good Archietecture. Historically interesting. Seen from the Hop on Hop off bus so the sound track of the history could be heard in English.
Cool to walk across. Great view of both sides of Budapest from bridge. You can walk across just as easily drive across. Well lit at night for a walk or a river cruise on the Danube under it.

Nice during the day-awesome at night. I encourage all visitors to Budapest to take the short walk over the Danube river on the chain bridge. Great views of the river and the beautiful buildings on its banks. A must do on any visit.

Stunning views. Though on a rainy day, we could not stop, trying to capture as many possible views of the castle and Fishermans Bastion.
In the night it is equally impressive.
Definately one should seek to cross it at least once
Beautiful . Walked across evening time, traffic was light, views were amazing, read the history of the bridge.... worth a look
Beautiful and functional. What can you say about a bridge? It was both beautiful and functional. It got us from one side of this magically beautiful city to th other and back.

Szechenyi Lanchid- one of Budapest 6 bridges. A symbol in Budapest, nice to cross on foot when you pass from Pest to Buda to climb up Gellert Hil l(20 minutes hard walk!) to reach the Liberty Statue; from this site you can get one of the best panorama of Budapest.
a must do walk. we walked across the Danube on the Chain Bridge. There are several sculptures to see. There were lots of people doing the same as us, just enjoying the " promenade "
Stunning and romantic. A gorgeous sight at night! Lights twinkling, it is truly breathtaking from either side of the Danube. A must see!
Beautiful Bridge you should walk across. A testament to the beauty of Budapest . This impressive and beautiful bridge across the Danube should be one that you make time to walk across and linger on .
Impressive. Whilst in Budapest you just have to walk across the Bridge over the Danube it's very impressive and a lovely walk.
Chain Bridge. Iconic Budapest landmark. Is absolutely beautiful at night. Did not have time to walk over it, but grove over it on a city tour and floated under it in a Danube River cruise
Nice view at night to all sideas. Nice view from bridge at night, it comes to cable car to Budapest Citadel. Good place for walking ..

A bridge to somewhere.... Definitely take some time to walk across this lovely bridge! The view from every angle will inspire. This is a bridge that definitely takes you somewhere. Whether you are headed to Buda or to Pest...make this your connection point!
Amazing views in the evening . If you are walking or using a taxi while in Budapest you will enjoy the views especially at night of this bridge.

Romantic Bridge. This is a wonderful and romantic way to see the city with a lived one.
The views are breathtaking.
Lots of quaint shops nearby and nice restraunts.
Seems even better during Christmas..

Trip to Budapest. Famous and well-know bridge connecting Buda and Pest. Cross the bridge to discover Buda with the castle hill with all it's amazing places of interest. Spectacular view on the bridge in the night with the castle and church in the background.
History. Very inpressive design and application also interesting story about it. Kind of a mice neclace on Danube river.
Beautiful view. A bit rusty in places but we had a great time walking it. The view was wonderful and the path was safe. Don't miss ir

A walk over this bridge is a must. A walk over this beautiful bridge between Buda and Pest is a must. Great views of the city, Parliament and the Danube from it but the bridge itself is stunning. The engineering with the big rivets and metal plates all in perfect condition is outstanding.
Amazing view. It is a great bridge to pass by walking , especially on a sunny day. The view over the Danube is amazing

Stunning. The bridge is gorgeous at night and during the day. A real must see when visiting Budapest.
You can casually stroll across to other landmarks such as the castle and there is a lovely wine store you can pop into and sone delicious slush puppies to try on your way.

Cool at night . A very cool place to see at night when the lights are on
Romantic and modern it's a place for all tastes and age
The most famous bridge on the Danube River. This bridge connects Buda to Pest. It's easy to walk from the Castle to the Parliament and Basilica.
Obvious visit. this is an obvious visit when in budapest, I feel morning is best time to take a stroll, infact der are other places which can be seen across Danube like Parliament, Church etc

Beautiful Bridge in Budapest. It's a bridge! so you know what it does. It's not just any bridge though, it links the two sides of the city together and is a beautiful structure to look at. The walk over is very pleasant and you get some great views of the bridge and the city. Try going early to avoid the crowds. Also beautifully lit up at night so worth finding some good viewing points.
A must cross. A beautiful bridge and great connection between Buda and Best. Surrounded by great hotels such as the four seasons and also very central located
Great views. More than just a way of crossing the Danube, the bridge offers beautiful views of both Buda and Pest. Make sure you cross on on both sides of the bridge to get the best of the scenery.

Must-See in Budapest!. The Chain Bridge is one of Budapest's must-see sites. It's an ideal way to get from one side of the river to the other - Buda to Pest (vice versa)! Seriously good views during the day and even during the night it looks like a golden city with the lights. My mum and I walked the bridge a couple of times at night and its a lovely way to take a city in.You can walk across it and see outstanding views of the Parliament Building. There are several bridges in Budapest that you can see and all have a charm of their own - Elisabeth Bridge, Liberty Bridge, Margaret Bridge etc. The Chain Bridge is old of course but is a national landmark so definitely check it out.

Beautiful bridge!. This is the main bridge connecting two part of the city: Buda and Pest. It is most beautiful to walk across at night. And it provides a beautiful view of the amazing buildings along the Danube.
Just Too Crowded. Walking across this bridge is so popular that it is hard to enjoy it. Tis a shame. Of course at night it is evocative.
Good walk. Easy bridge time cosseits with great views up and down the Danube......fully lit at night is perfect time to cross on one's way to dinner.
Beautiful landmark. Ideal way to get from one side of the river to the other! Seriously good views day or night. Beware of the high speed cyclists!
One of many. It is one of the few bridges over the Danube river, perhaps most famous as it is closest to Buda hill. It is old but nice.

Indispensable part of the town and your visit . If you are not rushed trough the city in organised minute by minute tour, you will probably find yourself walking the promenade in the evening, admiring the scenery over Danube. So find time to cross the river on one of the many bridges that span the two banks - Buda and Pesht.The most attractive for walking of the bridges is Lanchid our The Chain Bridge. Our just sit in the open area cafe-bars at the bridge's end and enjoy the view and the crowd.
Connecting the history.... The main bridge to connect Buda and Pest.. Its very beautiful in nights and with full of tourist.Historical tourist point.

Beautiful Landmark. The chain bridge is beautiful and romantic. You can walk across it and see outstanding views of the Parliament. There are several bridges in Budapest that you can see. All have their unique charm. The Chain Bridge is a national landmark!
Nice. The connects the two sides of Budapest. It has historical importance. As a tourist attraction it is not more than okay.
Beautiful bridge. Amazing structure, fast moving Rapids below, surrounded by beauty. Nice experience crossing it. Great photo ops..
Historic!. Most important bridge connecting Buda with Pest side. Must walk on it at night and admire views and lights on both sides. Beautifully romantic by day and night!

Cheap option of San Francisco. Incredible design and architecture to match the rest of its surroundings. Something to certainly view at night once it's all lit up with all the boats cruising on the river. Defiantly one for the romantics out there.

Simply stunning . A gorgeous old bridge. One oft he cities oldest and links Buda to Pest. Take a walk across it to get a rear view of Parliament House and also to enter Castle Hill and fishermen's Bastion
Lovely bridge to walk of ride over.. This bridge is a must see in the city. It was building by a Scot and Englishman. It leads directly to the funicular to Castle Hill area on Buda side.

Walk it for the views up & down the Danube. It's an easy walk across the chain bridge with pedestrian access from either side. Its a great way to take in the vistas of Buda and Pest and the beautiful Danube.
Can't Miss It!. Amazing bridge that leads to Buda.. Enjoyed the views while walking across the bridge to the funicular.
Lovely bridge. I loved walking around and seeing all these different bridges :) if you're seeing Budapest by foot, these bridges add to the diversity of the city
Wonderful. Such a wonderful looking piece of architecture, it really is magnificent. At night it is so beautiful, this is a must see.

It's nice to walk across at least once . It's not that short and you on the outside path where cars can still drive in the main road. Doesn't compare to the Charles bridge in Prague. I wouldn't consider this a must do.
first bridge across the Danube river. This bridge connects Buda and Pest cities together. A must see if you are in Budapest! nice view of the parliament too

Nighttime photo hotspot.. The Chain Bridge is a great spot for photographers wanting to get those perfect nighttime shots. Traffic lets up on a regular basis, allowing for some perfect bridge only photos. The Four Seasons Hotel on the Pest side of the river is another nighttime photo bonus.
Great attraction. Fantastic piece of engineering, beautiful bridge and the way it's constructed, looks great at night when illuminated.
Nice way to get to Castle hill. We cross the bridge by bus from Andrassi street to the funicular steps. Is a small bridge so you can walk it, full os history and with great views of the Danube.

Ideal point of views. Taking a long walk thru this piece of art of metal condtruction is the ideal point for panoramic views of the city and of the Danube; is wonderful filling to stay on the bridge and to watch so far. I had the feeling that i can be anytime there, like a returning in time.

A Landmark not to be missed!. We walked the bridge in the middle of the day and again at night. Spectacular both times! The walk was easy and changing side was no problem. i would avoid trying to cross during rush hours.
Beautiful bridge!. This is such a fun place to visit! You should definitely go without a doubt and cross over from Pest to buda!

Significant Bridge. The Chain Bridge is a good looking bridge and an important symbol of Budapest's history as it was the first permanent bridge connecting Buda and Pest. It is easily visible from either side of the river banks and plays a key part in the views from Castle Hill in Buda. It is also nice to view from a Danube river boat.

Fun to walk across if you are in Budapest.. The Chain Bridge is a major landmark in Budapest S it is the oldest bridge built in the area to cross the Danube. It is fun to walk across, and is a good way to cross from Pest to Buda if you are visiting the castle area.
It's a rebuilt bridge . The first to span the Danube and build with giant chains. A master of engineering...but alas the Germans blew it up in 1945. Since rebuild and still grand. Worth the visit.

Beautiful scenery. We stopped off here at a riverside bar for a drink. We sat by the bridge and enjoyed the most beautiful views of the Danube and the boats sailing up and down. Very tranquil setting and well worth a visit.
Great view. Great views of both the Buda and the Pest side of Budapest . You can see the Parliment building and up the hill to the castle and huge cathedral

A famous bridge. The more famous of the many bridges which cross the Danube in Budapest. Nothing spectacular, as such. We walked across it several times. Lit up at night improved its attraction. We tended to use the Liberty bridge more, due to the location of our hotel and to be honest I found it more appealing.
must see. very popular. its good. there are walk way beside...its one of the must see in Budapest...all will like it

A walk along history. We have walked across, ridden the tram and travelled by car. Each time we see an interesting mix of people on the bridge. In the evening you will see people sitting on the braces. It is a fantastic bridge that is celebrated by the people with fireworks from time to time. There seems to be a love for the bridge by the people. It moves you from Pest to Buda or vice versa. A quick 8 minute walk and you are where you can begin a whole new adventure.
Nice view!. A really nice piece of architecture! Its a wonderfull place to walk at night with your bf/gf, really romantic, nice view and many people are passing by... thats all :)

The most beautiful among the bridges that link Buda and Pest. One has to walk the chain bridge when visiting Budapest. The view from both sides is beautiful. Along the bridge some play music and others exhibit paintings

Amazing sight and passable too. I walked the whole expanse of the Chain Bridge from the Pest side to reach the Buda Hill on foot. It's a magnificent structure that bridges the 2 side of the city. Standing in halfway of the bridge on the pedestrian side is a good place to take a panoramic shot of the Danube and the Buda and Pest
Interesting structure. A walk over this bridge gives you direct access to the funicular and affords photos opportunities. Interesting structure.

It's a bridge.... It's a solid bridge which has been rebuilt in the original style after World War 2 and it's agreeable to walk over. I took quite a few photos of it from various angles and it's an attraction which is frequently in view.
Superb. To see its real beauty I would recommend visiting at night when the bridge is lit up in all its glory. Only regret was we did not walk across it.
IBridge between Pest and Buda. Cars and paedestrians are allowed to cross. Division between the two for safety? Great to drive your car across or hire a taxi to see the lights of Budapest at might.
A beautiful bridge to complement the city. Worth taking a walk across the bridge to see the views. It's a short walk from Buda to Pest or vice-versa and a good spot for some photography.
Nice Bridge. It is a very nice bridge. it looks good from the river, specially at night. The lights of the bridge are great.
2016 Summer Vacation. One of the best view of the bridge is from Buda castle as well as from Matthias Church bell dome. You can take the bus to cross to the Pest side or walk it.
Walking. Chain bridge is a central location in Budapest . It is a link between pest and buda . Walking on this bridge is a nice idea

Great history - but it's a bridge. Useful to get across the Danube and a lovely bridge but I wouldn't go there specially. Same construction as Hammersmith bridge in London and I don't think you'd go out of your way to see that unless bridges are your thing.

Great views from an iconic bridge linking Pest and Buda. We loved walking this bridge everyday to get from our hotel in Buda into Pest where we spent the majority of our 6 day trip. It is so impressive and the views are great. Mind out for cyclists though!
Lovely bridge. This bridge is quiet stunning. We didn't cross at this point, but it is pat of the whole character of Budapest

Impressive and Great Views . We made a decision to drop at No 19 of Giraffe Hop On Hop Off and walk over the Chain Bridge - took some photos as the views over the bridge was scenic and it is very central. The design is really impressive and it gee us to the furnicular railway to the Matthias Church & Fisherman's Bastions.

Bridge walk. Worth a wander across. Lovely views up and down the river. If on pest side, you will need to cross it to get to the castle. The funicular railway is just over the bridge if you wish to visit the castle.
Bridge chained with love! . Love lockets every inch on the chain bridge. You can get a locket from the souvenir shops if you wish.

Lovely walk and spectacular views. The title says it all. Easy to walk here from St Stevens Basilica and afterwards take the funicular railway for even higher views of the city (I chose not to take that: be prepared for queues and note that isn't covered by your transportation card). The bridge is a beautiful example of engineering and standing at the centre you can see the Fisher Bastion and parliament.

Beautiful at night. Saw Chain bridge during the day and at night. This bridge provides a walkway link across the river Danube between Buda and Pest. The views from the bridge are stunning and if you decide to have a night cruise on the Danube you will see Chain bridge lit up and it looks spectacular.
Pretty Bridge. You can get a decent view of St Gellert and Buda Castle. Lots of people walk, jog, and bicycle on the bridge. Go- so that you can say you went.

ICONIC. The Chain Bridge is a scaled up version of a bridge across the River Thames at Marlow in Buckinghamshire, England. Both were designed by the English engineer, William Turney Clark whom is mentioned in the memorial plaque at the Pest end of the Bridge. It was Budapest’s first permanent river crossing linking the two cities. The chains are in fact multi-layers of linked flat steel sheets that are visible to the eye. It’s an iconic symbol of Budapest and a useful approach route to the funicular railway up to the Royal Palace.
AN EASY WALK. we walked across the Chain Bridge to re-visit the Castle area. It is an easy walk even in the 30deg heat and the views down the Danube are worth the walk.
Nice view. Walking on the Chain Bridge across the Danube provides you with a nice view of both sides of the river.The bridge itself is a nice bridge, but nothing more to it.
Pretty.. Pretty bridge but I wouldn't go iut of my way to see it. My best advise would be to make the 20min walk up to the statue of liberty and view it from there! Xx

One of Budapest's highlights. It's hard to miss this Budapest attraction since it's visible from almost every part of the city. Taking a stroll down Danube's bank (or perhaps a cruise) will offer you the best view of the bridge for photographing, or simply enjoying the sight. But don't hesitate to take a walk over it. It can be a bit crowded in the evenings but it's certainly worth the effort. A wonderful piece of architecture and engineering.
An exceptional historic bridge. Every time I pass this bridge I have to take a look at it. And whenever I cross it weather by car or on foot, it is a special feeling. I can't get bored of it.
Stunning views, stunning bridge. One of many bridges that link Buda & pest, o ver the river Danube. All have character & no two are alike in structure.
Nice view, better to view at night. Nice view from and on the Chain Bridge. Better to come when the weather is cooler or at late evening/night. Worth the walk!

Must see at night. The main bride connecting Buda with Pest the chain bridge is interesting especially if you like technical aspects of how the bridge is built. It looks especially beautiful at night with the lights on the bridge. I went to Budapest right after my visit to Prague so was expecting it to be similar to Charles Bridge. Certainly not the case, one big reason is that the bridge is also open to vehicles so cannot have local street artistes performing or folks selling their wares.
Chain bridge. Very famous bridge that links Buda to Pest, One can drive over or walk.,One of many bridges that link Buda from Pest..
Beautiful . Definitely worth stopping off at the chain bridge. There are amazing views of Parliament from here and you can also go up Castle Hill from just near here.

Probably one of my favourite bridges.. For some reason I really like this amazing bridge and not sure why as really it is just a bridge but when you walk on it it has so much character and so old. Went on a river cruise and passed under it a truly great price if architecture.

Beautiful Bridge. This is a beautiful bridge connecting the Pest side of the Danube to it's Buda side. The bridge itself is very nice but the views you see while walking on the bridge are spectacular. It is so pleasant walking there during the day or the night. On the Buda side, the bridge leads you to the Buda Castle.
A bridge is not just a bridge!. The majestic lions guarding the bridge to the beautiful sight of the bridge at night. An absolute MUST SEE!

A must see and great looking in Budapest!!. The Chain Bridge is a famous landmark over the Danube in Budapest and has been made in the last century by English engineer.Considering the engineering level and what kind of tools available at that time, it could be wonderful. The Chain bridge, like any other sightseeing landmark in Budapest must see twice, in the day and in the evening. Walking on this not long bridge across the Duna river could be enjoyable and a good way to reach the other side to get to Buda Castle. The funicular by which you go up to the Buda castle is just two minutes walk at the end pf bridge.
Great view of the Danube. The bridge is a busy bridge. It has lions on both sides and is very attractive. You can great views of Bus and of Pest from this bridge.
It's a bridge. Lovely old bridge with tram lines and a road.Foot passengers are allowed. Good views across the river.

It's a bridge!. Make sure to walk on the North side of the bridge for a nice view of the parliament building.And walk on the South side to see Castle hill and a thousand other lovely views.Plenty of room for the kids to walk.Cheers,
Definitely a must-do. Walked across. Gives s great view of city, palace and river. Short walk and definitely worth time.Take the funicular at the end of bridge and visit castle districts.
Amazing view at night. You must see it at night and from Danube river while you're having a night cruise!! It's just WOW...

Provides good panoramas of Budapest. The bridge itself is fine, there's not a whole lot to see other than some lion statues and a constant flow of traffic. What is worth seeing though is the panoramas of Buda and Pest. From here you'll see the castle / palace, parliament and cross the Danube.

Fun bridge. This is the main bridge that we used between Buda and Pest. 3 or 4 times a day. A different crowd at different times of day. Aside from watching out for bicyclists, no problem. One or two beggars at peak times.
Nice venue. Great views of the Danube.

A must see in Budapest!!. The old and great Budapesti Chain Bridge or Lánchíd in Hungarian. One of the oldest (if not THE oldest) bridges between Buda and Pest. Was completely destroyed during woldwar. Must visit!!

A classic tourist spot worth a see. Is you are crossing the Danube to either side then this is s must see visit. It looks impressive and the views whilst crossing are a great photo opportunity. It gets busy so expect a few packed tourist crowds. On the other side you will find the Funicular up to the castle so worth a trip to see.

Brithish built. This bridge was built in the last century by 2 Englishmen.When you consider the engineering and what tools were available at the time, it's amazing.There was an identical bridge further down the river, which was destroyed in the last war, now replaced by a more modern bridge.Trams, cars and walkers use the Chain Bridge, but buses have to use the new one.
Nice Bridge. This bridge gives you great views around the area on both sides. Does not take too long to cross and a good way to go towards the castle.
Impossible not to see. Whether you are aiming at it or not, it is the main connection from Buda to Pest, in touristic terms. Thus, you will certainly have the chance to have great views of it

A feat of engineering by a Scot. The Chain Bridge is a famous landmark over the Danube in Budapest. We were lucky enough to be moored there on our cruise boat. It is an amazing feat of engineering for its time. The cars are separated from the pedestrians by a separate pavement. It connects Buda to Pest.
Great looking bridge.. It looks like the Charles bridge in Prague, the view from it is amazing and it has some nice history behind it if you are into those stuff.

Bridge Across the Danube. Our boat was docked partially under this bridge. Very interesting design for this bridge. We sailed under it during the evening to view the city from the river and people were lining the bridge on both sides to view the buildings on either bank.
Beautiful. Beautiful Bridge that connects Buda & Pest. Walking from Pest to Buda you cross over the bridge and the cable car is right there to take you up to Buda Castle.

Beautiful at night. One of several bridges connecting Buda & Pest. What a beautiful site at night. Our boat was docked just below it for 2 nights & it made for a very spectacular view. We also walked over it during the day which provided nice view of each side of the Danube.

An Iconic Bridge. Walk on the pedestrian lane of the Chain Bridge, mingle with people, then cross over to Buda and Clark Adam Square and then can catch a funicular to the top of Buda Hills. A superb experience !

Rebuilt from the past. The engineering is worth a look as well as the view from the bridge itself. We saw it from the river at night too. It gives a fine view of both banks and is close tonSt Stephens and its square.it is one of the links between Buda and Pest
Beautiful architecture . Stumbled across this bridge which is 1 of about 4 in Budapest. Lovely views of the city from here and good photo opportunities.

The connection between Buda and Pest. This is not the Charles bridge of Prague but this one is the bridge to see when you are in Budapest. You will have a great view on the bridge to the Parlement and to the Château.
One of the most beatiful bridges in Europe. The bridge is very pretty. You can easily cross it in just minutes. There are great views on boths parts of the city.

Grand. This is a must do in Budapest - to cross this beautiful old bridge from the Pest side to the Buda side. Pedestrian crossing is available on both sides of the bridge so you get a great view down both sides of the river from the bridge. It was quite spectacular to view the stunning, historic architecture of the city skyline from the bridge. Take your camera!

Iconic part of Budapest. The bridge has been rebuild after the WWII and when you see pictures how demolited it was, you'll understand how good job they have done with it. It is one of the main bridges in Budapest.one of the best places to take pictures of this bridge, is from a viewpoint of Buda castle.

A Nice Piece of Architecture from the Past. I'm sure I have seen a chain bridge before, but having it pointed out to me was quite interesting. You have to look closely, but if you know what you are looking at it becomes quite clear.

Always beautiful, but like a fairy tale at night.. Take the tram to Gellert and walk along the Danube to Batthyany. At night the city is so lovely. The Chain Bridge with the Parliament at night is amazing.Take a walk across the bridge during the day, read the history and see pictures of its destruction during World War II. You will truly appreciate the magnificence, and the enduring spirit of the Magyar people

Tourism. The Chain bridge connecting Buda with Pest is the most beautiful of the ten bridges in the lovely Capital of Budapest.It is architecturally superb & well kept. Incase you wish to visit Buda Castle, this bridge can easily be negotiated by walking on either side on the pedestrian paths. Don't forget to use your camera enroute for mesmerizing views of Denube & the city on either side. Must read it's history to enjoy walking over it & remember to wear your hat as it does become overbearing in sun in summer !! Enjoy.
Interesting.. The architecture all over Budapest is lovely and this is no different. From the bus/ boat tours you can learn a small amount of information about each attraction.

Prettiest bridge on the Danube. If you walk through one bridge in Budapest this should be it. With all the details it is just amazing. Also worth reading up on the history behind the construction of it.
Charming. The bridge adds to the beauty of the city. It is very nice and well lit at night. It is easy to walk as well.

Amazing Bridge. It is worth going to the bridge and walking across. The bridge has a lot of history and an amazing view over the Danube. Lot's of people walk across it and automobile traffic was heavy on the bridge. The bridge is on your way to the Castle Hill area.

Popular lively bridge specially in the evening. The bridge is beautifully engineered and standing in the middle of it you get a fantastic view of Danube river that has a width of 350 meters under the bridge
A nice bridge. I realy didn't see The point of this bridge.Yes, it is the first bridge overkligt the river.It is Nice, and historical. But nothin more
Walk the bridge . We stayed on the Buda side of Budapest a few steps from the foot of this bridge. It's a nice walk across and a beautiful sight in the evening with the lights on.

Best Bridge in Budapest. Nice bridge - you're not really visiting Budapest unless you crossed it at least once or twice. It's proximity to the Parliament building and the attractions on the Buda side probably make it the most traveled bridge in Budapest
Busy but interesting. First bridge over Danube and most convenient place to cross between Buda and Pest. Busy traffic but wide pedestrian walkways on each side.
Beautiful from a distance and up close. We saw it first at night, all lit up, from a restaurant on the Pest side of town. It looked magical with all of the lights on it. Don't miss it!

Breathtaking views by day or night!. Sometimes dodging the bike riders can be a battle and tourists with selfie sticks but the breathtaking views from either sides of the Chain Bridge during the day, at sunset or at night will leave you mesmerized by the beauty. Excellent views of the Parliament, Buda Castle and other bridges. A romantic evening walk crossing the bridge gazing at the suggestively illuminated landmarks is a must see and do!

Perfect way to cross the river- views from. If you are in Budapest, you need to take the time to visit both sides of the Danube river- each is unique and worth the time. The perfect way to cross is a stroll across the Chain Bridge. Not a strenuous walk and great photo opportunities along the way.

Night time is the best. Build on the river Danube, in 1849 links the two sides of the Hungarian capital: Buda & Pest.The bridge was designed by the English engineer William Tierney Clark in 1839 and is a symbol of connection between the East and West, located in the center of Budapest. Good place for a walk, or if preferred can be seen from a boat.
Mini NYC bridge. This bridge reminds me a bit about the BK bridge. Its a nice 20 minute walk across and the cool gentle breeze coming from the river is pleasant

Looks better in the evening. I had been to many countries and cities somehow this was the least beautiful looking bridge for me. I liked it more in the evening. I am not an architect so everyone has a different opinion. Hence I only liked it during the evening, I only have a night photo.
Historic bridge connecting Buda to Pest.. Beautiful bridge with lions and lovely gardens as you approach the government part of the city. Easy access from either side

Great views. The chain bridge is one many iconic structures along the Danube river in Budapest. You can easily walk across from Buda to Pest or vice versa to take some scenic photos. By night, like most of the buildings on the Danube it is well illuminated and a picture postcard.
Impressive. One of the first bridges over Danube, very nice iluminated during the night it connects Buda with Pesta.
Beautiful. Beautiful big bridge in the center of Budapest. Good for walking and seeing stunning views. It's nice at night time
Great views. nice place to walk and enjoy an overview the sights of the city on both sides Buda and Pesht. must see

Chain bridge. It is fantastic which connects Buda and Pest built on river Danube. It looks beautiful, If see from a boat or side. Lot many attraction are there and boating facility is also available near it. You can purchase various types of item from the market near it.
A Truly Beautiful Bridge. Whats not to like. Its so nice, young locals like to hang out around the area. You can even climb up it part way. (technically illegal)
Oldest bridge in the city. Oldest bridge in the city. Nearly destroyed in the war. Now a great place to catch views of both sides of the city.
Walk it at night. The river is such a central part of the city, so any of the bridges are good to walk over. We went across on our first night and the views from it and later of it were beautiful.

Nice bridge gives a good view. Gives a good view over the donau.
And a clean pic for the parlement building.
Its nice to travel by bus in Budapest

Another of those must do's...walk across the Chain Bridge. How do you get from Pest to Buda or vice versa, walk across the chain bridge. Apart from the obvious quickest route, it provides a great backdrop for both sides of the river Danube plus the Danube itself. Be a tourist and join the crowds along the way, just be cognizant of who is around you!!

Very elegant bridge . The most beautiful bridge in Budapest to my taste even if there are more pictoresque bridges in the city. We crossed it many times and enjoyed the beauty of it even from the dinner cruise boat at night. Just stunning!

Landmark bridge. Historic bridge right in the middle of the city, linking Buda and Pest. Pedestrian/cycle path across as well, separated from road traffic. Well preserved and looks great from on top of Castle Hill. The famous lions are very impressive but they have no tongues (which caused a man to jump into the river once apparently)!

One of the nicest bridge I ever seen.. This bridge is located between Buda And Pest. Most central location in Budapest.
It's very old. It's nearly too Market Hall.

Simply a must - easy to reach. Check out Wikipedia why they name this bridge Chain Bridge... even Hungarians have no idea why!
However, to cross it from Buda to Pest and from Pest to Buda is a nice walk over the Danube with a nice view to some objects of interest.

Great photo shot. Impressive sight and links Pest to Buda.
Get a great photo at night or go up to castle to get even better vies with Parliament in background.
FUN. It is amazing. I love it so much !It was so great and it was plain fun!You really need to visit!!!!!
Best admired from the Buda hill. The bridge was the last to be rebuilt after the distraction during the war, but is of an iconic stature in Hungary and for a good reason

Please Visit At Night. It's a stunning bridge, over a stunning river, against a stunning backdrop, however, you must visit this bridge at night (preferably a Saturday night). It becomes a site were tourists and locals relax, drink, eat and I even spotted a couple groups smoking shisha. The atmosphere is incredible as people clamber on the bridge to get the best spots, I don't think I've experienced anything like it before.
Iconic. This bridge is a symbol of Budapest and a tourist magnet. You can cross it to get to the Siklo and up castle hill. It looks spectacular at night.

Fun walk. If you're staying on the Pest side of the city, it's fun to walk across this bridge to see the Buda castle. It puts you out a short walk from the entrance. It is a pretty bridge and affords nice views on both sides.
Very interesting bridge. This is a lovely bridge and worth walking over. Definitely worth reading about it's history and then you'll appreciate it more.

Nice Bridge with great history. Much like London Bridge it is very busy with cars and people with a narrow foot path, whilst in Budapest you have to say you have walked over it but the history of it being the first bridge to join Buda to Pest is more interesting. If you have a padlock you can lock it to the bridge and throw the key in the river.

It's a bridge . Beautiful but that's all. Not like some wide bridges with street performers on it. Best viewed at night when lit up beautifully. Connects the Pest side of the city to the Buda side. A ten minute walk from parliament. You can pick up the train to the Buda hills from here.

Walk it. Well worth a walk along though chose your side before you get on as no way to cross once you get on - one side you get great view of the parliament etc other side you see more of the gallery and the hotels great view of the Gresham place (4 seasons hotel now) from the bridge
Mrs . A lovely monument. We did a tour with the people who lived there and this was included in it . A beautiful sight and very good to take photographs of. Well worth seeing.
Cool bridge - one of a kind. Bridges in Budapest are a marvel to look at. A lot of travellers walk to the other side and back. A lot of fun when climbing to the castle.
Take a walk across at night. It's a beautiful bridge, and worth photographing and walking across. The view across the Danube is terrific.
Best bridge in Budapest. Most beautiful bridge in Budapest but you need to find good spot to get good picture as it is always crowded with people. There is nice spot at the foot of Castle Hill.
Chain Bridge. Don't miss the opportunity to walk across the Chain Bridge to get a different perspective of both the Buda and Pest as well as the beautiful Danube.
Im sure is already your plan;). i think Budapest is nit done if u dont se this pridge...is one of most tourists attraction. Is beautiful with view of Budapest and much more:)
Historical bridge . Enjoyed a pleasant stroll across the bridge during the day. Gets a little overcrowded but that's to be expected. The lions look very cool close up. Worth seeing at night too.

Nice bridge. The bridge is a bit of an attraction in Budapest, it's nice to see, especially at night when the lights are on. It looks rather the worse for wear these days, but it's pretty sight. Well worth strolling over the bridge when visiting Castle Hill.

Budapest's Top Bridge. The city has many beautiful bridges, but this is probably the best and most famous. I was told it was Budapest's Tower Bridge, but that is a disservice, as it is a beautiful bridge in it's own right (and quite different in design to London's Tower Bridge, though probably has a similar standing).

One of most attractive attractions.. Well its a bridge that connects Buda and Pest, western and eastern part. Take a lovely walk through the bridge, good to see city from there,also good for a photos.

The best of all bridges in Budapest. As soon as you get closer to it you will realize its beauty. It reminded me of Brooklyn Bridge...only this one looks much older...it is most magnificent at night when the lights are turned on. For the best photographs stay on the Buda side of the city as you will have castle hill and Matthias church in the background for extra effect.
Must see. . We walked chain bridge three times, the views are stunning and it's worth getting the funicular up to the castle. A great walk and designed by an English man and built by a Scottish.
A lovely cleverly designed bridge. An easy walk across the bridge to access attractions on either side.What a great view from the centre down the mighty Danube
huge. We walked across lovely views of the city we also watched the fireworks go off on this bridge on the night time of St Stephens day AMAZING

Nice but crowded. A bridge in the center of the city with really beautiful views of both sides of the city. But soo crowded with tourists. And like many other reviews here say - it's a bit overrated. All guide books etc mention how beautiful it is but it's really nothing very special. Still worth a visit for the views!
Lovely bridge with great views . We walked along the bridge and stopped and took photos as the views were beautiful. Nice structured bridge with plenty of walkway for people like us who had prams.
Beautiful!. The chain bridge is beautiful. Must visit in Budapest! It's even more beautiful at night.You could even consider taking ferry cruises and enjoy a great view of the bridge also.

Stunning with breathtaking views. This twin-towered span is amazing and a great feat of engineering. It is named after its instigator Szechenyi, but was built by a Scotsman called Adam Clark in 1849. The bridge itself is a larger scale version of a bridge that spans the River Thames at Marlow in the UK. It connects Buda and a Pest ( the East and West sides of the town) and was financed by a Greek gentleman who had business and land holdings in the area. Views from both sides of this bridge are excellent, but none more so as you look towards the Parliament building, which takes centre stage. Interestingly the bridge can be seen featured in the Katy Perry music video Firework.

Really pretty at night with interesting history. You have to read up on the history beforehand. During the daytime this bridge just appears to be a standard bridge really, most people seem to use it to get to Buda castle... but at night. it is spectacular!
Seeing the sights. This is a must see attraction especially at night when it's lit up it looks spectacular if you're in Budapest you can not miss it
Impressed. Bridge is amazing .Easy t find and easy to walk on it.Other bridges are not to bad as well.Good views from it

A nice site.. The Chain Bridge is an engineering marvel. It connects Buda and Pest and was started in the 1800's. It provides a nice evening walk with 360 views of both banks of the river and all of the wonderfully lit buildings at night.

Beautiful . When we visited Budapest, the chain bridge was closed for traffic due to some road work at the Buda end. This gave great opportunities for photos from different angles of this beautiful bridge. There was lots of young people just sitting around and some even climbing the bridge. I'm not sure if that's safe, but looked super cool
Day and Night. I highly recommend crossing the bridge during both the day and night timeIt is beautiful to walk across and too view it from Fishermans lookout on Buda at night time

My Recent Visit . I walked along the Danube to find this majestic bridge that connects Buda with the Pest side of Budapest. This is best seen at night when it is lit up and both sides have great architecture connecting and visible from the bridge. The views to the bridge and from the bridge make for great pictures so bring a good camera.

Beautiful and old bridge. Not easy to review an old bridge?Well, it is a bridge and it is old. I could walk over the bridge and did not have to swim or find a boat. That makes the beautiful and old bridge very good I think :)

Famous Chain Bridge. Walking across the Chain bridge that connects Buda and Pest parts of the city provides a magnificent view of the River Danube and the Parliament Buildings. In the night time this is well lit and a photographing the Bridge from a Night Cruise along the Danube provides a spectacular view of the Chain Bridge.
Oldest bridge in Budapest. Seen perfectly clear from the Citadel. At night it will be all lit up and some good pictures can be taken while enjoying a dinner cruise on one of the danube cruises.

beautiful by Night. the Chain Bridge is an exciting view from when you are roaming around the Danube for sure. But it is in the evening time after it is dark when its lit and the bridge looks all sorts of gorgeus. Must dine around the river with view to the bridge and other monuments
