Stayed near this Chain Bridge.. Our hotel was located near this Chain Bridge. The bridge is lite up at night. Many other bridges and buildings are lite up at night. Very pretty.
Cool bridge. Definitely a unique bridge and worth walking across. It's not a long walk and you get a good view of the water

Beautiful!. Although bombed during the Second World War, the towers remained and the bridge was rebuild in 1949. It is a stunning piece of architecture with two huge carved lions at each end. The story goes that the sculptor said if anyone could find fault with the lions, he would kill himself. Upon inspection, it was found that the carved lions had no tongues. The architect jumped off the bridge to his death!

Wait till dark.. Our hotel wax a stone's throw away. The bridge is beautiful. Easy to walk over, good paths, just very busy a night. Once the lights are on the bridge looks magnificent. A real icon of Budapest.
Great way to walk between Pest and Buda. Built in 1850s, provides an easy way to walk between Pest and Buda. The 16 bus will also traverse it if you do not wish to walk it.

Nice part of the city for a night bike ride. Nice part of the city for a night bike ride; we enjoyed very much biking along the riverbank and visiting the different bridges that are lit up very nicely at night with a great backdrop of Castle Hill ; The area safe and lend itself nicely to take a stroll along the riverbank and or biking along the whole area

Great walk between the 2 parts of the city. This bridge is a great way to see both parts of the city; Buda and Pest. The bridge itself is massive and walking from one side to the other takes about 10 minutes. You get great views of the Danube and both parts of the city as you walk across. I'd especially recommend it at night as you get to see the city all lit up.

Just a chain bridge. The bridge looks good on photos but in real its just abridge. I dint understand why people love this bridge. I walked on this bridge but its too much crowded due to national holiday St. Stephen's Day.

It's a very nice bridge. The Chain bridge is a very nice bridge and a sight to tick off the list, but it's not a particularly special site with anything going on there. Recommend crossing the bridge to visit Buda and see the old side of town.

Iconic Chain Bridge. Chain bridge was one of the first bridges to connect Buda and Pest. Walking the bridge especially when it is lit up in the evenings is very nice. You can get a view of the Hungarian Parliament when walking on the bridge. Buda Castle funicular is right at the end of the bridge on the Buda side. You can get an amazing view of the bridge as well as the Hungarian Parliament from the Buda Castle.

Worth the walk, do not miss . We walked from the Pest side to the Buda side to take the Buda Funicular to Buda Castle and Matthias Church. The walk in the daytime was beautiful, but it was incredible on the way back at night. The lighting in this city is out of this world. Make it a must to walk across at night (especially if you're with a significant other!).

One of my favorites in Budapest. What can I say about it? One of my favorites in Budapest. It symbolizes the old Budapest and when you walk on by, you just feel history. It is a pity it is not closed for cars like the Charles Bridge in Prague.
Bridges over Budapest. How can miss this. To fully explore Budapest you need to see both sides of the river. Check out this bridge as it is most iconic of them.

Chain bridge joining Buda 7 Pest towns over the Danube. This is a charming bridge with combination of the old & the new charm. A drive on this bridge to see the flowing Danube underneath and architectural sites on Buda / Pest sides is wonderful!

The iconic bridge of Budapest . The walk on the ionic chain bridge is a must when visiting Budapest. This bridge connects Buda to the Pest side. You can get a birds eye view of the bridge from the Buda castle
Chain Bridge view from pop up bar. Central bridge in Budapest which looks great when lit up at night. Check it out from the pop up bar on the Pest side whilst sitting in a hammock with a cold drink!

bridge over untroubled water. There is no hyphen between Buda and Pest but there is this marvellous bridge, offering spectacular views of both banks of the Danube. Photographers, be prepared!The only problem was the cyclists who tend to come charging at you at any time.On the 'Buda' side, it is really hard (and somewhat dangerous) to walk to the other side of the bridge.
Beautiful and iconic. You must cross the Danube on the Chain Bridge. Stunning views of both the Buda and Pest sides of Budapest.
Very nice. Impresive structure. Very nice to walk on it and take a closer look to the structure, especially if you are more technical inclined. Great panorama while on the bridge!
Beautiful. We were lucky enough to have a view of this bridge from our hotel room, fantastic to wake up to in the morning. One of the best views in the world.

One of the world bridge must visit and walk on. . Sydney harbour bridge,London Bridge,Paris Bridge,Oslo floating bridge,Copenhagen palace little tiny bridge,Lienz city river bridge,Bratislava Bridge, And now The Margaret Bridge Budapest. Doesn't matter weather big or small bridge it is but definitely one of the bridge human must walk on.  The experience its self is just amazing. Once you walk across that bridge you'll finding interesting places either hidden or just right on your face. Both side of the bridge there's Castles,Attractions,Museum,Parliament house,Restaurant and lots more to see!! #Lovebudapest #MustTravels #Amazingexperience
Nice bridge. What else can I say... your 100 character restriction is annoying. You are probably get less feedback because of it...
Buda Pest joined by a chain.. The Bridge spans the River Danube joining Buda and Pest, the Funicula to Buda Castle a short walk from the bridge .
Beautiful. Beautiful bridge. Looks even better in the night. Lightening on this bridge and surrounding is amazing
A walk by/over attraction. The bridge is a thing to see by day and by night. Also the Donau is an impressive sight when you walk over this bridge.
its a bridge. unless you are into engineering-its a bridge- with personal padlocks by travellers attached(same as in Paris)

A fairy tale brought back to life.. Buda and Pest were separated by Mother Danube. The original bridge was the first stone bridge to unite the city. School children tell tales of tongues missing from the mighty lions guarding the bridge. They even speak of the architect committing suicide. Not the real story. But, a good example of the sadder side of how locals view their city. When walking across this great bridge, watch out for bicycles. You might even stumble across a young couple in an embrace. Sometimes you might see some daring Hungarians climbing up the long, sweeping chin. No, this is not a good idea.
First Permanent Crossing Between Buda and Pest. Beautiful bridge with two huge towers that support the mammoth chains. I wish I could have seen it at night!
Nice walk across Danube river. Good place to cross the river with a great views towards Buda and Pest. Brilliant photo spot especially when long bargues passing under the bridge.

The symbol of Budapest. A historical bridge, which you shall not miss, while you are in Budapest. A walk over the Danube is a must during day and in the evening or night. Be prepared as it is mostly crowded, buth the view pays off. If you like, an early morning walk is even better, as the sunrise is beautiful and there is silent in the city....

The bride was closed only for pedestrians on August 20 HUNGARY National holidays . One of Europe's most impressive bridges over the Danube river connecting the two parts of the city Buda & Pest . The view from one side of the bridge in to the Parliament building and to Margit Island
Wonderful. In doesn't matter if it is a day or night, this bridge is wonderful anytime of the day.At night it is lighted and you can have a night Danube cruise to see its wonderful creation.
Splendid view. Chain bridge can be compared to london bridge but again this is a place to visit after sunset with your cam

Historic Chain bridge. Historical bridge. Well worth the walk across. Good views from the bridge. Beautiful at night. Safe and easy to negotiate. If you walk a lot like me, it is on the way to the bottom of capital hill and entry to the funicular.
It's beautiful during the day.... ...but SPECTACULAR at night!. We say it from underneath (on our river cruise boat) both in the daytime and at night.
Looks good on pictures.... ...and that's mostly it. Crowds walking both directions bumping into each others. Noise from all the traffic spoils all the views and good mood. :-)

A lovely walk and a great place to people watch. This Chain Bridge was the first joining Buda and Pest. It is a nice flat walk offering unique views of many landmarks on both sides of the river, the other bridges, boat traffic, and the city. There was a lot of foot traffic but it wasn't overly crowded.

Do this on your first day!. Walk the Chain Bridge on your first day. Its just beautiful and provides some great views of the city and the Danube. Walk during the day, but also come at night when the bridge is all lit up.
Chain bridge. You can walk from buda to pest across this beautifull bridge and can se the Danubio and parliament building , at night is All light up.
Great views. Crossed the bridge to get to Buda Castle. Great views of the city from the middle of the Danube. Budapest is an amazing city!

Walk it out. Just cross the bridge and watch the par;ligament by night from the other side. The bridge is nicely lit, u should see it by day and then by night. Big monument and a must during your walks across the city

Beautiful at night.. A late evening walk across the bridge after dinner was both relaxing and an experience not to miss. We walked from the Pest side, over the Danube to the foot of Castle Hill on the Buda side, and back. Even the rain did not put us off.

Historical and charming bridge. This is the bridge that connects the cities of Buda and Pest. Lovely ten minute walk across this historic bridge. Popular with both locals and tourists. Right in the heart of the city.
Pretty. Nice place to walk or sit with an ice cream cone. I loved the atmosphere with so many people from different countries

Walk across the Danube. The Chain Bridge was the first joining Buda and Pest. A nice walk offering unique views of the other bridges, boat traffic, and the city. There was a lot of foot traffic but it wasn't overly crowded.
An icon. A wonderful icon of Budapest and very much a must do to walk across. Standing watching the boats is very relaxing and a great spot for photographs.
THE bridge. Its not just a bridge, it's the bridge- one of the most recognizable monuments of Budapest and the location you must visit because of great view, history and feeling.
Postal card of Budapest. It was our first stop in Budapest and it was a wonderful to be welcomed to this beautiful city...highly recommended to cross the Danube through this bridge

Nice walk over the Danube. Impressive architecture. Provides the opportunity to take on the sights of both sides of the Danube. Fairly crowded. We enjoyed walking from the white bridge to the chain bridge and complete a full loop
Awesome bridge. Have to walk to see its beauty . Excellent construction, awesome views. Beautiful at night and day. Go to Buda castle where view is best with funicular.
Pedestrian friendly. Although we walked it in the rain, still a nice way to view the city and the Danube. Hard to believe the sculptors were not more attentive to detail re the lions -- oh well.
A fun way to cross the Danube.. Easy to find. Great way to get across from Pest to Buda and then up to the castle. Lots of people there. Lovely views on both sides of the Danube.

a must visit bridge!. sunny & chilly day when me & my family walk through this chain bridge..in between, you'll see the locals selling beautiful self-painted pictures as souvenir, birds chirppping & flying all over the places..few boats sailing with tourist capturing the scenic lake view. amazinggggg !
very pretty at night. A good quick stop for a few pictures. It can be cold though if you went in winter like me. good transport links around this attraction.
It's abridge. What more can you say. Large bridge over a large river. Nothing much more than that. Ok it's the Danube but when you look at it its a large muddy body of water that moves.

Four different views of old bridge. First – it is nothing special when you just drive over the bridge. Traffic is usually smooth. Far better is second way: walking over the bridge. It is 350 or more m long but it is nice walk with view. Just some bikes and their users can be a problem. You can admire Danube or details of the bridge, from lions on each side to the details of the lamps. Third, most effective visit is during the night. Pathways are well lit so it is not dangerous (some beggars exist). Fourth, very interesting way of the visit is trip on boat under the bridge. It is special and not difficult for your legs at all. I propose you three ways. Skip bus or car. You can, of course, admire the bridge from the top of the castle hill, too.
Beautiful. Very beautiful bridge, lit at night and it is spectacular, just below Castle hill. The funicular for Castle Hill is at the foot of the Bridge on the Buda side.

Really good . This is an amazing find it is so historic with amazing views and if you visit it at night it is very beautiful light up at night. It is very busy at night though with people sitting on top of the bridge drinking.

Symbolic of the link between East and West. This bridge was opened in 1849 after the Hungarian revolution of 1848 and was the first bridge to link the 2 sides of the Danube in Hungary. The sculptor János Marschalkó carved the 2 stone lions at each entrance to the bridge. The bridge has come to symbolise the link between East and West. Impressive design
The highlight of the city. There are many bridges over Danube that unites the 2 cities of Buda & Pest, however Chain bridge happens to be the most popular. Its a sign of the city.
Reminds me of Brooklyn. I crossed it more than one and in both directions. It is really impressive. Strides over good old blue Danube.
Nearly obligatory when in Budapest.. This bridge is historically significant, probably not thrilling, but it costs nothing to walk over it, so... just do it.
Lovely bridge. There are so many bridges in Budapest, but this one, for me, was the most attractive. Taking photos from our river boat and then walking over later, it is a must for photos.

Amazing Attraction. No visit to Budapest would be the same without a visit to the chain bridge.
It's absolutely amazing and you must go and get your picture took on it.
Walk over. Looks lovely when lit up at night! Great to walk across the bridge. There is an awesome bar just below the bridge with live music and sheesha.

Nice bridge. The chain bridge is probably the most beautiful bridge in Budapest, though it is quite simple in it's architecture. If you've ever been to the Brooklyn Bridge, it looks pretty much the same, but lower. Nice for taking sunset pictures, but it wasn't a highlight for me.
Beautiful from a distance. From a distance, very beautiful bridge, but up close pretty rusty and very dirty. However, still romantic at night and perfect for a panorama shooting!

Great walk with a view. See it in the day and come back at night. Great walk. Locals and tourist all out to enjoy the view and the walk. Go to one of the bars at night under the bridge, have a drink and enjoy the water and the people.

Crowning Jewel of Danube!. The bridge is a beautiful and useful piece of architecture. The night lights on the bridge are a treat to the sore eyes. The best place to get a shot of the lighted bridge is the Castle hill. The bridge is usually heavily crowded and a major tourist attraction.

Great bridge with awesome views!. Walk across this central bridge and treat yourself to wonderful views of the Danube. You will also be right in the middle of the action on both sides of the river. Beautifully lit up at night as well.
The Chain Bridge is amazing!. Definitely worth seeing. The bridge has some history too, this is worth exploring. Also, don't forget to see the bridge at night, since the lights are beautiful.
a must see in Budapest. great place to walk around! nice view from the river, specially with good weather is one of the best options to start discovering the city

Romantic stroll any time of the day!. Connecting Buda (hilly) and pest (flat land), that's how the name "Buda+Pest". View was beautiful. The water, the air, the bridge and the people who walked past..whether couples or friends. Everyone in good mood and friendly smiles. The locks on bridge, make it special!
Just one thing to watch out...people on bicycles (but generally slow speed)..
Nice way to cross the Danube. The bridge has its charme and it provides a nice view of Budapest! Great way to cross :-) There is heavy traffic, so be aware!
A Beautiful Bridge . If you are visiting Budapest, u will for sure pass this bridge. There is a bicycle lane but the traffic is normaly busy during summer.

Emblematic bridge. Emblematic bridge in Budapest. You have to cross it on foot and enjoy the views it offers.
The evening is illuminated offering a beautiful photograph

go for an evening stroll..... A lovely evening stroll will take you over one or more of Budapest's lovely bridges. If you come at the right time you can see the Grand Prix Air Races, the planes dip under this bridge.
Perfect walk from Buda to Pest. This bridge is so beautiful, two big lion statues guarding the bridge and the chains look impressive too. We walked in the afternoon from Buda to Pest. Very nice.
Fantastic structures !. Many great bridges in Budapest who ties the Buda and the Pest side together. Really nice structures !

Elegance and Beauty Over the Danube . There are two must see ChainBridges, the daylight version connecting Buda to Pest and the night time version all lit up like something out of a fairy tale. The bridge is both the subject of many fantastic photo opportunities as well as a great phot shooting location.Any visit to Budapest must include a visit to and onto this great site.
Lovely. It was such a beautiful place. I enjoyed taking a walk and riding a bike day and night. Also, perfect spot to enjoy the view of danube river.

A Budapest Must See. Walk across the bridge day or night for excellent views of the city. During the day, take pictures of the links of the chain that suspend the bridge. At night, the lighted bridge is awesome from afar. The location of the bridge is ideal for tourist attractions, tram stops, and eating. If you want to walk across only one bridge, this bridge has much to offer. For a good view of the bridge from the Buda side, consider walking up the steps along the steep wall.

Nice bridge and views. I walked over Chain Bridge from the Pest side and then down by the river to the Elizabeth Bridge and back to Pest. It was an easy walk, and there are great views on the bridges and the riverbank. Took me a little more than an hour, with stops for traffic and taking pictures. Modest numbers of folks walking and biking to work on a lovely summer morning.
Beautiful bridge. A beautiful bridge, well worth a walk across from Buda to Pest, then a walk along to return via the Elisabeth Bridge.

Beautiful old bridge. This is a must for every visitor. The oldest bridge in Budapest was build like a masterpiece. It is very approachable and suitable for walk to the other side. There is a beautiful panoramic view from the bridge.
Beautiful. I love it..from every angleGo upthe castle hill or fishermen's bastion to get a good view of the bridge

Stunning Bridge Over The Danube. The Chain Bridge is one of the most beautiful attractions in Budapest in both day and (especially) night and has to be one of the most scenic bridges in Europe. We walked on it a number of times on our way to Buda and were impressed with the views of the Danube which look far mightier from there. The bridge is purely for vehicles and pedestrian so there isn't a whole lot of charm associated with it.
The most historical bridge in Budapest. Try to walk and see the beautiful lions at the entrance of the bridge, I walk along the bridge to go to the Margaret island.
Beautiful at Night. Don't miss this bridge when in Budapest. The bridge is particularly beautiful at night when all the lights of the city highlight its key buildings.

The favourite of the locals. Our tour guide told us that when the bridge was blown up in WW2 it broke the hearts of all the residents. This was the first bridge rebuilt. It is very nice to walk across and you can stop to take pictures. You can see the boats going by, which is neat.

Beautiful bridfe. Defines the character of Budapest across Danube
Good to walk on the bridge though not sure if it is allowed 😜 good views while walking on it as well
Must do for younger crowd visiting Budapest
Great views. This is a fantastic bridge a good place to cross the river from Bud to Pest but it also a great view of everything.

Spanning the River. This is one of the most famous landmarks in Budapest. The city of two sides Buda and Pest is connected by a number of bridges across the Danube. This one certainly warrants a visit and walkover

A perfect hanging out place. It looks amazing especially in the dark. Just get your drink and join the crowd in the night. Lots of students spend theor nights chatiing on the sideways of the bridge when they sip their beers.

It's just a brodge. It's nice to walk over the chain bridge. I was told it was a must do and for that I'm a little disappointed as it was built up to be spectacular when all it was a bridge! There are nice views mind you!
Nice bridge . Beautiful bridge, especially at nighttime when the lights are on. We enjoyed a very nice evening at the bar next to the bridge. Get yourself a lemonade and a beer and enjoy the view!
Beautiful place. Cross the Danube on a majestic bridge, and take the most beautiful pictures of various buildings in Budapest from the middle of the Danube.
It's a bridge.. Pretty and historically relevant but I have a hard time giving it top ratings because it's a bridge, and a crowded one at that.
Nice walk over the river!. The bridge is beautifully built. Crossing it by foot was a very pleasant activity. Also it offers a very good view of the danube and both sides of the city.
Chain bridge - Most important sight to see. Great landmark. was able to absorb all the history with this bridge. It was a great landmark to see and my teens loved to see this sight.

Awesome. The bridge itself (not the pillars) where bombed in the second world war, so the mid section is not that old. However it is still the oldes bridge in the city and it is structurally really interestig. Views are great as well. Try and see the bridge by day and by night. (night is my favorite).
Walk It. The bridge is central to everything i love about the river area. The views from here were spectacular. I had a nice cold beer here and i don't even really like beer.

Great view from the top of buda. Lovely to look at day and night. This bridge joining the two halves of the city, buda and pest, is a lovely landmark which isn't to be missed. Can walk across it. Would advise wondering along the river from this bridge. Nice area.

Bridge over the lovely waters. We walked across the Danube on this bridge. There are some great spots for photos and the pedestrian path is wide and well away from the traffic. This bridge connects Buda with Pest which makes it Budapest

Holiday time. This bridge it is beautiful to see
From there you can get many beautiful photos of the panorama!
The structure is really particular and unique in the world , I believe.
Pretty. Another landmark that you can say that you have seen =) It does certainly look much more impressive up close or when you're driving over it than it does in the pictures.

Classic Budapest Sight. This is Budapest's most famous bridge, and it's definitely worthwhile to walk across between Buda and Pest at least once while you're here. We enjoyed the huge lion statues along the bridge and the grand architecture you can see on both sides of the Danube.
Great Views. Take a walk over this bridge to the other side of the river and you get to see all the lovely views of this city
Fantastic sight. We enjoyed walking on the Chain Bridge and clicking beautiful photographs. It was a great sight walking from the funicular station to the Chain Bridge

Beautiful and Historic. Drove Chain Bridge during an orientation tour during the day. Again saw it at night during Danube river cruise. Looks very beautiful at night. A historic bridge and a must see attraction. Had recently seen in in a Bolywood movie in Mumbai, India !
Lovely . Well maintained bridge joining Buda to Pest . Seems to scoot over the end of Margrets island as well. Quite famous in Budapest

Enchanting!. The Chain Bridge cannot be missed at any cost! It's an absolute bliss to walk over the bridge, especially if you're with your loved one! You get to see many love locks locked in by couples all over the bridge! We were able to feel and experience the magic of this glorious city!

Good Walk. This is a nice walk with the bridge running over the river Danube from Pest to Buda.The bridge chief engineer was a Scotsman Adam Scott and is testament to the engineering excellence of the Scots and just another addition that we have made to this world. I would also recommend that the walk is done at night, when the place is lit up and is very nice

A fun walk to the Buda side. All the action is in Pest except for a few major attractions--citadel, castle, Fisherman's Bastion, etc.--but whether or not you go to see those, it is fun to walk across the bridge. There are several points along the bridge at the major supports where you can stop to take in the views. The bridge itself is a work of art, rivets and all. Traffic noise is not bad. On a hot day, it's breezy. Lots of people stopping for photos. On the Buda side, there is a cute little cafe and Clark Adam ter (park) before you hit the series of switchbacks that take you up the mountain--a fun walk up and not too steep a climb if you decide to do it. There's a zen garden cafe halfway up the hillside on the way to the castle--who would have expected that?

bridge. I am not impressed by static things and it felt like any other suspend bridge. I wish there were tour guides to tell me about history of it and why it is important. My fiance wasn't much help.

Nice Stroll on a Sunny Morning. Another one of those iconic things that make Budapest special. We walked across on our way to the all of the sights on the Buda side of the Danube. It is a relatively short walk, actually, but it gives you a wonderful view of Parliament, as well as some of the longboats that routinely navigate the river. Certainly not essential, but a nice thing to do when the weather permits.

Obviously! . Obviously you are going to come see this in Budapest! The views from the bridge are phenomenal! Sitting on some of the bridge is a great way to watch the sunset and people watch. A must do in Budapest!

you cant miss it. Its right in the middle of the city. Walking on the bridge in the evening was amazing. The weather in July was amazing too with the breeze. Those into photography can get a good pictures of the city here
Best bridge to walk.. Although this bridge is popular, it is by far the less crowded bridge to walk over and less congested. Again offers good views of the Danube and looks nice lit up at night.

Lovely bridge. A beautiful bridge connecting Buda with Pest. You are able to walk on both sides of the bridge and are protected from the cars and buses.
We walked down again in the evening and at night with the lights it is a beautiful sight.
Old bridge nice view. Espevially during the night you can take a nice photograph of this bridge from the riverside. Lighting of the bridge is nice.

Great views on both sides. Walked over this during a free walk tour. You can walk on both sides, so I would recommend doing that over and back.The walkways can probably fit 3 people. If you are walking with others, keep that in your thoughts, as other people are walking against you.Folks, don't buy locks and leave them here. Set up a a web site or something instead. More can visit your web site rather than the lock.

Simply Stunning. This is a highlight of any trip to Budapest. The views at night are simply stunning. Take an evening cruise on the Danube to see the Chain Bridge, Parliament and Castle Hill all lit up.

Bridge over troubled waters. We used 4 of the Budapest bridges. The Danube is continually crossed by small medium and large boats but the view over the town is superbe both with the light and at night..

Beautiful at night!. Sure, I've seen tons of bridges but Chain Bridge is quite special. It's probably the backdrop - beautiful bridge, awesome architectures. One should make an effort to see it at night because it is really special. They turn off the lights at 1 AM though (I think because that's what happened to me). If you can't make it during the night, it is as marvelous in broad daylight especially when viewed from Fisherman's Bastion.

Great views. The bridge offers great views of the Danube and both Buda and Pest. We walked across, there was ample room for foot traffic and bicycles, and that portion was well separated from cars and busses.
The heart of the city. The best walk between Pest and Buda where the city feels closest to the Danube and easy to explore the two sides at once.

Great bridge must see. This was my second Visit to Budapest and I have always got to go visit the bridge, it spans the river Danude it's a must visit especially to see it on a night and cross over to the Pest side to explore and castle have a ride in the funicular.

Beautiful Bridge, Especially at Night. We were lucky enough to be docked right by Chain Bridge so we had a great view of it day and night. Actually all the bridges connecting Buda & Pest are quite nice.

Great veiws. Very nice to take some great pics across river and very nice in evenings when a little cooler
You can catch the big red bus

It's more than a great walk. What a great storied bridge. The first of it's kind--opened in 1849. The Nazis destroyed it in WWII and it was rebuilt--an exact copy--in 1949. It does moe the connect Buda with Pest, in a symbolic way it connects Hungry with the western Europe. Take pictures by day and by night... but to see it you have to walk it.
Beautiful by night. Impressive design by both day and night - beautifully lit by night and worth a photo as you wander by the river. Lots of history, as has everything in this city!
Interesting. This bridge has an amazing history. It is a great way to see the Danube River while crossing from Pest to Buda

Perfect for an evening stroll. This Bridge links Buda to Pest and is located in the center of River. Makes for a lovely walk at night when buildings are lit up. It's free. Bars at the end of the bridge make for a good stop too. Many lovers enjoying the bridge and lots of good photos. Go for romance and take the walk. You will be glad you did. Night time is best in my opinion.

Amazing view specially in the night. I would say that one of the top attractions in Budapest is just having a walk through this bridge or others in the city during the night. The view is just amazing!
lovely to walk on the bridge. It is lovely to take a leisurely stroll over the chain bridge. The bridge is well kept and has a lovely view on the parliament buildings.

Scary. I went over this bridge several times and we even walked it at night. If you like to take pictures you need to walk over it and get pictures of both sides at night. I would have liked to do a dinner cruise at night down the Danube at night to see from a different angle.

Good walk. We came down from the Basilica and walk all the way over to the other side.Splendid view even though it's raining.And we walk down and cross the other bridge to get back to the other side.Good walk, highly recommended after u had a great dinner and Night view was awesome too,

I love this bridge. This was the first permanent bridge across the Danube in Hungary. It was designed in 1839 by William Clark and construction, managed by Adam Clark, was completed in 1849. It is fun to walk across and look up and down the river.
Scary 😁. Was a bit scary but it was ok. It was raining so I was trying to get across asap! I'd do it again as well. Gotta do the bridge. It's beautiful.

THE place for a Beautiful Nighttime Stroll. Take your time strolling along this bridge at night and you won't regret it, the views of both river banks are incredible and Budapest is beautifully lit up at night, make sure you've got a good camera!
Great views of both sides of Budapest. Nice walk and great views. It is very convenient and picturesque way to go from Buda to Pesh. It is very historic.
A great hangout . The tramlines were being repaired so on a warm August evening the bridge was occupied by 100's of people. Picnics, fun, selfies & music. Wonderful vib.

A useful bridge!. I really wanted to see the Chain Bridge for myself and to be honest I cant see what is so wonderful about it! It was nice to be able to walk over it and to see the view from it but that was about all really.

Beautiful, accessible, great views. Definitely worth the walk on the bridge. Make sure you come back on the opposite side to take in all the views. Great pictures of Gellert hotel/spa and parliament to be had.

For the romantic. This is a fantastic piece of architecture so must be seen.
This has taken over from Paris for young and the old to lock in their padlocks of love.

Great icon. Worth a trip and a walk across, we went as the sun was setting which was great with views over parliament. Bear in mind that most ancient monuments were destroyed at the end of the war and were rebuilt afterwards. This is one of them. So it's more a matter of Hungarian reconstruction determination than longevity.
Very romantic at night. A view to behold in the day, but at night when it is all lit up it really is a treat. You can easily walk across it and get some great pictures of the Danube river.
Wonderful lit up at night. Quite busy to walk over due to traffic and pedestrians and noisy too. But it looks lovely all lit up at night. There are a lot of people with selfie sticks!!!!!!!!

The most beautiful bridge. During Day time or at Night this beautiful bridge will amaze you every time.I tool 100 of snaps but i couldn't stop myself. Go till middle of bridge and take snap with Buda caslte. Awesome view !!!

City's oldest and arguably most beautiful bridge. This twin towered bridge was built in 1849. You can walk across or drive. Lit at night it is quite pretty. It was built by two Scotsmen named Clark (no relation). Was considered when it was built as THE symbol of modern Hungary.
Verry nice. This is a suspension bridge over Danube joing Buda & Pest. Designed by British engineer it was the first permanent bridge over Danube in Hungary.
It's a bridge.. Yes, views down the Danube are nice but it's just a bridge. Can't see what the fuss is about really.
No need to walk across . This bridge seems to connect the most popular areas of town, so we crossed it every day. It's beautiful but there's not much additional value in walking across it.

A good walk. The Chain bridge is another landmark in Budapest. It's a nice way to get to Buda from Pest by foot. From there you get nice views of the Danube and when you reach Buda you are right in front of the funicular.

Chain Bridge covered in lights at night.. We were on a Viking Cruise and arrived in Budapest around 10:30 one night. We were told this was the best time to cruise in as Parliament and the Chain Bridge are both lit up. Don't miss this! Make sure you are by the Danube after dark because you will not want to miss the beauty. We even requested a hotel room at the Marriott that overlooked the Bridge.

Chained with a beauty. Two roaring lines at the gates with their own story in the back ground gives a totally splendid look The bridge has a strength of its own in its look only , one can simply imagine the mind and the technology involved to build it - dividing Buda with Pest -the bridge has a beautiful look especially at night when it is glowing in its splendid strings of light showMust watch during that time is highly recommended
Buda meets Pest🖒. Could be a great connector for your daily trips.... u might end up looking/visiting it numerous times during your visit... exquisite
From Buda Castle....Very Impressive . Viewed from the castle district, the chain bridge is very impressive from a height. You can also walk across it as it spans the Danube connecting Buda and Pest.

Iconic. This bridge is a true beauty, both from architectural view and historical importance.
This was the first permanent bridge which linked Buda with Pest, and it dates back to mid-XIX century.
Lion statues on both sides are the most well-known image of the bridge.
Best At Night. There are some nice views from the bridge. You can walk across the bridge and up to Castle Hill. Very beautiful at night and you cannot miss it.
Average. It's a bridge. You walk across it and take photos of both sides of the Danube. That's it. Frankly, I didn't get why it's considered a tourist attraction. Maybe I missed the point. :)

Interesting Bridge over the Danube. As bridges go, it is a quite an interesting bridge and you can not miss it!You can of course walk back and forth across it or you can go on a short river cruise which will take you under it. This will be accompanied by an audio pre-recorded commentary and a glass of wine, depending on the boat company that you choose.Good fun!

Much better to walk than drive!. Excellent views of the boats on the Danube and access and views of the castle and the Parliament buildings. There are limited eating facilities on the castle side, but access to stairs and lift to the castle
Beautiful and impressive.. It's really impressive to cross the Danube throgh this bridge. At night it's even more beautiful and impressive.

LINKS BUDA WITH PEST. This bridge is an absolute must to walk across as it links Buda on the hill, with Pest. Walking towards Pest, you can go right up to the funicular to ride up the hill or you can walk up. It is great to stand in the middle of the bridge and watch the river 'action' on both sides as well as both up and down the Danube.
Beautiful views. Definitely should walk over the Chain Bridge (a suspension bridge) as part of any visit to Budapest. The views are breathtaking!

Great views. Obviously we were going to visit the chain bridge and cross it while in Budapest. We first saw it in the evening when it was lit up, it is stunning. We then crossed it the next day, was shocked how run down the bridge actually is but you get lovel views from the bridge.

Fantastic span over the Danube. Walked over this bridge several times a day while in Budapest. Connects the Buda and the Pest areas. Walk over this and you can get to Margaret island for a great day out.Stand on the bridge day and night and see all the boats below. Sometimes the river looks calm and still other times it looks dark and gloomy.Great viewpoint to see all the buildings illuminated at night.If you do not feel like walking several of the trams stop on the bridge.

Magnificent bridge over the Danube in Budapest. The Chain Bridge is a magnificent bridge over the Danube River that joins Buda and Pest. We walked across the bridge one evening and it was spectacular to see the Parliament lit up on one side of the river and Castle Hill lit up on the other side. We walked along the promenade of the river and had great views of the bridge as we walked to and from dinner. The Chain Bridge is one of the highlights of Budapest.

Good view at night. The Bridge links the Old (Buda) with the new (Pest) side of the city over the River Danube. Like many other landmarks in Budapest, the Chain Bridge has a dramatic view at night. You can capture the guardian lion at the entrance, then walk onto the bridge. It can get a bit scary with cars whizzing by.

Nighttime stoll along the Danube. Again, this rating is for the view at night - Budapest has an absolutely lovely 'river walk' along the Danube at night. The Chain Bridge is just one of the sights to see.
Good Looking Bridge. A replica I believe of the original destroyed in the 2nd world war. Take a stroll across and view both Pest and Buda. Looks good at night illuminated.

A landmark which looks nice at night. Unfortunately the bridge tends to be clogged with traffic and hence there are lots of fumes. It also does not look that spectacular during daytime although it is fun to walk across. It looks far better at night when it is lit up and when we visited there were lots of people taking pictures from various angles both of the bridge and from the bridge either up to Buda Castle or towards parliament all of which are also lit at night. I understand that the bridge is occasionally closed to traffic for festivals and that must be fun.

A must to see if you are in Budapest. Great bridge to view Budapest from, and to walk across and see the Danube and take some great photo's - you can walk along the river both sides lovely in the summer, spring and even winter.
nice bridge. can walk the bridge from side to side the bridge connect the old city with the new one recommended to watch it also at night
Amazing. A view of the bridge in the the evening is a spectacular show to your eyes. Amazing view to mesmerise you from the banks of Danube.
Nice design, but needs some repair. We walked across the bridge to get to the other side. It is a longer walk than I thought be well worth it. Get to the middle and take pictures of Buda and Pest.
Beautiful bridge. Have to remember the Germans destroyed all 8 bridges across the Danube so this isn't the original, but is a great replica. Pleasant to look at.

Lovely at Sunset. The views and colors at sunset make this magnificent bridge even better. Take a stroll across and enjoy all the beautiful colors on the Danube, especially of Castle Hill and Parliament. Walked across many times.

Striking Chain Bridge in heart of Budapest. When walking along the Danube river promenade, the site of the Chain Bridge in Budapest is striking, from both sides of the river. It is a good example of the past success and history of this City. The are many bridges over the Danube but Chain Bridge is the oldest, which was built in 1849 i think. A beautiful part of the City, especially in Summer.
Take a walk on the Chain Bridge. Enjoyed this walk over the chain bridge from our tram ride over to the castle where a Picasso exhibit was highlighted.

Historical value mostly. This bridge is in serious need of renovation. Parts of it are rotting away. As an artifact, it can't hold a candle to Menai Straits or Clifton. As the bridge that united Buda and Pest, and is 160 years old, it is amazing. Selfie paradise, apparently...
Chain bridge. Good link to both sides of Budapest with views across the Danube. Can be a long walk for those with walking difficulties but can be crossed by bus.
Lovely bridge . When walking around Budapest, this is a bridge worth using to cross between Pest and Buda - the bridge has good architecture and is worth a look
Softub budapest visit. One of the nicest bridges we have seen Very central located down town conecting buda and pest at the door steps of four seasons
Buda side tour. Budapest is a very interesting city and so much to see. Enjoyed it very much. This country has such a long history and some of it very tragic.
Interesting structure. Interesting structure and very significant location, a good point to cross from Pest to Buda. Definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful bridge. They are spoiled for beautiful bridges across the Danby in Budapest. However Chain Bridge is the most beautiful of them all. Well worth wandering across for the fabulous views.
Beautiful at night. The bridge is lighted up at night and presents a very nice background especially when you view from fisherman bastion.
Interesting place. The Chain Bridge is one of mains attractions in Budapest. It is impresive the bridges in Budapest are different. You can pedestrian walk over having nice view of Danube river

Our favourite crossing on foot. As we stayed on the Buda side of the Danube (in Hotel Victoria, great!), we crossed this bridge at least twice if not four times a day. The pedestrian walkway is separated from vehicle traffic; very pleasant. Is it relevant that this bridge was the first? Maybe not, although it drives home the point that Buda and Pest were indeed separate cities connected only by ferries or seasonal pontoon bridges.
Its all about the View. Whether you are just out for a stroll or really want to get to the other side, definitely worth it for the view of both the scenery and the Iconic Bridge!

Historic bridge . This bridge was the second longest suspension bridge in the world when it was first built in 1849 and it joined the Buda side with the Pest side. Sadly it was badly damaged during WWII and was rebuilt shortly thereafter. It's stunning at night from any vantage point, especially though with the Buda Castle in the background.
My favorite bridge in Budapest. A beautiful walk, especially after sunset. My favorite Budapest bridge, I still appreciate driving or walking it even after so many years of living in Budapest.

My favourite bridge in Budapest. Budapest has many bridges above the Danube but my favourite one is the Chain bridge. You can easily walk accross the bridge and you can see the Parliament, the Fishermen's bastion, the Buda castle, the Liberty statue, the Elsabeth bridge. Normally it is better to use always the right side of the bridge there and back (so you see the Parliament there and you see the Elisabeth bridge when you turn back). After walking accross the bridge you can go up to the Castle zone as there is a direct connection from the end of the bridge (Clark Ádám tér) on the steps or by the Funicular.
MUST SEE. This bridge is pictures in many Indian Films like 'Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam' and "Sultaan'. It is pretty and very famous not he Danube. A boat ride is ideal way to see this

A big meeting place. At present the bridge is closed to traffic because of road works.It was filled with people, mostly young, sitting chatting in the road, sitting on the pavement with food and some drink. One couple had slung a hammock under the girders. It was a great atmosphere and very non-threatening. No obvious drunks, stoned/dodgy people just a lovely way to spend a summer evening. We walked along just before midnight and us oldies were quite envious. A police car came across the bridge "just checking" but only encouraged some young men who had climbed high up the suspension chains to come down to a safer level.

Excellent views on this replica bridge. You may wonder why I titled this as a replica bridge? Well the Nazis blew up the original during the seige of Budapest in 1945 and the modern bridge was rebuilt in 1947. This aside, it provides great views of the Danube and once crossed an easy entrance to the Castle district.

Iconic bridge of budapest . Iconic bridge of budapest which joins buda and pest. Lovely to walk across and look across the river from the other side.
Also is free to walk across.

Think of bicycle chain links. Széchenyi lánchíd is known in English as Chain Bridge, so called because the suspension “cables” are like links in a bicycle chain. This suspension bridge opened in 1849, spans River Danube, and connected the separate cities of Buda and Pest. It was Hungary’s first permanent bridge crossing the Danube. In the mid-1800s, it was regarded as one of the world’s engineering wonders, and contributed significance to Hungary’s social, economic, and culture, much as the Brooklyn Bridge impacted New York when that was completed 34 years later, in 1883. Today it serves as the city’s symbol, much like San Francisco’s Golden Gate Bridge did 88 year later, in 1937. Is the GG Bridge “just” a bridge?It does serve as a bridge leading to Buda Castle, Fisherman’s Bastion, and Mathias Church, as well as dozens of other attractions on the Buda side. When visiting, I walked across to fully experience it. I got various perspectives of both sides of the river that I couldn’t when surrounded by b
Spectacular bridge. The most amazing bridge. Best time to appreciate its' beauty is at night when it is light up. Central location so easy to cross from Buda to Pest

Beautiful bridge, especially a night. Chain Bridge (Szechenyi Lanchid) gets a 5 because it is gorgeous when lit at night. It is also very nice in the daytime for walking as it provides convenient access between Pest and Buda. This review is from a pedestrian perspective, although I expect boats provide excellent views also. I am very fond of bridges and whenever possible like to walk across them. For a bridge lover, Budapest stands out for how pedestrian friendly its bridges are, the glorious lighting of bridges and buildings, and also the way the Danube is its heart.To get on the bridge from Pest, decide which side of the bridge you want to walk on and if necessary use the underpass to get to the desired side (from the embankment take the stairs up). I recommend the north side looking at Parliament and Margaret Island, but south looking at the National Gallery and Elizabeth Bridge is also nice. Access from Buda is via crosswalks around the traffic circle leading into the tunnel (near the Buda Castle Funicular).When we visited in July the bridge was lit at 9PM, about 15 minutes after sunset, but with sunset color still in the sky. The chains were lit first, followed by the towers, which at first had a greenish glow, followed by the more conventional yellow light (see photos). We were able to see it with sunset colors initially followed by full darkness, making a nice contrast (the view from south of the bridge on the Pest side is best for sunset color).
Beautiful views. A must while in BudapestBeautiful bridge, the most famous in Budapest. Over the Danube River. Great photo ops from both sides
It's a bridge!!. Not worth a special journey, it's a bridge - big deal, nothing very special that we could see! Bit windy half way over!

BEAUTIFUL, ESPECIALLY AT NIGHT. This is the main tourist bridge crossing the Danube from Pest to Buda and Castle Hill. Bridge is very attractive, especially when lit at night. There are great views when you walk across the bridge whether you are looking up at Castle Hill or over to Parliament. The passageway is rather narrow in spots, especially when you are going around a corner so be careful of bicycles and stay to the right. Also watch your footing as bridge has some rough spots that need repairs. We stayed directly at the foot of the Chain Bridge at the Intercontinental Hotel and had a great view of it from our large triple picture window. Can't beat it at night.
Chain Bridge in Budapest-#3. So much to see in Budapest. The Chain Bridge is very centrally located, and connects Buda with Pest. A beautiful structure, especially at night.Tom and LisaBroomfield, CO

Nice Bridge!!. It was precious to see the Danube from the bridge and crossing from Buda to Pest. The architecture is pretty nice and the views from there are breathtaking. Make sure you go there with a camera to take pictures of the skyline!!
A bridge full of life. A wonderful bridge with great views of the city, take time to look at the bridge as you cross as the design is wonderful.
Great way to cross the river. Fascinating to learn that this bridge was almost all completely destroyed during the war. The bridge itself is stunning and provides lovely views as you walk across.

Useful to get to the castle . The bridge is nothing special but useful to get to the castle. Crowded with tourists, traffic & people on bikes it's not particularly stunning or beautiful but gets you accross the Dan.
Awesome. This is one of the oldest bridge in Europe, with amazing chain architecture. You can view by a nice walk, or even pass it by car.
Interesting to walk over the Danube. Enjoyed walking over the bridge and seeing the boats navigating the Danube. FYI, unlike the song describes, the River Danube is not blue. :)
Stunning. The view of the bridge from the boat cruise is breathtaking. I would very much recommend you visit at night to soak up the atmosphere.

The patio bar of our hotel had a view of the Chain Bridge.. Before a Danube River cruise we spent two days in Budapest at the Intercontinental Hotel just downstream from the Chain Bridge, the oldest existing bridge in Budapest. After a day of sightseeing in Budapest, we had a beer on the hotel patio overlooking the Chain Bridge and its iconic lions guarding the approach on each side of the bridge.
Beautiful. Stunning bridge especially at night would deffo reccomend heading down at about 9pm when the lights come on
Beats Paris. When i drove through the bridge as i reached budapest centrum - the aura shook me. beyond words and supremely beautiful
A Fun Way to Cross the Danube!. Hey, it's just a bridge but you can say you walked across the Danube! Easy walk, great views and it gets you over the Castle Hill. A fun way to get across the river!

One of the beatifull historical bridge in the world.. One of the icon and beautiful historical bridge like Charles (Prague) and Tower (London) in the world. It looks very nice from the Castle Hill , Parlemento and inside Danube river. Starting from Chain Bridge up to Castle hill, Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion one of great and beautiful historical area in the world. Take a booth tour before sunset and watch the bridge.

Fantastic views of the Danbue. We were lucky enough to be visiting Budapest when the Red Bull Air race was on so saw many plans fly under this icon bridge to start their trials. It was the first bridge to link Buda and Pest and I would definitely recommend walking over the bridge to get the best views and then take the fennecular rail up to the castle area.

A must do. With the Danube forming such a central part of the history of Budapest, it is only right to try and walk across as many of the bridges as possible, to get the different perspectives of the City and the river itself.

Every time, different see. If you go daytime, of course it is nice. But I prefer to visit sun set. In July, the sunset is after 21:00. I walked at that time, and also watched from the hill. You can enjoy different view.
A good walk. We used the Chain Bridge a few times to cross the river but it is not just a means to get from a to b. The views of the river are worth stopping for and admiring the structure.

Difficult to review a bridge, but.... It's a Budapest landmark and it is a very nice looking and functional piece of architecture, however (HOWEVER!), be warned that it gets shut to traffic and walkers on a whim. It's a pain in the bum to expect a pleasant walk to Buda only to find the bridge closed and facing a 20 minute taxi ride over another bridge. :(
Awesome at night. We went across the bridge a few times during the day and twice at night. People gather to hang out, with drinks and food. Very nice atmosphere and great for people watching

Walk over it and enjoy the views!. This is such a beatiful city and the chain bridge is the focus of the Danube River. We sailed under it at nightfall and enjoyed the views of the lights on the bridge!

a great view of the river between Buda and Pest. Take the time to walk both the Margaret Bridge and Chain Bridge as each gives slightly different and interesting perspectives. The Chain Bridge also has many massive sculptures to see close up and the old world masonry is exquisite.
Beautiful. Worth visit. Beautiful bridge over to the other side of Donau that makes it possible to visit sights on the other side. Beautiful construction. Wow effect
A nice bridge with history. You will find this bridge a lot more interesting if you read about it first, as it is pretty but it's the historical part of it that really stands out
Stroll over the Danube. It was a nice walk over the Chain Bridge. It connects Buda and Pest at convenient locations. The bridge is very beautiful.

Great view from hill. My favourite bridge in Budapest! Great view from hill (Budapest Castle, museum and from small bridges on funicalar). Gorgeous lions, a lot of ships, beautiful night views. Love it!
Good for late afternoon walk. It is crowed in afternoon, people hang around for sunset it is nice place to roam around in late afternoon before heading for dinner
Impressive. The bridge is impressive, it connects the old "Buda" and "Pest" and allows you to have a great sight of the parliament.
fantastic place. lovely views of the danube by far the best bridge built over it we travelled over it a few times and loved it the architecture is amazing very happy would come back
Beautiful brigde. I like the view and the architecture. The bridge entrance is guarded by lions and while crossing it by foot you can feel the vibrations from big automobiles.

Ponte Luiz I in Porto, Chain Bridge in Budapest. I felt the same on the Chain Bridge, what I felt on Ponte Luiz I over Douro River in Porto. Charming, Powerful, aesthetic and romantic at the same time, especially at sunset. Connecting two worlds apart. Feeling "being there".
Beautiful view of the city. Don't miss this short walk between Pest and Buda... it offers beautiful views on both sides. Be ware on rainy days ... it is windy - hold on to your umbrella.

A beautiful bridge!. I am a fan of amazing bridge architecture and this bridge falls into the amazing bridge category -- but then -- all of Budapest is so inspirational! Highly recommend you see the bridge from a river cruise if you can -- highly recommend Viking.

Beautiful bridge especially at night. Chain Bridge spans the Danube and was the first bridge (opened in 1849) to link the Buda and Pest sides of the river. The towers are original but the rest of the bridge was blown up by the Germans in WWII and had to be rebuilt. Be sure to take a walk across the bridge both during the day and especially at night. The bridge has great views of both Buda and Pest so there will be plenty of opportunities to take great pictures. Be sure to head up to the castle district above to get great shots of the entire bridge.

Beautiful by day, spectacular by night. This chain bridge is one of several bridges across the Danube, but is probably the most beautiful - -and is absolutely spectacular when lit up at night. We were on a Viking River Cruise and at night our boat made a scenic cruise to view the lights -- this bridge was gorgeous.We were surprised to see a number of younger people walking ON the bridge. There are no rails so if it's wet from rain looks to be hazardous. We thought they were nuts to be honest, because that walk is at your own risk. There is plenty of sidewalk space and there are times the bridge is actually closed to vehicle traffic. In any event, the views of the Danube are lovely and the views of the bridge FROM the river are also something to see. We also viewed it from the top of Castle Hill on the Buda side and it stood out.The Danube separates Buda from Pest and a busy River. We were surprised how busy it was at night! But why not -- the views of the lit up Parliament Building, Castle and other sites are something you'll never forget.

Best place to propose . What a romantic place...and all around the bridge the view is breathtaking . Incredible. The Mathias church, the Royal castle, Four season Hotel. Best place to walk around ....
Best viewed at night. When the lights lit up after sunset, the bridge looks exceptionally beautifully. Weird that a bridge can look so good.

Walk across in the pedestrian lane.. This bridge is the newest bridge across the Danube in the city area of Budapest. We walked across the river using the pedestrian lane and then walked back.It was wonderful. We were able to take many wonderful photos of both banks of the river. It was a very enjoyable walk.

Real feel of Budapest. This Bridge is situated on Danube river which divides the old Buda from the buzzing pest side. Great clicks from the bridge and amazing view in night time with all the lights on.

climbing chains and free yoga class. Passing there with the kids it was fun seeing all this people climbing and walking on it I mean climbing the bridge itself not its sidewalk! A sweet local girl explained us that in the summer they close the bridge to transport and have a great free bridge yoga lesson and more. When we were there it was yoga time and many people had picnic on the road. It was beautiful seeing it loved it!
A relaxing walk. . Go for a walk over the Chain Bridge stop and take in tha sights of the Danube flowing beneath, take a boat trip at night and wonder at the beautiful sight of the bridge lit up.

chain bridge walk. Wonderful view from all angles, boat, road and from the castle. Would recommend good walking shoes and enough timevto take it all in. Well worth a walk across on foot. Views of the danube river and castle. You wont be disappointed

Chain bridge Budapest . Good place to visit. Take a cruise ride in the river below, but be sure about not getting overcharged. The bridge connects western and eastern city parts viz Buda and pest. Spend some time in the evening summer cool breeze at the bridge.
Evening walk. Go up the castle by bus number 16 in the evening and walk down as the sun goes down and walk over the chain bridge in the evening

The view of the bridge is just breath taking . Its one of the sights you must visit once your in Budapest. Make sure you take a good camera with you. I recommend visiting the sight day and night . you will not regret it.
Stunning views.. Lovely bridge with great views over the River Danube and directly opposite the Funicular up to the Castle.

Will lead you to the Castle District.. This is the bridge to cross from Pest to Buda if you wish to visit the Castle District, National Gallery, Fisherman's Bastion area. Having crossed the bridge you then have a choice of walking up the hill - good luck - or taking the Finicula Railway - wooden in construction and charming to ride. It is also the bridge to stand on for great sunsets and at night to see the most beautiful Parliament Building all lit up. On the Pest Side at the foot of the bridge you have the famous Four Seasons Hotel that used to be a bank and is a very impressive building too. Wander and enjoy.

Proportion. One of my favorite views at night. I love it's proportion, solidness and it's reflection in the Danube. Somehow it is calming and triggering at the same time. It makes me want to take a deep breath and enjoy life and the beauty that surrounds me.

A Beautiful Bridge. What is there to say except that this is a beautiful bridge. Szechneyl was a 19th Century Hungarian noble who raised the funds for this showpiece which serves today as an iconic image of the city.

A great place to stroll, going from Buda to Pest. We took a city tour to get the highlights for Budapest, which is divided by the river into the more traditional Buda section and the more modern Pest section. After the tour, we walked to do our own tour. There are many bridges crossing the river. It is easy to get from one side to the other on foot. The Chain Bridge has lions on each end of it. The guide told a story about the sculptor being ridiculed because the lions had no tongue in their mouths. He committed suicide, only proving that bullying has been around for a long time. The bridge itself was beautiful, and the city lit up at night to make a lovely river cruise.

Sunset. This funky bridge is fun to view cross and sit upon anytime day or night but sunset is most wonderful. Just be careful getting up. A local told me that sitting on it is against the law and that he has heard police write tix so sitters beware!

Nice Views. We walked across ALL of the bridges connecting Buda and Pest but the best views come at night when the Parlaiment building is lit up. Certainly worth an evening stroll to get some awesome pictures

The historic bridge that unifies Buda & Pest. A wonderful bridge that is friendly to ALL!!! You can drive, walk, run or pedal across the bridge for different perspectives. A magnificent feat of engineering with "watch lions" keeping tabs on everyone.

Amazing bridge. Amazing chain bridge joining Buda and Pest in to one town.
Looks even nicer at nightime when lit.
Must see when in Budapest.
Lions without tongue . You must see if you go to Budapest. Try to go if it is not full with tourists. Nice view of the city from here.
Great to walk across.. Great to walk across for panoramic view of Budapest. Very photogenic bridge, good vantage point for picture taking.

Spectacular, Day and Night. Walking across the Chain Bridge provides great views (and some reasonably good exercise), and the lit bridge at night is truly spectacular. From the end of the bridge on the Buda side, you can easily walk to the funicular which takes you up to the castle. I most enjoyed the view of the Chain Bridge from our river cruise boat as we left Budapest after dark. Day and/or night this is a must-see if you go to Budapest.
19th century bridge . Great to walk across at night offering amazing views both towards Buda and it's gorgeous castle Hill and down to Pest for a view of the Parliament building.

Chain Bridge. An impressive looking structure which connects Buda to Pest on the Danube River. It is often shown in the evening with its lights on, as one of the luring highlights of Budapest. Unfortunately, we sailed from Budapest before it got dark.

The most impressive bridge in Budapest. There are a number of bridges across the Danube in Budapest and Chain is the most impressive architecturally. If you are staying on the Pest side of the river and want to explore Buda on the opposite bank, it is also the best thoroughfare to get there, providing excellent views of all the major sights as you walk across.

Beautiful! . The bridge was designed by Adam Clark a British man and is an iconic feature of Budapest! Lovely views when walking across at daytime and nighttime and then the view of the bridge itself from the pavement is beautiful at night when it is lit up!

You will see it. A Bridge is a Bridge really, but the views from there to both sides and the river is magic. Being where it is there are many opportunities to see it on way to or back from other attractions.Do take your time to stop and walk it for the view. If you can, do it during the nite as well. You will be well rewarded. A tripot will be handy if you like photography.

an easy walk across and back and great views. Take the time to cross even if you simply turn around can come back on the opposite side of the bridge. Great views, and on a hot summer day, a cooling breeze.
Great for photos. Great place to take photos and look out over the river. Highly recommended - pick a sunny day if possible.

First bridge of Budapest. Okay, it's a bridge. It's the first permanent one of Budapest.
But it's not that impressive. Don't except anything like the Charles Bridge in Pragues.
But it's a must see in Budapest and it's really convenient to cross the Danube (you don't say!!)
Iconic image of Budapest. Take your camera and photograph this bridge when lit up at night from the Buda side looking over to the Pest side. But any angle and time of day would work too.

The most important bridge in BP. The first and most important bridge. Very beautiful, nice view from there. It has also funny historical background. :-)
Not to miss, when in Budapest!

Beautiful. The chain bridge is a vehicle bridge with foot paths for pedestrians, and connects the old town of Buda to Pest, over the Danube. It's a beautifully designed bridge that takes approx 5 mins to walk over with excellent views down the Danube. The significance of this bridge in Budapest's history is great, being the first one to be built after all bridges over were destroyed during WW2.
Historic bridge. If in Buda or Pest check out the chain bridge. My Uber driver told us of the historical significance! We walked it! You've got to get a picture in front with the lions!
Great. Great area so much lively filled up with stationed & moving cruises.Huge crowd of tourists hanging around with selfies & camera

Beautiful Bridge over the Danube. We took a stroll over this bridge which is a replica of a bridge built in 1849 that was destroyed in WWII. The foot of the bridge at either side has two majestic lions at either side and you have a beautiful view of Buda and pest as you walk. Also there is a lovely breeze on the bridge. A great orientation to the City.

The best of the bridge is illuminating at night. ΅You can admire the chain bridge from many sides. During a cruise in the Danube river at night is the most wonderful case. If you go through the bridge, it' s dificult to realize it, because of the noise and the traffic.

Lovely chain bridge. Loved this bridge, it's between the parliament building and the buda castle and crossed it many times. It has such a presence and has great views. Lovely to watch the cruise boats set sail from the bridge too. It connects buda and pest everyone will cross it at some point during their stay.

A Link between Buda & Pest. The chain bridge was perfectly located between our hotel position and the funicular that runs from to the top of the hill linking you to The Royal Palace and the established area around Fishermans Bastion.
A pleasant walk either during the day or night provides many a sightseeing opportunity and activity on the river.
Yep it's a bridge . While this bridge has a good story it is ultimately just a bridge. For us it was the best walking path to visit the Budda side which is highly recommended.

Worth walking across to take in the scenery. Watch out for cycists and be wary of beggars.. I enjoyed walking across the bridge to get to Gellert Hill but I just love walking. There were some parts in the areas nearby which had urine smells and there were many beggars. Personally I preferred the view OF the chain bridge once I reached castle hill.

Historic and Romantic all in one Place. Budapest's Chain Bridge may be one of the oldest suspension bridges still in use. You can (and should) walk across this span as a way to enjoy the beauty of the city and of the Danube. You'll see those ubiquitous locks of love, you'll see romantic strollers, and you'll realize why Budapest is such a joy to visit. Don't let hurried schedules deprive you of this walk at least once.
Strolling on the Danube. Enjoy your walk crossing the oldest bridge connecting Buda and Pest! Enjoy the sunset during summer by the Danube river
The iconic bridge. .A beautiful bridge best viewed from a boat on the river. Walking on the bridge is less attractive with constant traffic and traffic noise and fumes

A beautiful bridge that is worth the time to explore. The bridge was right outside our hotel so,we were able to watch hog both the river traffic and the foot traffic across it. We walked across the bridge to the Buda side. The views of the Danube and the city are wonderful. A great place to take pictures and people watch.
Unique. Even reconstructed, nice bridge with history and beautiful views over Buda and Pest, interesting to cross walking

Our favorite Budapest bridge. The loveliest of Budapest's many bridges, the Chain Bridge connects some of the best parts of Buda and Pest. Delightful to stroll across and beautifully illuminated at night
It's beautiful!!. Definitely walk...run..jog..whatever it is on this bridge but do it! It's gorgeous out there..it connects buda and pest and offers great views of both sides.

Lovely bridge. It is a lovely bridge definitely worth a visit especially were is is situated with the view from the top of the hill definitely a recommendation if you are visiting Budapest. The lions on wither side give the bridge amazing detail. Worth a picture

A crazy experience. I was walking near the bridge and I saw a bunch of tourists climbing up the stairs (which I think is not allowed but maybe someone started it and the others followed). I decided to take the opportunity and join them so I went all the way up and had a great view over the city and the Danube. Keep in mind that you are responsible for yourself if you want to do it!
Good picture point. We stayed in the Pest side of Budapest. We walked over this bridge to see the Buda side. The bridge itself is picture worthy, and the views from the bridge are also good.
Gorgeous views. No matter what make sure to walk across this bridge. You get really neat perspectives from the bridge.

Beautiful bridge; lovely walk, but go in early morning or evening to avoid crowds. When you go to Budapest as a tourist, the Chain Bridge is something you want to cross. It's a beautiful bridge across a beautiful river. Best to go in the mornings or evenings as it gets very crowded during the day and it's much more enjoyable with fewer people. Views from the bridge are excellent.

Synonymous with Budapest. We went there at night and also saw it in the day time. I would suggest night view. In the night you can also spend time on the bridge in the cool breeze. Chain bridge is located close to the parliament and is a must see in Budapest. The two lions are majestic. You can have a good view of the parliament from the bridge. In addition to the main road on the bridge, there is a pedestrian way allowing you to walk freely across the bridge. However be wary of skateboarders. If you need to go to the other lane of the bridge use the underpasses located at ends of the bridge. There is no conspicuous pedestrian crossing close to the bridge. DON'T try jay walking as there is a good traffic on the bridge.P.S. For photography enthusiasts, do bring a tripod if you're coming at night. You'll have beautiful shots of parliament and Buda castle district from the bridge and vicinity.
Pleasant walk across Danube with beautiful view. We had a very nice stroll through Chain bridge, with very nice views of both Buda and Pest. A must do!
Széchenyi Chain Bridge. It was the first permanent bridge across the Danube in Hungary, and was opened in 1849. It spans the River Danube between Buda and Pest.
Beauty of Badupest. You should take a roundtrip stroll through this bridge.I really enjoyed scenic night view of budapest from this georgeous bridge.

I couldn't get enough of this. When I was in elementary school I learned about the River Danube. To actually walk across this lovely bridge and take in the views...one of the most priceless experiences of my life.

Majestic Over the Danube. The image of the chain bridge is so symbolic of Budapest. Indians head to this bridge made famous having featured importantly in a very successful Bollywood flick.
It is a marvellous structure.

Old and nice. Spanning over the DAnube, it is one of the many bridges. But this was the first bridge which was builkt by the Englishman Clark, on the initiativ of Baron Széchenyi. Walk through the bridge to enjoy both sides of the river.
Beautiful at night. I walked over the chain bridge at night. It is a beautiful walk. It is well lit at night, There is a bar on both sides of the bridge if you want to extend your walk. It is free.

Beautiful view for Dunai. watch out for cyclists, they ride very quickly and you have to watch out for the cameras, next to us, some couple when taking pictures hit cyclist and they lost camera in water

Beautiful bridge and views. Architecture was superior and views from bridge and on either side of Buda and Pest were great. Definitely worth a walk across the Danube. Stop in the middle and take a panarama shot!
You have to go see it when in Budapest. We walked over and the history is interesting but its pretty much just a bridge, still you need to go when in Budapest just so you can say you have been
Must walk across during sunset!. Ancient chained bridge that connects Buda and Pest. Take a stroll specially during sunset to see the change in colour of the sky and the Danube that is running below.

Heart of Budapest. This historic bridge can't be missed when touring Budapest. It drops you out at the base of the Vernicular on the Buda side, so it makes a nice walk to approach a day of hiking around the castle district
Hey it's a bridge. It's a bridge and it's cheaper and sometimes faster than catching a cab -- get your picture taken at night with lit up landmarks in the background
Beautiful view . Highly recommended to visit it in the evening or night, when all the lights in the city go on and you see all the landmarks

Stunning views. Lovely bridge to walk over the Danube linking Buda and Pest. Great views up and down river. The bridge is very popular so very busy and a little noisy with the road traffic. Worth the effort to cross though and a lovely experience to see both sides of the city
Beautiful to see at night. The Chain Bridge (Szechenyi lanchid) is an amazing sight to see with the lights on during the night time

Must see. I would recommend seeing the bridge by walking it, from top of Buda Castle and from the Danube. It's great during the day with its proud lions watching over it and magical when the lights come on.

It allowed us to travel to Buda.... Having read so much about the Chain Bridge, I was disappointed when I saw it. It is a bridge and not an original one. Almost all the bridges along the Danube have been replaced having been blown up during the last war. It is lovely when viewed at night when it is all lit up but does not compare to the Charles Bridge in Prague as a tourist spot.

The most famous bridge in the city. It is a great architecture example. There are lion sculptures in the beginning of the bridge. I heard that the artist forgot tongues of the lions and he commited suicide when he realized his mistake. After his death, other lions sculptures made without tongues.
Historic Bridge. Large and historic bridge with lion statues on the end. As you cross westward, there's a great view of Buda Castle on the hill.
Main attraction at Buda pest. This is the most beautiful bridge that connects Buda and Pest.While there are 4 other bridges that connect the 2, this is most beautiful decorated.
Lovely at day and night. The view of the bridge from above is spectacular especially when it is lit up at night. Like a chain of gold.
It's a bridge!. If you are into bridges then I'm sure you will like this one- other than that it's nothing special but provides a way of getting to the other side of the river.

Impressive. Lovely way to cross the Danube. Walk on the left of the bridge going both ways for the best views of Buda and Pest. River cruise boats moor next to it. Nice to see something practical and aesthetic.

Connecting East and West. Impressive structure considering it was built 166 years ago. At the time an important addition to connecting Eastern and Western Europe and the result of a rare collaboration between British engineers and an Hungarian count. Don't forget to have a look again after dark, as it is nicely illuminated.

Bridgw. We only had a short time in Budapest
Got off the bus and walked the bridge and some of Budapest
A lovely city
The bridge is beautiful and a great spot to view the Danube
Trip Across the Pond. We had a wonderful time in Budapest the three days we spent in the City before moving on. Lots to sites and activities to do for all.
