Lovely bridge especially at night time!. A lovely bridge that links the old town with the new town and it is especially gorgeous and beautiful at night due to the special lightings!
Awesome!

U must visit this site. It is important to visit the site and must pass it by foot as part of a visit to Budapest. Fence views of both banks and the river itself.
Recommended reading about the history of the bridge and not just to visit and see its unique structure.

Captivating anytime of the day. I guess this is the most famous bridge in Budapest where tourists abound any time of the day. I walked through this bridge during daytime but was more captivated at night when you see both sides of Buda and Pest lit up with main attractions well illuminated creating a magical spell as you walk through.

Breath taking views. Stunning place and taking a walk at night here absolutely amazing. The sound of cars and the fresh breeze blowing and people walking pass you just one of those experience you will be glad to be part of

spectacular looking at night. We got to drive over the bridge during the day but to see it all lit up at night was amazing. The bridge was rebuilt entirely after the Nazis bombed the bridges so the Russians could not get across to Pest.We got to see it at night when the boat we were on took us up and down the Danube so we could see the bridge and Parliament all lit up

Chain bridge. Unparalleled experience, amazing structure. Great architecture. Lions at the ends of bridge were so cool. Overall very photogenic and full of beauty. Can be seen from castle and also while on cruise. Must see while visiting Budapest.

Beautiful Especially at Night. We saw the bridge during the day on our bus tour, at our stop and at night from a dinner cruise. I loved having to wait by the bridge, it gave me time to get a closer look. It's a busy bridge. The best was seeing it at night though, lit up and much more romantic.

Brilliant views of the danube. The bridge is central and is assessable to pedestrians and cars Once in Budapest the funicular is just in front of you this is an efficient service getting you up the hill easily The bridge is of interesting old construction and very historic
Stunning architecture . This is a beautiful bridge which we saw from both the bus tour and from the river cruise ... Such an impressive bridge that just adds to the beauty of Budapest

Its just a bridge, I suppose!. We walked across from the Pest side to visit the Castle hill. The bridge has an interesting history but it is just a bridge really and mostly very congested with traffic!
Iconic Link of Buda & Pest. Great place to walk across and enjoy the view of parliament while exploring the history of this ancient bridge.
Good looking Bridge. I think our cruise ship was docked right next to this bridge. The bridge is beautiful and can easily be observed when walking around Budapest.
Just a bridge. For all its grandness at the end of the day it's a bridge. In fact the bridge just further up the river is probably more impressive. Still unsure why it is seen as a must see
Better at night. We found it better to go on a boat trip at night to see the bridges and sights. It's so well let up and beautiful. Well worth a visit
The oldest bridge from all. One of the bridges in Budapest and one of the most beautiful at night, Perfect for romantic walks and landscape pictures.
Views of Budapest. One of a number of bridges in Budapest, the Chain Bridge takes you from Buda to Pest and is an easy way to take in the sights of the city. Well worth the walk.
Beautiful Architecture. Coming through the tunnel on the approach to this bridge adds to the atmosphere. You don't have to have a car just use the hop on and off bus .
Bridge with an interesting history. Interesting history. Do notice the lions without a tongue. When pointed out, the sculpture got a shock and tried to commit suicide by jumping off the bridge.
One of many beautiful bridges in Budapest. One of many beautiful bridges in Budapest, everyone has its own history, which will be told to you on the hop on hop off bus.

The view is awesome. I recommend you to go by the bridge by night to see the lights and also during the day. It's not the most beautiful bridge, but it's a very good way to walk over the Danube river and see all the beauty of Budapest. By this bridge you get to the castle and other atractions.

Bridge to the Other Side.. The Chain Bridge is a sturdy structure that connects Buda to Pest just below the Buda Castle. There are walking ways on both sides of the bridge, that are structurally seperated from the traffic. Some of the views are amazing and there are some great opportunities for pictures. If you do not mind a few steps, check out the sites from a different perspective.
Nice views. A beautiful bridge with some history. It is lovely to walk across it and offers some really wonderful views over the river.

A nice warm breeze while walking across. Walked across the bridge but then wanted a better feel for the "real country".with my wife.. we took a tram(like a subway..but above ground) to the "end of the line" and back to the bridge...approx. an hour ride in each direction. Purchased tokens at store right across from Intercontinental hotel since you cannot purchase on train. Saw where the" real" people live..and as it gets further out of the city you see more country. Not exactly outstanding views like we see in central coast california but an "experience" worth taking. After being "spoiled" with a private guide for 3 days..nice to have a feeling of what NOT to expect.
Walk over the Danube. A nice walking adventure, particularly spectacular at night with the lights of Castle Hill on the Buda side and parliament on the Pest side. Safe for tourists to walk at night

recommend you visit by night. We visited the Chain Bridge three times:1. by foot, from Buda Castle;2. by boat, on the #12 ferry;3. by night, from in front of the InterContinental Hotel.If you only have one opportunity, go at night. Truly stunning.In contrast to the most recent review, this is not just any bridge. The Chain Bridge was destroyed by the Nazis when they left Budapest in 1944 (see the pic at the Museum of Terror and you will see what I mean). Seriously, I can't countenance anyone saying "its just a bridge" i.e, those who forget our history are condemned to repeat it.

Amazing man made wonder. The current bridge that was rebuilt in 1949 after the original was destroyed in the second world war is still beautiful. While there are many beautiful bridges on the Danube today, this was the only way Buda and pest were connected till 1849
Budapest trip. Budapest has a lot to offer for anyone interested in architecture, culture, and good food! Fabulous place, not to miss!

We took the Hop on, Hop Off bus across the bridge; beautiful bridge. Since we did not have much time to visit Budapest, we tried the Hop on Hop off bus. What a tremendous way to see sights! It was financially reasonable for a several day pass, and we caught buses which ran about every five minutes. Earphones gave great information in dozens of languages, about historic places including the bridge. We bought an extra pass to avoid the lines for the ride up the mountain. We loved the bridge, the museums, and so many sights that the bus took us to that we wouldn't have found otherwise. Well worth the money.
See it by night if possible. All the bridges across the Danube in Budapest are spectacular but the Chain Bridge is probably the best. But if you can, see it at night. WOW

It's a bridge. It's a bridge made of chains and it gets you across the Danube. While it may be the oldest bridge across the river in Budapest it is not the prettiest - that honour goes to the Liberty Bridge which the locals reclaim at night by climbing up it and partying.

Beautiful bridge with views. You'll most likely have to cross this bridge to get to the castle and palace from Pest. Walking across is perfect. There are sweeping views of stunning architecture on both sides. If nothing else, do it for the instagram-worthy photos.

It's a bridge. A very striking and very busy bridge for both traffic and pedestrians. Two lanes of traffic with pedestrian paths either side, but watch out for the silent cyclists! Gets you to the Pest side from the Buda side, where there is the access to castle.Very dodgy driving! Very beautiful at night time with all its structure covered in lights.
Beautiful landmark. This beautiful bridge is even more amazing at night. Best viewed from one of the river cruises. It is the main connection between Buda and Pest.

Lovely walk over the Danube. Connecting Buda with Pest, this beautiful bridge is a must to cross several times and take some good shots of both sides of the river. Make sure you use both sides of the bridge not to miss anything from this amazing city.

An average bridge crossing the river. This bridge is very english like for the period it was made. Like the other bridges we crossed it has plenty of good vantage points for taking photos and an easy walk way. It is well located to get to the castle hill.

Look and walk across!. There are so many bridges across the Danube! Walk across them! Better yet, sail under them, after dark, and appreciate the lights that help show off the marvelous creative architecture. Remember, these were damaged during WWII and feel into the Danube!

Pretty brige over rushing water. When I was here, there were extensive roadworks going on, so the bridge was closed to traffic. This meant that people were able to climb onto the bridge and many seemed to spend the evening sitting there just watching the boats go by on the river below. The bridge is very beautiful and Budapest itself is a beautiful city and well worth a visit.

Symbol of Budapest. An iconic sight for all visitors to Budapest, symbolically joining Buda and Pest, since 1849 They became a unified city in the 1870's. The original bridge was constructed by a Scotsman Called Adam Clarke, who stayed and married a local girl, He also built the tunnel under Castle Hill. Elegant and proportional design modeled on a similar bridge over the Thames at Marlow designed by another man named Clarke. The Funicular to Castle Hill is near the Buda side of the bridge. The original bridge was destroyed in 1944.

The Heart of the City. Docked beneath this glorious bridge I felt like I had access to the whole city. On our first evening we took a stroll across the bridge. So romantic! Lots of people were doing the same thing - lots of people from everywhere, including Budapest. You really feel a part of the scene and it is such a remarkable scene. Do not miss the opportunity to grab the hand of someone you love and walk over this bridge. It's also lovely in the daytime.
Chain bridge. Prices are a rip off on the boats especially The spoon boat stay clear of that one.over priced and no toilets to be found.I hope we rip them off when thy come to UK

Exciting. Budapest was exciting and memorable. The locals are friendly and welcoming. Also, the city easy to tour, if you're lodging in central Budapest. I highly recommend walking the chain bridge and visiting the parliament. Also, take the bus tour around the city. I visited during the summer and temperatures were pretty warm.I would like to return to explore other parts of Hungary.

You will get to know it well. The main pedestrian bridge between Buda and Pest. We stayed in Pest and many of the attraction (funicular, Palace, Hungarian Museum, St. Matthias, many others) are on Buda side. Largely rebuilt from its original state due to wars and such, the lions are still the original from circa 1850. Beautiful views of Danube from both sides.
Great view. The Chain bridge is maybe the most central one, as it goes straight ahead to the Buda's funicular. A great landmark of the city with great view to both Buda and Pest.
Beautiful Mesmerizing. In Heart of city , Bridge give a stunning view in night with reflection over river. Once you are walking on river side you just keep gazing beautiful light shining
Romantic bridge!. At night is so beautiful see the bridge with amazing illumination. Perfect for a couple walk. If you have opportunity take a beer in the bar beside the bridge.
Nicest bridge of the city. Gorgeous bridge, a piece of Hungarian history. Check up-to-date information as it will be renovated in June 2016.

Chain link bridge.. This bridge was built by Scottish architects about around 1820 or there about,they did an amazing job Not just saying that because I am Scottish it did not get damaged during the war,
Beautiful bridge. This is a beautiful bridge and it is very nice to walk across it and enjoy the views of Budapest. The construction is unusual.

Very impressive . We got a taxi to the top of the hill, that gave us a fantastic view of the bridge, and it was very impressive, with views of it on the walk down, quite a steep walk down if you are not very stable on your pins, but an ice walk if you can make it, with the bridge at the bottom, and the walk over the bridge I to town, with a welcome coffee on the other side
Surprisingly beautiful. Honestly, it surprised me a lot that I am calling a bridge beautiful but Budapest Chain bridge really is. Worth to visit and take a pic!

Not too much to see. But good views of Buda and the parliament. Like all the bridges, it's a post-World-war-II reconstruction. (The Germans blew up all the bridges in an attempt to stop the Soviet army.)
On the night Hungary beat Portugal in Euro 2016. Beautiful bridge designed by an Englishman bombed by the Germans climbed over by Hungarians. Very pretty at night.

Beautiful--by day and night. Be sure to cross at night for a view of Pest from one side and Buda from the other. A gorgeous view of each side---we were docked right under it to begin our Viking cruise.
Beautiful. Great to cross by foot from one side to the other. the bridge is beautiful, very busy and when you get to either side you are right in the middle of landmarks to visit.

A feat!. There are several bridges that span this city. Some more attractive than others. As u tour around it is interesting to see how they differ one from the other. Each has a distinct style of architecture and when lit up at night they're very beautiful.

One of the main attractions of Budapest. You could say its just a bridge but its not just a normal bridge. Go see this bridge in the evening (post sunset) the lights will be on. Sit by the bank and enjoy the view of the bridge
May Day on Chain Bridge. Unexpected thrill. Formula One and Air show, both could be seen from the Chain Bridge. A beautiful piece of architecture and a spectacular view of the Danube.

Gorgeous architecture. Me and my friend called this the "going home bridge". We would purposefully walk the long way back to our hotel just to walk over this bridge. It's absolutely stunning at night too!

Walk during night. It's more beautiful that way.. I think the title says everything I wanted to say about this bridge but Danube river is pretty nasty under day light so just walk at night if you fancy romantic lol

Great pictures and views. This bridge has a historical background. Check it out! Go for a stroll day or night time for views of both sides of the Danube. The current in the river is really fast and the captains of boats handle it very well pulling up to a dock. The nighttime stroll is wonderful cause all main buildings are lit on either side of the river. Photos everyone!
Nice bridge . This bridge is closed to vehicular traffic so is a great one to walk across. Keep an eye out for speedy bicyclists though!
Excellent views. Walking across the chain bridge can be very windy, but offers excellent views of both Buda and Pest.

A great walk and a must do.. A magnificent old bridge that must be walked to take in the glorious views. There is much to view while taking this walk. Stop to take some photos. The views are worth the walk

Beautiful bridge. One of the most beautiful bridge that i have ever seen. It looks so strong that could describe the bridge as a protection to the city. We could see the bridge from the hill above. It is better to see during the night so that we could see the light that was on around the bridge.
At night. Suberb. One of the great bridges from above and below but so superb lite up at night. Try the cruise up the river and if a dinner can be attached even better
Nice Walk for Views. We walked across the bridge after leaving the Buda side. There were some nice views of both sides. It's free to walk across the bridge.

Unless you are a bridge collector.... .. a civil engineer, a bridge fanatic or some such it's really just another wide bridge over the Danube that happens to connect lively Pest to expensive Buda. Buda may be prettier but it has hardly any amenities and is packed full of tourists ad their buses. If you are in Budapest it is a must but don't get carried away,
Great bridge. How to connect to parts of one amazing city? Creating one Amazing bradge. It's very simple. Amazing at the night with the lights.
Beautiful at night. A great landmark in Budapest that can not be missed. Try to capture views of the bridge from the bank.

Nothing spectacular. Heard so many good things about Chain Bridge, and we couldn't believe when we came across it that this was the bridge everyone has talked about. The lion statues are nice, and it has the traditional padlocks on it, but in the daytime it really wasn't anything special. We walked across it a couple of times. Perhaps we should've seen it at night.
Beautiful.. A beautiful bridge, worth a walk across. The view of it from Castle Hill is lovely too. Well worth seeing.

Historic Bridge. One of the defining sights in Budapest, the first bridge to link Buda and Pest. As with so much of the architecture in Budapest the bridge is imposing and ideal to wander across as it has separate pedestrian lanes (just watch for the odd cyclist!).The views of and from the bridge are stunning. Make sure you also see it after dark when it is lit adding a new dimension.

Great bidge to walk over day and night.. No one is going to miss this bridge, it's right where everything happens. I especially liked walking down the hill through the woods to the bridge. Going down, it's short and easy with lots of views of the bridge and city.
Beautiful vistas. A wonderful walking tour. I went across at noon and at dusk. The combination of lights from the buildings and the boat traffic on the Danube made the night crossing extra special.
Good walk across the bridge . Better to do this in the night as the Bridge is lit up and you can also walk with the cool wind. Amazing views of the parliament and buda castle in my opinion.
Amazing. Beautiful bridge - lots of history. Bombed during war and rebuilt. Cruised river during night and all the bridges looked fantastic all lit up.
Beautiful!. Of all of the bridges in Budapest, this is one of the most beautiful! It's beautiful both to drive across on a tour bus or to walk across. Gives great views of the city!

Interesting. Interesting bridge. For me I would not go out of my way just to touch the bridge but the history behind the bridge is interesting. And views from the bridge are very nice
It would be hard to go any where Along the river without seeing this bridge in the distance

Easy to build into your day. Grab a coffee and a sweet treat and take a stroll across the bridge. Kids will love it. Bathrooms for public use are close by. Can easily stop to piece out boat cruises...make sure to negotiate! They will go down in price.
A nice walk on a hot day. It was a nice short walk and allows for a unique view of the river. It is the oldest bridge over the Danube with an interesting history.

The unifing bridge. The construction of this bridge happened in 1876 which united the two cities along
The Danube and in front of each other: Pest and Obuda, therefore Budapest. The lions are
Impresive and the metals from the haning bridge reminds the brooklyn bridge in USA.

It's a bridge.... Not really much to say here, one of several bridges connecting Buda and Pest. As it no longer stands it's original form, it's just one of many.
But the best choice of your crossing from Pest to Buda to go exploring the castle district as you land right in the Center of it :)
A thing of beauty. Like the rest of the architecture in Budapest, just stand and marvel in the beauty of this bridge.We Sat having a coffee on the bank of the Danube enjoying the view of this bridge.
Walk on the bridge. Walking across the Chain Bridge is a great adventure. I was able to take pictures of both sides of the Danube River. It was a great view of the both sides of the city.
Beautiful. Some will say: "ok, it is just a bridge". In fact, for me, it is one of the most beautiful and famous bridges in Europe. You can not miss it if you are in Budapest! How could you?

Great engineering . This is after all an iconic bridge to not see when your visiting the city, The Chain bridge is great piece of engineering the buses stop just before so we could walk over and back. Worth a visit whilst in the city.

Fantastic Bridge spanning Pest with Buda. Rich in history, with both sides of the Danube one being Buda and the other being Pest. Once the bridges were erected it became one city Budapest. Good to see on top or via boat tour

ancient architecture. It is incomprehensible how one could build this oldest bridge over the Danube. Especially after sunset there's a romantic atmosphere. This, together with the beautifully lit Buda Castle in the background and you have a memorable postcard
Bridge over the Danube. This is one of several bridges that crossed the river and they are all different. Worth walking across for the views.
Amazing. This majestic structure is amazing walking across it makes you feel the strength and resilience of the Hungarian people .must walk in they shoes to appreciate.

Do have a stroll along the bridge!!. Engineering at its best I believe, interesting to see the links and the way it was done or how did they do it kind of thought (about 180years ago) do go at night as well as the lights really make the bridge stand out and there are less people and traffic..
Walked to the Fisherman's Bastillion. We joined a walking tour and walked past this 1st bridge that connects Buda with Pest. Bridge is functional and sturdy. View from there is great too.

Second the best . My first visit to Budapest was cold, grey and rainy. That didn't stop me taking way too many photos of this stunning construction. This time, on a clear, sunny day the plays of light and shade amidst the ironwork were brilliant. The views, particularly upriver to the Parliament building were unbeatable.

A very pleasant walk across the considerable width of the river. Do take the time to walk across this iconic bridge. It is a Budapest landmark. A little rusty and worn perhaps but this added to the charm.

You can't miss it....See it at Night. We saw the bridge both in the daylight and again in the evening. It is so much prettier at night with the lights on it. There is a café right at the bottom of the bridge that you can grab a drink at and sit for as long as you want!
Great views walking on the bridge. Crossing the bridge is a good way to get across with a lot of nice views to be seen before you go to the palace!
Nice bridge to cross the river. We crossed the river on 4 different bridges and this was the most beautiful one. Great view and great bridge itself

beautiful bridge in my favorite city. beautiful bridge we walked across several times during our stay, between Pest and the quieter Buda side. Great scenery walking across the bridge, both ways, and fun to think you're walking across the Danube river!

Landmark bridge with great views of the Danube. We walked over this bridge numerous times and always enjoyed the great views of the Danube and the buildings along the river. The bridge has a lot of history and is almost a must to visit if you are taking walking tours of old Budapest.

A stroll across Chain Bridge. A lovely way to cross over to Buda from Pest is taking a lovely walk across the Chain Bridge, where you find yourself at the base of Buda's funicular (taking you up to the Palace and Fisherman's Bastion). There are some lovely views of the city to be seen whilst crossing the bridge

Bristol Clifton Suspension Bridge 2.0. Great bridge. By a Scottish engineer who must have been looking over the shoulder of the great Isambard Kingdom Brunel. Makes for a nice stroll, but is hardly the Charles Bridge of Prague that the Hungarian Tourist Board would like it to be......
Nice Bridge with a good view on the river. The bridge looks very nice and provides a good view on the river. For nice pictures, wait until the night when the bridge is lit up by the lights!

A lovely bridge. Would be of strong interest to those with an engineering or architecture bent, this is a lovely bridge offering a splendid walk across the Danube with fine views along the river.
The lion statues add interest. The road crosses seems to be very busy during the day.
Historic bridge. Take one of the walking tours to walk from the Pest side, over the bridge to the Buda side. You get some of the history. It's lighted nicely at night.
Just great!! . You have to pass that bridge by walking. Both day and night. You will love it! Atmosphere is magnificent. And during the night all the light of the city makes it unforgetable. Try it!!
landmark. it was copying hammersmith brigde in London. it's ok over there. it was beautiful in the night time.

Pretty and architecturally interesting. This is worth seeing - it's free to walk across and is an impressive architectural feat if you're interested in that sort of thing! Lovely short walk across the Danube, and also looks great from afar. A number of the bridges across the Danube are beautiful and make for some excellent photography opportunities.

Beautiful especially in night . The chain bridge looks like any other bridge but in the night it does look beautiful. Its worth just sitting along side of the bridge to get a view of the bridge and just looks spectacular

Shorter than it looks.. I was led to believe this bridge was a long walk? That it was also something special? Well it was neither really to be honest. Its a metal bridge across a river, with stone lions at either end. Yes its got nice views and gets lit up at night but lots of bridges have and do in various parts of the world. I don't understand the hype personally. Both London and Paris have better examples. With more going on along their banks as well.
Worth of seeing. Defenetly need to see all the Bridgestone if going to Budapest. At the night time even more beautiful.
Reminds me of a mini Brooklyn bridge. Lovely to walk across and a beauty to see from afar. Well worth either walking up or using the lift to see it from the Palace

Must see site. All the bridges in Budapest are worth seeing. What a site!!! They're all gorgeous and different in their own architecture as they were built in different styles. Nothing else to say but definite beauty. Try to walk on them or see them from different vantage points as each will show you a different picture.

Central to Buda and Pest. The Chain Bridge is a reproduction of the original one and is the link between the castle district of Buda and the city of Pest. If you go on one of the many official bus or boat tours you learn a little of its history. It's a short walk across and gives fine views of the Danube and the riversides on both banks. Is an attraction in itself and looks good lit up at night. Go over and under it and looks good from the castle or the citadel hills.

A nice walk pass the bridge. To reach tourist spots in Buda from Pest or vice versa the chain bridge seemed the most convenient. Its central location brought convenience, and the walk was pleasant enough. Good place to take pictures of both river banks as well.
An icon. Beautiful walk over Danube river. Lions at entrance make great backdrop for pictures Safe area to linger and head up to buda or enter pest side of budapest
Chain Bridge. Guide told us that this bridge was damaged during the WW II which was rebuilt again as per original design

Probably the Prettiest Bridge Spanning the Danube. The beautiful Chain Bridge was literally right outside my hotel room in Budapest. I was mesmerized by its beauty all day long, morning, noon, and night!Back in 1849, the Chain Bridge was the first stone bridge to connect the two Bulgarian military fortresses of Buda and Pest. At the time it was completed, it was the 2nd largest suspension bridge in the world!
Beautiful. A beautiful busy bridge with some stunning views and the best access from pest to castle hill on the Buda side.

Beautiful bridge. The bridges of Budapest really remind you of Paris and the Chain bridge is no exception. Absolutely stunning and you wonder how this was built back in the days without modern technology. What a massive effort! Don't miss to visit also during the evening - it's so beautifully lit up. And since no ugly neon ads are on any buildings in Budapest centre, it's simply magical.
A bridge. This is a beatufull and strong, but not brutal looking bridge. I crossed it a couple of times and got time to look at bit at the nice work.

Great for a walk . The views on the walk across the bridge are excellent, we walked firm the chain bridge to Elizabeth bridge, crossed over Elizabeth and back to the Chain bridge. Easy walk but watch out for the bike riders flying past.
Pedestrian Friendly. Nice bridge. Pedestrian friendly (but obviously noisy, busy with all the cars). However a great way to go from Pest to Buda and see the Danube.

Beautiful and picturesque. The Chain Bridge is remarkable and so picturesque. It links Buda and Pest in the most lovely location. It is so easy to enjoy a stroll across and simply marvel at the Danube and the views on both banks. The statues and majesty of the bridge make everything magical.
Great views of the city. Very pedestrian friendly, and the walk gives tourists an array of great views of both Buda and Pest, and most of the major landmarks.
Beautiful structure. Great looking historical bridge, well worth the walk across. Stunning views across the river Danube.

Impossible to "do" Budapest and not at least look at this. Its an iconic part of the landscape. The beggars half way across are a downer, especially contrasted with the luxury river-cruise boats alongside.

Great historical bridge. The famous chain-link bridge was built and designed by Clark in the 1830's. It was, at the time of construction, the longest span of a bridge built in this fashion. It was destroyed during the Second World War, by a retreating Nazi army, but was rebuilt as you see it today in 1939. Traffic and pedestrians can drive/walk across in either direction. It offers great pic opportunities whilst spanning the Danube.

Well worth the walk. Designed by a british architect who has only one other bridge to his name, the remarkably similar bridge in Marlow, UK. There is something rather special about the design and engineering of the bridge itself, well worth taking the time to cross over it and take in the spectacular views.
Beautiful. Take a stroll during the day and at night. You will love it at both times. A great view of the Danube.
Beautiful sight.. Of all the bridges over the Danube in Budapest Chain bridge is the most attractive. It is also a marvel of architecture.

Nice night for a stroll. We left our hotel for a night stroll around 10:30 pm. We walked across the bridge which was all lit up. Seeing the castle, parliament and the whole city lit up was really something to see. We got back to our hotel around 1am and best part was we felt safe. There were many people in the streets and no one bothered us( that's more than I can say about my own home town). So yes, go out at night and see the bridge and the lights of the city.
Part of the free walking tour. We crossed the bridge during the free walking tour from Pest to Buda and it offered great views of the Danube.

YOU HAVE TO WALK IT. The bridge is beautiful to look at and easy to cross by car, bus or train. To really appreciate it, you have walk from it from end to end. You'll stop and admire the river and the boats on it, plus it offers you a different perspective of both Buda and Pest.
Nice!. This was the first bridge which connected Buda with Pest. It is a beautifull bridge and you can walk over it with a view of both sides of the city.

Well worth the walk across. The chain bridge is well worth walking across when you are in Budapest. As you cross the Danube from Buda to Pest admire the engineering that went into such a structure so long ago. We were lucky to see the majestic sight if the bridge coming out of the early morning mist from both sides of the river. A must see
walking beauty. this bridge is a must to walk on, especially in the night. lightenings were excellent, romance is guarentee:)

375 meters worth crossing and admiring. Budapest offers a number of bridges across the Danube, but I chose to focus on this one. The Széchenyi Chain Bridge kind of reminds me of the Brooklyn Bridge but it is much shorter. Of British design, it was the first permanent bridge over the river in Budapest, and it opened in 1849. It's a quick and easy walk across. I didn't time it but I'd guess around 10 minutes? Just be careful since bikers zip by the pedestrians. The Chain Bridge is stunning at twilight and at night, making for excellent photo opportunities. Don't miss this bridge!
Very interesting bridge, landmark in the city. I really love this bridge over the Danube linking the Buda & Pest parts of the city, an interesting landmark.

Wonderful sight. This bridge crosses the Danube joining Buda and Pest, crossing from the Pest side to the Castle and to the funicular. The bridge has a lot of character and at night is lit up.
Not sure how to comment further other than to say it has a lot of character and should be seen.
the most scenic view of magnificent Budapest. Linking the 2 cities Buda, and Pest,and a beautiful landmark over the Danube river. A must to see or cross upon.
Historic. Although under construction, you can still walk the bridge (covered in some places with locks) to cross the Danube. It is beautiful at night & was the first bridge built to cross the river.
Historic. Not sure how to write a review about a bridge, but the Chain Bridge is a very old and historic bridge. A must see when visiting Budapest.
Surprising work of architecture. It is hard to describe--you have to see it. It was amazing that something that old could be foundation for modern transportation.

Iconic landmark of Budapest. It is a wonderful example of architecture from the 18th century.
It was built in 1849 by English engineer William Clark and therefore you will see lions at the end of bridge. Chain Bridge is linking the Buda side to the Pest side.
old beauty. makes a good photo, especially at night...Otherwise it makes a good place to cross the Danube with some character
Take time for a bridge walk. Beautiful bridge. We love to walk across famous local bridges on our travels, and this one was a must. This bridge crosses the Danube and connects Buda to Pest.
Beautiful bridge with beautiful views. The main bridge in Budapest, very iconic. I could spend hours there just looking at both sides of the river!

Must see in Budapest!. A walk along the bridge which connects the Buda and Pest sides of the city is definitely a must. With the high rise 5* hotels on one side and the glorious castle on the other, it's a lovely walk across the river!
Lovely. Good views down the Danube but this bridge is lovely at night when all lit up with boats going up and down a lovely sight

The oldest bridge of Budapest. Walk through Chain Bridge from Pest side to Buda and continue your trip up to the castle.
The bridge was nice and the view was even better!
A must to see! :-)
Loved the stroll across the Bridge. We strolled across the Bridge and it was lovely. Firstly you are welcomed by the 2 big Lion Statues at either end.

Great views. We crossed this bridge on our walking tour and were able to get some great pictures. It had a great view of both sides of the city. It also has an interesting history that our guide told us about. We saw it lit up and night too which was beautiful.

A bridge...ok, a bridge with history. Travelled under and over on various tours. Featured on each tour. Lovely reproduction of the bridge destroyed in WWII.Walked across it after missing ('by that much' MS) the last hop-on-hop-off bus at night. Close up appears to need some maintenance as could see through the rust holes in a few places on the pedestrian walkway.We loved Budapest, one of our fav places on Europe tour.
One of the sites to see in Budapest. Beautiful at night when it's all lit up and best seen from the river. Alternatively take a walk from Pest to Buda across the bridge and see it up close.
Unmissable. This bridge is totally unmissable, we highly recommend in seeing it in both day and night ! The passing boats and the architecture design of this bridge is astonishing
From Buda to Pest. Wonderful way to walk from Buda to Pest. Amazing views from both sides of the bridge of the river Danube.

Great view in the night. The bridges of Budapest are one of the most charming part of it. Viewed from the top, they create a nice image. Crossing this bridge in the night will give you nice views on both sides of the Danube

Beautiful at night, but take a walk across during the day!. The Chain Bridge isn't just for your nighttime viewing pleasure... it's a nice walk across the Danube where you can enjoy views of Parliament and Margit Island, plus get a first-hand view of the architecture of this beautiful structure.

Great. Chain Bridge is an iconic landmark of Budapest. Linking the Buda side to the Pest side. From the Pest side near the Four Seasons Hotel ( formerly Gresham Palace) you cross the bridge over the Danube river and on the other side is the Fernicular rail to Buda Castle.Take a lock to put on the bridge.Mukul Shukla Ahmedabad, India

San Francisco Bridge in Europe ?. Not really because every bridge has his own style. Everyone visiting Budapest will cross this bridge. It is an example of very good engineering and a real eyecatcher!
Historic bridge. We walked across this historic bridge and cruised beneath it too. The most famous bridge linking Buda & Pest.

Iconic structure with great views.. Right outside our hotel (Sofitel) so it was hard to miss. Interesting from an engineering and architectural standpoint, but also offering great views of both sides of the river.
Why?. A bridge is a bridge. It gets you across the river. The shoes on the side of the walkway where the brave Morons arrow cross shot innocent children and adult Jews is a crime against humanity.

Beautiful. Bring your camera. We walked the bridge several times and it is very romantic at night overlooking the danube. Feels like a safe area to be at night for tourists. We stayed on the Buda side but had dinner on the Pest side so we walked the bridge at night along with many other travelers and locals commuting.

Highlight of my visit. I really enjoyed walking across this old bridge. The architecture is just so beautiful. the Lions that are at both ends give you feeling of a powerful structure. Even though it was destroyed in WWII they reconstructed it to look like the original that was built in the 1840's. Don't forget to see it lit at night, it is a treat.

Nice to Walk in the Night.. One can enjoy the view of Danube River, Matthias Church, Parliament and Castle from the Chain Bridge. The lights make it more beautiful. Restaurants near to the chain bridge make it more worth to enjoy the place.

Worth crossing . A tight fit with a pram, but worth the effort good views and leads to the castle worth queuing for the little vertical tram but watch out for oriental tours they push to the front and can cause aggravation by bribing the ticket office.
Whatta view. Mesmerising view of the city in evening. Could not resist the urge to walk every evening. I and a colleague walked hours each day.

Most Photographed Structure of Budapest. The Chain Bridge is probably the most photographed structure of Budapest. It is certain that all tourist must have walked across to Buda side on the Chain Bridge. It is most fascinating, specially look at it from the Buda Castle or from the River Danube or from the Castle Hill. Illuminated bridge at night is more beautiful.

Chain Bridge (Szechenyi lanchid). Chain Bridge (Szechenyi lanchid) is a wonderful example of architecture from the 18th century. Crossing it from on side to the other and back is really worth the walk.

Beautiful at night. This bridge is one of the most iconic bridges in Budapest and it is absolutely amazing. The bridge is beautiful at night and it's a shame they turn the lights off. There are great views as you walk over the bridge

Very Impressive Bridge. This bridge is impressive and joins Buda and the Pest side of Hungary. It takes about 10 minutes to walk from one side to the other making it easy to see as much of Budapest as possible.
The lions on the entrance onto the bridge are impressive.
Old bridge . Facinating to see this special bridge from Buda Castle with the view of Pest in the background. Oldest of the bridges connecting buda and pest.

Solid attraction. Crossing the most famous bridge in Budapest is a must-do item on your list. From the Pest side you combine it with a trip up the funicular to the castle on the Buda side. The views up and down the river from the center of the bridge don't get much better than that.

Padlocks. My husband took me for my birthday as a surprise and very romantically had a padlock engraved with our names which we added to the others along the bridge. The city had many lovely, different bridges.

Iconic Bridge!. Budapest's most famous and iconic bridge - the Chain bridge! It is certainly worth walking on this bridge - but also remember to get some amazing views of this bridge when you are walking up to the castle and/ or the Gellert Hill - and also while walking along the Danube river! The bridge looks all the more charming with the lights on after sunset/ at night!

Walk across the chain bridge. A walk across the chain bridge is a must during any visit to Budapest. The bridge is an engineering marvel and provides an excellent view of the Danube and both Buda and Pest. There is a cute little outdoor restaurant on the Buda side where you can get snacks.
Take in the views. The history...the views. We stayed close to the bridge & walked across it many times. You can walk or bike. Beautiful views of the Danube.
excellent walk over bridge. we got lucky with the weather but the walk to and over the bridge is certainly worth doing. sights from bridge were good

Good to walk across and to reach Buda. The bridge itself has a good pedestrian walkway and you can take your time to take in the views. It is the link between the cable car to go to the castle, seriously it is a couple of minutes of walking to get up the hill, you don't need to line up for the cable car
Walking across the Danube.... Walked from Buda to Pest. Climbed castle hill then down to the bridge. Fantastic views of the city and the river, very nice.

The old bridge is a pride to Budapest. This old bridge crossing the Donau can be seem from a lot of places in the city. It is a real symbol of the beautiful town. And the bridge is very nicely illuminated at night.

Functional. Considering the splendor and historic buildings all around, would have thought that after the bridge was blown up by the retreating Germans in 1945, that the rebuild would have been a grander design.
What a bridge!. Needs to be seen both day and night, both brilliant. Best daytime photo is from the Buda side between Buda Castle and citadel.

Best seen at night from Gellert Hill. As many of my other fellow travellers have mentioned, it is best viewed post sunset when it lights up, from Gellert Hill. You could take a walk on the bridge during the day. Gives you pretty decent views of the Danube river, and both cities.

Short bridge to cross between Pest and Buda. Honestly, not sure why the hype over the bridge. You're going to cross it if you're walking between Buda and Pest. It's a nice bridge but nothing special. It's quick to walk across but watch out for cyclists who share the path.

Nice stroll across the Danube. An easy, beautiful walk over the Danube offering wonderful city vistas. Watch the river activity with boats of all sizes meandering up and down river. Many activities on each side of my he River.

Another landmark ticked on the bucket list. You could spend a whole day walking the banks of the Danube in Budapest, just to look in awe at the impressive bridges. Even more impressive to see from one of the many river boats.

Beautiful !. One can take nice photos and enjoy the view from the promenade starting near the parliament building. Or get on a hop on. Hop off bus and view most of Budapest in a day. On top at the funicular , one has a very good view of all the bridges in one time. Take the evening cruise and the view is even more breathtaking with the bridges and monument all lit up.

Best bridge. For me chain bridge is my favoured bridge in Budapest offering great views at either end and whilst crossing. It is part of the heart of the city and no trip there is complete with seeing and crossing the bridge. Great way to spend part of your day.

It's a Bridge. It's a bit odd to see so much written about a bridge when it's really nothing special. There is an easy footpath to cross the Danube and get to the older parts of the city and tourists sites.

Magical nightime Budapest. For a wonderful sense and picture of Budapest at night, walk down from the Matthias Church (on the north end of the hill) and take the streetcar over the next bridge north of the Chain Bridge. Get off for a picture which includes the gleaming, glowing Parliament Building, the Chain Bridge, and the Palace. Budapest: the Jewel of the Danube.

Our favourite Budapest bridge. For me the bridge was slightly underwhelming from a distance, except at night when it came into its own illuminated by all the lights of the city. Close up,however, and when walking across it, the splendour of the architecture and the achievement of the engineers became apparent. The bridge was a wonderful place to snap photos of the many sensational buildings that grace the banks of the Danube, the boats moored, sailing or speeding along the river, and lovely Margaret Island in the distance.Ultimately, strolling over the bridge became our favourite way to cross from Buda to Pest and vice versa.

Lovely Bridge, good to combine.. A perfect attraction to visit after having been to Gellert Hill and/or Castle Hill.A lovely old bridge with great views over the city.After getting to the Pest side you are in good position to continue your sightseeing to the shoes on the dock or the St. Stephens Basilisk.
Beautiful bridge. Stopped very close to here on a river cruise. A very picturesque bridge in daylight and also very much at night,

Night view is so different. I came here in the daytime and found it disappointing because it's not as unique and magnificent as people said. And then I came again in the night time. Things became so different and so worth it. Certainly recommend the night view of the bridge.

An architectural tour de force and a symbol of a great city. The Chain Bridge was the first bridge to link Buda to Pest, opening economic, social and touristic opportunities for both sides. It was built in 1849 by English engineer William Clark, Tyhe bridge was buiilt at the instigation of the great Hungarian patriot, Istvan Szechenyi (also responsible for the Hungarian Academy of Sciences, the Budapest Opera House and other important civic contributions). While the bridge is named after him, locals refer to it a s the Chain Bridge, based on its design. This beautiful bridge starts at the Roosevelt square, in front of the Hungarian Academy of Sciences in Pest and ends at the bottom of Castle Hill, by the entrance to the funicular. Two stone lions guard the entrance to the bridge on both ends. The retreating German Wehrmacht blew up the bridge (along with all other bridges in the city) in January 1945, but it was rebuilt in 1949. It is one of the busiest crossings over the Danube in Budapest and provides a beautiful site from all angles. If you walk to the middle of the Bridge, on the South side you will have a great view of Gellert Hill, the Taban and a good part of Castle Hill, the Erzsebet and Freedom bridges and central Pest. If you stand on the Northern side, you will have an incomparable view of the Academy of Sciences, the Parliament, Margaret Island, Obuda (or Old Buda), and Castle Hill, with the Fisherman's Bastion and Matyas church at the top.

A walk through history . We enjoyed a boat trip and got some of the story about the chain bridge so went for a closer look. It is only a short walk to cross the bridge but worth getting the information from the guides as it has quite some history. It took the Germans a short while to blow it up in WW2 as with all the bridges in Budapest. But it is a very simple construction that is very efficient at supporting the bridge surface.

A must place to visit. Try to visit this bridge during the day, but also at night when the whole structure is illuminated. A great photo can be taken on the first pedestrian bridge which crosses over the funicular railway leading to the castle

Walk on it to believe . The connection between Buda and Pest . The walk is easy albeit a bit windy . Nice view of both banks can be appreciated with the relaxing walk . This is the first thing we did upon arriving and we have no regrets!
Beautiful . I loved it, absolutely beautiful, must see it at night too. It easy to cross it, and you could take awesome pictures from there

My favorite bridge in Europe. This little bridge is walkable and has so much character. The views from it are spectacular and make for awesome pictures. I love the view of Buda as I crossed it. A must see for anyone visiting.
Great at night. The Chain Bridge at night is as great a view as during the daytime. We crossed it many times as our hotel was located at the foot of the bridge.

Very nice place, incredible view. Very nice place, incredible view. You can walk to several restaurants and check some beautiful facades on near by hotels. Check the restaurant in front of Intercontinental hotel.

Easy stroll to the funicular.. Take a leisurely stroll across the bridge for a gps view of the Danube. At the funicular on the Buda side, buy a one way ticket to the top. It will drop you off at the entrance to the castle which currently has a great Picasso exhibit. Afterwardsyou can stroll through the shopping and restaurant area at the top of the hill. Then saunter down the hill in front of the castle. The path starts across the street from the number 13 stop on the hop in hop off tour. At the bottom of the hill grab a beer and a languish at the stand in front of the funicular ticket station.

Lovely!. The bridge is very well kept and is a lovely way to cross the river. The foot path is well separated from the road so is very safe. Stopping and each part of the bridge to see a fantastic view all down the river. The love padlocks give the bridge a romantic feeling.
Absolutely beautiful at night. Budapest is a must see at night either from the Danube River or the Chain Bridge both amazing. If you get a chance you definitely should walk across from Buda to Pest

Landmark. We used the Chain Bridge as a landmark for navigating. It joins Buda and Pest and is a particularly pleasant walk at night when the city and bridges are illuminated. It's safe to walk around at night.

After a few days in Budapest we understood that it's quite often you cross this bridge depending on what you want to visit.

Can't Miss Piece of Budapest History. This bridge is such an important part of Budapest history that it's worth seeing for that reason alone. But if you are into architecture, engineering, or construction, the bridge is worth a closer inspection due to its unusual chain style construction. It's also conveniently located at the foot of Castle Hill, where you can catch the funicular or a bus to the top to check out the Fisherman's Bastion, Matthias Church, etc., so there's no good reason to skip it. It's a short walk to cross by foot, and a fun way to see the Danube and connect with the city's history.

The most beautiful bridge ever!. The bridges of Budapest are simply wonderful, a beautiful work of architecture. It’s impossible not to be mesmerized by it. So to say, The Chain Bridge (Széchenyi lánchíd) over the Danube is one of the most famous images of Budapest, not to say an icon of Hungary. This bridge between Pest and Buda offers the spectacular view of the city. On the Pest side, the pointed towers of the Parliament Building cut the Danube, while the Buda Castle stands on the other side.The suspension of the bridge is quite impressive, especially at night when the heavy chains sparkle with thousands of lights. It was completed in 1849 and the first bridge to connect the cities of Buda and Pest. At the time, it was an extraordinary architectural masterpiece (and still is in my opinion), 375 meters long, one of the longest suspension bridges in Europe. Large stone lions guarding the bridge on both sides, and the impressive pillars bearing the coat of arms of Hungary with the crown and a wreath of leaves. The imposing lions have been carved by sculptor János Marschalkó. Luckily it survived the destruction of World War II. Still about the lions, there is a legend in Budapest that the lions don’t have tongues. From below, it’s true, you can’t see it, but people say that the lions have tongues, however, the tongues can only be seen from above. Well, I didn’t notice that until I was told, and the fact is, I could not see the tongues.
Beautiful bridge. We were very lucky that our cruise boat was docked very close to the Chain Bridge area. The views of the bridge was beautiful especially at nighttime.

Interesting views, easily incorporated into a walk. It's a bridge. A beautiful one and great sites either side. To be honest walking across the Danube on any of the bridges is rather picturesque, but worth incorporating this on a route or walk, as you explore.

Neat bridge. The story of the builder and the lions was interesting. Perhaps just a fable. I heard several versions of the story.

Chain bridge at night. Take a walk on the bridge,recommended at night when all if the lights are on and the view is very romantic. Nice way to cross the river and enjoy the point of view on the city from bith sides of the river

Linking Buda with Pest. Completely rebuilt after 2nd World War but you'd never know it. (Hint: visit Royal Corinthia Hotel which has a fascinating mini-exhibition of the hotel and city incl. photographs of the bridge destroyed).
Great Views. Walk across this wonderful bridge and feel Budapest.Walk through the tunnel on the Buda side of the bridge.

Great walk. We had a great look and walk over the bridge. Not loads of chains on the bridge as described in a book I read but different! Lovely views of the bridge and down the river to be had from the bridge.

Interesting and historical. This is a lovely bridge with lovely views of the Danube, Buda and Pest. It was nice to stroll on the bridge which takes you across to the Funicular to explore the Buda side of the city.

Amazing view of the city but too crowded. The bridge was amazing, from the architecture to the scenery, everything was perfect except for the huge crowd of tourists even in the winter season (which has less number of tourists than summer)
Wonderful at night. I loved taking walk at night. The view is amazing. It can be very romantic if you travel with your partner.

Very attractive bridge. The most attractive of the bridges in Budapest dates from the mid 19th century
Great way to approach Castle Hill & the furnicular

Great way to make it across the danube to castle hill. Impressive bridge, Specially at night. I walked it all crossing to castle hill and I was amazed with the views. You can take some great pictures. Most people take a bus or cab to get across but If you have the time to walk do it! you won't regret it, specially with all the great pictures you can take.
It's a bridge !!. Not much to say, it's a very pretty bridge. Been under it a couple of times on a river cruise. One of many over the Danube.

The best views by nightlight!. Take time to stop & admire the views by day & watch out for speeding cyclists! But by night make sure you climb up and sit a while, breath in the atmosphere and watch the boats float underneath you.
Great icon of Budapest. This is a wonderful bridge that connects Buda to Pest across the Danube. It is attraction to stand back and admire.
The prettiest bridge in Budapest. Walking across the bridge is quickly done and the view is spectacular. The bridge itself is very charming.

Rebuilt after WW II. All the bridges in Budapest were destroyed by the Germans during WWII. The Chain Bridge was rebuilt in its original style because of its historic significance. It was the first bridge which united the two parts of the City which are divided by the Danube River. it is particularly picturesque in the evening when it is lit.

Chain Bridge. Chain Bridge One of the bridges of remarkable size ... great to see him in the evening while sailing on the Danube
Full of glittering lights reflected in the water
One of the oldest European bridges. One of the oldest elaborately engineered bridges in Europe - still as grand as the day it was built. Definitely a must-see!
Must See. It's place you have to see, when you are in Budapest, especially on the night. One of the most impressive bridge, which we saw.

Impressive. Our first glimpse of the bridge was from the top deck of a cruise ship. It was after 10 PM as we entered Budapest and seeing the bridge lit up as well as the Parliament building was breath taking. The bridge is massive and amazingly designed and made. Wish I could remember the year it was completed. It is one of five bridges that span the Danube river.

A great bridge to cross and make your way to 'Castle Hill'. A well laid out bridge for walkers to cross. If you are with a loved one, bring a padlock and seal your love by locking it to the structure.

Budapest Chain Bridge. Lovely to review from many angles and beautiful at night when it lights up. Its a must as you can take the bridge to get to the other side and head towards the museums or other site seeing areas.

Lovely bridge . It is lovely to walk on this bridge, gas a wonderful view of river and it's really nice at night time to be there also there are a few nice restaurants and bars near by to sit and relax.

The King of Budapest Danube crossings. This majestic bridge with its parks on either side is one of the best walks in Budapest! Night or Day this is a short walk that pays you with views you'll enjoy!
Nice bridge. The stone pillars holding up the bridge are impressive but I think Liberty bridge is more beautiful. The best view of the bridge you'll get is from the Fisherman's bastion or a boat.

Really cool bridge!. It's a pretty stunning bridge and is a key feature of the city. Featured on most of the sightseeing tours, its also super easy to find yourself and is definitely worth a look if you're in the city.

Must see. What else is there to say, this is a must see for every tourist. Walk from Pest to Boeda across this bridge to get to the castle and back. The view on the Donau us stunning as is the view on the castle.

The most beloved bridge for locals. Harmonic architecture, turbulent history, imported engineering, very functional with the Chain Bridge Tunnel.Symbol of bridging, a popular motive for conference logos hosted by BudapestHigh-times of the bridge are the days, when the bridge is closed for the traffic providing space for walking peoples or the yearly firework on 20th August.Southern pavement near to the Pest side: the best place to take photos on the Royal Palace, today the National Gallery.

Breathtaking. Chain Bridge (Szechenyi lanchid) is a wonderful bridge. I was blown way with how big it was, If your in Budapest, check it out the danube river runs right under this amazing bridge. Most sightseeing tours offer the river cruise free, with the purchase of bus ticket.

What a sight. In a city of bridges, this one in the heart of the city is stunning, whether you see it from the banks of the Danube or as you sail underneath it at night. It is just one of many sights that makes Budapest so special.
Worth a walk across. This is a lovely bridge especially at night with all the lamps. It also gives you a great view of parliament both day and night.
Great views of the city and Danube. The oldest and most central bridge in Budapest. Well worth a walk across the Danibe for great views and catch the funicular at the Buda end for great views.

The main bridge across the Danube.. At the end of the day this is just a bridge across the Danube which separates the two parts of the city. It is a must visit and you get great views of the great river as you walk across it. The bridge is well lit at night and looks quite spectacular from Buda Castle at the top of the hill.
My favourite bridge. Just lovely - love to walk across. It starts and ends so pretty. The view from the bridge is very pretty to both sides. We visit it every time

Interesting bit of engineering. Well, it is only a bridge, but for an engineer, I assume the construction would be particularly interesting as it works on the same principles as any other suspension bridge. It was more spectacularly interesting when it was built, but has a lot of competition nowadays from huge suspension bridges!
A lovely stroll. We walked from the Pest side to the Bupa and then up the walk way to the Museum, stunning views from up there.
Stunning. A beautiful bridge separately the Buda and Pest sides of the city. At nighttime it is breathtakingly beautiful all lit up.
Amazing view. You just have to go across the bridge to the other side and visit the castle. We walked up to the top but their is a cable car available at a small cost.

Night Beauty. Visited in day and night time. I will definitly recommend to visit in the night . Amazing view, On clear day, you get photo prefect reflection. It is amazing. Nice architecture and beautiful view of Parliment, Buda castle.

A beautiful piece of architecture. This is a romantic bridge in a romantic and bustling city. It has the old world charm and some of the best views of the river Danube. I recommend walking it during day light and also once at night time when it is lit up. Bollywood fans be ware that this bridge along with many parts of budapest were used as a setting for "Hum Dil de Chuke Sanam". Lovely view of the buda castle at night from this bridge. If you do visit spare some change for the musicians/ performers that perform there and add to the atmosphere's charm.

Chain Bridge. We walked across the Chain Bridge and when we asked our guide why there were Bike locks on the links she told us the story of the "Locks of Love" The bridge is an Engineering sight. It is beautiful at night, to look at (there are lights on the bridge).

Chains Bridge Budapest. The main bridge of Budapest is such a beautiful thing to see but wait to see it during the night when all the lights come to life, an image that will stand forever in your memories.

Beautiful setting. Our room at the Four Seasons had a great view of this bridge. We crossed it many times while exploring the highlights of Budapest.It's lit up night and you must take photos then! Below a photo of the bridge taken from our hotel.
Great view. Stand on the bridge that connect Budda and Pest and admire the view and architecture of this amazing city/

Walking the Chain Bridge is a definite must when in Budapest. From the Chain Bridge you can see most of the major sights of Budapest. I would recommend both a daytime and evening stroll across the Danube. During the day you can see the boats pass by and clearly see the Buda Hills and the Pest urban center along with the iconic Parliament building. At night, the beauty of the city comes alive. If you only want to walk one way there are plenty of trams/buses that will get you quickly back to the other side.
Impressive bridge. The construction is impressive, in very good conditions and with an amazing view! It's a real link between old and new.
One of several bridges over Danube in Budapest. Attractive suspension bridge crossing the Danube in Budapest. Guarded on each end by large lions. Near Viking River Cruise dock.
Lovely view of the Danube. This is a lovely spot to just stand and look at the Danube.It is also a meeting place for the young people of Budapest who sit on the bridge.

great walk across the Danube. Great photo op - do it at Sunset. People watching and you can walk to the castle side where many of the baths are located. You can also rent bikes right off the bridge and ride along the Danube.

Beautiful Bridge. This is a lovely bridge to cross over and admire. We walked over it repeatedly during our week long visit to Budapest and I never tired of it or the view along the way. Enjoy the walk!

Majestic structure over the beautiful Danube River. We overviewed the bridge every day and night from our room. We also walked across this amazing structure that sits so beautifully over this famous river. At night the bridge takes on another aura of majesty as it lights up the Budapest sky

Walked it three times. The bridge has two lions on each side at the beginning of it, which look very nice and give the architecture something interesting and appealing to it. It takes about 5 minutes to cross over- and we crossed it like three times. It's a pleasant walk, though sometimes it can be slightly crowded.

It's a bridge after all.. The bridge is a copy of the one that spans the Thames at Marlow. (Built by the same bloke), but it is a little bigger. It is a lovely bridge and is very useful for crossing the mighty Danube without getting your feet wet. Apart from that....it is a bridge !
Wonderful during the night. It seems to me that this bridge is the most famous in the city. If you want to know why, go visit it once is dark ;)
Loved it!. Fun walk across the river on a beautiful day or evening at sunset. Enjoyed reading the locks and wish we had brought our own.
Magnificent Bridge. It is one of the bridge that links up the city centre to the Buda Castle area. Would recommend to take pictures of this historical and magnificent bridge.

take the time to enjoy this. It is quite an experience to walk on this bridge. It has a pedestrian section, so there is no danger of being hit by a car. Take your time and look at the construction. We were told it was bombed and quite damaged during the war and then repaired. This is one of the experiences in Budapest not to be missed.
Worth a visit!. Walk across if you can as you will get spectacular pictures of the castle and parliament - great for a pano shot! Lovely bridge and worth a visit

Well, it's a bridge.... Yup. Definitely a bridge. Not much you can say about them really, but it's very attractive and the way it lines up with the tunnel is pretty neat, and the views along the Danube from it are very scenic. So good luck with your bridge spotting, this one is a good one.
“It's worth a visit”. One of the things that you absolutely have to visit if you are in Budapest. It is also close to a number of other interesting places.
Walked across . We walked across it was a nice walk the bridge reminded me of a smaller version of the Brooklyn bridge. Be careful of cyclists as you are walking across.
Beautiful view. The Danube river is special and you get a rocking view for free. Easily accessible, I'd say worth a stroll over a night as so atmospheric. Enjoy!
Great for River Views. We walked over the bridge during a walk round part of the city. It offers lovely views over the River Danube - great for taking photographs!

Very nice!. If you are on business in Budapest, you definitely should find some time to see the Chain Bridge! Very good for walking - splendid views! Although it is very cold and windy there in winter (tried it last time:).

More than just a bridge. To describe it as just a bridge is a bit like describing Marie Curie as just a woman. The bridge was pioneering in its day and brought prosperity to the region and unified Obuda, Buda and Pest. Apart from its historical significance, it is quite easy on the eye.
A regular crossing. We must have crossed this bridge dozens of times, partly to get over the other side and partly because of the many photo opportunities.

It's a bridge. I'm not sure what I was expecting... Don't get me wrong, it's a very nice looking bridge, much like many others. People have put padlocks on it like in Paris. Other than that, I felt like I was walking across the Brooklyn Bridge.

Just okay.. Chain bridge is a famed bridge and its nice with two big towers. It gives good view of the city. Good to look from top of Buda castle. Found it okay, you will definitely cross this bridge to reach the castle so no need to plan for it specially. Proximity to city center - near.

Students use this as a meeting place. This is a lovely bridge. Cyclists use the pavement. Trams rattle the bridge.
Couples are beginning to leave padlocks as a momento. Students climb onto the chains and leave some litter. By the following morning it has been cleared away.

Spectacular Bridge with Awsaume View!. Significant bridge with history, as locals demonstrated in the past for freedom. It is easy to walk from one side to the other. Astonishing view from over downward the Danube with riverboats crossing. A must place for picture taking. Even more romantic at night when the lights are lit.
Very nice, worth a visit! . It's hard to see the hype about a bridge , but this is nice and much loved by all that visit , it's tells the story how these beautiful sides buda and pest come together!
Must visit for your trip. Fabulous views both day and night, a must visit location on any trip to Budapest. Can take the 16 bus across and go up to the Fishermans Bastion and Castle Hill as well.

One of the oldest bridges. This bridge looks like an ordinary bridge, but when you step closer, it looks like the chain from your bike - pretty spectacular! It hasn't got much space for walkers and bikes but it's doable

Beautiful. Lovely to walk over between the two halves of the city, a great place to admire the views on both sides of the river. The bridge is the link between the hills of Buda and the town area of Pest, it is also a great architectural sight.
Charming. A charming place to have a walk while enjoying the city different angles and the Danube river as well crossing from Buda to Pest!
Prettiest bridge to take to the other side. Awesome pictures, beautiful views, easy walk over to the other side. So happy we walked the length and enjoyed our journey from Pest to Buda :)

The Title says it all. This is a mere chain bridge that appears in millions of photographs and is not as glamorous as it appears, it is merely oversized bits of Meccano bolted together but in its day was a tough and innovative challenge to build.Standing on the bridge the views are nice looking up and down the Danube but that is about as good as it gets.

Beautiful bridge.. Nice bridge, and not too long to cross. A bit stupid that anywhere you travel, if there's a bridge, there are little locks with names on it. In this case they were attached on the little lamps... But hey, what can you do?

A beautiful bridge. This first permanent stone bridge helps connect residents of Buda and Pest, built in the 18th century by an English engineer. At that time this bridge was regarded as one of the modern world's engineering wonders. Too bad at the end of II World War the German troops blew up all bridges including this one. The city started to rebuild it in 1947 and the exact copy of the original one. We can see the bridge from Buda Castle and boat tour on Danube. The 4 bronze lions guarding the two entrance of the bridge reminded me of the 4 lions at the Trafalgar Square. Happy Travelling!

Stunning. Absolutely incredible sight at night especially, lovely view from high up and during the day aswell. Very picturesque walk along the bridge and close many of the nice attractions in Budapest.

Impressive at night. There are hotels next to the bridge. My hotel, Budapest Marriott was down the way and a short, nice walk by day and especially by night. Spectacular views in the evening! A great evening walk after a meal.
fun to walk across!. What a view! It was a delight to walk across the bridge. The river is below and you can see so much of both sides of the Danube from the bridge.

Amazing view. The bridge is a long walk but worth every step of it, you get to see some amazing landscapes and can capture good pictures. It is mostly crowded so be patient and have fun here during the sunrise.
looks magnificent. we saw the bridge at night, looks magnificent, a true symbol of the city, realy nice, I like it a lot

It's a bridge.. One of four bridges you can use to cross. The pedestrian walk way is secluded from the road.
There are a few sellers along the way selling drawings and couples "love" padlocks are here too. This bridge isn't far from parliament.
just a bridge. it's just a bridge. if you are taking bus from buda to pest, you will drive through this bridge... haven't seen its charms. and it looks better from buda castle.

Beautiful bridge. Built in 1839-1849, this bridge was a major feat of engineering. The bridge itself is reminiscent of the Tower Bridge in London, but not quite as attractive. Destroyed during WWII, the bridge was rebuit and continues to move traffic across the Danube.
Beautiful views from the bridge up and down the river and both the Pest and Buda sides.

Well, its a bridge all right!. This is a very short attraction but does have beautiful views. Watch out for demonic cyclists though *ching ching* and that is all the warning you're going to get. They will not slow down, they will not try and avoid you (although highly amusing). Off the bridge it makes a wonderful photogenic piece :)
Watch out for the cyclists!!. Beautiful bridge by day and night with great views! Mind out for kamikaze cyclists around the corners as you take your life and theirs in your hands!
A must see. Whether youve crossed the Brooklyn bridge or not, this is its little brother. Brings you directly to where you want to go in either Buda or Pest.
Good walk. Beautiful views from the chain bridge. You can walk across the bridge then take the funicular to the top for even better views of the bridge and surrounds.

The best way to get from Buda to Pest. Yes it's a bridge but walking on its footpath you get a real sense of how different Buda and Pest are. great for views and a remarkable bit of engineering.. It's a bridge not much more you can say
So charming and offers a great view!. Very charming bridge that offers a great view. Take a walk, cross the bridge and go up to the castle. The Chain bridge is an all time favourite of mine.

Whats the big deal about this bridge?. Interesting old bridge, very busy with traffic, I just do not get the attraction, maybe the history is what sets it off, but it was a hohum old bridge. Nothing like the Charles Bridge in Prague or Florence's covered bridge.

Tongueless Lions. A pleasant way to cross the river. You will have heard the story of the bridge many times on the 'Hop On, Hop Off' buses and it has beautiful details in the architecture. It seems a popular site for lovers padlocks too.
Best walking experience. We chose to walk across from one side of the city to the other....an easy walk and great photo opportunity. Lots of others travelers and locals on the bridge too...

A fascinating bridge. Crossing the Danube couldn't be more interesting than over this bridge. And it's beautifully lit up at night! It is also ideal to cross when heading to the Fishermen's Bastions which you can also reach by funicular.
Another Great Feature of Budapest. Must get to the Buda side and take advantage of the great views of Pest. Budapest--a great city to visit and even to live in. Would go back in a heart beat!
A good way to cross the Danube. Interesting walk from Buda to Pest and vice versa across this bridge with great views of the river traffic and both banks with their buildings.

Wonderful and Magestic. It was my first place in Budapest, I found it magestic, full of history and architectonic details, I recommend walk and stop every moment you want to enjoy both sides of the city, and go warm because is windy.
amazing views of the city. A stroll at night is a must because the lights and the fog (been there on December) just give it such a magical atmosphere...
Bring your camera!. By all means, if the weather allows, walk this bridge. Take in the views, snap some pictures - it's a great few minutes walk!

Landmark with a View. The original "Chain" Bridge was the 1st stone bridge connecting Pest and Buda and inauguration of the Chain Bridge took place on 20 November 1849. The iron chains, on which the road-bed hangs, are held by two 48-meter river piers in classicist style. At the time of its construction, the Chain Bridge was the suspension bridge with the second-largest span in the world. Retreating German troops blew up the Chain Bridge on 18 January 1945 and it was reconstructed in 1949 with expanding the original pillars.It is a beautiful bridge which is illuminated at night. There is pedestrian traffic on the bridge too and the views up and down the river are fabulous. No admission so it is another must see place!

Amalgamation of Art and Architecture.. The bridge is an amazing work of architecture and art. It was designed in sections and shipped from the United Kingdom to Hungary for final construction.
The bridge's cast iron structure was updated and strengthened in 1914. In World War II, the bridge was severely damaged and was rebuilt and reopened 1949.

This is one to walk over..... I walked over this bridge several times on my last visit. In good weather it is worth a walk across. All of the bridges where destroyed in WW2 so a little research on Google will give you the interesting history.

Beautiful Bridge. Make sure you actually walk over this bridge to really appreciate the structure. You can get good views of the bridge from the Buda side of the river. It looks great at night when it is lit up.
Great. What a lovely place to visit and take photos. You can easily see down the river in both directions. Easy to take great photos of the buildings on each side of the river.

Iconic bridge of Budapest, similar to Tower Bridge in London but with a spectacular backdrop. Pretty bridge linking the castle hill section of Buda with downtown Pest. Reminded me a lot of Tower Bridge in London as I guess it was constructed in a similar way.

Highlight monument. Along with the Parliament, this is another landmark of Budapest...hundreds of people crossing it, fantastic pics to be taken from many different angles, close to the city centre and traversing the Danube, separating the Buda and the Pest...It was so cold that we couldn't breathe but we wouldn't give up going back and forth even when it was dark and the cold was getting bigger and bigger..
