Must. Maybe the Most beautiful bridge in Budapest, suggestive!! It is very likely walking but also watching it from the Fisherman Bastions
Most beautiful bridge in budapest. This is the first bridge in budapest. Walking along the bridge exciting-day and night. But specially night view of the bridge seen almost from everywhere budapest.
Budapest Landmark. Beautiful bridge with nice view. Having such warm feeling when crossing this bridge. At night the light are beautiful.

Beautiful bridge between Buda and Pest. Location: it is very accessible with pubic transportation (there are public bus stop just in the front of the bridgeExperience: you could across the bridge if you would love too, there are pedestrians along the bridge. You could bring some written locks if you would like to put in the bridge. It would be great to be photographed at day instead of night.

Historic piece of engineering......... We visited Budapest in December, and the best way to circumnavigate both Buda and Pest is via the historic and very impressive chain bridge. Spanning the river Danube you can't help but be impressed with the sheer size and history of this monumental piece of engineering......

Impressive Bridge. We did a lot of walking on this trip and the views crossing this bridge are impressive. There are a lot of things to see and do on the Pest side whilst the Buda Castle and Gellert hill on the Buda side are also worth a visit.
The bridge is a great photo spot and definitely worth a walk.

Iconic Bridge linking two cities making them one. The Chain Bridge in Budapest is an Iconic Bridge linking two cities making them one. Sitting at a table drinking wine in a bar on the waterfront of Pest the bridge takes your eye to Buda and the Castle which is amazing; from Buda the bridge leads to the modern city of Pest with its shopping, eateries, waterfront bars and superb hotels. Well worth walking over and calling in at the Gresham Palace on the Pest side for cocktails,.

Lights on bridge are magical. The chain bridge is beautiful! Walk it during the day and drive it at night. The history is of the bridge and lion statues is interesting and sad. The bridge adds to the romantic backdrop of Budapest.

Beautiful Bridge . We spent the late afternoon and early evening in Buda and walked back to Pest over the Chain Bridge. As pretty as it is during the day time, it is beautiful to walk there at night as well to take in the views on both sides. There is also great history behind this bridge so it is well worth a stroll across it!

Beautiful. Day and night it is a must see, you will walk it numerous times during your vacation as it spans Buda and Pest! Enjoy the lions roar and the views to the Danube and all around! Ensure you get a glimpse at night, you wont regret it!

Impressive bridge that needs better care. This is the replica of older bridge but still it is very impressive and nice Bridge with a pedestrian paths on each side from which you can enjoj spectacoulos view and take pictures of both Buda and Pest. However hope they will put some information about it at the begining and take better care of it since rust made some wholes and there are many stickers on the pilars.
This is a Bridge. It definitely works as a bridge. you can use it to go to the other side of the Danube. it has some lion statues which are cool i guess. thats about it.
Impressive. Another must do is a stroll over the Danube on this very impressive Chain Bridge. also beautifully lit up at night

To do once you are near the Danube river. This bridge is beautiful and spectacular at night when illuminated.From the side of the chain bridge it’s recommended to take the funicular to the Buda castle.You can also visit the Parliament nearby at the other side of the bridge.
Great bridge . My hotel was near the bridge and the view of the bridge was really beautiful I suggest you to walk on the bridge and se the view of the river...

A very grand bridge. We went over the chain bridge which directly takes you to the funicular which leads to Buda castle. There are lions guarding both sides of the bridge. Looks amazing at night, especially seeing it from a boat trip down the Danube. A lot of the main attractions are around this bridge.
Nice walk. Nice walk from buda over to pest, some might say it's just a bridge but it's the history that goes with it. Brilliant views over the river Danube and a nice touch to the holiday.

Unique, beautiful bridge!. There are a couple of bridges which cross the Donau in Budapest, but this one might be the most beautiful one (the Freedom Bridge is bautiful, too). You should walk across this one, especially since it's close to other main sights like the St. Stephen's Basilica.

It is a bridge..... So cross it!! To understand it is to read up on it, for the British we had a huge part to play!!
A few stray padlocks of love but the true attractions are its lions. Such a great bridge to stroll across.

They don't make bridges this beautiful anymore.. We crossed the Chain Bridge several times while exploring the city during our weekend break. As with many other sights in Budapest it is grand, solid and beautiful. Lit up at night it really is lovely.

A walk. It's a nice walk between Buda and Pest over Donau, if It's not windy, in a slow pace you make it within 10 minutes. Could be crowded, but there are Two lanes to choose from. Popular place to get your pictures taken for wedding couples
Have to. You have to have a walk on the bridge, you will enjoy the fresh air and good look for the city and people arround you
Nice bridge. But I prefer Liberty bridge. Either way gorgeous views of Buda and Pest. Bring your camera and spare change for the elderly beggars.

Beautiful at Night!. A must see in the evening when all lit up! Easy walking access across bridge on both sides to visit both Buda and Pest. It looks long, but does not take long to walk across. View from below along river is quite gorgeous as well.

Very impressing. Went there a a part of an evening tour along the dune. Very impressing bridge ewith the fanuos lions without the tongue. There is a tell that the artist who made the statue comited a suicied because he forgot to locate a tongue for the lions...

Same good landscape all the time. Having been lived in Budapest, I walked over it sometimes. But it doesn't matter how often, one always stops at some places to enjoy the view. Or you can treat your eyes with it from a nice place in Buda.
Old bridge. You can feel when cars are passing by and that way you're able to feel old times when it was built when looking to Danube.

Nice bridge but what is the fuss about. I read a bunch of reviews about Budapest and many of them talked about the Chain Bridge so I thought I must go and see this. I was on the Pest side of the bridge and to be honest the view across to the Buda side was much better than the bridge.
Need to walk the bridge at night. Need to walk the bridge at night as all the lights are on and it so beautiful. The light do go off at midnight so go before.

Landmark!. Stunning from every angle and time of day. Very early suspension bridge. One of the places you need to get your picture taken while in Budapest.
TIP - the pad lock craze has spread here so if you have a secret you want to lock away, bring along a pad lock ...

Nice to walk over. We stayed on the Buda side of the Danube and used this to cross the river, it is great to walk over and gives you some fantastic photo opportunities, there are lots of places where the metal exterior panels have rusted through and looks its best at night when it is all lit up.
Walking the bridge . We first saw the bridge at night it was outstanding when it was lit up and even just as good through the day

Its a bridge with nice lion ststues. Nice walk with unusual bridge intricacys. Lights up nice at night.
The story behind the bridge was interesting. Same guy designed the tunnel.

It's a bridge. Don't expect anything special. It's a bridge. We crossed it to get to the other side. There are some padlocks on the bridge but you're not going to get any amazing views or anything like that

View by night only. The Chain Bridge is one of those attractions that anyone visiting Budapest flocks to see. In reality, it is best viewed at night when it is lit up and the incessant day-time traffic has eased.
Historical bridge. This is the most beautiful bridge in Budapest! Historical monument with a nice view. It connects Pest and Buda and located in the most panoramic place of the city.

Beautiful Bridge over the Danube. This is one of the most stunning bridges over the Danube in Budapest. A great place to take photos of the all the famous buildings along the Danube and also the Four Seasons Hotel.
oh yeah. most beautiful bridge on earth. I cannot get bored watching it. Love the walk over it and take picture with the lions:)
Long!. It's such a long bridge, but the views are amazing. Great for a walk along to the other side of the city.

Night time journey over the bridge. Having visited the sights on one side of the river, we walked to the bridge and crossed during commuter time in the evening, it was very busy with as many vehicles, cycles and foot passengers and equally as busy heading towards the city centre, worth a visit at different times of the day.
Budapest 2016. The Chain bridge is lovely especially at night when it is lit u, it is a very interesting walk over the bridge.

Worth a walk . The Chain bridge is one of the main landmarks of Budapest. Got some great pictures of both sides of the river and the Danube as well. Crossing the bridge is just one of those things you have to do when in Budapest.

Beautiful bridge. This bridge is amazing! I walked across it and it was gorgeous.
Lots of people (me including) were taking pictures of the views on both sides of the Danube...
Highly advise to see it for yourself

Beautiful!. Based on architecture, Budapest is arguably the most beautiful place in the world! The chain bridge is probably the main or most popular attraction in the city, you have to see this for yourself! And read up on its history when you get the chance, it's pretty interesting.

The Most Beautiful Bridge of Budapest. Take a walk over the Danube in the early evening for the best views of the city. I recommend starting on the Pest side as the views of Buda Castle are incredible!
Mesmerising. The bridge that connects buda and pest built over river Danube is a great site to see. The traffic is all day through but still it is a nice place to walk in the evenings.

Missed the chains. We wanted to visit this bridge as many people said to go see it. We thought it was called the chain bridge because it had huge chains on it but this was our mistake it was named after a person lol.
Chain Bridge. We walked over this bridge twice! It is better seen by night when it's lit up, which can be seen quite far away. I found all the padlocks on it fascinating!
Nice crossing. The bridge is a nice crossing between pest and buda, especially on a beautiful day. Sadly there are quite a lot of cars..would be great if it was made pedestrian only
Walk on the Bridge. The bridge connects Buda and Pest side of the city and is a good vantage point to enjoy the sites along the Danube. Nice for an evening walk
beautiful bridge especially at night when it is lit.. we experienced this bridge while on a river cruise, it is especially impressive at night with lights reflected on the water.

This was a great walk. The bridges are all very different- the chain bridge was very unique and hearing the thoughts and history about each one never gets old. Walk them all, feel the difference in each one!

View the Danube.. A loverly bridge to walk across with loverly view's of the Grand Danube. Makes you want to waltz across. A lot of padlocks attached to the bridge from loved up couples. So don't forget to bring your's. A must to see and stroll across.

Beautiful bridge . Spent a lot of our time walking over this bridge in Budapest. Really is one to admire. It is anchored on the Pest side of the river to Széchenyi (formerly Roosevelt) Square, adjacent to the Gresham Palace and the Hungarian Academy of Sciences, and on the Buda side to Adam Clark Square, near the Zero Kilometre Stone and the lower end of the Castle Hill Funicular, leading to Buda Castle.
an excellent thing to visit. great to watch, to take pictures of it, to admire it, to stare at it... simply a city's trademark. love it

Very Unusual Bridge Linking Buda and Pest. This was the first permanent bridge between Buda and Pest built around 1840. It is very beautiful and became one of the most modern bridges in 19th century Europe.
Beautiful views. Such a lovely view from the bridge. My other half (who is terrified of heights and of grids and any general flooring that isn't concrete) walked over willingly to see the sights.
Stunning. The most beautiful bridge in Budapest, in my point of view. Don't forget to see it at night too. Loved the views!! A wee walk at night...

very beautiful bridge and even more beautiful at night. very beautiful bridge and even more beautiful at night
you must see it on your Budapest tour !!!!!!!!!!

beautiful bridge, Scottish influence.. The Chain Bridge ( SZECHENYI CHAIN BRIDGE ) is simply the most stunning bridge in Hungary. The bridge links Buda to Pest spanning the mighty River Danube. Building was completed in 1849 with the construction supervised by Scottish engineer Adam Clark.In 1944 during ww2 the eastern span was destroyed by an explosion .I love the look of the bridge both of a day or night and it offers great photographic opportunities. It's a great bridge to walk across or with B.K.K. public transport ticket you can grab one of the frequent ferry boats for some great unique views of the bridge. A wonderful landmark and well worth checking out.
beautiful bridge and view. We took the metro to the bridge entrance on Buda side and walked across. Very impressive and a wonderful view.
Beautifull. I like it for taking really great photos,and the story about the bridge is very amusant. Very beautiful bridge with magnificent view.
Beautiful and worth a walk across it!!. This is a cool bridge that is worth the walk across and on the Buda side stop at little drink shack to get a hot chocolate! Beautiful city!!
Beautiful walk. Take the time to walk the bridge, the views are spectacular. The walk was easy and the time well worth it.
It's a bridge. Nice bridge but nothing ot write home about on its own, plenty of associated history and great views overlooking it from the royal palace/ castle hill.

Gorgeous and interesting bridge. Very interesting from both aesthetic and engineering points of view. Regular crossing of this bridge links the fenicular to the main shopping and cathedral district. Beautiful both night and day...
lovey bridge. well worth a see and even a walk over but if your feeling lazy can always get the bus over great views of river

Easy walk over Danube between Buda and Pest.. Took an easy walk over the bridge - rebuilt after being destroyed during WWII - from the Pest side to the Buda side. Originally built between 1842 and 1849 by a Scotsman, Adam Clark. There's a stone plaque on the Pest side commemorating him and his achievement. The bridge is more significant for joining the two sides than for its beauty. Considered a symbol of Budapest. Some people have started to put padlocks on the spotlight holders but so far there aren't man of them.
Beautiful bridge!. We could not get enough photos of this bridge! It is spectacular. I recommend taking a walk across the bridge to take spectacular photos of both sides of the Danube.

Best at night. As impressive as it is during the day you really want to see this at night. Most of Budapest is designed to be seen lit up, they've done such a fantastic job at highlighting all the must see places along the river with appropriate lighting. Get yourself on an evening river cruise and enjoy the Chain Bridge at it's best!

Nice morning walk. The Chain Bridge can be reached by M 1,2 and 3 at the Deak Ferenc Ter (square) exchange station and 10min walk from there to the Duna river side Szechenyi Istvan Ter leading to the bridge. From Andrassy rd can be easily reached by bus 105. This is a nice photo spot for the old architecture enthusiasts, and leads to the Buda castle district hill on the other side of the river. The photo is taken at the mid point hike up the castle district hill.

Views not the brisge. I didn't get the significance of the bridge, I'm sure there's more too it in terms of history, but to view it its just a bridge! The views are nice though, but I see people have already started ruining it with damn love locks!!

looks amazing at night. Destroyed during the war the bridge was rebuilt using the same materials . Look out for cyclists when walking across and go back when its dark to see it lit up at night - a treat
Spectacular at night when lit up. Great piece of architecture designed by British engineer. Looks spectacular when lit up. Couples have put love padlocks on, if we had one, would do the same.

Come for the views not the bridge. This bridge connects the Buda side to the Pest side. Therefore, a must visit during your trip during Budapest. Walk both sides of the bridge to get views of Parliament on one, and then views of Gellert Hill on the other.

Everyone should take this walk!. We didn't plan on walking along the bridge, but it was sure worth it. Just to get the view from the other side of the river was really worth it. Stunning views from a new perspective. Make sure you take a stroll across - there are a few cute little cafes that are right there, too, which are a bit less busy - which was nice.
How not to enjoy when staying at Sofitel . Beautiful bridge especially at night from Presidential Suite at Sofitel! Easy walkable or you can take bus 16 to cross.

A bridge but not of especial note. I am aware this bridge has some special significance for some but it does not merit the adulation it appears to have received in other reviews. It is no Golden Gate, Sydney or Tower Bridge. And as for padlocks as Sykes of love I think the Accademia Bridge in Venice might outdo it in numbers and weight of metal.
Look's amazing.. That should be part of everyone's tour. If you didn't visit Chain bridge, than you didn't visit Budapest at all. :P
a must visit place. a must visit placeIt is recommended to walk across the bridge during day time and during night time.

Our favourite of the 7 bridges across the Danube. Destroyed during the WWII with a large and terrible loss of life, this bridge has been completely rebuilt and impressively so. Whether you walk, run, cycle, drive, take the bus or the tram - the bridge is very well equipped to cope. It lends fabulous views of the Parliament building too.
We love bridges. Beautiful bridge that connects Buda & Pest and it was just outside our hotel. It's lit up lovely at night & with the Palace behind it makes for a great photo.

Stunning architecture, worth the walk. There are many bridges in buda, but no so iconic as the chain bridge. Situated between Buda an Pest, the walk across is short but the history is large. Situated underneath the Buda castle it is one of the most famous castle picture stops in history. While not as spectacular as visiting the eifler tower, it is the architectural icon of the city.

Historic Landmark. Used by lovers to attach a padlock to show their feelings and for good luck. Bridge built to celebrate liberation in 1945 so strong historical importance but not a stand out design.

Interesting walk. We drove over this bridge several times during our stay and also chose to walk over it it gives some very nice views up the river towards the parliament building we also passed Beneith it on our river cruise the architecture is very interesting and the story behind it if you go up to fishermans bastion or Buda castle at night it's all lit up and looks amazing
Beautiful At Night. We stayed just round the corner from the bridge and its worth a visit, especially at night. It looks fantastic from the river by boat

Lovely bridge, take your camera. I took some great photos whilst crossing Chain bridge. Hold tight when the trams pass as you can really feel them! Also take care of all children as the gaps are, in my own opinion, a little too wide. Takes a few minutes to cross also due to the significant width of the Danube here
Crossed - 2. It is a bridge. It connects two banks of the river...The best part of it was a destination and great views................................
Lovely views*. We walked the bridge both day and night. Totally different but both amazing! We also added a lock to the bridge!

Great photo opt. This is hands down the most beautiful bridge in Budapest and it has a very interesting history - I googled it while walking across the bridge. If it is a nice day, it id worth walking across from Buda to Pest to take in the view. This bridge is very beautiful at night and it so well lite up. Try to get a night shot from the Danube Promenade.
crossed. Crossed the bridge on our tour of the main sights after visiting castle hill and others. Links buds and pest. Nice stroll.
Beautiful bridge. Glorious bridge complete with photo worthy statues. You can walk over this bridge. Not far from the Houses of Parliament.

A beautiful iconic bridge. It's one of the most captured, most beautiful images of Budapest - postcard-pretty Chain Bridge connecting Buda and Pest. In the evenings it is beautifully lit, and it provides the opportunity for a romantic walk. One can go on a mini cruise on the Danube and the Chain Bridge can be seen from different angles; it is an architectural marvel, truly unique and special. I recommend viewing it to those that are keen on architecture, or after a romantic, pretty location.
Beautiful bridge. This a beautiful bridge linking the cities of Buda and Pest. Worth claiming castle hill to take photos of as its very pretty

just a fantastic historic place. Drink the atmosphere. Find a bar have a drink and enjoy the place while it hasnt changed to much. I am sure that over the next few years it will become just another city break.
lovely at night. it great to walk over at night really romantic, it definitely worth walking over the bridge with ur loved one and a good grid reference if ur lost
Chain bridge. We just drove by but it was beautiful. The old part of the city is very attractive. Wish we had more time to stay there.

Worth a walk . We walked from Castle Hill down to the chain bridge and over the bridge to Pest, at night, it was lovely to see the views of the city all lit up! We drove accom road it many times as we were staying on Castle Hill and socialising in Pest, but it was lovely to do the walk. Would recommend seeing this wonderful bridge up-close.
Szechenyi bridge. . The walk across the bridge gives spectacular views on the Danube and its many beautiful and historic buildings. Going over to Buda, the hilly side and the funuclar is a must do.
Budapest. What a nice city. Very friendly with great transport system. Some pubs need to clean up there act but overall a good experience. ..
Nice. Makes for an okay stroll. Good views. Some photo opportunities. Don't go out of your way to visit though.

Very impressive and a nice view on Danube. Really nice and impressive bridge. A good spot to do pics of the city with a great view on Danube and many points of Budapest. Because of the wind it was pretty cold to stay here to do photos but so nice.

This bridge connects Buda and Pest. It is a beauty to see it in the evening.. The lights add more drama and romance to it. Dont miss the boeat cruise along the Danube..I missed it.. Looking forward for a chance for a boat trip

Important bridge.. A very unusual and beautiful bridge, that also is and have been important to the city of Budapest. Easy to pass walking on a separate sidewalk, also a nice view and lookout over Budapest when you pass.
Lovely Bridge . Lovely historical bridge to walk across the Danube towards the Castle Hill district. Looks spectacular at night. A solid sturdy bridge that's endured the test of time.

Its a bridge!. Ultimately its a bridge but a very pleasant one. Apparently it was bombed and destroyed during the war and the metal spans collapsed into the Danube. They were then lifted out of the water and the bridge put back together again. What you see today therefore is mostly the original structure even though it went through 2 world wars.

Amazing bridge !!. This is really one of the greatest must see when one goes to visit the city of Budapest both by day and night. This is since one can appreciate more its architecture and even the views. Further to this at night it is lit in a way that you can appreciate it in my opinion more, because the architecture it contains are brought to attention to the users/tourists.
Cold in march. City and especially riverside is a little bit cold. I recommend having thick outfit for even a small walk
Great views. Take the time to walk across this magnificent landmark bridge and admire its architecture and the views. Free.
Amazing bridge. I'm a bridge fan and this one is on my top list. It's specially beautiful at night, and it's definitely one of Budapest's attractions
Take a look at night.. Interesting construction, definitely worth strolling across during the day.Looks quite pretty at night.
Magical. Although during the day passing the bridge is a nice experience, yet at night its a magical one. This is the bridge that takes you to the area under the buda castle.
Bridge with History. A beautiful bridge which crosses the River Danube. It gives amazing views of both Buda and Pest. Its beautiful in the daytime and when lit up at night.
Amazing Views. Take your time, stroll across the Chain Bridge from either the Buda or Pest side. Amazing views and ideal for great pictures.

You won't believe it, but it's a bridge. It's a bridge. I walked on it. Primarily to get to the other side.
The bridge was ok, seemed sturdy enough, and I never felt in danger while on it.

Nice site, substantial!. The Chain Bridge is beautiful at night and pretty during the day also. You can see where some couples have placed locks on the lights and on the bridge supports, a nice sentimental touch. We walked across this bridge a million times over our week stay, watch out for bikes coming around the corners of the supports.

Spectacular. It connects Buda with Pest, the two sides of the city, so before or after you have to go across it. It's incredibly beautiful, during the night with its light it's simply amazing. From the Castle it's spectacular but also from the parliament is great and you can take amazing photos of it.
Makes Budapest even more beautiful. This bridge was designed by an English that's why reminds a lot the British one in London. It is very beautiful mainly in the night when it is bright.

Great attraction. We walked across this bridge many times as our hotel was on the Buda side. The bridge is pretty during the day, giving great views of the river, but it comes into its own at night when lit up by the hundreds of white lamps - stunning and must be one of the most photographed attractions in Budapest.

Wonderful views. Living in Buckinghamshire, we particularly wanted to walk across this bridge as it's the same as the one in Marlow. Very easy to walk across and enjoy the views of the Danube, the Royal Palace, St Stephen's Basicila etc. Definitely worth it.

Bridge too far. Beautiful bridge that has pedestrian and vehicle access.It has wonderful views of the Danube and leads straight to Buda castle and these pastries that are cylindrical and covered in nuts and chocolate,cinnamon sugar.Anyway check the bridge out at night when it's lit up.

Attractive bridge. We saw this from the tour bus, and later walked across it. It has a history to mid 19th century, but rebuilt after German troops destroyed it in 1945. Now decorated with lovers locks. A good way to go between Buda and Pest.

A nice old bridge. It's a pedestrian and a vehicle bridge at the same. It's the oldest standing bridge in Budapest and a great place from where to look at the parliament building. In night it has a nice lightning.

Gorgous Views From A Bridge!. This bridge is so wide that you can spend a long time on it enjoying the views of Buda and Pest without getting in the way of anybody crossing. The sight of the Danube from here is beautiful!

Chain Bridge. One of the most important Hungarian bridge, with almost 200 hundred years old and nice history. It has 4 lions at the entering points. Hungarians and tourist love walking through it. In the city centre.

Beautiful Bridge - must walk across!. We stayed on the Pest side and walked over this bridge during the day and night, I think it's a must! At night it is at it's most spectacular as it is lit up and the reflection into the Danube is wonderful There are pedestrian walkways on both sides of the bridge

Great Experience . This is a beautiful and historical bridge, and part of both the day and nighttime Budapest scenery.It is a very beautiful bridge that crosses the Danube, it lets you walk from the pest side to the buda side. It is usually very windy in spring and autumn, and best enjoyed in summer. It can be crossed by bike as well as foot and cars.

An easy walk with great view of city. The Széchenyi Chain Bridge (A.K.A. Chain Bridge) spans the River Danube between Buda and Pest. It was the first permanent bridge across the Danube in Hungary, and was opened in 1849. It's an easy walk from the "Pest" side to the Budapest Castle Hill Funicular on the "Buda" side of the river. There is a great view of the Hungarian Parliament Building from the bridge.

Just an average bridge . The pedestrian sidewalks are not comfortable, as this bridge is primarily utilised by vehicles. The view from the bridge is limited because of its specific construction, but the bridge looks lovely from other observation points, located on hills.

Unusual historic bridge. The Chain Bridge is one of the iconic sights of Budapest. It is a simple suspension bridge construction but was regarded as one of the wonders of the modern world when it was opened in the mid 1800's. The designer wanted to span the Danube in a single span with no piers in the middle of the river since they might be damaged by winter ice floes.There is a safe walkway for those on foot.
Walk over.. As the bridge joins the old and new areas take the time to walk over the bridge.You see so much more this way and it is not very far between destinations.

Amazing day and night. Stayed at the Four Seasons across from the bridge so I admired it day and night. Try to catch it when it first lights up. It will have since hue of green and then turns white. Best pictures are taken during the "blue sky" when the sun goes down and the sky is still blueish black.
good views. Some good views from here, with the added interest of the padlocks going along it. Very good for photo opportunities
Beautiful bridge. Beautiful Bridge between Buda and Pest. Offers great views of the city. Crossing the bridge walking is recommended
City Break. Loved this bridge - amazing views - amazing city! It was great the way you could walk across to the other side - we were on the Pest side
Week end trip. It's a must do to walk over bridge. Take some photos etc. There are a few plaques on the way over which make interesting reading. It's a wonderful sight at night

Iconic bridge. One of Budapest's most iconic sites it will rightly be on most people's to do list. By night it is especially attractive. With other bridges having undergone restoration in recent years I imagine it will soon get its turn.
Beautiful. One of the beautiest bridge all over the world. If you visit Budapest, you have to check it out. Just go to Clark Adam sqr and enjoy it :)

A bridge is a bridge. This bridge is one way access the Buda from Peste. Designed by a Scots man in 19 centuary. It spans the Danube with pleasant walls along both banks. The Peste side of the bridge faces the Four Seasons hotel.
I love it. Walking on the history from one side to the other side, perfect design, in the middle of the city with wonderful view

A don't miss place.... Walk across it, feel the history. Don't take the funicular (cable car) up the hill, waste of money. Great picture area for sure, with lots of activity on the river and interesting people.
Beautiful bridge. The most beautiful bridge in Budapest. Impressive stone lions, great illumination at night. He can be crowded, but worth it at least once before the walk.
Great architecture . The bridge is great to see with huge lion statues. The design is quite unique and it's safe to walk across. You get good views on both sides of the river

Historic. The bridge has lots of historic significance and is still standing beautifully today. As with a few of the places of interest in Budapest, a greater description in place in English would be nice for tourists, but the hop on buses provide information on all aspects.
Beautiful bridge . . .. A beautiful bridge spanning the Danube which is even more spectacular when lit at night -- perfect for a romantic stroll.
It's just a bridge. Spectacular view. The footpath os clean and the bridge seems well kept... But it is just a bridge... not much to see

Beautiful bridge. Worth a look and picture opportunity - even more beautiful looking down onto it from the castle. Not a mention of it being twinned with a beautiful bridge that crosses the Thames. Poor Marlow!

Pretty bridge. This was my most favorite bridge connecting both cities of Buda and Pest. It's quite charming and has so much detail to this bridge. Has walkways so you can cross through as well. It's beautiful when it's lit up too.

Nice, but not spectacular. Ok...we were on a river cruise so saw the bridge mainly via boat so we may be harsh! It is a pretty bridge, not with a wow factor but sure it is a feat of engineering! The architecture of the riverside buildings was more noteworthy (to us) but then we know almost nothing about bridges! (They are either pretty..eg Severn Bridge, Golden Gate etc, or....its a bridge!) the key point is that you MUT do both a river cruise (or the hop on hop off boat) AND a hop on hop off bus tour to have ANY chance of appreciating this huge city...especially if your time, like outprs, was limited. A truly stunning city.....sadly with a large number of people politely begging fir food, money and cigarettes.

A beautiful Walk. This is a beautiful bridge to walk across! the lions on either side have no tongues- which was interesting to note! A great walk for history lovers since it was bombed during WW2 and rebuilt.
Beautiful bridge. there is nothing like this in england and it was very interesting and we where able to walk across it.

Walk over the bridge. I walked over the bridge on arrival - in the afternoon. It's a wonderful construction and by walking over it, despite usually suffering from vertigo (not this time though) you can really feel the distance of the Danube from one side to the other. You can also see how the metal is suffering and in places has started rusting away ! It's a fantastic construction and looks really good at night from my hotel room (Intercontinental) which is at one end. It is worth the walk- a lovely bridge.

A Bridge Between Two Cities ?. I felt an actual change between Pest & Buda after crossing this Bridge ? Spooky or not I think it might of been the expectation of what awaited up on the summit ? Which turned out to be spectacular but back to the Bridge ! Having seen how it ended up in Jan 45 I was amazed & happy at the repair work and realise how much this actually means to the locals and visitors, a pretty cool Bridge I reckon !!

Big Marlow Bridge. Living close to the only other bridge of this type in Marlow Buckinghamshire we simply had to check this out. Quite a bit larger than the one over the Thames but exactly the same unique style. Not sure if Clark built any others but this is a superb example of engineering complete with lions on plinths and looks fantastic at night all lit up.

Badly needing refurbishing. Looks good from a distance and historic worth unquestioned but badly needs visible metal surfaces cleaning and painting. The corrosion on the pathway edges on the down stream Pest side needs to be seen to be believed (and seen through!). Remarkably big gaps in the side balustrades up to and at small child height. Feel Health & Safety fanatics in UK would have closed this bridge already for this reason alone!
Architectural master peace. Very interesting and impressive object. It is obligatory to pass it on your way to visit citadel. Well illuminated over night
Beautiful Bridge. One of many lovely bridges going over The Danube. Would recommend walking over the bridge from Pest to Buda as the view through the road tunnel is stunning.

Beautiful walk across the Danube!. Walking from Pest to Buda was a pleasure walking across the bridge.Fantastic photo op's on the way!Take the bridge and hop on the Funicular to castle hill, beautiful setting!
What a bridge!. Looks totally different in the daylight in comparison to nightlight. Some of the other bridges are more decorated.
Very attractive bridge with beautiful views. Very attractive bridge with beautiful views. It was lovely to walk across and it looked lovely from up on Castle Hill
Nice big bridge. Almost all of Europe has an artistic bridge. Budapest has about five of them. They are all nice and worth a walk / drive across them at some point of your stay.

Placed our lock. Walked across the bridgeGreat views of the river and both buds and pestWe placed a lock on the bridge there are more interesting bridges ( Prague ) for this but here with my husband on my birthday so thought we would ( engraved it at home first) means something for us

Absolutely Stunning Bridge. Budapest is a city filled with beautiful architecture, and it is easy to see why it is often referred to as the Paris of the East. There are several bridges connecting each side of the city across the Danube River, and they are each unique in their own ways. The one we utilized the most was the Chain Bridge. It was the closest to our hotel and easily linked us from the Buda side to the Pest side each day of our visit.The Chain Bridge is the bridge at the bottom of Buda Castle on the Buda side and empties out near the Gresham Hotel on the Pest side. The bridge is amazing to walk across and get great views of the Danube River, boats passing by and each side of the city. The lions are powerful and unique, and the traffic is always on the bridge, reminding you that you are in one of the EU's largest cities.Public transportation in Budapest is great, but it's even better to walk because you get to take in nature and see and hear the sights and sounds of one of Europe's great cities.
Yes. It has chains (sort of), it is a bridge;(Without question), it is beautiful. Walk across, ride across or just photograph. A "must see", if "hard-to-miss" Budapest sight
A big bridge. This is a bridge that crosses the river- the Danube and quite beautiful architecture. l do not think you can walk over it.

Surprise. This bridge was the first in the continental part of Europe - so colled - "hanging" bridge! This bridge was the first permament crossing possibility between Buda and Pest, which was not Budapest, because the unification of three parts (incliding Óbuda/old Buda) of this town happened only later.As I am leaving in Budapest regularly passing throughout this beauty - admire talent of Hungarian engeeners and builders!It's more beautifull with new illumination/lightings, especially at the evening from the Castle Hill!
A must at night. This is the best view point for Budapest, especially in the evening. A must walk.You can access Castle hill from here.

Lovely lit up. We walked over this bridge numerous times both day and night. Its stunning to look at both ends of the day. Lit up it is beautiful and with the palace and parliament as backdrops it is a view I won't forget.

Superbly Restored and Interesting. The bridge joins the twin cities of Buda & Pest bisected by the gorgeous Danube River. A MUST VISIT Bridge out of the several bridges that connect these two sides. Superbly Restored The bridge had a almost 100 year life before it was blown up towards the end of world war -II by the retreating German troops. It was quickly rebuilt and the quality of restoration is something to marvel about; just like the hundreds of other building that have also been restored in Budapest just as in Prague

Very particular bridge . One of the principal bridges in the city that collegues Buda to Pest. I recommend to follow it on foot! It gives to you a very spectacular view over the Danube and the city!!!

Perfect Spot. This is one of my favorite spots to see when I am in Budapest. This is truly one of my favorite European cities. There are a few ares to get excellent pictures of the bridge, or eat in one of the cafes along the Danube with the view of the bridge. I enjoy walking the bridge at night, while lit up with white lights. It's a very serene experience.
Pretty in the night. Love the bridge in the night with lights, very romantic view and it was backed by the castle hill and grand national museum, I do prefer it than in the daytime.

Worth to walk!. This bridge is one of the landmark in Budapest, located on river Danube and promises good views around...It was the first permanent stone bridge that connected Buda to Pest and is considered as the symbol of linkage between East and WestDon't miss to walk there when you're in Budapest!

Nice bridge. Walking over the Chain Bridge was fun. It provides a great view of both Buda and Pest and even on the rainy cold day when we visited and walked across, it has a feeling of something splendid. I would say, as chain bridges go, this is a great chain bridge.

Free walk on the bridge to reach Imperial Palace. The chain bridge is very impressive and free to walk across. While on the bridge you can take great photos of the city. Make sure you also visit the chain bridge at night as it is well lit and very photographic.
Chain bridge. We visited february 2016 , chain bridge connects the buda & pest. It has a great view from buda castle and/or during the night. You can walk on the bridge and enjoy the view.

Beautiful at night. Very beautiful bridge. It's great to walk over when going from Buda to Pest. This bridge is most breath taking at night time. If the opportunity to go under it on a boat cruise come available definitely do it!
Romantic, even if alone. This is like walking across the Brooklyn Bridge, only older and more scenic. It's a short walk across the Danube. Who wouldn't love that?
Connecting Buda to Pest. Lovely architecture and even more spectacular at night when all lit up and set against the river. Very majestic looking bridge, just one of Budapest's incredible monuments.
Great Views!. Walked along the Chain Bridge whilst going to another landmark. Some nice views off what is a very nice bridge, but it is just a bridge!

Walk it. Much is made of this bridge, but it is like any other crossing the Danube. Or is it?We did an early morning stroll along the Danube and then over the bridge. This is the way to see and experience it best. From the people who spend their lives on the street, to investigating the structure of the bridge. They don't do it like this anymore. Have a look, take some interesting phots. Listen to the thrumming of the bridge when a heavy vehicle passes by.On our trip the water level was very low and the morning misty. Quite different photos to the usual. Witht he market so close by - and the riverboats moorings - there is quite a bit to see here in the heart of Budapest. Across the bridge you can walk up to the statue on the hill. Or go into one of the swimming baths (to the left as you cross the bridge from the market.

One of the must-see attractions of Budapest. The Chain Bridge is one of the iconic, must-see attractions of romantic Budapest. The bridge is over the river Danube, connecting Buda and Pest, and - as there are several bridges in Budapest - in my opinion this is the prettiest and most romantic one. It's really nice to walk over the bridge and take in the sights of Budapest, it is such a pretty capital city, one of the prettiest in Europe. I highly recommend this attraction.
Cool Bridge. You can see this and other bridges over the Danube by riding Tram number 2 an inexpensive way to your around.the Doctor hit me with a helpful vote

Windy! But a nice walk... The walk from the statue of queen Elizabeth to the city centre was really nice (not ideal if it's windy AND raining as you could lose your umbrella if holding one) it was a bit windy but it wasn't too bad.. The views were beautiful from both sides of the bridge. It has plenty of space for pedestrians and people on segways and scooters..

Chain Bridge. Not much to say really, looks nice when it is lit up of a night and a good little walk across. Access to Buda Castle and Fisherman's Bastion. Good history behind it if you go on the Danube River Cruise and listen to the headsets.

Romantic and beautiful !!!. We did cross bridge several times to go to Buda hills from Pest. It was cold, snowy but romantic and interesting . We are not only pedestrians there which makes more interesting for us a couple. We like Buda side of city and this bridge has a good connection to it.

Lovely Bridge. We ended up crossing this pedestrian bridge several times during our week in Budapest. It is a different experience crossing it during the day and in the evening when there are musicians entertaining and looking for donations. Many people stop to take photographs along their way across the bridge.

I love it on the first sight. My apartment booked is close to Oktagon, I took bus105, get off at the stop once the bus went throught the bridge. The bridge is cross the Dona/Danube river, first bridge to connect Buda and Pest, It was the idea of the great Hungarian Istvan.The 0km milestone is there, in front, you can climb onto the hill to visit the art musuem and other sight seeings. But we went in the evening, just want to have a leisure walk, so we walked back throught the bridge, u can see the parliament bilding on one side, and other attractions on the other side.At night, with the lights on, the bridge looks more elegant and stylish.

Bring a Lock to ensure your love . This is one of the amazing bridges to cross the Danube in Budapest. It is covered with locks that have initials of the lovers and then they throw the keys in the river. It is adorned with lions and the construction is amazing and a bit neo-gothic.

Chain Bridge. One of the landmarks of Budapest, this Chain bridge is the oldest bridge in Budapest, spanned across the Danube river- connects two parts of the city- Buda castle on the right bank and Pest, former two independent cities.
Interesting bridge. A great bridge to walk over, remembering that it was the first bridge built over the Danube. An interesting structure.
Very nice view. One of some nice bridges crossing on the Danube river between Buda and Pest. View is great. A good way to cross to see both interesting places for turists in the city
Absolutely beautiful view.. I really enjoyed the chain bridge. My hotel had a perfect view of it at night and the lights were beautiful. In the daytime, it really highlighted the city.

A tale of two cities. Standing above the mouth of the tunnel which leads from Buda under the castle district and sets one up for one of the most picturesque views along the riverside, I had explaining to do. And it wasn't as to why Clark Adam, or Adam Clark, was the name given to the square /roundabout just before the bridge. In the presence of two young children I was presented with the difficulty of finding ice cream. Gladly it's not a problem in the summer months what with the vendors sitting just below the funicular up to the castle quarter, but come winter I was pressed for answers. That it was cold just wasn't sufficient, but being that the Chain Bridge sits comfortably in the vicinity of Batthyány tér with its old market building a little further north up the river Buda-side and the immediacy of what is the more vibrant Pest just across the river, I wasn't phased. I know this city enough to know when I'm truly entitled to panic. What did slightly upset me was the need to leave just when I'd set myself up for the growing evening lights. Sitting above the tunnel looking Pest -side is certainly one of the least spoken wonders of the world, perhaps because everybody wants to keep it, selfishly, for themselves... Understandable, of course!

Lovely during day BUT spectacular at Night. Title says everything. Spectacular viewing for photographs and the walk over to the other side to take photos of either Buda or Pest.Can get busy, especially people walking to catch the funicular - which personally I think expensive but would not like to walk up to the Castle and Fisherman's Bastion. There is a free lift to take you up halfway up the hill (I think somewhere near the Hilton Hotel) .. we found it on the way back.
Amazing. a very beautiful bridge..It worth it to walk along during the day but also during the night. When you go have a locker with you (only if you are in love)
Beautiful!. Going across on this bridge is always beautiful, but don't miss it in the night! Absolutely romantic!

Historic bridge with a soul. The bridge is centrally placed in Budapest and a very historic construction. Worth a visit especially in the evening and during special occasions summertime when the bridge holds market and food fairs (no cars allowed on the bridge)
Nice views. My girlfriend and i walked over this bridge to reach tower hill, lovely views either side, not very busy either so plenty of room.
Beautiful pictures. The bridge itself is breathtaking. It offers amazing views of Buda as well as Pest. A must see and we are definitely going back!

Just a part of Budapest's landmarks you can pass by. You cannot leave Budapest without seeing this bridge or pass by. You don't have to look for this or walk across the Danube river. It is beautiful. though.

Never seen something like that. Budapest being one of the major tourist cities attracts a lot of tourists. The best part of the city is the Chains Bridge. Such a huge structure built with a lot of iron and heavy stones. Walking across it gives a nice view of the river Danube. Equally eye-catching at day and night
Most beautiful bridge. Amazing with lights at night, and ideal to walk during the day. Full of details everywhere, makes you not want to reach the other side!

Lovely sights . Recommend walking over the bridge and back again for great views of the city! There are a few gypsy beggars lurking on the bridge but they don't annoy you if you say no and move on. Great bridge with lots of history.

Iconic part to see in BP, a must for every newcomer!. Having photos from your Budapest holiday taken at the Lanchid is a must for eveyone who comes to Budapest for the first time! It gets you the feeling that you see the big chucnk of history in front of you streching over the river Danube. As most bridges are new in Europe, or greatly reconditioned to an extent it looks something else than 50 years ago, the Chain Bridge remains the great historical bridge of Budapest pctures still on postcards and international representations of the city.We had a nice time there as well, you feel like part of history. I had the same feeling as in the Szechenyi Baths!The bridge does not need any special recommendations, I am sure all visitors drop by upon seeing the city. I recommend taking a walk in the park in ffront of the bridge in the Pest side!

The Grand Bridge of Budapest. I stayed in Airbnb flat that overlooked the River Danube with the Chain Bridge on the right and the Parliament in the left. Daily i will walk across this beautiful iron bridge from Buda to Pest and back again. There are 2 lions on the front and another 2 lions on the end guarding the bridge. On one end of the bridge in the Buda side it leads to the Buda Hill and Castle. On the other end of the bridge it leads to The Gresham Palace. Maybe its winter, after sunset close to 5pm this area becomes very quiet especially after 7pm. But its beautifully lit at night and it's great because this bridge virtually belongs to you as it's very quiet!
beautiful. Very nice bridge, especially to take photos of! With lots of beautiful things to do on either side of the bridge
Good views. We really enjoyed the view from the bridge, and yet it isn't a long walk to cross the river. A short walk from he end of the bridge brings you to a perfect view of the Parliament bldg
a must while visiting the city. great piece of arcitecture! Walking across you must have a look at all the locks (from love-birds all over the world).

Nice bridge!. You pretty much can't avoid this bridge if you are trying to cross the river to get to the palace, however it is pretty impressive especially when it's lit up at night time.The only thing I can say that is negative is that it could really do with a touch up. It is looking a bit rusty and not well looked after.
Nighttime on the Chain Bridge. Wonderful views of the bridge at night can can be had from many vantage points, so give yourself some time to explore.

It's a bridge!. A very good looking bridge, especially at night when it's lit up, but at the end of the day it's a bridge.There are four very fine lions, two at each end. The artist was so proud of them that he challenged anyone to come up with anything that was missing, and if they did, he would jump in the Danube! Someone did eventually, and he did. See if you can work out what's missing from each of them (no it's not the ears, they are under each lion's mane).

The bridge to see from the hill of the royal palace is splendid. It will be the best to look at the Szechenyi bridge from the hill of the royal palace.As for the bridge itself, a lot of cars run, too; and, seeing from neighborhood, there is not the thing.I go on the hill of the royal palace, and the bridge to look at from there is the best.(^^) which is good in the daytime, but is particular again at night

Grrrrrrrrr lions . Lots of lions. If you like lions then visit this bridge. If you don't then you'll have to look at the Danube instead, sorry. It's an attractive bridge and happily only sparsely attended by hawkers and beggars.

Beautiful. The many bridges of Budapest are all unique and an memorable experience. The Chain Bridge is one of the best. In fact I would receommend that it is viewed both in the morning and also in the evening. We saw it first from the Hop on Hop off bus, where we were given an explanation, then we walked near it and last we took the night river cruise and passed under this bridge while it was all lit up at night. Always beautiful. Do not miss it.

It is a Bridge. Yes it might have a place in history but aside from the views - to Buda and Pest - it is just that. A smart bridge. I really thought it was not hellishly different from the other bridges over the Danube.
beautiful bridge day and night. for best shots of the bridge go to castle district, click shots during the day and night both. you also take the funicular up and down castle hill and get good views.

Must see at night.. Most famous of the Budapest bridges and you can see why! It was definitely a photo opportunity at night as it is all lit up. Also used it to walk to Buda side for all the sightseeing during the day.
Nice walk. Takes about 15 mins from buda to pest walking.both sides had very interesting historical places.again take the hop on off bus.we took the buses with the giraffe on the side.
Beautiful Bridge, a lot of traffic. In other cities in Europe you might expect this to be a beautiful pedestrian bridge, so traffic took away, but it was still a wonderful walk across.

Stunning!. Chain Bridge is one of the most amazing sites in Budapest. You can have a romantic walk (or just touristic walk, whichever you like :D) and see both sides of Budapest: Buda and Pest. I love the scenery when the lights are on at night, but even daytime it's simply stunning! Funny thing is travel guides like to make jokes about it, that the Bridge has the same length as the tunnel on the Buda side, so when it rains they push the bridge into the tunnel. Silly, but funny things. :D Don't believe them! There's loads of other stories around the bridge. One is on both sides there's a chamber for the chains and in war time the enemy wanted to explode the chamber of the chains. So they filled it up with gunpowder. Then locals were pouring the water of the Danube onto the gunpowder to stop the enemy. :) And try to find out if the lions really have their tongue. The other anecdote is that the architect who made the lion sculptures said that these lions are perfect replicas of a real lion. Then someone stood up next to them and said, well, these guys don't have their tongues. So the architect jumped off the bridge. (Who knows what's true? At least check the tongue.) :D
Never disappoints. Just a gorgeous bridge, we were lucky enough to have views of the bridge from our Airbnb and it was hard to keep your eyes off, especially at night. A true landmark.

Attractive. One of the best known bridges of the world, is laid over the Danube, and connects Buda and Pest. Great views during walking and a lot of photos can be taken either looking the Parliament, or Gresham Palace and Liberty Bridge
Lovely tourist site. . The bridge over the danube. Very ornate at either side. Spectacular view. Worth seeing on a trip to budapest

Beautiful walk, beatiful view. Loved it, magnificent and historical. Great for taking pictures and enjoy the view. Nice look at Parliament building and Danube river. Try to take a walk over that bridge if you visit Budapest. It's very impressive at night when the bridge is lit up.
Watch out for dog poo. Great piece of engineering and great views but watch where you step as lots of dog poo! Beautiful at night and great just to watch barges head up and down Danube
A great old bridge!. This bridge is worth a walk! Great views up and down the Danube from both sides of the bridge. I recommend it!
Over the Danube. Over the Danube | Between Clark Adam ter and Roosevelt ter a historical bridge built by earl Széchenyi as a display of new age thinking and reforms.

A great crossing point. . This bridge looks nice, and is worth a look at night when lit up. It was foggy the first time we went over it properly, and somehow the fog made it appear even more surreal and quite isolated when half way across and unable to see either riverbank. A great crossing point, and nice to use getting across to Buda Castle, Fisherman's Bastion and the Hospital in the Rock.
Great views . When walking along here you get to see some good views of what Budapest has to offer. It's not worth going out of your way to see but I guess it is a key monument to the locals.

Chain Bridge delight. I love how all the bridges are pedestrian! Super to walk along depending on which side of the city you are visiting.At night the bridge is lit up and makes an impressive landmark and photo opportunity.
Great architecture and famous landmark . One must see the chain bridge. I recommend taking the tour on the Danube at dusk. It's majestic and you'll see it lit up at night.

Well....as far as bridges go.... It's a good one. But let's not get carried away. It's a bridge. Now I'm not a bridge afficianado, it's not quite up there with tower bridge or the Golden Gate Brdge. Those are premier league bridges. This is a solid championship bridge. Reliable and "Bridgey". Delivering on all aspects of Bridgedom. Good walkability. Firm ground. No risk of suddenly toppling into traffic. Good tourist to local ratio. And excellent anti wobble technology. Good work.
Historic bridge. This is the most historic bridge, connecting Buda with Pest. At the end of the bridge, on the Buda side you will find the funicular to Buda Castle.

Iconic bridge in Budapest. One of the most recognisable sights in Budapest. Always busy! Great to walk from centre to Castle area. Looks brilliant lit up at night.
When approaching the Castle side and funicular, watch out for bikes speeding along cycle path - my husband nearly got knocked over!
View from the Funicular. Great engineering worth walking across as well as viewing from the Funicular, looks great all lite up at nights.
Excellent bridge. Very nice bridge to view at night or in the day. We did the walk many times over it. Highly recommend doing the walk day or night. Very good for photography too at night espically.
Beautiful Bridge. Beautiful bridge. In itself, it is a wonderful sight from any angle. It adds so much character to an already amazing city.
The main bridge, must be done !. This bridge will lead you to the castle and is an attraction that deserve to be done. When crossing hte bridge, make sure you check the parliament on your right.

100,000 reasons to visit this. Yes a really iconic piece of engineering a good landmark and necessary to cross the river Danube to Buda, if you are wondering why 100,000 reasons I'll yet you count the BOLTS & the locks on the ironwork it will not take too long.

A symbol of Budapest together with the Parliament. The oldest bridge in Budapest is worth to walk over.
After getting to Buda side of the city you can continue straight to the castle. The bridge is very photogenic.
Must Go. This chain bridge connects Buda with Pest. Good place to take many nice picture as all the nice building are in the background

Amazing for photos . This bridge is literally only a bridge, it's quite good for photos but you have to be close enough and have the correct camera for a decent photo - the bridge itself is centralised so you can get a good view of both sides of the city
Wow. You should cross this bridge if you are visiting Budapest. Beautiful during day and night! In my opinion one of the finest bridges in Europe.
Very nice walk. We walked across to take the funicular up to Castle Hill—it's the best way across. A nice walk, even though it had snowed the night before.

Beautiful bridge . We could see this bridge from our hotel, in truth it was one of the main reasons I booked the hotel and it didn't disappoint. The bridge connects Buda and pest and is great for getting photos across the Danube, particularly of the parliament building. I love architecture but even if you don't there's no denying the bridge is beautiful, and not only that it's also super functional connecting all the key tourist areas.
Great views. The chain bridge is iconic in budapest. It is only a short easy walk across and you get a great view at different parts of the bridge. Particularly beautiful at night time.

Guarded by Lions. Budapest is linked by numerous bridges all having some significance in the history of both Buda and Pest. None more beautiful then the Chain Bridge in the very heart of the City and leading to many places of interest.

Lovely bridge. Lovely to see during the day and at night. Recommend crossing it to get an appreciation of how quickly the river flows although the bridge moves with the traffic so don't go across if that puts you off!
Nice. Just another bridge. No more than that. It is nicer by night . it is a good spot to watch the points of interest that are situated along the danuba river.
Must walk along if in Budapest. Chain bridge was the first to connect Buda and Pest. The design is beautiful and worth a visit if you are in Budapest. It makes lovely photos, especially at night.
Amazing!. An architectural wonder and marvel, even if this is not the original one. Splendid view at night time!

Iconic Budapest . What trip would be complete without seeing the lovely chain bridge? Although it's a hard one to miss. Smack dab between the once buda and pest, it's a beauty in itself. Visit at night when it's lit up, and walk across it during the day to look at the beautiful lions. Photo opportunities of the river at sunset as well.
Great bridge. Iconic bridge to view either from the banks or from a boat. We walked across here a couple of times and the bridge is very interesting aesthetically.

Impressive Distinctive Suspension Bridge. The Chain Bridge was a gorgeous distinctive suspension bridge with two impressive arches on either end that links the former Buda with the former Pest sides of the Danube River. While crossing the Chain Bridge, the pedestrian is offered fantastic views of the Parliament Building, the Danube River, and all of the historic buildings located near the edge of the river. The views of the Parliament Building from the Chain Bridge crossing the Danube River as the sun was continuing to set were majestic. During sunset, the lights illuminating from the bridge were a greenish color. As the light from the sky continued to fade, the Chain Bridge appeared as if it were glowing above the Danube River. The bridge appeared absolutely enchanting with the transitioning lights.
Chain Bridge. a stunning bridge in design and worth a visit day and night. It looks superb lit up in reflection of the Danube.

Great engineering. This is the most well known of Budapest's bridges, and impossible to avoid. It reminded me a lot of Hammersmith Bridge in London and upon investigation, discovered that it had in fact been modelled on it. It was designed by an Englishman and constructed by a Scotsman. Some tourists have taken to adding padlocks to the light fittings which is a shame but otherwise it's lovely to look at and appreciate the design.
Great. Beautiful, this is truly beautiful bridge. I kept coming there 3 times a day, just to walk over it.Don't miss this bridge, once you are in Budapest!

The Queen of Bridges in Budapest.... Been visiting Budapest several times last couple of years I always find new "pictures" to make. When the dark coveres the city, its incredible second image shows up, change the tourism into a strong feeling of that: "I am the city". Look at the pictures and tell me what you feel...
Can't miss it. Best way to check it out is to go to Buda through it. Fantastic view of the Danube and bot Buda and Pest
Pretty but poor people tried to grab you . Very pretty architecture with a great view of the river but a few people looking for money. It's longer than you might think.

Part and parcel of Budapest . It is one of those icons you have to visit. If you buy a postcard, it will probably feature on the front! Also, from the bridges, you get a good view of the Danube and both sides of the river
Great views. This bridge is the crossing from Buda to Pest. The view of the Danube river is great with the royal castle and other historic buildings.

Expected more. We went there at the evening after heraring so much about how pretty it was. Sure, it looked beautiful with all the lights, and sure none of us knew much about its history, but all the great things we had heard Kinda fell flat. It was a Nice bridge, im glad i saw it but after all, its a bridge. You can walk over it.
Very nice. Great to see. And very beautiful at night with the lights on (they turn them off at midnight so make sure you get there before)

A beautiful bridge and the gateway to the Castle area. This Chain bridge does link Buda and Pest across the stunning Danube. It is a very distinctive bridge and worth a look on your way to the Castle District.
Beautiful from all angles!. Gorgeous. Walked across, mooched about underneath and around it. A lovely piece of architecture and a good photo opportunity. Make sure this is on your walking route!

Visual treat........... Stunning visual treat specially at night, when the bridge is all lighted up. Views excellent from either sides of the bridge. I think this structure is certainly one of the main landmarks for a Budapest trip. One can walk across the bridge along the pedestrian paths and take pictures to their heart's content.
great bridge. the bridge is really great and one of the most important landmarks in Budapest, worth taking a walk across the Danube

It's a bridge. As far as famous bridges go, this is a great one. Certainly not as long as the Brooklyn or Golden Gate, but beautiful nonetheless. It's at its best when lit up at night...amazing backdrop.
Chain Bridge. We were fortunate that our hotel (the Sofitel) was right beside this bridge. It was a very quick and easy walk to go to the Buda side.

What can you say about a bridge? . As far as bridges go it's pretty nice. Looks great at night. Worth strolling if your in Budapest. Probably wouldn't go as far as calling it an attraction. But pretty
It's a brodge. It's only a bridge. Ok it has some nice big stone lions guarding each side but let's not get carried away saying its more than what it is.
See. Huge! Masive! Must see. Must walk and take picture in the evening from top of fortress, it is magic moment that you will remember
NIght time is the Best. The bridges over the Danube, including this one are well lit at night. Get yourself out onto the river and you'll get some fantastic photos of the bridge

Oh, What a Bridge!. Chain Bridge.. Such a beauty.. Danube's diamond.. Cross it and take a minute to enjoy the view to the Parliament and to the Castle.. We went there on foot several times! We ever put our love locker!! <3
(Another beautiful spot to watch the whole bridge is from the Buda Castle!)

Wonderful Engineering. This is a particularly beautiful bridge to behold at night, looking across the Danube from Pest to Buda. There are few bridges that are more magnificent and steeped in as much wonderful history as this one.
The beauty of the Danube and Budapest. One of the most beautiful cities right on the river. It's inspired artists for centuries and it is easy to see how.

**walking**. among those bridges around it is the one with the LIONS, and it's beautiful,nice walk to go to the other side of the city and vice versa.....nothing extravagantly special aside from its history!!
View from Gresham Palace Hotel. You have nice views of the bridge, from Buda Castle or Hungarian Natinal Gallery on Buda side, and from Greshan Palace Hotel (FourSeasons) on Pest Side.
It's a bridge :). Well nothing amazing, but does look good and has a good historical knowledge. I enjoyed walking across it and traveling via bus.
Worth the walk. Fascinating bridge with good viewpoints of the city and surrounding area, real history. A must do - glad we did!

amazing. One of the most beautiful bridges in the Europe with very interesting story and history. This is absolutely must to see and must to pass in this city. The city is by the way well known because of its bridges and this one is the main. Equally is beautifull at every part of day.

Cool thing to see on your way to Castle Hill. If your accommodation is in Pest, you will have to walk the bridge on your way to Castle Hill. It is very nice attraction on Danube river.
Do visit it by night also, when lighten up it looks beautiful.

No tongue. A bridge is a bridge is a bridge. This one is special because of the missing tongues of the lions that guard the bridge on both sides. I was told that the architect jump from the bridge for suicide because he built perfect lions but forget the tongues. Nice story but true.

Elegant Engineering with a purpose. The Chain Bridge was opened in 1849 designed by William Tierney Clark. Officially the Széchenyi Chain Bridge, it was the first permanent bridge across the Danube in Hungary. It is a larger scale version of the Marlow Bridge, across the River Thames in Marlow, England.

Beautiful Bridge. Standing strong over the Danube river between Buda and Pest it is a amazing looking bridge that took us a wee while to get over as you have some nice photo opportunities for both side :) well worth to see.

Viewed from Dinner Criuse. This was an absolute delight to see from the River Danube at night during a diner Cruise, the walk on the bridge the next day also good, linking the two parts of Buda and Pest is very splendid, all good, worth the visit.
VG. This is almost the signature view of Budapest taken along the Danube River. Many commercials are filmed here but it's still a place w a great vista
Beautifully lit at night.. We walked over the bridge in daylight and sailed under it at night, both trips were worth doing for the lovely views on both sides of the Danube .

Romantic scenic views. You cannot visit Budapest without visiting the chain bridge. It is a spectacular sight and honestly feels like the epicentre of this amazing city. It links the two old cities and has perfect vistas of the major city sites. A romantic way to start your holiday.
An afternoon to remember. I went for my walking tour with a group and must say it was splendid..Walk through the chain bridge makes one feel the real budapest
Sturdy walk. This icon of Budapest is a quick way to get to your Buda sights. What better way to cross the Danube?
Walked across it everyday!. We had just a short walk (375m) across this bridge everyday from our hotel. Is a beautiful attraction, especially when lit up at night.

Chain Bridge is rated high - it is well worth seeing - but you can see from afar.. Chain Bridge was well worth seeing but you can definitely see from afar. The Chain Bridge in other cities were worth seeing more than this one in Budapest. It's a large bride and you can see even while crossing another bridge or from your hotel room

The Lions. The oldest bridge in Budapest. If you stay at the Four Seasons Hotel, your view is fantastic to the bridge! :)
When you are walking on the bridge to Buda side you have to see the castle at the top of the hill.
Difficult to get excited..its abridge. As bridges go its a good piece of engineering and has the Danube as a back ground. Traffic wise very busy so has pollution issues
Wonderful bridge. we enjoy the view of the bridge. but there were some constraction that I couldnt take a good photo for the bridge..

Walking over the Duna. This is my favourite bridge and I think the nicest bridge in Budapest. I like it even by car but I like walking through, because of the nice view!
The Bridge is very beautiful.

Very impressive craftsmanship. The most historically significant bridge in Budapest. It is worth crossing it by foot if you have the chance. You get a great view, statues, history, and some exercise all rolled up into a single package.
Beautiful bridge. This bridge is without any doubt the most beautiful bridge in the city. Totally recommended to look at it from the castle.
Beautiful Bridge. Very interesting and amazing structure! It also takes you to the other side of Budapest which is also wonderful to see!

impresive look. I recomend to pass through this bridge with car and to enter from Buda side so that you can see the impresive look on hotel Four season infront of you.it is a look that you will never forget.

The view at night.. mesmerizing.... This was the first bridge that connected Buda with Pest.. The construction is mammoth and the bridge functions even now normally. You can walk through by the sides with a great view..

An evening stroll along the Danube and across the chain bridge. This was part of my first day and I walked along the buda side and across the bridge at sunset and the views were spectacular, on the pest side of the bridge was the most beautiful setting of the four seasons hotel in all its Xmas decorated splendour, great to be a part of the history and some of is it is written on huge plaques at each end of the bridge. Great views of parliament and the Danube and all of the key buildings are lit up

Not just a bridge.. Started to cross over and you see the Lion....Yes, he looks great. A short walk and you are over the bridge and another part of the city awaits you. It is as memorable as the Tower of London Bridge, and Brooklyn Bridge. Just one of the greats.
Landscape. Very pleasant to walk on,as the sun goes down it is getting more and more beautiful,finally when the lights turn on it becomes center of Budapest,wow!
good views. This bridge is beautiful and connects the Castle Hills and the Fisher's Bastion with the city center.

Nice bridge . Well worth seeing at night like all the other bridges into Pest from the Buda side. In the day they just look like bridges but at night they light them up to make them look spectacular. Go at night at take pictures and walk across the bridges.
Simple bridge with amazing view. This is a must visit if you come to Budapest. You have to plan for your trip if you're driving in that area.
Beautiful Bridge. Walked across this bridge every day of our stay. Good views of river. One night they shut it for David Cameron and his security convoy.

Beautifull Bridge. Beautiful bridge to walk on. But unlike the Charles Bridge in Prague, the Chain Bridge does not have any attractions, just a sidewalk for pedestrians along with cars road. Nice to photograph the bridge day and night to capture the Danube from the bridge.
Great views. We walked across this bridge before the snow blurred the view, at night it looks amazing. The bridge was built by the same Lord who built the baths of the same name.
Almost Mandatory. Crossing the bridge is almost mandatory during a visit to Budapest. Try late afternoon or early evening during midweek to maximizes the scenery and minimize the pedestrian traffic.

"Romantic". Chain Bridge is very romantic at winter sunset , when lights shine through cold air.
Great pictures. Amazing view on Danube River.
Nice. Is nice visit this place at sunset each time i'm in Budapest, is very romantic and offer a beautifull view of the Danube River

Unique . Recommend to go through the bridge on your way to Buda instead of using transportation at least once though it looks completely different on the day time and the night time. Amazing view, great pictures.
Stunning!. Stunning, old bridge - a must walk over when you visit Budapest. It is one of few bridges that connect Buda with Pest, but defnitly the oldest and most beautiful.
Nice bridge, nothing special though. The chain bridge looks nice but there is nothing special to it. It's a quick pass by place where you take a picture while passing the river.

Worth the walk. We walked the bridge on our 2nd day in Budapest on our way up into Castle Hill. It's such an enjoyable walk and nice view we ended up doing it on all of the following days as well--it became our morning stroll. Highly recommended (and who doesn't like free?)
Beatuiful Bridge!. We walked across the Danube via this bridge... it is beautiful. Love the lion statues! It was a cloudy day, but still beautiful.
Don't miss it. Walk the bridge up and down, take a look at the Danube, at the bridge statues... go during the day, during the down, at night... enjoy it
Very nice to be seen at night from ferry. This bridge is quite beautiful seen at night lit up if you take a ferry on the Danube it is even more beautiful!

Favourite bridge in Budapest. Crossed this bridge many times and it truly is stunning. Best viewed at night time or in the early morning fog. It lights up and stands out in Budapest. Best bridge to get from Pest to Buda as leads you straight to Buda castle. On the Buda side there is some maintenance work as they are building a tram line that goes under the bridge so it can continue along the Buda side of the Danube.

Excellent view . Chain Bridge is one of the main attraction in Budapest you cannot missed out to not seeing this bridge while you are visiting Budapest a specially during the night the view is spectacular.
