A "Musdt do" activity in Budapest. It's one of the things that all visitors to Budapest MUST do. Walk right across the Chain Bridge, and back again. You get stunning views of the magnificent architecture of the city.

Connecting Buda and Pest. The bridge is a beautiful way to see the river and to get between Buda and Pest. The Chain Bridge with it's giant lion statues connect the two across the beautiful Danube river. It is the natural and best way to cross from visiting one to visiting the other. A great peaceful stroll. The tram up to the bastion is right at the end of the bridge on the Buda side, as is the beginning of the pedestrian path up to the top. Great To See. The pictures don't do it justice. We walked over this bridge every day as our hotel was on the Buda side of the Danube and the sight of it never got old. We had a river view room that allowed us to see it lit up at night, which is when it looks its best!

Mid-19th century technical wonder still impresses 21st century tourists. The first permanent bridge over the Danube linking Buda and Pest, ruined and rebuilt after the 2nd WW, offers a great pedestrian look to either side of the Danube. Every details reconstructed by the original plans. Many legends surround the bridge, ask your guide.

Learn the legend of the lion sculptures on the Chain Bridge. All of the bridges over the Danube between Buda and Pest were destroyed during WWII, with only the towers on the Chair Bridge remaining. This is just one of the beautifully rebuilt bridges. Of particular note are the lion sculptures standing watch at either end of the bridge. Legend has it the sculptor who created them was so proud of his work he declared them "perfect in every way!" Immediately upon their unveiling someone in the crowd declared, "The lion has no tongue!", causing the sculptor to be so distraught he flung himself off of the bridge. Apparently the lions DO have tongues, they can only be seen from above. Interesting legend nonetheless, enjoy this beautiful city!
Beautiful. This is a very very bridge but well worth a walk across. By day you can see for mile down the Danube (on a clear day) but by night it's simply beautiful. A must see when in Budapest x
Big and nice to see. It is the bridge that combines two sides of the city. It reachable by foot or car and you can see it from the Buda castle on the hill.

The symbol of the unification of Buda and Pest. It is a really beautiful bridge! It was built when the town was unified. Before there were two towns, Buda and Pest united only by a boat bridge during the good season. It was built in 1849. At the time it was one of the biggest in the world. In 1945 the occupying German troops made it blow up to halt the advance of the Russian troops. It was rebuilt on its centenary, in 1949. It took the name of the man who wanted its building, István Széchenyi ,an Hungarian Count

Budapest's iconic bridge. The connection between Buda and Pest is beautiful at day and stunning at night! A very iconic sight of the city which is a "must" visit when you are in Budapest. The massive lions at each end of the bridge are also a great indication of an architectural masterpiece.Even though some say it's just a bridge, it has an interesting legend behind it (don't be tricked, it's fake) where at the time of its construction, the bridge was considered to be one of the wonders of the world. Chief engineer Adam Clark, a master builder from Scotland, completed it in 1849 and legend has it that he was so proud of his masterpiece he would challenge anyone to find any fault with his work. When it was discovered that the lions at either ends of the bridge didn't have tongues, he was so ashamed that he committed suicide. Another important note is that during World War II, the bridge was damaged and its rebuilding was completed in 1949.

A photographer's dream!. The Chain Bridge is a photographer's dream and I spend many hours shooting the bridge at every time of day and every angle. During my first visit to Budapest however, I was quite disappointed that many of the iconic views of the bridge are often obscured by the many tour boats, particularly the gigantic Viking Cruise ships. The crime of it is that the people taking the cruise are mostly not taking advantage of the view since they are off touring the town, while the ship being parked there for days just prevents others from enjoying it. If the tour boats are not there, good shots can be gotten from various locations north and south of the bridge on the Pest side. You might want to ride the 2 tram and scout out the various locations. On my first visit to Budapest, I had to go quite far to the north to get a photo without a cruise boat in the foreground. During a visit in March, the tour boats were not around so the views were much better and more more enjoyable for the pedestrians. You can also get good shots however from Castle Hill from several locations and from atop the tunnel. However, In December 2015, the landscaping in the center of the traffic circle on the Buda side of the bridge was all torn up, as were the roads and sidewalks on that side of the bridge so good photos were not available from atop the tunnel at that time. Walking across the bridge is pretty fast and easy, sometimes just as fast as taking the bus if the traffic is heavy. Plus you can stop to take in the views of the Danube and the Parliament building along the way.The waterfront in Budapest in a UNESCO World Heritage site so is quite beautiful. All the Budapest bridges are lit at night and are gorgeous. The lights go on just a little bit after sunset.
Just a busy bridge. This is really just a busy bridge with a bit of construction going on so pretty crowded as only one side being used. Nice views from the bridge

Chain Bridge. It's an impressive bridge, great for iconic photo taking. It's possible to cross the bridge by foot to the other side, highly recommended in non-rainy days. Offers great views over Danube and Buda castle. It's a must visit if in Budapest.

Chain Bridge. This bridge was pure history. My children had studied and researched on the places of interest and on occasions I was amused to see that they were 'cross examining' our guide. Reminded me of the Brooklyn Bridge or the bridge in Covington Kentucky over the Ohio River.

Landmark for Budapest!!. You simply cannot go to Budapest without crossing this beautiful chain bridge over the Danube. It is a great example of British engineering. Impressive structure but if you look closer you will notice that needs some serious maintenance

Rebuilt. All bridges over the Danube at Budapest were destroyed by the retreating German army towards the end is World War 2 and had to be rebuilt. The Budapest authorities have done an excellent job and the Chain Bridge has been restored in its original style. Traffic is heavy but the views are fine.

Walking over the danube . This is a short trip as it only takes 10 minutes to cross the danube chain bridge. We went early at 8 am so it wasn't busy and no traffic so it was very pleasant. From on the bridge you can take great pics of both buda and pest.

Walk across the bridge. This is one of those things you just have to do during your time in Budapest. Walk across the bridge. It is a lovely view of the river and the city. Plus it is a stunning architectural piece.

Well it's a bridge. Sorry but this just didn't 'move' us. I mean it is a bridge. It has lots of traffic going from Buda to Pest or the reverse. Yes it was the first to cross the Danube here, but....it remains just a bridge. You will see it and likely even cross over it.

Particularly Pretty as Night. This bridge offers wonderful photo opportunities and is especially pretty at night when lit up. This connects Buda and Pest over the Danube river. This was completed in 1849 and destroyed in 1945 by the retreating Germans during the Siege of Budapest with only the towers left standing. It was rebuilt and reopened in 1949.

The spotlight in Budapest. The view is fantastic from Buda side of the hill. Chain Bridge is the highlight in the city. No matter day or night time, from the hill or the bottom. It always get your attention.

Unique. Maybe there is nothing to say!
It is a bridge for cars, and passing persons on sides.. but still it is unique.
And it is not that much old, it was opened in 1849.

Very pretty at night . The Chain Bridge is lit up at night, and if you take the steps down to the river (rather than walking across it) and sit on one of the benches near the riverbank, you get a lovely view of the palace, bridge and cathedral all lit up. Beautiful!
Well lit up and clean with great views. Lovely big bridge over the Danube and just beside Gellert Spa (go to the hotel bistro for bargain great lunches).

nice brisk walk!. it's not at all difficult to get from Buda to Pest, and we decided it would be a nice, brisk walk on a cold, but dry November night. Certainly was, and got our appetites going for a lovely meal on the Pest side. Highly recommend it.
Wonderful traditional bridge. Walk across thus bridge, s good experience, on the way to to chapel "in the rock". Good views up and down the Danube....

Best seen in Darkness ( like some Aunts). Visited during daylight and it's a clever design, but a bridge never the less.
However when you visit it at night and view it from the Palace overlooking the city- wow!
The Bridge and the city are awesome in the dark.

Amazing views. This bridge is very easy to walk across and my sister and I sat on the sides of the bridge, people watched and watched boats cross the Danube river. I saw a lot of locals and tourists sitting on the sides of the bridge and eating lunch and my sister and I took some great pictures on the bridge. It's not very long either which is why we decided to walk across it.

Cool scenic bridge for those into architechure and engineering!. The Chain Bridge was the first permanent bridge between Buda and Pest, and is an incredible sight today. It rivals the Brooklyn and Golden Gate Bridges for its beauty, and predates both of them. Great spot to take a stroll by the Danube, and short enough that the walk from Buda to Pest is pleasant and enjoyable. Must see!

Passing through Budapest. The most beautifull bridge from Buda to Pest, or from Pest to Buda. If you passing through Budapest by car, cross the bridge from Pest to Buda and you will enjoy a beautifull view of the Castel Hill.

An experience not to be missed.. An experience not to be missed. The sense of history here is almost overpowering! If you only visit one bridge, make it the Chain Bridge. Opened in 1849, it was the first permanent bridge across the Danube in Hungary. When it was built, with its span of 202 meters, it was the largest bridge in the world. One aside: the lions at either end were carved without tongues, an oversight that it is rumored, caused the sculptor to commit suicide!

Great Bridge to Walk Across. Very pretty to walk over the river and see the view of the city from each side. Especially fun at dusk/evening as the lighting is so pretty. On the Buda side, there is a nice shop where you can get hot wine that is really delicious.

Looks just like a chain!. This is a wonderful architectural feat and like the Golden Gate Bridge or the Narrows bridge in Washington state, posed some fascinating challenged in its construction and design over a large body of water. As you drive across it and look at the cables of the bridge, they look exactly like a chain, hence the name "chain" bridge. It also connects the Buda and the Pest side across the Danube and is quite popular with tours to go up to the castle area.
Great views but..... At the end of the day its a bridge. Shame people have taken it upon themselves to deface it with stickers.
Gorgeous. Another must see in Budapest with fantastic view of the river. Bit windy and rainy but worth it for the views.

atmosphere. Loved the chain bridge.great views of both Buda and Pest.try walking instead of public transport to get the atmosphere.you see the magnificence of the Danube when on the bridges and they are easy to cross.lots to see in Budapest.

Chain Bridge. This is considered to be the most beautiful bridge across the Danube in Budapest and I have to agreeit connects the Buda and Pest side as you walk across it you have to take notice jay how beautiful this bridge isFor an exceptional photo take it at night when the bridge is lit up!

Walking from Buda to Pest. This historic bridge connects Buda with Pest. My wife and I walked over it at nightfall and the city lights astounded us. We loved how the steel of the bridge fit through the precise holes cut through the stonework along the bridge. The pictures from the bridge are beautiful as well.

So gorgeous and especially at night. What a gorgeous sight.. Definitely a must see at night all lit up!Take a walk across, enjoying the views and end up on Buda at the steps of the funicular. What a gorgeous, gorgeous city.

A must see from both sides!. Unbelievable structure, best to see it from Buda during close to sunset. Once its lit up - fo-get-a-bout-it!!!
Not much more to say about that!
CHAIN BRIDGE. The chain bridge is a nice bridge, it is known for its legendary lions, other ways tome it is just a bridge. Better thing to see while in Budapest.

A beautiful bridge at night. A great location for photos..and steps from markets..you can reach either Buda or pest side attractions from this bridge and surprising it is clean to walk over and no graffiti

Unforgettable. When the Nazis left the area they blew up the Budapest bridges connecting the two sides of the city. The bridges have since been restored.The Chain Bridge is a most popular bridge.....it is beautiful....stately....and well lit at night....a sight to see.There are 'sidewalks' so that one can walk from either side of the River. On the Buda side, one can then take the tram up to the Castle District on the hills above the river.Going west across the bridge puts one very near the heart of the downtown area and within a block or two of Andrassy ut.To an outsider, this would appear to be the most popular of Budapest bridges.

See it from a far - beautiful.... There was aerial show when I visited Budapest. It was crowded every where.Best place to see the bridge was from the palace, it looked grand and very interesting with the aerial show.

must walk across.... ... and back if you wish! Must see and think about it if you can fit in in the tunnel when it rains or does the lions have tongues :-) Jokes aside, it was the first permanent stone bridge in Bp. 166 years ago, connecting the 2 sides of the Danube together.
Crossed over to Buda from Pest. Crossed over by bus from Pest side. A lovely bridge that does its job. Looks very pretty at night with the lights on.

My favourite bridge in Budapest. With over 10 bridges connecting Buda with Pest over the Danube river, this has to be my favourite. With its very rustic look and design, this central bridge connects the centre of Pest to the castle hill. Well worth a visit and a stroll across. Stop either side for a lovely view down the river.
Amazing Walk. By night the chain bridge is definitely an attraction worth seeing more than once. It is a very nice walk across then bridge too!
Great for photos. It's an impressive bridge, great for iconic photo taking. It's possible to cross the bridge by foot to the other side, highly recommended in non-rainy days.

Fantastic. The bridge is fantastic.
It looks very attractive.
You may see amazing view of the river Danube as well as the city Budapest ( both parts Pest and Buda ).

This is one hell of a bridge . If your scared of heights (like me) then brace yourself because this is something else!! You get an amazing view of the city especially if you carry on to the castle at the top of the hill it's truly mesmerising
Bridge. Beaultiful bridge with many details and carvings, giving lovely views of the danube and buildings lining it.
impressing. Romantic,traditional bridge which connects budda with pest at the point of the castle.it is very near to the center,and you can easilly walk it.

Is a bridge just a bridge?. Essentially its just a bridge, but apart from however theres a lot of history behind this one & it probably the best known bridge in a city known for bridges. Very popular for Photographs - from the buda side you also get a great side view of the Parliament building and from the Pest side Buda Castle, all making great back drops for those photos.

Everything was interesting, the people the history, the food, the chops, I felt very safe traveling around even at night. Budapest is a beautiful vibrant city, I loved it as much as I love Paris. By day is an awesome city , one must visit the market, the Pest side is beautiful and if you walk along the River at night you can see all the castles lit up , up on the hills , and the bridges across the River connecting both Budai and Pest it is an incredible sight.
History. Amazing entry or exit point to Budapest by vehicle. Also an absolute must walk during day or night time for amazing views of the Parliament.
Beautiful. Stunning piece of engineering that can be enjoyed as a view or as an activity ! We loved walking along it and it is a truly iconic piece of Budapest !
stanning. Huge bridge to connect 2 parts of the city, huge and stunning. We had a great walk through it. It's nothing special, but anyway.
stunning. you have to see it for yourself to appreciate it but it is so lovely to walk over it and the a completely different view of budapest!

Mesmerizing!. Absolutely love this bridge for many reasons...the views from it are incredible, it's great for taking a nice evening stroll, there are so many angles and features of the bridge itself that make great fotos & more! This bridge connects Pest & Buda it is easy to walk across from one side to the other because it has walking/bike lanes on the outside of the bridge. It was one of our fave places to be at night to look around the city!

Beautiful day and night. Such a pretty bridge crossing the Danube in Budapest. Early morning fog, bright sunshine mid-day or spectacular night view with lights, it is the symbol of Budapest. Walked across on several occasions as well as sailed under it. Avenue between Buda and Pest connecting the city.

One of the beautiful bridge. Chain bridge is located in the heart of the city, it is the chain between Buda and Pest. Take your time on Pest side and then walk to Buda side through that bridge and while you are moving, you would see the Palace, Fish Bastion and etc.
Nice view walk. It is nice walk if you are warm and not in the middle of rain. We liked the view of the bridge from the Citadella in the evening when it is all light up.
Wow.... Beautiful to see...worth walking across day and night...took some great photos....opportunity is best at night. Asbridge looks amazing.

Beautiful bridge. Pretty bridge in a pretty spot on the Danube in the center of town - be sure to walk across and take in the river views - runs from the Four Seasons hotel to the funicular to the top of castle hill
Lovely bridge at the heart of the city. I think this is the prettiest of the bridges in Budapest. It was directly across the street from our hotel and allowed easy access between Buda and Pest.

Bridging the gap!. It is worth a quick visit to the bridge, knowing that it was the first built to link Buda and Pest but it is heavy with traffic. I took the number 16 bus across which seemed a good way to see the river and bridge without the noise and danger crossing roads. I returned at nightfall to see the bridge quite transformed with its illuminations.

Cross the Danube. Wander casually across one of the great bridges of the world, watch the river traffic go by and wonder where it will finish its journey, Vienna, Bratislava or even Linz in upper Austria, one can only wonder.

Spectacular Bridge on the River !. One of the perfect looking bridge situated on the river Danube connecting the cities Buda and Pest. Views from the bridge are eye catching especially at night. You can see many tourist walking along side the bridge capturing its beauty in their cameras. Must see location in Budapest !
Simply magical by night. Dramatic by day but oh so romantic by night. Must see. Even better when you are sailing under it on the Danube
Two days in Budapest. You get great views of this bridge form the Citadel, and even better views if you take a walk along the Danube at night.

Beautiful at night. Our first night we arrive late and we walk near there.ogg my gof is really amazing bride.the only that the make some.constructions in on side and it is a little difficult.but very nice

impressive. not a massive bridge lover but this one has a massive amount of detail and the tunnel beyond the bridge was built by the same person adam clark?,,they say just to put the bridge in when it rains lol,,,thats straight from the tour bus,,,
YOU HAVE TO WALK THIS. Great walk over the bridge to Castle HIll, well worth the walk really easy. You can find out the history of the bridge which was designed by a brit.
Very nice. For sure the most beautiful bridge over the Danube.great architetture. The best way to reach Buda from Pest!

Great views of Danube and Royal Palace. 22nd October 2015. Worth walking over, and you'll most probably do so if your heading to the Cog Railway to take you up to the Royal Palace, etc. Great views of the Palace, the river, and the Buda Hills. Be warned - lots of traffic on the bridge.
schain bridge. this is a spectacular sight on the Danube river , it allows you to walk to either side ( buda+pesch sides)
Amazing view . Even in the rain this bridge is just amazing , definitely a must visit at night parliament looks even better at night. Take your camera with you you won't be disappointed
lovely view. we took a walk from our hotel to this bridge and walked across to Buda as we were in Pest, the views and the bridge was amazing.

Great bridge. I didnt have a chance to walk this bridge because I took on the hop-on hop-off bus. When the bus was passing on the bridge, the view was fantastic. Seeing both of Buda & Pest cities. Especially, the views of the Hungarian parliament, Buda Castle, Fisherman's Bastion are great and also Pest City!!

Beautiful day or night!. We visited the Chain Bridge while taking a Viking River Cruise; we actually docked right next to it, so we could easily walk off ship and on the bridge day and night. Weather was great while we were there and the bridge is a beauty, day or night!

Really nice place . Famous bridge connect Buda and Pest. Watch it by night - perfect illumination!
But walk through this bridge is nothing special...
Best Feature in City!. One of the Best Places, NOT to be missed, just take a walk and enjoy views of this magnificaent jewel of Europe!
beauty. one of most beautiful and my personal favorite bridge of Budapest.not far away from Parliament,great views from both river side.and at night with illumination-drop dead gorgeous.

A very nice walk to cross from one side to another. It is a nice part of any city walk to have a stroll on this famous bridge. It looks awesome from far but even better if you get close and walk on it. Amazing views are from either side.Right now there are roadworks on the Buda side which makes that part of the walk a bit less pleasant but it takes only a few minutes to find your way down to the Riverside and continue the walk

A beautiful view. .....is to be had of this bridge from so may angles. British visitors who have been to Bristol may have experienced the same thing, although with very different design and setting. By day or by night, this is a landmark, and a place to stand and stare. Do remember, though, that this is a working, public highway!
A great walk. One of Budapests famous bridges it is a great walk to take in both sides of the city as well as the Danube.

THE Bridge of Budapest. The Chain Bridge is by far the nicest brige of Budapest. It's as delightful to cross it as to admire it from one of the hills. I've been crossing it so many times over the years that I don't pay so much attention to the small details, but if you're crossing it for the first time you should reserve time enough to enjoy the architectural details. Why not make a break at the middle of the bridge and watch the river boats passing By under the bridge. However, I think the sight of bridge is best enjoyed from uphill or during the night when its lighted.

Interesting Bridge. Interesting bridge. Though not as big as the Tower Bridge in London. When I was there in October in the afternoon, the bridge was congested with lots of vehicles. This was due to some road works being carried out in the Buda area. Pedestrians could walk on the segregated part on either side of the bridge. Photos taken afar is nicer than on the bridge itself.
One of the great views. We were lucky enough to be in a hotel room with a view of the Chain Bridge. Twenty-four seven, no finer view! Dazzling!

Wonderful Evening Stroll. The picturesque bridge is an enjoyable walk, especially during sunset your first night in Budapest. Walk down the gardens of Buda or ride the funicular to the base. The bridge is well lit and offers several picture worthy vantage points. After crossing the Danube River take a few minutes and walk into the lobby of the Four Seasons Hotel, an art nouveau building restored in 2002.

A kaleidoscope of vistas. Having traveled to many Capital Cities around the world, it is very difficult to pin point my favourite - each one has its own unique charm. Naturally it is hard to see it all at once or to get a concise picture from one area. Standing on the chain bridge, looking down the Danube with Pest on my right and Buda on the left - I couldn't quite make my mind up which city I was looking at. Personally, there were overtones of Istanbul meeting Florence (a strange combination I know). However, with Budapest's rich tapestry of history and influences; this could be quite an accurate synopsis. The bridge itself is really quite beautiful especially on a bright summers day or equally charming of a sultry moon lit evening. The walkway is quite narrow so be aware of people randomly stopping to have their picture taken, collisions could be fatal. Definitely worth a meander across irrespective of which side you go from.

Chain bridge, interesting not spectacular. The Chain bridge is interesting to note its construction and history. However it is not spectacular as say London Bridge. Something to visit for sure on your walk around Budapest.

So pretty!. My trip to Budapest was very last-minute and I hadn't even googled a photo before I arrived. However, I was in awe of this beauty when I did get there and I absolutely loved how prominent it was in the city. I really enjoyed taking a walk across the bridge to see the beautiful landscape of the city and climbing the hill on the Buda (west) side of the river.

Such a Beautiful Bridge!!!. Budapest developed from two Bulgarian military frontier fortresses — Buda and Pest — situated on the two banks of the Danube River. Completed in 1849, the Chain Bridge was the first permanent stone bridge connecting the two, and was the second permanent crossing for the entire length of the river. When it was completed, the Chain Bridge was the world’s second longest suspension bridge. With a span of 1,650m (and approximately eight times longer than the Chain Bridge), the Xihoumen Bridge in China is now the world’s second largest suspension bridge.The Chain Bridge was literally out the front door of my hotel, and I enjoyed its beauty in the early morning, midday, and at night.
Photo Opportunity. You can see along the Danube and also some of the other sights so it is great for photo opportunities

A romantic place full of history. We passed the bridge during the day and at night as well. Under the sun we saw padlocks put on the bridge which was very romantic and saw how detailed the construction and its’ art is. During the night the sight of the bridge just took our breath. The lighting is just perfect and with the Buda Castle behind it we just couldn’t have asked for more. Unfortunately we didn’t like the traffic jams that always seem to occur there. All the horns and stressed people kind of kill the feeling of the place.

Picturesque. This highly traveled bridge links Buda with Pest. The bridge is guarded by 4 mammoth lions. It is very walkable from both sides. If it has recently rained, the south side where Viking River boats park, will have a large area of water at least 2" deep. Pedestrians will have to walk around a pillar onto the busy road. The Parliament side is safer for walking.The bridge photographs nicely during the day from the Buda side and is outstanding at night.
An iconic walk in Budapest. If you visit Budapest you must walk this bridge - quite safe and fantastic views. It doesnt take long and its priceless.

Iconic. Really great to see such an iconic landmark that links Buda and Pest.
It looks really good at night and you can notice lots of padlocks when walking across that lovers have left before throwing the keys into the river.
Stunning at night. What an amazing picture at night! We were really impressed with the beauty and elegant display at night! It looks lovely during the day too

Chain Bridge. Looks better at night when it is illuminated but had a walk across the bridge during the day and noticed all the padlocks on the railings, apparently this is what lovers do then they throw the key into the Danube. Sweet 😍

Iconic. Really enjoyed my stroll along this bridge from the Pest side to Buda side. A must do while in Budapest. I prefer the night view from Pest overlooking Buda, where the Buda Castle and the bridge are beautifully lit up. However the footpath along the bridge is rather narrow, thus if you are a slow walker you'd need to make way for pedestrians behind you. This would also restrict your space when taking pictures. You might have to rush a bit when doing so as you are most likely to block the path.

Chain Bridge. It's the most famous bridge in Budapest and one of the symbols of the city. I fell in love as soon as I met this bridge. I knew the story before which made me feel the bridge from the heart. Hope to see it again in the future
Holds s o much history. We walked across this bridge several times the stone pillars are magnificent saw different things each time we crossed it.

By night and day. You need to walk this during the day and then again at night. Although its only a bridge, destroyed during WW2 it has a certain charm and you have some great view of both Buda and Pest when you walk across. But be warned the wind can whip along the Danude and even on sunny days it can be cool. The Buda end is at present in the midst of construction work so no green and pleasant Clark Adam centre piece. The funicular to the palace, Matthias square and the Fisherman's bastion is found on this end of the bridge. The other end has the Gresham hotel which at night is quite spectacular and well worth a view from the chain bridge. We have walked this both ways during the day and at night as well as taking the tram and it still delights us. Try it. I know it's only a bridge but id has structural history if nothing else

Nice bridge. Elegant suspension bridge, but most impressive when viewed with the palace as the backdrop. Unfortunately, the river cruise companies (Viking primarily) park their mammoth floating busses right in the middle of your photo opportunitues, so you end up visiting repeatedly , hunting their timetable or getting 2nd rate pictures dominated by mega-boats.

A Very Easy, Enjoyable and Quick Walk At Night!. My family and I caught the bus from the Pest Side to the Buda Side. As we were on Castle Hill (I think that's where the area is called), the sun was quickly setting and the bridge became lit. The bridge looked so fantastic that we ditched our plan to take the bus back and ended up walking the bridge. It was a very beautiful walk with great views of Parliament but more importantly, I enjoyed seeing the bridge and the lion statues guarding the bridge close up. There were many great picture opportunities on this beautiful suspension bridge. If you are thinking of skipping this walk due to concerns that it is too physically exerting, reconsider - the walk took no longer than 13 minutes (that's including time to stop to take pictures). To give you a comparison, it felt like it was only 1/5 of the distance of the Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco.
Visit at night!. Such a beautiful sight when visiting in the evening. Very romantic to sit on one of the benches and enjoy the night sky.
brilliant to view. Well worth walking over . excellent views of the city and excellent for photographing - a wonderful piece of engineering
Beauty and the Bridge. This bridge is wonderfull, highly recomended to see. If you walk through u see the lovely Danube and the gorgeous Parliament of Hungary.
Wonderful night view. Wonderful for a walk at night watching the city turn into a million little colorful lights. But watch out the bikers. ;-)
Chain bridge. I'd like to be in this romantic city again! I felt like i was in istanbul. The atmosphere of this city is amazing and the river with this bridge seems very historical and sensual!
Beautiful view at night. Take a river cruise at night and see the bridge at night. another important view to take in while in Budapest.

Landmark worth seeing. The chain bridge takes your from the Buda side to the Pest side of Budapest. Its a great little walk and worth doing while you are there since you'll want to take in both sides. It seems like there is a lot more to do on the Pest side of the Danube, but you have to go over to Buda for a few hours to see St Matthias Church and walk the streets of Buda.

Historic Bridge on the Danube. The view from the Chain Bridge is fantastic at night and also a great photo opportunity. Not a place to miss when in Budapest because of both the history and the views of the Danube.

Great views. One of many bridges in Budapest and one of the best. It's well worth taking a walk over it as the views are wonderful. The views looking down from the Castle district are even better. A must do.
day and night also. Have a look at it from Buda castle, cross it on foot, or by boat under it either during daytime or night

The iconic bridge of Budapest.. Great views of the bridge from the Funicular railway and its paths. The 16 bus goes across it as do every hop on and off buses. Spectacular view as you come out of the tunnel especially if you on top deck and up front. Walk across the bridge and watch the River Cruiser go underneeth it.
nice view. Very famous and touristic but it's still worth a walk on the bridge for the look over the Danube and the Parliament
It's a bridge!!. Actually i found it very disappointing. Nothing special neither in architecture or anything else. We walked it by night. And that was it.
Beautiful!. There are 7 bridges in the city and they are all lit up at night so they are lovely at any time. Beware of the crazy bicyclists though, they whiz past you without any regard.
Déjà vu!. If you've seen Hammersmith or Marlow bridges then it's no surprise. I worked in Hammersmith for decades so my opinion is based on seeing it day in and day out.
Its a bridge!. The view of the bridge and the city from castle hill or from a boat at night time is truly not to be missed. But it is just a bridge at the end of the day!

Walk it!. Take the time to walk the bridge during the day and at night. The views are amazing. Always consider the time of day - where the sun will be - for any outdoor site you will want to take pictures. You will want to time to have the sun behind you.
beautiful vantage point. A really nice experience walking over the bridge and seeing Parliament and Castle Hill. A great photo point.
lovely!. you can see these from any bus tour. they are nice to see and the history behind them is interesting!
Beautiful bridge. Amazing experience to cross this brige and take some pictures of Danubio River, you see on one side Buda, and in the other side Pest, very nice!

One of the most famous bridges in Budapest. Crossed this bridge during my city tour. Also got great views of this bridge from fisherman's bastion. Guide explained the details of the bridge the history etc. Its ok to cross it once or twice.

Beautiful during the day, splendid at night. This bridge is really beautiful and at night with all the lightenings, it was even more beautiful. Looking at it from on top a hill makes it even more nice.
Just a cool old bridge. I saw this bridge during my visit in Oct 2009. A neat old bridge, in and of itself, and for viewing the Danube. I will say there was a lot of traffic around it.

SCENIC LOCATION, HISTORIC STRUCTURE. A significant engineering structure from the 1800's, it is aesthetically pleasing and the views of the Parliament Bldg , Danube River, Elizabeth and Margaret bridges, architectural marvels on both side of the river, and Buda Castle from this bridge are profound. Great pedestrian attraction (although the bridge has traffic).

Beautiful way to enjoy traversing the Danube. This is a functioning bridge with car traffic, but there are wide separated walkways both directions between the Pest side and the Castle District on the Buda side. There are bicycles also using the sidewalk so stay to the right and enjoy the sights and sounds of the Danube. Beautiful Margaret Island and Bridge is clearly seen to the North while Liberty Bridge can be seen to the South. Great views of the Parliament Building and complex are also viewed from here.

Amazing addition to Budapest!. One of the greatest bridges in Budapest! Very impressive! It looks like it is made of chains. Graf Szechnyi gave money to build the bridge, that's why it is has his name. You go thrugh the bridge to funicular to Buda & Roal Palace. it will be beautiful vew to the city in from of you! Will never forget it!

Beautiful bridge centrally located. Construction on west side a little tricky but navigable if you watch where other people are walking. Main bridge for connecting 2 halves of city but we used all 3 during our stay
Not an impressive enginnering feat.. This bridge is not very old and serves really as what it is: a bridge across a river. Don't think this is anything like Charles Bridge in Prague.
Really pretty bridge. Lovely looking bridge, well worth a visit, not as old as thought though. looks amazing at night when all lite up. You get a good view up and down the Danube from this point.

One of the old constructions. Walking across the bridge is good, if you like gazing at waters. Otherwise it is just another bridge. The places around it, you can take the Buda castle from Adam Ter, trek the hill from other side. Joints around are places to visit.

The Reason to Visit Budapest. I have seen this bridge in photos and movies for years and it was my main reason for coming to Budapest. It did not disappoint! It is so beautiful and it was great exercise walking back and forth. Since it is one of the many bridges that connects Buda and Pest, you will probably find yourself on it at some point while visiting the city.
Chain Bridge. Chain bridge connects Buda and Pest. Best to walk though it. You get a great view of Danube ad the bridge from Fisherman bastion or buda castle hill.
Wonderful at night. Pretty impressive during the day but best viewed at night when it's lit up. The view both side are wonderful.

Splendid. Very interesting architecture, it gives character to the river and the city.
you can walk on the bridge, see the lions and both sides of the city.
Stunning at night. Had a nice stroll across this impressive structure and a good place to take some more pictures up and down river.
Stunning at night!. We had a room at Four Seasons, over looking the entire bridge. I felt like a queen each morning and evening looking out on the bridge. Gorgeous!!
a must to go when you are in Budapest. Make sure you check the lion statues in the bridge. There is a famous urban legend behind the facts that they have no tongues! :)

Iconic Budapest landmark. A walk across the Chain Bridge should be included in any visit to Budapest. It bridges Castle Hill (by way of the finicular rail) to Pest and provides great views up and down the river.
Just lovely. Not to be missed day and more so at night, very nicely lit and nice views. Highly recommended to people of all ages. A must see when in Budapest.
Beautiful view from the iconic bridge. Chain bridge is a very popular tourist spot in Budapest, offering a stunning view of the city - especially at night! Great place to take photos!

So amazing to finally see it. . Really cool to see the bridge by night and by day and walk over it as well as travel under it by boat. Very gorgeous bridge and to think it was the first suspension bridge in Europe is also neat.
Stroll across Chain Bridge on a sunny afternoon. Combine a stroll across the Chain Bridge with a stroll along the Danube to visit the Shoes on the Danube memorial to the Jews of Budapest.

Go to the castle for the best views. This bridge is really gorgeous, and well worth walking across. Take in the spectacular views from the top of the castle to really appreciate this bridges prominence.

Interesting but smoggy. Unlike the Charles Bridge in Prague, the Chain Bridge in Budapest is not strictly for pedestrians. So it is noisy and the traffic fumes can make you cough. But it took us where we wanted to go -- up to the castle.

Night walk into town. Lit and busy on summer nights, perfect walk across into town if you are staying on the other side of the river. Walk straight ahead toward St Stephens Basilica to find restaurants, bars and all the action.
Beautiful bridge. Lovely views of the Danube and all the river boats. Good pedestrian access from Pest to Buda or vice versa.
So so. Currently there is road works happening so a lot of digging which takes away from beauty. After seeing Charles Bridge in Prague, Chain Bridge is not that special
Nice lit up too. Took a ferry near this at night was a nice start to see it from both sides. Love Budapest. Walk it or take one of the hop on hop off bus tours overs it.

Absolutely stunning!!!!. This bridge was one of the first of its kind. We enjoyed walking across it several times, it gave beautiful views of both Buda and Pest. Also take a few minutes to take a look at the beautiful lions that flank the beginning of the bridge going from Buda to Pest. I would not recommend driving, and it truly is a short walk. At the end of the bridge is the funicular that will take you up to Buda Castle. There's also access to public transportation everywhere. This is a great place to take photos.
Budapest historic bridte. While visiting Budapest, we stayed close to the chain bridge. Did a self guided tour of bridge, walking the length of it and taking pictures of the bridge and danube river.

A copy of Marlow Bridge and nice to see. This is a lovely bridge which is a copy of Marlow Bridge in the UK. It is having roadworks done at the moment, and is a bit of a nightmare to cross at one end, but it is worth a visit even in this state.

The Chain bridge. Having just come from Prague and experiencing their iconic Charles bridge, I was very much pleasantly surprised to see how majestic looking the Chain bridge is. Both during the daylight hours and especially at night. Seems to me that the Charles bridge gets more attention but I was more captivated by the Chain bridge. They are very different bridges. The Charles in Prague a strictly foot bridge for pedestrians only with people just hanging out and kiosks from one end to the other. At times, you can hardly move. At night, dimly lit but very romantic. The Chain bridge is both a foot bridge for pedestrians as well as a bridge for automobiles. This bridge connects Buda to Pests. At the Buda end of the bridge is the funicular that takes tou up to the Prague castle. I think it is so much grander in part due to the views of the surrounding sights. It teminds me very much of the Brooklyn bridge in New York, only nicer. The Pests side is illuminated with the parliament building being the main focal point. It really is captivating and photographers are in their glory with so many photo ops including the Chain bridge. If you get the chance to visit, do not pass it up.

Budapest Icon!. This world famous bridge is a Budapest icon! Visit both during day and night as it offers totally different atmosphere! You have not been to Budapest if you have not cross this bridge on foot!

Historic Bridge. This is a must see for people who want to get an authentic feel for the area and it's history. The bridges are recommended in leaflets and by locals as a point of interest. You can also walk over the bridges and cross from Buda and Pest linking the various attractions on both sides of the river.

Beautiful Bridge, Day or Night!. This bridge is iconic to Budapest. We were able to view it on the night cruise, as it is romantic and majestic. Then we were able to walk across it the next day, as it was closed to cars and only pediatricians. It has a great vibe to it and is architecturally impressive.
Buda meets Pest. An interesting bridge to cross during the day reading the padlocks along the way. Impressive by night when it's fully illuminated
Stunning part of the view from our window. This bridge formed part of our blues. It connects pest with Buda and is used by thousands daily. Adds to the whole breath taking scenery of Budapest.
Great view.. this bridge has a lot of history. The view is amazing and the construction is unique. I would recommend for anyone to make a visit.
Stunning. It was a sunny day in January when we went cross from Pest to Buda. The view was fantastic and very relaxing to walk around .
Cool Bridge. Easy walk from one side of the Danube to the other. Walk one way on one bridge then cross back on one of the other beautiful bridges. I think this is the prettiest!Beautiful views!
Masterpiece of engineering and architecture. This bridge is a masterpiece of combinations engineering and architecture. Visitors must see it in a short distance and step by step to know how it works.

Beautiful bridge. The bridge itself is beautifully designed. In addition the setting is stupendous as it crosses the Danube at a point where you have amazing vistas of Castle Hill as you cross to the Buda side and views all the way to the gorgeous Parliament on the Pest side. The walk is short and easy either way. Truly a must see when visiting Budapest!

It is a nice walk day or night. This is a nice walk day or night. On the other end you can take the tram elevator to the top of Buda or you can walk up the stairs. (honest not as bad as it limes. looks) The bridge provides great views day or night. I would suggest doing it both t

A Charming Bridge over the Danube. Its a modern world bridge spanning the busling side of Budapest and the quieter Pest side. There is a constant heavy flow of traffic but pedestrians are safe, using the side pathways....but watchout for cyclists. Its silver in colour and seems to be very well maintained, as compared to the other bridges.

AN AMAZINE BRIDGE VIEW. Great place to spend in the evening when the bridge light is on. Gives a beautiful view in the evening you can take a tram which runs on the side of the river giving a great view of the chain bridge.

A nice walk to take.. If the weather is good take a walk on the bridge it is breath taking and refreshing also you can take good snap shots for the dazzling views of the city Buda and the other side pest
Great view. Excellent view of danube and beautifully views. If your on the pest side it's definitely worth the walk across to Castle district
A Must See at Night. This is a stunning view on the Danube, especially at night. Very historic. There are a lot of restaurants and shopping around the bridge. It really is the center of action

Historical and pretty . The chain bridge was the first bridge that attached the previously seperate cities of Buda and Pest. Due to its historical signficance alone it is well worth seeing, however you can't really miss it as you move around Budapest. It is lit up at night and is part of the beautiful sights you can see along the Danube at night.

Nice walk across river. Easy way to access basilica hill. Great views of both sides. On Budapest side we took funicular up the hill- not cheap-1400 florints(maybe 1200) for a two minute ride but a unique experience.
Beautiful view. Beautiful view, loved walking across to see different vistas. Well worth the time, the bridge is not that long.
We Walked Across the Chain Bridge. We walked across the Chain Bridge. It was no different than walking across any other bridge. Very nice walk. Very nice views of the Danube. Very pretty bridge.
don't miss it. this is a must do..fun to go over and a great way to get from one side and then go up the Castle. My kids loved walking across it and there are no vendors selling which is nice too.
Nice walk. It was cool to walk across the bridge over Danube river. It is easy walk just look at all rust on bridge. Having seen river in other cities on trip was a nice thing to do

Beautiful bridge . It was an easy walk across the bridge with our guide who shared some interesting factoids about the bridge , it's construction and history . Well worth the time . We enjoyed it and came back across it on our own as we wanted a second look .
Bridge. Not only important route in the city but also very old bridge. Very beautiful especially at night. You can see it on postcards so it's a must see point during your stay
Lovely Bridge. Lovely Bridge, go see it at night as well as in the daytime - has beautiful views over the castle on the Danube!
Amazing views. Be sure to walk across this bridge and check out the beautiful views of Buda Castle and the roaring city on the Pest side of the Danube.
Fantastic at night. The bridge is amazingly beautiful at night. The lights along the sides of the bridge appear like illuminated pearls. A must see when visiting the country

Nice bridge worth walking or running over.. I went over this bridge at least 5 times, once during the 1/2 marathon and several time walking from Pest to Buda and and back. At night the city lights up and the view is wonderful.
Beautiful. Its imposing by day being the biggest bridge in terms of mass and so beautiful during the night. No entrance or photo fee and inspiring with the cold air of night. Proud Hungarian heritage
a pleasant, easy walk across the Danube. Do add a walk across the Danube into your tour of Buda and Pest. It's an easy walk, and we enjoyed seeing both banks from the bridge.
Budapest Symbolic Architecture. Very beautiful and worth to walk thru the bridge, especially during night time. Have great view over Danube River, Buda Castle and Parliament building.

Stunning to look at in the night. Walked across this bridge during the day, gave great views of the Danube which was beautiful, and it brought us to the Buda Castle area of the city. Of a night time, this lit up the landscape, very beautiful pictures and added to making this city stunning

Love these old bridges!. Europe has some of the most fascinating bridges on earth. This one is no exception. It is made of chain links! They are holding this bridge up! The bridge is unique to the ones in Budapest, and connects the two city parts of the city, Buda and Pest!

Cool bridge. As you pass walk the lions at the beginning of the bridge enjoy the scenery on both sides of the bridge. Make sure you look back once you are half way. Originally built by a Scotsman between 1842 and 1849. It was destroyed by the Nazis during WWII but was soon rebuilt.
Visit at night. Take a walk on the bridge after your dinner and enjoy the view and bridge in the dark with the lights shining. Romantic! You wont regret it.

Beautiful bridge .. Chain Bridge was the first bridge built , linking Buda and Pest . Walking the bridge gives you plenty of opportunities to take photos of the Danube and the stunning Parliament building .

love it.. My travelling partner and I loved walking on this bridge for it provides you with good view of the city especially during sunset. Golden light reflecting the ancient beauty of the city. Many local artists setup tables on the bridge for travellers to view and buy.
beautiful views. came to Budapest for a long weekend break. Chain Bridge is stunning it is a magnificent piece of engineering.
Beautiful bridge. Lovely bridge, looks great at night time too. A great backdrop for photographs, and of course it leads you to Gresham Place, a must see.
Beautiful bridge to visit by walk, day or night. This bridge is easy to visit as it is not very long, only a few hundred meters from the Pest to the Buda sides. Excellent view on the Danube River.

At night lovely. Just idn't live upto expectation. Having been to Prague earlier in the year I thought it would be similiar to their bridges but it's busy lots of traffic the best bit was it was built by a Scot with an English architect both named Clark which is my husbands family name so there may be a distant connection there!

It's a bridge. It's a bridge and a pretty bridge but it won't make or break your holiday.... We used it to cross from Buda into Pest after a day on castle hill and it was a convenient access route.....It's best as part of a picture.....

The link between the two cities.. This beautiful bridge links Buda and Pest together in the central tourist area.
It’s an easy, safe walk across and very lively.
If you can, walk on both sides of the bridge for different perspectives.
A great link between the Buda and Pest sides.. Historic bridge built by William Tierney Clark, an English civil engineer, Another remarkable piece of architecture in this beautiful city.
great bridge. I love bridges but this one at night or day with the lion's ,the structure etc , just wonderful....and spell binding

impressive bridge. The chain bridge is an impressive bridge and not without significance as the main bridge linking Buda with Pest. Unfortunately we did not get to walk it so we have one more reason to return.

Budapest isn't the same without this Majestic Bridge!. Take your time to walk this beautiful bridge take photos and stop at the "balconies" on the sides. They offer great views even at night time the bridge is nice to walk on. also Don't forget the 4 Lions!!!
Absolutely beautiful luminous bridge. This old bridge is beautiful when you see it after dark. The reflection of luminous bridge on river Danube is amazing.
This is Budapest. This is Budapest and i am so happy to be back, and walking close to the chain Bridge-one of my favourite part of this Beautiful City.

Don't miss the 4 lions. This bridge links Pest and Buda. There are some nice views of each side from here. There are 2 beautiful lion statues on each side.
Crossing this bridge over to Buda will get you right to the funicular, the street or stairs that will take you up to Castle Hill.

Impressive. This bridge is nice and it is the main bridge in the city. You must walk on the bridge at least once for a one way trip or a round trip return if you feel like walking. Great view of the river.

Walk across it. We did this in the twilight and it was great. Learn the history of this bridge before you walk it. Go to Terror Haz to set a feel for what happened to this bridge. Then walk across it and think about all you learned.

the most stunning bridge in Budapest. In my oponion, this is the most stunning bridge in Budapest. We really loved the lovely piece we got of the City when we were there last week. It looks beautiful from the river too, but if you take the time to walk across you’ll see what I’m talking about. The bridge was built based on what Széchenyi István imagined and I have to say, he had a really wonderful fantasy. The bridge in the evening lights looks like made of hundreds of stars. And here comes the other thing what makes this masterpiece extremly unique and special. The lions. As the guardians of these stars, made of stone, laying at the bridgeheads. The harmony of the lights and the lions make Budapest oldest and most famous bridge a really complete piece of art. Visit it when your in town!

Walk the Chain Bridge. If you have not walked the Brooklyn Bridge, try the Chain Bridge. It is a fun and short walk, 1/6th the distance of the Brooklyn Bridge and the two bridges have a somewhat similar look. Once across, take the funicular up to the Palace or, if you prefer, walk up to the Palace. Walking across the Brige is worth the effort and you get a good feeling not only of the Bridge itself but of the Danube and the views of Budapest from the "water" or, to be more precise, the Bridge.
CHAIN BRIDGE. It is a nice bridge to walk and cross and see Budapest from both sides of the river.Crossing that bridge you can climb up to the Palace and Bastion, etc.

Engineering marvel. It is great to be able to look at the way things were made before the modern times. There is so much detail that the people paid attention to back in the early 1900's. This bridge is one of those old structures.

Its perfect as part of the city.... Crossed the bridge, as everyone that goes to Budapest does. It isn’t the longest or most spectacular of bridges and as one of our tour party said ‘they have one of these at Marlow (UK)', but as part of the scenery in Budapest – it’s perfect. What could make it even better would be to stop traffic, to repair it – we saw rotting ironwork in many places and to paint it, and sorry to all romantics – stop people putting padlocks on it. There were hundreds and hundreds, and some had really taken risks to put their padlock in the most obscure places.
Crossing it almost every day. Since I worked near, I crossed the bridge almost every day. Reminds me of the good-old days, when these kind of stuff built in Budapest.
Beautiful . The bridge is very beautiful, I recommend to walk there at daylight and also at night, very pretty and long bridge

Chain Bridge Budapest. An architectural Marvel, not to be missed on a Visit to Budapest. One of the Bridges connecting Buda with Pesta; it was severely damaged during World War II but has been fully restored. The Bridge is still operational and you can walk or drive (or be driven) across it.
Iconic bridge with great views. We walked over and back on this bridge. A must do in Budapest. Also fun to do boat tour and pass underneath it.
Best Budapest bridge. Just crossing the road is a bit challenging. The bridge is amazing,and unforgettable at night with the unique Budapest lighting.
One of the first chain bridges of Europe. A must when in Budapest. Stroll over to enjoy the magnificent views of the Danube. An interesting attraction also on its own.
Nothing special. Go near the bridge, have a quick glance, and head to one of the nearby bistros for a bear. Money well spent ;)

Great bridge, right over the Danube,The lions at each end are really great.. Loved the story told that the tunnel at the Buda end of the bridge was to be used to shunt the bridge into when it rained! Great structure with lovely views of the Parliament building.
Good View of the city. Walk across it and then take the funicular up the hill. It's the best way to get up to the castle and you'll be able to get many good photos along the way.
nice bridge. This bridge reminds me of other bridges in the world like in prague, san Francisco,etc.At night it is well lit and looks like one in paris.
Stunning views. Beautiful views up the Danube - even in the rain! Took a leisurely stroll from Buda to Pest. Good stuff!!!

prague. after visiting the castle the walk over the chain bridge is a must. so much history and beautiful views that are just breathtaking on a perfect day. the bridge has an ageless feel and it is like being sent back in time. prague is a beautiful city, with friendly inhabitants and a certain zest for living.
Chain bridge. This bridge links Pest to Buda = end of the bridge there is a funicular which takes you to the top of Buda
Great views. We viewed from a boat trip and walked across,spectacular views but beware,if it's rained alot a huge puddle forms in the middle, I saw many people with wet feet.
Worth waking across to get to the castle. The river is green and extremely pretty so walking across the bridge is very pleasant, the many photo opportunities are worth it alone.
lovely. The bridge is lovely and links the two areas of Buda and Pest. takes you to the castle area and funicular railway.
Walk across the Chain Bridge. You can very easily walk across. Walking across at night will provide you beautiful view of the Matthias church, parliament, and the Buda Castle

Take a Romantic Walk across this Bridge.. When you walk across the chain Bridge, you will find hundreds of locks with lovers names scrolled on them in attempts to immortalized the romantic love that these lovers feel on this bridge.

It's a bridge. Walked back and forth over this seveal times going back and forth between Buda and Pest. And, well, it's a bridge so how exciting is it going to be? Some lovelocks added a little visual interest and it's easier to access the sidewalk than the more traffic-intensive Elizabeth bridge

Historic Bridge across the Danube. You just can't miss seeing this bridge on your visit to Budapest. It is beautifully constructed and visible from anywhere along the river or up on Castle Hill. Stroll across and enjoy your views
Lovely views down the Danube. Beautiful bridge, can be a little busy in the afternoons so try getting to it in the morning. An easy walk over and back.
the Chain Bridge. a beautiful bridge, different from all the other bridges over the Donau; walk on it, drive on it, and enjoy the view!!
Great romantic spot. Took a walk in the evening after a Danube Cruise. It's very romantic and you can see all the main attractions.
Impressive. The bridge that connects the Buda and Pest. It has contributed a lot to Budapest history. It's absolutely aspiring at night.
Magnific bridge. One of The most visited place în Budapest. Offer a spectacular view and has nice architecture. One of The most beautiful Bridge i've seen.
Chain Bridge. Great to see but be careful of the traffic. You can walk across this bridge. At night it is lit up as is the Parliament building and the view is fantastic.

Impressive, stunning at night!. Another impressive sight in Budapest, really comes to life at night, the beauty of the lights does simply take your breath away. The views from the bridge are jaw dropping, well worth the walk across from either side.
Best at night. What a bridge. Gorgeous to stand here at night with all of the lights of Budapest. Nice way to cross the river - easily accessible and spacious.
Great. A great advantage to the bridge to connect Buda part of Budapest with pest, plus the great view it offers to people across the Danube river & it's sides.

Budapest's Famous Bridge. Beautiful bridge that is accessible to both cars and pedestrians. I rode my rented bike across this bridge, stopping along the way to soak in the sights of the beautiful Danube River.
A must see. A must see. We didn't walk across, but did take a lot of pictures. This is a must see in Budapest from either side.
Beautiful. Very beautiful, is very nice see the booth sides Buda and Pest, you can easy walk between the sides.
Lovely Views. Nice walks and views, very pretty at night. When the seagulls are flying at night it is quiet magical.
Brink your camera. Easy to get to, but you do need to be very careful of traffic as you walk on the crosswalks. Beautiful photo stop
Chain Bridge is more stunning at night!! Don't miss a chance to see it!. Walk this beautiful landmark bridge. Great photo opertunities exist of the Danube River from this bridge!
A river crossing if not a spectacular view.. A little disappointing as a viewing venue but a good way to cross over by foot for the funicular and a view back across the river.
What's not to like? Best Bridge in Budapest.... Walk along eyes agog as the mighty Danube rushes below...Perfect views from either side .. and it's FREE!
A wonderful bridge. A wonderful suspension bridge above the River Danube which links the two cities Buda and Pest. A beautiful landmark in the capital city of Hungary.
Nice bridge to walk over. Good for a walk over - see lots of the city and the river. Reminded me of Paris a little bit as river very similar.
Even though it´s pretty, it is just another bridge. Supposedly the 1st suspension bridge in Europe. Reminds me of an older Brooklyn Bridge. Other than that, it's just a bridge

Worth walking both day and night.. I wanted to walk the Chain Bridge after seeing so much of it in the museum and I loved it, both day and night. It's an impressive piece of engineering and looks fabulous from a distance and on it gives good views up and down the Danube. Lovely.
Nice bridge specially at night. Nice to see and to walk over but not spectacular. At night it looks nice with the lights on. Very high.

A diamond tiara by night. From all sides of the bridge and on it, it makes wonderful pictures of the Parliament, Danube, Castle and Margarit Island. Many Budapest brides have their wedding photos taken with the bridge in the background at night when it is lit up like a diamond tiara.

Must See!. This is one of the beautiful bridges that connect the Buda and Pest sides of the city. I highly recommend walking across the bridge for fantastic views and picture-worthy sites. We drove across the bridge at night and walked both sides of it during the day. I highly recommend the walk across the river.

Gotta be seen at night!. The best bridge in Budapest and has to be seen at night from a distance, then, take a taxi across it to see it from another angle. Even better is to walk across and you can see right down the Danube and see the Parliament buildings etc. lit up. Go across to the Pest side and there are a few good bars just as you come off it. Live music most nights and they are pretty banging!
Busy attraction. In the day time not so impressive but has a good ww2 history.A busy traffic bridge , at night is light up very attractive

It moves ever so slightly!. Architecturally interesting bridge over the Danube. We felt it moves a little and with the amount of traffic driving over the vibrating was a little disconcerting! Didn't put us off using it again to return to the Pest side!

A must do, walking across the Chain Bridge. Be prepared for the crowds of people crossing the bridge. Views are restricted from the Bridge because of the way it is constructed but the view from the land is great particularly when the bridge is illuminated at night. Lots of construction on the Buda side so be prepared for a bit of diversion to get to the walk along the water's edge

A nice walk on a good day. Get public transit to the Pest side of the bridge, walk over it to the Buda side, take the funicular up to the top of castle hill then back down and take the 105 bus back to the Pest side. A nice hour - hour and half tour.

Enjoy the view as you walk across the river.. It is a pretty bridge. I thought it would be more like the Charles Bridge (Prague), instead it is a traffic-heavy car bridge with a narrow pedestrian sidewalk on the sides. It is a pretty view of the Danube in the middle, but it isn't a place to hang out. Enjoy the view as you cross the river.
Chain Bridge. Wonderful bridge, well worth the visit. Very impressive. Must have walk over this bridge a dozen time during our stay. Beautiful Christmas lights.

you must walk the Chain Bridge to enjoy the sites and the people. everytime i've accompanied a friend to cross from Pest to Buda or vica versa, they don't want to cross over by bus or transit. Instead, we walk across the Chain Bridge, viewing the sites and sensing the comraderie of other people crossing. these are special moments, i've never seen anyone in a hurry to get across. i regret that i never bring an engraved lock to preserve that experience.
Beautiful bridge. At night this bridge is all lit up and beautiful. Perfect time to walk across it. Picture opportunities.

Great views of the city at night. This is a fun bridge to go to at night. Great views, nice pedestrian and bike trails on the side. Many people just sat on the flat bridge chains looking out over the Danube.
Great Landmark.. Great for photos and amazing architecture. stunning bridge with great views of the city. lights up beautifully of an evening.

nice bridge over the river. there are many bridges above the river connecting buda and pest. this one is one of my favorites. the Gallert hill is located just after it. also the buda castle. u must not miss once u r in the city.
Okay. Yes it's a nice bridge, but I think there's nicer ones along the river to be honest. It's more modern than the others and to me it has less character.

Breathtaking!. The Chain Bridge and the shores of the Danube in Budapest are two of Europe's most beautiful sights. To visit Budapest without visiting the Chain Bridge is to not visit Budapest at all!
Must see. Very photogenic bridge with interesting history. Good to walk across from Buda to Pest. Very pretty lit up at night.
Incredible night lights.... Short walking way between Pest side and Buda side. The lights on the bridge are incredible at night. Interesting to see ships on the Danube river from the bridge.

Amazingly beautiful!. One of many beautiful bridges in Budapest. It's beautiful during the day and even more stunning at night. Take a boat cruise at night, its a great way to see many of the beautiful buildings and bridges illuminated. Our tour guide told us some interesting stories about the bridge. One of them being that when the bridge was built it was said to be perfect until a little boy noticed that the lions have no tongue.It's definitely worth seeing.If time allows its a great idea to cross the bridge however we did not have much time so opted for a dinner cruise and walked by during the day as well.
Engineering marvel. Marvelous engineering at its best. Take your time and walk the entire bridge. Don't forget to take pictures at every step!

well it's a bridge. strolled down to the famous chain bridge, very impressive, reminded me of Hammersmith Bridge in a better setting. Enjoyed the huge market building just before the bridge, great for refreshment, with an general produce down and clothing etc. up.
Anyway, the bridge, take a look but don't pencil in too much time for the experience.

Chain Bridge. One of many beautiful night lit bridges in Budapest, The Chain Bridge was the first permanent stone-bridge connecting Pest and Buda. It is one of the symbolic buildings of Budapest, the most widely known bridge of the Hungarian capital.

Great bridge. Cool to walk over. Very modern considering the age
No space for padlocks
Lovely view of both sides of the city and the river
Great day or night. Pretty bridge to view at day or night. At night with the lights and views of Buda Castle or Hungarian Parliament it is fantastic!
Chain bridge. Great bridge over the Danube , i walked over it ,taking my time to see some great views , looking over to Buda and Pest

Walking across (or cruising under) the Bridge is a great way to experience and photograph Budapest and the Danube. Designed by an Englishman and built by a Scotsman, completed in 1849, walking across the bridge is a great way to experience and photograph Budapest. If you can, do it when it is closed to traffic (generally weekends in the summer), or go under it on one of the river cruises. By walking across it, you can appreciate the scale of the engineering, the mass of the towers and the chains which hold the bridge up. At night the bridge is floodlit, as are many major buildings along the river.
Beautiful bridge . I enjoyed walking across thus bridge during my stay. The views of both sides of the city are stunning from there. It looks even.more beautiful when it is all lit up at night.
Budapest holiday.. Beautiful bridge with a lot of history. It looks lovely when it is lit up at night and is a wonderful walk across the Danube.
one of the several in Budapest. all the bridges are easily accessed by public transport. we drove so managed to cross the all several times. transport is are frequent and inexpensive

Historical bridge lights up at night for people to enjoy. Very romantic!. Beautiful lights cover this bridge at night. Don't miss taking a boat ride on the Danube river at night. For 16 euros each my wife and I enjoyed a romantic cruise. After the cruise go and walk the bridge towards the Castle.

Walk across. Walk across this beautiful bridge to get a great experience. The bride is over the Danube River which separates Buda from Pest. When you get to the Buda side you can take the funicular to the top of Buda and visit the Castle, The Bastion, St. Stephans Cathedral and historic Buda. If you are going the other way the bridge leaves yo in the heart of Pest and near the main street for shopping and restaurants as well as the Parliament and other attractions

Do day and night visits to enjoy its beauty completely. The most visited bridge in Budapest. Do walk during day time and night time with its hundreds of lights , it looks like Pearl Necklace. Go to nearby bridge or hills to get beautiful snaps of night time

The quintessential sight in Budapest. The history, awesome views and those amazing lions make a walk across the Chain Bridge an absolute must when visiting Budapest. An added plus is that the Pest side of the bridge is near a major shopping area as well as one of the most moving Holocaust memorials ever devised (The Shoes) is only a few minutes walk from the foot of the bridge. Do not miss this.

Great view. The chain bridge offering a great experiance. You can walk on it when you are planning to go from pest to buda side, because the wnd of the bridge is righr under the fisherman bastion. Great view at day and night.

The first permanent bridge to connect Bud to Pest.. Walk across the bridge and look at the artistic work involved in the master piece. Completed in 1849 and rebuilt after WW 2 to its original splendor. One must add this Chain Bridge to the sight to see in Budapest.

A great stroll across the Danube. It's worth the effort to walk from the Pest side to the Buda side (or vice-versa) just for the lovely views of the river and the buidings on both sides.The bridge got its' name from the fact that in times past, prisoners were taken in chains across to the Pest side.
Postcard. At night the Parlament shines brightly behind the bridge and there you have one of those famous European postcards. Walk across it both in the day and as it glows at night.

Stunning, especially at night. This is a very attractive bridge and worth a view. It's especially stunning at night. If you can arrange to view it either from the river or from the Buda hillside, it's very strongly recommended. It looks something like the Brooklyn Bridge. (please see picture taken from a boat) on the Danube.
fantastic bridge. great bridge across the danube, worth walking across both sides - also great view of the bridge from the funicular railway at the Buda side of the bridge.
Iconic Bridge. The Chain Bridge is an outstanding structure and the most iconic bridge spanning the Danube, connecting Buda and Pest together. The best views of it are from Gellert Hill.

always crossing . I must cross this bridge at least l twice a day as I journey on the public transport. the bridge is an interesting sight especially the new round about they are constricting at Clark Adam end and the tunnel under the castle. it also leads to the vernicular that takes one to the castle itself
River Danube and Budapest from The Chain Bridge. Visiting this attraction is a great opportunity to get an overview of the River Danube and all of its activities and to see Budapest from both sides.
Beautiful bridge. It is really nice and beautiful bridge. When you are in traffic jam on this bridge you just don't care because it it is simply nice.

Beautiful 19th century lion-guarded bridge. This is one of the most beautiful bridges you will ever see. A wonderful piece of engineering from the 19th century connecting Buda and Pest. It is worth walking on it to salute the lions and enjoy the views.

Historic bridge over the Danube . The original bridge built in the 1840s was of forged wrought iron links, pinned together like a compact bicycle chain. The design was similar to Brunel's famous bridge in Bristol. Ironwork was made in England, and assembled on Site.All bridges over the Danube were destroyed by the Allies during WW2, so the bridges were rebuilt to similar design, but using modern materials such as steel.

Must see and must walk on!. A very iconic bridge that connects Buda and Pest. A must to cross!I even bought myself a pandora charm to represent the Lion's head on the bridge.Great views on both sides. It also takes you close to the Castle Hill Funicular and Km.Zero post. While you're at it, you will want to go up Castle Hill to visit Buda Castle, Fisherman's Bastion and the Trinity Square.

Where's the chains?. Reminds us of the bridges in NY. We looked for the chains but couldn't see any so not sure why it is called this. Lovely lit up at night. Everyone seems to walk this bridge on one side from one side of the Danube across to the other side of the bridge only to return walking on the other side of the bridge back to the other side of the Danube. Many boat cruises on the water under the bridge also all lit up. All the building on both sides of the Danube also lit up. So beautiful. Feels like Christmas everyday.
Hungary in the Spring. Easy walk over the Danube to the Gellert Baths and the cave church. Watch out for the cyclists and skate boarders.

Impressive by Day, Awesome by Night!. This is THE bridge over the Danube connecting Buda & Pest, to my mind, which catches one's imagination both by night & day! The fact that it's 202m span was impressive at the time of its creation, reveals what a feat of engineering it represents for its time! One can't but compare it with Prague's Charles Bridge over the Vltava! This of course has to grapple with both vehicular & pedestrian traffic unlike the purely pedestrian Charles Bridge.Each is romantic & awe inspiring in its own way. The impressive lion sculptures carved in stone greet you with majestic splendor! Truly a sight to behold, be it day or be it night!!
Walk Across. Walking across the Chain Bridge was a great experience! It is such a beautiful bridge and is a part of the exceptional beauty of Budapest!!
worth the walk over the river.. One of several attractive bridges across the Danube in the centre of the city. Take a stroll over it to admire the views of the river & skyline around.
An Icon of Budapest. A beautiful bringe. In need of repair. But fun to walk over day or night. Great views from either side and from the center. A must see.

Iconic bridge . Iconic site in Budapest, plus a must see. However, if you visit this city as a tourist you would need to go on a bit of a weird trip to avoid it.
It's worth reading up on the history online - which I won't recant inaccurately here.
Pleasant Place. The bridge is a real masterpiece with interesting history and great architecture. I highly recommend to have a walk there and take a picture with lions on the Chain Bridge.

Beautiful-day or night !.
