We started the day walking on the Chain Bridge,and finished it on a boat,by night.By day,we admired Duna (the Danube River),made nice pictures,and crossed the bridge for a visit to the castle.We saw a lot of locks,not as many as on the Alexander Bridge in Paris,but,anyway....nice.By night,the river is magic,and this bridge told us a beautiful story !Just go there,and discover it !

A great panoramic view of the city. The Bridge will take you about 15 minutes to cross, but will also give you a panomaric view of the great architecture that abounds in Budapest. You might spot a monument or sculpture that you didn't existed and in that respect, it's a great for you to identity other things for you to visit. Budapest in general is a great city to walk, and this bridge is just another reason to stay on your feet.
Walk the bridge. We visited here both at day and night it was lovely at both but particularly at night when it is lit up.
A must see. The bridge links Budapest and Pest, enjoyed watching the boats going up and down the river,looks lovely at night when it is all lit up
Pleasant walk. A great walk across the bridge, it is very interesting to look at all the love padlocks on the bridge.

A true span of time. The Chain Bridge has a long history beginning with it's completion in 1849. It's truly regal when accented at night. The Hungarian people chose to stamp the Chain Bridge on one side of the new 200 HUF coin (they make a nice souvenir for acquaintances). When I saw photos of the bridge after the bombing in WWll I could not imagine how the citizens of Hungary must have felt at that time. Today, a walk across the Chain Bridge is like walk in the park. This could be a very good stroll for great photos.

A fascinating bridge to see and walk across. We were stopping on the Buda side so we walked across the Chain Bridge every day to get into the main part of the city.
It's a marvelous construction to see and the lions guarding the entrance of the bridge are just stunning.
Historical and amazing views. Definitely worth walking here. Important history and stunning river views. Cost zero. Easy to get over on foot, by bike or by bus.

A definite walk over. The bridge is lite at night and is beautiful. Plan to walk across to see the sights and the boats on the Danube. There is heavy vehicle traffic so it is necessary to go under the bridge to access the other side on the return leg.
Breath taking. Amazing view of the Danube, very romantic, I recommend walking on it for dreams, kisses and fantastic memories!

Chain Bridge. A must see in Budapest. It was an easy reach from our hotel, either on foot or by tram. We walked across it twice to view the bridge itself and the Danube. We walked down from the Bastion to the bridge, a fairly easy walk.
Nice in the evening. This is a gorgeous bridge and is even more spectacular when it is lit up in the evenings. True icon of budapest
Beautiful at Night. Very attractive by night. Walkways on both sides across the Danube. Worth a stop. The luxury hotels are located right at the bridge.

Wonderfull construction. We went over it and under it. Wonderful construction, very similar in style to Tower Bridge on London, but not everybody will appreciate the engineering skill that made this attraction so marvellous to study.
nice bridge!. As part of the walking tour we had to cross the bridge in the hot sun! Be sure to bring your drinking bottle along!

Picturesque. I love walking through a city, getting to see the different views and taking it all in. This was perfect for all of that. I was here with my mother and sister and I'll never forget it. You can see this bridge from a far and it's absolutely magnificent but you must walk it because the view of the Danube is unreal.

Nicely lit up at night. This bridge links the major attractions on both sides of the Danube. British built and destroyed during the Nazi retreat, it has been well restored. Fabulous photo opportunity at night with the bridge, castle and Matthius church all lit up.

Place of Historic Importance and Life. I like this small bridge connects one part of the city to other part , while passing through the river you can see both part . City Centre and other part . Accessible by Tram or Taxi .

Lions and arches are special. This, for us, bordered between a 3 and a 4 on TripAdvisor's rating system, but the guardian lions brought this up a notch for us; the artistry made it that much more special.This bridge is the closest to the attractions of the Museum and surrounding areas. If you decide to walk (our prefererence), this is the route!For history buffs, the lion rests upon the coat-of-arms for Hungary (crown with a wreath of leaves) and the bridge is mostly reconstructed after being blown up by the retreating Germans in 1945. Napoleon would have (and did do upon occasion elsewhere) the same thing.
Must see and walk. One of the most beautiful bridge in the world. So nice to walk from one river bank to the other with nice views on fascinantnih buildings.
Great bridge to walk across for the views. Beautiful views from the bridge and of the bridge from the castle. Walk up to the castle for great views

Great views of the city and Danube. You cannot help seeing this bridge everywhere from the city. So nice at night to see the bridge lit up and walk across it to get pictures of all of the sites. Enjoy!
Very romantic in the night. What a view in the night. A perfect walk along the Danube late in the night and end up at the bridge so so romantic.

A fantastic walk and city orientation. You have not been to Budapest unless you take a walk across this bridge. A must see. Then you meet the city people of all walks of life. from sandals to high heels....

A 'Must' Walk. Something about walking over a bridge from one castle to another that spreads smiles everywhere. A very pretty bridge...especially at night. We were fortunate that it was closed to traffic on a day we were there and spurred on by an adventurous friend and the help of our male counterparts, 5 of us climbed up to get one of the best pictures of pure happiness with the Danube behind us you will ever see!

A Walk Worth Taking. The main bridge connecting Buda and Pest and it is a very nice walk. Excellent views in front and behind you during the day or night. At night the Chain Bridge is especially beautiful as it is fully illuminated and really brings out the beauty and charm of the bridge.
A must see while in Budapest. Wonderful engineering and it's on the way to the Royal Palace. Great views of the Danube were a bonus.
Over rated . Do not go there especially - you will anyways pass by during your stay. You can spend some extra time if you feel like it

This is particularly pretty way to see the city at night. The lights especially on the Parliament are spectacular.. Take your time walking across the bridge and enjoy the scenery and the boats passing below. Very picturesque and worth the walk. Do not walk through the tunnel on the other side. Exhaust fumes are very unpleasant!

Short bridge, Long history!. The chain bridge is basically...a bridge, so you may wonder what's special about it. Well, this is simply the most mythic bridge of Budapest, that you'll probably have to cross to reach the Buda side (especially if you're going to the Castle district). It's not long so you can even cross by foot but there's an amazing legend about it that'll let you figure out yourselves... Key words: "Lion" & "Tongue" ;-)

Famous Budapest Bridge. This is the famous bridge linking Buda and Pest. The walk across bridge connects the two and the walk over is lovely giving great views of each side. The bridge is all lit up at night and gorgeous. Definitely one for the to-do list!
Cross the Danube on foot.. Try visiting this bridge in the evening to take advantage of sights that are illuminated. Learn a bit about the history of its making too!

Beautiful old bridge. The very busy bridge connects Buda to Pest. A walk across the bridge is highly recommended, the views are wonderful. We took the train to Buda and walked the bridge back to Pest.

Great panorama. Walked across the bridge from Intercontinental Hotel to the Rudas Baths on the Buda side of the river ,,Had to stop a few times for photo opportunities as the view on a clear day over the Danube was fantastic ,would recommend a walk over this splendid bridge whilst in Budapest as the panorama from the middle of the bridge is quite extraordinary.

The most beautiful of the Budapest Da pun be bridges. The chain bridge is certainly the most picturesque, with ton of photo opportunities of EVERYTHING in Budapest It least to the funicular and up to even more breathtaking views

Truly Represents this beautiful city. This bridge represents the city. You must walk across this and take in the views and take photos! Great to people watch and this bridge connects you with buddy and pest.

A classic design by a Scottish engineer. As a civil engineer I found the bridge design interesting. Like so many structures around the world, it was designed by a Scottish engineer and built by an English contractor, but we keep these things quiet as most engineers are very modest people. For example did you know the Sydney Opera House was built by an English engineering company. The Danish Architect had the idea but could not put his ideas into physical reality, it took an English engineering company to build it. The chain bridge is not built of chain but I guess that is the best description for a none technical person to understand. It was closed to traffic at the weekend and in my opinion should remain closed at all times to allow people to walk along the middle of the bridge and take in all its engineering features and beauty.

Walk it at night! It's awesome. Seriously, it is far better walking it at night time rather than day time when it is all lit up and you can see the parliament all lit up as well. A spectacular view and good for everyone. Go as a couple, with friends or with your family and take a couple of photos there. It will be a memorable experience I assure you especially if you've never been on a bridge before. Apart from this at the end of the chain bridge just underneath it, is a bar which I highly suggest you visit and can see the whole view of the chain bridge while relaxing on a bench :)
Iconic Budapest Sight. Busy bridge used by locals and tourists alike. One of THE most iconic bridges linking Buda with Pest
Great views. Magnificent views up and down the river from this bridge as well as the buildings on each bank. Great view of the Parliament building from here.
Impressive. Impressive bridge which gets very crowded as it the main route joining the two parts of the city. But when in Buda and Pest it is a must do.

A must see and a must walk!. This is the main bridge over the river joining Buda and Pest.The best view of this bridge is at night when they turn on the lights on the bridge and it is just dusk.While it is a great sight to see you need to walk across the Chain Bridge and see the views from the bridge. It was also a great way for us to get from our hotel to the tram up Castle Hill.

Scenic walk across the river. Walking across the bridge to the Buda side gives a great view of the Danube and the boat traffic. And when you reach the Buda side, the view back to Pest is lovely especially with the parliament building adorning the river edge. And from the Pest side you get a closer view of the Buda side in its entirety. Easy walk. Unusual bridge with huge lions adorning the ends. You can also take a bus across on the bridge but it is not as nice.
Beautiful.... Lots of history runs in the city's monuments. Beautiful view of the river. Myst cross on foot to understand.

crossing the chain bridge. The chain bridge was a sight visible from our room. We walked the bridge to the Buda side and back. There many opportunities to get pictures from both sides on the walk. Pedestrians are competing with bicycle riders on the bridge. The Pest side is mostly flat while the Buda side is hilly if you wish to walk that area.
Amazing history. Spectacular.Great walk across.Well worth meandering and taking in the views of Budapest dsy or night.

It is a Nice Chain Bridge. It is a nice suspension bridge made with chains and has lions at its base. Unfortunately, it was destroyed during WWII and the present bridge is a copy; but its just a bridge!

Oldest bridge in Budapest, and an engineering marvel. Designed by Scotsman, Clark, and built in 1849, this bridge is a wonderful testament to the engineering achievements of the 19th century. Fantastic carved detail- check out the lions on either end and the lions'head on the central span, this is a bridge to really savour. And to think it was blown up in 1945! The reconstruction is amazing!
Just a bridge. Not very ornate, smelly and noisy from diesel tour buses and cars, not the best views, crowded with people. This is a highly overrated bridge.
Wonderful view and history. Stroll across this wonderful piece of history for unparalleled views of the city. Stay on the upriver side for the best view.
Romantic Bridge. A lovely bridge to walk across. A good location for seeing both the Buda and Pest sides of the city while standing above the Danube.

Interesting and differently built bridge. Very unusual bridge. We were given an explanation for it's building, but it would have been better to have more signage on it (multilingual, of course, given Budapest is so cosmopolitan) explaining why the bridge was built as it was, etc.

Most known landmark. One of spots everyone will recognize on your photos.
Budapest must see landmark, and crossing it is an experiance to remember, especially by nights.

The bridge with tongue less lion statues at the base. This bridge can be recognised by the two lions statues at each end. The bridge is the one direct bridge that joins Budapest and Pest though several others also cross the Daube and allow you access.We drove across the bridge, walked on it and sailed under it. In day time it is nothing too remarkable, though does allow for some spectacular views of the major buildings on each of the river and great photos. At night it is lit up prettily just like some of the bridges and does look rather magical. A local waiter advised us to take a good look at the lions to see what was missing........apparently they have no tongues!!, We looked and I think this could be debated, but go look for yourselves, it would be a good gimmick to keep the kids interested
Beautiful. Another beautiful bridge in Budapest. What an amazing job they did reconstructing it after the WWII when it was almost completely destroyed.
A nice walk. I enjoyed walking over the Chain Bridge. It provided a great place to take pictures of the Danube River.
Nice site quick visit. A nice sit to see while in Budapest . Be sure to have the history around the bridge explained to you or else it's just a nice thing to see.
Must see at night. The Széchenyi Chain Bridge is a suspension bridge that spans the Danube River between Buda and Pest, that opened in 1849 after 9 years of building.
Beautiful bridge. One of the great bridges. We where lucky that the bridge was closed for car traffic, so we could walk on the centre of the bridge.
Picturesque. The bridge was out the front door of our hotel, to the right. It is a lovely, picturesque bridge. It's very pretty, lit up at night. It apparently is a big tourist attraction.

Nice little stroll across the historical bridge. I enjoyed walking across the lengthy bridge twice. It has beautiful views of the sea and buildings and it was fun taking pictures of it. Didn't walk here at night which I'm disappointed at as the pictures on here looks beautiful!
Impresive. We walked this bridge a lot of times.got impressed every time. Views are amazing both sides. Just be careful with people on bikes.

A beautiful Hungarian Landmark, especially beautiful at night. A beautiful Landmark, built by a Scottsman, Adam Clark. Guides all tell variations on the story of how proud he was of the bridge. Built between 1842 and 49 under the orders of Count Istvan Szechenyi, it was the first bridge that charged nobility and commoners alike. Two large lions on each side of the bridge Guard the entryways, very majestic. This bridge is especially beautiful at night, from a ship sailing underneath or on foot walking across it. This symbol of Budapest like all of the city's bridges was destroyed by the Nazi's toward the end of the war. It has been rebuilt and is beautiful.
Historical Bridge of Budapest. Many history comes with this bridge. If you don't mind, you can cross the bridge by walking. This is must visit place in Budapest.

A significant piece of history, but.... We crossed the Chain Bridge several time but always on board the #16 bus. And always there was lots of car traffic that discouraged us from walking across. The bridge lacks beauty and has more value as a connector between the Pest and Buda sides of the river.

Beautiful design and pleasant for pedestrian use. Arguable the most famous and picturesque of Budapest's bridges. Well-located for pedestrian crossing of Danube at the northern end of the downtown core and tourist area. Cars and pedestrians are well-separated.
Just a bridge. To be honest, we crossed this during the hop on, hop off bus tour so it was just a bridge. But we then walked over the bridge the following day. This can take some time so beware.

mighty strong great bridge to get across from Buda side to Pest side or vice versa.... historic Chain Bridge in budapest is a symbol of Hungary... strong bridge to get from Buda Castle district to Pest new town....pedestrian lanes on both sides gives you both sides of the danube river...4 lanes of car/tram traffic help gives the Chain bridge its strength and beauty of Budapest..at night.. lights are lit up to give it a good nighttime show.. it is beautiful
Another landmark near our hotel. This was near our hotel and was beautiful to see in daylight and lit up at night. We walked across it to the Buda side of the Danube.
Walk the bridge. Great walk from Pest to Buda to Pest to Buda. And it's free. The bridge was rebuilt after World War II. Easy walk going either way.

Icon joining Buda and pest. Beautiful from all angles. We were moored beside this bridge on the Danube River and crossed it several times. It has a personality and construction that the locals are proud of. Definitely worth taking a look and walking across it.
Great views and great activity for great photos. A beautiful bridge by night and a great way to see both sides of the city as you walk across the Danube River.

Great views from the top of the castle. This is one of the most popular attractions in Budapest, and rightly so, especially at night, in my opinion. For better views (and photos), you must go to the top of the castle (possibly by funicular). Excellent panoramic views of the Danube and the Chain Bridge, including St. Stephen's Basilica, could be had at the top.

Chain bridge. The bridge is the first built to connect Buda and Pest. There are pedestrian walkways on both sides and I would highly recommend taking this route. The bridge also looks stunning when illuminated at night.

Good example of early suspension bridge engineering. Not as old as other bridges in Europe, it is interesting nevertheless as an early example of suspension bridge design before steel cables were used. The name "Chain Bridge" stems from the use of (flat) chain links to take the load. You'll walk right next to them as you walk over the bridge.
Cant miss it!. Beautiful bridge, first to join Buda and Pest and holding a lot of history, easy to walk across and explore Castle Hill on the Pest side
Adventure Budapest. We love chain bridge. Our hotel looks out at this gorgeous architectural marvel. We have made many trip across day a night. Do not miss this landmark.
A walk cross an iconic bridge. This was a short walk despite the pic. It is staggering to just think of the man hours, blood sweat and tears building this bridge

Budapest icon. This is the most iconic sight in Budapest. Probably even more than the castle it leads to. You couldn't miss it if you tried. It's nice to walk across or take the tram across and is very photogenic.
Pretty much every other sight is within walking distance. Visit it, and take loads of pictures.
chain bridge. its a very nice looking bridge. the best way to get the best views is take a cruise down the danube for spectacular view of it

Great Views of both sides. An impressive bridge that has pedestrian walkways on both sides. You have excellent views of sites on both sides of the Danube and can see many of the sight seeing boats pass underneath.
Lovely attraction.... A fun walk if you are in Budapest. Takes you across the Danube and is a lovely piece of engineering. You are able to see the palace on the hill as you take the short walk.

A fantastic piece of engineering. Sadly, slightly past its prime now, but a lovely way to walk across the river none the less. Pedestrians have their own dual walkways, away from the cars, but look out for the cyclists!
A must do bridge. A beautiful bridge over the Danube river that connects Buda to Pest. A nice walk,unfortunately could not do it on foot as temperatures in July were soaring high.

Visit here in the evening. Walk through this bridge to cross from one side to another, the scenery here is amazing! If you have a locker to lock on the bars, and if you are with your boyfriend/girlfriend that would be a lovely memory too! :)

Beautiful walk, beautiful views. Chain Bridge is the iconic bridge that links the Buda and Pest sides of the city. It is flat, and relatively straight forward to traverse, and is a masterpiece in itself. It provides beautiful views of the Danube and city. Tip: Bicycles and segways share the pathways with the many people walking the bridge, so be aware and alert while taking photos.
Lovely. We arrived at noon, the weather was cloudy yet warm, and we had a good view all around. The bridge is situated in the middle of the city bridges just over the palace.
Amazing history . We found out alot on the open top bus tour about the history of this and all the bridges in the city and found it very interesting and both enjoyed the architecture

Lovely bridge. I love bridges! They all are engineering marvels to me. The Chain Bridge is really one of the nicest I've seen. Walk across and take a good look at some of the details. The views of both the Pest and Buda are amazing from the center.
History and nature. One of the impressing sides of Budapest. You may enjoy the beauty of Budapest while passing through a historical bridge

Pleasant Walk. It's definitely a very pleasant walk over the bridge and the views are fantastic. I wouldn't describe it as a "must do" but if you are planning a visit to the Buda side, it is lovely. At night it is lit up for a time and looks spectacular.
Monument to walk upon. This bridge looks beautiful during nighttime when all the lights are lit. You'll get great pictures from the city both side of the river.
chain bridge. This is a must see for any Budapest visitor, made from real chains the bridge is an equisite piece of construction with a lot of history.

The most beautiful Bridge of Budapest. The bridge itself is very beautiful
The views are superb
The air is wonderful
and it is in the center of things to do in Budapest.
A historic bridge on the Danube river. You'd probably go there anyway, but don't expect to see the most beautiful looking bridge of all times. It could use some cleaning.
Sightseeing. Place to see especially when lit up at night. Main bridge between Buda and Pest with the famous tunnel on the Buda side.

Another bridge to cross!. We walked both way and it does not take that long, approx 30 minutes each way. Just have to watch out for segway vehicles!
The bridge is rusty in places but still holds a charm and warmth. Highly recommend a leisurely stroll across. Great views as well.
Great view at bight. Walk across the Danube, enjoy the sites on both the Buda and the Pest sides. Its great during the day and awesome at night.

Beautiful bridge over the Danube. It seems a bit odd to rate a bridge as an attraction, but the Chain Bridge really is beautiful. The banks of Budapest along the Danube offer outstanding architecture, and this bridge fits right in. We crossed the bridge several times via bus, and also saw it from a river cruise.

Beautiful suspension bridge. The Chain Bridge (Szechenyi Lanchid) is a suspension bridge that spans the Danube River.It is an impressive bridge that joins Buda and Pest - the two sides of the city of Budapest. I was surprised to learn that it was an English engineer - William Clark - who designed the bridge. Its various links are made of cast iron.It was first opened in 1849.The length is just over 1,200 feet and it has two lanes for traffic.The longest span is just over 660 feet.The name of Georgios Sinas is inscribed on the base of the foundation on the Buda side. He was a wealthy Greek merchant. At night, when the lights are on - it looks fantastic.The bridge is located close to Intercontinental Hotel where we stayed during our visit to Budapest.

Beautiful! . This bridge is honestly stunning. However, i thought it was more of a walking bridge rather than a heavily traffic kinda bridge. There is plenty of room to walk, but not, i don't know, all over the bridge? I know i sound like a spoiled egocentric pedestrian haha. Anyway, worth a visit!
Beautiful up close and far. No matter how much little time you have, if there is one thing you HAVE to visit when in Budapest, is the Chain bridge.

Beautiful at night. The views of and from this bridge are superb and especially at night. The area where the chain bridge crosses the Danube is where the most stunning views of the city can be seen. The bridge and the area around are lit up at night and it is magical.

Beautiful by day, stunning by night. Definitely take the time to do 2 things - walk across this bridge by day and sail the river by night. Some of Hungary's best buildings are lit up and are truly stunning. The Chain Bridge is beautiful and for those lucky enough to sail during a full moon, your pictures will be stunning.

Budapests First Bridge. Beautiful bridge in idyllic surroundings. The architecture ins truly amazing, we would highly recommend a visit due to it being one of Budapest's landmarks. Designed by an Englishman.

NOT A BRIDGE OVER TROUBLED WATER. We visited the Chain Bridge. This bridge has a story that should be told. It is a suspension bridge that goes over the River Danube between Buda and Pest, the west and east sides of Budapest. It was opened in 1849. When it was built, it was regarded as one of the engineering wonders of the world. The lions on each side are carved in stone. Because of the lions it reminds me of the bridge of lions in St. Augustine, Florida, although that is not a suspension bridge.
Lovely Views. This is worth crossing both day and night, plus seeing from the river on a boat trip. In the evenings, this bridge is lit up and looks lovely.
Amazing structure. A beautiful walk across the Danube. The struts are built like a bicycle chain instead of cables or?? Quite a structure.
Engineering as it should be. A wonderful sight, one of the several main bridges crossing the Danube, each a different style. View from the water and the land.

Great, famous site in Budapest.. Awesome place to see the city. It's not too far to walk across and takes you right to the base of the hill where you can see the castle. It's easy to catch a cab by the bridge as well. Just make sure you talk to the cabbie if he's driving like a maniac.
Is it a tourist attraction. Bridge that connects Buda and Pest.At the end of the bridge are two lions that not have tongue in mouth.

More than a Bridge. Crossed it several times and every single time it makes you feel as it was the first one. By stopping at the middle of it and observing his amazing conjunction between Buda and Pest.

A beautiful Bridge combining "old" and "new"!. A charming bridge reminiscent of the past glory of the city with the "new" part seamlessly adjoining. A delight to look at when lit at night but do walk over it and cross the Danube... the views are stunning.

Make Sure You Walk Across the Chain Bridge. We were staying in Budapest on the Buda side of the Danube. It was an easy walk across the Chain Bridge to Pest. Photograph the lions and enjoy the view. It gives great access to leave lots of attractions and facilitates easy access to Pest shopping malls.

Worth the walk. From castle hill a short way to walk into Pest if you want great pictures take the funicular to the top and shoots your pictures of the bridge from the front of the first car. An experience not to be missed

Is it a tourist attraction. Is it a tourist attraction, well no its a bridge.How many places these days bolster their short list by adding things rhat arnt really an attraction, whats next a main road

LOOKS LIKE MENAI BRIDGE IN WALES. As I crossed from Buda to Pest I for a moment thought I was walking across the Menai Bridge in dear old Wales with the Menai Straits not the Danube below.The bridge was designed if not built by an Englishman maybe he was influenced by seeing the Menai Bridge.This a lovely busy old bridge(not that old )it is particularily lovely lit up at night.

The lions have no tongues. Admire it from all angles, walk across it, it's an amazing feat of engineering and architecture. Rumour has it that the designer of the lions place at each end of the bridge said he would commit suicide of the very bridge he designed if there was a flaw in any of the design. A little boy noticed that there are no tongues in the lions mouth, subsequently he jumped off the bridge! He didn't die though... Happy viewing!

Worth walking . The chain bridge is one of the best and shortest bridges to cross. Worth walking even if you do it both ways, as you get a good view from each side up and down the river. There are cafes at each end if wanted. One of the architects committed suicide as he made the lions without tongues ( really due to depression) but look at the lions as they do look a bit weird without tongues.
great to visit at night and to see the river traffic at any time. Nice walk across the river and very beautiful at night. You can also view the river traffic which is interesting.
Good place to see in Budapest. This bridge is so beautiful. it is worth visited when anybody is in Budapest, hungry.you can have a look for palace on top from this bridge.

A Fun Walk. The chain bridge, one of the older bridges in town, and connecting the Pest side to Castle hill is a fun one to walk across, so if you are adventurous avoid the Hop On Hop Off buses and do it by foot. That way you can stop and take in the beautiful sights along the Danube.

Engineering wonder. This suspension bridge is between Buda & Pest over the Danube river. It is an engineering wonder. There are stone carved lions at the both ends as gaurdians. there are inscriptions on eatch side of the bridge. One sholud walk through this if you are in Budapest
Must see in Budapest.. The first bridge built to link Buda and Pest. Walk across the bridge. Walk along the bridge, get a good view of the city and admire the architecture along the way.

Chain Bridge. The Chain Bridge is an attractive older bridge crossing the Danube connecting the Buda side to the Pest side in the center of Pest not far from Parliament. Here one can take a pleasant stroll over the bridge from Pest to Buda.
Chain Bridge. The Chain Bridge is very beautifull, it looks exactelly as in the pictures. It must be visited if you're in Budapest.

Nice to see driving on it and walking it. The only one in the area.
not a lot to do there, so better see it form the bus driving through and the tunnel before it. but also walking it. it is a small city anyway.
the bus trips normally give you the history behind it, nice to know

Walking on history. We started our visit to the city on a national holiday (St Stephens day) and the bridge was only open to pedestrians. I'm not sure how often this is done but it was a great way to start our vacation by walking across the bridge to the Castle hill district.
Definitely recommend it!

Travel by foot. Good way to get across the river!
If travelling from Buda to Pest, to visit the citadel, it's the best bridge.

Beautiful Bridge. Beautiful bridge across the Danube River. Lots of history and beautiful views both up and down the river. You can walk accross from the Pest side to the Budda side. Looks similar to the NYC Brooklyn Bridge.

TheSzechenyi lanchid. This bridge, one of the best bridges in the world, is there since 1849 and has been the first to join Buda to Best. I suggest to go all over, during the day and in the night when the light are up.
Prettiness on a river. This is a beautiful sight to see. Especially at night, it looks gorgeous!!! Try to get it at night when it is all lit up. The whole river looks scenic against it's glow.

Majestic views of the Danube and of the sites on both sides. Szenchenyi Bridge crosses Danube and leads directly into the heart of Buda. While crossing on foot, there are unobstructed views of the Danube, rolling its mighty waters, and also the majestic sites on both sides: the world-famous view of the Parliament on the Pest side, and the view of the Castle Hill on the Buda side.This bridge is not blocked by street performers or beggars, like some other famous bridges, the only time you might be delayed is when people are trying to take a picture of the view.
1 of many.. all the bridges are great, for different reasons. the structures are amazing and we crossed them all.
Nice looking bridge, especially at night . A real monument for the city. I would recommend a view after sunset since the light arrangements makes it even more impressive.

One of the most beautiful Bridgestone in the world. Must visit and walk the bridge. This is one of the most pictured bridge in Europe together with Karls bridge in Praha. I love the architechture and the beatiful lamps on this bridge. Great walking on the bridge in the evening and overseeing the lights from Budapest by night. This is awesome.

Better at night. Chain Bridge stands out at night when it is all lit up.
Recommend a drink at the Intercontinental Hotel opposite and admire the view of this bridge

Chain link bridge Budapest - worth a walk. The chain bridge is quite old and very famous but not the only one in the world (there is one in Wales going to Beaumauris, isle of Anglesey). It is an easy walk across, take the time to go on each side.

Historic Chain Bridge over the Danube. Walking across Chain Bridge over the Danube with Buda on one side and Pest on the other is very scenic, especially on the beautiful day that we were lucky enough to do it.

Take a walk over to the Castle side. A historic bridge, testament to the period. Less crowded during off peak hours thus more enjoyable. Bridge takes you to the base of the funicular. Will arrive just beneath Buda Castle and food market once hill is ascended.
Nice bridge but not very special. You will probably pass this bridge anyway but I think it is a bit overrated. Nice bridge but definitely not world class.

Week in Budapest. Just a bridge. There may be history but I don't know it. For walking it is a nice bridge to walk on. on the Pest side it ends right at Gresham Palace and a huge statue! FREE to cross.

Walk to the other side. The nicest bridge of all in Budapest, nice to see and nice to walk if the weather allows it, the distance it is walkable and at the end of each side there are places to see. On the Pest side you are facing a park with statues in front of Gresham Palace, and on the Buda side you face the lift to the palace.
Best bridge in Budapest. Perfect and by far most beautifil bride in Budapest.You make know that Budapest actualy have 8 bridges and in my own opinnion this was the best one.

BE CAREFUL!. During the summer, it's clear that plenty of young people enjoy to sit on the green structure of the bridge for a drink. The structure is about 5ft high at its lowest point and I have NO idea how anyone manages to get up onto it. It looked like a fun place to sit until one night my friend tried to launch herself into the structure but fell 5 feet straight onto the concrete. Her coccyx is traumatised and we can't do nearly as much climbing/walking as we did when we got here, and it's really sad. It's tempting to sit up there (and if anyone has an idea then please let me know) but please please be careful as one slip can seriously ruin your holiday.

Perfect for a walk during sunset!. Lovely bridge with nice lion statues, which are very "photogenic". It's the perfect place for a walk during the sunset. There you can enjoy both the Pest and Buda sides, checking the Parliament at the distance and Budapest's Castle in the Buda's Hill.

Lions on the bridge. It's a narrow bridge, two lanes. To us the Lions make the difference in being "just a bridge" to something exceptional. Protecting the crossing from invaders?
It leads from near the Parliament, arguably the most beautiful building of it's kind in the World to the Buda side.

Add this to your list of things to see.. Similar to the bridge in Venice and overlooks the Danube River.
Walk across to old town Pest and see the Parliament building and old ruins.

Beautiful bridge and view of the castle.. One of the main symbols of Hungary It is quite beautiful although busy from passing traffic.
If your really into your bridges you can find the original (much smaller/less interesting) bridge in Windsor, England
Scenic. Beautiful view of the city. Transit takes you over the bridge but it is worth the walk. great to see boats going by and birds on the Danube.
Beautiful Bridge and Views. We took the bridge across to Buda and made a stop at a cafe for a strudel as we were waiting for our cruise across the Danube River and It was really nice.
Grate view!. I like this historical bridge. The view was beautiful by night with all the lights both sides of the river!
Magnificent. The bridge is a must. Walk over during the day and view also at night. Can do this by boat trip down the Danube for 1.5 hrs which is also delightful

My visit. The photographs which I saw came to be real when I was in front of the bridge. The structure and engineering, the surroundings, the Concrete gateway (where as a joke the bridge would have been pulled in during rain) the funicular to go up the castle district and the opposite bank of Danube - super class.

Walk in the night around 8.30ish. If you love photography you will enjoy walking in this bridge during tje night around 8.30ish where the city lights are there. I spend more than an hour crossing this bridge amazed by city lights
Lovely at night. Great lions on this bridge, beaten only by the bronze lions at the Parliament building. We could see this bridge lit from our hotel every night.
A beautiful stroll!. This is a must do and is an iconic symbol of Budapest offering stunning views and photo opportunities of the Danube and nearby attractions!

Stunning Bridge. one of my favorite bridges - if you are lucky enough to be there on a day that they shut down the bridge to motorists, enjoy your day walking across and taking in all of the amazing details. Lots of lion iconography to love.
Nice walk in the evening. A lovely bridge that is a nice stroll after supper. Nicely looked after giving great views across the city. plenty of opportunities for nice photos.

Worth a Trip!. Beautiful bride with great views. At the end of one side, there is a great street where you can get drinks at a bunch of local restaurants and then walk straight up to St. Stephen's Basilica.
Chain Bridge. Very interesting construction and very romantic walk in the evening to or from Buda to Pest. Busy with traffic in daytime.

Underwhelming . Was no better than any other bridge I have ever had the joy of visiting. Perhaps coming from such a rich background of Bridge history I have grown accustomed to bridges of high quality.
However, if one is 'in it for the likes' a stupendous opportunity for Instagram worthy photos will present itself.
Beautiful bridge. Amazing structure linking Buda to Pest. We walked along this almost every day from our hotel the Gellart.

Mesmerizing Wonder !!!!. Beautifully restored historical bridge is a definite must to walk across. A short walk over the River Danube from Pest to Buda and back again.
Picturesque views of the river and historical buildings can been seen from both sides of the bridge. Take a trip back into history while crossing this wonderful chain bridge.
Beautiful sights. Nice bridge over the Danube with a great view of both sides of the city. Most visitors will cross this bridge many times throughout their stay.
A historical bridge. It is historical, but it is just a bridge. Not too long to walk over the river. Our cruise ship anchored near by.
Glorious at night. The bridge is impressive when you first see it, but when it is lit up at night it letterally glows!!

Ugly Duckling. I agree that during the day the bridge although special because of it's history and how it was constructed is a bit boring but a night when the bridge the Danube river and surrounding building all come to life, the bridge goes from an Ugly Duckling to a beautiful swan.
The beautiful bridge connecting Buda and Pest. We enjoyed walking across this bridge. The lions are beautiful. The bridge is also enchanting by night.
It's a bridge. It gets a lot of mentions and it's certainly nicer than many modern bridges, but it's a bridge you can walk over, next to busy traffic !

Stunningly beautiful by night. I used to work near Marlow in Buckinghamshire so was keen to see the masterpiece of the man who designed both The Chain Bridge and the Marlow Bridge across the Thames - Charles Tierney Clark. It's best seen on a boat trip at night. Like so many of the key landmarks it was destroyed in the war only to be rebuilt. You can't really miss it as its part of the landscape.

The Chain Bridge.. I guess that most tourists either visit the chain bridge or travel over it as it is right at the centre of the tourist area and near the castle. We walked over the bridge on our way to the Castle.
Wonderful to Walk Across. The views of the Danube and surrounding city are wonderful while you cross the bridge. The bridge is truly magnificent.

Gorgeous!. This is so beautiful, the setting of course, but the lion sculptures and bridge design is unique and a delight for picture taking. A walk across provides tremendous photo opportunities of the Danube and the cities of Buda and Pest alongside.

A bridge is a bridge. Whether Mr Clark, who designed this bridge, was Scottish or Hungarian, it's still just a bridge and one that was rebuilt after WW2. Why would anyone consider it a tourist attraction? It serves its purpose as a bridge and that's all. Illuminated at night, it is attractive but so are most bridges in the world.
The definitive view over the danube. The most historic bridge but the liberty bridge down river has more character and style than the chain bridge.

City Lights. Commonly known as The Chain Bridge.We were in Bucharest during a National Holiday.During the evening the bridge was closed to traffic and it was thronged with pedestrians walking to and from both sides of the river. It was a great vantage point to view the buildings and bridges which are lit up at night.We also walked the bridge during the day and ventured out of the recognised tourist area. At all times we felt there was no risk to our safety.

A bridge during the day, and a stunning sight at night. I think this is one of the only bride you can "climb" up using the handrails. I'm not sure if this is legal, but there were no signs indicating it was - do so at your own risk. The bridge is okay during the day, but at night it is beautiful. The best views of the bridge are actually on top of the hill on Buda side, and on the boat at night.
Nothing to see. No particular reason to be or see the bridge.I don't think this should be a tourist attraction.Better spend your time in other places you should go.

Magnificent Bridge. The Chain Bridge spans the Danube river happened to be the first to permanently connect the then towns of Buda with Pest.This 123 feet long & 50 feet wide Bridge has just two towers supporting the spans with giant iron chains & this gave the name `Chain`to the Bridge.The beautiful Bridge towers are decorated by the sculptor Janos Marschalko with the Hungarian coat of arms & two imposing lions guard the Bridge on either side.The construction of the Bridge lead to the economical revival of Hungary & to the provincial towns of Buda & Pest to evolve in to fast growing metropolis.This Bridge is illuminated at night which makes it a wonderful sight to see & visit.Also from the Castle Hill it looks like a fairy land!
De-Light-Full bridge. Visit the bridge in the day and then see it again lit up at night well worth it, reminded me of a mini Brooklyn bridge

Must see/walk. We arrived jet lagged etc and first thing we did was walk across this bridge. It is lovely although crowded with touristy stuff. The river is gorgeous and no matter what you do in Prague you always come back to it in a wonderful way. This bridge is so iconic.

Vist in the day time but marvel in the night time. This is a lovely place to stroll around and I enjoyed it in the day time but int he night time it is really spectacular, especially with the historical sites in the background. This is a must see at night if you can.(just across the road from Four seasons hotels- near Sofitel hotel and Intercontinental hotel)

The beautifull bridge over Danube. ...and the oldest also. There is still car trafic over, even if it is narrow. On both pedestrian sides you have to pay atention to the bikes passing. Must be seen from the Danube also to get full picture of it.

Chain Bridge by Night. Perhaps the prettiest of the bridges in Budapest, the Chain Bridge offers fabulous views of the city. One should especially visit it at night when all the buildings and bridges are lit up. The river side is beautiful to sit around near.

Spectacular Old/New Bridge. We saw this bridge in daylight before we left on a Danube River Cruise and again at night from our ship on our first evening aboard. While it is an interesting bridge during the day, it certainly is spectacular at night. The lighting is superb. Later a tour guide gave us the history of the bridge and we were more impressed. Apparently it was severely damage in WWII and then rebuilt. And there are other bridges in Budapest but none that are as attractive and photogenic.

Amazing view in the night!. It's perfect when you walk along the Danube in the night, to go to the Chain Bridge. From there you can see the Parlament all light up and also the Citadel.
It's so beautiful!

Great bridge!. It's one of the biggest landmarks in the city and rightly so. It was destroyed during the war then reconstructed but it's still quite epic and worth a walk along. From it you get a great view of the river and Prominade.

my happy trials in budapest. don't recomend walking alone in evenings, I got robbed by gun point on the bridge, in 2008, the good thing about the visit, buda city, park in pest, and I saw u2 there live in stadium, great show

Beautiful bridge. Spanning over Danube river , this is a magnificient bridge. During the night, it is glowingly glorious and magically lovely. Definitely one of the most beautiful bridges in the world.
a bridge over the dan/a. walk over this bridge it is worth it,on the other side is busy and colourfull a wide range of shopping and all sorts,this is a must.
Don't miss. Much nicer way to get from Pest to Buda. Just a short walk across the bridge which brings you to the foot of Buda Castle.
Enjoy the view. When visiting Budapest - one must walk across as many bridges as possible. Each one is so different and gives you a perspective of life on either side of the Danube.

Impressive. The small details that make this Bridge impressive are really special. On the one part of the Bridge is the Funicular that lifts you to the Buda Castle and President's office and on the other part is the Gresham Palace (Four seasons hotel) just behind of a beautiful square. It takes around 10-15 min to walk it and you won't be disappointed.

Joining Buda and Pest in Budapest via the Chain Bridge. One of the most iconic landmark of Budapest is the Chain Bridge, It is an impressive bridge joining the Buda side and Pest side over the Danube River. I would venture that any tourist visiting Budapest would have crossed this bridge on foot to go from the Pest side to the Buda side several times It is a major thoroughfare in Budapest and from the Pest side one can see the Buda Castle and Royal Palaces, St, Matthias Church, and the Fisherman Bastion. From the Buda side, the impressive Hungarian Parliament building would capture your sight. The Danube traffic under the bridge is fairly busy as well with all kinds of marine vessels and cruise boats criss-crossing the Danube. All you need is the urge to walk to the bridge and cross it . No fees, but you do need a pair of good walking shoes and physical stamina. One of the never to miss attraction while in Budapest.
Nice!. This bridge joins Buda & Pest, travelled through this bridge on Segway, Beautiful view from this bridge. Very near to the marriott apartments that we were staying.

City' symbol, beautiful view. One of Budapest symbols, and most famous bridges. Very recommended to climb the hill and watch it from the Buda side. If you have a chance, watch it at day time and at night.
Bridges are soul of the Budapest!. You have to cross the Chain bridge and Danube by foot. That is how you get to know the city. This is probably one of the most beautiful bridges in the world.
Help Join Buda & Pest!. It's a lovely walk with great views. The only caveat is to be aware of cyclists. We all share the same space so wake up and take it all in over the Danube.

Icon of Budapest. Iconic bridge over the Danube, the people of Budapest are extremely proud of this bridge. It was designed by an Englishman, William Tierney Clark and built by a Scot, Adam Clark (no relation). Take a walk over the bridge from either the Buda or Pest side to appreciate it and the history behind it.

Parades and Walking. We just walked across the bridge a couple of times, but it a magnificent structure and was a good walk. Walking to the Buda and to the Pest side was a lot of fun and while we were walking a parade ended up going past. There were also several restaurants on either side that were well worth going to visit.

amazing. One of the nicest if not the most beautiful one
Very nice way to cross the duna river and have a look on all the details from the bridge

A "MUST SEE" in Budapest!!!!. A romantic walk across the Danube at night is a must for visitors to Budapest!!! A bit crowded at night but the lights and the view of the river are worth the hastle of so many people.

A wonderful bridge which matches its name.. The Chain Bridge is one of the major sights of Budapest linking both sides of the city across the Danube and below the Royal Palace. It was badly damaged during the 2nd world war but has been carefully restored.
Walking tour from Parlament.. For a good view start at bottom of Vaci Street, cross the river and climb to top of the Citadel, this gives good panoramic views of the city.

A beautiful bridge, with wonderful views of the river and the city. This is the bridge linking the major tourist sites on either side of the Danube. Whichever way you cross this bridge you are looking at amazing sights - the castle and Matthias Church on one side, the Parliament and wonderful buildings on the other side. At night the church and everything on either side is lit up; makes for a super evening stroll. Once you are on the bridge everything is within walking distance. I was staying in a hotel just 2 minutes walk from the bridge - and would certainly stay there again, it had to be just the best location in the city.
Delightful Chain Bridge!. Chain Bridge is delightful and spectacular. The lions on each end are worth the visit alone. Prettiest at night, it is a delightful structure to ride, walk or drive across.
Nice. Just adds to the city look. Links between buda and pest. walked over it a few times, great for getting cars over

It Holds Buda to Pest. It's so fun to walk this quiet wonder and admire its design. Look closely into its nooks and crannys and gain a perspective of it that is lost by many.And look for its weaknesses ... like the corroding metal next to the bridge's edges. Look into the eyes of the Lions that guard it. See if you can find a vantage point that others have missed. (You know it hides secrets.)The Danube would not be the same without Chain Bridge.

What can you say about a bridge ... ?!. The bridge is not as tough a walk as you might think and it's pretty safe even for a solo female traveller at night. Monuments and structures like this are always brought to life by knowing a bit about the history of its construction but even without that knowledge, it's an attractive and interesting bridge.

Beautiful Bridge. Budapest is easily one of the most beautiful cities, and probably the best for night photography. This bridge is front and centre of the city line and is done in the most elegant style.
Ancient bridge with a beautiful view on the river. Both banks of the Danube next to Chain bridge are awesome with plenty of cafes and eye-catching buildings

Nice but it's a bridge, come on. It's a nice bridge but not that interesting. There are no places with plaques or information boards so you are on your own in terms of historic info. Gets quite crowded, because cyclists also use the walking area.
Iconic Landmark. We went across this bridge a few times and got to see it even at night when we took a cab up to a spot to take some night shots. It is a very iconic landmark of Budapest.
Perfect panoramic view. Beautiful bridge, has a safe path for pedestrians. Worth visiting at night time to see Budapest's lights.
Trip July 2015. An interesting construction that you can climb all the way up! 1/3 way up has no railing, 1/3 has 1 railing, and last 1/2 up has railing on both side. If no high phobia, go for it!

Very nice bridge that connects the two sides of town. We walked over this bridge many times to the Castle Hill District-there's a great view of the Danube from the bridge. There are many statues and it is very interestingly constructed

Pretty Much Unavoidable. This is one of the main bridges joining the Castle Hill area with central Pest so if you don't end up going across it at least once while you're visiting Budapest you're probably doing it wrong. It's an attractive bridge with great views of the surrounding area and most importantly allows safe passage from one side of the Danube to the other.
Chain Bridge. We stayed at a great hotel on the Buda side of Budapest and as we had family staying on the Pest side we walked this bridge at least 2 times a day. Lovely views of the city along side.

Romanticv Danube between two cities. A beautiful view over the Danube. But be careful. There are gangs of pickpockets there who will come up and snatch a woman's purse and throw it over into the river where their buddies retrieve your belongings.

It is beautiful and built by a Scot.. It is one of the main landmarks in Budapest and a must see. It is also a main traffic artery for traffic going over the Danube unfortunately. There is a round about on both ends and the Buda side is below the Castle and called Clark Square after the builder. Budapest has 7 bridges over the Danube and this is the best of them. The Margret Bridge and the Freedom Bridge are also must sees.

Just like the city: Beautiful!. You don`t have to make a special effort to go there cause sooner or later you`ll be there when you`re acrossing the danube to go to the other side of the city (Buda or Pest depending on which side you are)
Touring budapest. A day out this was one of the places we visited amoung load more.Castle garden margaret island Blue danue a must do cant miss out on this and will fit all budgets

Perfect spot for viewing skyline of Budapest!. Perfect spot for getting a view of all of both sides of the city. Great landmark for a reference while sightseeing throughout the area. We watch fireworks from the bridge for a recent national holiday...spectacular!The best bridge to cross to get to one side or the other...centrally located. Probably the best spot for taking photos of the Danube and aerial shots of both sides of the city.
Great walk around the city.. Bridge views are amazing. And very clean too. It is part of the trip and must do. Also make sure to go up in the hill.
Budapest must-see. This is a bridge that connects Buda with Pest, right near Buda Castle. Looks great during the day and at night, and there is a comfortable pedestrian crossing on both sides.
Drive over history.. A great view..though you need to go late in the evening to enjoy it.. either side of the bridge. Also an interesting historical architectural achievement.
Must see. Chain bridge is a must-see in Budapest. It's view at night worth travelling to Budapest. Walking through the bridge is also pleasant.

Chain Bridge and public transport.. A great old Bridge and one of many that cross over from the Bud to Pest side. Best part of the Bridge are views from the lower observation beck, Also you can combine a trip to the central market which is near by. Its a great place to take one of those bucket list photos. You now the kind I mean. There the "I've been here and done it look." Make sure you buy your ticket before you get on, there a big fine up to $50 Australian dollars for riding the tram without a ticket. The best tickets I found were the 24 hour pass that let you ride on all the public transport options. Budapest has a number of underground lines from fairly modern and bull to the great historical cable car running the length of down town Pest. Trams are every where and then you have buses. Avoid cabs a bit expensive and not necessary in the city center.
Very romantic night view. The bridge and the view from the bridge are fantastic on night time, considering clear weather conditions.

Beautiful . Very nice bridge to visit! You'll have a nice view from the bridge to the other bridges and the Donau River. You'll also get a great view of this bridge from the too of the castle on the Buda side of the city.
Beautiful! . The bridge is amazing! You have tk considere that the background helps sooo much! Defenitely, a must see!

Must-see bridge - and you must WALK over it too!. The buses all drive over this bridge but it looks nothing special until you walk over it. Then you see/hear the musicians, drink in the view from the bridge and appreciate the workmanship that went into it. I was warned about pickpockets, so I held my bag carefully (I don't have pockets!) and it was fine.

Must see if you are in Budapest!. Your guidebook will tell you the specifics and the history of this historic bridge! If you take any of the bus tours of the city, you will be taken here for sure... :)

Bridge between Buda and Pest. This is the main tourist bridge that connects Buda area with Pest. Walking on this bridge and crossing over to the other area is a pleasure. As you walk along, the views are excellent. you have a great of the river on both sides and the ships and boats in the river. The views on the castle side are spectacular and so is vice versa. You will normally find a load of tourists crossing the bridge all the time. You can also get a bus to cross to the other side in case you don't feel like walking.

Just a bridge.. We walked across after hearing so much about this bridge. It looks beautiful at night when the lights are on but during the day it is simply...a bridge. It's beauty may be lost on me. Liberty bridge is better looking!
Stunning. Beautiful iconic bridge, if you can, go up to Buda Castle and look down on the bridge and Danube from there, beautiful view.

Bridge filled with history. Chain Bridge is the first bridge to connect Buda with Pest. It is a beautiful bridge filled with history, and we recommend combining crossing the bridge and visiting Buda Castle.

Beatiful view of the bridge and from it on four sides .Do walk through.. Incredible work of art .should be crossed by foot to appreciate its beauty.
You will notice that the iron work on the left hand side walking from Pest to Buda
just below the lovely railings is corroded in such way that the wholes the size: tip of woman's shoe will let you see the water below.

Walk It.. Here is a bridge that literally ties together the Buda and Pest sides of this capital city. It is worth the walk to see the bridge itself but the views of both sides of the city are just spectacular. Don't just drive across it, enjoy it. If going to the Pest side to the Buda side, stop for a cold beer at the base of Castle Hill.
amazing. we walked back and forth the bridge, stopping and taking pictures at night time. it's beautiful at night because of the lights; so grand and incredible.
Spectacular. Beautiful bridge granting easy walking access to the other side of the river. I loved the history of the bridge .
Amazing sites. Had a bus tour on the hop on hop off buses great way to see all the sights of Budapest Commentary is excellent with great detailed information
Worth two trips. Particularly pretty at night when it is lit up. Worth two trips: one at night for the lights and one by day to see the Danube.

It is just a nice bridge. Me and my partner walked across this bridge and took some great photos of the Danube river and surrounding buildings. It was near the Parliament buildings and there were many tourists however it was just an old bridge with a bit of history to it and we were a bit disappointed.
One of the Bridges, the Chain one. Constructed by Clark, the bridge was very closed to our hotel and we crossed it several times to go and return from the Buda side. Its impressive.

The lions have no tongue. The architect of this bridge that if they found anything wrong he would jump off it and into the Danube. One of the workman said the lions are missing their tongue! The architect agreed and jumped off the middle of the bridge into the Danube. Since the Danube is not very deep he just walked to shore.Enjoy the bridge by day but it is most beautiful by night.
View from the hill. All the bridges are so pretty! Try and go up on the hill to see, especially at night fall when they are lit up

Absolutely beautiful bridge...especially at night. We walked across this bridge several times, as well as crossing over on a trike, and enjoyed it every time. This is a beautiful bridge that really stands out as it spans the Danube. Don't forget to take a selfie from the bridge with Buda Castle in the background.
Most well known bridge on Danube. Certainly the most well known bridge on the Danube and the most photographed. A real piece of art to be visit.
Chain Bridge. It is easy to transverse from Buda to Pest and enjoy great views of the Danube. You must watch for pickpockets as they are rampant here
Most original bridge in Budapest. Beautiful, must see bridge. Again, it is the part of the hop on and off tour will take you there. Nearby Margarita Island is a must see as well.
Romantic. One of the must sees in Budapest. Take a romantic walk on this bridge at night and you won't be disappointed!

Iconic site not to be missed. Beautiful site Day or Night. The Chain Bridge joined Buda and Pest. Great view of the Danude from the bridge. There is a pedestrian pathway on both side of the bridge and road traffic uses the middle.

The First Permanent Bridge of Budapest.. The Chain Bridge also known is Széchenyi Lánchíd, spans the Danube at the base of the Castle Hill. It was constructed in ten years between 1839 and 1849. This bridge is historically significant because it was the first permanent bridge which connected Buda and Pest. Before that temporary wooden bridges were constructed which were dismantled each winter because the snow damaged them. It is a stone bridge guarded with huge lion bridgeheads. There is an interesting anecdote about this. The sculptor Janos Marschalko committed suicide by jumping into the river when he realized that he forgot to give these lions any tongues.

Go for the views. Day or night, walking across this bridge affords beautiful views up and down the Danube. Whilst most aren't going to come to the bridge for the bridge itself, if you are going from Pest to Buda, it's worth taking a moment to appreciate itIt was the first permanent bridge over the Danube, designed by an Englishman and built by a Scotsman. It's apparently modelled on the one in Marlow, Buckinghamshire! The bridge is guarded by two lions famous for having no tongues (an oversight by the sculptor)
Iconic, good place the view the Danube in both directions.. Be sure to walk this bridge both ways at least once. Lovely way to take in the atmosphere of Budapest.
What a beautiful bridge. The chain bridge looks spectacular and the best time to capture this beautiful bridge is from the freedom bridge just a few yards away.

Szechenyi Bridge - A Beautiful Evening View. Beautiful bridge, especially at night when the lights come on and the Sun goes down (whether Winter or Summer)My favourite spot is at a little bar near Sikló (at the bottom of the Funicular Railway)When you walk across the bridge, look for the little padlocks, and if you can, read some of the lovers inscriptionsYou may not know that this bridge is seen as a 'copy' of Hammersmith Bridge in London, and also Marlow Bridge (both were built before the Szechenyi Bridge - by the English Engineer William Tierney Clarke b.1783 - and are likely prototypes for it)
beautiful sight by night. riverside by night is a sight you will remember. this is a beautiful city with a picturesque well decorated and lit riverside.

An engineering marvel.. The bridge is a fantastic sight which is best seen at night when it is lit up. It allows easy access to either the Buda or Pest sides of Budapest, with the Pest side having numerous bars, restaurants and hotels nearby.
Very average. on of the city's landmark that you have to see just because it is one. nothing special about it but the area around it is nice for a walk
Lovely bridge . Lovely bridge connecting Buda and pest, it is a must see if you travel to Budapest and go on a tour bus across this wonderful bridge or even walk along it!

A great bridge. A great bridge deserves to be crossed on foot and we loved doing it twice! The statues of lions protecting the approach were magnificent. I was impressed with the engineering qualities of the bridge.
Got to see at night.. You will see this bridge a lot just in general travelling around but the best views are cruising up the Danube and at night. It and the Parliament all lit up are magical.

Jewel of the Danube . I took a night time cruise of the Danube and marvellous bridge stands out as an absolute jewel. The immaculate forgings and the ironworks of this elegant structure are a treat and speaks volumes for the skills and craftsmanship of its builders. It has to be one of the gems of the world of iconic bridges.

One of the eight bridges over Danube in Budapest. Nothing special if you don't know the history. I would love to look at the construction with some basic information about it. I see it everyday and I don't give enough value for. But for many other people it can mean a lot.

A must see landmark in Budapest. What is so nice in Budapest, you can do the sightseeing on foot. This imposing bridge is the ideal passage from the sights in Pest to the ones in Buda. The chains are enormous!
Bridge. Impressive bridge, easy to get to on the number 2 tram line. Great views of river Danube from it. Lit up at night time.

I always go here when I go to Budapest. Nice. Good views. History, culture and good story attached.
Connects old to older. Loved it. Nice for taking pictures

Very cool. Not only is it an awesome bridge but it provides incredible views! You can spot many of the incredibly beautiful buildings you'll want to visit from the bridge. Visit by day and by night, do a panoramic photo both times. It's gorgeous!

made in times that design and workmanship did matter. The views are great day and night. Picture post ard in every direction.Exceptionally well maintained and a comfortable incline fot the gentle walkers.
A must see at night!!!!. The fact that this old structure is still standing and in full use today, says something about the quality of materials and workmanship used to build it.
Chain Bridge. Bridge is quite lovely. Reminds me of Brookyn Bridge in NYC. You can walk across and take great pictures of Danube areas.
Not special, but ok.. If you want to see it, take a walk from city centre to the other side of the bridge, and than go right, you will have a nice view on the parliament...

Beautiful Bridge. When I planned my travel in Budapest, my research says when you do not see the Chain Bridge it is similar to not being in Budapest! Well, The bridge looked normal from far but as soon as you get closer the beauty gets better every time, I was more amazed when the bridge light went on during sun set. WOW! I had to cross to the other side by walk to experience it. Watch out on Bicycles crossing as you may not hear or see them from the back but other than that, it was awesome!

Walk and take in the view. I hate to perpetuate "must see" spots, but this is a great place to cross the river, and depending on your health and the weather, take a hike up the hill. Good photos opportunities at at every step. Golden sunlight glowed through the neighborhood while I was on the castle and cathedral side, just around a bend in my travels, yielding an unexpected delight. There are lots of places to eat and drink once you're up the hill, besides drink in the views!
interesting history. One of the key links across the river between the two parts of the City. Interesting architecture and brings you to thefoot of the hill that the Castle sits on.

Budapest the bella.. That day I went up to the Buda Hills. At the top of the hill you can see the bridge. It happened that day, it was a flight demonstration. Small airplanes were doing acrobatics and going under the bridge. It was amazing.

The Chain Bridge. The chain bridge is one of the oldest one in Budapest yet still standing there this bridge is the only one use to link Buda with Pest and it's an icon u can't miss when u r there beside the bridge there u find all the floating testierants and the cruise boats that take in unforgettable trip in the grater Danube
The most beautiful bridge in Budapest. In front of the Széchenyi square is this fantastic bridge. It is worth to walk through because you can take great pictures from there. DO NOT MISS IT!
Awesome!. Chain Bridge has a very great history, and i'm personally really happy to see it refurbished after long ages. Having the crown on the top is like cream on the cake!
Amazing at night . Beautifully lit up bridge at night that connects Buda and Pest. Gives nice view a of surrounding buildings which are all lit up (parliament, Castle etc.)

The Chain Link to Historical Buda Hill. The Chain Bridge is the iconic structure that tells you you're in historic Hungary. The link between bustling Pest and the luxurious hotels overlooking the Danube and Castle Hill, overlooking the city, lighting up the night, reminding locals and visitors of Hungary's significance in European history. Walking across the bridge offers the perspective of the old and the new regimes--the Castle, Matyas Templom, and Fisherman's Bastion on the Buda Side and the impressive domed Parliament building constructedright on the river for the millenial celebration in 1896 on the Pest side. Heading to the Castle over the bridge you will likely meet lots of people from around the world, taking photos, riding bicycles, enjoying the view up or down river. On the Buda side, be careful as you head to the stairs up the hillside or the funicular to the Castle level. A very busy traffic circle (or roundabout) is located at the foot of the bridge, and crossing the feeder roads going into the traffic circle requires one's full attention. Only crosswalks provide a way to the other side, and it can be treacherous at certain times of the day. If you choose to ride the funicular up the hill, prepare yourself for a photo/video opportunity as you rise up higher above the bridge and the river, until you get to the top and can get the popular shots of the bridge from above and the nearby Parliament across the river. At times on weekends, the Chain Bridge is closed to vehicular traffic so that folk dancing, music and food festivals can take place there. It is a central feature of the city, and a walk across is a must. If you spend time in the city, take an afternoon one weekday to sit on a bench near the bridge to just watch the people of the city -- tourists, locals, commuters--as they cross the bridge, ride by on the tram, or just play by the river.
Beautiful walk. This bridge is beautiful to walk. We walked this bridge during day. Probably pretty at night as well. Watch out for bicycles.

perfect during day or night time. It's free to see and it is absolutely the best place in Budapest. A boat tour cannot be missed if you would like to take some nice pictures of the bridge. Do not forget to take a walk during night time when the light enhance the beauty of this bridge.

ok but not really woth making a detour to see. much talked about but this landmark was a bit of a let down for us ; we went accross by bus ; it was very crowded traffic-wise in both directions . Gives a good view of the river and both banks but there are nicer points of interest in this beautifull town imho

Take the time to see it by foot. I wasn't really thinking about visiting the bridge until I saw other reviews raving about walking across the bridge. We did, and it definitely was worth it. We ended up crossing or driving near the bridge several times, but the view on foot was the best by far.

Love the lions on each end.. Nice bridge, rebuilt after all bridges in Budapest were bombed during WW II. This bridge begins at Intercontinental Hotel on Pest side to funicular on Buda side. This is an important bridge to the Hungarians and makes for a nice walk across it.

A Great Walk Day and Night. What a wonderful walk during the day watching the boat traffic on the Danube. Then again, at night the lights sure make everything look more magical. Do both if you have the opportunity.

Nice Views of the City. This bridge is pretty average as it goes - the history of it is much more interesting than the actual construction. We visited at night and enjoyed the lit up views of the city.

Lovely Views. On a very hot day we walked down from the Matthias Church to cross to the Pest side as we were boarding a boat for a 7 day Viking River Cruise. The views from the bridge are spectacular especially the beautiful Parliament Building.

Cross over the Danube under your own Power and feel the River flow. So fun to take the 10-20 minute walk across depending on your pace. See the hot forged steel rivets and admire the metal work while you gaze up the hill to buda castle.
All the while while you look down you can see the powerful Danube flow smoothly and happily.

A nice walk across. Do walk across this bridge & appreciate the two parts of Budapest. There are some great photo spots on either side. Hard to imagine the bridge was destroyed during WWII but such an important landmark for the city.

A green glow as soon as the lights come on.. Try and see the bridge as soon as the lights come on the evening. It is a wonderful sight. The lights have a green glow before they turn white. However, we did notice on one night that the lights on the bridge did not come on at all, and we do not know why.

If You Like Bridges .... I like bridges and travelling across them and I enjoyed the views of the Danube and both sides of the city. The pedestrian area is quite separate from vehicular traffic so no issue there. The lions guarding the entrance are cool.

Cross this bridge to get to the palace and hill top art museum and churches. Good walk , sight seeing and photo opportunities abound. Once across the other side you can pay to go up on the hill side tram or you can walk up left or right side of the tunnel is okay. Old and dry young kids best you take the 15 bus up to the top it is around 450' HOF per person or you can use your Budapest card if you buy one which gets you free travel on trams, buses and metro lines all over the city. Museum is a must when you get up , it is large but lots of 15th to 20th century fine art and sculptures.
Would feel much more nicer. Without the high traffic. Maybe this bridge could have much more flow if it was a pedestrian bridge only (like the Karls bridge in prague)
free architecture. fab views of the city a nice walk over the river ,great piece of architecture and part of the Budapest charm and its free!!
great view. quite a good view of both Buda and Pest ...the bridge itself wasn't that spectacular. was a good walk across
Chain Bridge At Night. Advise an evening stroll along the bridge. Parliament, castle area all lit up. And marvel at the bats flying around the buildings. Gorgeous and magical.

Brilliant Bridge. We were in Budapest during 2015 Easter period and on the second day we planned to visit this. We stayed in a hotel in Pest side and it was walking distance from the hotel. Chain Bridge is a marvellous piece of engineering arts. It was built in 1849 and was the first bridge to connect Buda and Pest. We strolled on the bridge, starting from Pest side. On both ends of the bridge, there are two lions as a guard. We could not see their tongue. There is a legend about them not having tongue. The view of river Danube, all the beautiful buildings like Parliament, Castle Hill, Royal Palace and other bridges were all looked very nice and took lots of photos. At the evening, we came back again when it was dark. We went to Royal Palace area and took beautiful illuminated snaps of Chain bridge with the reflection shimmering in the moonlight.

You have to walk across the Chain Bridge. The lions at either end of the Bridge are awesome and very impressive. Although it was very crowded with many many tourists, it is worthwhile to take the walk across the Danube on this famous bridge.

Grand City on the Danube. We were docked right at The Chain Bridge and it just blew our minds, along with all the other lights of Budapest. This was our favorite city on our 15 day Grand European Tour with Viking River Cruises. I can't get back this year's trip abroad, but this town, this bridge, those lights draw me back.
Nice walk over the Danube. Don't cheat yourselvs for a nice walk over the Danube and if you take the bridge you will take the fastes way to the cable carts
You see it all the time. Bridges Buda with Pest. It's unusual and worth stopping to take a picture. Seemed every time we went out we saw the bridge, each time from a different viewpoint.

Beautiful bridge!. We first drove across the bridge on our tour, then ended up walking across it at least twice to see the sights both from the bridge and on the other side. Lots of photo ops. Be sure to see it in the evening with all the lights. Easy walk separate from the cars and can see both directions (not blocked by bridge itself).
