A must do Budapest landmark. Three things you must to do enjoy this monument: 1) Take your picture with the lion and look for his tongue 2) Walk across the bridge and 3) Be there at dusk to watch the lights come on. You'll never forget it.
The best way to enter Buda.. Definitely walk over the chain bridge from Pest to Buda. The view from half way is beautiful...especially if the sun is shining!

Stunning Bridge. This is a beautiful scenic bridge which is really worth visiting whilst you're in Budapest. You get some brilliant views of both Buda and Pest. It takes about fifteen minutes to walk across the Danube. Which gives you a good amount of time to appreciate the lovely views.

A must-see in Budapest. Wonderful, historic, fun to walk across. On the Buda side of the Danube, the bridge put you right at the entrance to the funicular, if you don't feel like climbing the hill. good views up and down the river from the span.
Beautiful bridge . Both watched it and passed it by car. If you drive from Buda site from the road Attila ut you will pass under the cast area through a very beautiful tunnel.
Great view to the river from the bridge.. Nice bridge to cross the Danube on foot. Great view to the river. See the lions on the ends of the bridge. Beautifully lighted in the evening.

No Padlocks. We wanted to add a 'Love Lock' to the Chain Bridge because we were led to believe that is what's done but there were no locks - except for a few small ones in obscure places.However, we don't need a lock on a bridge to show our love so we weren't too bothered.The bridge is stunning. Both Buda and Pest look amazing from the bridge. The bridge is a real spectacle when lit up at night.

Iconic bridge with stunning views of Budapest. Beautiful, scenic bridge that is worth a drive in hot weather or a walk in better weather. Affords great views of Budapest and connects the two parts of the city (Buda and the Castle District). Well worth visiting Gresham Palace at the Buda end.
Stunning bridge. What a beautiful bridge. Art and so great for a scenic stroll for visitors. We loved walking up and down across the amazing Danube.
lokk. Not usually into bridges but enjoyed the views from the Chain Bridge. Great photo opportunities and a nice chance to soak up the atmosphere.
postcard picture place. This bridge is an ideal point to take pictures at night Watch the tourist boats with their pretty lights on the Danube.
tourist bridge. crowded so difficult to stop to admire views and so on; the bridge is beautifully lit at night with the best view from the river.

Stunning!!. The Chain Bridge is best experienced at night as you sail down the Danube. The lights on the bridge as well as many other buildings truly highlight the beautiful vista of Budapest a whole. For the first timer, put a ride down the Danube on your list. Day or night the scenery is sensational, however the evening does have that certain edge.
Bridge connect to cities!!. Incredible bridge if you're into things like this. The engineering is brilliant. Easy walk to get from the Buda to the Pest side or visa-versa.
Walk Across - Great Photos. When visiting, you will definitely want to see both sides of the city, so you might as well walk across. The views are amazing.

Fantastic piece of architecture. This is a fantastic bridge as bridges go. Not the original but we have the Germans and Russians to account for that. It is well worth having a beer next to the river over looking the bridge and watching the fast flowing water flow by.

Beautiful and Best photo backdrop. So many photos of Budapest shows this Bridge and its no surprise.. Its a beautiful backdrop for all your photos... Best place to have a photo taken is from the Castle and you will see the whole view of the river, including the impressive parliament building... It connects the 2 sides of the city.. Best time to see it is evening.. and walk across it for than Romantic feel of Budapest.

Beautiful bridge, lovely walk. Try and walk, it connects nicely to the funicular on the Buda side. Great views when the weather is nice. Watch out for bicycles, skateboards and the like on the sidewalk though.
A great attraction. You must walk over Chain Bridge and see the amazing sights over it . Without this , your Buda-Pest visit will not be complete
Cruise ships dock here. Chain Bridge, beautiful. This is where many of the River Cruise ships dock (Viking). Bridge is beautiful at night.
Great Photography Spot. The bridge is absolutely beautiful and was really fun to walk across. I took my time walking across and took lots of pictures. Be careful of people riding bikes.

Beautiful Nighttime Views. The bridge is well lit at night and is the first thing that I practiced my nighttime photography on. A nice easy ten minute walk across and gives excellent views of both sides of the city.
Must walk and cross over to the other side.. it was the first bridge built to connect the two sides.. beautifully preserved. Closed to heavy traffic and nice to walk across and admire the river

Great view at night. The location of the bridge is what makes it so important linking Bida to appear and an entrance to The castle district. Great views during the day and even better ones at night of everything around.
The lions at each side gives it a royal touch...
Really loved it

Walk it AND look at it. Well of course this is a fun and iconic bridge to walk in Budapest. However, the real value comes when you look at it from another part of town--on either shore or from one of the other bridges. Beautiful in the daytime but especially beautiful when it's lit up at night along with the castle, Parliament Building, etc.

Waltz across the Danube. Chain Bridge across the Danube joins Buda to Pest. You can walk across the bridge and peer into the depths of the 'no longer BLUE Danube. It's amazing to think that these slow flowing murky waters were once a favoured swimming place...not so these days. The bridge itself stands out against the skyline and is one of many bridges serving the community. You do however get a great view of the parliament building on one side, the castle at the top of the hill on the Buda side and upriver, Margaret Island. It's a free activity doesn't take long and you can catch a bus back to the centre of Pest.On the subject of busses...it's probably worth mentioning that if your visit is longer than three days you could consider a weekly ticket on metro bus and tram. Although it doesn't give concessional entry to museums it beats hoofing it if the feet have " had it"!
Must visit place. Walk through this bridge at night to sample the atmosphere. Segways, walkers and bike riders all share the same space while automobiles crawl through the traffic.
Best to visit at night. Beautiful bridge over the Danube. We rode across it after dinner and enjoyed the magnificent views on both sides of the river.
Gorgeous bridge. The bridge is gorgeous and like the other bridges connects the two side with about a 10 min walk. Views of Buda and Pest and the riverboats are just lovely to see.

Beautiful historic bridge especially at night. The chain bridge provides a stunning view of the Danube, the Buda and Pest sides of Budapest. It is especially impressive at night when bridges and edifices on both sides of the Danube at lit.
We were especially impressed when the lights were turned on at dusk.
A Must Cross. The Chain Bridge is Budapest's most beautiful Danube crossing. When you have to cross from Buda to Pest or Pest to Buda check out the Chain Bridge.

Nice at night. Ok, so I would not say this is much of a standout bridge, You have to walk over it anyway to get to the palace and fishermans bastion, its an alright bridge really, at night when it is all lit up it is beautiful to see from along the Danube but thats it

Great Architecture. The Chain Bridge is my favorite bridge in Budapest. It was designed by William Tierney Clark, whose Marlow Bridge in Buckinghamshire is a smaller version of this one. It was constructed by a Scotsman, Adam Clark. The bridge was opened in 1849. It was damaged in the Siege of Budapest in 1944-45. It was rebuilt as it originally looked and reopened in 1949. The bridge is an amazing suspension bridge and the pylons and cables are wonderful to observe.
Nice because of its place in history. This is a bridge, great to walk over to the other side of the Danube and nice to know its place in history as the first link between the two cities.
Just walk it!. Easy on, easy off. Great views of both Buda and Pest. Safe. Separated walk and bike area from vehicles. Stunning pictures from many vantage points. Very enjoyable walk.

First suspension bridge in mainland europe. We walked across the bridge to experience the first suspension bridge in mainland Europe, there are some excellent views and crossing from one side Buda to Pest is an experience I recommend.At its simplest it is after all just a bridge but an iconic one which leads to the tunnel and funicular
first part of our trip to Castle Hill. Impressive and enduring structure linking Buda and Pest. Next time, we will cross it at night when fully lit.

Beautiful view and a piece of history.. Since it is Budapest's first bridge that united Buda with Pest, I thought it would be great to walk across it. I love the gigantic Lions at the beginning of each side and it is wonderful to take a photo of them and the bridge at night. Only thing you need to consider is that is a bit narrow so if you have kids in a stroller it can be a bit daunting with all the tourists walking by....loved it at night!

Beautiful historic bridge. Not much to say about it really! Stunning in the day time and stunning at night too!Great for photos and a great place to take quality images from. A jewel in the wonderful city of Budapest. Enjoy!

Beautiful especially at night. All bridges over Danube in Budapest are really beautiful. Especially at night when they are being lit by the lights. Just take a walk from Buda to Pest (or vise versa) through one of the bridges- it is a good place to have a midnight walk.

Worth seeing especially after 9 p.m.. The bridge is one of the most famous landmarks of Budapest. It is worth to see especially after 9 p.m. when it is lit. It is beautiful from any place you can see it but also the view from the bridge is beautiful. I visited Budapest two years ago and brought a tripod with me just to take pictures of the bridge. But the lock of one of my suitcases was broken by thieves at Helsinki or Budapest airport and I couldn't open the suitcase in which there was the tripod. It made me go again to Budapest to take pictures of this bridge.

Walk across at sunset. I did not find the Chain Bridge to be particularly impressive or attractive, but if you can time it right to walk across during sunset then the view of the Fisherman's Bastion and Matthias Church with the sun setting behind it quite spectacular.
Night walk. Bridges are everywhere, but to walk on the very first bridge in Budapest is something else.Try walking at night , as the lighting is special.

Joining Buda and Pest. The bridge joins Buda and Pest and spans the Danube. It is detailed with beautiful 19th century lights and statues. We walked it from the Pest to the Buda side and then visited Buda Castle which made for a great experience. Enjoy!!!

Chain bridge. Everybody visits bridge. Obviously must see. We visited it couple times . First on tour. Then went back 2nd time on our own where we were able meander. Toura in morning make bridge very very busy. 2nd time we went mid to late afternoon which less crowds. Much better. Good go on tour as you get interesting history.
Iconic Beauty. So we went on an evening cruise under the Chain Bridge, with a glass of Champagne. I must say it was a wonderful experience. Chain bridge looks best from a boat on Danube.
Lots of ways to See. You can cruise under the bridge, walk over the bridge, see it from either side, drive over it... no matter how you view it, it is a beautiful bridge, joining Buda and Pest.
Beautiful Bridge. We loved all the history of each bridge. There are 7 bridges connecting the two cities. ..each should be seen. You can walk across each, which we did.
Enjoy the scenery and be happy. Take a moment from the busy time in Budapest and enjoy the scenery. Fresh wind will make you happy, especially in hot summer.

Impressive Bridge. The most beautiful bridge in Budapest. Recommended to walk the bridge and go from Pest to Buda or v.v.
Also you can have a walk parallel to the bridge and enjoy the view and pass by the Shoes memorial.
It’s the bridge that is ideal for photos and the number one attraction of Budapest.
Iconic and historical. It's a bridge but it's icon of Budapest. Beautiful for picture taking especially at night. We were able to see it by day and night and even once from our boat ride.
Across the danube. Love the lions on this old historic bridge, the views across the city from the bridge are also excellent.

beautiful arcitecture. Chain bridge is defiantly worth a visit and walk across its truly beautiful the views across each side, visit both day and night and walk both ways across to get the most from it, stunning city we had the best city break here,

Amazing. This is a must see when you are in Budapest,it is so much to see around too.
We had a lovely time, and will visit again, there is so much history there.
I must mention you have to see in when the lights come on in the evening, amazing.
icon of Budapest. very nice spot, I remember is as a icon of Budapest, presented on every picture. good to walk along up to Gellert thermal bath
Don't Miss it at Night. Much more romantic and picturesque than the bridges over the Seine. It's lit up at night and is definitely worth a wander over - a lovely, free attraction.
Making your wish come true.. The chain bridge is the place you can take beautiful pictures and make wishes. What you can bring from here is the most beautiful memories of the night sight.

Chain bridge. This is a lovey bridge that crosses the Danube river, it offered very picturesque views of the city of Pest and the Parlament building. My only complaint is it is difficult to get to the pedestrian part of the bridge, just mind the crazy traffic!
Photographers dream by night.. We parked under this beautiful bridge when arriving in Budapest on our Viking cruise. A magnificent site especially by night.

chain bridge. i wondered why it was called the chain bridge then when i saw it lit up at night from a distance the lights look like a gold chain, best way to see bridges in this lovely city is to take an hour long cruise on the danube at night its breathtaking

Fun and free. We walked across chain bridge several times but first on our free walking tour (which was awesome). It's so cool to see all of the architecture up close. Ask your tour guide about the architect who designed the bridge.

So cool!. While I loved the beauty of this bridge, my husband absolutely loved the mechanics and pointing out the impressive details of the structure to our daughter and me. Highly recommend a stroll across.
Outstanding bridge linking the two sides of the Danube.. A marvel to see -- linking Buda with Pest. It crosses the Danube River not far to the markets which are also worth a visit.

Lovely especially at Night. Beautiful Chain Bridge, but is now supported by cables. The Chain Bridge connects the Pest side to the Buda side. You can walk, ride a bike or take the no. 16 blue bus across it.

Take a bottle of wine and enjoy the sunset. This is an interesting bridge to look at, and very popular with the younger set. It seems to be no problem to sit along the bridge and watch the world go by. A great way to spend the afternoon, if you ask me.

Great spot for pictures at night. It's a bridge that looks a lot like the Brooklyn Bridge in NY.This is a great place to go for night pictures. You can see Gellert and Castle Hills as well as the Parliament building from the bridge.

Great way to to and from Buda and Pest. We crossed the Chain Bridge three times. The views of the Danube and the Buda hills are terrific. Walkers have their own paths; however, the constant flow of auto traffic in the center lanes detracts from the experience. It's a good shortcut between Buda and Pest and the funicular up to the hillside is right at the Buda side of the bridge.

Great for night pictures. I visited in December so nightfall came soon to the city. However, from the edge of the river the Chain Bridge makes for some cool night shots. If you're a photographer you'll want to take some profile shots at night and also set your camera up by the tunnel. You'll get some cool night shots.

Beautiful!. All of the bridges in Budapest are beautiful. From this bridge you can take some amazing pictures of the parliament and other beautiful buildings behind you. The architecture of this bridge is outstanding. It is fun to walk across and many people were on bicycles. Beautiful!

A True Landmark.. I was taken in by the beauty of this incredible structure from my hotel room window. After travelling across it several times, I am still in awe of its construction. This is the main bridge joining Buda and Pest along with the other two famous Memorial (Green) Bridge and the Liberation(ty) (White) Bridge.
Nice and clean. The bridge is very beautiful and on mu opinion is the most beautiful in Budapest. From beidfe you can see Buda Caslte, another bridge,...

Interesting piece of bridge building very popular with young people. Fun to cross,view the river and people watch! A great place to view the river activity,the river traffic and very convenient for lots of interesting places to visit

Walk accross a beuatiful bridge. Forget riding across the bridge in a car, bus or tram. Walk with the people of Budapest and you enjoy on the most beautiful bridges in the world. The people of Budapest were smiling on seeing us enjoying their bridge.
Good views. The views from the bridge were absolutely stunning!! Couldn't recommend it enough to visit. You could cycle along there too- for the cyclists
Twinned with Marlow. Lovely looking bridge. It's a bigger version of the bridge over the Thames at Marlow, England. There's a plaque on each bridge saying so. It's also a nice walk over the Danube.

Beautiful. All the bridges are spectacular, but this one is the best. What I liked most about Budapest is the walkability and the bridges gave you a clear gauge of where you were at any time. Very easy to get around.

Walk on History!. We docked on the Danube, almost underneath the Chain Bridge. Not only is this a beautiful bridge, but walking across gives you fantastic views of both Buda and Pest. If you find yourself in Budapest, take a walk on the "oldest bridge" in the city and enjoy the views.
Photo spot. Very beautiful. A must visit spot. The trip to Budapest is not complete unless you visit the chained bridge.

Great way to cross the Danube. Mrs G and I always walk everywhere and the Chain Bridge is the best way to cross the Danube. Been there for 150 years, designed by a Brit, built by a Scot and a bigger version of the bridge over the Thames at Marlow. Ideal place to take photos of either side of rhe river.

Beautiful at night. Whenever I think about my trip to Budapest, I immediately think of how beautiful the Chain Bridge is, while lit up at night. So, wait until it gets dark, walk across the bridge, and enjoy the view. Better yet, it's free!

Nice views from the top. This bridge is easier to walk up due to the less steep metal framework and metal 'hand' railings. If your drunk and bored and want to climb one of the bridges this is probably the best one

One of my favourite bridges ever. Besides Charles' Bridge in Prague, the Chain Bridge is my favourite Bridge ever. It is simply amazing and one can not but wonder how it was possible to build something amazing like that in the period when it was constructed. Love it!
Great Photo spot. I would suggest walking the bridge for the great views. You will also be able to get a nice photo op. The walk isn't that long and the reward is worth it.

Good Walk and Nice View. The bridge is stately and nice to walk on because the pedestrian traffic is separated from the cars. The view from the bridge is wonderful, especially romantic when the sun is setting.
Wonderful views. A lovely bridge to walk across at night or daytime, with lovely views of the bridges in both directions. It gives a nice perspective of castle hill
Bridge with a view. Walk across this bridge, on both sides, and get wonderful photo opportunities of the sites from over the Danube.
one of the best bridges. the bridge to see,one of the best bridges i have seen in my life ,a must for everyone who visits budapest
Beautiful. We walked across this during a sunny morning, and it was fantastic. Definitely worth it, and would recommend also doing a boat trip which takes you along the Danube under the bridges.

Tongues or no tongues?. I had heard about this suspension bridge prior to my visit to Budapest and was looking forward to seeing it. We walked along the bridge over the Danube and were rewarded with beautiful views of the city ; it also looks impressibe from the distance up on Castle Hill as well as on a river cruiser at night when it is lit up . It was the first permanent bridge to be built over the Danube in Budapest and was rebuilt after it was blown up by the Germans during WW2. The two large, majestic stone lions guarding its entry are, according to local legend, without tongues. I did not get close enough to inspect them! It is a busy bridge, carrying heavy city traffic so don' t expect to be able to amble along the centre as on Charles Bridge in Prague. There is, however, a pedestrian walkway at the side. This bridge is a "must see" on any trip to Budapest.
crossing the river. an extremely beautiful bridge reminders of the past glory, and innovative architecture thought out by Count Szecsenyi
Walk it!. This was a great walk from the castle hill back into town. A fun, historic bridge, and great views of both, the city and the river.

Amazing bridge. Looks amazing from every angle. We walked across couple times, drive across, took photos of it from both side the river, from Buda palace, from promenade in front of the Parliament...Top 3 best landmarks in Budapest
Chain Bridge. Absolutely beautiful at night and very walkable. This is one of the most impressive bridges in Budapest and visible from the dome of St. Stephen's and the Fisherman's Bastion
Best Budapest sites. A nice example of old engineering. Impressive size. Nice metal work. Gives great views over the Danube.

A bridge with a lot of historical significance, but still just a bridge!. Chain Bridge is a very long bridge, just like all the other Danube bridges in Budapest, because the Danube is a very wide river at that point. In spite of its historical significance, it doesn't specially stand out from the other bridges and doesn't seem to have any special architectural merit.

Chain Bridge. This bridge is made in a very different way. My husband is an engineer and I had it all explained to me. However it is very touristy with stall holders along the bridge. There are wonderful statues to view too. Worth a look but perhaps choose a not so busy time if you are interested in the actual bridge
Historical bridge. one of the principal bridges linking the Pest side with the Buda sie of Budapest. it is afete of engineerinng that is very much part of this beautiful city

Lovely bridge with great views. We walked across the bridge twice a day as our hotel was very close to it on the quieter side. It's a busy bridge but very safe and great for photos up and down the river as well as photos of the bridge itself. Looks great when lit up at night.

The crossing. Cross from flat Pest to hilly Buda or vice versa over the most famous bridge in Budapest. If your walking towards Buda castle the bridge leads you directly to the railway or the steps to climb.

A nice stroll and a must do for everyone. Fun and beautiful. makes a lovely stroll, there are many places to grab a beverage and enjoy the view! The bridge and area are full of stunning little tidbits of architecture. The doorways, the little gardens and the bridge are full of picturesque vignettes.

Fascinating View. It is one of the most fascinating views you are likely to come across. You will be charmed by the beauty of the place and its surrounding. It connects Buda with Pest to make them Budapest. On one side of the bridge is the Palace and on the other side is the St. Stephen's Basilica. The beautiful building of the Parliament can also be viewed from here.
A favorite. We crossed this beautiful bridge along with hundreds of people when it re-opened after the air race.it get us from one beautiful part of Pest to an even more beautiful part of Buda!!
Great for photography lovers. This bridge is the link between buda and pest it is worth going there at night for amazing photo shooting for all the interesting sightseeing in the city

Pearls on the Danube. Most postcards or photos of Budapest feature this iconic bridge. It connects two beautiful sections of the city so you can spend a day between Buda and Pest. It is like the Chain on your neck only it stretches over the romantic river. On the Buda side you can visit the Castle and take the funicular up there, There is a great cukrasda (confectionary) located just on the Buda side. On the Pest side some great dining is afforded at Spoon (the boat) and Peppers! in the Marriott-both open for lunch or dinner. Great photo ops await.
Iconic. It is nice but its a bridge. So do not expect anything further. Even hte surroundings there is not much one can do. But its a must see when you are in Budapest.
Amazing view. Impressively designed bridge on the Danube, connecting Buda and Pest. The view from the bridge is magnificent and it's a shame to go to Budapest and not walk across it at least once.
Beautiful at night . The bridge is an icon of the city and at night it gets a live. I love the oporto d luis bridge but this one is alslo very beautiful special at night.
A Great Walk. Sometimes the best things to do in a city include just wandering and taking in the majesty of the city. It has such character and a wonderful view of both Buda and Pest.
Impressive. Massive and beautifully designed bridge. My favorite of the Budapest bridges. This is a perfect bridge for a stroll across the river and enjoy the views of Castle Hill.
A very quick look. You don't need to make a special visit here because when you are going to other sites you will pass this. Of course the history behind these structures is interesting.
Very huge and beautiful bridge. It more beautiful when you see this bridge from the top of Buda side, specially during the night when it is has a very beautiful light on it.

Wow!. I have seen the pictures but this historic bridge is so much a part of the history. It first linked Buda, the castle Town and Pest the working part of the city in the late 1860's. Beautiful to see especially at night when illuminated
Great bridge.. This bridge is based on the Marlow bridge in Buckinghamshire, but is much bigger. Fabulous to walk across the Danube to Buda and back to Pest.
Crowded but easy to manage. We arrived at mid day so the location was crowded and hot but this made us slow down and enjoy are time there.
Brilliant evening stroll. We avoided the crowds and walked across by night. Don't try to cross midway, though, it can be dangerous: Budapest drivers don't slow down for pedestrians.
chain bridge. This bridge was constructed by a Scotsman in 1846. His name was Clark Adam and he came from Edinburgh, the bridge is majestic and has withstood the test of time.
talented people. It is amazing that people were able to construct this bridge during such difficult times. It took creative and talented people to be able to achieve this lasting structure.

A walk in the evening. In the summer months, grab an ice tea bottle, walk the bridge from Buda to Pest, take a moment to enjoy the view across the danube, and continue your walk on the Pest side towards the north.
Heaven!

Great for walking, DON'T cycle!. This is a wonderful link (so to speak) between the Buda and Pest sides of the river. Well worth a stroll in both directions, however, be aware that you will not be alone! We did it on a Saturday afternoon and it was very crowded. If you choose to rent a bike to tour the city, you would be better off crossing the Danube on one of the other bridges.
A bridge. You need to know the history of it before visiting but if you take a hop on hop off tour on either the bus or boat then its explained well.
cool. We walked twice there. My honey loved it so much! I was wondering how could it be built so many years ago.

Fortunately the architect knew how to swim in Danube. From Pest to Buda or from Buda to Pest you have to walk on this amazing bridge... Istvan Szachenyi's masterpiece... the lions on both sides are excellent sculptures... Walking on this bridge is an unforgetable experience

chain Bridge Budapest. Good to see the big sister of Marlow bridge.
Best view is at night from a river cruise, when the illuminated bridge, together with the Parliament building is a magical site.

Great for pictures and view of the river. It was a lot of fun for my family to walk over the bridge. One day it was very windy and the kids had to hold on to us - they thought they would be blown off- the next day with no wind, they could not stop looking at the river and took many pictures with different backgrounds.

The community at the base of the bridge is wonderful!. This is a very lovely walk across the river. My wife and I walked across on the way back from Gellert Spa to our hotel near Parliament. We really enjoyed the views looking to the north at sunset. This is a very worthy adventure. We managed to do this walk on a Saturday around 6:00 pm and found a little street market with lots of food vendors, beer sales and even a chorus singing American music. It was quite interesting!
London Bridge of Bollywood. I have been seeing this bridge since I was a kid in Bollywood movies and often referred a London bridge. The best time to see is when its lighted up in the evening.
Beautiful. The river side is truly beautiful & the Chain bridge creates the atmosphere to make Budapest perhaps one of the most beautiful cities in Europe.

THE Bridge. Well there are many bridges in Budapest, this one sits at the heart of it all. Make sure to take your time and walk across it several times it is beautiful at daybreak and is beautiful in the evening. Don't miss it!

Imposing sight. Probably best viewed from the River, the 'Szechenyi Lanchid' is an imposing sight, designed by the English Engineer William Tierney Clark, being the first permanent bridge across the Danube in Hungary, officially opened in 1849 and a fairly monumental task when first built, being regarded as one of then modern world's engineering marvels.A walk across the bridge, the cast iron decorations and the stone lions bring back memories of the Brooklyn Bridge in New York, and the same sense of permanence and stability.Definitely something to see, and walk across, whilst in Budapest

Great views and lovely architecture.. Linking the Buda and Pest sides of the city this iconic monument over the river is a must see - even if only using it as a bridge! Great views along the river in both directions and to either side of the river. Some lovely architectural features.

see this up close. pictures will not do it justice. If you take the hop on hop off bus which has two routes (red and yellow) you will get an eyeful and plenty of opportunity to appreciate the architectural work that went into this structure. Yes, it was destroyed in WW2 but they rebuilt it in 1949 so see it.

Feel the power of the Danube, over the Chain Βridge. The most impressive and the most stepped bridge of Budapest on the Danube. Crossing from Pest to Buda, or vice versa, you will feel the air and the Danube to travel in the green valleys of the first passing beside the most impressive buildings of Budapest.The Chain Bridge (Hungarian: Széchenyi Lanchid) is a suspension bridge that spans the River Danube between Buda and Pest, the western and eastern sides of Budapest, the capital of Hungary. Designed by the English engineer William Tierney Clark, was the first permanent bridge across the Danube in Hungary, and inaugurated in 1849.
WALK THROUGH IT .. Yes it is a long bridge but you should definitely not miss to walk through it . While you walk don't forget to stop and enjoy the view and take pictures.

Beautiful and unique, lovely views. While on a business trip in Budapest, I walked the bridge a few times. It offers lovely views of the city. Beautiful and bold intricately carved lions guard each end. Walking across at night with the lights is romantic. Avoid rush hours as this is used by lots of drivers and exhaust can be smelly.
Beautiful near and far. We thoroughly enjoyed walking this bridge because it provided a beautiful setting for taking pictures of the Danube. It is also a sight to see from a distance.

Beautiful at night!. We wanted to walk across the Chain Bridge at night, and it was a wonderful stroll. There are pedestrian areas, so walking and stopping to enjoy the view are relaxing after a day of touring the pest side of the city.

The main passage from Buda and Pest. A great piece of architecture on the Danube. Not everybody knows the bridge was designed by the English engineer William Tierney Clark in 1839, ;)It's a must to see in Budapest.

Beautiful. I wouldn't go down to the Danube just to see the bridge but at night its too beautiful when its all lit up. The bridge links Buda to Pest and was designed by a French architect; making the design distinctively different to the rest of what one sees in Budapest.
Nice Breeze on a warm dsy. We got some great pictures from the bridge. The was also a nice cool breeze which made it even better.

Iconic bridge. Crossing high above the Danube, the bridge that connects Buda and Pest is guarded by four lines, two on each side. It has pedestrian sidewalks as well as lanes for transport. From the bridge, you can see all the major sights of Budapest and can take in the beautiful panoramic view.

Great bridge to walk over. See the sights of the beautiful Danube from both sides after your walk over the bridge. See the boats bobbing around and the Viking ships docked. Then try an actual cruise down the river well worth it !

Aamazing. Walked along this bridge as part of the free budapest tour - you get a sensational view of the city along the river including the incredible Parliament houses..picture perfect! Watch out for cyclists as you stop to take pictures!!!
Just a bridge. OK. It is famous, but still it is just a bridge. A nice spot for a selfie, but nothing more than that...
Not a bridge too far. Looks fantastic in day or night. Credit to builder for erecting such a substantial structure. Super area around bridge on both sides.

Impressive bridge connecting Buda and Pest. A beautiful bridge connecting Pest with Buda. Enjoyed strolling along it and got great sunset pictures and a different perspective of the city, over the Danube. A must do walk that will bring you to the cable car that goes up to Buda Castle hill. This is a lovely area to walk around on a nice day and also to see Fisherman's Bastion which offers more superb views over the river towards The Pest side
Nice view in evening. Nice view in the evening with all lights on. You can just sit and relax and watch BUdapest from other side

Beautiful, atmospheric. Budapest deserves a good walkabout during the day and by night. The bridges are beautiful and connect the two incredibly beautiful halves of this vibrant, stunning city.The first time we saw this brdige was by night. We had just arrived and being late, decided to traipse around the river side, the main purpose being to see the bridge as it was easy walking distance, and so iconic.Wow!! what a sight! all lit up it looked magical! There are beautiful lion sculptures along it not to mention stunning views of Budapest in all directions. Also, the whole area is fabulous on both sides of the bridge. Love it!!

Nightstroll. An impressive structure. Very well maintained. A memorable slice of history. Admire the workmanship - which can still retain its strength and finish. Worth the stroll over it in order to experience being part of history. Can also access by tram / bus.
close. Close to hotel. Nice walk across, but watch out for bikers. Lots of tourist and a nice breeze over the river.

Spans the Danube. A great walking bridge. We crossed from the Pest side to Buda to go up the tram to castle hill, then crossed the bridge again to get back to Pest. The bridge is very walkable, though you need to look out for bicyclists. Great view of both sides of the city from the bridge.

Wonderful Budapest!. Absolutely wonderful bridge. Get your walking shoes on, and hike across toward the funicular, take it up to the top and enjoy that quintessential view of Budapest. Of course, while you're "up top", enjoy all of the wonderful attractions there, too!

Walking across the bridge. During a walking tour, our tour guide had us walk across the chain bridge. The view is great and an adventure to walk. If you have a problem with heights, you might not want to look down. Heights bother me and I was fine.

Stunning bridge. You will walk across this bridge whether you like it or not!! So, take the time to look at it's stunning construction and the view up to Castle Hill and the tunnel underneath Castle Hill.

Visit at night. Return to the bridge at night, it is a sight to see. There are some awesome pics to be taken. From the Elizabeth bridge you can get the Parliament building, the Chain Bridge and the Castle area in one pic. Walk towards the Parliament then past it along the river. As you approach the bridge you will see many people enjoying the river bank at night. Just before you reach the bridge is another location for a great shot. On the bank under the bridge. Next go above and stand on the triangle of raised pavement in front of the bridge and take pics here. Nice shots of the pillars lit up. Continue to the other side of the bridge returning to the river bank and walk until the Castle area on the hill is directly between the two pillars of the bridge. This will be behind you as you walk. Nice shot there too. It is very beautiful at night. Enjoy.

Must See in Budapest. You can't help seeing the Chain Bridge if you go anywhere near the Danube in Budapest. It is worth stopping to taking pictures of the lions and bridge structure. You can also take pictures of the Buda and Pest sides of the bridge.
A pleasant walk. I was staying in the Sofitel next to the bridge, so in the evening after my business day I had a pleasant stroll over the bridge in both directions.
A nice view of the city!. It's a nice place to take some photos and get Budapest from a very good view! If you want to go from one side to the other, i think its the nicest bridge of the city!
Beautiful. Definitely advise seeing it at night and having a walk across it. I would recommend reading a background on it. Interesting story.

Some May Wonder. How Bridges become such significant tourist attractions is Mystery to me. Budapest has several bridges connecting Buda and Pest. By far Chain Bridge is the most popular. It is closest to the Parliament and the Buda Castle area. A walk accross the Bridge is a joy. First, its a beautiful bridge that connects the two hottest tourist (and for locals too) areas of Budapest. Always busy with tourists talking a walk accross the bridge and water carriers under the bridge. If you are in Budapest, you will have to cross this bridge, unless you make a concerted effort not to do so. It is the main artery that connects the two parts of the city and if I were to guess probably the first bridge. The bridge offers tons of photo ops of both the city landscape and people. I did not cross the Bridge at night but I can bet it would be a whole different experience.

Pretty Place for Photos. The chain bridge is one of the major bridges connecting Buda & Pest. It's flanked with huge lion statues. It's a nice walk across the bridge and is big enough for bikes as well. On the Buda side, there is a trolley just as you exit the bridge that will take you up to castle hill. It's great.
You can't miss it. You can't miss this iconic bridge whilst in Budapest. You are sure to see it multiple times! It links Buda and Pest.
Chain Bridge. We walked across it. It is an old and interesting bridge. There are another 5 parallel to it but this is the most famous. You can see it from everywhere.
A symbol of the city. Our Viking ship was docked next to the Chain Bridge. Its a beautiful span, especially wondrous when lit up at night.
Nice bridge close to funicular. It's bridge! Quite a nice one but it looks best lit up at night with the castle in the background a quick walk across it take you to the funicular which is good

Check the banks too. I took some nice pictures of the bridge and the castle from the banks before walking on the bridge. The view is marvellous from there. Also its photograph from the castle is as fabulous. The stroll on it is a real nice experience. Although some bridges of the kind exist in New York and may be larger but this one has a taste of history and culture.

Fab place. Take a walk on it, see it from the Buda hills, admire it from the Danube cruise or just go over on a hon on hop off bus, the chain bridge is one of the 7-8 magnificent bridges that connect Buda with Pest. All of them are so different and attractive...wow...

It's a bridge..... Was surprised to see this as such a high rated attraction, because, well, it is a bridge! But if you do very little else in Budapest it is well worth a walk across, to see the view. It is especially nice in the evening. The Buda side of it drops you right at the bottom of the funicular up the hill, while the Pest side is very central too.
Chain Bridge joins Buda to Pest. Budapest is a very walkable city. The Chain Bridge is a great way to feel the city as you cross the Danube. We took the funicular to the castle precincts.
Lovely..... I think we had about 50 pictures of the bridge day and night. We have narrowed it down to maybe 15 with different views in front of it, beside it and looking over it!!! Lovely for sure.

First permament bridge. Just go for a walk on the bridge and enjoy the views and admire the construction.
Don't miss the lion statues.
beautiful!. we loved walking across this bridge and taking photos of both sides of the river and of other bridges spanning the river

Most beautiful bridge in Budapest. This bridges is simply beautiful! And at night for me it has one of the most romantic views. To walk the bridge and stop to admire the view is simply a great experience.
Beautiful. We had a lovely walk on the bridge this afternoon and evening. It looks beautiful at night when it is lit up! Great spot for pictures!

Beautiful. Beautiful! . Beautiful. Worth walking across. Beautiful ;)
The best enjoyed early in the morning, before all the tourists wake up or by night. Make sure you bring your camera.
Highly recommended!
Beautiful. Beautiful old bridge. Go see it when it´s dark. It is amazingly beautiful by night when all the lights are on.
Amazing. We stayed for 5 nights looking out at this amazing bridge. Of a night it is light up, Walking over it gives you a an amazing photo shoot of both sides

Lovely views from the bridge.. I always find it delightful to walk across a bridge in a landmark city. The views from the bridge are lovely and the grandeur of Budapest is complemented from all the new angles.
Bridging the Danube.. One of the 5 beautiful bridges over the Danube. Very pretty at night when it is all lit up. The guides will share the funny story around its architect if you ask.

Nice Scenery. This Biridge is the badge of Budapest. Especially in the nights, it's so sensibility to watch this bridge under the lights of it. I was lucky because of my otel location which could watch it all over the night. All day you can watch a good scenery from the top of the Buda Castle with the Chain Bridge.
Gorgeous architecture. What can you say about such an iconic landmark that hasn't already been said. My only advice is see it at night!

What a view, magnificent!!!. Def a place to see!!! This was magnificent, reminded me of the San Francisco bridge, lovely place, even better looking at it from a distance whilst touring on the boat to visit Margaret island perhaps!

Beautiful especially at night!. One of the biggest symbols of Budapest really deserves this reputation. During the day time the bridge may not seem that good but at night the view is fantastic. We were staying in a hotel next to river. Looking at this beautiful view every night was really great feeling. You can also enjoy the bridge by sitting next to the river having some drinks as some locals do.

Romantic view. Every single time I go to Budapest I always cross this bridge to see Buda's beauty. To me the bridges give so much value to the beauty of a city. We booked a hotel to Gellert and the view was towards sunset over Danube and this bridge. It was one of the most romantic moments of my life!

Visit to the Chain Bridge. While on a Viking River Cruise we came into Budapest at night. The reason was obvious to all the spectacular view of all the bridges, castles, parliment buildings and hotels along the Danube create a the illusion of a fantasy land. We traveled the full length of the city and returned back down to dock beneath the beautiful Chain Bridge. It is a wonder all should have the opportunity to view .Then take the short walk from the Pest side to the Buda side and return.

Beautiful lights at night. The bridge is the conduit for passage from Pest to Buda...and back. At the end of the bridge there is a conveyance to take you to the castle. A great way to experience the views f the Danube and the city.
Chain Bridge. This bridge has an interesting history behind it. It is worth hearing the story, even if only from a hop-on-hop-off tour bus.
Iconic. You should visit this in the daytime and then at night. I fell in love with it at night and the city and bridge lights all around it made the feel of the night stroll that much more special
Walk over - dont just take a bus or car!. You must walk this bridge to see the Lions up close and personal! Its a great structure to see up close.

The first permanent bridge over the Danube in Hungary. The first permanent bridge was built in the 1840s, and it caused a huge change in the life of inhabitants of the then two cities of Buda and Pest. It was rebuilt after World War II (when it was destroyed) but its original beauty was restored only decades later. It is narrow amd can be congested during the busy hours. It worth viewing from the Danube bank and from the Castle Hill too. Illuminated at night.

Attractive bridge. Nice views from it along the Danube. You cross t when you go to the castle area. Seen better bridges but still it is a nice place to see. Walk way along the side of it with heavy traffic crossing it. Leads to Clark Adam square which is really just a roundabout with pretty flowers growing on it. It leads to the funicular which takes you up to the top . Long queues so we walked up. Not a bad walk. Scenic views along the walk.

Beautiful, really scenic and a lovely walk across the river. A really photogenic landmark, the whole city is beautiful and this is one of the reasons why, it's worth walking up to the bridge a bit farther up from this and seeing it from afar too.

Such an interesting story as to the engineer and builder!. This is such an important landmark in the history of the city(ies) coming together. Hadn't realised that there was an Anglo-Scottish connection that is so strong they named the square on the Buda side in honour of one of them. Please don't climb upon it, as some tourists were doing when we visited. She's far too noble for that sort of "fan" treatment. Just walk across it several times and reflect on how long it has been standing relatively undisturbed.
Chain Bridge Budapest. Much like any other big bridge. There are lots of them over the Danube. Doesn't compare to the Charles Bridge in Prague
History, history, history.. Such a beautiful area to visit, so much history from bridges to buildings. Awesome and so easy to get sound.
Nice to see at night. Enjoyable to walk across with good views up and down the Danube but watch out for cyclists. Its best viewed at night when its all lit up with the Buda Castle in the background.
Magnificent at night. The icon of budapestMagnificent, recognizable and stunning especially at night when it is lighted up

Who Would Have Thought a Bridge Could be a Major Attraction?. This is a bridge, while pretty during the day, is stunning at night. We were on a river cruise, docked on the Pest side of the Danube, and I could not stop admiring it.

Beautiful by Night.. Our cruise ship was docked very close by the Chain Bridge. During lunch on the deck we could wave to all the people who were walking across the bridge and stopping to look over the side at us having lunch. There are lots of people who walk or ride a bicycle over this bridge as it leads up to the hill beneath Buda Castle. It is a great way to view the traffic on the river. At night when the whole city is lit up by gas lights this bridge is very charming.

budapest famous point. Most famous point in Budapest. you can walk across the bridge by foot.You can have nice views from here also.If you get time, visit the bridge during night also.Its easily accesible by bus 16 and 16a from Deak square or from buda side.

Typical Budapest. We crossed this famous bridge several times because it was next to our hotel. It was nice that it could be trespassed on foot. It was rather windy but offered a feeling of freedom crossing it :-)

A masterpiece histporical bridge. The view of the bridge is one of most characteristic pictures of Budapest. (Not by chance, it is beautiful, day and night!) It was destroyed in the WW II, and rebuilt identically to the XIX-th century one.

Istanbul flashback. This is one of the most scenic bridges in Europe, especially with Castle Hill on one side and the city on the other. I walked the length of it several times, as it was so stunning to soak up the scenery and strong breezes. Reminds me of being in Istanbul.

Budapest icon. Most famous bridge in Budapest. We crossed by foot on a windy day. From here you can spot some of the most iconic points of the city - the parlament,the Gresham Hotel and the fishermans bation. It has been the setting of movies.

Mesmerizing. Such a beautiful old Bridge over the Danube, it is look so elegant.It looks rather narrow with only two lanes, but might that is why so beautiful.I do prefer it in the evening when the lights are on, actually the whole city in the night time is breathtaking. Well worth to just walk over day and night time, you will see different faces of this lovely city.Also so many things to do close by.

Beautiful. This is a beautiful bridge connecting Buda and Pest. We had a view of it from our hotel room and it was stunning at night. We walked over it numerous times and it was especially lovely at night.
Must see in the day. Must see at night. Lovely area to take a stroll. On route to castle. Great choice of bars diners on hotels side. It's the landmark bridge.

Bridge where people stand and look at the view. Beautiful bridge which offers a presumably stunning view of the Danube, I can imagine people proposing marriage on it. I hate walking over bridges in a slightly phobic way so my problem with the chain bridge was the amount of people hanging about cuddling each other and taking pictures. If you like bridges for standing on then do visit, if you like to get over as quickly as can be then use one of the less popular ones.
Favorite Bridge. This is a lovely bridge with a nice walkway across on your way to the Citadel. Enjoy the breeze off the Danube and the wonderful view.
bridge. stacked in history fantastic design well worth the visit and central to visit both sides of Budapest

back again. We visited Budapest as a family and loved it! We walked the chain bridge which is a beautiful way to see the river and city. part of my family was back again this year and once again made this stop!
Historic, beautiful bridge. Chain bridge - first bridge to connect Buda & Pest - built1849 (destroyed 1945 & re-built 1949) - possible to walk across for grand view of Danube and Budapest.
impressive but a bridge. Yeah walk across it, take some token photos, but lets remember, its a bridge! A nice one, but a bridge never the less

Pretty bridge. When all is said and done, it's just a bridge, but a pretty one. Maybe not one of the most notable in the world, but it is on the to-do list for Budapest. It's also an easy walk to get from the Pest (city center) side to the Buda (castle) side. It offers great views when you are on it, and it is very pretty lit up at night. There is a whole legend about the lions and the sculptor who designed them (I won't tell you so you can find out if you do a tour).
Chain Bridge. It is an easy walk and is one of the first of 8 bridges that connect the two cities. It is near the finicular on the Buda side.

Don't miss a walk across the bridge. Classic, breathtaking bridge across the Danube, linking Buda & Pest. With giant carved lions protecting all who cross, this is an architectural gem. I walked it every day I was in Budapest. Very romantic for evening strolls as well.

Imposing bridge. The Chain Bridge or Széchenyi lánchíd in Hungarian, connects the Buda and Pest sides of the Hungarian Castle. It was designed by an Englishman, William Clark and is a major thoroughfare across the Danube. We walked across it many times during our visit to Budapest. It has pedestrian walkways separate from the traffic so makes it quite safe to cross.

Bridge walk Danube/People View. Walk from Buda to Pest, or vice versa along this magnificent 19th century bridge. One way about ten minutes with a pause or two to observe the river and the people on the bridge. The chains are large flat slabs of steel held together by enormous bolts. Strung from massive stone towers they support the bridge roadway. A great walk on a good day between the two banks of the Danube at one of its most interesting points.

Nothing great. I had read about the Chain Bridge as Budapest's most glorious attraction but to be fair once I got there it was just about OK. It's not that walking over the Chain Bridge left me overawed or anything.

If you have time......... If you have or would take time to cross, or, even, stand on the bridge and view the RIVER DANUBE.. it is a sight you will not forget and a thrill that will stay with you and want to share with others not so fortunate.... Have your camera, of course, so your picture can be taken on the BRIDGE.. Worth the time !!!!! Not to forget to get the history of this historic bridge..........
Have a look and walk across. Take some time to stop and read the plaques on the different pillars and below the statues. Interesting with some lovely views

Beautiful Bridge - both day and night. Make sure to visit this beautiful bridge during the day and come back at night to see it! We made a special effort to see it at night on our last evening in Budapest.

Its a bridge. Well it is a bridge and you can walk across it so it does what it says on the packet. I expect you will cross it some time to get to the other side but I would not make a special visit to see this bridge, its not like the Golden Gate Bridge or London Bridge.

Big, beautiful and helpful bridge. . This big old bridge is quite spectacular and also very helpful. It is a spot many will use c to get over to the castle district. The bridge is metal and stone and was quite advanced when it was built. The walk over is good for photos of the Danube and budapest.
Must visit location. One of the main attractions which you just visit at least once during your stay in Budapest. A masterpiece by day and beautiful at night.

Beautiful at Night. Best to visit this place at night when the bridge is lit. If you can catch the sunset there, it is indeed beautiful. Once the lights of the city come on, the bridge and the buildings have a magical feel. From one bank of the Danube, you will see Buda Hill Castle all lit and it is stunning.
Another iconic landmark. This magnificent bridge spans the Danube and connects Buda with Pest. In the evening it is lit up which adds to the panorama of illumination within the City.

Great views of the Duna (Danube). We were on a walking tour, but the views were so distracting that one of us got left way behind (but managed to catch up). Interestingly, this bridge is modelled on London's Hammersmith Bridge, which we also walked across.

Walk across it and take a million pictures. So glad we had to cross this beauty on our way to Buda while staying in Pest. The views of the Danube are superb, and it's eye candy all around. You see the Parliament building and Buda castle, and it was just a beautiful way to see a lot of the city in one location.
An essential part of beautiful Budapest. I could see this bridge from my hotel room and enabled my walking tour to explore the both sides of Donau. The lions were impressive.

Another bridge . I know this bridge has historical importance to the city but it proves to be just another bridge. There's nothing that really stands out as amazing or architecturally significant but then again I'm not an architect!

Magical view. The chain bridge is worth a visit if only to view the city at night. The buildings during the day are impressive, but the city comes alive when darkness comes. It is truly an experience you must have when you come to Budapest!

Views from a bridge. The Chain Bridge is worth seeing both during the day and at night as it offers stunning views of Buda and Pest. It gets very congested though, with pedestrians and cyclists stopping to admire the views.
Beautiful. A lovely bridge to walk along and observe the almost crystal clear river Danube. The lion heads are particularly awesome!
A nice historical bridge. A nice and historical bridge that - to my taste - receives it fame more through it's history than it's architecture - although the lions are nice....
The oldest bridge joining Buda and Pest. Nice place to center your visit to Budapest, from here, most of the city is at your reach, specially if you are planning to do a bike tour.

Nicest walk across the Danube and wonderful sights from the Buda side. We stayed in Budapest with my wife in an excellent hotel near the Danube (the Prima Fashion Hotel) and decided to cross the Danube by foot at the Chain Bridge. It is a very old bridge that ends where starts the Buda Castle funicular. The view of the Danube from here is astonishing as well as the view of both sides of the Danube. On top of that, when you are done, you can take the funicular up to the Castle which is valuable to be given a visit.

Worth a visit to see the views and to see the bridge lite up at night. Beautiful bridge worth walking across to see the excellent views of the city And river . The lighting on the bridge at night makes this bridge standout from all areas of the city
Amazing views!. You should cross the Chain Bridge at least once on your stay, beautiful views of both Buda and Pest. The bridge itself is lovely too.

Marlow Bridge's Big Brother!. At the end of the day it's a bridge across the Danube, but it is a beautiful bridge and worth a walk across for the views of the river.As others have noted this Bridge was built shortly after its slightly smaller sister across the River Thames in Marlow England.My wife and I both work in Marlow so we took a little bit of extra notice... On the bridge in Marlow there is a plaque which shows it is twinned with the bridge in Budapest, so we were a little disappointed to see that it wasn't replicated in Budapest...

Nice building. A very special bridge and a nice walk over. The bikers were rough.
It's very beauty full in the night time.
You can't visit. Budapest without seeing this bridge.

Great views. We stayed at the Four Seasons Gresham Palace which was situated at the end of the bridge - it is an impressive structure and - like the Gresham palace - with a Britsh heritage. A walk across the bridge affords spectacular views of the Danube and both riverbanks. A very historic bridge and one not to be missed.
great free Budapest experience. This is a grand bridge with an interesting history - and a walk across it to look over the river and see both sides of Budapest with uninterrupted views is great.
an English connection. The designer of this bridge also designed the one at Marlow, UK, it is a good piece of design and an impressive bridge

Chain bridge Budapest . The closest bridge from our accommodation to the hub of the city. Spectacular at night. Beautifully lit along with all of the beautiful historic buildings. This place is a photographers dream.

Walk across Danube. Walking upon the bridge in the late night under the full moon was not only memorable but the mesmerizing sight of the parliament and Buda hills were absolutely dazzling. I stopped in between and simply stood in the center of the bridge feasting my eyes with the city lights listening to the murmuring Danube rushing beneath.

Chains of Love. Beautifully Lit Bridge from Buda to Pesht. During the day it is just another bridge but at night, it changes flavor, altogether. Make sure you see it at night, along with the other nine bridges.

part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site. The chain bridge is part of the Budapest UNESCO World Heritage Site.. It's a 19th-century suspension bridge, designed by William Tierney Clark & illuminated at night it is absolutely beautiful. You can walk across and is a great place to take photos of the historical areas of Budapest.

Heart of Budapest...take it all in.. Stroll across the famous Lanchid to experience Budapest.
You'll have the best views of the city both Pest and Buda and will really feel the
expanse of the great Danube (Duna).
Fabulous landmark. A fabulous landmark crossing the Danube. Classic postcard view of Budapest and the best way to access the funicula railway up to Buda .
Lovely of a night. Nice bridge you can walk or go over by bike ... It lights up of a night great pictures to take we went over it quite a few times

Worth crossing. Lots of photo opportunities of both Buda and Pest side and great view points up the Danube. Leads from the Pest side to the foot of the funicular on Buda side, to take you to the top of Castle Hill

Excellent architecture. Make sure you take the time to walk across instead of riding. Savor the views on both sides of the Danube as well as the bridge itself. There is a pedestrian walkway to avoid the traffic.

Amazing bridge. Engineers and architects should appreciate this bridge. The scale and size of the steel chain "links" is amazing considering that it was built in the mid-1800s. A wide walk path makes its easy to traverse it and you can get a panoramic view of both sides of the city, Buda and Pest, and see the large amount of river traffic. Be alert for people on bicycles. Many locals use this bridge. The funicular is near one end, next to the traffic tunnel, that takes you up to the castle.

Worth Walking Across!. We were staying on the Pest side and this bridge connects Buda to Pest. It was a fun walk across with great river views as well as views to Pest and Buda. It was like walking across the Brooklyn Bridge in New York but less crowded and better views.Once we crossed into Buda, which is the older more historic side we had great views of some of the beautiful buildings on the the Pest side. Definitely worth the 20-30 min walk across (including stopping for photo ops)

Well worth walking over and back again. If you don't want to go on a river trip this is the next best thing. Lots of photo opportunists of the city from the bridge and also a magnificent piece of British design & civil engineering - almost art!

Another Nice Old Bridge. If you like architecture, you will like this bridge. From the bridge, there are great views of both sides of Budapest. Additionally, you can capture great shots of Gresham Place. Be on the lookout for the (stone) lions on the bridge. They are great to use as a back drop for photos.

Great Bridge in Budapest. One of the first things we did when arriving in Budapest was to walk over the bridge from Pest and back. This is one of the landmarks that defines the city. It is a pleasant walk with a pedestrian path.

A bridge with a history... And a view. If you think either side of the Danube looks good, try it from this bridge. Beautiful day or night. The sunset is spectacular! I found the bridge is not as long of a walk as it appears. Enjoy!

Iconic landmark of Budapest. Whether seen on a stroll along the river's edge, or from one of the city's vantage spots, It's quite difficult not to be drawn to this beautiful landmark. Located just south of the equally iconic Parliament Building, it's one of several bridges spanning the Danube and linking the Buda and Pest halves of the city. Designed as a hybrid suspension bridge, its stone towers project a sense of sturdiness while its late-19th century design exudes a sense of confident elegance. At each end of the bridge are a pair of guardian stone lions. The bridge is a good spot to get a panoramic view of both halves of Budapest and the river traffic along the Danube. It's also a good idea to revisit the bridge at night when it's brightly lit all along its length.
Beautiful night and day. The lights at night and you can go up to the buda palace and walk down through the gardens and catch some nice pictures at sunset or at night
The lights of Buda and Pest. Sundown and the lights are marvellous and inspiring on this most beautiful bridge between Buda und Pest

An amazing view!. We crossed the bridge with the tour van but still got the chance to take nice pictures of the Danube.
You can cross it on your own, walking, the view of the parliament is perfect to take pictures from there!
At night, when the bridge is lit up, its such a romantic sight!

Photographers Nest. It is a nice walk on the Iron bridge but it gets really beautiful in night. It becomes a great subject to get captured at night. It is also a good location to click pics of other nearby attractions as well.

The oldest Chanin hunged bridge in Eastern-Europe. The birdge were 165 years old in 2014, and it has been built by a scotsman Adam Clark. The construction had been financed by Széchenyi István, who is named the biggest Hungarian of his age! This stunnig brideg connected the two cities of Buda and Pest, and started the common history of the Capital of Hungary!

A must see in Prague.. Everything I heard about the beauty and wonder of the Chain Bridge was true. I approached on foot and was amazed by the extraordinary religious sculptures Musicians were entertaining at various spots and the views were delightful. Do not miss this sight when visiting Prague.
interesting view. Lovely walk down the bridge to the other side. Enjoy the view of the river Danube as well as the famous Parliament building :)

Great for photos, easy to walk across. If you like taking photos you've probably earmarked this bridge for a photo shoot. I found that the best shots are on the left hand side so that the parliament building is also in view. The lights on the bridge and parliament go out at 1am so there's plenty of time to setup and shoot.Otherwise as a means of accessing the other side, it's easy to walk and safe to do so.
Beautiful bridge. Beautiful bridge, especially at night when it lights up. Cross over to Castle Hill and take the funicular, where you can get great views of it.

A lovely way to cross from Pest to Buda. On a sunny day one of the best ways to see both parts of the city by foot, can walk across or cycle across from one side to the other and back. Great place to take photos.
The best Danube bridge. The best Danube bridge linking Pest with Buda. 4 lions decorate the 2 enrties of the bridge and produce a special landscape at night.
You can't miss it. Each time you cross from Buda to Pest, you either go across or see it. The reconstruction has been done well.
Yawn.. It's, you know, a bridge. With statues, some refurbished, some black. Hoards of tourists. Nice views up and down the river.

One for your bucket list. The Chain bridge is an absolute must when visiting Budapest. This can be viewed best from the Buda side high on the hill. And also whilst travelling over it by taxi or by hop on hop off bus

Visit. We crossed the chain bridge several times it is magnificent the lights ,the lions figurines are so lifelike we also visited in a he evening to see the bridge lit and it is a beautiful backdrop for the palace,fisherman a bastion and parliament buildings dependant on which side u are on ,we had to try both its so lovely

Magnificent!. This was a spectacular sight not to be missed. Connects Buda and Pest and provides a fantastic view of Danube, the whole Budapest landscape and brilliant architectural structures like the Parliament.

Beautiful historic bridge and scene of interesting activities day and night. This beautiful bridge is worth visiting for the activities as well as the bridge. People gather there day and night and the hotels and buildings are wonderful as well in that area. Fairs and public gatherings also take place at the Pest end where food and beer is available.

Much used British Engineerd bridge. The romantic locks fixed to the bridge by lovers.
Used by cyclists and vehicles with pedestrian access at one side.
views down the Danube and both sides of Buda and Pest.

Beautiful . Beautiful in the daytime as well as in the evening when the lights are on when it can be romantic. Don't be fooled if planing on walking all the way across. Sit down half way and take in the sights around you

An Icon of Central Europe. Its a bridge. A great way to get to Buda from Pest and visa versa. The design is iconic. The views as you walk across are beautiful and the walk up the hill to the Fisherman's Bastion area is worth the effort for the view.

nightwalk. I've crossed the bridge a thousand times; but this time it was at night and with inquisitive students. The bridge opened so many cultural pathways in our discussion. I hope these cultural pathways stay open in my students' heads.

Classic but showing its age. We walked across this bridge to visit Castle Hill. A good landmark to check where you are in the city. It has some spauling concrete and other signs of aging. It's a convenient connector between Buda and Pest. Looks good in photos and provides good views of both Buda and Pest.

I Love Bridges. I love bridges, arches, domes, and lions. The iconic chain bridge is a beautiful structure adorned with lions so it was a big win for me. I walked across from Pest to Buda at night and enjoyed the fabulous views on both sides of the Danube and up to the illuminated Fisherman's bastion.

You can see it from the bus. The bridge is great to look at. The construction is a replica but wider, when it was redone after the destruction in the war. We walked it halfway but I liked it best at night all lit up
Bridge. There are several bridges to see and go across. Lovely walk around the city and must walk along the water to appreciate the area and all the sites.

Great to visit on an evening. Great views of the Danube and other City attractions especially on an evening when the sun goes down and the lights come up. Good place to watch the river traffic. On the Buda side of the bridge to the right and side. There is a lovely little wine bar cant recall its name with outdoor tables. (reasonable priced too) Great place to sit and watch dusk turn into night and the lights come on the bridge. The Viking Cruises berth opposite and its a great place to watch the ships dock and make way.
Very pretty. Walked the bridge and also sat and relaxed on the bridge. Just lovely. Recommend visiting because it goes from Bud to Pest.
Stunning. This bridge was amazing, we drove over it, went under it during the evening dinner cruise. So pretty.

One of the many bridges across the Danube that has beautiful lighting at night...... Our Viking Cruise left from this area and we had time to walk it several times while there..... the night view was certainly the best... Budapest does a fabulous job of lighting up its stunning buildings....
Great views. Walk across this bridge and get great views of both Buda and Pest along the River Danube, especially the Fisherman's bastion and the Parliament building.
Its a bridge. Really nothing special - just an old bridge - certainly something to look at but nowhere near the interest level of Charles Bridge in Prague.

Budapest's first bridge. This is Budapest's first bridge. You can see the imposing Buda castle in the background. Actually, it is amazing to see parallel bridges connecting Buda and Pest - when you visit you will see that Buda and Pest are separated by the Danube river and connected by parrallel bridges. Quite an interesting place and not to be missed!
Amazing. Have to see the bridge illuminated at night, just spectacular. The design is individual from the other bridges crossing the Danube.

Atmospheric Walk. What a lovely way to cross the bridge slowly on foot, with magnificent views of Buda and Pest. Well worth crossing from Pest and then climbing up to Buda Castle on the small railway.

I must agree that it's just a bridge. Must agree with a previous reviewer that this is just a bridge that you walk over to cross a river. Quite a nice bridge, but nothing special. Walkways too narrow for any meaningful entertainment, stalls etc. Went across a number of times both in the day time and at night time and didn't stop once to admire anything. All I can suggest is that, if you want to cross the river, walk down to the chain bridge and cross it there. Then you'll tick two boxes in one go, you'll get where you want to go and you will have seen an attraction.

If you like bridges like I do, make sure not to miss this one!. One word should be enough-beautiful! Walk on it, stop to look at the details and the views from it. A tip: take a walk in the evening from the Buda side to the Pest side and watch the mysterious Gresham palace (now a five star hotel) at the end of the bridge. Take the cogwheel train on the Buda side to see the chain bridge from a distance. Try to sit in the first cabin for the best view. Good picture taking opportunity from the Buda side. A lot of cables from the tram line on the Pest side. This bridge was the first to be built over the Danube in the 19th century and the first to be rebuilt after WWII. Enjoy!

Nice bridge over a spectacular river. Visiting Buda, or Pest, you are sure to cross it. It's a nice bridge, but only a bridge!I crossed one side Buda into the hill of Pest, then the other side back before heading to the Parliament building 1/2 mile away. A gentle stroll
Not really worth stopping for. It's a big bridge between Buda and Pest. There are many. It has to be crossed to,get around. On a short visit there are lots of better places to,visit.

Worth the walk. We walked over this bridge at night, after visiting the Fisherman's Bastion. It looks great illuminated, with all the boats passing under it. And it's over the Danube, so... yeah, worth it.
Gorgeous. it was really really beautiful. The architecture, the grandeur, by day and at night, it is just gorgeous. You have to see it.

Visit both day and night. So much history in Budapest, ancient and modern in such contrast. A day visit to actually see the bridge and move across it and then at night from the water, if possible, for great pictures of it lit up.
Be affraid. It's worth to walk accross the bridge, because it's so scairy. The bridbe moves all the time, but the views in the middle are so nice that go for it.

A Bridge is a Bridge like a Bridge !!!. It is a nice Bridge, but A Bridge is a Bridge like a Bridge !!!Now for us it was nice. A Violin Player who was playing there, offer my wife to play "The Blue Danube" by Johann Strauss II. That made our day !!!How many times in you life can a Violinist play for your wife, The Blue Danube right on top of the Blue (Brown) Danube ? I tip the violin player and he was very satisfied.

The symbol of Budapest. The first bridge to connect the 2 cities, Buda and Pest, this is one of the most famous symbols of Budapest. The view of the bridge from the castle hill and the funicular is really amazing in the evening, so if you would like cool pictures of the bridge, the hill after sunset is the place to be.
Part of two river cruise my wife and I were on.. This is just one of the amazing bridges in Budapest. Most are lighted at night which is a beautiful site.

A City Separated By The Danube. My husband and I walked over the Chain Bridge from the Pest side to the Buda side, took the funicular to the top and then walked to Buda's old town. The bridge has lots of cracks, you are safe from the flow of traffic and it can be windy.

Chain Bridge. This is a remarkable bridge. It has a strange tale, they wanted to roll it up and store it in a tunnel. It is a very easy walk from Pest to Buda over the bridge. Do not use taxis, use buses or the metro.
It's a bridge!. Not sure why this is classified as an attraction. I guess that the original bridge was made with chains, but this a rebuilt bridge having been bombed during WII

Best at night but also enjoyable during daylight. The Chain Bridge is so beautiful at sunset. It us so interesting to walk over and stop to admire the views of both sides of the Danube. At nightfall the lights go on and the sight us spectacular.
Chenyl bridge. It's a bridge that the Budapest people are very proud of but I prefer Elizabeth bridge lol the view around it is lovely
Amazing views. This is a great bridge and of course, iconic in Budapest. Easy to walk over and makes for some great photos.
Walk it. Walk it rather than just photograph it. You'll love the experience and that way you will see all the locks people have placed onto the bridge..
Beautiful!. Wonderful to walk over any time of day. At night it lights up with entertainment and food vendors. The view during the day is amazing!

Great views. Being a bit of a "bridge fan" I was toally impressed with this structure. I believe the original was destroyed during WW2 but has been faithfully restored (like most of the other bridges across the Danube).
The views of the Parliament building in particular can be spectacular from the bridge - especially at night.

Centres the city . The chain bridge to me us the focal point of the city and while it is lovely by day, it us stunning at night. It's a bit of a traffic nightmare though if you are travelling across it in a car but a nice walk to the cable car to the castle. Everyone photographs the bridge and you can't help but fall in love with it.

The Grand Crossing of Buda-Pest. Another landmark connecting Buda & Pest over the Danube. It also has a lot of history in its construction. For the photographers, it's a feast for the camera eye, both for day and night shots.
Romantic. Beautiful bridge that joint the Buda abd de Pest and offer a wonderful views from the Danube river.Good for pictures lovers
