An interesting historical landmark in Budapest. Many bridges over major European rivers were destroyed toward the end of World War 2, either by retreating German troops or by Allied bombing. The Chain Bridge was severely damaged during the Siege of Budapest which involved Hungarian, German, Soviet and Romanian forces and rebuilt in 1949. So what a tourist sees today is a beautifully restored suspension bridge designed by Englishman William Tierney Clark in 1832, built by Scotsman Adam Clark (no relation) and opened in 1849.The Chain Bridge links all of the central tourist sites of Buda and Pest.While the narrow bridge has a footpath on both sides, each is rather narrow and skirts around the massive stone piers. Pedestrians and cyclists meet at these blind corners.
Buda or Pest. You get an amazing view of either side, depending on where you're standing.A nice spot where to take pics!
walk that thing. walked both sides of this thing, very memorable and some great sights to be had of the river in both directions.

Night scene better. Visit the bridge at night and see the lit-up buildings and churches on both sides of the river. More impressive than during the day.
Walk along the river on both sides of the river and see the different views. Buda side is best for viewing the lit-up Parilament but also walk up close on the Pest side too.

HISTORICAL. The Chain Bridge is fascinating for its design and the lions at each end. Read the plaque describing why the lions have no tongues. Interesting!
Zoltan Molnar
Montreal, Canada

Architecturally beautiful!. A suspension bridge that links Buda and Pest, opened in 1849. We walked across, it's surreal to be crossing the Danube in that manner! Great views of both sides of the city!

Essentially, it's a bridge. Yes, this bridge is a bit more ornate than your average bridge, but if you've been to London, Paris or some of the more well known Italian cities this really doesn't seem that special. Not sure what all the fuss is about, but it is helpful for getting from Buda to Pest.
nice walk across. Very cool looking bridge, and a nice walk to the other side, which ever side you start on. Nice view from the middle of the city on both sides.

Majestic bridge on the Danube. Beautiful bridge. Leads you fro the Pest side to the foot of the Buda castle.Can get of several tram lines and hop on or take bus 16, 105 etc depending on where you are coming from to take get on the bridge. Can take magnificent pics on the bridge with the Parliament building int he background. Not to be missed.
It's a bridge. It is a beautiful bridge nothing compared to Charles bridge in Prague but you're there you have to see it!

Beautiful bridge. You can't really go to Budapest and not walk across the Chain Bridge. Hotel was very close so was the most convenient bridge to use anyway, but it still offers wonderful views of the Danube and the other bridges linking Buda and Pest.

The place that you shouldn't miss. The chain bridge connects the Buda and Pest sides each other.you could see the most beautiful parts of budapest while you pass this. at the night you could take more beautiful photos of this bridge the riverside of danube . cheers !!
Wonderful. This is historically and a beautiful bit of engerneering please take the time to walk across amazing

One of many splendid bridges. There are some great bridges over the Danube but the Chain Link bridge has an interesting history because it was designed by a foreigner from the UK and in its day the design was quite unique. I's been beautifully maintained and is still the main bridge to cross the Danube on if you are heading towards the castle.PJ Barker author of the novel Changing Pillion.
Family trip. Great spot for photos looks great day or night, some good places to eat on either side too. Tram 2 runs right along the riverside so jump on that if your feet ache
Romace for sure. Bring your camera and your walking shoes. This bridge is one-of-a- kind, and you will want to walk it more than once, especially at night.

Lovely walk. Even if you're not terribly interested in bridges, this is quite impressive but it's also a lovely, tourist filled walkway between Buda and Pest - grab a drink at the coffee shop and admire the Lions with no tongues!!!!!

Beautiful Bridge and Great Views. We took a bus one way over the bridge, and then after our tour of Buda we walked over the bridge. Its a beautiful and majestic bridge. We also sailed under the bridge on a Legenda boat evening cruise!

Beautiful lights at night!. Walk across this beautiful bridge to the other side to view the old palace area, the majestic cathedral (with interesting saints in glass coffins), some of the oldest bakery and shops dating back hundreds of years! Dine outside at an old cafe and indulge in lovely pastries and wonderful coffees! Buy some Herend bone china as it is made in Hungary!

Very nice walk over the Danube. If you like to walk around, go over this bridge to Buda and enjoy many beautiful sites. The Buda Castle, Gresham Palace, Castle Hill. Once you cross the bridge, take the venicular to the top and you will get breathtaking pictures of the city.
Beautiful views and easy walk. This was the first bridge to connect Buda and Pest. It was destroyed is the war but rebuilt. It is stunning to see at night so try to walk it and view it at night.
My favorite bridge in Budapest. It is especially beautiful at night when it is all lit up. I have to take pictures of it every time I go to Budapest. A most romantic spot.
Easy walk to perfect views.. Best at night, the design and scuplture are highlighted to perfection. It was also less crowded and better for photos and romantic moments.

A link in history. There is in one of the many museums of Budapest a black and white photo of the original Chain Bridge laying in ruins on the bottom of the Danube River after the perfidious Nazis blew it up. Happily, the bridge is rebuilt and one of the symbols of renaissance in this most beautiful and tragic of European cities. If you have only crossed it in motor conveyance and not by foot, then you have not really visited the city - merely paid a visitation.

Easy to walk over and very captivating. Many of our photos have this bridge in them. Its very eye-catching and is in the heart of Budapest. We enjoyed a stroll across it. Its very pedestrian friendly. The only thing you have to contend with are the cyclists, who are very impatient of walkers. Something you have to do and see.

The most beautiful bridge in the world. I have seen beautiful photos of this bridge and I assure you that you will find this bridge even more fantastic if you walk over on it from the Pest side to the Buda side.

Chain Bridge without Chains. This bridge has a beautiful view and architecture. There was also a shot of this bridge in an Indian Movie, Hum Dil De CHuke sanam. It connects Buda side to the pest side.
Easy free. Wonderful bridge to walk and view from afarEspecially romantic and beautiful at nightWatch for bikers!Great history and architecture
Stroll across Chain Bridge. walk across, very lovely bridge during day or night. Many perfect spots for pictures in either direction.
Walk the bridge. This bridge is fun to walk during the day but perhaps more so at night when all the surrounding beautiful buildings are lit.
History must see. The chain brigde, which is connecting Buda and Pest is simply a must for everyone interested in history.
Stunning bridge. At night the bridge is it up and well worth walking across as you get the full experience of the Danube and all of the amazing buildings along the shore.
Much more beautiful at night. We walked across the bridge during the day and went back at night to get night photos. From the beach area you can get some extraordinary photos at night.

Beautiful bridge. Worth looking at at night and walk over it.
Beautiful lanterns in front. Special! It's about a 5/10 minute walk and you can see the Donou, Parlement, Castle.

Beautiful design and very pedestrian friendly . The chain bridge is probably one of the most well known sites in Budapest. It crosses the Danube right in the heart of the main touristy areas on both the Buda side and the Pest side. The design is unique and very appealing to the eye. The photo ops you get from either side of the bridge are amazing. Locals use it for jogging and riding bikes across so stay aware of your surroundings or you could get knocked over. This is a great thing to do in Budapest.
The first and the only. Very nice sculptures. Easy to walk. We wrote our names on the bridge. It's a must. When cars and buses pass it seems like the bridge is moving!

Spectacular design. the engineering will appeal to anyone with an interest in design, as will the overall visual appeal. Great views of both Buda and Pest from the Middle of the bridge. Walk across one one then swap sides to come back and get the other view. Beware when it's raining as the traffic can spray the surface water over the pedestrians. Very funny unless it happens to you!
Lánchíd (Chain Bridge). Walk from Pest to Buda on this beautiful bridge :DTake the cablecar or walk through the tunnel to the Castle :D

Nice piece of antique ironworks. Nicely kept in a good state. It's a good example of early heavy metal works, all rivitted and bolted. It's well restored after the 2nd ww and treated with respect to the antique details.

It's a bridge, it's nice.. This is a bridge across the Danube, it is probably better in photographs that photographing from. The walkways are a bit narrow on either side, with blind corners and many bicyclists.
Beautiful views of the city. We walked both sides at night and the views are stunning. The bridge looks nice when the lights are turned on. Very busy with selfie takers so be careful.
Beutiful engineering work - also at night. Both day and night we loved the view of the bridge. Is nicely lightened at night. You can walk over the bridge.

The most beautiful Bridge In Budapest. This bridge is very old as witnessed by the darkness of the sandstone which has absorbed many years of soot and smog. From here you can take in sweeping views of the Danube, as well as views of cruise ships, Buda, and Pest. Take you time as you walk across and take in all that Budapest had to offer. Lovely

?It's a bridge, a pretty bridge.... A bridge is a bridge I say and I feel this is really no exception. It looks nice, its nice for taking pictures and its free but can't really say its anything more than that to a tourist like me. It is however even nicer to look at from the top of the hill in Budapest with the statue on it. i don't remember the name but if you're by the bridge just look up slightly, do a 360 and you'll see the hill - cant miss it.
Nice relaxing walk great views. Design of bridge visible as you walk along creaks and moans a little thousands of steel links forming the bridge beautiful lighting at nighttime
It's a bridge!. Hey, it's part of the charm and history of Budapest and you can get 3 minutes worth of information on design etc. but it's still a bridge. Go over it and enjoy Buda....
Okay so it's a bridge. Not sure what the big deal is about this bridge other than the convenience of linking the two sides of the city. Nothing really spectacular IMHO compared to others in Europe.

The Jewel on the River. Look down on it from Buda, walk over on both sides of it, get a boat under it, take the Number 16 bus to drive over it. It looks great from everywhere. A reconstruction after the war, alas, but it makes the Budapest riverfront very special. Visit Marlow when you get back to the England and see its smaller brother, not a reconstruction!

a very nice bridge. there are a lot of bridges over the Danube in Budapest but htis one is by far the nicest in Budapest. Unfortunately this is a very crowded bridge for the traffic. It would be nice if the total bridge would be pedestrian area like the Charles bridge in Prague

A bridge from the Eifel time. Very nice construction. Our hotel was in Pest, so to visit Buda we have used this bridge several times. Don't miss this beauty at night. This bridge and parlement is nicely illuminated at night !

Marvellous. Such a charming bridge. A different view during day and during the night. Must walk across this bridge and admire the view. At the end of the bridge on the Buda side you see the two Lion statues. (Did you know that part of the bridge also appears in Katy Perry's song "Firework".)

Best when it's dark. The Chain Bridge is a fine bridge in terms of its artistic and architectural flourishes and it is also incredibly practical, as it connects 2 significant parts of Budapest. Pedestrian and vehicle traffic are always pretty heavy, but walking out onto the bridge and stopping to stare up and down the Danube is a wonderful experience. This beauty, however, is best admired from a distance and in the dark. I advise walking to the Buda side and up into the hills were the Buda Palace is located and enjoying a nice dinner in one of those neighborhoods. When you are done and the sun has faded, you'll be treated to a truly splendid sight--the bridge all lit up and the majestic lion statues partially shrouded in ominous shadow. The Chain Bridge is lovely at night and fantastic as the light fades behind the Buda Hills.

a must walk for an evening stroll on a summer night. Walking the bridge at night really puts the town in perspective. The beauty of the buildings and river in the evening are a wonderful perspective on Budapest. A must in a visit to Budapest.

A must study, in Budapest for every engineer. The bridge is a great example on simplicity, and good engineering, simple construction with a impressive chain pair on each side, a chain assembled like a chain for a bike but in multiple parallel sections. A solid and rugged construction, rock solid.In the evening it is a wonderful scenario when the lights on the pylons turns on, first light green, later soft white.

Lovely, interesting photo spot. Impressive landmark! I walked across it and got some great photos of the city (both Buda and Pest sides) and of the bridge itself. Don't forget to take close-ups of the bridge itself
Neckless of Budapest. I think this bridge, which combines Peste to Buda, is a real landmark of Budapest. Without walking on it from one side to the other the visit is not complete.
Pretty. Admire it at night time on one of the many night cruises or during the day from the Hop on Hop off tours. It is a historic bridge which was ahead of it's time when built
Fabulous Bridge. This is one of the most charming bridges in Europe. Walk across the bridge to see the Lion statues. However take note that they are missing tongues in their mouths!

A Must See. This is a beautiful bridge and a must see by day and night. Ultimately it is a bridge which is why I didn't give it 5 stars but as a tourist to the city you need to visit the river side and get your snaps and appreciate the architecture. When it is lit up at night it looks completely different to during the day so if possible try to see it during both.

Magnificent. The current Lanchid is a reconstructed version of the original bridge which was demolished during the final stages of WW II. Much like Pittsburgh, Budapest's bridges link and define the city. The Lanchid isn't as light and elegant as current generation suspension bridges but it fits the architectural context of Budapest perfectly. The bridge has a very functional pedestrian access as well.

Such a landmark of Budapest. Woke up to the view of this wonderful bridge each morning from our hotel. Fantastic both day and especially at night. Be careful when walking across as cyclists use the pavement.
A historic landmark. Right next to Sofitel. It is designed by the same engineer who designed the London Bridge. It is walkable and it is one of the nine bridges that connect Buda and Pest.
massive edifice. we saw the bridge from close quarters when we were in the boat.incredible piece of work.radha aiyar.
walking across the chain bridge at night is awesome. Everything is lite up and gorgeous. You are walking between Buda and Pest and you feel like you are in a postcard.

Absolutely magic when illumInated. Count István Széchenyi had a dream. To connect Buda and Pest. He proposed it to the council and the construction began in 1840, funded by the Greek merchant Georgios Sinas. Designer was an English engineer William Tierney Clark. The construction lasted up to 1849, supervised by the Scottish engineer Adam Clark. At that time it was the 2nd largest bridge in the world. Named after the Count - Széchenyi Bridge - it's 375 m long and made out of wrought iron and stone. The Buda Castle Tunnel has exactly the same length and there is an anecdote saying that when it rains the Hungarians put the Chain Bridge into the tunnel for protection! In 1914 the bridge was strengthened. In 1945, at the end of WWII it was blown up. It reopened in 1949 again. It's usually called Chain Bridge due to the iron chains held by 48 m. river piers. The guardian lions at each of the abutments are sculpted by János Marschalkó. They look like the Trafalgar Square ones, but they are smaller and were installed earlier (1852).The legend says that during the opening ceremony a little boy noticed loudly that the lions had no tongues, something that made the sculptor so upset that he jumped into the river Danube!!! Even today people don't see any tongues although the authorities insist that they do exist but can only be seen from above!!!! Anyway the bridge is really beautiful especially during the night, illuminated, and surrounded by Buda's and Pesta's impressive buildings, also illuminated. Magic panorama.

Good Views of the City and the Danube. Walked from the Hilton in the Castle District in Buda across the bridge to Pest side of the river and the shopping district. Bridge is an easy walk. Recommend it for the healthy and adventurous. Nice views of city, River and river traffic.
A must!. its beautiful, particularly just before the sun sets! Parlament and Buda castle are all lit up and stunning! Walk across the whole thing and take it all in!! You don't need a tour for this!

A Budapest Must-Do. A walk across the Chain Bridge is an essential for visitors to Budapest. Besides being a significant engineering achievement, the bridge has played an important role in the city's history -- you should read up on it before or after your walk. The views are incomparable and if you have as perfect weather as we did --and even if you don't -- the experience is something you should long remember.

Great atmosphere. This bridge is a must in Budapest. So take a walk across - a good start of visiting the Buda side of the city. The cable car to the castle is just at the end of the bridge. Don´t miss the sight of the bridge at night time, maybe from a sailing trip on river Danube.

Marriage Proposal on chain bridge!. Me and my now fiancé visited Budapest in October for our anniversary, while visiting we took a lovely walk along chain bridge, you are able to see all over Budapest it's a beautiful sight. Along our walk my parter got down on one knee and asked me to marry him which to his delight I said yes, he had a pad lock which we attached to the bridge with lots of others! With the quote will you marry me on it! It was a perfect moment and the most perfect setting, Budapest is a truly amazing place and we are hoping to re visit when we are Mr and Mrs next year :)

Great views of both sides of the city! . Definitely go see & walk across the bridge for great views of Buda and Pest. The sun was shining when we were there so we got some great photos & views right up the Danube.
nice to walk on and cross the Donau. we walked from Pest to Buda and i was very nice; a goood foot path to walk on; the only thing is that sometimes people on bicycles cross you come from the corner
Romance. Romantic walk and exellant view. Best place to take photos from both sides of the river. Many people use it for jogging, walks and romantic dates.

Walking over Chain Bridge. When visiting Budapest you are bound to see Chain Bridge and at night it looks quite spectacular - as do the other illuminated bridges across the Danube here. For bridge enthusiasts it is well worth close inspection and some research into its history, but an average tourist would be mistaken to compare it with, say, Charles Bridge in Prague for any on-bridge attractrions. It is a working combined roadway and pedestrian bridge but with good views along the Daube when walking across it.

Chain bridge. Ok, there are a zillion bridges crossing the Danube in Budapest, and this is definately one of the most beautiful. But bridges are not really my thing, so I'm not that impressed. You might as well use this bridge when you cross the Danube. It's as safe as all the others :-).

Walked across the bridge it is not a long walk. It is 10 min walk across the bridge. Well worth it . The views from the bridge are spectacular. The bridge end at the venichular that takes you to the top of the hill
Great Walk!. What a fantastic view from the center of this bridge. Only 10 minutes to walk across the Danube, and well worth the trip. Make sure you take a picture of the lions guarding the entrance.
worth a look. excellent to see not just this bridge but others over the danube would really recommend budapest a most vist city
Chain Bridge. Another example of beautiful architecture. I spans the Danube and is a great place to take in all the views
Main bridge over the Danube. This is the most famous bridge over the Danube and leads directly to the funicular at the base of Castle Hill. Impressive stone lions guard each end of the bridge.
Great for city photos. easy walk across bridge with beautiful views up and down riverConnects Buda with Pest and a great way to split your time
Great walk across. After walking down from the Palace we went to Pest via this bridge. The Danube is powerful and it's a nice place to view the Parliament buildings.
Very nice place to see the sun set. We stayed in an apartment right by the chain bridge and the views of an evening were stunning. Nice place to sit along the river and watch the world go by.
Charming Bridge. We walked all the way from Pest till Buda on this historical bridge and make sure to bring your camera and capture amazing photos with it...

My favourite bridge.. When here for a few days this seems to be the landmark used more than any other. It's a lovely bridge that look superb at night time, it appears on most memorabilia in Budapest. Fantastic sights on both sides when crossing, you can't avoid it.

Impressive. ONe of the great bridges and looks stunning all lit up at night. Designed by an Englishman called Clark and built by a Scotsman called Clark. Interestingly the Scottish Clark stayed and married a Hungarian and now has a street/square named after him.
Very Impressive. Connecting Buda and Pest this bridge is definitely worth a visit. Very impressive architecture. Crossing it by foot is a nice experience!

A great way to get from B to P. I don't know if I'd want to visit the bridge to see it...but when we went down the funicular and wanted to cross the river back to Pest, it was a nice, short, Scottish-designed bridge with an adequate sidewalk, which we enjoyed.
Its a bridge. Whilst I understand all the bridges of Budapest were destroyed in WW" I cant get excited about a bridge - yes its nice to look at but its a bridge.
Wonderful View. Great Bridge giving wonderful views down the river. Impressive construction with fantastic lions. We went on a windy day, was quiet but you have to hold on to your hat!

City of Bridges. One of the many pretty bridges that connect the two cities (Buda and Pest). Great history! The lions at foot of the bridges are beautiful views. Story goes that the builder of the bridge was so proud of his work that when he unveiled it he said that if there were any flaws in his work he would throw himself in the river. Then a bystander pointed out that the lions had no tongues so the builder jumped in the river....good thing he could swim!

First Link In The Chain of Places To See. This is number one in the list of places to visit in Budapest. It was the first permanent bridge across the Danube, destroyed and then rebuilt after WW2.It's massively busy, all the time, so whenever you go there, you'll get an even larger dose of Budapest's traffic fumes than normal, but it's worth it.Take time to enjoy the views from both sides, photograph the lions, walk across from the Pest to the Buda side and take the funicular up to the Castle district. Walk back over the bridge two/three hours later when you've seen the Castle and the Fisherman's Bastion and get an expensive but superb cocktail from the Four Seasons Gresham Hotel piano bar, right in front of you, across the green square.
Bridge with history. Walked over the bridge several times. Magnificent architecture. Somewhat spoilt with hundreds of locks attached, although I appreciate the sentiment of the gesture.
View from our room at The Four Seasons. Fabulous view from our room, looking into the chain bridge, this for me was the most fantastic view of the holiday.

Provides great views!. Staying on the Buda side of Budapest I had many opportunities to cross this bridge going to Pest. It provides fabulous views of the city and is an easy walk. This is the main bridge so there are a lot of pedestrians crossing during the day. You can stop and get great photo's along the way. There is a lot of traffic as well but I did have the opportunity to cross when there was a bike marathon going on and they had closed it to traffic. It made that walk especially pleasant (no cars whizzing by!) You will enjoy your walk so take the time.

Iconic and beautiful!. You have to see it! Lit up at night it's just so beautiful. Be watchful here and all over Budapest for the mad bicycle riders. They go fast and seem to tear around everywhere. it's fun to walk across the bridge.
Gorgeous bridge. Looks stunning during the day and night especially the beautiful Lions at one side. A lot of begging going on though.
Nice pice of history. This bridge looks realy great! I heard the story it was build as a perfect project - looks like ;)You should came and take some pictures :)

nice walk. The chain bridge was only a very short walk from our hotel. It is an impressive especially at night. Worth the walk across the river either during day or at night. Great view of Parliament and both sides of the city
Oh,what a bridge !. Its very attractive place ! We have so wonderful weather to walk there and no harry go elsewhere. There are many other bridges too but this is the best !
take a walk. One of those must dos take a stroll over chain bridge from Pest to Buda and back. You get a great view of the Parliament Building too

The Lions Still Have No Tongues!. Simply an amazing tourist site in one of the most beautiful cities in Europe. The Chain Bridge is simply stunning. I remember this from 32 years ago when Trip Advisor did not exist. Glad I finally got a chance to comment.

Just a walk on the cities oldest bridge. well there is nothing really to plan about this bridge, but simply walk across it! Its main of chain links as the name suggests and is the oldest bridge. You will most probably cross it anyway on your walk from Pest to Buda..

Lovely . Lovely historic bridge. The first night of our stay in Budapest we took a cruise and to see this bridge lit up in the evening is stunning! We also rode our scooters across which was difficult with all the pedestrians :p
Best at night. There are several lovely bridges across the Danube however the Chain Bridge needs to be seen at night. Photos say it all.

An Engineering Feat!. It's a well-built bridge considering its age. The view over the Danube that splits Buda and Pest from the bridge was beautiful on an warm April day. I would imagine it'd be more beautiful at night with the evening lights on over the Parliament Building and Buda Castle, which we had missed after a long day of walking up and down Castle Hill.

See it at night. The bridge is lit up in a soft yellow tone which reflects beautifully off the Danube and the opposite banks add to the mystique. I enjoy long exposure photography and this is one of the best places I have ever been for that. It's very easy to just sit and take in the sight for hours. I did this even when I visited Budapest in mid-January
Beautiful from the river at night!. Beautiful from the river at night! After dark it is lit up and you can see the palace and other beautiful buildings also after dark are also lit up

Historic Bridge. When you are in Budapest and going up to the Castle District then i would advise going across this bridge. I have seen the photo's of when all the bridges were bombed during the Second World war and it looked very sad. However it has been restored to it's former glory and on the Buda side is the entrance to the cable car which takes you up to the Castle District.

A bridge with a great view. A great stretch of a bridge that links Buda and Pest. Great view both in the afternoon and at night - though my personal preference was walking the full length of the bridge in the evening. Nothing over-the-top spectacular about the bridge other than that - but worth seeing.
Nice. Visited on May 1st this bridge gave us possibility to enjoy the airshow over Danube. The bridge itself is nice, but it's just a bridge :-)
Beautiful. It is a great bridge connecting Buda and Pest, and it really is beautiful in daylight and at night..
View At Night. Arrived by river cruise at night to the stunning city and the beautiful Chain Bridge at night! Not to be missed...

Beautiful at night!. Ok, it's a bridge.But it is a great bridge connecting Buda and Pest, for both automobiles and pedestrians. The walking area is safely separate from the cars, so you can meander your way across, take pictures etc.Even better at night when it's lit up. We were there in January, cold and windy, so hold on to your hat! :-)

Lovely in morning and evening. we walked across chain bridge about 8 times over the 5 days we were in Budapest -we moved between the Budda and Pest side of the river. The bridge is beautiful, lots of traffic and pedestrians though

What a brilliant view. The Chain Bridge linking Buda and Pest is just so distinctive. With the enormous Arches reminiscent of the Arc de Triomphe in Paris - there's a real sense of grandeur about this Danube crossing
Beautiful. A great way to walk from Buda to Pest (or vice verse) on one of the city's most picturesque bridges. It is a must for any visit to Budapest, but watch out for cyclists!

Amazing at night. The bridge itself is nothing special during the day but completely transformed at night. With the lights on it's just breath taking. I would recommend sitting on the promenade around 7.30 in the evening when the lights are switched on at dawn, spectacular!

Classic design. Designed by TJ Clark, an Englishman. It is a larger version of his bridge over the Thames at Marlow. The stone lions at the ends are very similar to those in Trafalgar Square. The bridge was made in England, and shipped over to be assembled on site. Partially destroyed in the Second World War. There is a nice plaque commemorating Clark on the Pest side of the river. A nice rusty green colour.

Spectacular by Day or Night. Our Viking River Cruise ship sailed beneath it several times and then docked almost beneath it. As a Civil Engineer, I really appreciated its simplicity and elegance and realize now why it is such an icon of Budapest. Don't miss seeing it by day and by night!
Beautiful Bridge. Fun bridge to walk over and bealutiful at night when lit up. Get a picture from the top of the hill looking back toward the Pest side.

Landmark centrepiece of civil engineering style.. Stylishly photogenic, both by day and night, forming a graceful link between the twin communities of Buda and Pest, providing translation into Budapest. Besides the variety of excellent panoramic views ( both towards and from the bridge ), be sure to take in the substantial lion sculptures on the bridge entrances, very reminiscent of the lions in Trafalgar Square, London.

over and under. We walked over, rode over in a Big Bus and cruised under , so saw all perspectives of this handsome and Scotsman designed bridge.It is one of many beautiful features along the Danube near the centre of Budapest and very photogenic.

Most beautiful bridge in Budapest - make sure to walk across it. The Chain Bridge is a beautiful structure that is best experienced by walking across it. We did it twice, once during the day and once at night and it is wonderful.
Pretty at night. Pedestrians can walk across the bridge that connects Buda & Pest. Lion statues guard the entrance. Great for taking pictures in the day, even better at night.
Evocative of Budapest. This is of international renown and its iconic position over the Danube, connecting Buda with Pest is significant. It looks amazing a night as well as day.

Nice bridge . Nice especially at night time view
Morning traffic is bad
From far distance the bridge look very nice
And good place for photo

Must see and feel. Believe or not, this bridge has been destroyded during WWII. Straight route via tunnel to Buda if you want to inhale fumes local people way (Funikur under renovation - again). This is The Monument being first told. Magnificent. For lovers: Do not forget the lock of hearts

Famous suspension bridge over the Danube in Budapest. Best seen to full effect lit up at night. Built under the supervision of the Scottish Engineer Adam Clark between 1839-49. Longest bridge in the world then and the first permanent bridge in Budapest over the Danube. You can take a walk over it between Buda and Pesht.

Nice walk. We walked from Pest to Buda and climbed to the castle. Bridge was right by our hotel. Loved the architecture and construction of the bridge, the lions guarding each approach. Good views up and down river.

First Bridge. The history surrounding this bridge is quite fascinating and worth finding out about it. Desgined by A scotsman William Clark and built on request of Count István Széchenyi, William Clark put his life on the line by saying that there was no design fault in the bridge and if anyone found one he would jump off the bridge. The danube river currents are not inviting less so than the thames, a young child apparently found a fault, the lions that stand proud as part of the design have no tongues, so William Clark lept the middle of the bridge to his fate. A definite visit and walk across.
Re: day and night. It connects Buda and Pest. We saw it from the castle in Buda. But seeing it from a different vantage point which was from the Danube at night made me appreciate it more.
Cold windy exploration. We walked to the chain bridge with dozens of young people.The wind was very cold, the sites along the way was impressive.Another must was ticked off.

Best Bridge in Budapest. If you are staying in the Castle district of Buda, The Chain Bridge is the closest for crossing to Pest. Green iron bridge flanked by huge stone lions this is the most photographable bridge - and well worth visiting at night when it is lit.
Just stunning. The views from the bridge are great. Even the kids enjoyed our walk across. Great photo opportunities on the bridge and of the bridge.
Excellent. Architecture par excellence. If only they woul;d look at history to consider how to build today, taking pride in the work

worth a night walk. Oldest bridge of the city with 2-2 lions on the sides.
Its beautiful to see in the night and also look at the sight from it.
You can recognise the bridge from several movies, events - like "I spy", Budapest air -, and also Marathon race
So pretty. This bridge really comes to life at night. Walk it during the day then view it from your boat ride on the Danube at night. Really nice!

Great way to get from Buda to Pest and back again. We are staying right on the river in a nice apartment. We had a tour of the parliament building and then used the chain bridge to come back over to our lodging. Many people walking & biking and the views from the bridge are great both up and down the river. Budapest is a very walkable city- when you leave the bridge on the Buda side you can easily go up the hill to visit the castle. Not all bridges are pedestrian so check before you go- the chain bridge is safe and scenic.
First Static connection between Pest and Buda. The oldest and first static connection between BUD and Pest side. Before the bridge there was a temporary swimming bridge in summer only.
A Bridge to Remember. I have seen this bridge so many times in the Movies and Photos of Budapest. Well, now I can say I have been there and walked across that bridge.

Lovely Bridge, Great for Pedestrians and a Fabulous View!. The promenades and access to this bridge, view of it and then ultimately the views FRMON the bridge are fantastic.It's easy to cross this bridge as a pedestrian, and it provides great views of the river and both sides! Photo opp!!!

awesome view from up here. I walked the Chain bridge 4 times even though I could have just easily taken a bus. You need to walk the bridge at day and night time beautiful view from both sides of the bridge.

Fabulous. Just so lovely, we loved all of the bridges, but we went over this one to visit the castle, it is lovely what a job it must have been to build, glad they did and the scenery from it is breathtaking

Linking Pest and Buda. It's worth strolling over this bridge...the first permanent stone bridge to link the two sides of the city. The Nazis destroyed it, but it was rebuilt in 1947. Great views and interesting structure.

Joining Pest and Buda. what a construction of a bridge from 1850 so designed by engineer clark from scotland so i read. just walk across and look out both ways. the ships the water the hills the buildings. castles churches parliament and just you there being a part of it. go and see. enjoy this.
Good views. This is a modern bridge and a very wide span. An interesting fact is that they had to move a church on the Pest side, sideways on wheels to get the bridge in!
Don't miss it. Amazing bridge that will transfer you to previous eras.Really enjoyed this place in the city centre. Don't forget to take many photos and keep in mind to watch for the lion's tongue ;)
A must. This was the first bridge to link Buda & Pest! Although the original bridge was damaged during the war it is still very impressive even more so lit up on a night

An interesting bridge. Seen it so many times in the movies.
it was many know Budapest for.
Great to walk across the bridge and back.

world master traveller in central europe. a fantastic way to cross the mighty danube river. first saw this impressive structure on my first evening in the city, all lit up like a massive horizontal christmas tree, with the busy goings on down on the river itself. i believe designed by a Brit or 2 which would be the case if its as classy as this bridge is. The fact it has been rebuilt after those nasty germans had blown it up makes this great structure even more impressive. I`d send the bill to berlin, if you havn`t already??

Stunning and Budapests most Famous Bridge and Landmark. We visited Budapest in March, 2015 and this bridge (which is one of the cities most famous landmarks) connects the two different parts of the city. It is stunning both day and night to see and walk across. At night the lights on the bridge (as well as the lights at most of the main attractions along the Danube) are a stunning sight. Paris is the "City of Lights" but Budapest is a very close second in this visitors opinion. DO NOT MISS walking along the river and seeing the stunning vistas of Budapest by the Danube.

walking over the danube on the chain bridge. I was looking forward to seeing the Chain bridge after reading about it. I was not disappointed & walked over every day I stayed there, the views from it are beautiful. The only problem is the noisy tram going over it, & people on bike crossing the bridge on the foot path. However it does not spoil the beautiful of it.

Chain Bridge. Budapest most famous bridge, connected Buda and Pest. Very beautiful at night with all the lights up. There is a small park under the bridge with some bench and you can enjoy the river view with the bridge.

Historic. You will enjoy this marvel especially at night when it is lit up. As a matter of fact at night both Buda and Pest are very impressive with all of the lights from buildings, and many bridges in close proximity.
Magnificent. Take a walk across for fine views along the river. The tram also uses the bridge as a crossing into Buda

It's a bridge. Like the title says: It's a bridge. Is it a nice bridge? Yeah why not. It brings you accross the Donau without getting your feet wet, that scores points with me. Is it a long bridge? Yup. About 200 meters long. Is it a good idea to walk over the bridge in a T-shirt when it's cold, windy and raining? Hell no, but we did it anyway. How tough are we huh ;-)

Iconic!. This bridge is an iconic landmark in the city! It is a beautiful long bridge! we spent a couple of hours relaxing and walking on the bridge and simultaneously enjoying the beautiful views of the Danube!

Amazing. Huge bridge over the Danube where you can have a walk or where you can relax. In fact it is so big that you can sit on one of the "chains" and enjoy the view of the river (if the weather allows it).

Lovely bridge with great virws. Great views up, down and across the river, especially to Parliament buildings and the Palace and magnificent church on the Buda side of the river. Especially impressive at night when these beautiful buildings are floodlit.

Impressive bridge and its crossing offers great views of city and river. More than just another bridge as its engineering is impressive. And the panoramic views it offers of the city - both Buda and Pest - and of the Danube that flows beneath it are simply wonderful both by day ( if the sun is shining) and by night.
Excellent. This bridge was amazing. Very nice view from the bridge, The lions at the beginning of it were fantastic.

Part of the scenery. Another of Budapest's iconic buildings- commissioned by Count Szechenyi , who seems to be responsible for quite a lot of the architecture along the Danube at that point. It's just a beautiful bridge, in the same way that Prague's got the Charles Bridge, Ljubljana's got the Dragon Bridge, the Triple Bridge and the Cobbler's Bridge, Paris has the Alexander 3 and Pont Neuf and London has Tower Bridge, Westminster Bridge and lots of others. Really busy at rush hour and currently it's got road works at Adam Clark's Tunnel which holds up traffic a little. It's also the stop for the Funicular up to the Castle, but the Funicular is currently being refurbished so it's not running.

Visit at night. Highly recommended to go for a stroll on this bridge at night; less crowded and you get a chance to see the whole city illuminated both on the Buda and Pest side which is truly a spectacular view.

Great Bridge. This is one of the most iconic places in Budapest. I would recommend a night stroll on the bridge. Great view and there is nothing like seeing the Danube and Buda Castel at the night from the bridge.
Beautiful Bridge. Our Viking ship was berthed nearby on the Pest side of the river. What a view, especially in the evening when all the lights of the city are illuminated!
Lions.... Walk across the Danube and see the two lions...Mr. Clark almost died for them.....see that they have no tongue....a mistake that caused him to jump in the river :)
Desibned by a Scot. Beautiful Bridge, steeped in History and interesting stories, nice to walk across if the icy wind is not blowing.

Pretty Bridge. I personally find the bridge very pretty to view! It is also a great place to take pictures with the beautiful parliament buildings it's a backdrop. You also get a nice view of all the boats going down the river and the river cruise boats anchored. I've been to the city twice now and I would definitely visit the bridge again.
Very historic.. It's a beautiful site and a fabulous landmark. This historic monument is a center of tourist attraction.

Great price of Victorian era engineering. The bridge was built by a Scottish engineer and has a walkway on either side. Great photo opportunity, and most of the cyclists go slow and are courteous to the pedestrians. But watch out for the testosterone fuelled Lycra types who go far to fast and give a bad name to cyclists
It's just a bridge?. we went to see what everyone was raving about. To be honest I didn't really get it. It was just a bridge over a very windy river?? Would say the views are that spectacular

A pleasant stroll. The bridge looks great during the day but amazing at night. It is great just to stroll along the bridge enjoying the views of the castle and city but also the Danube with the boats going up and down.

Beautiful!. The bridge on the Danube that ties Buda to Pesta is a beautiful suspension bridge that you should definitely visit in Budapest. When you arrive on the Buda side you can see the funicular that takes you strait up to Castle Hill. You can also climb on foot - i recommend that because is a nice stroll if the weather is nice.
magnificent. Day or night, you will want to walk across the Chain Bridge and take lots of photos. It's a communal experience - you will have lots of company and everyone will be enjoying the moment.

Spectactular. Hard to believe the history of this bridge. We walked across it. Imperious times on our way to the Budapest castle area. It is also worth making sure you do both sides of the bridge and visit it at night when the lights of the city are blazing.
wonderful bridge. It is very easy to travel from Buda to Pesta on the Chain Bridge. and the view that Danube offers is magnifique. it can be crossed in 10 minutes.
Great landmark. Great landmark. Travelled over here a few times during our visit. Great view from the Middle over to both sides of the river and a good viewpoint looking up the Danube.
Rusting at the edges. Bonny bridge with major tram track etc repairs on the Buda end.The side walkways appear to have been added later.Can be windy and cold.

Nice!. A nice bridge where you can go either to Buda from Pest or to Pest from Buda. About 1 minute to walk all the distance. You can relax watching Danube's water and you can take some beautiful photos.

beautiful at night. This bridge is amazing and becomes to life at night. The story behind this bridge is also amazing. This was next to our hotel sofitel so we were able to appreciate the beauty of this bridge day and night.
The bridge of Budapest. Great piece of engineering and the most beatiful passover of the river Danube.Great also in the night when it comes alive with all the lights.

Chain Bridge. Chain bridge is one of eight bridges found in Budapest. This bridge leads exactly in front of the funicular, which will take you up to castle hill. It's most enjoyable on foot so that you will see the views over the Danube.Be careful of bikes....try to keep on one side when crossing the bridge on foot.

Do this at sunset.... Take the sightseeing bus tours hop on hop off and go up the funicular but don't get back note bus instead walk across the chain bridge at sunset and you are in for a treat.. The sunset is beautiful! You will remember the evening forever.

Lions guarding Chain Bridge. Like all tourists, we enjoyed the walk over the bridge. It's quite safe with a section for pedestrians on each side and great views of the Danube. Gresham Palace is also stunning when walking from the Buda part of the city to the Pest side. Many photo opportunities with buildings as backdrops all along.
Everyone should cross the Danube at least three times. I crossed four bridges in Budapest on foot and highly recommend it. It is so beautiful you don't even realize you've walked so far.

Budapest is amazing city. i visit Budapest many times for my busness of course never for my pleasure. Budapest is amazing city. across by Dunube river which connect many countries as Austria, Yugo-slavia, Bulgaria, Rumania and so on. many bridges are in Hungarian Danube river but the most famouse is Chain bridge. nice view by night. Nice walk. many pictures. you can travel by boat too .

Chase the Sunset. I was there in March 2015 and had read about chasing the sunset of the liberty bridge, i was closer to the chain bridge and it was spectacular !! at about 5:50 i climbed up onto a section in the middle of the bridge. I faced the down the river towards the parliment and towards the fishermans baston ... as the sun began to set, half of the river decended into darkness and the other half was still lit up by the sun. The pictures i toke were amazing ! unfotunatly my phone was nicked the next day and i dont have many left but the memory is enough it was simply beautiful a great free thing to do just before you grab some dinner !!
One of the beautiful bridges of Budapest :). I have crossed this bridge alot of times and its beautiful. Especially at night the view is just magnificccc! :)

Beautiful!. An amazing bridge, really beautiful and by far the nicest bridge in Budapest. Well worth a visit, especially at night when it's all lit up. If you walk across it at night you will also see parliament all lit up which is also really beautiful.

Lovely Walk. We enjoyed taking pictures and walking across this pretty bridge. It is definitely busy in the afternoon. Go early in the morning if you want to have a shot without all the people crossing. Easy 15 minute stroll from one end to the other.
Lovely. Nice walk, great views of the river. Interesting story about the sculptor. Make sure you bring your camera
Beautiful. My kids love it from the first moment!No matter if you bike , drive or walk if you are in Budapest must try it.

Beautiful monumental bridge on Danube. If you ask me it's the most beautiful bridge in Budapest.
I enjoyed the walk from Buda to Pest although was cold, windy morning.
Taking picture is a must. Even better view would be from Fisherman's Bastion.
Don't miss it while in Budapest.
Bridge over Danube. Interesting structure and better to walk over it to appreciate it fully We drove as it was cold and windy Great view

A superb stroll. The Chain bridge is one of the icons of Budapest and is omnipresent in almost all Hungarian & Budapest postcards. Before going, i thought it will be a bit overrated.. However i found it to be an extremely scenic walk. We strolled there once in the afternoons while moving from Buda to Pest and walking on the bridge with the mighty danube below gives great photo ops. Also the view of both Buda & pest from the breidge is scenic and pictures taken here will surely etch the memories of Budapest in our hearts.The best time to stroll on the bridge is during the nights. Mind you, it can get a bit nippy and windy though. But the views are worth it.
better at night. a cool bridge, but nothing special... until you visit at night. really beautiful when the sun goes down and the lights turn on
Old beautiful Hungarian Bridge. It's an amazing place to visit, walk through it, take some photos and watch the view of the Danube and the city

Beautiful Bridge. Its size, its structure, its lights in the evening - just a beautiful bridge.....loved the walk across, also just to stand and look at the workmanship and all that went into the construction.
beautiful architecture. this is one of the iconic bridges crossing the Buda and will always remind me of the 3 great years we spent in Budapest.

You can't visit Budapest and not walk the Chain Bridge. This bridge is gorgeous and even more so at night. So try to walk it at night if at all possible and don't forget your camera either. The walk is popular, enjoyable, scenic and safe too. I can't imagine going to Budapest and not walking this bridge or any of the other ones. But as I alluded to earlier, the walk is best enjoyed at night when the bright lights of Budapest dance against the Danube and you can see the city in all its glory.
Epic. Very beautiful architecture, walkable and drivable, and beautiful views on both sides of the city. The lions at either ends are also very cool.
Nice place to take photo day & night. If not so windy & cold weather, it's very nice to see & take pictures of the castle & the parliament on the bridge.
Engineering at its best.. This is a well engineered bridge and linking Buds to Pest it is a stunning walk across too from either end.
Must see in Budapest.. You have to walk over the bridge, when in Budapest. The bridge is newly renovated. There are safe pedestrian Ways along the road, crossing the Danube as well.

Walk this walk. Never thought I was going to write a review of a bride.. But this was a really nice bridge. The day me and my girlfriend took a walk over it, it was very windy with rain in the air. Still it was worth the walk over the Danube. We came from the Buda side. And it was amazing to walk towards the Royal castle. The bridge it self was really nice with some great details. I would almost say it is a must to walk over this bridge if you ever find yourself in Budapest.

Great Structure and Viewing Platform. A lovely and uniquely designed bridge that is pleasing on the eye and an excellent platform to view Budapest from. The bridges' structural design (similar to a bicycle chain to the layman) will interest the engineering travellers and the views from the pedestrian walkways (one either side of the bridge) will leave all with a sense of satisfaction that they took the time to walk the bridge both ways. Highly recommended to all.

Nice walk over the river. Anyone visiting Budapest should take a walk over the bridge into a riverside walk of the city. The bridge is well kept with nice construction details visible - obviously it is one the most photographed objects in the city.
First chain bridge.. First chain bridge. Great walk lovely views over the Danube . Access to St Matthias Church and Buda.

Brooklyn Bridge look-alike. The engineering and construction details of this classic bridge are a pleasure to admire. Well maintained and easy to cross on foot, and offering beautiful views of the Danube, tis bridge links Buda and Pest, and is within easy walking distance from central Budapest.

bridges always enthrall me. .. and so did this. Its beauty and symbolism are immediate. Buda and Pest once were two different cities, this great bridge is the best walk or bike ride to move from one to the other.

Walk or ride over the bridge. To really appreciate the scenery from the bridge it is best to walk acre rosesThe funicular up to the castle district is at thee end of the bridge on the Buda sideGreat for taking photos from but wrap up warm it's pretty cold when the wind is blowng!,

A nice looking bridge. Although it seems to be one of the icons of Budapest is it quite plain. Not worth a trip on its own at all but you will probably cross over to see castle hill or the other side of the Danube.

Beautiful bridge, especially at night. The chain bridge in Budapest straddles the Danube. It is a beautifully constructed bridge, although as you get closer you can see signs of wear and tear. It can get busy, so early mornings work well. At night it looks fantastic.

lovely walk along during nighttime. you can catch amazing shots of the city by lights. literally the area from Basilica to Buda castle have to be seen during night, it not dodgy even if you are alone.

If you like the lions at the NY Public Library, you'll go crazy for the lions at the bridge .... Walk around near the bridge and really look at it. You'll go back again and again. There are quite a few bridges between Buda and Pest but this is the queen, I think. Don't miss it.
Uninteresting. The other bridge that leads to a small island is way nicer and more interesting. This one isn't worth it.

Familiar Bridge. As we live fairly close to Marlow in Buckinghamshire this was a must to see and we were very impressed with it it sort of adds to the atmosphere of Budapest, so many different bridges.

A Bridge. what can I say its just a nice bridge you seen one you seen most I can only say that you use to get to the other side of the Dunab or as we call it the Danube it a pretty bridge The Clifton suspension bridge in Bristol my eyes is better and more dramatic also higher as well

See from different perspectives. This is probably third most important landmark after Heroes's Square and Statue of Liberty (yes, Hungarians have their own lady atop a hill). One gets to go under the bridge during the Danube cruise. It is indeed beautifully lit!
Beautiful Bridge. Beautiful bridge allows you to travel from Buda to Pest effortlessly. Walk down the hill from Matthias Church and cross the bridge to get a great view of both Buda and Pest.

Nice leisure walk. The chain bridge isn't anything super fantastic. The history of the bridge is nice, and the convenience of getting across the river is even better. When taking the funicular up to Castle Hill, you get a great view from the bridge. My oldest daughter loved crossing the bridge and watching the boats in the river.

Walk through as many times as possible. Its just lovely, and the scenery changes drastically with the weather. the buildings from each sides of the bridge are quite nice, just take a walk, enjoy the view, stop in the middle and enjoy the wind, take photos. Take your time.

A night landmark. When I crossed this bridge in the full light of the afternoon, I thought that this place was a bit overrated.
Then I went back there by night, and my sensation disappeared.

Yep, it's a bridge. As a lot of people have said, it's only a bridge. But it is THE bridge of Budapest; an iconic symbol apparently. The first stone over the Danube. It doesn't have chains, but people thought it looked like it did, hence the name. Guarded by two lions at each end, none of which have tongues; no-one seems to know why. More attractive at night when it is lit up, then it is really quite an attractive thing. We noticed, in Hungary, that they do "lighting" very well, and rarely do you find any bulbs that don't work. The bridge runs from Greshams Palace (Four Seasons) on the Pest side to the foot of the funicular railway up to Castle Hill on the Budapest side. Not long in European terms, with pedestrian walkways on either side, and steps and underpasses at each end so you don't have to deal with crossing Hungarian traffic - this is a REALLY good thing as Budapest drivers are not slow! Whilst most people take photos from a distance, particularly at night, there are opportunities for good close ups of the lions, or architectural bits. But, at the end of the day, it is just a bridge.
Awesome Views!. This is a great location for photos, Morning walks and site-seeing. Its History is just as important as other site in Budapest! Go see it!

Beautiful at night. I know to some people it's just a bridge but to me it is a wonderful structure ,a real feat of engineering and a stand out focal point of this wonderful city.The sheer size of the bridge is jaw dropping ,at night when it's illuminated it look's magical,go underneath it on one of the many boat tour's and you get a real close up view of the bridge and the scale of the structure ,simply amazing.We were staying in the Carlton hotel Budapest side so crossed this bridge everyday on our holiday out here,a great experience ,viewed from castle hill at night,unbelievable sight.If your on holiday in this city a little stroll or river tour over or under this bridge is a "must do"on your tick list of thing's to do and see here.

Must Visit At Night. At night the bridge transforms and looks very pretty...its next to the Christmas Market so spend some time in the bridge / cross the bridge walking and then walk back and have local food at the Christmas market.

It's a bridge. a monumental one! . Like some of the other reviewers said "it's just a bridge". But being one of Budapests landmarks it's definitely worth a visit! When going up the hill with the elevator you have a great view all over Budapest! :)

Lovely views. Stroll slowly across taking in the beautiful views of Buda and Pest. Take time to admire the architecture of the bridge which unfortunately could do with a little TLC, much like many of the beautiful old buildings in Budapest.
Its just a bridge.. Not really sure what the fuss is about. We saw it during the day, at night, up close and far away. Its just a bridge, and far from the most interesting bridge out there.

Interesting. Is good to know some background about the Chain Bridge as well because it's very interesting and good to hear so if you're having a tour guide - ask him a couple of questions. I've been in a school trip in Budapest so I've found out that this Bridge is a historical unique and it is a quite experience to walk through it as well.If you're a passionate traveller I truly recommend to get to know this bridge! :)

Nice way to cross over the river. Chain Bridge is a nice stroll from one side of the river danube (Buda) to the other side (Pest), hence Budapest, giving access to the tourist attractions on both sides. As well as a stroll, it's also nice to see underneath it via a river cruise; preferably an early evening cruise just when it's become dark outside so that you see the true beauty of the bridge, river, buda and pest in real harmony.Pest is the tourist side (Parliament, Train Station, Opera House, Heroes Square, House of Terror, etc).Buda has the mountain on it, with attractions such as the Fishermen's Bastion, Matthias Church and the Royal Palace.

Beautiful. This bridge over the Danube is magical both at day and night. You can walk across very safely and undisturbed by traffic. It is amazing at night to look out your hotel window (Sofitel) and just take it all in. The memory is still with me!
Good walk across. Walking across to buda side will end up in Clark Adam where the funicular to take up to buda castle. Alternatively u can hop on a bus that goes all the way up.

Nice walk. There are bridges and there are bridges. The Chain Bridge is, well, another bridge. It's not on par with the Charles Bridge in Prague, but it's quite nice and offers some wonderful views and photo opportunities of Parliament and the River Danube.

Perhaps one of the most beautiful bridges in the world!. How easily people walk and see both sides of the best sights in Budapest. Lions on both entrances of the bridge are wonderful gatekeepers and the bridge view from either side both day and night are simply enough to empty all the memory of one's digital camera memory card!

Beautiful day and night. You have to walk through this bridge at least once in day and night time! You can see the four-season hotel on one side and the castle with fisherman's bastion on the other side.
Chain Bridge. No trip to Budapest can be completed without walking across the bridge and soaking up the atmosphere. The views were inspiring.
Fantastic one. Really its very nice bridge i was in marriot and go by foot to see it as it was clear from window by its attarctive lights in night so i go there .

Top tip if you're going as a 'loved up' couple..... My partner and I visited Budapest recently on a short city break and walked all over this stunning city crossing this and the other bridges on our days out. Whilst walking over the Chain Bridge I noticed there were padlocks on it which people had written their initials on....you know the type of thing. So, we wanted to place a 'love lock' ourselves and made it our mission to buy a padlock and a permanent marker. Well, the padlock was fairly easy, just find a Mister Minit (shoe repairers) of which there are at least 2, possibly more. The permanent marker was quite another matter and it took us hours.....literally hours to find a shop that sold one. So, my top tip if you're going to Budapest as a couple?...TAKE A PADLOCK AND A PERMANENT MARKER WITH YOU!! (Alternatively, if you live in Budapest and are looking for a business venture? Set up a stall at either end of the bridge selling locks and pens....a little gold mine! ;-) )

A Night Stroll. How else can I tell you not to miss out crossing the Duna (Danube, Donau), against the beautiful backlight of the Parliament lights and Castle Hill lights? Even with hazy weather, a nighttime stroll along the Duna can't be complete without crossing the bridge. If your hotel is not located near, you may want to map out your bus, tram or metro ride "home" beforehand. The #2 tram runs parallel to Duna and #16 bus will take you from Pest to Buda and vice versa. Enjoy.

Historical Beauty. You cannot miss this it is a huge feature of Hungary and what give Budapest its character, you get great views of the Danube here (Duna), and you get the great mix between the newer Pest and Historical Buda sides, notably there are lions on both ends of the bridge without tongues, these lions guard the bridge and its something really cool to take a picture with. =)
Don't Miss. No trip to Budapest would be complete without walking across this bridge. You get great views of the Danube and both sides of the city.

Fantastic beauty!. We had a perfect view of the Chain Bridge just from the balcony of our hotel - Four Season Gresham Palace. In the evening the view was amazing and the lights of the bridge made the all scene an unforgettable memory of those few days spent in Budapest!
Lions. We walked across the bridge while waiting for our bus. The structure is very interesting and the tour guide told us a stry about the Lion's creator. It must be a unique bridge.

A most beautiful bridge!. This is one of the most beautiful bridges that I have ever seen. Be sure to see it from all angles. We sailed the river at night, and it was even beautiful at night with the lights!

History in a stroll. Between the two cities stands a monument to a passage across a great river. Somehow the place has withstood the test of time. Taking a tour the significance will be explained to you. If the engineering of the bridge itself was the subject of the tour, then I might rate it more highly. For now, this is the best I can do. However, to have reached this bridge, and crossed it yourself, it an accomplishment in the life!
Unbelievable when lit up!. During the day this is a nice enough looking bridge however when it's lit up at night it's just extraordinary. Very much worth a trip over during the night.

Breathtaking view from Chain Brigde!. If you stay in Pest side, take a walk across the bridge, don't rush, observe changing perspectives, and take photos if you like. I usually stay with my clients in Hilton Buda. I encourage them to walk down, walk across the Chain Bridge but on the return to take funicular car back to Buda Hill. It's a wonderful attraction, and saves the effort of walking up the hill.

Nice stroll by night. This was one of the first things we did on our first day expiring the city. Its such a surreal feeling to walk across one of the main bridges in Budapest. Can get to it by foot once ur in the city. Sone fab views down the Danube river what could have passed for summer days in the month of February.

great views. Stand on the middle of this bridge and take in the best view of the river and both banks.This bridge is a great piece of old style architecture,it is one of the must visit sites in Budapest.
lovely. the chain bridge is so lovely and the architects detail is just outstanding, your able to walk over the chain bridge and take photos
A bridge. It spans the Danube very successfully and has done for some time. At night it is illuminated and looks quite nice.

Prettier at Night. The Chain bridge is a bit of a construction marvel, but during the day it is busy, lots of tourists/ bicycle traffic, and tons of photographers. It was prettier at night - with the lights, and less traffic which made it a bit easier to photograph.
Beautiful view. The main Budapest bridge is house of love locks and lots of tourists crossing it both ways. Beautiful view, you to cross it to go to the Castle Hill, very nice to walk through.
interesting. The walk on the Chain bridge is great.You get to see the Buda and the Pest.It has lots of padlocks placed in the middle of the bridge and they have some interesting writings.

Beautiful view. It was so beautiful the view especially if you go see it at night time or look down from castle district ^^if you ever go to budapest highhly recommend you go see it ^^ you wont regret it ^^
Just a bridge. what more can I say, it's just a bridge. Don't expect anything lovely like Tower Bridge, you'll be disappointed.

The most romantic evening walk. Cross the bridge walking from the Pest side to Buda side in the evening for an ultimate romantic experience, enjoy the night lights and the flowing river while you are approaching the tunnel at the end of the bridge (looks like the mouth & inside of an imaginary fish).

A must. This bridge can be seen, almost all the time when you walk along the river. I recommend getting a nice view of it during the night as it lights up. It also makes for a nice walking trip, to cross it.

The most famous bridge. This is the most famous of Budapest bridges,and actually all British,designed by an Englishman and built by a Scotsman.From the centre of the bridge you get fabulous views of both the Buda and the opposite (Pest) side of the danube,and also good views of virtually all the other bridges over the Danube in Budapest.

Beautiful. Must see, especially at night as it lights up and it's super romantic! Make sure to walk over it at least once.
It can be seen from most parts of the city and it's really something you must not miss.

walk this city, fall in love. Walk along the Duna in the evening, stroll across the chain bridge. Look at this beautiful city. Stroll through the market walk to the Ferris Wheel. There is no city more beautiful than Budapest

A must if you are in Budapest. Having undertaken the free Budapest walking tour, my wife and I had gleaned the history of the bridge and spent some time walking across it. You get fantastic views and pictures of both sides of Buda and Pest. It is a lovely walk

Walk Across Both Directions, at Least Twice. I absolutely fell in love with this bridge. Be sure to walk across it both ways—you'll be astounded by the views! Then cross a second time, and focus on the bridge itself—so many details that you won't catch if you're too busy just taking in the incredible view! One of the world's best bridges...

Historic bridge. By all means take a walk across this bridge as part of your stroll along the Danube. This bridge has interesting architecture, history, and views going for it. Linger in the middle to watch the river traffic going by.

Walked. Got the bus from Pest to the Buda side up to Castle Hill and walked down and across the bridge. Similar to other places in Europe, small padlocks have been attached and locked to the 'chain' by newly wedded couples and the keys thrown into the river, to show that they would be together for ever!

Good views. one of the popular bridges, came down from the castle hill and walked on the bridge in the evening when it was well lit. Connects well to the city center and major hotels on the city center side. The sculptures are good and the bridge is very authentic in the style compared to the other bridges ...

Chain Bridge. The Chain Bridge is the 1st bridge, what links the two parts Pest and Buda. The construction was started in 1840 by Adam Clark, scottish architecture.
It is one of the most important monument of the capital, and also a symbol.

Approach from east to west during sunset. The consensus among reviewers is clear, you should see this bridge when you're in Budapest. That is in and of itself not that hard as it is visible from many parts of the city. What is worth noting in particular is that approaching it from the east at sunset lends itself to especially beautiful views. With the sun setting behind the castle across the river on the other side of the bridge, you can get beautiful shades of yellow, orange, and purple mixed in with the blue and white of the sky. The silhouette of the lions, the bridge and the castle makes for an especially gorgeous sight. Of course, all this will depend somewhat on weather conditions, but it's worth a try since the bridge is in the middle of the city and you can easily work it into any itinerary.

A great looking bridge. We walked across this bridge a least twice a day as we stayed on the Buda side. It does at times look like London Bridge I especially liked the Lions at the entrance. Another bridge that looks great at night when all the lights are on.
great views. enjoy the walk but the river brings cold air so wrap up. Links Gresham hotel area with the palace hill.
must see. A must see-great history behind the bridge. It is worth crossing it on foot and experience the view of Danube.
By bus and walking. A must do in Budapest, by day and night, by bus and don't forget to cross it walking. The best panoramic view of the Danube.

Beautiful Bridge - a must to walk across. Cross this bridge over the Danube which joins Pest to Buda, just under the Royal Palace (Castle). Amazing architecture, and has a smaller sister bridge by the same designer in Marlow, UK.

Fascinating. We walked across to and aside from the great views of the Danube, Buda, and Pest it is filled with locks that people have put on with their engagement or wedding dates written or inscribed on the sides.
Beautiful. A wonderful bridge modelled on one in Marlow in London, England, luckily not fully destroyed during the war. Very photogenic.

chain bridge. There are many interesting bridges across the Danube. All are lit up
At night. Historically very interesting.

Loved this bridge!. This is a must, it's near all the sights. You need to walk across it , during the day and at night. I got some great pictures of the bridge it looks beautiful. If you do a tour there are some good stories about the history of the bridge.

Stunning running options await. I'm an early morning runner and I was amazed at the stunning dawn views and options for across the bridge and in the areas nearby. It felt very safe as even at 5am there were other runners and it was well lit. It was colder than away from the water, so cover for your ears and hands is particularly needed.
Even more impressive of a night. Very impressive bridge it looks even better lit up of a night-time. Well worth a stroll down the danube of an evening to see all the bridges.

A bridge to take your breath away!. Many of the bridges over the Danube are stunning, but this was probably the most beautiful. We could see it from our hotel room too - and it is quite a sight!! Don't miss it!!
Beautiful . The chain bridge is a beautiful way to walk from either side of the Danube and even more stunning at night, a picture postcard sight to see
Beautiful. Spectacular chain bridge with lots of personal padlocks attached from visitors. Great views up and down the Danube.
Even better at night!. This bridge provides great views of both sides by day and night, but it's when darkness falls it transforms itself into an iconic sculpture.

A great view. If you have never read anything about the history of Budapest this bridge might seem mundane and slightly outdated. But once you delve a little deeper the history and violence associated with the Chain Bridge comes into sharp focus. Just an incredible experience to walk across a bridge with so much history. Just watch out for the Segway tours that go zooming by!
Nice walk. Budapest is great for walking so be sure to stroll across this bridge. Read about its history beforehand to make it an even more memorable experience!

Nice. It is not something that you could see here and nowhere else in the world. But it has its' charm, and decorated in Xmas lights, along with the rest of town, makes the total picture of a city from a farietale

One of the best views of Budapest. The best view of The Hungarian capital - Budapest. - in my opinion , is the landscape of the Danube River, crossed by it's bridges , linking the two parts of the city - Buda end Pest.The Chain Bridge is the most impressive and beautiful . It has been planed and built by two engineers named Clark, with no connections to each other. The first, William Clark , an English man, planned the bridge in 1839 and the other - Adam Clark, a Scottish man, build it 10 years after (1849). The bridge has been bombed by the Germans, at the end of the 2nd W.W. and rebuild 100 years after it's inauguration in 1949.One can admire its neoclassic pillars forming two nice arches and the impressive metal constructions, the huge chains,on which , the bridge itself is suspended. The two pairs of lions, which are guarding the bridge at the both ends are also very impressive, but familiar figures, at the same time, on similar constructions.The view seen from the bridge on the both banks of the river is simply charming - the Hill of Buda, with the Royal Palace, the Matyas Church, The Fishermen's Bastions and The Gellert Hill - on the south bank and The famous House of Parliament, build in the architectonic sprite of The British Westminster, in a neogothic stile and many other impressive classic buildings, along the north bank of the Danube on the side of Pest. This spot has an even greater splendor by night, when all those sites and the bridge are illuminated . Sometimes , one May have the the chance, as well as I hade once to be there in a full moon night, while all this splendor has been reflected in the river by the moon light. It was a view , You never forget
from Pest to Buda. This bridge is worth walking over, it is famous for being built and designed by Adam Clarke an Englishman. See if you can see what's wrong with the lions at each end of the bridge.

Stunning at night. The best way for a visitor to the city to get from one bank of the Danube to the other. Splendid views of the surrounding city districts. The beauty of the bridge is best enjoyed at night, then it is really impressive. You would not say it was so much damaged during WWII.
nice bridge. It looks really nice at night with all the lightning. It is said that is the most beautiful bridge from Budapest but I personally liked bridge Elisabeta more

Thank you Scotland. A wonderful way to walk back to Pest having visited Buda my metro tram and funicular. The Scottish designer and engineer obviously knew a thing or two about steel. You'd never know that it was knocked down in WW2.

We done the love locks on this,. Amazing history to the bridge,
We done the love locks :)
Would recommend to go see and walk it !!
Great view from it so dont forget your camera or selfie stick :)

by night. looks much better by night :) its good connection with castle hill, that is so easy to claimp (no need to take the tram to the top if you are able to walk few mins up). you can do the circle chain bridge, castle hill, marerit bridge and parlament.
Beautiful bridge. Beautiful old bridge for a nice walk from one side of Budapest to another. Great view on the Danube river and the city. When night falls and the lights up, it is absolutely magical.
great. this was a stop on one of the free tours put on by HostelCulture and it had a very interesting story! worth looking up and visiting for sure.

Marlow Bridge original. The Chain Bridge is the original bridge that the one in my hometown of Marlow is modelled on And it did not disappoint. We loved making the walk across it every day to see the sights or just head to the castle hill for dinner.
