the bridge is not so special, i think .. but. The bridge adds nicely to the castle on the hill. To me it's just a bridge. It's no tower bridge of London. It's nice to walk across to the castle and get some views on it from top of the hill.

Impressive engineering. An incredible engineering feat- gobsmacked to read the original was destroyed in WWII by retreating German troops, with only the towers remaining. It is still a very beautiful bridge.
Interesting. Walked over the bridge a couple of times, If you are into engineering or like architecture then this is a must. The views down the Danube are also impressived

The first permanent bridge across the Danube in Budapest. Built in 1849 by English architect William Tierney Clark this is a major thoroughfare in this capital city and is the site of a new vogue where loving couples attach inscribed padlocks on the light cages along the lower reaches of the suspension bridge.

Visit at night time.. Nice bridge to have a mosey across during the day, and the views up and down the Danube are lovely.
At night time though, it's absolutely stunning.

Just go see it.... Speaks for itself. You can't miss it if you stroll along the banks of the Danube. Just think, during air shows over the Danube, pilots will fly their small planes under this bridge and come out the other side in once piece. Amazing if you can catch one of the air shows during the summer.

Most Beautiful!. Walking across it is a must do! But....pay attention to which side of the road you want to be on when you get to the other side. It is difficult because of barriers to cross sides of the road on foot at the entrances to the bridge!
Great view. Beautiful bridge amazing Bridge with a great view of the river and vice a versa really close to great shopping also
buda to pest. This historical place is the most iconic place in the Budapest, its great visit on different times of day!
Special. For me this is the best brifge on Danube in Budapest. Its amazing at night when the lights ar on. Spectacular to see it from Margaret bridge.

Nothing special. Yes its a bridge that is very helpful from going to Buda from Pest or vice versa. Dont think it would make anyone's top ten bridges!! Probably some nice views from it in summer but in February it was cold & windy! If you have some time to kill then worth a visit.

Chain bridge. Like most of budapest this attraction is best seen at night or in the day time from gellert hill looks beautiful.The Chain Bridge constitutes one of the symbols of Budapest, very suggestive in the night, when it’s enlightened by many lamps, practically drawing its contour, and is one of preferred settings for a photo, with the Buda Castle as background.This bridge connects Pest and Buda.
Chain Bridge. Am impressive structure in the middle of Budapest. The bus trips all cross it but if the weather is good take time to walk across.
Lovely. Hisrory is flying when you are standing on tha beautiful bridge. Adorable ladskape. I was in Budapest in February and Budapest is lovely in every season.

It's just a bridge. I come from San Francisco, a city known for it's bridges, so to me this bridge was largely unimpressive. It's not particularly beautiful or unique. I suppose the view from the bridge is what people like about it.
chain bridge. a fantastic old bridge with a great history. this bridge and the tunnel in front is a masterpiece of old architecture

Lucky Timing!. I was lucky to have just arrived in Budapest at sundown so headed straight down to the riverbank to check out the sights along the Danube as the sun came down. Was the perfect time to see The Chain bridge in daylight and night within the same hour!
Beautiful from afar..worth walking over. The bridge looks stunning from the Danube, especially when it's lit up at night. It was nice to walk across it but it is just another bridge.

Very nice bridge . The bride itself is very nice especially at night. Once you are there walk through as it gives a very cool panorama, however the bride is in a bit of poor condition but you should not be scared.
nice to see up close. Depending on where you come from a suppose a bridge is a bridge but as we don't have such things in my country i thought it very beautiful:-)

Nice walk and great views over the river. I recommend walking over this bridge at night. It's lit up beautifully after dark and easy to walk across. It connects the Buda and Pest sides and provides great views over the river. I wouldn't necessarily say walking across the Chain Bridge is a must-do while you're in Budapest, but seeing the beautiful Parliament building at night is definitely a must and the two can easily be combined in one night. If you're staying on the Pest side then walk across the Chain Bridge, enjoy the stroll, and then see the Parliament building from the Buda side across the river.

Walk across it and enjoy the experience. Wrap up warm, wear good walking shoes, avoid the cyclists and walk from Pest to Buda, or from Buda to Pest - it is worth the effort. There are many photographic opportunities during your adventure. The lions 'guard' the bridge and there is a saying that the architect wanted the bridge to be perfect in its original design. He said that he would jump into the Danube if a fault was found. When it was pointed out to him that the lions did not have any tongues - he had to jump, but he lived to tell the tale!
Goodviews of the Danube and Parliament. Take a stroll across the ridge to add to your collection of memories from Budapest. The stroll doesn't take long
A Bridge. To me this bridge is nothing special it's just a bridge. What I did notice is that lovers have attached padlocks to the lights strung across the bridge.

Beautiful at night!. A striking landmark, so beautifully lit up at night. One of the many bridges to cross the Danube between Pest and Buda, but possibly the most quaint - particularly with the 'locks of love' attached to the lights on the bridge.
An Average Bridge. Other than the history behind the bridge there really isn't anything remarkable about it. It is worth seeing but so are all the other bridges over the Danube.

Link over the Danube. To clarify, the chain bridge has no more chains. It used to be a chain bridge a long time ago, but now it is all steel. It is certainly worth a walk over the bridge as it provides some great photo perspectives, both when approaching the Buda side and the look back to the Pest side. The bridge is a little long so if you don't like to walk or don't have good walking shoes, you will not enjoy the walk. A little tip, if you want to walk on one side going and the other side coming back, then the way to 'cross' the bridge at the end, is to get off the bridge on your side cross UNDER the bridge - there is a walk way - and then get on to the bridge again on the other side. Enjoy your time in Budapest. It is a beautiful city!

Easy walk crossing the Danube. Easy walk from the Pest side towards Castle Hill. Dropped off from the hop on hop off bus and great Kodak moments with the lions, the view of the Castle Hill. Watch out for bicycles. My thoughts upon crossing the bridge was the history of the river beneath (how many lives were thrown into that river) and such an inspiration for a song.The walk also brings the promise of the beauty of what is Buda and the view of the Pest side.
Nice walk. Pleasant walk across the bridge with views down the Danube. One of the things you should do in Budapest, but not overly exciting.

oh, the lions!. I was born and raised in Budapest, so this review might be biased, but I think if you're here, just take a walk through this bridge. Both sides are amazing, especially at sunset in the summer. The bridge is a historic monument beautifully restored, still carrying the characteristics of an era long passed. It's nicely lit at night and there are lions at both bridgeheads, guarding the bridge. As a kid, I loved them. :) But really, a city-centre walk including the Chain Bridge is kind of the first thing to do at Budapest. Don't miss out on it.

A piece of History. This a landmark of all Budapest like the Parliament and the Castle Hill and both are seen from the Bridge.Cross the bridge from the Pest side to the Buda on the right side to have the best views of the Parliament which just glows in the sun on the Blue Danube.Look at the wonderful detail on the Bridge and the huge lions at the either end - which have no tongues.

The bridge with the urban legend of the "tongueless lions". Budapest is known for its beautiful bridges over the Danube and this one is a great work of art from the 19th century. It was severely damaged during World War Two and rebuild in the years after.An interesting thing is an existing urban legend which was told to us by our tour guide through Budapest. The Chain Bridge is "guarded" by four lions. At the inauguration, the sculptor was so proud of his work that he said that the animals are done with so much attention to details that they appear to be real. But seen from below, the lions look like they lack tongues. So a person from the crowd told the artist that he made some "tongueless lions". He was so ashamed that he threw himself in the river.Anyway it is a great spot for admiring the city views and the Danube.
Picturesque. The chain bridge is very grand, both daytime and at night when it's lit up. It was nice to walk over and stand on the bridge and look up and down the Danube and the great views.

Beautiful bridge. We stayed at the Intercontinental and so the bridge was right on our doorstep. The bridge is a stunning piece of architecture viewed from afar, but also offers beautiful views of the city when you are stood on it. On a practical note, it made crossing over from Pest to Buda for meals and sights very easy.
Great in the dark. Start walking across the bridge while it's still daylight. Wlk up towards the castle and see the bridge in full light.
Superb. Stunning views of the dunube, well worth a visit. Walked along the bridge and stopped for a coffee the other side..beautiful

Beautiful walk. Hi,
if you are lucky and the weather is good make sure to walk the bridge! it's magnificent!
Just take your time and stop frequently to look around. View changes with every step!

Nice enough. As far as bridges go, it's decent enough! We crossed it during one of the walking tours (2.5hr) from Pest to Buda and we were told it was designed by a British architect and based on one in England. My girlfriend rightfully guessed that it was based on one in Marlow!The bridge features a few 'love locks' along the way, however you're encouraged to use a dedicated place in Erzsébet tér instead rather than the bridge, as I imagine they remove the locks from time to time.
Close it to Vehicles. Suberb bridge bombed by the RAF in World War 2. It should be closed to traffic and become like Charles Bridge in Prague

Easy to walk across, beautiful to see. This is the epicenter of Budapest's touriism, but well worth a visit, especially at night when the bridge and castle are all lit up. Walk across the bridge day or night, it is safe and a quick 10 to 15 minute walk from Pest to Buda. Or look at the beautiful bridge while walking along the Danube.

beautiful sightseeing. we went in december to budapest and chose to see various things including the chain bridge, we did this on foot walking across taking in the veiws of the river danube all be it wasnt a very clear day but was well worth doing, wewalked across and took the fenicular to the top of castle hill where you can again see the fantastic veiws all over budapest.we then took a river cruise in the evening and seen it all again with the lights making it all look spectacularwell worth a visit, the only downside was that a few people were begging for money across both sides of the bridge.once at the top of castle hill you can browse the grounds and shops and some lovely little coffee shops

Magnificent suspension bridge. The Chain Bridge is a bridge that spans the River Danube and connects Buda with Pest (at the time of its construction, still two separate cities: a temporary bridge was only available in the summertime)The iron chains, on which the road-bed hangs, gave the bridge its name (lánchid in Hungarian language).

Beautiful views of Buda & Pest. Walking across the bridge is historic in itself, leave alone the views you can get from the bridge. For a complete view of the bridge, you should climb the Gellert Hill or take a furnicular train. One can feel the link between the twin cities of Buda & Pest. The lighted views at night are the best. We clicked some amazing photographs. Also, it is the most prominent bridge historically.
Great views of the city!. Budapest is so beautiful, and this is one the best places to appreciate the Danube, passersby, life, boats and views of the Pest and the Buda.

A link between Buda and Pest. This is one of the many bridges that traverse the Danube river. It serves a great connection between the two parts of the city. It is beautiful both during the day and during the night. We saw it during the day from a distant viewpoint and we passed underneath it during a dinner cruise. It's a nice attraction.

A staple of any Budapest visit. This bridge is to Budapest what the tower is to Paris, you simply have to see it. It is worth seeing at daytime and beautifully lit at night. We walked across it and even went on the river under it. The history of the bridge is interesting too.
Beautiful views. The Chain Bridge offers some breathtaking views but, be careful because it can get very windy up there! A wonderful place from which to see Budapest by night.

The Chain Bridge. The Chain Bridge is difficult to miss as it is one of the main connections that links Buda and Pest. It looks beautiful by day but comes into its own at night as it looks absolutely stunning. It really stands out against the night sky and is worth a trip down to the riverside to see.

Another chain bridge. This is just another, albeit beautiful like many bridges, river crossing. As an attraction it probably isn't a destination but should be walked across as an access to the other part of the city, depending which side you start from. If there is any breeze about it will be worse on this bridge - in our case the crossing was miserable
Great views. I was on a bus tour but got off the bus, just to walk across the bridge. A bit like crossing the Brooklyn Bridge in a sense. Sensational views
Magnificent. Can't decide if it's more spectacular from a far or when you're near it. Practical as well as beautiful.
Lovely views. Walk across this it gives a different Vista to the city also the open top bus is good value to see all of the sights. This is very pretty lit up at night

Drama and the Sculptor. The Chain Bridge was the first bridge to bring together Buda and Pest. It was designed by William Tierney Clark, an English engineer based on a bridge he built earlier over the River Thames (the Marlow Bridge). The sculptor János Marschalkó carved the lions on the abutments in the entry from stone and believed them to be the perfect sculptures. According to our guide, during the unveiling, someone pointed out that the lions did not have any tongues and Janos was so distraught that he threw himself in the river (but he was saved). Chain Bridge drama! But the views from the bridge are very nice, and the lions look fierce even without tongues.
Very nice walk. Beautiful sorriundings and hotels. It is very good to walk there!!! I would love to do every time when it is dark and the lights are on! Wonderful!

Incredible views! - May 2013. We walked the length of the bridge a couple of times; once with a tour and once again ourselves. The views both ways are extraordinary and the Parliament building was a great complement to the already astounding scenery. The Pest side of the bridge is guarded by 2 stone lions, the sculptor of which was so proud that he challenged someone to find any mistake with them. If one was found, he promised to kill himself. A child was quick to notice the lack of tongues, and as the legend goes, the man was so distraught that he jumped into the Danube.
Brilliant . Great stroll around budapest!! perfect views can be seen from the bridge and perfect to do a loop while checking out the sights
Best at night. To enjoy Chain Bridge the most, pop by at night. There are some magnificent views of the Danube and Buda Castle to be enjoyed here. The lighting of the bridge is stellar too.

Outstanding!. The view of this bridge is the best! It's great at night in Winter, because the trees don't block the view of the lights from any direction. We've walked across it, and viewed it from both ends. We can't say enough good things about it.
Great views of Buda & Pest. Wonderful bridge joining the two parts of the city. You get spectacular views down the river of both the castle & parliament building.

A must see.. There are already a lot of other positive reviews about the bridge and this is no exception. At night obviously it looks incredible. We saw it from the top of our hotel room and with all the lights it is spectacular. Walking along it to cross the Danube to Buda you can see various other sights such as Buda Castle, the Citadella and Parliament. Along the bridge there are locks inscribed with couples names, dates and other likeness. I'm not sure if one is allowed to add to them but I can't see any reason not to. You don't have to pay to get to the bridge or go along it and it is 10 second walk from The Four Seasons Hotel. An important piece of any trip to Budapest.

Iconic Budapest bridge. This bridge is always shown as the main attraction in the centre of Budapest. The chain bridge divides Buda and Pest, was the first permanent bridge between the two cities and was opened in 1849. Designed by an English engineer in wrought iron and stone, the bridge was manufactured in sections in England and shipped to the city for final assembly. The opening of the bridge was instrumental in the vast change in the economy and culture of the two cities.The most stunning view is at night from the river.
Chain Bridge, Budapest, Hungary. Excellent view, amazing bridge. This is the link between Buda and Pest with a difference between the old and modern architecture.
Stunning at night. So romantic at night, the gold lights are incredible at night- be sure to visit and see from a distance as well as walking along it.
Very nice. Its much nicer in the evening with the lights on, you can take nice photos of the bridge and the Parliament from Citadella. you need to cross the bridge while you are there too ;)

Good views. There were some very good views to be had on Chain Bridge. Especially around sun set. Going over the bridge, you can also get a pretty good look at the Four Seasons, which is down as a tourist attraction here on Trip Advisor.

Go to Marlow - its prettier. Ultimately this is a bridge with a busy road over it. You can walk over it to get to the Castle area but the bridge by the same designer in Marlow Bucks is pretty much identical in design and much nicer to look at.

Crossing the Chain Bridge. Can't visit Budapest without travelling over Chain Bridge. We experienced the walk across on a cold, rainy January day so didn't spend too long admiring the views but the next sunny day climbed up high at Gellert Hill and the Citadel and could really appreciate the structure straddling the Danube.
Lovely looking bridge. There were some great little facts about the bridge dotted about the city. So keep your eyes peeled.

Must see.. A nice bridge, but still a bridge.
What are you doing after you cross it, that's the question.
Very nice photo-setting at night though.

Beautiful day and night. We visited the bridge at all hours of the day and it is beautiful at any time. Easy access to the bridge, and safe pedestrian paths. Lovely view of the Danube and kind of cool to straddle Buda and Pest

best in budapest. dont drive over this bridge walk and soak up the scenery budapest has a lot of nice bridges and this is probably the best
try the sight seeing buses to well worth the money but dont forget to barter

I can confirm bridge status. Having walked the length of the span and inspected (without mechanical intrusion) the structural elements required to constitute a bridge; I can confirm that this indeed, a bridge.Furthermore, it has the benefit of joining one side to another enabling a successful transition from either side, although only tested in one direction on this occasion, I did witness others crossing in the opposite direction. Ideal for foot and road traffic, it is unfortunately inadequate for rail or boat crossing.
Budapest has many beautiful bridges and this is one of them. Budapest is a walkable city so enjoy its beautiful scenery! We used the chain bridge to walk across danube.
been there!. had an opportunity to take photos of the bridge on both ends...angle and time of the day. The night one is my favourite. Its amazingly beautiful!
Beautiful at night. We walked over this bridge at night after exploring castle hill. It gave us a beautiful view of both Buda and Pest.
Beautiful. Not entirely sure how to review a bridge but TripAdvisor seemed to want me to. It's a beautiful structure, especially when it's lit up at night.

TRESURE CHAIN ! Loved IT.... Its not possible to imagine Budapest without this Bridge.Its symbol of a city. destroyed in WWII and after that rebuild.Very huge gates and nice design. with 2 Lions in every side.best location of the city.Highly recommend to take time walking along and take some shots in the day and night.Its like a GEM that gives much Value to BUDAPEST !

A work of Art. Budapest is very proud of its bridges and quite rightly so. They are monuments of a time when beauty was as important and practicality. Built to last they have seen terrible times but have been restored where possible to their original engineered brilliance.
One of the "has to be seen". A nice, good looking bridge, that you obviously has to see while in Budapest. And why not walk across it to get to the other side? Healthier and cheaper than a taxi! :)
wedding anniversary trip. very impressive bridge which was located very close to our hotel. some excellent views of both sides of the Danube. Superb when lighten up at night

Meh.. Yeah, so I walked across this but I wouldn't say that it is necessarily a stop you should definitely make. You can easily see it from Castle Hill, which is where it should be seen from. Walking across it wasn't anything special though. If you want a view of the Danube you can walk across any bridge there.
Beautiful at night. Huge and imposing bridge across the Danube. You really appreciate just how fast the river is flowing when you look over the side!
Majestic!. Outstanding bridge , really reminding one of the greatness of the Hungarian capital in the past and nowadays.Great view from all the high points in Buda, especially at night!

Very pretty. Particularly attractive at night when it's lit up. The views from there are quite breath taking. Get a clear day and you can look at the eclectic architecture on the 'Buda' side. It rally is where east meets west.

A Beautiful Bridge Day or Night. There is no way you can visit Budapest and miss this bridge unless you don't leave your room. It's the best way to walk from the tourist area of Buda to the tourist area of Pest. OK It's only a bridge, but a walk over it is a must.

A very pleasant walk from Pest to Buda. Incredible design, great photo shots.
So much to look at on the bridge it's self and the views beyond.
But watch out for the cyclists who use the pavement as well.

Make sure to see this at night. What a great history this bridge has. The best time to see the bridge is at night when it is lit and really looks gorgeous. Great way to get from the Buda to the Pest side and back.

Best to cross the Danube on foot. The chain bridge connects two iconic squares of the city: Széchenyi tér and Clark Ádám tér. The first permanent Danube bridge (1849) gives its best at night: it is illuminated by hundreds of tiny light bulbs.

Stunning views and engineering!. Enjoy the historic walk on the large pedestrian paths on either the south or north sides of the bridge. This bridge employed many "firsts" in steel construction when built. It is an amazing work of engineering and art --much like waking the Brooklyn Bridge in New York City. Very easy to traverse and crossing East to West puts you at the base of Palace Hill. Enjoy!

Engineering history. The history behind this bridge is amazing, from being the longest suspension bridge when first built to being virtually totally demolished in WW2. Worth walking across to see the engineering involved in its construction.
beautiful and bright lit bridge. The bridge was beautiful and beautiful especially during night time. There was no traffic and it was nice to cross the bridge. The bridge seemed to be solid and safe.

Historic and useful. The bridge is an iconic building in Hungary and symbolises the unification of Buda and Peste. Not necessarily beautiful but striking and looks stunning when lit up at night. Worth a trip across as there are interesting things to do at both ends of it.

go by river, by night. the best time to see this bridge is at night. The best approach is by river. But any time is good. Firs time there, there was a bridge festival going on. Great memories! Not this time, but we had a great water approach and walked across the bridge several times getting around town. My favorite bridge in Budapest.

Nostalgic walk. The bridge is quite unique and the history of the builder and why it was originally built make the walk intriguing. Do it in the warmer weather as the wind and cold in the winter can be challenging. However in the summer with all the river boat tourists is busy. The view to either shore is quite impressive

must-see bridge. great views from the reconstruction of the original bridge (destroyed in WW2) that linked Buda and Pest to form Budapest in the late 19th century. Fantastic, free views of Buda, Pest, and the Danube!
A must to walk across. It was fun to see the bridge up close and take photos of all the views surrounding it. The famous Lion statues are a great photo opportunity. Very romantic, too!
I don't get tired to say it: amazing !!!. There so many bridges in Budapest, and each one of them is amazing. I recommend a boat tour thru the Danube river so u can admire all bridges :)
Gorgeous. A beautiful bridge steeped in the city´s history. Worth visiting both during the day and night and is especially fun and beautiful on New Year´s Eve.
Looks great at night. Not especially impressive during daylight, but with the lights reflecting in the Danube it's really spectacular at night.
Walk it after dark, at least once. What a nice walk after dark. Great for an after-dinner stroll. Beautiful landmark & great spot to view/take photos of both Buda and Pest.
Beautiful at night. Like most of budapest this attraction is best seen at night. Whilst here go on the funicular railway nearby

Nice views. Great views for free! If you like walking, make sure you walk over this bridge. Booking a hotel near the Chain bridge is a great idea if you wish to explore the castle. Both sides of this bridge offer something interesting to look at and you will not be disappointed.

Nice walk !. We walked over the bridge In Pouring rain ! - no one else there at all ! - very safe and good views of the Danube let and right and across the city. Once over from Pest to Buda do either walk up castle hill or take the cable car and walk down.
So old, but so nice... The bridge is essential for Budapest atmosphere. The view from it is very nice. During the night, the way it is illuminated makes a rather romantic landscape.

Chain Bridge!!. [No Budapest without this bridge.
One of the most beautiful bridges in the world, the evening is much more beautiful and impressive. Surely worth cross it and enjoy the views. Spectacular place. Must visit

One of Budapest's symbols. Built on mid of XIX century, due to initiative of count Széchenyi, from whom it got its name, this bridge was the first one to permanently connect the two towns of Buda and Pest, which were separated from each other by river Danube until then (before, the passage between the towns was allowed thanks to a barges bridge).It connects the Széchenyi square, in front of Gresham Palace (at Pest side), to the Adam Clark square, from which the historical Castle hill funicular is rising to the Buda Castle.The Chain Bridge constitutes one of the symbols of Budapest, very suggestive in the night, when it’s enlightened by many lamps, practically drawing its contour, and is one of preferred settings for a photo, with the Buda Castle as background.Its crossing by walking takes 5 to 10 min, and allows to look into the details of its construction, very similar to a chain, of course on larger scale; two big lions, at Pest side entrance, seem to be monitoring the people and transport media crossing the bridge.
Gorgeous !!!!. Beautiful,breathtaking..another must see night spot. Walk it!. I could go there 100 times. Great views and interesting people . Will definitely return to the Chain Bridge !

So stunning at night. Walking across the Chain Bridge is a must do - take a padlock with you to attach to the flood lights along the way - there's not many there yet but I think in a couple of years there will be. It's beautiful at night and a great way to walk over the Danube to explore Buda
Great Overall View. Great spot to visit when you first get to Budapest. Gives you good quick look at what's around and helps get your bearings

A walk to Remember. Chain Bridge is half a kilometer long.All along the chain bridge, You see a lot of tourists stopping and looking over Danube river. Chain bridges connect Buda to Pest. i am sure, you will walk over the chain bridge at least twice :)

The best over Danube. There are lot's of Bridges in Budapest over the Danube but this one is the best expecially when lighted at night. A stroll over it is a must during any visit to Budapest even if during cold days, the magnificent views will warm anyone. Make sure to walk both ways as each way looks at different side with different views.

bring a love lock!. This bridge connects Pest and Buda. It is an easy walk to get across the brigde and is conveniently located to downtown Pest. The bridge connects you to the Buda side near the incline. On our walk across the bridge, we noticed that many people have put love locks on various parts of the bridge. Wish we did - would have been awesome to go back 20 years from now to see if the lock is still there. Definitely worth the taking a few minutes to walk across the bridge spanning the Danube.

Great views of the Danube. I visited the Chain Bridge on 17 December 2014. The bridge looked beautiful, spanning the Danube. The bridge wasn't as interesting as I expected when I walked across it though.

from Buda to Pest, over the magic Danube. Crossing the bridge brings a kind of magic feeling. Couldn´t prevent to imagine history and souls, and also i enjoyed the beautiful architecture and the impressive sight-seen . A plus not to miss at Budapest.

A bridge for bridge enthusiasts. There's several bridges over the Danube, but this one is the best of them. They light it up at night, so be sure to visit also when the sun goes down. It somehow reminded me of the Brooklyn Bridge in New York.

Great River Vantage Point!. Great for taking pictures of the river and boats along the shore. It was cold the day we walked it, but loved every step.
Great engineering in providing spacious walkways on either side!
Great at night. The views from the bridge are great during the day but even better during the night! The bridge connects you to central locations in both Buda and Pest

Nice bridge. Nice bridge to make some photos of Danube river, and ships on it.
Also is interesting experience about sound of trafic there, everything vibrate :)

Beautiful!. For me is the most known sight of Budapest. A symbol. It is for the city what Eiffel Tower is for Paris. Highly recognisable, beautiful and provides a great view of both sides of the city divided by Danube. Don't skip to walk it, especially at night. It is gorgeous and so romantic with all those lights! The huge lions that guard the entrances were made by a Slovak artist and there is a legend saying that when they revealed them to the people, a little girl noticed that the lions didn't have tongues and the artist got so ashamed and devastated that he jumped from the bridge! I don't know if it's true but the lions don't have tongues! They are so majestic though!

Outstanding. Although there are several bridges between Buda and Pest, the chain bridge stands out as a unique and beautiful connection between the two cities. It is one of the many mavels of this magnificent city.

Nice Place for a Stroll. Designed by English engineer William Tierney Clark in 1839, Budapest's Chain bridge may look rather familiar to UK residents. That's because it's nearly an enlarged version of the Thames-traversing Marlowe Bridge in Marlowe, England, which is also, coincidentally, a Clark construct. The lions that guard the bridge also appear suspiciously like miniatures of the bronze lions found in London's Trafalgar Square. No matter! The Budapest structure is quite lovely AND quite convenient! An excellent addition to your walking-tour of banks of the Danube. Here's an idea: Start in Pest, viewing the Shoes on the Danube Memorial, just 100 yards or so upstream from the Chain Bridge. Then walk across the bridge, take the funicular up the incline, and spend an afternoon in Buda at the Presidential Palace, Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion. Take the funicular down, cross the Chain Bridge, and grab a light meal at Pepper's in the Budapest Marriott. The hubby and I did this and had an excellent excursion.
The bridge is like any other bridge. That about sums it up. Except that you can walk across it and get great views of Buda Castle, the Parliament and the Pest side.
impressive at night. lovely at night!! lovely to see when on night cruise! easy to walk over from Buda to Pest!! lovely to see down the river
Average. Yes, it's beautiful, but a little boring if you've already been to Prague and expect smth like St. Charles bridge. Also no souveniers/painters etc. I've expected more.

Iconic Budapest bridge - perfect!. If you want a classic souvenir picture of Budapest, this is one iconic bridge complete with lions that is perfect. Daytime or nightime, sunny or rain; take pictures and enjoy the bridge composition and art walk. Safe and easy to walk across.

Magnificent. The bridge is beautiful during the day but at night it is ever more amazing. The lights come on after dark & illuminate this stunning bridge. 100% the nicest looking of the many bridges that connect Buda to Pest.

Beautifully impressive bridge!!. This is by far the prettiest of Budapest's bridges. It is equally impressive both day and night when illuminated. Linking Buda and Pest, it doesn't take long to walk across and the views from here are worth it.
Mood changer. The lions on the Chain Bridge are almost scary but I loved the link between Buda and Pest, with the funicular rising on the Buda side of this fascinating city.
From pest to buda. Nice bridge that serves its purpose as the the five that connects pest and Buda .though we liked but nothing special .however it has to be seen

Beautiful bridge ... especially at night. We visited the bridge day and night. Beautiful scenery ... Romantic place
Visit the bridge at night ....you will not be disappointed

Serves it's purpose. An OK bridge that fits in well with its surrounds. Nothing spectacular though; not in the same league as, say, Charles Bridge in Prague. Good for crossing the river but not a must see.
Beautiful with a Dusting of Snow. Beautiful to ride or walk across. This is taken from the Pest side traveling over to Buda. So glad to see this iconic bridge just last week.

Chain Bridge. I guess this is on everyone's list of "must-see" things in Budapest but in truth it's average. All the other bridges along this stretch of the Danube are equally as picturesque and worth a visit. Take a stroll from Liberty Bridge up to the Parliament buildings and see what I mean. We did it in minus 5 temperatures and still enjoyed it. On a summers day it must be brilliant.
Amazing view. To walk on this bridge and look at both Pest and Buda side is a great experience andamazing panorama.
Sweet. Take a walk from Buda to pest or vice versa. It's free, gets windy, but great for pics. I wish I had time to walk along side the Buda castle from the ground
Charming. Our hotel room looked over the bridge giving an almost fairy tail look every evening. Easy to walk. There was nothing I disliked about it.

Oldest Bridge of Budapest. Chainbridge was built between 1839-1849 upon the plans of William Tierney Clark (GB). It was bombarded down under the 2nd WW., rebuilt in 1949. This bridge is the symbol of river Danube's hungarian section and one of Budapest's most nicest archistructural monument.

Picturesque!. Go at dust for some beautiful picture taking as the lights come on the bridge and buildings at the end of the bridge. You will capture some memorable photo's to share with friends and to remember your trip. The Number 16 bus goes by and crosses the bridge so you can jump on and off on your way to and from the City Center metro stop and Castle Hill!

Part of Budapest's Soul. Walk across the Chain Bridge. Admire its structure, history and beauty. Know you are above the Danube, and admire both Buda and Pest. This is as good as it gets. Originally built in 1839-1849; Replaced in 1914-1915; Destroyed by the Germans in 1945 and rebuilt in 1949 as it is today.

Amazing. Our hotel was close to the Chain bridge so every day we saw it. The bridge is huge like other bridges in Budapest. It very historical and beautiful. When we took a ship trip we heard guide explanations about every bridge.

Beautiful.. The lions on the ends guarding this bridge are really powerful. Amazing to see how this bridge and others were destroyed during the war and yet refurbished so incredibly. The lights at night are beautiful as well.

Spectacular Span Across the Danube!. This bridge provides a pleasant means of walking from Pest to Buda or the reverse as well as some interesting views and photo opportunities. It cuts the Pest side in half with the left side mostly government related buildings and the right side the center of commercial Pest. It is especially beautiful at night when the bridge and some of the major buildings on both sides are illuminated. A stroll along the Pest Promenade gives the viewer some wonderful sights.
Nice views. It's a bridge, not much to say, has its own pedestrian path, so safe to walk across and also stop for photos
Great way to walk from Buda to Pest or vice versus. Great walk over and across the Danube from one side of the city to the other. The vistas from the bridge are just amazing.

ROMANTIC. One of the several beautiful Budapest bridges ove the Danube river. I can spend day walking over bridges in Budapest. They are all very nice and it is lovely for walking from one side to another of city. For me bridge which conect hotel Gelert is the most beatiful. You can take u bike and ride over all bridges and near river and enjoyed one day of your stay.

A walk across the bridge over Danube. It is a historical bridge and worth a leisurely walk . Plenty of opportunity for great photos of the scenic beauty. I walked in the evening to reach the palace on the other side which itself in the evening light looked fabulous. And the chain bridge itself presents a great view with lions on either side of the bridges. A must to see in Budapest.
Great photo ops. Great opportunities for Photos day/night here at this bridge. Holocaust Monument is also very near as is Parliament and Funicular to Castle Hill - can't miss it!

Great Way to Cross. Great way to cross the Danube. The views of the river are very lovely as you cross the bridge. Very nice walk across in the daytime. However, the bridge is lit at night--incredible
A beautiful view durig night. Even december, in a clear weather a beautiful view for both sides. Do not forget to take your camera with you.

Amazing at night. We arrived at Budapest early evening and drove across this bridge as the lights came on, it looks very impressive all lit up, a beautiful sight. It was bigger than I was expecting, crossing -as a pedestrian- was fine, some terrific views too.
Chain bridge - very pretty. The best time to see the bridge is after sun set when the lights are on.. The bridge looks very pretty and is a great sight when u see it from the riverside

Beautiful bridge over the Danube. This is a beautiful bridge which we saw both during the day and at night. We went over it and saw it from below on a boat. The city including the bridge, is very well lit at night which creates a fabulous environment which was enjoyed by many people of many varying ages.
YEP - a bridge. for all you fans of bridges - this is a must - for those who use them to cross things - a must to use -

Brigde over the River Danube. You have to walk the walk over this iconic bridge from Buda to Pest - it's a must do. And you also have to return to see it at night and to see the wonderful castle and Parliament building form the other side of the river. Stunning

Use your feet. A great walk across. Interesting to see the padlocks left by people. Also nice views of the river and city from each side of the bridge. Puts into context that Buda and Pest are two very different places
So strong and so much history.. Imagine how many people have been passing tru this strong and steady bridge each day going to Buda and Pest. At the bridge you see the beauty of each side of Budapest.

Beautiful Bridge on a beautiful River. Loved the Danube and the many bridges with this one being quite special. Great to walk on and even better to look at. Loved in the day and night..must do walk at both times of the day. Fabulous even in winter
Iron Chain bridge, Budapest. Very impressive sight to see from many different angles, and to cross, knowing how beautifully made it was at the time of it's design
very beautiful. right int he heart of Budapest it connects Buda with Pesh right near Parliament and the royal residence. Vistas were amazing

Chain Bridge. To sail under this bridge when it is all lit up is a wonderful experience. Love the way Hungary takes care of its building treasures.. Site not to miss. Was disappointed not to see it and the Parliament one last time the night we drove to the airport!
Great views!. Any way you choose to walk up/down this bridge gives you beautiful views of the Danube and the city.

The night view is impressive. The bridge connecting Buda and Pest, and made the city become Budapest. It's nice place to walk with many beautiful buildings in the area. Parliament building and Buda Castle can be seen from here. The night view is impressive. With many lights and lamps hanging on the bridges.
Stunning Bridge. The bridge once lit at night is nothing short of being stunning. Walk across it to get a beautiful view of the city as well as the bridge itself.

Most beautiful bridge. Only after walking over i realised how bit Danube is. And is well worth it. Don't miss all the stories about the bridge:1.count has missed his father's funeral when the ferry service across the Danube was halter due to bad weather, resolved to build a permanent bridge across the Danube.2. the sculptor forgot to carve out the lions' tongues and when a boy made a remark a bout it on the opening ceremony, he was so embarrassed that he jumped of the bridge into the Danube.3.according to the anecdote, they push the bridge to the tunnel behind it when it rains to prevent it from getting wet.Enjoy the beautiful sights, but be aware of bikers.
Fantastic view. We really enjoyed walking through this bridge. It is very old, beautiful piece of art and history. There is a great view to the Castle and to the Parliament

Iron Beauty. When in Budapest the Chain Bridge is well worth a look and is on the way to the Castle area of Buda. on a sunny day images of this bridge can be included in your album to improve it greatly.
A very fine bridge. Not to be missed.
Beautiful at Night. We sailed on the Danube on an evening cruise and the chain bridge is impressive at night with all of the lights - almost magical!

Beautiful at night time. Lovely bridge that looks beautiful at nighttime and excellent for a touristy picture.
From this point we visited the funicular and the Castle district.
Whilst this is not the most beautiful bridge in Europe, it's a nice crossing and good to see en route to something else
Walking value. Both night and day, a place to be seen either on foot and by boat to cross. Night landscape is going great.
Lovely Bridge. We worked over the bridge as it was designed by a Brit Adams when we went over to Buda for a morning well worth a trip.

A long walk. During our 5-day stay we walked across this bridge in biting cold winds so many times and it seemed to go on for ever! It was close to our hotel (Boutique Victoria) and a convenient way of crossing the Danube.

Just ok. Its a nice bridge when viewed from afar and good for photography when its lit up at night but standing on the bridge it is very average if compared to Charles Bridge in Prague or the Tower Bridge in London.

chain bridge.. Great crossing point acrooss the danube, brilliant for photos. Chain bridge like all bridges across the danube rebuilt after ww2 as germans destroyed them to try to halt allied advances.

Lovely, especially at night. We were lucky enough to sail into Budapest on Viking Lif, at nighttime. Standing up on deck with glasses of Schnapps. The whole City skyline is stunning, especially at nighttime. And athe Chain Bridge is absolutely beautiful. Designed by an Englishman, built in Britain and shipped out. At the same time and by the same people, the little Funicular and tunnel were built on the Buda side. Well worth a visit.
Make sure to walk it at night. The views you get from any pic the bridges is great, but the view of the castles and statues from the chain bridge is awesome, especially at night
Absolutely beautiful. I feel like this is one of the most beautiful bridges in the world. Great photo opportunities from entrances on both sides. Great views.
Great Look. It is amazing how this bridge looks! i think it is one in the world! i wait for opportunity to come again!

Unusual !. My husband and I walked across the chain bridge quite a few times. Strangely, it wobbles as you walk over but you still feel safe ! I'm not sure of it's age but I would guess at very old. The lion statues at each end are reminiscent of the ones in Trafalgar Square !
Attractive. Wonderful bridge which connect the two sides of Budapest, best view is during the night when the bridge is lighted, at the moment you understand why called the chain bridge.
Great views!. Definitely worth a visit, especially if it's a nice day! Lovely views! And both sides of the river have something to offer! I suggest walking over on one side and back on the other!
Walk It. This is a must do when visiting Budapest. We walked the bridge to Castle Hill and then saw it lit up at night on a boat tour. It is also not far from the Shoes on the Danube.

Great architecture. Great tourist attraction. Wait for the night view by the river or if possible hop on the river cruise. The view from the river is stunning. You need to experience both day and night view of this bridge.
Great views and photos. Such a beautiful bridge,my husband and I got some wonderful pictures during our stay. Very unique and romantic especially at night when the city is all lit up
Photoholics Dream. I just couldnt get enough with the angles and different places to shoot this grand chain bridge...looked wonderful at day and night both
respect to the art. this bridge so notorious with the architect who built this bridge so there are several bridges if i am not wrong about 8 bridges to see has own histories

Pictures don't do this bridge justice.. Had be seeing pictures of the Chain Bridge on the Viking Cruise website for some time and couldn't wait until we arrived in Budapest for our Christmas Market Cruise. The bridge is amazing both up close and at a distance. Got some great pictures at night and in the day. Worth the trip to see.

Beautiful Structure. Beautiful Bridge it is stunning especially at night and seen from the river on the cruise boat its so spectacular with the quality lighting on the bridge and its is the bridge that takes you over too the Gellert Hotel
Nice bridge with great views. Excellent views of both Buda and Pest from this bridge. Particularly nice to walk at night. Best views of the bridge itself are from nearby Castle Hill.

Better from afar. I'd recommend taking in this sight during a walk on the riverside at night, but don't go near it as the wrought-iron railing is infested with spiders that are attracted to the heat of the lights used to illuminate it. Not a very pretty sight on close-up. Not to mention the horrible smell of exhaust pipes due to traffic.
Excellent. Was a fantastic view looking at the bridge being on the bridge. Walking over the bridge an experience to enjoy and capture.

very practical and looks nice. very nice bridge we were staying just next to it so it sort of became a usual convenient way to cross to the buda side
put your lock on it and cross

Good Views. Yes as said, one can get good views from this bridge.
This is one of a number of bridges across the river at Budapest but probably the most famous due to its position, age and style.
You can walk across the bridge from Buda to Pest or vise versa
I liked it. A really nice bridge restored post bombing, and leads to a lovely area of the city. Looks great at night with the lights and from afar.
Nice but another bridge. Interesting but another bridge. Good views from it and I just used it to cross the Danube. I guess im not big bridge fan. But still mildly interesting
Connecting Buda with Pest. Worth a walk across to visit the varying sights on both ends. Lovely in the evening as it's well lit. You'll get some great photos too.
a must see. i guess you should see this bridge if you are in Budapest. It connects Buda to Pest among other bridges nearby.

Easy walk. Walk across the Chain Bridge during the day and at night. The views are spectacular both ways. The city is so beautiful at night when all of the buildings are lit up. Both sides of the river have amazing buildings that you view.
Underwhelming. Nice to walk across to say you've done it - but lots of cars and a restricted view.Its architect also designed the bridge over the Thames at Marlow!
Beautiful Bridge. Beautiful bridge to walk on especially late evening. It is a must visit for couples or families. Definitely worth a walk.

This bridge was built at the same time as the Eiffel Tower. The most famous of Budapest's bridges it was completely restored after its destruction at the end of the Second World War and is simply beautiful.

Have to walk the Chain Bridge.. Trucks and large vehicles are not allowed to cross the Chain Bridge as apparently the Hungarians are not sure how much it will hold. However, it was full of cars. There is a nice walking area on each side, but it is clear that it was designed a long time ago (I think it was 1849) when they weren't as worried about how open the sides are. If you have small children, you'll have to hold their hands as the rails have large gaps in them and my wife kept saying to not get close. In addition, there are some places where the iron plate has rusted completely through on the bottom in some corners so it is clear that Hungary is going to have to come up with some maintenance money to preserve this beautiful bridge. Hopefully they will not let it go too long before they get it fully repaired. The lights on the Chain Bridge are a must see from the river banks.

Much photographed. This bridge had to be rebuilt after World War 2. I have walked across it and driven across it many times. My apartment looked onto it so I saw it every day and night.......such a lucky woman I am!
Favorite Bridge. This is one of our favorite bridges that we have ever crossed. It is an easy walk and leads you right to the tram that will take you to the top of the hill and the castle.
Looks fabulous at night. The bridge is lit up at night and makes for some lovely views by day or night. It can be seen from most viewpoints across the Danube and is definitely worth a look.
Amazing views. Standing on the bridge allows amazing views of the city and parliament building which is especially magical when lit up at night.

My favorite bridge in Hungary. The Chain Bridge was the first permanent stone-bridge connecting Pest and Buda completed in 1849.
On a nice day, it's a beautiful walk across the bridge with breathtaking views.

Chain Bridge Link.. We stumbled upon the Chain Bridge by accident before we got our map of Budapest. This is a most impressive Bridge spanning the River Danube and can best be viewed at night when lit up.

Nice views. I walked the bridge both ways in daylight and at night, and found it to be a nice experience. The bridge itself isn't so exciting, but there are good views to be had of both sides of the river, and it's a must-do for any Budapest trip. It's also lit with some lovely lights at night, so walking one of the neighboring bridges gives a nice view of the Chain Bridge that way, too.

Iconic landmark. The Szechenyi Chain Bridge is a iconic landmark structure over the Danube river, connecting residential Buda and lively Pest.By day you get great views up and down the river and at night it is illuminated and looks stunning against the other attractions of the city.

Sorry a bridge is a bridge is a bridge!. Unless you are a civil engineer there is nothing to really excite you about the bridge..it has a couple of lions at either end but it's a bridge that serves it's purpose and is nice to cross from Buda to Pest

Beautiful. Being hungarian it might be a bit bias but the Chain Bridge is a must see! Especially by night :) A walk along the Danube during the night will give you a breath-taking experience of the lit up Chain Bridge and the Royal Palace across the Danube

An historic city bridge spanning the Danube. This beautiful bridge spans the river Danube in the heart of Budapest. The views of the bridge from the river bank, especially at night, are very beautiful. Probably the most usual way of crossing the bridge is on a number 2 bus, to get up Buda hill, at the top of which are panoramic views across to,the Pest side of the city.
Beautiful 19th century bridge. Beautiful architecture; looks very romantic during the night, when it's being lit with a billion yellow bulbs :)
Excellent!. Every visitor to Budapest MUST come by foot and see this bridge.Very old but in good shape bridge with very beautiful architecture.Great view on Parlament and city.

The most beautiful grandeur bridge. I would be able to gaze at Szechenyi Chain Bridge for hours, whether in the morning or under a hot sun. It looks stunning when the sun is about to set and more gorgeous when the lightnings attached to bridge were lit up at night. Rest assured that those beautiful view are FREE unless you wanted to view it while cruising along the Danube river. Be wise, cruise only after the sunset for opportunity to snap more photos when there's flood light at both sides of Buda and Pest city. It's priceless. Read more about it from the entry in my blog, "http://aswana-cliche.blogspot.com/2014/06/budapest-szechenyi-chain-bridge.html"
Beautiful Bridge. This bridge is beautiful during the day, and stunning at night! The lights across the spans illuminate the profile. The lions at the either end are also stunning.

Just a stately infrastructure one has to see both in the day & at night. take the 16/105 bus from BUDA hill & cross the bridge to the Pest side (to either Dek Ferenc Ter). Public transit is so underrated in Budapest & one of the best gems.

Large Lions guard this impressive bridge.. We walked across this bridge which is one of many stradling the Danube. We also passed underneath it on a night cruise later in the evening. It looks more impressive at night lit up and from the water in my opinion. Its a busy bridge used by cars and buses by day. Some great photo opps.
Great Views Along the Danube . It's a bridge connecting Buda and Pest. Interesting engineering for those who are interested, not much else you can say really

Worth a look.... I travelled here in November 2014 with 3 friends on our day of sightseeing. If its a day with nice weather I would definitely recommend crossing the bridge and viewing the other half of Budapest.If you do find the bridge a bit too much to handle then there are also pubs on either side in close proximity to de-stress!!The only warning I would give is that if you are afraid of heights I would recommend maybe avoiding this as it is higher than it looks!
Breathtaking and picturesque. If possible, walk the chain bridge and take in the beauty of the city from its vantage point. During dusk is a great time for a photo op as well.
Lovely old bridge. We walked across the oldest bridge in Budapest. It is a lovely bridge and quite busy even in chilly November.

Nice lights shine over the bridge!. Wonderful early evening walk across this beautiful bridge. Stop and take in the veiws. A great way to see both the Buda and Pest side, just amazing with great architecture.

Enchanting!. We stayed in our hotel just to make sure that we have this bridge as a view as I have heard a lot of nice things about it. In the evenings, it looked magical. Its design and lighting transported me to wonderland.... It has charm in the mornings and magic in the evenings!

Amazing. When you think of all the work that was put in the making of this bridge and the importance of this bridge you just revel in the such a structure.Our ship was docked right by this bridge I was able to view it up close and personal

a real chain in the butt!!. before going to budapest i read so much about the chain bridge which might have contributed to the anticlimax of seeing it. its nice, not as good as the charles bridge in prague, even at night. still cool though
Beautiful!. So pretty see it spanning the Danube. A very nice area on both sides as well. Unfortunately on one of the days we were there someone tried to jump from the top. Yikes!!
nice view. I crossed it at night , the lights and the traffic gave it a lot of life. The Danube under the bridge is impressive and huge.
Nice walk across. This was a lovely walk across the Danube .it is very pretty lit up at night time and you can get some brilliant photos .
Visit at night. Well worth a visit nothing to special it's a bridge but see it at night lit up with castle in back ground and makes for a romantic walk and place to admire the views

Nothing to do with chains!. It's a bridge, which if you are interested in engineering or bridge design is probably quite a fine example. The name comes from the chap who built it, and has nothing whatsoever to do with chains.
Walk -dont ride!. Walk, take your time (it's not as long as it looks... probably 6 minutes to cross the river) and enjoy the views :)

Spectacular !!!!!. The city's oldest and most beautiful bridge without question as it lights up the night sky. We walked across it multiple times and enjoyed the various views of the city at night. MUST SEE !

Quite a sight. Well worth walking over for the views. On both sides of the river. At night it is quite a sight all light up. So many interesting things to see in this area. Either use the hop on hop off busses or just enjoy the walking experience.
Very nice at night. The bridge is the biggest in the river. During the day looks fine. However, at night is when you'll enjoy it most, along with the lights of the opposite side.

Wow. Get some info on what you will see. The couple of dozen staues all tell a tale,
How often do you see a large, very Catholic crucifix with topped by golden Hebrew characters saying, in Hebrew,Holy, Holy, Holy? Yes, there is a story behind it.

A must see!. This is one of the best things to do in Budapest - and it's FREE!!!!!!! Walk across it from Pest to Buda and take in the views of Buda castle, the Fisherman's Bastion and the views of the Parliment Building on the Pest side. I recommend going at sunset/twilight if possible!

Beautiful bridge in a great location. This is an interesting piece of architecture that suits right next to Budapest's best hotel - the Gesham. It's also the route to take so that you can take iconic images of the amazing parliament building of Budapest. Cross it, you won't regret it.
Great view. Chain Bridge is a great view of other bridges, Buda and Pest sides of the city. When I went it wasn't super busy, so you could take a lot of pictures without having too many cars in them.

Best Introduction to Budapest. I have been coming to Budapest at least annually over the last 25 years and I always walk across this bridge at least once. The bridge is an easy and safe walk and gives superb views of all the highlights of Budapest. Day or night, it is easily the best and lowest cost (free) attraction in Budapest. It connects two dramatically different halves of this wonderfully walkable city and never fails to highlight something different about this city. So, the first thing you should do when you arrive is to take a half an hour and at least walk half way across - you'll be charmed, as I am every time I do this. And don't forget to look at the grand lions guarding each end - notice anything unusual? they are missing their tongues

Beautiful. This is one of the iconic bridges of the world. Crossing the Danube, it is such a amazing sight. In the middle you can go to the side and take pictures. Don't miss night when the bridge is lit up beautifully. Walk from Pest to Buda and explore the castle district, or Buda to Pest and walk around the city center. The bridge is beautiful.
Enchanted. You can make a nice walk from pest to buda side through this beautiful bridge! The most beautiful look is at night, when you can sit and see this beautiful view of the city and the river
Beautiful at night. This lovely bridge links the two cites of Buda and Pest, don't miss seeing it lit up at night. Very impressive. Budapest a great walkable city.

lovely. My husband and I crossed this bridge many times during our 4 days in Budapest. It is the prettiest of the major bridges crossing the Danube which separates the city. It's a beautiful place to capture pictures of loved ones with beautiful buildings in the background.

Very cool bridge. We walked this bridge last time we were here so didn't walk it this time but it really is worth the visit and the walk. You can walk for the marriott just about two blocks and then across the river you go. It's an easy walk The only thing I found a bit disappointing is that it's a re-construction. The bridge was totally destroyed during WWII so what your looking at isn't the original bridge.

Worth the walk. The Chain Bridge is worth the walk. The day we were there it was clear weather but a little chilly. The bridge built in 1849 has been a central point in the city and is a great tourist spot. The view of both Buda and Pest from the center of the bridge gives you a special appreciation for this iconic structure and its preservation.
This is a very unusual bridge held by chains. We went over the bridge in a bus over the Danube which gave us a nice view of the area. There was nothing to dislike about this bridge.

Fantastic Chain Bridge!. When you're at the top of the hill and you're standing right in front of the Bridge staring at all this unbelievable landscape by night, you're feeling really happy and absolutely free - fantastic emotions!!!!!!!!!!!
More than a bridge. Yes, it is just a bridge BUT it's a landmark seen from all over Budapest. It provides a nice walk from the Pest to the Buda side with good photo ops.

As crossing bridges is my thing, I loved it!. On a business trip to the city, I didn't have much time, but a friend drove me across the bridge, so I could add it too my collection of favorite bridge crossed. I loved it, we drove from the castle side of the river towards the city. A must do to cross the wonderful Danube on this stylish bridge.

It's a bridge. Great views from the bridge and of it from the banks. But it's just a bridge and you walk from one side of the river to the other on it. The cyclists were generally respectful since the walkways are narrow.
Nice view. Visited in 2012. Bridge looks amazing. Worth to go, see and walk through from Buda to Pest site. Nice view.
Stunning at night. This bridge that spans the Danube connects Buda to Pest. It is a short walk across-10 minutes at the most. It is particularly stunning at night as it is adorned with many lights.

Iconic. It seems silly to review a bridge, but this one really is at the heart of the city of Budapest. There are a number of really iconic bridges in the world and you can safely add this one to the list. You owe it to yourself to see it at night.And yes, you can even walk across it.

Living history. Come to Budapest, visit Hungary!!!!The Chain Bridge is a piece of the old times the real values and the real great people.Nit many city has such a perfect fundamentals. Good restaurants on the river and in the city, good prices and many many buildings, museums and churches to see.Come to Hungary and enjoy the gastronomy with the history.
It's a bridge. Well, nice is nice, but still it's a bridge that I couln't find more exciting than other bridges already visited.

Best view of Danube and its banks. Walk on the bridge. You have a wonderful view of the River Danube. The buildings on both banks are colourful. The Parliament alone is so massive, if you are a photographer, the bridge allows you to take great architecture.

A must do, main bridge between Boeda and Pest. This bridge you have to see cause it is the main bridge between Boeda and Pest, it has a true story behind it, and It's pretty beautifull as well! But don't worry if you travel between Boeda and Pest you surely will travel on this bridge!

Best at night!!!. I really enjoy the view of the landscape from there, specially on night time. Is full of light, and it shows youthe beauty of the Budapest. In my oppinion is really similar of what we seen in Prague, but I gues is a king of European charm

View If Possible From The Buda Side Of The Danube. This is a Budapest landmark and extremely nice during the day but at night when it is lit up, it is something spectacular. It can get very crowded and you may be pushed and shoved but stand your ground!! Bikes can also be a nuisance. At the Pest side there is a statue of giant coming out of the ground.

Just OK. I will honestly rate it as Ok experience, nothing special .There are not so many landmarks in Budapest, so that's why I guess this bridge has become an attraction.If you are in Budapest already- then I guess it's a must,but no need to travel there intentionally to see the bridge.

Best seen at night from Buda side. A Budapest landmark and nice during the day but clearly spectacular at night when light. Very crowded so you will have to be patient and accept some jostling as people pass you. Beware of bikes! There is great statue/modern art on Pest side of giant coming out of the ground. Great photo op!

Sunset on the Danube. Nice place and a very romantic one! It's a must-see attraction, especially by night or at sunset. It really impressed me! This bridge is one of the "connections" between Buda and Pest, I saw it also in the daytime when I took a long walk in order to visit both sides of the river Danube - it is worthwhile because it makes you feel so free and happy. :) Enjoy!
Sight to be seen. The bridge is something you need to see when you visit Budapest. It's not something worldshocking but a nice sight.
Great landmark of Budapest. At the end of the day it is just a bridge, but it is a famous landmark of Budapest. The Lion statues are famous as well. The view from the bridge is also very nice.

My favourite landmark in Budapest.. From the Chainbridge you can see all the beautiful sights of Budapest. I have walked many times on the bridge. In Oktober this year I watched the Budapest Marathon runners by the bridge.

Walking on this bridge..feels like you are in a movie. This bridge is simply grand. The lion statues are so legendary. I used to go for a run across this bridge..it reminds me of the game Metal gear solid. Its just a bridge, but the view is so breath taking..you have to be there to experience it..pictures dont really do justice. This is once of my favorite spots in Budapest.

This is the heart of Budapest, you can feel the pulse of the city and its flow. The oldest permanent bridge of Budapest stands for more than just an architectural construction. It joins the old and the new history of this city. Best is to start in Pest (may be a breakfast at the Four Seasons in the Gresham Palace), then take a stroll across the bridge to Buda. Take the cog rail up to the castle, and continue the walk. Finally a coffee at Russwurm before the decent through the castle gardens to make your way to lunch in one of the restaurants on Lanchid utca (Zona or Marvelosa) and you will have explored a key part of Budapest and dined well :-)
Beautiful. Originally from Hungary,but I didn't realized how beautiful is this bridge till I moved to an other country and started to visit Budapest as a "tourist".trully amazing place!

Good for a evening or night walk; but can be given a miss. Take a walk from one end of the bridge to the another during the night. It gives a very nice view of the Danube river and the cities Buda and Pest. If you miss this its not a bid deal.

Great view from here!. Lovely to walk across from one side of the river to the other and visit the Castle. Lovely view from the bridge and at night when lit up. Spotted a lot of padlocks that people had clipped on to the lighting.....with names and dates engraved, so if you are a bit of a sentimentalist then take yours with you and add it on as a permanent feature :-)

Walk over the bridge. Beautiful views from the bridge to both directions day and night and beautiful view of the lit bridge at night.Read the history if the bridge in order to feel the historical spirit.

Impressive sight. The Chain Bridge is a very historic ( first built bridge between Buda and Pest ) landmark and best viewed from Buda Castle Hill . Very impressive sight spanning over the Danube and Pest in the background. The walk over it diminishes the feeling of grandeur since it is rather busy with lots of people walking at a fast pace and traffic rushing by.

Impressive Bridge. This impressive bridge was designed by an English engineer and the construction was supervised by a Scotsman. This was the first bridge to link Buda and Pest. There are 2 impressive stone lions on each side. It looks lovely when it is illuminated at night. Beware of cyclists when walking across the bridges in Budapest.

see this at night. This was right in front of our hotel. Its bes6t to go about a half an hour before sundown and watch the city light up. Plan on staying a full hour. This bridge connects old town to new town.

Nice walking place at night .... One can stroll around the bridge ... there is walking area on the side of the bridge ... the bridge look very beautiful at night .. it connects buda and pest ... one can view the fisherman's baston, castle and parliament from the bridge ...

Slightly disappointing. Having been to Prague and walked Charles Bridge we were expecting more from this bridge. However it is more of a vehicle bridge than anything else. It looks impressive at night, but not what we thought it would be.

Everyone should walk it once. The views from this historical views wow a visitor. The busy river, the massive ornate buildings, the lions keeping watch over all, and the people both locals and tourists give one a taste of all Budapest has to offer.

Best at night . You can’t go to Budapest without seeing the chain bridge. Or probably crossing it for that matter. It’s one of the highlights of the city and plenty of history to it as with the city in general. My favourite view of the bridge was at night from the Castle district. It gives a good perspective of the bridge joining Buda and Pest and there is nothing like the city lit up at night shining for the camera. A picture is also attached. It’s worth doing a river boat cruise to see it from a different perspective as well as a great way to see some of the sights of the city

Beautiful bridge with an interesting history. A walk across the bridge during the day is a very pleasant way to get to Buda Catle (assuming you're staying on the Pest side). At night, it is lit up beautifully and quite romantic (for a walk across or just admiration from afar).A bridge being a bridge, you will pass by on or by it if your visiting Budapest.

Buda and Pest. The Chain Bridge is just one of the many beautiful features of Budapest.I love walking over this bridge, especially at night. The lights of both sides of the city are so nice from the bridge.it connects Buda and Pest. Moreover from there you can see the most beautiful places in Budapest. It's full of lion statues and the atmosphere is incredibile.If you are in Budapest you must..
Good history. A very beautiful bridge but it is a bridge. There is good history about how it was destroyed and then rebuilt. Do a little research before you go to fully appreciate it.
Enchanting. Such beauty especially in the evening when the lights are on. Very romantic as you walk on the suspension bridge and thru the Danube river.
Triumph of the English. The nicest bridge over the Danube in Budapest, built by Adams as seen by the names of all the squares. Links the funicular to the casle hill to the centre of downtown Pest.

Another perspective!. The bridge connects the two areas - Buda and Pest. Bridge offers a chance to see the buildings on both sides of the Danube. Worth seeing, especially in the area are many sights. You can easily reach using the funicular, Museum of Art. Also nearby is Church Matthyas, Labyrinth, Buda's Castle, etc. On the other side, you can easily reach and visit the Parliament Building. ... and something funny ... I remember the large number of locks, cables hanging bridge ... maybe some put their wishes ... I hope to be fulfilled! A place worth visiting and sightseeing are nearby, on both sides of the Danube!

Impressive at Night. At night, the illuminated Chain Bridge majestically spans the Danube and provides many great photographic opportunities. A walk across the bridge between Pest and Buda is a must to experience the power and magnificence of the river and the many craft navigating its waters.

More metal plate than chain. The bridge is made of metal plates with two stone towers. Its shape is like a large version of the Bristol Suspension bridge. Definitely worth a visit particularly in the evening where the white lights reflect in the Danube.
Nice short walk. Nice short walk, plenty of room to pass slower walkers. Compared to other bridges in Europe and US, nothing special except it's in a great location between sights.
awesome. Really lovely bridge and definitely worth seeing!Always really busy but the architecture is great and wonderful views!

A Different Perpective. Many travelers have noted the extraordinary design and importance of the Chain Bridge in linking Buda and Pest. However, a stroll across the bridge also gives you a sense of just how large the Danube really is and offers different perspectives of Parliament House, the old city of Buda and the development of Pest. An easy 10 minute stroll that will give you some different views of major Budapest landmarks.
Very cool.. We loved seeing. It and hearing its story for our private tour. It's worth seeing and walking on it.

Another iconic site of Budapest. This bridge, whether seen at day or night and whether seen form the Buda or Pest side of the Danube, is simply stunning. Walking across it, seen from atop Castle Hill or from Parliament, there is a different twist each time you see it. The lions guarding each side and the lights that so beautifully bathe it at night add a touch of romance to it. It is a favorite site in a favorite city.

Budapest Landmark. Just walk over from Buda to Pest or vice versa. The Funicular and Tunnel are at one end for going up the hill to The National Gallery. Good views of the Danube when crossing so it's nice to walk it.

Very romantic!. The bridge is so beautiful that you think you are floating over the Danube and you can listen your heart singing Blue Danube...From my room window I've spent moments looking at this bridge... During the night, with the lights on, it's still more beautiful!I'm , really, fond of Budapest...
Tour the bridges. The Chain Bridge is the most famous, but the bridges connecting the two cities are grand. Shopping it available at the foot of each bridges.

Best from a distance. When you go across the bridge, it's uninteresting and actually could do with a good clean, but from a distance it's a stunner of a construction, especially at night, or at twilight as it lights up first green then white. Obviously a 'classic' sight to see in Budapest.
It's just a bridge, but a really cool bridge!. The most storied of the Budapest bridges, I crossed it a couple of times, just to be able to say I have done it.

Beautiful view. Definitely a walk over the bridge is required when you visit Budapest. The view from the bridge is breathtaking. As you tour the city, you will definitely cross this bridge many times.
Beautiful bridge . It's worth walking over the bridge during the day to take views up to buda and of the river. It's also worth walking over the bridge at night to see it lit up. Very beautiful.

And they have one just like it in Marlow!. Lovely Bridge and it gives a great view of Buda & Pest.
I thought it looked familiar - and it does it is just like the Bridge in Marlow and designed by the same chap!
Walk across it from Pest to Buda and up to the Fishermens' Bastion or onto the islands

Iconic structure that connects Buda with Pest over Danube. Opened in the mid-1850, this suspension bridge connects the cities of Buda with Pest. It is a beautiful structure that offers a way to walk from either the Buda side and Castle Hill to the Pest side with its numerous boulevards and shopping. It provides both a pedestrian walkway (on the sides) and vehicle traffic in the center. It is especially pretty at night as it is lit up.
Only at night. It's a nice place to visit but only when dark outside and the lights are lit on the bridge. During the day you see it's just another big bridge over a wide river and European

Walk The Old Bridge. Chain Bridge is the oldest of Budapest's bridges, and is a beautiful old concrete & metal structure. Fortunately when Budapest's bridged were destroyed in the war, the city made a decision to rebuild them rather than replace them. The bridge is central in the city and connects the busy Pest side with the beautiful Castle Hill area. At the end of the bridge is the Funicular which will take you up the hill to the palace and the attractions on the hill. It is worth walking across the bridge as the view form the bridge is great, and since it is so central to the city is is a great place to start a tour of the areas.
