Nothing special. I've seen more impressive bridges, longer bridges, more beautiful bridges. It's a bridge. Get over it.

worth to walk. Feel the essence of the bridge walking on it , cross the Danube river. At the end either you go to the central market for some food, or in the other side, enjoy a thermal bath in Gellard!
All you have to do is walk. Great views! This is a highlight of seeing Buda and Pest. Great opportunity for photos as well and seriously, you are walking over the Danube River!

It's a bridge.... I was trying to make it sound exciting for my partner with my fact 'it was the first bridge to connect Buda and Pest'. But at the end of the day it is only a bridge. You need to walk over it, just for the fact of walking over it. Some people have carved their names into padlocks and padlocked them to the bridge so take a padlock if you would like to do this. I wish I'd of known! Not a long walk over either about 5 mins.
Not to be missed. The rebuild from the war is amazing. Walked across in both day and night. Both amazing. Watch out ford bikes on the tight turns.
Impressive bridge. In terms of its historical importance and structural beauty, it is certainly the most prominent bridge linking Buda and Pest across the Danube.

Wonderful Walk. We were fortunate to find the bridge closed to traffic on a Saturday evening. It was a lovely walk with great views of the City. In fact there is no need for a river boat tour with this walk.

Chain Bridge, one of our favorite picture spots. The Chain Bridge is one of our favorite picture spots, we have been taking pictures of our family in front of the famous lions on both ends of the bridge for 16 years and we just visited again and now we have more photos. Then we walk over to the fenicular and ride up the hill for more photos.

Simply majestic. The first bridge to be built on the Danube connecting Buda and Pest way back in the 1860's - it still holds the prime position amongst all the landmarks in the city. The moment you see it you are in awe with it - even love it - at least that's what happened to us. For us the lasting image of Budapest has to be the spectacular chain bridge.You have to walk across the bridge from either side to soak it all in - and it also affords some of the most amazing views of the Danube and the parliament building.On the Pest side Tram line 2 stops right next to the bridge and can be used to get to it - in case you didn't want to walk too much.The bridge was almost completely destroyed during the 2nd world war and since then has been painstakingly restored to its original glory.Some of the best photos of the bridge are from the Castle Hill and Gelert Hill on Buda side.The bridge almost acquires a different look during the night time with all the lights on - its simply put majestic.

yay another bridge. its a bridge, it does what bridges do, it carries people and cars over the river, from one bank to the other. its made from stone and iron like many other bridges, its called the chain bridge because the roadway is supported by massive iron chains, like many other bridges of this period.the great engineer isambard kingdom brunel built a far more elegant bridge in the city of bristol, england, that pre dates this heavy eastern european style one.i feel bad about this review, and sorry for this bridge thats been through so much, but its just another bridge...........

"Make sure you walk across". Very neat bridge in Budapest. I call the Lions that sits at the entrance the guardians of the bridge. We walked across from Buda to Pest. As we walk across, we felt the vibrations from all the vehicles crossing the bridge, a little creepy. But It was a great experience.

Magnificent. We drove over the bridge by bus...getting across took a long time in the peak hour, but the wait was worth it. Would have loved to walk across it and really appreciate its size and beauty. Lit up at night it is truly magnificent.

Walk it - you'll love the experience.. We walked about halfway across the bridge in the early evening and it was quite crowded with students and people getting off work. Great photo ops with the boats along the shore of the Danube and the actual chains are huge. Fun, easy (if the traffic will let you cross) and cheap!
Lovely architecture. One of the bridges linking Buda and Pest, the architecture of this one is lovely. It only takes 5 minutes to cross but the views are great and it is 'pedestrian friendly'.

Cool Bridge. As a civil engineer, this was very cool to see. We were able to walk across it and look at the construction. It's also very beautiful at night. You can't miss it if you're going from the Buda to Pest side, so take a moment to enjoy the construction, view, and history.

A must see attraction in Budapest. The oldest bridge in the city. Originally it was built for the Pest (the Eastern part of the city) citizens could cross the Danube more easily to go to the Castle and the Castle area. So both the circumstances in which it was built, both the bridge itself are a part of history. It looks very nice from both sides of the Danube, even from other bridges. If you would like to make a nice picture of Budapest, include the Chain Bridge, and you will get the likes on your social media site. :-)

Bridge over the Danube River. This bridge goes over the Danube river, linking Buda and Pest together. it only takes 5 minutes to walk from one side to another and is a beautiful site at night as it is all lit up

Take a Walk on the Bridge. OK, so its a bridge. However, the architecture is interesting and the views fantastic. Take a walk. You won't be disappointed.We were there during a festival and the bridge was closed to traffic - an even better time to walk over the Danube on the Chain Bridge.

Beautiful Bridge. The Chain Bridge is a focal point of Budapest connecting the two parts of the city. Everything in the city is within walking distance of this historic bridge. Walk across if and admire the lions guarding the entrance and its ornate ironwork. Great for taking panoramic photos of the castle, parliament and the other bridges on the Danube.

Classic bridge, walk it.. Nothing special here, but just a very nice relic and stunning bridge, that offers great vues over the Dunabe, and is a part of the cities history. If you don't walk this bridge there is something very wrong on your Budapest tour

One of the many prominent Budapest landmarks. Links the Buda and Pest parts of the city. Imposing landmark. Walked across the bridge one day, cycled over it the next. Great views of the Hungarian National Gallery on one side and the Parliament on the other. Must do when in Budapest.
Bridge by walk. We walk over this bridge. Its takes 7minutes. Then we take smaal-bus(blue) number 16 staitgh to mammut shopping center ( is alsso good if you want to go up !

Bridge designed by a Scot is now the emblem for the city of Budapest. A solid yet attractive suspension bridge with stone arches at each side At night-time there are lightbulbs on its outline which accentuate its beauty. It has huge lions at each side and it links from the beautiful Gresham Palace (Four Seasons hotel) and the tunnel under Buda Castle.
mixed blessings. Not the most attractive of bridges but certainly special, especially when viewed from the river, and can be appreciated best underneath and then at night.

Watching the Fireworks in 20/08/2014. I always dreamed about watching the 20/08 Fireworks live, so I've got my chance in 2014. We watched it from the Erzsébet bridge. It was a great show and a great view of the Chain Bridge.

One to see. The Chain Bridge is just one of the many beautiful features of Budapest. We love walking over this bridge, especially at night. The lights of both sides of the city are so nice from the bridge, and the water view is amazing as well. Great for photo opps!

The Lion Bridge. The Chain Bridge over the Danube River in Budapest features two Lions at the entrance to either end of the bridge. This is one of the main bridges connecting Pest with Buda. This beautiful bridge is lit at night and a "MUST See!" Highly recommend this bridge and all of Budapest at night!
Lovely. Beautiful bridge over the River Danube with a very unique setting, the Royal Palace and the Castle Hill in the background. I would recommend to see it in the night, too!
Beautiful. Walked over the chain bridge in the day and viewed its beauty at night. One of the most gorgeous scenes I can remember. Well worth a look.

Great. Chain bridge in the city of Budapest is on the river Danube and connects Buda and Pest. You can get nice view of the bridge from either side. There two lions on both sides of the bridge and are without tongue as was informed to us. You can take a walk on the bridge.
A bridge not too far. An interesting bridge across the Danube leading to the funicular up to Castle Hill. Mind the bikes as you walk across!
Breathtaking view and walk. Great views along the river and across to Budapest. An absolute must. We were fortunate with good weather though!

The best bridge I've ever seen. It's wonderful, it connects Buda and Pest. Moreover from there you can see the most beautiful places in Budapest. It's full of lion statues and the atmosphere is incredibile, especially at night.
Beautiful at night. Great to cross day or night, but for photos, it is especially beautiful at night. Only downside, noise and exhaust of cars as one crosses the bridge

Breathtaking night view! . If you're in Budapest definitely take the late evening boat tour on the Danube! You'll be amazed by the view given by Chain Bridge and the Parliament building. And you can watch this while enjoying a glass of champagne. The bridge is one monumentale engineering piece of art work. And the lights on it will bring you into a world of tales!!A "do not miss" objective in Budapest night!
See the Bridge at Night. Go on the river danube at night and see all the bridges lit up the Chain Bridge is amazing the view at night time on the river is good it looks different by night
HEART OF BUDAPEST. You must see it because it's so famous and so central. You don't have to linger, but it's good to walk or ride over the Danube and sense the old city (or cities -- Buda and Pest).

Iconic. Fantastic views across either side of the city both day and night. Steeped in history and free, great to mingle with local families at the weekend and great unhurried views of iconic sites on either side. The prettiest of all the bridges and best location for your photos.
Over the Danube. A nice bridge to walk over to get from Pest to Buda and vice versa. Cross the brown Danube! Not the most spectacular bridge in the world but worth the walk.

i assume this was very close to the hotel where we stayed. it was a suspension bridge the closest one to where we were staying.There are a few bridges over the Danube with some being more elegant than others
Beautiful!. This is a stunning bridge that you can see a great view down the Danube. It is even more beautiful when walking across at night.
A beautiful bridge. You can't miss it on your trip to Budapest. It is illuminated at night and equally beautiful during the day. In a city with many beautiful bridges, this was my favorite.

A "must do". This very famous bridge must be crossed by foot to truly enjoy the view. It is a nice walk and make sure to bring your camera for the one of a kind pictures of both Buda and Pest you will get.

Szechenyi Chain Bridge - stunning!. This is the most famous bridge in Hungary. It was the first bridge to join Buda with Pest, and has a very colourful history. Locals say the stone lions have no tongues! It's well worth seeing, and it's nice to walk across and see views of Buda and Pest from both sides of the Danube.
Great views. This iconic bridge gives you great views of both sides of the Danube and is a quick link of the main sights of both Buda and Pest. It looks amazing lit up at night.

It is one of the iconic symbols of Budapest.. The Chain Bridge was the first permanent stone-bridge connecting Pest and Buda, and only the second permanent crossing on the whole length of the river Danube. It is one of the symbolic buildings of Budapest, the most widely known bridge of the Hungarian capital. Its construction was proposed by Count István Széchenyi, one of the leading figures in 18th century Hungary. Its official name is Széchenyi Chain Bridge. Four stone lions taken their place at the edge of the bridge in 1852. They fortunately survived from the air raids of the World War II.

Essential.. Let's face it, you are not going to visit Budapest and miss seeing this landmark bridge. You must cross it on foot by day and night (or at least cruise under it by night). I can't imagine why one would want to drive across it, but the long walk is essential. If you cross from Pest into Buda, an entirely new world awaits you there (and the opposite holds true as well), and the bridge is the perfect historical link between these two magical worlds of one city.

Beautiful historic bridge over the Danube. Beautiful iconic bridge seen in many snapshots of Budapest. Particularly beautiful at night when lit up but a stroll across the bridge day or night is an inexpensive way to take in the beauty of Budapest along the banks of the Danube.

Nearly great Bridge.. The most famous bridge in Budapest and the most impressive, but one could name 10 -20 better in the world. At night it is quite wonderful and the views of Castle Hill and Parliament are beautiful.The story of the Bridge's lions Sculptor had me in stitches,worth a 2nd visit just to hear it.
Magic hour. You must visit the Chain Bridge during the magic hour and you must see it at night.Great view of Pest and Buda.

It links Buda with Pest. Yes, it's famous, and yes, the lion statues and the towers are impressive, but, I mean, it's a bridge; a busy bridge at that. The road appeared to be in constant gridlock and the pedestrianised area is so crowded that it is impossible to take photos. Even if one is able to stop and take a decent photo from the bridge without being barged, or having somebody walk in the way, the view and scenery from the less-crowded Margaret Bridge just ten minutes upstream is a lot better.It links Buda with Pest, and it's certainly worth one walk across because of the fame, but as with most bridges, that's mostly about it.

Cant Miss It. The Chain Bridge is beautiful at day and even better lite up at night.
Recommend strolling across at night and checking out the night city views and the river boats passing under the bridge.

Charming bridge!. You must walk along this beautiful bridge in the middle of Budapest and see the city at either side in all it's Florey. The lions at the entrance are there to protect it. Make sure to take the camera and take lots of photos as the views are stunning in all directions. At night it's all lit up and it looks fantastic! Don't miss this sight.
Great views from both sides of the river. Interesting engineering and adds to the city's beauty and charm! Great views at all times of the day

Nicest bridge in Budapest.. Designed by Adam Clark of England. Grof Szechenyi organised the building of the this lovely bridge in the middle of Budapest. Condition of the bridge is not the best, although it is certainly not dangerous. It could do wit a few licks of paint.

This chain bridge is sweat memory of Budapest , like other bridges in usa, london. Very old bridge, what a amazing look where r u , during walk , during city tour it is giving attraction day / night . How it is made it is a superb architect . It connect buda. & pest . This is a great remembrance of Budapest. If u r on Budapest u cant Miss chain bridge

Strong chestpiece. The location of this bridge is really central, which makes it not easy to avoid. It's impressive, with the lions and the chains. It also get's you from A to B very simple with a stunning view.

City vibe and touch of the past. Imagine city rush, cars, bicycles, tourists walking around you, and century old bridge and funicular near it. Two opposite pictures mixing together in present. This is Szechenyi lanchid (Chain Bridge) and Budvari Siklo (Budapest Castle Hill Funicular). Like the path in present leading in imaginary past. Instead of cars and busses rumbling near you imagine horses pulling the carriage or tram. Magnificent mixture of past and present in vibrant city center of Budapest.
Main Attraction. We liked the bridge day and especailly nights. After dinner we walked on iit. We enjoyed the lightening. It is a must to walk on it or go under with a boat
Classic bridge over the danube. Wonderfully constructed and in a vital location it is great to visit .there are numerous magnets, statues, and othe kits he items about it.

a great center piece especially at night. The Danube really comes alive at night, and the Chain Bridge is the centrepiece, it looks spectacular, especially at night, all lit up...well worth a few photographsit gets vey busy during the day, much quieter in the evening

Great walk over the Danube. All Budapest's bridges are very nice, during day time and at night. You can walk on both sides of it and admire the beautiful views of the city. This one gives you a great feeling of history, you can feel it's historical meaning through walking across it.

Good, but not the best bridge in the city. This bridge is popular among tourists and is indeed very pretty, especially at night. You can walk across, and get great views on either bank of the river.
But I'd suggest that the Liberty bridge is even prettier, and has lots of detail that the Chain bridge lacks.

Connects Buda and Pest. There is a walkway on both sides of the bridge for pedestrians. I used this bridge to walk back and forth between Buda and Pest. An interesting fact: all of the bridges in Budapest were destroyed in WWII and had to be restored. This one was no different.
Chain Bridge over the Danube. A Beautiful Bridge you can´t miss when in Budapest. You can see the Buda Castle in the distance and boats passing under the bridge.
Beautiful.. Make sure to walk over it to Buda and take lots of pictures, this is to Budapest what the Eiffel Tower is to Paris
Must see. This is a beautiful bridge with great history. They plan to widen it for pedestrians so basically see it before it's ruined...

Budapest Vacation. The Chain bridge was the first bridge across the Danube and united the cities of Buda and Pest. My wife and I walked across the bridge on our way to Buda Castle. The scenery was fantastic and watching the boat traffic on the river was nice. The bridge was restored after destruction in WWII.
Walk across this bridge. A survivor of terrible bombings by the Nazis during WWII, this bridge had cool and unique design features and crosses the Danube. Great view of parliament.

Bigger bridge than expected. I went through this bridge for the round trip between Buda and Pest sides in a daytime. I imagined the old and artistic bridge such as Charles Bridge (Karluv most) in Prague. However, many cars were running on this bridge, and both of length and width of this Chain bridge are bigger than Charles Bridge. The views of the royal palace on the hill and Danube were very good, although I prefer Charles Bridge in Prague for the artistic aspect of the bridge. Nevertheless, the chain bridge is also worth of visiting for its view.

Very nice bridge. It is an interesting detail that the bridge's designer was an English engineer named William Clark, who had no relation to the Scottish engineer, Adam Clark, the builder of the bridge. The Chain Bridge is a suspension bridge, and it's a large scale version of William Clark's earlier Marlow Bridge on the River Thames in Marlow, England.

Rare Bridge. Very beautiful bridge and one of the oldest in the world. Thousands of movies would have been made on its foot and the lions on either side is very attractive. A must visit and best photographs can be captured. One can see the lit up Buda Castel during the night from the bridge which looks awesome
A Bridge to other attractions. Architecturally and Engineering interesting .Visually attraction from land and the river especially when lit at night

The highlight from Budapest. The best and nicest bridge we have in Hungary!
You could do many nice photos, direct in front of the bridge, or, you go UP to the castle, and go to the opren air restaurant, buy a coffee, and enjoy the best view over the bridge, over Budapest!

🌜✨ must Visit at night 💖. We encourage you to visit the incredibly handsome bridge in the late afternoon,And enjoy the amazing views of both sides of the Danube River, In the evening the lights of the bridge are on..and everything becomes shiny and high energies And lots of romance for couples.*It is recommended to walk on the bridge, is worth the romance and the selfi That you will do,!With great pleasure .Eli

Especially beautiful at night. Very old bridge connecting Buda and Pest. Walking across the bridge should be very enjoyable. The funicular is not far from the west side of the bridge. Be certain to see it at night. It is lit very beautifully with views of the Palace and Stephen's Cathedral.

bridge. itis one of the bridges in budapest important for the festivities of saint stephens day, it is beautifull architecture, nice to walk over, but in my opinion not the most beautifull, liberty bridge is more charming

The most famous Bridge in town. The Chain Bridge is possibly the most recognisable sight in Budapest. It was the first permanent stone bridge linking Buda to Pest and was opened in 1849. The whole thing was designed and built in England by William Tierney Clark then shipped over. At the time it was the longest suspension bridge in the world. The chains allow the bridge to flew a little and have been replaced a couple of times. You will notice it wobble when you try to take photos from it. There are magnificent stone lions at each end. At night it is beautifully lit up and provides great views of Parliament just up river. You will cross this bridge a lot if you visit attractions on Castle Hill.
better at night. Saw the bridge during the day and night, def way better at night. Connects Buda and Pest. Can't miss this bridge.

Beautiful at night . . .. Walked across this bridge towards sundown and it was beautiful with all the lights coming on everywhere. Budapest is THE MOST BEAUTIFUL CITY at night, period. And I've traveled a lot. Paris is known as the city of lights . . . but I think Budapest is more beautiful. And crossing this bridge while viewing the city is magical. Don't miss it!

Pretty. This was the first stone bridge to link Buda and Pest. It is a pretty looking bridge - it's twin is in Marlow in the UK. You will end up crossing multiple times during your visit no doubt. It has been rebuilt as when the Germans retreated in January 1945, they blew all the bridges across the Danube, including this. Interesting to know who else has crossed before you!

A Landmark par Excellence. This bridge is easily the landmark of Budapest and it has it's charm and beauty during all parts of the day. When the sun falls on it at dawn, it's beautiful, but by night it is by far the best.

It's Just a Bridge. I realize there is a whack-load of history behind this bridge, but at the end of the day, you'll be using it to cross from one side of the river to the other. Do some reading up so that you know the history, and aside from that, you'll likely be using it to visit Castle Hill, Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion, etc. so you won't have to go out of your way too much to see it.

A walk in the river. There are other bridges in Budapest but this was our favourite.It was strange to see people walking ,bikes riding,public transport all in harmony above Danube.Even though we had our two kids with us we felt safe to walk on it.Feels like walking on the river!
fireworks!. we were lucky to be in budapest at the occasion of the national celebration day on august 20th and coudl enjoy amazing and extremely beautiful fireworks

A wonderful Old Bridge Connecting Buda to Pest. This is a very eye catching bridge. To walk over it is a memorable occasion. The history of this city and this bridge boggles the mind.Don't leave without a picture of the bridge!
Night photography must do. Spent about one hour one night walking over the bridge and getting some wonderful views. Lots of people out and about in the area. One of our trip highlights.

Er.... It's a bridge!!! Across the Danube!!! Gets you from one side to the other! Reasonable views but so there are from other places in Budapest...... Hold on! It was built by a Scotsman???? Fantastic place! Couldn't get enough of it! Walked backwards and forwards across it singing 'Flower of Scotland'!
Quite a site. The bridge was destroyed in 1945. Today it reigns as the focus of much of the life of Buda and Pest. We walked across, which is the way to do it.
Great!. Because it was the St. Stephen's celebration while we were there the bridge was closed to cars and became a pedestrian walkway, very cool!

Nice view and pretty at night. The bridge is definitely worth strolling across during the day. You get a great view of some of the grand buildings towering over you. We went back at night when the bridge looks very nice and equally so do the buildings in Buda and in Pest.
Nice. Bridge is easily accessible and great spot for taking pictures. Nice for either walking or bike-riding.

It's O.K.. It really is O.K., it is striking but really nothing more. You should see it, mostly because the view from the middle of the bridge is fantastic. But it is semi pedestrian, there are cars speeding around, it's noisy and nothing like, for example, Charles bridge in Prague which is totally stunning, romantic, traffic free and has a soul.

Nice Bridge but nothing more. It has history behind it and is the most important bridge to get from Buda to Pest or vice versa. It is well lit at night. We crossed it in the evening once and had good view of the Danube. But at other times, especially in the mid day sun it is better to use the bus.

It's not made of chains.... ... the name "chain" comes from the person who initiated the building of the bridge, Szechenyi. The bridge quite beautiful, definetly walk across it and stop by at night to take a photo or two.

Amazing. Amazing structure which was built more than hundred years ago. Was considered a world wonder at that time. Read about the history and the mythe involved with this bridege. Illuminated bridge at dusk gives an awesome picture for entusisastic photographers.
Walk the bridge at night.... We walked all the bridges in Budapest. Incredible experience in an unforgettable city. Take your camera and also watch the cruise ships as they come in to dock.

Nice Bridge. This bridge is nice and all, but it's LONG because the Danube is so wide, and it's bustling with traffic. We walked the bridge but would just take Bus #16 if we were going to do it again. Nice from afar, but nothing you have to get up real close to in order to enjoy!

Lovely views and great walk. Lovely views and a great walkway from one side to the other. We walked across this bridge to the "Buda" side to explore, makes for easy access to and from each side of Budapest. One day we walked across, along the walkways that line the shore then back across on the adjacent bridge, great for people watching and sightseeing.
A bridge. As bridges go it was ok, nothing overly special. Looks better at night when lit up. There is history but to look at not much.
Beautiful bridge. The bridge is wonderful to see during the daytime. At night time, it is spectacular! But a bridge is a bridge…not much to say.
Nice views. Good views of the Danube from the bridge. A nice touch are the little love paddocks that people have attached to the lamps.
Nice walk. Nice walk, easy to find. The whole city is great to walk around. Worth a walk............................................................................
Architecture. All the bridges in Budapest are beautiful, night is the time to really enjoy there beauty, we were lucky enough to do a illumination cruise, It was the highlight of my trip !
Icon of Budapest. The Chain Bridge is the landmark you think of when you think of Budapest. It's a great design in a beautiful setting. One that can't be missed.

Beautiful. Beautiful bridge, better at night. It is just a bridge where all you will do is admire it from afar or cross it so unsure why there is a "visit time" of 1-2 hours in the information as it's certainly not that but definitely worth visiting. If you visit any of the attractions in Buda, such as the Matthias Church, Buda Castle, Fisherman's Bastion or even if you do the caving under Budapest, you are likely to use this bridge as a route anyway and will not require a specific journey there.
Breathtaking. One of the reasons i love Budapest! this is one of their most beautiful bridges! Both at day an night time i can recommend you to take a look at the view, or walk across it!
Picture perfect. We were aboard a Viking River cruise ship and parked right by the bridge. Great to take pictures at night time of the whole city as we floated in.
Beautiful. It's very pretty at night. We walked from chain bridge to the next bridge along and the views were beautiful. It's a very romantic walk on the Pest side of the bridge.
Old and graceful. Some parts has graffitti and rust, but still in good condition. Take a jacket with hood as it might get cold:-)
Walk it.. So impressive to see this bridge. Remember to get a good look at night. WOW. Worth the walk across to feel the ambience of days gone by.

Worth a visit.. Walk over on one side and come back the other. Also visit a night if you can to see the splendour of the city at night.Yes, it's a bridge with a basic function of crossing a river. If you are expecting anything else don't visit :-). But it is a pretty bridge and for photographers it's a must visit. Excellent opportunity for architectural and structural photographs. Bridge really lends itself to some create b&w work as well. Yes, the bridge can be busy, but the crowds ebb and flow and it's always possible to get some decent uncluttered shots with patience. Great views of the Danube up and down river.As bridges go, it's a good one to visit so make the effort to visit.
Lovely views, interesting structure.. Great views from this bridge. Nice to walk across on a sunny day. We walked from Buda to Pest which took around 10 mins. Worth a visit.

Chunky bridge. The first things I noticed from Chain Bridge are the chunky gates and the lion statues waiting in front of it. It's very beautiful even though it's very crowded with tourists and traffic. However, there's nothing more to do here, just make sure to stop when you are crossing to have a nice view of both Buda & Pest. Too bad didn't come here at night, probably more beautiful with the lights on.

The most famous bridge connecting Buda andPest. A wonderful bridge to walk over and enjoy the view of the Danube, especially at night, with the lit up Castle complex on one side and the Parliament on the other side.

Take a Picture. Okay, so it's just a bridge shared by cars and pedestrians (no buses or trucks), but in a romantic, scenic locale linking Buda and Pest. Stroll along the Danube on ether side, or rent a bike. Nice views day or night. Bring your camera for a selfie or take a picture of the historic buildings and boats. Worth a visit for sure.
It's free and the views are what it's al about. The Chain bridge links Buda with Pest. The views are extraordinary and postcard worthy. You truly get a great sense of the old and new.

Mesmerizing - from whatever way I look at it. This is such an iconic part of Budapest, and I love it from every angle, every time, day or night, when I have the pleasure of being near it. It offers beautiful views, and it is itself a beautiful thing to look at - either from the sides, walking towards it, or from halfway up the Buda Castle, right above the tunnel, where there's a little spot from which you can admire the lights of the bridge and Pest during the evening.
Linking Buda to Pest. Nice walk and good views of the river from the bridge. Look back at the ancient fenicular. Links Buda to Pest and good shopping on the Pest side
Nothing special. If you have seen the bridge from afar then you are probably as satisfied as you will ever be, views are better elsewhere and its tremendously busy!

What's Not to Like?. It's a pretty bridge, clearly separated pedestrian lanes (whew! since it carries quite a bit of traffic), and it both has a beautiful view and leads to a beautiful view.Take the time to walk it at night as well, when it and the river shores are fully lit. It's a classic European experience.Tip: On the Pest side of the bridge, at the northern side, it seems local bands frequently set up a mini sound stage and do full shows, for free, for people walking nearby. No coinage seems to be expected, unlike the buskers. They are doing it for exposure. We heard two really interesting electronica bands. There was also a drinks tent set up. It was a nice family crowd the night we were there, and we will definitely be going back another night or two to check out what's going on in that spot.

Over rated but you have to see it. We were unsure which Bridge was the chain bridge. Finally we got to it and crossed it. It was good to see and cross it but I did not see anything really special about the bridge itself. Just it is nice to say I crossed it!!

Its a bridge you gotta get over. Whats in a bridge, it gets you one side to the other you walk it or you ride it what else is there to say. Does it look better than the Brooklyn Bridge or the Golden Gate up to you.

See it light up in the evening!. It makes for stunning photos to have sunset light with the bridge lights in the background. We were also able to catch the lights being switched on in the evening (we were there in late July at around 8:40 pm, which was fun and romantic!
Beautiful bridge well worth visit. Well worth a visit as part of Budapest history, had a lovely walk over and heard all about it from the river cruise

Definitely walk this one. This bridge, although rebuilt after WWII, is majestic!
Walk it by day for some excellent views on both sides of the city, walk it by night for an atmosphere you'll never forget!

No mention of architect.. Politics of the cold war, perhaps, but the Scottish engineer responsible for the bridge is not acknowledged. He built the bridge at Marlow to a smaller scale and waited 15 years to see it proven with traffic.
Stop halfway across to take an uncluttered photo of the parliament.
A magnificent structure.

Best visited at night. The bridge is beautiful, not the best I've seen, but certainly the best in Budapest. It offers great views to both Buda and Pest and allows for great photos. You should walk on it during the day but most importantly at night. You should also pass under it with one of the many cruize boats preferably at night. And of course you can see it from above the Castle Hill.
Worth seeing. Worth seeing and easy to visit- nice stroll along the Danube river and easy access, worth doing a boat tour to view and get good pictures.

Interesting Bridge. I know its "sister" in Marlow, Buckinghamshire. This one is bigger! Good views of the river, the town - both Buda and Pest. Take care of the bicycles that ride (too fast) along the pedestrian pavements. Can get a bit crowded at times.

An OK Bridge. The Chain Bridge is functional, it gets you across the Danube close to many sights, but personally I think the Elisabeth Bridge is far more attractive particularly at night as this is lit up too. The views from the Elisabeth Bridge are quite stunning.

A Nighttime Must See!. This iconic landmark of Budapest must be seen at night in it's full illuminated glory. The walk around during the day is lovely with the parks and trees, but at night it sparkles in twinkling lights. The river cruise at night highlights the Parliament, Chain Bridge, and Castle Hill all illuminated and beautiful against the darkness of the evening.

Spectacular. It is the most beautiful bridge on the beautiful, powerful, blue Danube. With it's surroundings, Gresham palace, tunnel, green roundabouts, walkway and the buildings along the bank every frame is like a postcard, the history of the bridge is very interesting and to look at it from the castle uphill is awe inspiring.
A striking bridge over the Danube. We crossed this bridge several times during our stay in the city; it's really striking and beautifully frames the waterfall on the Buda side of the river.

Unique experience. A walk on the cain bridge is just amazing, it takes you back into time. You get a beautiful view on the danube and Buda and Pest, the bridge will lead you to the foot of Budacastle.
An icon. What hasn't been said about this bridge- It takes you back to a wonderful time that we all wish we could have been a part of.

great for an evening stroll. on our way down from castle hill on bus 16, we got off just after exiting the tunnel. It is a pleasant walk and quite busy with people taking photos and bicycles trying to maneuver around people.
A must to walk here. I crossed the bridge maybe 6 times in 3 days in Budapest! The sights are out of this world. Do it. Put it on your bucket list

Chain Bridge. This bridge was beautiful and one of the many that cross the Danube in Budapest. It was very pleasant to walk at night across the bridge from the Pest side to the Buda and back. It gave great picture ops of the city at night.

Bridges in Budapest. The greatest sights must be seen at night when all the lights are on. An experience of a stroll along the Danube you will not forget. The only disappointing thing - the existance of night public transport is kept secret...

Just magnificent. What a fabulous bridge. We went over it several times and I have some great photos of it. Just lovely. The views from it are wonderful too, a great landmark. It separates Buda and Pest of course

City tour. We visited this on a city tour of Budapest. It is a really impressive bridge and the best in the city. Major sure you also get to see it at night, ideally from a river trip, when it is all illuminated in green.

My top 1 favorite place in Budapest. I like this bridge! I spent half an hour to walk on it, enjoy this old guy, enjoy the river view, enjoy the buses, bikes, cars and walking people on the bridge. It's so beautiful in the sunny day!And very elegant in the evening!!You can enjoy a cup of coffee at a cafe close to the end of the bridge, just look at the bride, the blue sky, enjoy your relaxed moment.

It's a Bridge. It is what it claims to be! The views are great and it's an iconic landmark so worth a visit. The Fenicular is just across the road and it takes you up to the palace used in the Katy Perry video. All in all a nice little trip

Beautiful bridge. Hi Guys,It is stunning looking bridge between Buda And Pest.It looks amazing at the evening or night - very romantic...Great views - excellent place for a walk with your other half..
old bridge. In my opinion, this is the most beautiful bridge of all bridges not only in Budapest, but the entire world.

You have to see it at night. You have to see it at night when it is all lit up and reflecting in the river. We were on a river cruise and our cabin was right by the bridge, we just couldn't get enough of the view.

Nice bridge to view the city. Nice place to view both sides of the city and watch all the river traffic. The architecture of the bridge is wonderful and the walking path is nice and wide. Watch out for bikes though.

Chain Bridge. The Chain Bridge was the 1st bridge to link Buda and Pest across the Danube River. It's a beautiful old bridge dating back to the 1800's. It was bombed during World War II so has been partially re-built. There are great views from the bridge as well as from both sides.

Spectacular bridge. I believe the chain link bridge was one of seven bridges linking Pest to the Buda side. This bridge is most beautiful . if you have any opportunity to stay at a hotel over looking the Danube the site of this bridge in the evening is spectacular
Beautifull. We loved it , great view for walking and you will take your nicest pictures of your journey . I missed it already .

One of the iconic sights of Budapest. Well, this is one of the most iconic sights of Budapest, so I guess you will most certainly see it when you visit this beautiful city. Every night when the lights go on, there is about a minute while these lights warm up and until then the bridge shines in green colour.

Impressive . With impressive architecture, good views and a great look when lit up at night there's not much to say against the Chain Bridge, whilst it's good at really giving that feeling of connecting Buda and Pest. It's certainly good to include in a visit but it's nonetheless extreme to say that this is a must given that, at the end of the day, it's a bridge and there's much better sights to see in Budapest.

Neat. A neat piece of engineering opened almost 200 years ago. Walk across the bridge, take in the sights and activities on the river, then hop on the funicular for the ride up Castle Hill. The bridge looks great at night when lit up.

A Budapest landmark you'll want to walk across. The Nazis destroyed this critical bridge during WW2 because of it's strategic importance to the Americans and their allies but it was rebuilt in it's former glory after the war. It's majestic, old world and walking across and back let's you know you're really in Budapest. It's free and there's plenty of sidewalk, just watch out for the bicyles!

Quite interesting. I walked over the chain bridge with a free walking tour, which i would suggest, that way you get the history of the bridge and the legends that go with it!Other then that, it's just another very pretty bridge!
Walk once during the day and then at night. Superb views, great to watch the evening embrace the city. Steady people tide during the day, evening is not as busy.

Its a bridge. Walked over this bridge after coming down from The fishermans bastion,You get a very nice view of the river from it and the method of construction may interest some people but there is nothing going on on the bridge itself unlike some other bridges I have visited in other cities(Charles bridge in Prague for example) It is lit up very nicely at night and you can get great photos of it from the river.

Bridging Budapest. Cross the bridge from Pest to hilly Buda, climb up Castle Hill (the walk up is totally manageable but the funicular is available for those who prefer not to walk) for spectacular view of the Danube.
Beautiful!. Just walk through the bridge during a hot summer night and be mesmerized by one of the most beautiful city on Earth!

C B. Well, the bridge itself is nothing spectacular, though it is one of the main sights in Budapest. It is nice walk across it on a nice day. You can have a good photos of church and castle on top of the hill from there.

The most well-known Bridge of Budapest. We walked across this bridge and apart from the construction and architecture of this bridge the views are definitely spectacular. Be mindful of the fact that it might be a bit too crowded during the day but walking to the other side you can take an almost vertical train up to the castle area. Recommended!

See the Chain Bridge from the Intercontinental Hotel. Our room included a view of the Chain Bridge. It is a lovely old bridge connecting Buda and Pest. You can walk across to get from Pest to the Castle Hill. There is a funicular to go up to the top of the hill. Lots of floating restaurants nearby will also give you a nice view of the bridge.

Worth Seeing. Had to see the bridge. All as expected. The scenic view is amazing. Walk along the river and view the bridge. Take photo's of the bridge with the river traffic in the background. Go to Budapest you can't miss it. A bit of advice, watch out for push bikes while you are taking photo's.

View this at night. Walk across to get from Buda to Pest and back. Very pretty bridge at night when it is lit up along with several other buildings along the Danube.
Can walk on either side.
There are restaurants/cafe's etc on the Pest side ( the flat side)
Walked to the National Art Gallery. We had a lovely walk on the Chain Bridge to the National Art gallery. We chose to skip the Funicular and walk to the top. It was a nice walk.

Good to walk on. When in the city it is worth walking across the bridge to get a view of both Buda and Pest. Cross the bridge on one side and then re cross on the other side to get great, but different views of the city.Note the small padlocks left by lovers clipped onto the bridge lights.

Romantic views at night. It's very nice to take a stroll along the Danube after dinner to the Chain Bridge. It's lit up at night and is stunning. There is also a pub / bar right next to the front end of the Bridge and it is an interesting mix with the elegant Bridge in the background. Very romantic spot.
must see by night. Some great views can be had from both ides of the Danube. Good both by day but even more by night. Well worth a cruise on the river below the bridge

Great what a Scotsman can do!. This bridge was built by a Scot and when it is lit up at night it is pure magic.It is a great landmark and as our hotel was in very close proximity to it we crossed it frequently to visit sights in Buda.

european vacation. The sight of the bridge is breathtaking during the day and the beauty of the bridge at night when it is lit up is outstanding. it is hard to believe that it has stood for this many years and lasted through the wars

Budapest's "Brooklyn Bridge" - beautiful by day or night. My wife & I visited Budapest for four days 5/10-13 & saw the bridge from our river-front, eighth-floor hotel window thru lots of different weather & lighting. We also often saw it from ground level, drove across it on a tour, & crossed below it twice at night on a Danube cruise. But, sadly, we never found the time to walk across the bridge. Despite that, the bridge was a visual highlight of our trip, Budapest's landmark version of the "Brooklyn Bridge." Well worth whatever time you have to spend with it.

Part of Budapest's History. On our last day, we took Tram #2 over to the Chain Bridge, and walked mostly across, then back. It was a warm sunny day and both walkways were very crowded, but it was a pleasant stroll. Then we took the tram #2 down to Market Hall. Look up the history of the bridge before you go, so you'll know what you're seeing and why it's important.
Great view!. It is one of the iconic land marks of Budapest and you must have a walk on the bridge. You can see great views across the Buda and Pest sides.

Beautiful at Night. Completed in 1849, this massive bridge is fun to see during the day with great photo opportunities in front of the lion heads. But it is truly beautiful when lit at night. You don't need to schedule a lot of time to visit it, but you will probably want to see it from every angle so visit more than once.

Landmark not to miss. Chain bridge connects Pest and Buda and is located close to Hotel Intercontinental on the embankment. It is a nice walk across the danube and leads to the Funicular station on the Buda side.Nice to walk across the bridge.Good Photo Spot especially in the night
Beautiful bridge to Buda from Pest. Although used for vehicles, pedestrian walkways line both sides of the bridge for easy crossing. The tongue-less lions stand guard on both the Buda and Pest sides.
Beautiful. What I disliked was the graffiti. Such a beautiful and historically important bridge. Easy to walk across and beautiful at night.

Best seen at night. One of the attractive features of Budapest is the pleasant lighting and this bridge is one of the finer examples of this. It makes for a eye-pleasing sight with the Castle as a backdrop. I was surprised at how modern it was.

Love locks!. Beautiful bridge, we must have walked over it three or four times during our visit. On our last night we joined hundreds of other couples and locked our padlock on to a railing, and plan to do the same on every visit :)

massive bridge looks good at night. Go see at night looks really nice. After all it is just a bridge but its a nice bridge lol can see both sides of budapest and can get some good photos from both sides

Nice Walk. We walked the bridge from Bud to Pest side. It's a great place to take pictures. Or if you want to you can hang a lock. The personal locks with peoples names are hung on the bridge. I enjoy reading them to see were some of the visitors are from. Once across the bridge on the Pest side you can also take the Funicular Cable Car to the castle.
Best bridge of the town. No review could be able to describe this masterpiece. Try to plan your city tour in order to cross it as many times as you can, you will miss it when back home!

A comprehensive presentation of Nazi attack on Jews and Roma before and during WW II.. Walking across the chain bridge affords a spectacular view of both Buda and Pest. If you cross it after 5 PM in the summer on a sunny day, the Parliament Building lights up like a fairy tale castle. In the morning Castle Hill likewise is spectacular. The view to the north is of Margaret Island, also beautiful sight.
beautiful. I loved walking across the bridge at dusk as everything was getting lit up for the evening. The city is beautiful and the bridge is one of the best views in town.

Walk across it!. I know, it is just one more bridge over the Danube. But do not miss the chance of crossing it on foot! The views of the river and of the city on both sides are amazing. Just be careful because the walkway is shared between pedestrians and bycicles and there are some sharp corners where visibility is minimal.Not to be missed, in my humble opinion.

The most photographed bridge of Budapest. The Chain Bridge is one of the iconic places of Budapest, and hence a must see. Architecturally pleasing to the eye, it's also one of the main links between the Buda and the Pest side of Budapest. On the Pest side the Gresham Palace faces the bridge, and on the Buda side you'll encounter the Siklo (= cog railway that you can take to the top of the Castle hill)You can also walk up the hill from there, which gives you the opportunity to take some pictures of the Siklo in motion or views of the bridge.
Visit this at night. Good site for night photography.walking along the bridge at night would give you great views of Pest side and the Parliament House.
Beautiful Sight!!!. This bridge is just stunning at night. You can walk over both sides and it links Buda with Pest.Picture Postcard!!!
A photo must. A beautiful bridge, but like so many others it was blown up in WWII. The supports are original but the chains are gone. Still very pretty and a landmark.

Lovely bridge and great views. The Chain Bridge is one of a number of beautiful and historic bridges in Budapest. Each of the bridges is unique, and provides a great vantage point for appreciating the magnificence and beauty of the many historical areas along the Danube. One can walk at a leisurely pace along the bridge, appreciating the lovely atmosphere of Budapest and taking advantage of the great photo opportunities along the way.
A walk one does not forget. The bridge is made of 50,000 chains. An accomplishment. It is beautiful. At night, it is well, words don't describe. I love the bridge.

At night = stunning. At night this bridge is all light up and it is stunning! You can see the parliament and the bridge all lit up at night from the buda side OR the bridge and the castle all lit up from the pest side! Stunning
Ok as a means to an end. There are several bridges that span the Danube. The Chain bridge was interesting to see but not as impressive to me as the green Liberty bridge further along.

A must see. We stayed very near the bridge and made a point of walking over to see it lit up at night, which was really beautiful. During the day you can walk across the bridge to take the funicular to the top of Castle Hill. It is a short and easy walk, with pedestrian-only areas. The views from the bridge and the top of the hill are spectacular!
Great views. Walk across this bridge for great city views and to make your way to the funicular that takes you up castle hill (a must see).
Walking across the Chain Bridge. Walking across the chain bridge was wonderful! You walk from Pest to Buda and we took the tram and went to the Fisherman's Bastion
Beautiful scenery. If you are going to Budapest it is definitely worth walking across the bridge. You can see so much and there are some beautiful sights. We took some great photos across here.
Nice walk. From afar, it looks like it would take awhile to walk across, but it really didn't. We walked in the evening/night. I would recommend both as the views are very different.

The oldest and most beautiful Budapest bridge. This is beside the Parliament house definitely the symbol of Budapest. It is in the very center of Budapest connecting Buda and Pest. The bridge is marvelous, both by day and night.Drivers be aware for heavy and very slow traffic across it, since it has only two lanes, one for each direction.
Beautiful. Worth the walk across to fishermans bastion and the castle - great view back across the river with the bridge and parliament building looking fantastic

Nice place to take a walk. Great views and lots of history.. We walked the chain bridge twice. Very beautiful. Has lion statues on each side. The bridge crosses the Danube River and connects the city of Buda with the city of Pest. Hence Budapest. Nearby on the Buda side is castle hill and on the Pest side is the Parliament building. While walling the bridge is interesting. It is better to see it from afar. So for best viewing of the bridge go to castle hill. Best viewing is at night when the lights are shined on it.
scenic walk. it's fun to walk from Pest to Buda and back. Lovely views of both sides of the river. It is concerning that there are so many areas of rust on the bridge. I hope they maintain it!
Architect. Great history in the building of this bridge look at the lions mouth', especially the lack of tongue

It's a bridge. But you should at least look at it. Lovely suspension bridge and according to which guide shows you it it's either the oldest ( don't think so). Or was the longest when built. Then all tourist attractions uni Budapest were qualified by either oldest, longest or 3rd biggest. Well worth a walking over though and looks quite spectacular with the parliament building as a backdrop from certain angles

Nice view, good pictures from bridge. We walked by the chain bridge on our way to the Parliament building the lion statues on the ends are very pleasant, possibly the nicest ones we have seen, the views of Parliament from the bridge are very good. All in all a nice walk
The most beautiful bridge!. Very beautiful Chain bridge with very nice view from both sides, at any time of the day. Hardly recommend!

Sightseer's Delight. A walk across this bridge is the equivalent of the Charles Bridge in Prague. So much to see in front of you, behind you, and the vista of the river on both sides. If you can, get to the Museum to see the marvellous model of the bridge and technical details.

Walk the bridge!. It was a lovely day for a walk across the bridge. On close examination you can see the ornate features on the pillars, the flowers above the lions heads and the incredible detail. Stop at one of the landings for some wonderful photos on the river and the incredible buildings along the edge.I don't think you can come to Budapest and not walk the bridge !
Well... a beautiful bridge.... If you have the chance to go there during the spring or the summer, try to make it by bike, especially at night!

wasnt overly impressed. on a visit to budapest we thought wei would be more impressed by this bridge but it was a bit of a let down, we only went over by tram/bus as it was to warm when we went to walk, so maybe didnt get the feel we should have
Very estehic. A very esthetic bridge over Danube. Budapest has a magnificent silhouette with Danube and extremely beautiful bridges over it.

great bridge. As we had the hotel on Buda close to this bridge, every time we had to Pest we needed to cross it so it became quite familiar to us. Halfway down there is a little balcony-like where musicians stay and perform for the amusement of pedestrians. We had some strolls up and down this bridge with diverse performers which was quite enchanting. When at night it is lit, it gives a magnificent silhoutte to the skyline of the city

Take a nice walk across the Danube. I recommend it by day, but you have to see it by night! The whole bridge is lit up by lights and it's simply beautiful! Must see attraction, if you are in Budapest.
Chain Bridge. Interesting design and history. Reasonably accessible. Beautiful to see at night when it is all illuminated, Difficult to cross main roads leading to the bridge.
Great walk over the Chain Bridge. Budapest is great to explore on foot. Lots of great sights to see on both the Buda and the Pest sides. The chain bridge is a great way to cross over to see sights.
See it at night. We did a Viking cruise and entered Budapest at night. The Bridge, Fisherman's Bastion and the Parliament building were all light up, what a fantastic view.
Very cool old bridge!. The history of this bridge is pretty fascinating and it is absolutely gorgeous lit up at night! Definitely don't leave Budapest without seeing it!
Nice Walk. I enjoyed our walk across the Chain Bridge. It offered some unique picture opportunities and it was an easy walk as well. There are some impressive lion statues on either side.
A top attraction. Not to be missed and leads direct from the Centre of Pest to the funicular railway up to the Castle district . Great for photos too but needs painting.

A nice walk. The bridge is beautiful, but do not look for the atmosphere of a bridge in Paris. It is a predominantly for transportation or walking. There are not artists or moonlight have-to spots. It is a beautiful and interesting bridge that you would definitely want to walk across at least once to get from Buda to Pest or vice-versa. The view of Parliament is good (better from the top of Varhegy Hill). Enjoy the Danube as you go - out across the water is always different from along the side. You have to love a good bridge.

Nice. One of the major attractions in Budapest! You can have a nice walk from the centre to the other side by crossing the bridge. Then you have the choice either to take a little train or walk up the hill to get a breathtaking view of the parliament and the city.
Great views.. Pretty bridge. Watch out for crazy bikers zooming past at high speeds. You could do a great business selling bells here.

Unique. I didn't get too excited about the Chain Bridge but have given it a Very Good because if I was interested in engineering I would be impressed by its method of construction.
It is a good spot for catching images up and down the Danube.

great spot to stop and take pics of Buda and Pest. The Chain Bridge is an interesting feat of architecture and actually is a suspension bridge constructed with stone and actual CHAINS. There are two towers and lovely old fashioned street lamps along it. It is wide enough to roll a wheelchair comfortably. It links Buda and Pest and I wanted to have a chance to see the city along the water on both sides. Although the construction on the Parliament kind of messed up my groove with some of my picture plans, it turned out to be good fun to just walk it and see where we ended up.
Wonderful Holiday. Was across from our hotel so was an easy walk. We went twice once during the day and then again at night which was lovely with all the lights on
Unique Bridge. A unique old bridge rebuilt post war in its old style.Contributes well to the Danube 'scene'.It is delightfully lit at night and is as good to see from the land and water.

Nicest Bridge on the Danube. The history and design of this rebuilt bridge are fascinating; you can see it and appreciate it from wherever you go in Buda or Pest; going to the entry points; you can also view the 2 lions sitting at each side of the bridge; adding to its glory. It is at its best when eliminated at night; don’t miss this magnificent view.

Stunning at night. One of the beautiful bridges that span the Danube joining the Buda and Pest sides of the city. It is also a major thoroughfare for pedestrians. Make sure you take some photos of this bridge at night. It is spectacular.

Excellent piece of Engineering. This bridge was destroyed during the war and was rebuilt to replicate the original. Great to walk over viewing Buda and Pest from the middle and admiring the Danube. Must to walk over

Looks great at night. had supper at a restaurant sitting outside near to the bridge. It does look great at night, but its just a bridge, the Parliament buildings boats and other bridges in the close location make it a part of Budapest you should see, but go there at night when the entire area is lit up.
Great Engineering. This bridge is iconic to Budapest, is a great piece of Engineering in its day, and looks great from land or from when you cruise under it on the Danube. Part of Budapest's history

Beautiful views but beware.. This is a beautiful place to take pictures of the city, but beware of the fake "policemen" lurking around the Buda side asking to show your wallet in search of fake money.
Beautiful at night. We walked over the Chain Bridge. Very crowded, but you must go to this iconic Budapest site. Beautiful at night.

It's a nice bridge. You will be seeing the bridge when you are in Budapest no matter what. It is a pretty beautiful bridge over the river, but not really a separate attraction. Walking over the bridge offers you nice views of the Danube as well as the Castle Hill, and is worth it if it fits your route. At night the bridge is lit up nicely.

A nice bridge. I found the Chain Bridge overrated. It is nice and interesting, but nothing too special, if you don't dig into the history behind the bridge. Worth seeing and worth walking, but not as exciting as its reputation.

Beautiful landmark. The bridge, along with parliament, are Budapest's famous landmarks. The bridge is very graceful and the views of the river and both banks are spectacular as you cross it. It' beautifully lit up at night.

Breathtaking!. Beautiful peace of work! Take the tour for all the details, a guide would give you all the details about the old times and you'll feel that taking a trip on the Danube is the perfect complement!

Nothing special. It's a symbol of Budapest, but since is open to traffic and very busy, it's not a touristic attraction itself. is more a landmark, since its not'like the Charles Bridge of Prague whre you can stroll freely on the bridge.

Good views and an easy walk. Not as impressive a bridge as it seems from the tourist guides but nonetheless an outstanding and iconic part of Budapest well worth walking over and taking some pictures of both Buda and Pest sides along the Danube.

Spectacular by night!. Arriving at 10:30 PM on a cruise ship we were stunned by views of the Parliament building and this majestic bridge very well lighted at night. The next day we crossed it on foot and saw the massive chain links that give it its name.

Beautiful at night. We first saw this beautifully lighted bridge upon arrival on the Danube. The lighting is extremely well done and gorgeous at night. We walked across in the day time and it was immediately clear why it is called Chain bridge because of the massive metal links.

Can't go to Budapest without walking across!. Iconic and historic part of Budapest history. Cool way to get a perspective on both sides of Budapest. Does not take long to walk across and back. It is your own picture taking that might hold you up! One of those things you just have to do when you visit Budapest. Very symbolic of the combining of what was at one time two separate cities.

The best crossing over the Danube.. From all those bridges in Budapest this one is the best! It has great looks and during the evening/night the lights go on and it has a special feel to it. Great views also offcourse!
nice bridge to cross by foot. cross the bridge and take the cablecar if you have the patience to wait in line. It's also easy to take the stair, there is shade if you walk up and its not to steep.

Both Day & Night!. The varied walks you can do in this fantastic city are numerous and each have impressive sights! This bridge surely makes the top of that list. I can see why Katie Perry uses his bridge in her firework video! We walked across both during the day and night...the daytime offers long range views, wind swept landscapes and more than usual pedestrian traffic...particularly before noon. However, mid afternoon, there are few people on it. The bikes go slow and are not really an issue. The nighttime shows many buildings lit up and a much slower pace on the bridge can be seen. Th lions at either end are very impressive. It is a pleasant walk no matter your age. Just go! Hint: July and August will have weekend markets when the bridge will be closed for traffics to allow a fun market to be set up! Check it out if you are in town still!
You never been to Budapest if you didn’t visit chain bridge. Its first permanent bridge between Buda and Pest. Looks especially nice at night from the distance with all the lights

Impressive Bridge. Beautiful bridge with gigantic lions flanking both sides. Nice walk across the Danube and gorgeous at night. Icon of Budapest, destroyed by the Nazi's during WWII but rebuilt and looks original. At the Buda end you can catch the funicular to the top of Castle Hill.
Romantic walk. Right in the centre of town, linking Buda and Pest, this bridge is perfect for a late night romantic stroll. Just watch out for the cyclists
Busy. A busy bridge that will give you a nice view of both Buda and Pest. Just too busy sometimes, so you might want to try it after 12pm, when most tourists have already crossed it.
Connects Buda and Pest!. Connects Buda and Pest, beautiful bridge by day and stunning when lit up at night! Must be seen from river at night to be appreciated!

your visit will be incomplete without Chain Bridge. We crossed the Chain Bridge and had a picnic near the Siklo....we spent hours there admiring the view,people and all kinds of different transportation that past the area....our children loved it...its near shops selling ice creams and drinks...a good rest stop if you habe small children like us,before you move up to the castle or even Fisherman Bastion

If you are able, do it.. I loved my walk across this bridge. So much history and the opportunity to photograph is great about half way down. You can shoot on either side, up and down the river. The walk is easy and safe. Look out for bicycles!

Nice bridge, nothing flash. The bridge has lion statues at either end of the bridge and it's a nice bridge, I don't see it as a tourist attraction though. The bridge is used by cars, buses etc and pedestrians to cross the bridge, and apart fom the statues, that's about it.
good base. We used this as a base as it is next town centre with shops bars and restaurants and on the other side is good sight seeing
Must. Just another must do in Budapest. The locals are very proud of this bridge with its own little history
Imposing bridge. Very impressive and imposing bridge. It’s an icon of Budapest and well worth a visit to get great views of both Buda and Pest.

Impressive construction, amazing night-time views. This is an imposing bridge, linking both sides of the city. Whilst it is nice to look at during the day, it is much better experienced at night with a walk over the bridge to take in the wonderful views of the city, with the buildings along the river bank illuminated by lights. The bridge itself is also lit up and makes for a great view from a bit further down the river.Ordinarily I would not recommend a visit to a bridge, but for views and scenery this is a great location.

Spectacular Bridge. Beautiful bridge spanning the Danube. Take a walk across and enjoy the statues and engravings across its length. The lions at either end are wonderfully carved statues that tell of some of the history.I proposed to my fiance near here at night, when all the lights made the entire city absolutely beautiful, so this bridge will always have a special place in my heart.
Climbing the Chain Bridge. Climb up that bridge just to experience this amazing moment! it was really great and totally exciting :))
Nice walk after dinner. We used to walk over the bridge every night after dinner, such a lovely view I. The evening and a ver refreshing walk from pest to buda

Breathtaking Engineering ............. This bridge is just an amazing piece of construction .... do take the time to walk across its length from Buda to Pest or vice versa the views of the Danube and its expanse are just beautiful, you can just idle away some time soaking up the beautiful panoramic views which this powerful bridge affords us !!
A walk to remember. We walked across the Chain Bridge at night and looked back at Pest.. The Parliament Buildings and hotels were a sight to see.
Historic. Love the chain bridge! Make it a point to visit, if simply for historical reasons...this bridge is famous. I enjoyed studying the architecture, too.

Fantastic views. Walking across the bridge from the Pest side to the Buda side and then back across again was a very comfortable walk. The views were extensive and really amazing. You need to stop several times while crossing to take in all the views available.

A little disappointing. This is a lovely bridge as bridges go but was expecting it to be a little more like Charles Bridge in Prague, which it isn't. Traffic is constant although you are shielded from it by stone walls but the noise is very loud. It looks better from above, try the funicular ride up to the top of castle area where the bridge looks as it should.

Lights along the Danube. The Chain Bridge is majestic, no matter the time, but the view at nighttime is spectacular. It is difficult to imagine that the Nazis destroyed it upon their retreat, but glorious to witness its resurrection in modern times.
Beutiful bridge. Rebuilt after wwii, the chain bridge is the first bridge of Budapest. The lift to castle hill is on one end, and the other is into city central where the pedestrian streets start.
Worth the walk. Wherever you are staying it is worth the walk to the river to view this bridge. We first went and took pictures during the day and returned in the evening when it was dark & lit. WOW!
Iconic landmark. Incredibly graceful and elegant, gorgeous at night. Easy walk between Buda and Pest. Check out the lion statue on the Pest side...what is he missing?
Beautiful and romantic at night . Great views of the bridge and the rest of the city. Worth seeing especially at night. Impressive but simple engineering of the oldest bridge in Budapest.

Great walk and hike up. Walk across here from Pest and go up the path to the Liberty status for some great views. There are a lot of switchbacks, and we encountered some interesting character along the way.
Strolled over. Nice scenery from the bridge. We went over a couple I times as visiting the palace. Hope this is useful, not much more to say as it is just a bridge.
Nice. Very good sight!! Good place to take some photos, espesially durring the night. One of the must be sights in Budapest!!
Bridge evening stroll on arrival.. Watch the traffics! Great views over the river and city. Night lights look stunning. Lots of people out doing the same.

Stroll Across at least once. With so many ways to get from Buda to Pest and visa versa crossing a big traffic-y bridge doesn't always come to mind but its definitely worth a stroll in both directions to get survey the landscape and see what the folks 100 years ago would have had to do to go across. Its also the fastest way to get down to the Shoe Memorial promenade (without crossing traffic and trolley lines) and at night it lights up beautifully.

Better from the river bank. Chain bridge is indeed an iconic image in Budapest, but in my view, it's better looking AT it, than walking ON it. A walk over the Danube on the bridge is something to consider, but be prepared for congestion and vehicle noise. The best view are from the river bank, on either the Buda or Pest side. Evening is spectacular when the bridger is lit up.

Worth walking!!. This bridge is the main bridge to go to the Castle, and many tourist buses go through it but it's worth walk at least once. It's distinctive because is made of stones and is light green.

Oldest Bridge of Budapest. This is oldest Bridge of Budapest...majestic view...makes one feel like living in a fairyland... Takes across Buda to the heart of Pest...underground station just under the bridge & tram station above it...

Historic bridge landmark of Budapest. This wonderful bridge designed by Adam Clark is like a larger version of the bridge at Marlow over the river Thames in England. I would recommend walking across the bridge and back with all the other people that do so and looking at the structure and design.
got to walk the bridge. There are so many bridges in Budapest across the Danube. All of them are great to take a walk on. End of March and early April were great for walking around by the river.

Iconic Bridge. Spanning the Danube, this is probably one of the most iconic structures in Budapest, which is beautiful both day and particularly when lit-up at night. The city is fantastic by night, including this bridge, and a night-time river cruise is a great way to see it.
Nothing special. This bridge was very noisy and busy. We walked over it at night and the traffic was still heavy. It does look lovely lit up though at night.

Amazing. Stunning bridge at night whenm the lights come on. On the Pest side under the bridge on the right there are benches. You can take your own drinks and just relax. On the left side of the bridge is a lovely outdoor open bar with good music and lovely views!

You get a great view of Buda Castle from Chain Bridge!. If you go in the morning, you get lovely views and photos of Buda Castle from Chain Bridge. The bridge itselt if quite lovely to see and has an interesting design.

bridge. One of the best landmarks in the city of Budapest. There is no thphoto of Budapest without this bridge! is the 2nd oldest bridge of the 7 bridges in total. On of the best sites in town especially the night
My favourite bridge ever. Walking through during/after sunset is a must! Beautiful with the Castle Hill in the background. Don't miss it when visiting Budapest.

A great Bridge. Not a bridge too far.
The view from the bridge is great. You can see the various attractions on both sides ( i.e. Buda & Pest ) of the river/ Danube from the bridge. You can get a good view of the citadel also from here.

Wondrous Feat. Although the bridges have all been rebuilt since the war, hearing the history and personal motivations and the engineering machinations that created this original bridge was very interesting and the start of merging these two areas into one city.
Cool and Significant. The draw for me was not only is it architecturally interesting, but the significance it played and still plays of Budapest is interesting.

Lovely with a touch of the UK. This is one of many lovely bridges over the Danube but, it is special according to our local guide,
he told us it was built after the Hammersmith Bridge in London

Icon image of the city. The Chain Bridge is one of the famous icons of the city and should be walked or driven across. It gives you great views of Castle Hill and Fishman's Bastion. The city feels magical while walking across but ultimately it is just a bridge.
Its a bridge. No effort needed to see it as it is one of the main bridges across the Danude. Nice bridge, but doesn't stand comparison to other great bridges in Europe

Budapest landmark. This is a bridge that is a piece of Budapest's history. It lies at the foot of Castle Hill and its easy to get to. If you take the river boat cruise they provide details about the bridges and Budapest itself. The bridge was originally built in the early 1800's to serve the demand to get between Buda and Pest. The builder took great pride in the bridge and the pride still can be seen today with the detail that went into it. It is still a bridge, but I would for sure use it/take a look at it.

Romantic Setting at Night. Admittedly, I do not know much about bridge architecture, but I do know the Chain Bridge is a magnificent place to take in views of Budapest. The chain bridge offers stunning views both day and night, however, I recommend taking a stroll across both sides at night, as the other bridges and many of the notable buildings along the Danube are charmingly illuminated. It may be due to the fact that this is where I proposed to my now fiancé, but the Chain Bridge will always hold a special place in my heart, and hopefully, you'll provide it the same opportunity to have that affect on you.
Scenic bridge. The chain bridge is a beautiful bridge with a wonderful view of the city and the Danube! Take a walk across and take it all in!
'Must-visit' landmark. Look at the photos of how it looked after the retreating Germans blew it up in WW2, and be grateful that it was rebuilt authentically. Look for the lovers' padlocks.

A Budapest Landmark, but the bridge itself is just a bridge.... The huge lion statues at the beginning of the bridge are awesome. It's a beautiful walk across the bridge, and once across, it's an uphill walk along a winding staircase to the Castle District. However the lion statues aside, the bridge itself is not "wow" material. It should still be on your list of things to see however, simply because of it's historic value.

Cool. We walked this bridge several times. If you take the number two tram get off at the Intercontinental Hotel and you can walk across it. There isn't a tram that goes across it but there is plenty of space for pedestrians to walk in both directions. You can get amazing pictures of the Buda Castle and the Church on the Buda Hill. The Gresham Castle is on the the Pest side, walk towards it and the side road next to it leads to St. Stephen's Basilica. On the Buda side, there is a walk way to walk up the hill or you can take the ground tram (not sure what it is called). This will take you up to the Buda Castle.
Watch the cyclists!. Nice walk but be careful of the Kamikaze cyclists! They appear at speed from nowhere and take no prisoners!
best of british design. great news that a brit had a hand building this iconic bridge which is the symbol of Budapest and looks stunning at night when lit up

One of Europe's iconic landmarks. Our tour bus crossed Budapest’s Chain Bridge several times. During the first crossing I scarcely paid any attention to the bridge because I was so busy trying to photograph the Danube waterfront (a tricky proposition from a moving vehicle; not recommended!). The second time, I appreciated the bridge for what it is – a rare and beautiful piece of engineering as well as a functional and symbolic link between Buda and Pest. It would have been great to attend one of those festivals they stage on the Chain Bridge when it’s closed to traffic.
