Yet another good reason why I should pay a return visit to Budapest (as if I needed more!).As one of the iconic landmarks of Europe, the Chain Bridge is a marvelous photo op for Budapest visitors. It’s especially gorgeous when illuminated, so a night cruise on the Danube is highly recommended.

Don't leave Budapest without walking across this lovely bridge!. A beautiful walk day or night. If you are there ion a summer weekend, check to see if they might be blocking it off to traffic and having a street festival-- good (and cheap) food and wine, lovely free music, and crafts!

Not the best but historically important bridge.. This bridge is an important historical sight of Budapest. It was built during Hungarian revolution (mid of 19th century) and opened right after it. It was named after Hungarian Minister of transport Istvan Szechenyi, who supported the project more than anyone else. This bridge became the beginning of uniting two cities Buda and Pest into one Budapest.Besides the historical importance of this bridge that is possible to see in film like "The Bridgeman" (2002, dir. Geza Beremenyi), we (a couple) would not call this bridge as the best in Budapest. At first, it is not possible to sit there and enjoy the views as it is in Liberty (Green) bridge. Second, there are sometimes so many tourists together with souvenir/water sellers, so you are afraid that it can break because of the big crowd. There are also no trams on it that could bring additional atmosphere.In addition to historical importance, the government of the city updates the fame of the bridge via national celebrations by installing fireworks near it during St. Stephen's Day (20th of August) or letting pilots fly under it during 1st of May.

Great location for panoramic pictures of budapest. The positives first: An iconic bridge from with spectacular views of Budapest so a good location for photography. At night the bridge is also quite photogenic. The negatives: The bridge walkways can become very crowded with people but the real problem are the cyclists who expect everyone to clear a path for them. Also the road is very busy and the air quality is not that great !
Spot for views in all directions. Nice bridge to cross with beautiful views on all sides. A must cross at night to see the lights of the city and castle.

Impressive bridge.... It isn't the most beautiful bridge I've ever seen,but sure is very beautiful and impressive.We took a walk from Buda to Pest side,and it was very nice.You just relax and enjoy looking at the mighty Danube river.

Beautiful bridge; great views at day or night. Iconic Budapest bridge....it's in most pictures of Budapest. Easy to walk on either side, and the views in both direction are wonderful. Walking toward Buda, you see the funicular heading up to the Castle area straight ahead, the Citadella to the left, as well as the whole Buda waterfront. Going to Pest, you see the Parliament building to your left and the City Center is straight in front of you. The views are wonderful, and it's worth walking it both during the day and especially at night as the lights on the bridges and the buildings are illuminated.
Pleasant Walk Across the Danube. I am no bridge architect, but it was a pleasant walk across the river to the base of Castle Hill and the funicular station to the top on the Pest side of the river.
picture perfect. I am not into bridges but my husband is. He says it is a great example of famous bridges. i ENJOYED WALKING OVER IT AND SEEING THE VIEWS OF THE DANUBE

Wonderful bridge. Beautifully designed and either end leads to interesting areas - definitely one of my top bridges! The view north towards Parliament is spectacular and it gives you a great feel for the power of the Danube.
Neat place to walk. Beautiful by night when the neighboring bridges and buildings are illuminated. Walk carefully, though.

You cant miss it. Very easy to find and the walking path on both sides of the bridge is wide enough for pedestrians and cyclists - so watch out for them! Great views all around. To cross the road on the Buda side you can walk down the steps and follow the path along the river that runs underneath the bridge to get to the other side.

walk on the bridge and admire the architecture. Our hotel was around 500 meters from the bridge. We passed through this by day and by night. We walked on the bridge from end to end on our way to the river cruise. It was a 15 minute walk on the bridge and another 10 minutes going to the docking area .The bridge was well lighted at night and looked a bit festive with many people passing through it.
Iconic river crossing. A wonderful bridge designed by a scotsman called Adams i believe. It looks well proportioned for its site and is an iconic symbol for the city. Lit up at night.

Highest Water Levels in 500 Years. An amazing trip. The cruise was cancelled due to higest water in 500 years. But the opportunity to see the high river and the efforts to contain it were once in a lifetime.
Absolutele stunning at night. You must go down to the riverside at night and get some shots of this beautiful bridge…another fab view is from the Fishermans Bastion on the Buda side

An average looking bridge ...a lot of fuss over nothing. Thee was a lot said about the history of this bridge , so found myself underwhelmed when I crossed it 4 times on the bus and didn't notice.I expect something like this to be of london bridge esque, capturing a true historic landmark with colours and imposing itself on the city.This however was a drab affair with really nothing inviting about it.One thing is it looks good in the night. That's about it. Easily missed , but don't worry if you do.

Lovely by night. This is a walk worth doing but it's noisy to say the least. Views are lovely. Be careful of bikes. We visited it by day and night. The bridges are lovely and provide another way of viewing this lovely city.

Very nice bridge. We had planned to cross the bridge on May 1st, but it was closed due to a street race and an air show commemorating May Day. On May 2, 2014, we did cross the bridge. It was a nice walk with a nice view of both sides of the river. Yes, it is just a bridge, but it is a symbol of Budapest, therefore, a must see.
Very good. It's a beautiful experience to cross the bridge, especially in the night! The lights reflexes on the river are amazing!
Excellent views of River & Castle from Bridge. Took many photos of river & Palace etc from the Bridge. The funicular up to the Castle/Palace is just across the bridge on the south side.

Just a bridge, not an attraction. Why anyone would review this bridge as an attraction? Just a bridge. Yes you can see the water, and metal construction. Its not even that beautiful. Should not be on the list at all , dont waste your time.

Budapest's oldest and most famous bridge. The chain bridge (Szechenyi bridge) is the oldest bridge connecting Buda and Pest. It was built in the 19th century, but destroyed in the WWII. They retrieved it from the Danube and restored it. It is one of the city's landmarks, and for good reason. It is big, central, offers a spectacular view of the Danube and the City and it has a history.There is a story behind the 4 lions gatekeeping the bridge (2 on each side). Rumor has it that the architect was very proud of his work (as h should be), boasting that the bridge was perfect. He woved to jump into the Danube should anyone find a flaw with it. Then a little girl (some say it was his own daughter) noticed that the 4 lions don't have tongues in their open mouth. The architect admitted it was a mistake and was very distraught. He was about to surrender himself to the river, when Mr. Szecheny (who was a major benefactor) said that the lions would grow tongues when a Hungarian woman crosses the bridge, who has never cheated on her husband. Some 150 years later, they are still tongueless.
Interesting and Beautiful. This was just outside of our hotel, the Intercontinental, and is a must see and a pretty easy walk between Buda and Pest across the Danube. Highly recommend.

Pretty but more during the night. It is a nice attraction in the city but basically during the day looks more or less just like a bridge. But during the night when it is lightened and the building of the Parliament as well it looks amazing. Make a trip also at night to the other side of the bridge to see this view- you won't regret :)

One of Budapest's most important bridges. Chain bridge connects Buda and Pest so it is the shortest way to get into the city central if you stay in the Buda side or vice versa. Buses no. 16,105 runs very frequently crossing the bridge or it's about 8 minutes nice and safe walk along the bridge even at night (no tram). The bridge is well lightened and has it's beauty and impressive reflections in the Danube river. Beautiful photos at dawn and especially at night can be taken from the the bridge to both sides. Watching Castle Hill at night feels like living in a fairy tale...

Nice stroll across the river. We decided to walk across the bridge using the wide pedestrian walkway. The views of both sides of the river are very good. There are some great photo opportunities from the Pest side, with the magnificent Parliament building in the background. It is an easy stroll.

Worth walking across at least one. The bridge is long, but beautiful and walk is lovely with beautiful view of Budapest. You will need to cross one of the bridges to go to Buda side anyway so pick this one to go across. At night it is beautifully lit so nice to take photo of.

Széchenyi lánchíd. Beautiful bridge, good point to access the castle on the Buda side of the city. Worth a walk across, both in the day and at night. At night, would recommend walking one way over the Chain bridge (Széchenyi lánchíd), the other way across Margaret Bridge.
Worth a visit. Lovely lit up but also a nice walk through the day. Great views of the Danube. Didn't get a chance to walk over at night but lit up it adds to the beauty of the city.

Beautiful Bridge. The Chain Bridge is one of the landmarks of Budapest and it did not disappoint us! It is a working bridge: vehicles travel it in both directions and there are pedestrian walkways on both sides. It is easily accessed from both banks of the Danube and is definitely worth a stroll. Check the facades of the two pillars; their stone details are works of art in their own right. Also do a Danube night walk on either side of the river. The bridge is illuminated and both interesting and beautiful from near or far away.

What's with this bridge?. There are three important bridges over Danube, linking Buda with Pest, but I saw a lot of emphasis on this one.It has a Y shape and it also assures connection with Margarita Island, but I didn't think is looks as nice as the other two bridges.Anyway, I crossed the Danube multiple times on it and got to the island from it, so it has strategic location, but that would be all, it is very crowded, people with bikes cross it too and it is complicated because walking portion is tight, also when it rains there are portions where the water accumulates so watch what shoes you are wearing when you go over it.

Beautiful bridge and views. Though blown up by the Germans while fleeing Budapest near the end of WWII, the bridge was put back together and is well worth viewing and walking across. This is also the site of the first bridge joining Buda and Pest, which was a pontoon bridge. Walk across at night for a great experience!
Very romantic.. Visit at night, very romantic. There are some nice musicians on te bridge and paly wonderful music, my wife really enjoyed every minute.

Walking in Budapest. if you are into walking then a lovely walk is to start at the government building in Pest and walk to the Margaret Bridge crossing the bridge into Buda. Then walk along the river bank enjoying the views of the government building and then crossing back to Pest across the Chain Bridge. This walk it best done at sundown/dusk to take in the lit up Buda Castle and Government Buildings.

The Old Gold Days. Budapest city is full of history and Chain Bridge is no exception. A very good piece of antique to admire specially at night with breathtaking panoramic scenery. A must see if you are there.
Nice architecture. It felt really good walking through bridge and watching both sides of Budapest. It was also nice listening to story of the bridge from our lovely guide :)
A great walk across a historic bridge. Even though the day was windy and chilly, we thoroughly enjoyed our walk across this beautiful bridge in Budapest. Great views of Parliament and of Buda.
A great bridge.. A great looking bridge. When lit up at night is beautiful. It is a must see both during the day and night.
Beautiful in the evening. The bridge in the evening lit up looks stunning against the Danube and the Parliment building in the background.

Watch out for the wind!. We walked across this bridge during a free walking tour of Budapest. Our guide warned us to hold on to our hats and bundle up as it is particularly windy crossing the bridge. It gives great views of both the Buda Hills and Pest.

Beautiful bridge but VERY busy. The bridge connects Gresham Palace and the parliament district in Pest with the Castle Hill in Buda. As such it is also very heavily trafficked, so expect plenty of noise - as well as plenty of tourists! At times it was difficult to get through the walkway, as it was so packed full of people (many stopping to take pictures, of course).I recommend walking across it on both sides (there are two walkways, one on each side of the road), taking in the views up/down the Danube and of the two shorelines.

Footbridge between Buda and Pest. An interesting bridge linking the two parts of the city which you can walk or cycle across. Lovely views of the Danube river and both parts of the city. Look closely at the Lions- they have no tongues,

The Eifel Tower of Hungary. If you visit Budapest, you must have at least one photo of the Chain Bridge. Best photo opportunities are from the Pest side of Budapest from Castle Hill. From there you can get panoramic views of the Buda side of the city, the Danube and Budapest's glorious Parliament building.

Suspense. This is the oldest permanent bridges in Budapest. The name is Chain bridge. The point being that this is a suspension bridge. Designed by William Tierney Clark, it was regarded to be one of the world's engineering wonders. You should take a walk from the Pest side and enjoy the beautiful view of the not so blue Danube. At the foot of the bridge there are famous lions designed by Mr. Marschalko who is said to have committed suicide because the lions do not seem to have tongues. The Communist coat-of-arms have been replaced by the traditional Hungarian coat-of-arms. On the Buda side of the bridge there used to be the famous zero point, all roads in Hungary originated from the square. The traffic is quite heavy on the bridge during rush hours.
A symbol of Budapest. Probably the first thing to do in Budapest is to walk over the Danube to the Buda side. Enjoy the views!

Bridge connecting the two cities. This bridge is nice, especially in regard of the area it is located in. It connects the Gresham palace with the castle hill. I could imagine this to be a perfect spot if you are into photography.

Not sure what the fuss is about. We walked across this bridge on the way to & from Castle Hill and we saw it from a distance as well. Yes, it's quite attractive, but I've seen plenty more impressive bridges than this, I don't really know why people rave about it. Perhaps it's symbolic of Budapest or Hungarian national pride? Anyway I'm clearly in the minority so go and take a look, if it gives you the wow factor then great, if not then there are plenty of other things nearby to look at.

Beautiful but highly overrated. The bridge has a very strong and beautiful construction and some eyecatching statues, but for my taste, so does the rest of budapest danube bridges, they are all well taken care of, wide, have great access for both transport and walkers..concluded I would say it's a bridge you have to cross and you will even if you didn't intend to, but don't let all the reviews on the net put your hopes way up to how breathtaking it is.

A Chain Bridge. Nothing spectacular. A pleasant enough walk over the Danube but that is about all really. Very busy at Easter so what it would be like in summer I dread to think. Historical interest with the Second World War.

The Lions don't have tongues?. I heard from a Hungarian that the giant lion statues don't have tongues. Then I was reading about it, and the author said there is no way to tell since they are so high off the ground.
This was the first bridge I crossed after arriving in Budapest, and it is truly magnificent. The architecture, the views, everything....
nice walk at sunset. This is a great place to take a walk at sunset. There are lovely views of Gresham Place and the city.
historic. worth a trip over just to experiance the views from the bridge, and direct crossing to castle hill watch out for the bicycles crossing theres plenty of them
Beautiful Bridge. Great bridge to see from afar, walk across, at night or daytime. Strikes curiosity in me to see the Marlow Bridge in England for comparison.

Such a memorable sight at night. While in Budapest, we stayed in an apartment that overlooked this beautiful landmark. I highly recommend one of the many night cruises on the Danube. The photos of the bridge as you're passing under or near it are truly beautiful. The other sights while doing the cruise are breathtaking. Buda Castle, the most spectacular Parliament House and Castle Hill to name a few.

King of the bridges. I thought I'd seen some great bridges in my time, but this bridge is literally a miracle. I feel sorry for all others bridges, they must feel pretty uninspired in comparison. I crossed back and forth for hours lost in complete amazement. The architecture is truly unparalleled and I'm not sure I can return my hometown of Paris now without some food for thought, and perhaps a few architectural endeavours of my own.
Amazing at night. We walked over the bridge during our time in Budapest and it is such a beautiful bridge. It is amazing at night with all the lights along it.
A given if you are in Budapest. We walked along at night (6 college kids) and had a blast - beautiful city and this is center piece!

Crossed by night from Buda to Pest. It's 0 minutes from heaven. Further you go, 1 minute from there you find the most luxurious hotels, then the cathedal, and on to the Andrássy avenue, 'bout 15 minutes.... from there: left or right, or ahead, FUN, FUN, FUN..

Nice detail in our photos of the Danube. Although we didn't have time to walk across this bridge, it is seen in many of our photos and is a nice detail in all of them. The bridge looks really nice and became somewhat of a symbol of Budapest for me. Next time we'll have to give it a proper visit.
Very pretty. when the weather is nice you can see the most amazing views of Budapest from this bridge it's fantastic

if you are on the mood to walk. bridge is one of Budapest sights and i would recommend to have a longer walk and stroll over the bridge from Buda side to Pesta side and you will have a chance to make a great pics of Parlament!

A delight to stroll over. The Chain bridge - one of the most beautiful sights in Budapest. Walk over the Danube from Pest to Buda, or reverse, see the sights alongside the Danube. Very attractive at night time - all lit up.
Beautiful. Historical and beautyful. This is a must see in budapest. Enjoy the view and a nice walk in the town.
Beautiful but not a must. It is a beautiful bridge but not so beautiful. I don't understand why is so famous. The Elisabeth bridge is more interesting.

Crowded. if you care about photography go there after 01.00 or 02.00 am.
usually crowded with its side effects (noise, space for tripods etc.)
Strange lightings, tungsten (too orange yellow) on the road lights, white on the bridge.
Interesting, but just a bridge.... Not as stunning as Golden Gate. It is a cool bridge and we loved the Danube; however, the chain bridge is not a reason to go to Budapest for me...
Back in time. Bridge was destroyed in the second world war but was rebuilt to the original bridge plans rivets and all. Great to stroll along and day dream looking out on the Danube.
Nearly as good as Albert bridge. A part of Buda and Pest history as it joins the two parts of the city together hence Budapest. A great way to see the two halves of the city.

Worth a visit. Beautifully lit up! Great to see at night against backdrop of the castle. Interesting piece of info that the architect who designed it killed himself as he was criticised for not giving the lions tongues!

This is a beautiful structure. There is not a lot to say about this as so many of the bridges of Budapest crossing the Danube are beautiful but this one is among the tops. It is older and some of them are current architecture. You will see it pretty much however you travel around
Worth a Walk Across. The most famous of the bridges in Budapest, the Chain Bridge has lovely views of the Danube and the city. Well worth a quick walk across.

superb. The best of the many beautiful bridges of Budapest. Beautifully illuminated at night. Nice story told that the road tunnel on the Buda side was Built to house the bridge and keep it dry when it rains.
Nice. Went over here a few times on the tour bus, its a lovely bridge, one of many lovely bridges. Nice views when going over it.

Stunning. The views from this bridge are Stunning. Great photo opportunity. The bridge in itself is just Beautiful and so are the views. But to fall in love with The Chain Bridge, one must see it at night time with all the lights giving you such a warm glow. It truly is Breathtaking.
lovely. chain bridge is amazing at night lit up. we walked over it twice a day from Buda side every time was amazed at the views from it
A good photo opportunity. Walk across this and marvel at the engineering and the views, then view it again, at night, from the Castle District

The pride of Budapest!. Like the Eiffel Tower is to Paris, the Colosseum to Rome, Brandenburg Gate to Berlin, the CHain Bridge is the pride of Budapest! Each time i walk across or even drive across this spectacular breathtaking bridge during day or night, I fall in love with the city all over again (I've been living here for the last 2 years!). It most likely is the first thing to tick off your must-see list.TOP LOCAL TIP: Take the Furnicular up to Buda Castle for panoramic views of Chain Bridge during the day. And to see it best in all its magnificence at night time, go up to the Citadella!
Beautiful views and nice walk. A great opportunity for photos of the river and city from both sides... All of the bridges are just beautiful and have their own character..

Brooklyn Bridge of Budapest. Our river ship docked under this bridge and having dinner looking up at the lights was a treat. It is a very lovely bridge and perfectly matched to its surroundings. I would presume walking it is a must (we didn't have time).
Wonderful Views. Walked along the chain bridge a few times during our stay and it provides amazing views of the river and the city. At night it lights up and becomes one of the star attractions.
Great view down the Danube. Crossing the Danube on this bridge was really nice - great views both sides. It was very windy but lovely and sunny when we went across
Walking tour. Best to visit both in the day and during the night! There are a lot of things to see and lots of picturesque sites to capture on film...

Chain Bridge - Historic and attractive bridge crossing the Danube. Chain Bridge (Szechenyi Lanchid) is an historically important bridge crossing the Danube River in Budapest that is well worth viewing and perhaps walking during trips to the city. Designed by William Clark and opening in 1849, this was the first permanent bridge linking Buda to Pest. At the time, Chain Bridge was considered one of the most stunning bridges in the world, along with the Brooklyn Bridge in NYC (USA). It remains beautiful to this day. You can see the 202 metre long suspension bridge well from both sides of the river and there are some very attractive vantage points from upon Castle Hill, allowing you to take photos of the bridge with Pest in the background. It is very much worth walking the bridge between Buda and Pest as well. In addition to the decorative cast iron and two pillar arches you pass, the end of the bridge features lions resting upon the abutments. These were carved by sculptor Janos Marscholko in 1852 and add a majestic touch to this attraction. At night, the bridge arches are lit, making it very nice to see Chain Bridge after the sun goes down as well. Overall, we very much liked the Chain Bridge, finding this to be our second favourite behind Art Nouveau style - Liberty Bridge. It is a nice landmark to see and also enjoyable to cross during trips to Budapest.

Wonderful bridge wonderful view.. The chain bridge is well worth a visit. It's a wonderful piece of engineering. The views of castle hill and parliament are also excellent from here. Lovely place to go and see
chillly. Lovely bridge to walk along, is very chilly, nice views of the city. If you can go just before dark and you can see the lights go on, which is very pretty.

A Must visit if in the area. Such a beautiful piece of history here. Fantastic views up both sides of the river, and just beautiful to look at. A must do if in the area exploring. Only takes a few minutes to cross and is easy to assess. Good pedestrian access on both sides and wide enough for wheelchairs and pushchairs.

5/5 would cross again. Beautiful bridge, well maintained and with lots of character, as you might expect from Budapest's first permanent bridge! Crossing it is a delight. Great views as a pedestrian, not only up and down the Danube but up to Castle Hill and across to Pest as well. The bridge is fairly tastefully lit and makes a good spectacle at night too. 5/5 would cross again!

Views, history and an interesting story. The landmark of Budapest of course and built by a Scot. The briedge keeper is the same man, I think he said 4th generation, of the original family. Nice little funicular car at the Buda side worth a ride up to the Palace.

Lovely, especially on a nice day. Great views on either side and impressive architecture. Walked over and back visiting the Buda side of the city and got some fantastic photos. Should be on every tourists to do list.

5 stars not because of size but charm and ease of access!. This lovely bridge connects the Buda and Pest sides of the city over the Danube and is an easy walk of a few minutes. The walk is flat from the Pest side and the Buda hill can be avoided by taking the funicular or the bus from near the end of the bridge. Each side has a pedestrian path shielded totally from the traffic by the bastions and chains...lovely views of the river and city and guarded by huge lion statues.
Architectural Marvel. an amazing structure and looks beautiful.we walked over it to the Buda side and to the castle!must see!

Visit at night!. Be sure to head down to the bridge around dusk for the best view. The bridge is lit up at night, along with the Royal Palace on the hill behind, and is quite simply a stunning photo opportunity. I sat for a long time by the river side admiring the view.
A piece Scottish engineering. Handsome piece of engineering with good views of the river in both directions, gives access to the Castle district

Chain Bridge. The chain bridge is very impressive. Its a lovely stroll across it from the Pest side to the Buda side. The bridge is all lit up at night and looks lovely. A must see if you're in Budapest.
Nice. Need to checkin there and all. Beautifull as all old bridges :) better view you can get from the top of the castle hill
Landmark No.1.. Smell of the XIX. century, the bridge is designed by an English engineer called Adam Clark and became one of the most important landmarks of Budapest
Amazing. Lovely to stroll over the famous blue Danube rive. The chain bridge was wonderful and intricate, apparently designed by the same architect who made Tower Bridge, London
Just a bridge. Looks much nicer in the evening when it is lit and you see it much better from the boat trip. A way of travelling from Buda to Pest
Beautiful old Bridge. Lovely old bridge that is made for a stroll a crossed the river. We only saw it during the day but I hear that is worth seeing at night!

It's beautiful at night!. Make sure you see this beautiful bridge at all times of day & night. It's just beautiful at night, the lights playing on the Danube, the Castle lit up above. We stayed at the Gresham Palace where we could look out on this at night ~ an experience I will not soon forget!

Romantic walk. The Chain bridge is lovely for a nice walk across to Castle hill, but it was equally interesting to observe from a boat trip when we passed underneath it!! A great construct that nevers fails to impress you!
Worth a walk. Nice bridge that is worth a walk, especailly on a nice day! It is even more beautiful at night with the lights!
Nice walk. On a lovely spring day it is a nice walk accross the bridge - great views and very safe for pedestrians.

Links this wonderful city. . This is a baffling and stunning piece of engineering. Rivals any bridge I have seen in any other central european city. Please make time to go at night when lit up its breathtaking.

It's a nice enough bridge. I'm not sure why so many people are raving about this bridge, it's nice enough quite ornate and it definitely reaches from one side of the Danube to the other. Is it an attraction you should go out of your way to see......no...I think Budapest has more to offer than that. But it's impressive enough as you walk across it to get from Buda to Pest of vice versa
Lovely bridge. Obviously worth walking across - very nice bridge. Good views of both sides of the river, and also of the Four seasons hotel (Gresham Palace).
A good spot. The Bridge must be visited during the day and the in the evening. Both views are amazing. You can see the Danube and appreciate the beauties of Budapest. High recommended :)
Landmark bridge. We stayed on the Pest side with a view from our note. Very beautiful both in daytime and when the lights are on the evening.

You can't not go.. Okay, so it it is only a bridge. However, it's location make it a prime spot for pictures from anywhere in Buda or on the river, and it's a great spot to get some splendid views of the other sights of the city. On a warm sunny day a great place for a nice relaxing stroll.

What an incredible building!. If you search online, you'll see how this incredible bridge looked like before the war. Even tho the newer bridge looks more modern than the original one (not in wood and not as high), it is still a magnificent emblem of the city! You'll have a great view of both sides of the city and should enjoy taking some great photos.

BudaBest. Budapest was the Best! it is one of the must see cities in Europe, we were a group of friends in a Euro trip, Budapest was the last city in out tour, it is a must visit city! the view from Budapest castle to the Bridge and the parliament is hilarious!
Faboulas Bridge. You have to visit this bridge when in Budapest,lots happening on it and a great place for photosgraphs.

The bridge of bridges. The Chain bridge is one the iconic bridges in Europe. The best views of the bridge are during the evening, with its lights magically reflecting on the Danube waters, with the castle crowning a breathtaking scenery.
A beautifully designed bridge. Whilst in Budapest, this is well worth a visit to walk over between seeing Buda Castle and the Parliament building and 'Shoes on the Danube'.

Another bridge. This bridge was not really any more impressive than a lot of other bridges in river cities. I suppose coming from Sydney where we have a very impressive harbour bridge, I expect a lot! It was a nice way to walk across the river, and we did get some lovely photos but it's not the be all and end all of bridges. It is however a good way to get from one side to the other so it's worth a trip.

Central Bridge, See from Castle and Fort at night. Central bridge connecting Pest and Buda. Go up funicular on Buda side for a great view. Also great views from Fishermans Bastion and from the Fort at otherside of the plateau.

Spectacular night walk between the bridges. ’Széchenyi lánchíd’ (Chain Bridge), the oldest suspension bridge of continental Europe, is a must-see and a 'must-walk' attraction in Budapest. Even if you walked it over in the day and made some exquisite photos, make time to come back after it gets dark and stroll between the Chain Bridge and Elisabeth Bridge on Jane Haining rakpart when the bridge lights are on. The illuminated landmarks on the Buda hill side and their reflection on the Danube are astonishing - the bridges, the Castle, the impressive National Library, the Statue of St. Gellert, Citadella, the Liberty Statue, the rocking boats on the river... Don’t forget your camera!

First suspension bridge. Amazing bridge. Easy to walk over on either side - the traffic runs through the centre part, but you are separated by stone pillars etc. Magnificent views of the various historical landmarks plus the Danube itself which is a very wide river so lots to see.

Old world charm magnified!. A stroll across one of the most famous bridges on the Danube cannot be forgotten! My wife's great grandmother made the same journey back in the 1890's for her catering business, so a trip across by the 4th generation to visit Budapest was something special. You MUSTT see it at night!!

just one of those epic bridges. There's little or anything I can add that hasn't been said so many times before, but sauntering across this bridge is just essential. It's up there with the Brooklyn Bridge, the Golden Gate, and Sydney Harbor Bridge (okay..I'm exaggerating a tad because Sydney really blew me away!). I ventured across the bridge at night and it's just so picturesque with the unique Budapest skyline framed in the background.

The greatest walk. If you visit Budapest and don't cross this bridge, your visit is incomplete. Do it at night and experience the beauty of the city, listen to the Danube flowing by and imagine what it was like when all of the bridges in the city were destroyed during the war.

check out the lookout!. there's a lookout on the Buda side of the bridge where you can climb up and look over the incoming traffic ..great view :) the bridge itself is also beautiful especially at nighttime.

A beautiful way to cross the Danube. A nice walk across the Danube and the bridge itself is truly stunning. The walkway is very child friendly as there is no noticeable danger from the traffic...Stunning views too.

A classic to be seen day and night. It is always amazing to see early engineering feats to appreciate the technology and brilliance involved. And this one had to be rebuilt after the German's destroyed it in 1945 - you would not know. Most evenings we sat and marvelled at it lit up.
See it at night!. Beautiful bridge especially seen from the Danube river at night time, if you can go on a night cruise, you will see the bridge at its best!
Worth a visit.. Asuming you are going to cross the Danube while visiting Buda and Pest you would do well to cross here as this is a major landmark and central to Pest's Basilica and Buda's Palace.

Enjoy the view!. I sincerely think that the bridges in Budapest make the city such a beautiful destination for romantic getaways or any kind of trip really. This is a very walking friendly area, the bridge lights are on from early evening until midnight which is amazing to take pictures and enjoy a walk around.

British engineering. I got attracted to this location from Michael Palin BBC documentary on Budapest. This is a must see in Budapest as ithe best view of the bridge is from the Fornecular train at the Buda castle.

great bridge great story. very original architecture and interesting story that goes with the building of the bridge. we walked over one night, very windy, but worth it for fun. look out for the cyclists - for some reason they dont use their bells behind you so keep alert.
Night or day. Which ever time you visit its worth the time to stop and Look. In the day a busy river crossing and a night all light up its fantastic.
Walked across it 3 times!. What views from this glorious bridge. Recommend it as a wonderful refreshing walk! Got some great photos from the two middle posts which jut out from the bridge.
Great walk. We walked across the bridge and marveled at the views on both sides. I highly recommend making the walk to take in the beauty of Budapest
Interesting. There are quite a few bridges over the Danube linking Buda with Pest, I think we walked over 4 whilst we were there. The Chain Bridge is very pretty and worth a walk over.
Cross this to get to budapest side of budapest.. Classic bridge crossing the Danube. Walk across to the fenicular railway. It's a busy tourist trap but worth the effort.

great bridge. Spectacular bridge connecting Buda and Pest, very historical! It is a must to cross and walk on the bridge for you to feel the significance and the hugeness of the said bridge. Many people are walking so will not get lost and afraid
Its a bridge, but a nice one.. Did you ever cross a bridge before? Well here's another. Its nice with beautiful design but it's a bridge. ...get over it.
perfect for a night time stroll. This bridge is at it's best at night when illuminated, a lovely stroll from buda to pest with views up and down the danube. Beautiful.

Magnificent!. The bridge is grandiose! Its size, its lights, its lions, oh my, it really is so impressive!In Buda side you can find the funicular to take you up to the Castle hill, and in Pest side the bridge actually leads to the Four Seasons hotel, a true gem.Visit the bridge by day and by night, you should not regret it, since the photos you will take will be exquisite!

crossing a bridge is like coming across people from everywhere. We crossed this bridge tens of times ,it joins Buda and Pest together. Buda is the old part while Pest is the modern commercial part . The chain doesn't lie on its own, there are several other bridges lying parallel to it. All of them are so different and authentic. And they simply lit up the whole city by night..I would prefer a ight cruise...Budapest is busy city yet the river harmonises the air around

Nice construction. This place reminds the construction between the old and new Budapest. Walk through the river relaxing and enjoying the view makes you remind how should be in the past or use these minutes to see the difference between Buda and Peste from down.

Beautiful but busy. Chain bridge has a nice location and it's definitely a good place to cross and maybe take some pictures too. It's sometimes pretty crowded and there's might be beggars too. Better to walk that go by bike!
Very nice view. It is really nice, especially in the evening and at night.
Great walk over the Duna. Lovely bridge and a great views both from the Buda and Pest sides. Also its free. If you watch ITV dramas with Viking river cruises this is featured quite often.

Its a bridge. Whats there to like or not to like..
It looks nice, an impressive structure but its just a bridge :)
Iconic bridge. It's worth walking over this once in the day and then again at night. On the Buda side take the funicular up Castle hill.

Views!!. Walk over this bridge both day and night, see the city from the bridge. It's beautiful. At nighttime you can see the glow of the lights reflecting in the Danube.
If you can go on a boat trip and see it from the water.

Character. Of course this bridge gives a great amount of character to Buda and Pest. It's story is the modern history - built in the late 1800s as Budapest strove to rise. Blown up by the Germans on the way out of town. Rebuilt again in 1947. Still standing in 2014.Character also comes from a bracing walk from Buda to Pest on a cold winter day - the view is magnificent and the wind was bracing.

Just Walking. When you visit an attraction it is always good to know when it was constructed, who made it, what is its history. But there are some buildings, places, bridges, streets, where you feel you simply need to walk, not to think about history or technical data. Chain Bridge is typically such a place. Go in the evening, when lights are on and reflected in the Danube. The bridge itself is a wonder, but you have also an excellent view on the city. There is always an intensive traffic on it, so you can fell the heartbeat of Budapest. Just walk....

Allows crossing of the river. As a bridge, this is a 5 star attraction. It allows the crossing of a wide stretch of water from one bank to another. Certainly worthy of 5 stars, we crossed this bridge 4 times, twice by foot and twice by bus. On no occasion did it dissatisfy us. Furthermore we passed under the bridge (by boat) twice and I would say the view is better from the bridge itself.*****

Worths a walk through. We walked through the bridge as I knew it worth it and it was a good choice, even in not such a good weather, but I think it's one of the most romantic places and a must see for turists. Camera recommended! :)

Chain Bridge Walk. We walked over the bridge and it was very interested to see the intricate working of metal below the structure. Definitely a fun thing to do. It is a great jaunt from the Buda to Pest side of the city and a great view down the Danube.
Walk from Pest to Buda. Walking the bridge from Pest to Buda gives you a beautiful stunning view of Buda, while crossing the Danube.

The Iconic picture of Budapest - you have to see just to get the pic.. Rather surprised by a recent review saying it looks tatty and full of holes LOL It is old and thats part of its charm - who wants to see a new bridge (unless Norman Fosters done it I suppose). Its the main bridge between Buda and Pest, so you have to see it, and at night it has the most amazing view of both sides of the city. From Pest walk across the bridge and take the funicular up to the castle area - walk to Fishermans Bastion and just take in the view. If you are staying at the Buda Hilton, then do the reverse ! Either way this is how you get to see both of the best views in Budapest. Incidentally anyone who has been to Marlow and feels a bit of deja vu, thats because it was designed by the same chap !

First impression/views on our first morning in the city. Walking from our hotel which was nearby, we had an amazing view of this very impressive bridge which is 1 of 3 crossing the Danube, and is a very busy crossing for cars.It was apparently built between 1839-49, and was designed by an Englishman William Tierney Clark and built by a Scot.The bridge is supported by two majestic towers and is guarded by two vast stone lions

Disappointed with it.... The bridge is in need of repair and is quite tatty. Not quite sure what all the fuss is about. Yes, at night, it looks good but walking across it you get to see the rust and holes in it. Anything can look good when festooned with lights but in daylight I'd give it 2*.
Take in the beauty of Budapest. Budapest is situated in such a beautiful place on the Danube that anything that allows you to appreciate the view is simply worth it.
Worth a walk on!. This bridge had seen a lot and is still there! Parts are a bit worn down and needs so touch ups in my opinion but still breath taking and you can take some amazing pics from it!

A Great Spot for Breathtaking Photos. When sightseeing in Budapest, be sure to stop by the Chain Bridge. The views are gorgeous and it's a great place to take breathtaking photos, especially at night when the bridge is lit up. In the winter, be sure to dress warmly as a walk across the bridge can feel 10-15 degrees lower than actual temperatures. Fisherman's Bastion is a gorgeous sight from afar and during the holidays, it's a great spot to see landmarks all lit up.
so much to see from this bridge!. we stayed in Buda, traveled into Pest daily; the Chain Bridge was our path. Took a ton of photos here.

A "gold" chain from Buda to Pest . This bridge is so elegant in the day time. It connecting the old Buda and Pest part, where now we known to be one big city, Budapest. The look of this bridge at night is so beautiful, charming and fabulous. Its like a gold chain, linking the Bud and the Pest area and shimmering the darkness of Danube at night. Just enjoy your own sensation walk over from head end of Pest to Buda head end area, vice versa. The sensation so different between the day time and the night. Its worth to walk over crossing the bridge and spend and enjoy the beautiful view around. Adoring the bridge structure and it's glory are additional own experience. 3 days in Budapest, I crossed over the Bridge 2 times, and feel both sensation in day time and night. You can reach the bridge from center by using Metro or bus. It become a famous tourist attraction so be prepared for the crowd.

Playing lights. The bridge is realy astoneshing,i love the architekture it makes you fell hto be in a diferent time. The view at the night is awesome from every angle you are waching it:buda castleYou can see the whole city from it.

easy to walk!. It appeared too long to walk across when viewing from the window of our hotel(Sofitel), but it was not.It didn't take time.We were able to enjoy watching lion statues closely and feeling the breeze above the river.Recommend!

Worth a walk across. Very nice views of the city, and a beautiful and historic bridge. A great spot for photography enthusiasts because of that.Also, before or during your visit, look up the picture that was taken of the bridge and Buda Castle in February 1946, right after the war had destroyed much of both, and compare it to what you see. Gives a real sense of Hungary's rough history.
take a stroll. It's nice to take a stroll from one side to another. It's worth the wait to see it light up at night time, as the city's night life starts thriving even more.

Unbelievably beautiful!. Fantastic bridge connecting Buda and Pest. Gorgeous looking both in day time as during the night. I could take x amount of picture and it still wouldn't be enough.A must, must see!
Photos !!!!!!!!!. I just couldn't take too many . It has so many fantastic views to and around it . At night it just offers so many photo opps .

Best spot of the city.. You find yourself in between Buda and Pest, right on the middle of the history. Walking path on the sides of bridge is exciting, you get a wonderful view of Danube and both parts of the city.
Walk over. Walk over this bridge. The rust is a bit unnerving but the bridge feels solid enough and the design in worth the visit
Iconic structure. By all means an iconic structure. Unfortunately there were several strings of lights out making evening photos lacking. The Liberty Bridge held the crown on our trip and photos.

Beautiful sight at night. This is definitely the best bridge in Budapest. Luckily the river cruise boat I was on was moored close to the bridge and so I got good views of the bridge throughout the day. But a must is to see the beauty of it just as the night is drawing in, with the magnificent buildings on the hill behind framing it perfectly in any picture.
A must. It's hard not to pass it, but a beautiful bridge over a beautiful river. Can get fairly busy but take a stroll and some pictures on your way to the castle
Must see!. Cross it on foot, and pay attention to the beautiful details, it will quickly be clear why is this bridge so iconic. Be sure to go see it again at night, the lighting is beautiful.
Trademark of Budapest!. No visit to Budapest could be considered complete, unless you walk the bridge of chains! One of the trademarks of Budapest, along with the Parliament building!

The most beautiful Bridge in Hungary. The first bridge connecting Buda to Pest was opened in 1849. At the time this bridge was the longest in Europe and the best of the engineering world: just two towers supporting the spans with giant iron chains. The chains gave the bridge its name : LANC-HID, Hungarian for chain-bridge. It have beautiful views of the Buda Castle, the Danube river, can make lots of great photos of both side of Budapest. It is even more spectacular at night.

So iconic and beautiful. The Chain Bridge is one of Budapest's most iconic landmarks. It provides both pedestrian and vehicular access from Buda to Pest and vice versa. We took many pictures of the bridge both during the day and night and views were spectactular. I recommend eating at the Sofitel Budapest restaurant at night for great views of the bridge and of course great food.
Oldest and nicest. This is the oldest and nicest bridge of Budapest. Not so long, I recommend to walk across to the funicular.
A Must See in Budapest.... If you are travelling to Budapest, visit the bridge preferably at night. It's quite a sight and very romantic. Great view of Buda Castle and the Danube.
nice story. it is one thing like you have to see but it is not special except at night when the lights go on, the famous story is interestiong from arhitecture etc..see it everyone does.

Unbeliveable. I think its the most beautiful bridge in budapest.The bridge link the two site of the city. On the pest side there is the Greshem Palace, and on the buda's site there is the palace. The view from the bridge is the best at night, when the lights are turned on!

Couldn't see what the fuss is about. I can't see what the fuss is about this bridge. Yes the bridge is lovely to look at, but then again suspension bridge are generally quite elegant. Liberty Bridge in my opinion is a more beautiful bridge as there is more detail in the bridge from all the ironworks

Worth crossing on foot!. Crossing on foot is very easy as it has walkways on both sides. This also offers the chance to take some great pictures of the Danube. At night the bridge is very well lit offering some great night time photo opportunities too!

As Bridges go this is Good. This is no Golden Gate bridge but you will probably have to make the short walk over it get to the Gellert Spa (worth several hours winter or summer) and it is a must photo stop.

Its a bridge!. Admittedly a pretty bridge, but a bridge all the same.
The top 50 attractions gets filled up with bridges, rivers and "Budapest". Not very helpful.
Its a bridge. Go and see it, but you'll be hard pushed to not need to cross it. You couldn't spend more than about 10minutes here if you tried.
Amazing. A must visit when you are in Budapest. Go at night because the view is better at night. Walk from Buda area to Pest.

Anothe beautiful bridge. Great seen lit up at night - take tram number 2 down the river to see all the bridges. Tram tickets can be bought at all metro stations ( but not on the tram!) and just remember to punch it into the orange machines as you get on the tram!
It's a bridge.. It looks great at night. There is an area to walk across it which is good because there is always heavy traffic across it.
nice. very nice to take a walk through. amazing architecture. try to have a look on it during the night when the bridge is with lights all over.

Nice stroll. Beautiful bridge and an easy stroll over and back. The cold winter wind can chill you quickly but it is worth it. Lots of photo ops. Buda side of the bridge is at the base of the funicular for easy access to Fisherman's Bastion.
Beautiful Bridge. It is worth taking the time to walk out onto the bridge. You can get some amazing pictures during both the day and the night.

Favourite bridge. Most people who visited Budapest will remember this bridge, if it's the only thing they remember. Sad story about the lion sculptor. This bridge is especially photogenic come night time when the lights are on. Not to be missed.
Can' miss it when visiting.. Great to see the historic bridge- great views of Buda and pest. We had perfect view from the Four Seasons!
amazing. Perfect location for great pictures. You have to stop there and walk on and around the bridge. I felt like a kid while doing pictures, even as I usually don't act like a typical tourist.

Beautiful bridge. I ended up walking across this bridge a few times in both directions. The mood of the city changes as the weather moved from cold to foggy. Great photo opportunities on both sides. Views are spectacular at night and the city sparkles in winter.

Nice bridge. This bridge is really nice during the day, but it really comes to life in the night when all the lights are turned on! One of the best views of the bridge is up at the Buda Castle. Take the funicular up and enjoy the view of the Chain Bridge with St Stephen's Cathedral in the background.

Gorgeous landmark in a fantastic city. As cities go Budapest is up there with the best of them in my view. This bridge is simply stunning and great to walk over anytime of the day. As with most cities at night it comes alive and is stunning to take pictures of both the bridge itself and the city and parliament building.

Same as one in Marlow, Bucks. As I regularly go into Marlow in Bucks I was fascinated to see this bridge. It's the same but about 5 times the size. Bit like Newcastle & Sydney share the same bridge design

Simply beautiful. You can never take enough photos of the bridge! Or the lions sitting guard on either end. I was only able to visit during the day, but I heard it is even more beautiful at night. There's always next time.
very nice. you have to cross it walking and you can have the chance to take amazing pics with the Parliament and church on the Danube sides also Buda castle as a background
Unique, beautiful. This construction of Adam Clark is a masterpiece, in the beautiful surroundings of the Danube in Budapest.

Nice View & Nice Bridge. It was a wonderul day when we crossed the chain bridge to go the Castle section of Budapest. The we took the funicular to ascend to the top. Castle area was fantastic. The view of the Danube was wonderful on that sunny, cold and beautiful winter day. On the way back we crossed the chain bridge again. it was a superb day. We kept watching the Chain Bridge from our room at the Intercontinental Hotel every night that we stayed in Budapest. i strongly recommend you to watch this beautiful bridge especially at night while the lighting looks amazing. A must see experience.

A must to walk over during your stay. By co-incidence was in Marlow a couple of week before visiting Budapest so had the opportunity of walking over both remaining William Tierney Clark's bridges in a matter of days. The Budapest one is far bigger crossing a wider expanse of river and of course Marlow is much smaller. However worth doing the two if you can.

Great views. Visited Chain Bridge and soak in the beautiful views from all directions. Great view of the mighty Danube. Love the imposing pairs of lion statues at both ends of the bridge. Most beautiful after dark when the bridge is lighted up. Great photos for the album.
Breath taking view of Prague at Night. Despite the freezing temps I ventured along Chain bridge to take breath taking views of the area at night. It is beautiful with the lights on.
Day & Night. It is a very impressive bridge by daylight but it gets particularly beautiful at night. Get your cameras ready!
Beautiful walk. What a lovely walk with fantastic views.We walked across on a lovely crisp morning .Very safe to get between the 2 parts of this beautiful city.

100-year old and much praised. A fairly average suspension bridge, but highly rated because of its position linking the 'inner city' and the Castle/ tunnel (used to tell children that during the winter they shunted the bridge into the tunnel for protection). One interesting aspect is that its British designer built an identical but smaller version at Marlowe on the Thames.

Crossing the Danube. Crossing the Danube felt wonderful. The atmosphere was given a sense of epic majesty by the (artificial) roar created by the cars on the bridge and the strong winds that threatened to blow the ladies off the bridge. Plenty of excellent photos to be had from this bridge, but perhaps the best of all would be one of the bridge itself, from a boat or from the shore. We had brought 2 bottles of whisky along for the duration of our backpacking trip across Europe, and having whisky along the shores of the bridge at night was a great experience. It did get slightly cold during the night, but we were too distracted by the pretty lights to really notice it.

Iconic view of Budapest. This is the bridge that we all see when looking at pictures of Budapest. It's a vital link between the two sides of the city: Buda and Pest. It's a great piece of engineering design and is lit at night. The pedestrian walkway is totally separated from the traffic and it's a safe, quick way of going from one side to the other (beware of cyclists though who use the same path!). Stop and admire the views that stretch up and down the river taking in many of Budapest's most recognisable buildings.
A must see a night!. My husband and I seen the Chain's bridge during the day with our tour guide but when we seen it at night its a completely different sight. It was beautiful
A beautiful bridge. Great thing to walk across some great photo opportunitys looking back at Castle Hill and citadell. Best Bridge on the danube so far
Chain Bridge. Interesting bridge over the Danube. It is an easy walk from town center across the bridge to the Castle. Once is enough.

Great picture from the tourist boat on the Danube great engineering.. Worth a trip down the Danube to appreciate the best of the bridges the chain bridge being the star , showing the engineering against the recent one built in the 2008 era without the style .... Well worth a look in day and night
Loved the Chain bridge!. We didn't imagine that it would be so easy to see Buda as well as Pest, but the bridges made it simple and fun. They were amazing sites in themselves.

Beautiful Pic Opportunity. At any angle and any time of day or night, you cannot miss a by taking a picture of this old bridge over the Danube. From the Pest side then walk across and get shots up into the bridge. Also views of Budapest from the bridge are great. Wonderful memories to take home.

Its a bridge..... Gets you across the Daube from Buda to Pest or Best to BudaAs a Bridge it seems to do its job well.It is not the original bridge, as was rebuilt after the war, when it had been destroyedWhile the same design, is actually wider than the originalIs a smaller version in Marlow in Buckinghamshire England designed by the same person (who was English)

Beautiful bridge. And it affords great views and photo oportunities. I like to take the Siklos down from the castle then walk across the bridge to Pest. One of the lovliest bridges anywhere (and I live next to the Golden Gate)

Beautiful Bridge/Magnificent Views. The Chain Bridge (Szechenyi lanchid) is the oldest of the nine bridges that connect Buda to Pest and it is, by far, the most beautiful. It's a pleasant, short walk from one side to the other, and the views are spectacular, especially at night when Budapest is lit up like a sting of diamonds glistening in the night. The four lions who guard the bridge give you a sense of Hungarian history that I feel I should learn. Be advised, it can be a chilly walk in the late fall or winter. WARNING: Be sure to hold on to your hats as the winds have been known sweep many a person's head gear into the Danube below.

Pretty cool and amazing views. We purposely chose a hotel overlooking the chain bridge, and it was very pretty. A great area and good to be near both Buda & Pest sides of the river.Having been to the amazing Charles Bridge in Prague, I thought this may be similar but unfortunately it is not pedestrian, but is actually open to traffic & has a lot of car use.Great area & lovely view none the less!

Fine art of bridges. Chain Bridge from Budapest is a gorgeous bridge made with good taste in the 1800's.The decorative lions on the 4 sides gives you the chance to take funny and memoriable pictures! :)Enjoy!

Definite photostop!. As others have said, a massive part of Budapest's history.
A great photo opportunity.
I must go back with the tripod after dark!

Lyons without tongue. The oldest bridge of Budapest guarded by 4 stone lyons.... without tonge.
As a local joke: kids are often told, that lyons are pulled in the Buda side tunnel when it is raining..
Walk through from Buda to Pest, enjoy view of Danube and feel the scent of Hungarian history...

unique beauty bridge. The bridge was built in 1849 under by William Tierney Clark, English architect. This bridge was the first which originally Buda and Pest tied together, which was two separate cities. The two cities (Buda and Pest) only united in 1873. The bridge II. World War II, the Germans blew up. In 1832, a study in England built a miniature of the bridge (bridge MARLOW). The bridge is the most beautiful bridge when it is lit at nights.

Still great for classic night photos. Walk up and back on the bridge at night and there is great opportunity for night photos. Budapest as a whole has really improved the opportunity for night photos over the last decade. A photographers delight.

Part of Hungarian History. This bridge is beautiful - part of hungarian history. It was the first bridge that connected Pest with Buda side. Sponsored and managed by gróf Széchényi István who was a central figure and protector in the building of many important historical buildings in Budapest, railways, waterwarks, etc. Walk through in the evening, watch the Buda castle, Gresham Palace and the Danube and you understand why so many love this city.
Chain Bridge. This bridge is so beautiful!! When it's lit at night, it's breathtaking. It's a lovely walk in both directions.

Looks great. The bridge is one mighty structure. Prevented from crossing it on one of the days but well worth it as during the festival of St Stephens the bridge is the focal point of the firework display with fireworks cascading from the bridge looked fantastic.

Good old landmark. Very safe to walk across as you are segregated from the traffic. Very grand structure, solid and a monument to engineers of the past. Loving couples today go to the bridge to declare their undying love for each other and leave an engraved padlock attached to the structure. Good to see it from a boat on the river and to walk across.
Beautiful!. This is one of my favorite bridges ever. If you're in Budapest, you have to walk across it at least once and make sure to take a ton of pictures of it at night when it's all lit up!

beautiful bridge in the heart of Budapest. On sunday the bridge is close for transportation and it becomes pedestrian street with a lots of stands that sell arts antiquities and good hungarian food and pastries

Walk. Great place to walk across between the Buda and Pest sides. On the Buda side, leads right to castle hill, and on the Pest right to the Basilica and the centre of Pest. Great for views up and down the Danube.
Just a rusty bridge. It is essentially just a rusty old bridge. The views are amazing but can be seen from any of the other non rusty bridges! Over rated in my opinion.

Great views, decent attractions at both ends. Not too long a walk, with good destinations for tourist-ing at either end near by. Watch out for people on bikes taking the pedestrian path instead of driving on the road with the cars.

Wonderful Experience.... Walking over this bridge is an experience offering fabulous views of the Danube and is an enjoyable route from the Castle District on the Buda side to the lively streets of the Pest side and all they have to offer. Don't miss it....and the price is right!

Beautiful!. What a lovely bridge! The views from the bridge, over the Danube, are spectacular and provide a lot of picture taking opportunities. There are stone carvings on the bridge and you really get a feel for how old it, and Budapest, really is.

Just an average bridge 60 yes old bridge that as been glamourised. The bridge is one of the 6 or so bridges that cross the Danube river. It is a reconstructed bridge so it s a modern suspension bridge. The Main advantage is that the bridge leads directly to the castle hill area and is hence the most convenient bridge. Other than that, it s Ning spectacular. Use it as a infrastructure but not as a tourist attraction.
Free and amazing . Do walk over this bridge to get a real feel if the city. Oldest in budapest and so best for a reason. Also good link between castle hill and andrassy avenue.

Amazing views!. Definitely a MUST-SEE and visit for anyone to Budapest! It offers breathtaking views, especially at night! I would recommend taking a picture with the iconic Lions at the beginning of the bridge as well!
The best bridge in Town. We passed from Pest to Buda crossing tha bridge which was a really great experience, try to do it on your wasy to the castle right after your morning visit to the parliament

Reminded me of home.. A great free attraction, viewed from either bank, day or night, or on the water, and easily the best way to get from Pest to Buda, as the funicular to the castle is moments away from the Buda end, this bridge put me in mind of the older Thomas Telford bridge across the Menai Straits, which is a more spectacular setting, with the back drop of Snowdonia, and the rushing tides of the Straits. Still one of the best in Budapest, though.
Beautiful at night. Passed by here in the night and the Bridge was beautifully lit up. Take a stroll by the water on the Pest side as an after meal activity.

Beautiful Bridge, Must See. We walked across this beautiful bridge numerous times heading back and forth between Buda and Pest. Though you can hop on the #16 bus quite inexpensively which takes you across and up to the major sights in Buda it is a beautiful walk and gives amazing views and photo ops. Try it on a sunny day as well as a clear night if possible. The only negative I felt was that the guard rail was more aesthetic than functional. Under the rail, rather than bars or grating there was only open "x's" of sculpted iron. Perfectly safe for adults, though it looks much more open than one might expect, but it could be very dangerous with small kids. Mine thankfully have a healthy respect for heights so it was no trouble keeping them away from the edge, but it is something to be aware of if you are walking with toddlers.

Oldest bridge in Budapest. Every tourist in Budapest will walk for sure on the Chain Bridge, in order to reach the Buda Castle. It is best to do it during the nighttime, when the bridge will offer spectacular views over the city
Most famous bridge in Budapest. Nice walk over the bridge, recommend to walk in the dark. Beautiful views all around. Worth to see it.

A beautiful bridge that the residents can be proud of. This is a LOT like the golden gate bridge although not painted international orange :-), as the golden gate bridge is. It is fun to walk over and to include in ones pictures.

Walk Across the Chain Bridge at Night. Who would go to Budapest and not walk across the Chain Bridge? It links Buda with Pest and is the best route to get to Castle Hill. The bridge itself is beautiful, but at night it gives you a sparkling view of the city in all directions.
oldest bridge in Budapest. Nice bridge with 4 lions. It worth the time to walk accross the bridge and see the view of Buda Castle and Gellert hill.

Loved it during Night time . I am sure there would be no one who hasn't heard about this bridge joining buda and pest . Although there are numerous bridges now , this is the oldest . It looks fabulous when it's lighted and will give photographers many angles to work with

Beautiful by day but amazing at night. We had a free walking tour in the morning and walked across the bridge to the Pest side, lovely to see the activity on the Danube. But then by night it has to be seen either from the river or the banks of the Danube.
Nice bridge. Not Prague's Charles bridge, but then again, not city is Prague. Yet, it is a very nice bridge, as the whole city is beautiful

A Must. Incredibly busy but that is part of the attraction. The bridge is lined with art type vendors. Each has to have a certificate. All along the bridge there are statues of saints etc. On the other side are lanes with very old buildings and not far away is the John Lennon Wall which is a changing piece of graffiti type art. Allow a long time to walk the bridge and around on the other side.
A bridge to somewhere!. This bridge is a beautiful sight - majestic and stunning! The lions guarding it are quite impressive. Great photo opportunity!
Chain Bridge. Connecting the higher part of Pest from the lower side of Buda, it's most attractive when lit at night.
It's just a bridge!. Well, okay, it's got some history, and the views are good, but I wouldn't go out of my way to cross it. Looks nice at night from the river with all the lights.

Typical Bridge but with a History. Walk the bridge , it does not take very long and it provides a nice view of the river and the city. The neatest thing about this bridge is it's history of being destroyed , you will have to look it up. We saw several pictures of it destroyed in the House of Terror.

Walk down from the Castle- from Buda to Pest. Recommend walking down from the Buda Castle. Go to where the funicular starts and instead of taking it down, look for the stairs that lead down. It's a leisurely 15-20 min walk with beautiful views along the way.When you get down to Clark Adam Square, walk across the bridge. You will have great views of the Chain Bridge, the Pest side of the city and when you look back, also the Buda Castle.Also, the Chain Bridge is not to be missed when it's lit up at night. Recommend taking the 4/6 tram and getting off the Margaret Bridge for great pictures.

beautiful bridge. this bridge is one of the prettiest in Budapest - day or night - so include a walk across the Danube on this bridge on your visit. Special sections on the bridge for pedestrians - and bikriders, so beware!

Walk across the bridge!. Well, it is a "must do" isn't it!Nice walk across the Danube. Great views towards both the Buda side and the Pest side of this beautiful city. Not to mention the river!Recommended.

I adored it!!!!!. I loved it!!!!!! The view , the walk, everything was fantastic !!!! And the best part is at night when the bridge is lighted!!!!!! It's so beautiful and Danube river is amazing!!!!!!!
Interesting. Best seen as part of a tour a bridge after all is a bridge once you have crossed it that is itPlenty to do in the area particularly on castle hill

A similar one England. A similar bridge built by the same architect Mr Clark is in England spanning the river Thames between the village of Bisham in Berkshire and the town of Marlow in Buckinghamshire. The English one does not have the lions and is painted white.

Visited day and night. if you can only visit once choose night.. Stayed near here so crossed it a couple of times. Night time lights look great from here. The bridge itself is well a bridge apparently the bloke who sculpted the lions was ridiculed because they look like they've got no tongues. He supposedly took his own life because of it. Anyway mate If your up there reading trip advisor I thought your lions were pretty good!

Love it!. I enjoyed so much more Budapest walking on this bridge. I think it's the most beautiful bridge I've ever saw. The amazing architecture of the lions at the begging of the bridge, the amazing view of the Danube and the photos you can take will make your day in Budapest.

Great Views. We spent a beautiful afternoon walking on this bridge. We really enjoyed stopping midway and watching and waving at the boats on the Danube. Great views of the buildings from most places on the bridge.
spectacular at night. I liked its view day and night, especially night. This bridge is one of the most prestigious and oldest bridge of Budapest.

Historical Bridge with a great river walk!. The bridge itself is pretty at night when lit up but other than its historical significance isn't much to look at. The river walk along the Danube was a beautiful walk during the evening when all the buildings across the river are lit up (Buda palace, etc.).
Great Pictures. Went late in the evening after walking around the city. The weather was perfect and it was a great walk with friends. The bridge is lighted at night so it makes for some great pics!!
At night. Chain bridge and surroundings great at night, not bad during the day as well. As mentioned worth seeing from the open top bus.
Be sure to walk it. Lovely bridge reminiscent of the Brooklyn Bridge. Pedestrian friendly and gorgeous views from all angles.

Chain Bridge. We walked over this bridge and saw the names of the victims very moving. You get a good view of all the Bridges if you do the River Cruise. You can buy a 24hr Hop-on Bus ticket and you get the River trip for free.

Pretty at Night. I wasn't quite sure what the excitement of this bridge was until we decided to walk over it during the early evening. The lighting and the views from the bridge were absolutely beautiful. There is a nice pedestrian walkway so traversing the bridge is easy and safe.
Beautiful especially with night lights. We stayed at the Sofitel hotel where we had beautiful views of the Chain Bridge. We loved the night lights of the bridge. Such a beautiful bridge!

Enjoy a nice walk across the bridge. Walking across the Chain Bridge is a must for anyone visiting Budapest. Our favourite time to walk was early in the morning. The place is very quiet, the river was smooth and there was just a little mist to add character.
must see destination. Main attraction of Budapest, Even though the original chain bridge was ruined in war. It has been rebuilt with the same passion and style

I don't know whats all the fuss about. My wife and me saw the reviews on TripAdvisor and decided to go and the see the Chain bridge. It was a terrible decision, I don't know if I'm missing something but it is just an ordinary bridge, it isn't beautifull at all, the view is average and so on. So much better things to see in Budapest, don't waste your time.
Lovely bridge with a great history. Great photo oppertunities on, over and around this bridge. History of the bridge is displayed near the venicular railway ticket office.Lovely views of Budapest
Its a bridge. Ok, its quite a nice bridge, particularly at night but a the end of the day Its a bridge that's about the same age as Goldie Hawn. Yawn.
Chance for good pictures!. Amazing at night! for best pictures, better to walk the bridge at night :) or during the sunset.. it is safe! one of the busiest Budapest bridges
I think it was the oldest and most interesting bridge. Oldest and most interesting bridge joining Buda to Pest. Architecturally interesting, pleasant to amble across on a sunny afternoon

beautiful bridge. those who travel a lot won't be surprised but it's a beautiful bridge, well maintened, in the 19th century style, like the rest of the city. On one side, there is the market built by Eiffel (the same who built the Eiffel tower)

Classy Bridge and great views along the Danube. Walk both sides of this bridge to experience the best of Budapest. Views of Buda Castle, Parliament, the Danube River, and of course the Bridge itself are worth the trek across and back. Check out the Lions standing guard on both ends of Chain Bridge.

Walk across this bridge. A walk across this bridge offers not just a great vista of the Danube and a closeup of its construction and beauty, but a chance to experience Budapest...one of three bridges crossing the Danube and just a great view day or night.

Historic walk across the Danube. This is the most famous of several spectacular bridges in Budapest. It spans the Danube and is lined on both side of the bridge with wide, safe (totally separated from traffic). As you walk across the bridge the spectacular panorama of the river and city changes constantly. Another great photo op!

Well worth the walk. The chain link bridge along with the other bridges crossing the Danube gives one a unique perspective of the Danube.
If you research the history you will find pictures post WW II where all these bridges were destroyed. The fact that they have been rebuilt to original detail is a credit to the engineering and tradespeople communities of the area.

Wonderful views. This is my second favorite (if I had to choose) after the Liberty Bridge. It is stunning to walk across it and watch the river and all the attractions of Budapest!! Picture perfect views all around!! Take a moment to stand and enjoy the view instead of just walking across it!! It will be worth the while.

Worth a stroll and a night time view!. If you're in Budapest, you must talk a walk over this bridge. Interesting to see the lines of river cruise vessels moored on the Pest side. Easy walk across the river to take the funicular or walk up to Buda castle and the old town. The bridge is especially magical when seen at night with the castle in the background. Lovely just to walk along the boulevard and take it all in. A sight to behold.

Beautiful bridge with even better views!. If you are in Budapest, take some time to walk across the chain bridge. It is a beautiful bridge and it has some spectacular views of the Rathaus . We stayed in the Castle district, and walked over the chain bridge each day to spend time in the city. I'm so happy we did this, as it was a great way to explore the city and see all the beauty that it has to offer.
Chain Bridge Charm. You cannot miss it: it's there, in front of you, behind you, it's as part of Budapest as the Castle. And its Grand, early morning, in the sunset, at night.
Great views and the perfect walk to Castle Hill. Take your time over the bridge and enjoy the view. We saw the Danube at flood stage, and it was historic and clear of any river traffic.

Characterful Bridge. Spanning the Danube between Buda and Pest this iconic bridge is well worth walking across. We had a lovely blue skied day to admire it. The original suspension bridge was designed by an Englishman called William Tieney Clark, and was the first permanent bridge in Budapest. Badly damaged during WW11 it was restored to its former glory in 1949.

Walk across the bridge. Had seen the bridge on a travel programme so was a "must". We went on a national festival day so was crowded but still able to enjoy walking across this amazing bridge and travelling on to the Funicular railway.

Majestic Bridge. The Chain Bridge straddles the Danube at the midway point of it's journey through the city and when lit up at night with its ball chain lighting system seems to take centre stage over the whole exquisite Budapest Panorama.
very scenic landmark. all bridges on this part of the Danube are unique and a must-see, especially all lit-up by night-fall

CHAIN BRIDGE IN BUDAPEST. This specially architected bridge of the nineteeth century has been fully resotred and was a major function of traffic during the communist era in Budapest. The respect shown by the communists and now the liberalists to be sure to maintain this high traffic structure has become a hallmark of the river scenes in Budapest, especially at night when the CHAIN BRIDGE is lit up with multicolored lights.
