Do not miss taking a great picture and also (maybe)( walking across the bridge and gaining very interesting and different view of Budapest during the day and the evening.

One of the iconic Budapest landmarks.... It's a bridge so I can't get too excited about it but it is one of those places that you have to visit whilst in the city! And I don't think that it is the original one but there are several nice stories about it and the lions without tongues are impressive. It's a good place to stand on to see the other bridges and it does have rather a romantic air when lit up at night. But be careful of the cyclists who pedal along it at great speed!
Beautiful at night!. Wonderful place to visit at night...very very pretty. Definitely well worth a visit both day, and night especially!
It's a bridge. Pretty at night and connecting buda and pest. Good views. Great city, lots of things to see. Not as pretty as Prague.
Beautiful at night.. By the Hotel Victoria, where we stayed. Particularly beautiful at night. But what are all those padlocks that people seem to have fastened to the lamps?

Romantic chain bridge.. Having seen padlocks chained to a bridge in Tuscany which we were told signified the love you shared for each other.my partner and I decided on our return visit to Budapest to throw the keys to our padlock in the Danube from the chain bridge.silly I know but then very romantic.
Part of the Budapest landscape. I was expecting a little more than what I saw but after all it is a bridge. I had a fantastic view from my hotel window but you must visit if in Budapest.
Beautiful, historical. You must see this bridge at night! Also read about the history of it and the surrounding buildings. Budapest has a rich history!

One of Budapest's main landmarks - can't miss it. The Chain Bridge - what can i say. It's one of Budapest's main attractions. A great way to get from Buda to Pest. Don't miss the tongue-less lions (the reason it's architect jumped from the bridge). Enjoy walking/driving/biking or Segwaying over the bridge. But don't jump. The water is polluted.

Iconic photo opportunity. One of the most photographed structures in the city, and arguably one of the best places to take a photo from too, with the chance to frame many of the city's notable landmarks in the back of your shot. Only let down by the occasional presence of beggars or travelling sales units.

The chain bridge experience. The chain bridge is a pleasant area to walk through. Under the chain bridge is the lovers lock and they sell standard locks close by it in a shop. As you walk through the area you see many forms of artists which is amusing to see.
It's a bridge. It's made of metal, you cross in order to get to the other side of the river. Whether going to Buda or to Pest - ambulation across this metal thingymabob will get you there.

Nice views... Bridge like bridge - yes it's nice and construction is beautiful , but more attractive is Budapest's panorama from bridges ... colourful buildings at the river in the sun - is what I will remember , and view on the Buda's mountain:-)

OK. It seems to be a very popular landmark, but it is ordinary, walked across a few times as I was staying on the Buddha side. The walking paths are wide, be aware as to which side of the bridge you want to walk across as once you get to the other side you might have to make a complete circle to get to the side of the street you want. Great to view in the evening.
How can you miss it?. If you're on holiday in Budapest you can't miss the bridge, since it gets you to Castle Hill. Lovely vistas while walking across and the bridge itself is very impressive.

Better at night. Lovely bridge, which in the blurb we had didn't mention that it was built by a Scotsman! All the bridges across the Danube are great but the Chain Bridge comes into its own at night...then its something else.

spectaclar at night. looks good at nigh when lit up. Look out for the padlocks attached to the structure. Seems young lovers etch their names on them lock the padlocks and chuck the key in the Danube to symbolise they will stay together
ordinary. i really don't see why this bridge is a thing in Budapest?? its a BRIDGE,didnt see anything special.
1st Bridge to Connect Buda and Pest. You must walk over this bridge...it is mentioned in most articles and books when Budapest is the topic. At night it is lighted and even more beautiful.

Beautiful. Beautiful by day & by night, you can't leave Budapest with having a walk across, amazing architecture built by Scotsman & an English man sharing the same name the oldest bridge in Budapest (which I can't remember at the moment) the chain bridge has become one of the most prominent symbols of Budapest since existence, it also decorates the 200 Forint coin produced in 1992 and 2009
Good Historical Site. Beautiful at Night.. The bridge was very historical with great views. Too much graffiti and garbage. It was better at night. Read up on the history to appreciate this site.
Chain bridge. This structure is very photographic.There is something not only pleasing to look at but its is also quite facinating.
It's a bridge (get over it). Nothing special, seen bigger (and smaller) and better, part of the "history" so worth looking at but (yawn) it a bridge.

The bridge of Budapest. In a city of splendid bridges, this is the most storied, and yes, the most memorable. Just walk down the pedestrian lane on both sides of the bridge, and half your Budapest trip is almost done. The lions on either side of the bridge are imposing, and leave their imprints on your mind long after you have left the city.

Good views, interesting history. Can be viewed at a distance or walked from one side to the other. Has an interesting history in the naming and afraid I cannot remember all the details our guide provided, but it is beautiful with its protective lions at each end. It was the first permanent stone bridge crossing.

At the heart of Budapest. While the bridge, itself, is worth the view, particularly at night, the bridge connects castle hill in Buda with the active shopping district in Pest. The crowds move across the bridge from one venue to another and each is unique. Head to Chain Bridge if you want to be in the middle of everything and don't forget about the funicular at the Buda end of the bridge to take you up the cliff to an exciting old town.
Easy transfer. Good views of both Buda and Pest. Access to the funicular to castle hill. Nice place for photo ops.Not exactly an attraction but more a means to an end. Easy access to most sights

Amazing. To walk across this bridge is a privilege. To look at the marvelous parliament Building on the pest side and to see all the hotels rebuilt after the siege of Budapest is numbing. The view up to the castle District is great also,
Great views day and night. Walked this bridge many times and never tired of the views. Looks better at night when lit up. Feels a bit unstable when a bus crosses it!

Chain Bridge. Nice bridge, with public transportation crossing it.
Crossing the Danube River in the central downtown area you can look down at all the river boats.

Beautiful setting. In a city of bridges, the Chain Bridge stands out as most elegant. It spans the Danube, connecting the two cities of Buda and Pest. We loved it most at night, enjoyed from one of the many boat trips along the Danube; it lends a magic and luster to the city. We particularly enjoyed walking leisurely along the bridge, to get our first close-up view of Buda, as we were staying in Pest. This marvellous bridge has none of the tourist-trap glitz of the Charles Bridge in Prague or other similar places. It is simply a functional bridge that provides magnificent views of both sides of this terrific city.

Chain Bridge. The Chain Bridge is massive and beautiful. You can walk across it as it has a large pedestrian walkway so not to worry about all the traffic on the bridge. At night it is beautifully lit up.

A great bridge. A walk over this bridge is a must for every visitor, and make sure you bring your camera as there are plenty of photo opportunities. But watch out for cyclists from behind and coming towards you.

chainbridge view from tram.. There are so many bridges over the Donau. I remember this bridge only because I followed my track the whole time with a citymap of Budapest. These citymaps you will get in every hotel.

the landmark of Budapest. Budapest is represented by this famous Chain bridge over river Danube. Its spectacle comes alive when its illuminated at night. Wonderful views up close can be had as well as from the castle atop the hill. If you are visiting in winter the area being close to the river will e quite cold
Very romantic at night!. Beautiful at night! Great view during the day, and very romantic at night time. It gets alot colder along the bridge as you are near the water so wrap up warm!

Walk over at dusk. You are welcomed to the bridge by two huge lions and it is best to walk across at dusk.Next was the funicular that takes you to the palace, around the front of the funicular you can watch Budapest light up, which is a beautiful sight. In fact I was a little worried it would disappoint during the sunlight hours, buy no its still beautiful
some kind of landmark. Maybe nothing special, but still worth a walk for photos as a landmark of the city if you have time.

Go at night. This is an amazing bridge to walk across but it comes into its element at night. When it is lit up it must be the most beautiful bridge I have seen. We went to photograph it from an adjcent bridge just before the sun set and they are stunning.
It's a bridge. It's just a bridge, you walk on it, over it around it. It spand the Danube. It's a major part of uniting Buda and Pest. It's a bridge.

My favorite. We walked across this bridge several times, but our favorite time of day to walk on the bridge is at night when it and the castle on Buda and the parliament building in Pest are illuminated. With a steady hand and a good camera, you can get some awesome pictures.

Photographers' Delight. What more can you say about a bridge? It is a pretty bridge and no doubt engineers must find it fascinating, but it was very cold & raining when I walked across, which lessened its charms somewhat... ;(
Nice view of the Danube. Easy walk to both sides of the city of Budapest. Great views of the boat traffic on the Danube. Short walk from the Marriott Hotel and Four Seasons.

Connecting Buda and Pest in the XIX century. My favorite bridge in Budapest - probably because of the stone. It remind's me of the London bridge. It is south of the Parliament on one side and very near the stairs (or funicular) to climb the VAR, Castle hill on the idea. Impossible to miss!

Nice bridge connecting Buda and Pest. Nice Chain bridge with very nice view from both sides. Coming from NYC, i have seen my share of nice bridges, so I wasnt super impressed. Still a nice sight to see.

Chain Bridge. There are many bridges connecting Buda and Pest. Chain bridge is the most popular of the bridges it is the most central bridge.
Amongst the bridges that connect Budapest and Pest I liked the construction and night lighting of Liberty bridge the best.
Great. The bridge is fantastic. I love crossing it which I have done many times now.Great piece of engineering.
Beautiful walk. It is really one of the nicest walks u can take through Budapest, the bridge is amazing and the views are breathtaking.

A short walk. The tongueless Lions welcoming you are very noticeable , a nice walk accross leading straight to the furnicular, being 20th August a national holiday the place was so crowded with locals and traffic blocked out and all was pedestrian walkways. a nice experience....

First permanent bridge in Budapest. The Chain Bridge is officially called Szechenyi lanchid after Count Istvan Szechenyi. Construction started in 1842 after the Count missed his father's funeral because the ferry service was not operating due to bad weather. the bridge is 1230 ft long and at one time ws the longest suspension bridge in Europe. The bridge has to imposing stone lions guarding each side. In 1945 the bridge was blown up by the Germans and was later rebuilt to an exact copy of the original.

We walked across. Well really it was a yawn and just another bridge, maybe if I had known the history of the bridge it would have appealed more. The best thing about it was that it took us to the Fernicular railway which took us up Budapest Hill
City Symbol. Check out the lions that adorn the abutments, a reproduction of Trafalgar Square Lions. A cool chain suspension bridge spans 202 meters, it is the most recognizable symbol of the city.

Do not miss to see and walk it at night. Crossing the bridge at the end of the day, when the lights are turned on is one of the most pleasant moments. You see the river with the cruise and restaurant ships; you have a great view of tha castle that is also illuminated. It is quite romantic to stroll on the buda side, to the right after you cross the bridge: only be carefull of fast bicycles.
Charles Bridge. As pleasant as always, one should never miss walking on this bridge. Rain or shine, a walk across Charles bridge gives you this romantic feeling while in Budapest.
Cool bridge. As far as bridges go it's a pretty cool one. Good views and you'll need to cross the city at some point so worth walking across and taking some photos.
A beautiful jewel on the Danube. Look at it either from Buda or from Pest. It blends beautifully with the view on either side and appears great on photographs.

Beautiful. Our hotel over looked the Chain Bridge so we watched it during the day and at night. We viewed it from above, from the Elisabeth Bridge, in the van, and we walked over it. It's massive structure is so impressive.
Memories. The "Chain Bridge" has a very interesting history. Being borne in Marlow Buckinghamshire U.K Researchers will understand how proud the chain bridge made me feel!
Fun Walk to the Buda Side. Chain Bridge was beautiful to look at and provided a great direct walk over to Buda Castle and the National Gallery and History Museum. Definitely recommended.

Worth the walk. We walked on this bridge every night to get to Buda side and walk up the steps to go back to our hotel rather than wait for bus No. 16. Good exercise, beautiful view as always and did not find any beggars. Great place to take pictures too!

Well worth the walk across!. Walking across this famous bridge is a nice experience apart from the beggars and some selling rubbishy touristy stuff along the way. It is an easy walk and shows you how fat the Danube River flows which is not obvious from the banks.

Beautiful from a distance but inaccesible. This is a beautiful bridge with a lot of history and great for taking pictures from a distance but personally we found it quite inaccessible to visit on foot. We had to walk a lot and through a few obstacles to reach the bridge.But it is a part of Budapest history and hence you will have to visit it! :)

Why they like it!!. This bridge is overrated. I did not find anything special in it. For example, Charles bridge in Prague is unique and it is only for pedestrians. This one does not have such a beauty.
Chain Bridge. Well worth a walk over, day or night, more atmospheric in the dark. Again, excellent views of the Danube and Parliament.

One of the World's Great Bridges. This is one the most beautiful and centrally-located bridges that span the Danube in Budapest. It is a suspension bridge which carries both vehicle and foot traffic, as well as an icon of this gorgeous city. Each end of the bridge has two giant lion statues and at night the bridge is lit up and is just fabulous. It's the best way to get from Buda to Pest and back.

Beautiful setting. Walking across the bridge is worth doing as the setting is wonderful and you get a good view of both sides. If you get vertigo stay away from the edge and dont look down or you may see the many holes in the framework!!
Have to walk across ....to appreciate. The story behind the Chain Bridge is great!.....pedestrian and bike traffic is heavy....it's an absolute must.....
impressive bridge. Great view to and from the bridge. You can walk very close to it by foot and see the impressive lions.

Beautiful, walk over it on the way to the castle.. Looks a lot like a smaller Brooklyn Bridge. Very nice to walk across from Pest into Buda and then walk up to the castle where you can get some great photos of the bridge.
Connect the two cities. This suspension bridge across Danube connects the Buda Castle with Pest side of the city. The night view is superb. Walking over the bring (380m) is a nice experiance.

Budapest Chain Bridge. We were amazed on our first night there to see the Chain Bridge all lit up from our hotel room. Just fantastic! And then, to walk across it later that night was just unbelievable! An experience we will never forget!

Holocaust Center. This is a small and old museum..many artifacts and a cemetery of mass graves surrounds the center and synagogue. Very moving and a tribute to the many who died. A contemporary sculpture garden is outside the synagogue, very quiet and lovely tribute.

Bridge. Good place to have a walk. The landscape is wonderful.
Watching the river is relaxing. U can take fab photose! A well known place all around the world it was a pleasure to see it.

Nice stroll at night. We crossed the Chain Bridge fairly late one night going from Buda to Pest with a light snow falling. The bridge itself is interesting, but seeing the various buildings lit up and the light snow made it more memorable
Chain Bridge. Was good to walk on the chain bridge!!!! The beauty is just undefined and cant be captured in pics! It was featured in Hindi feature film "Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam"

Mini Golden Gate Bridge. It's a bridge over the Danube and it resembles a mini Golden Gate Bridge. It's functional and not that attractive. Beware of the cyclists who share the pedestrian path, they seem to cycle a bit too fast for comfort

Just go there. I would recommend everyone visiting Budapest to visit this bridge at least one time when it’s dark outside and the bridge looks just great. This bridge was the first permanent bridge constructed between the Buda and the pest side of Budapest and during a Danube trip the guide told us that there is a story that a young hussar captain wanted to get to the funerals of his father from a side to the other of the Danube and he had to wait a long time because there were no permanent bridges and it was the moment when he said that there has to be built one. I don’t know if it’s true but it is a nice story. One can walk on the bridge, get great pictures of the Danube, of the bridge with its lions and of the castle hill but has to be careful because there are a lot of cyclist so don’t get so absorbed by the view and get in their way.

Another bridge. Whilst the historic value of this bridge is undeniable the asthetics didn't live up to my expectations. I preferred the more picturesque Liberty Bridge. Nevertheless, the views from the bridge were outstanding at night time.
nice. Unless you have a great deal of time you might want to view it from the bus that goes to and from Castle Hill.

stunning any time of day. worth walknig across , especially at sunset , its a feat or architecture and lighting in itself . the only annoying thing too many cyclist on the pedestrian bit, watch your back !

Our daily walk. We stayed up in the Castle District, took the funiculaire down and walked across this bridge every day as we did our sighseeing. The views are great and walking into a downtown over a splendid bridge is a great way to arrive.

As good as London Bridge. Especially at night, the Chain Bridge is very beautiful. Fun place to meet people and for an evening stroll. When we were there, a group was showing a film against the wall of the bridge in the little park on the Pest side one evening. Bring your camera for sure!

You need to walk across. This is THE iconic photo of Budapest, especially at night. To get the best impression of the scale of the bridge, and the fact it was able to be reconstructed following the war, you need to walk it. There's a good footpath either side, and you get good views of the river and the tourist and industrial barges that plough up and down. A worthwhile walk, and you can head up the funicular railway to the palace etc in Buda.

GREAT FIRST IMPRESSION. On arriving in the Ibis Centrum hotel from Budapest airport, my grandson and I went for a walk. Barely a few hundred yards from our hotel we came across this beautiful bridge. Great subject for photos either night or day, but particularly impressive at night.

Best view of the Danube. We rode over the Chain Bridge by bike, it is the best place to see and take panoramic photos of the two sides, Budapest and Pest. Only thing is that it could be slightly cleaner, with cigarette buts everywhere!
Jewel of the Danube. Nothing beats walking across the bridge as the lights come up around the city. Beautiful bridge connecting Buda to Pest.
Amazing sight at night. The chain bridge is a very nice example how all bridges must be. Not only it's beautiful in daylight, at night the bridge is lighted which gives it an extra dimension

Nice Old Bridge.. A nice bridge to walk across and admire the views from. It is especially beautiful at night when the lights come on. At the moment it seems safe, just dont inspect the rust too closely.
odest bridge. Nice old bridge, it worth the time to walk accross and check both sides. We took the funicular to go up to the Buda Castle. Do not miss it.
Beautiful by night. Cross the bridge on foot or by bus. It's incredible. Furthermore, at night is majestic!!!Better photos are taken from the Buda side

Beautiful. It is really beautiful at night when the lights lit up in the bridge. The bridge is also the connecting point between Buda & Pest area.
I personally find that Chain Bridge is much more beautiful than Charles Bridge in Prague.

Beautiful Old Bridge. You don't have to make special plans to see the bridge. It is one of 3 main bridges that crosses the Danube. We saw it from both a bus tour and a boat tour. Interesting stories about how the Germans bombed the bridges as the end of WWII and then they were rebuilt.

Walk across this bridge. Classic Budapest. The bridge that linked buda and pest. Illuminated at night. Awe inspiring views. Take the time and walk from pest to buda and back again. Well worth the effort.
Budapest is beautiful. I recommend walking everywhere, if you are able to, wing it, it is worth it. You are surrounded by awesome views wherever you go.

Beautiful bridge. We were lucky to be here right before St. Stephen's Day, so the bridge was closed to traffic. We were able to take our time admiring it as we walked across. The views are amazing. We also saw it at night during a dinner cruise, and it was even more spectacular lit up.

Budapest chain bridge. One of the most beautiful bridges in Europe. This bridge is located in the touristic center of Budapest and you can see it even from far away. At night it is really like a pear chain shining. I would suggest to have comfortable shoes and start walking alongside the river in the morning, then walk over the bridge to the other side (where the famous castle is) and on that side you will have a lovely view of the Lion and the parliament in the background (one of my photos). You will also pass the square full of flowers where the tunnel begins.Budapest is a great city and you need at least 3-4 days to visit it :)

Great looking bridge. As old bridges go this is very beautiful Well worth walking acrossBudapest is a very pretty city bud has a lot of con artists Police probably among themBeware of the constant scam of two good looking women approaching men in main pedestrian street asking for directions then inviting you to a drink in a cheap bar that they pay forThen suggesting another bar where you buy the round back and it's usually around 350 euroThen the heavys close in on youYou can watch them at it all nite on the street Police must be in on it too
Excellent architecture. The view from bridge is amazing. You should try to cross the bridge and take pictures while crossing. Great place to admire danube
beautiful bridge. The Chain Bridge was my favorite of the Danube River bridges in Budapest. It has a charming design and is beautifully lit at night.
Memorable Bridge. We walked across it as one must in Budapest!! Lovely views up and down the river and a must see!! It was the first bridge to cross the Danube between Buda and Pest.

Nice Bridge, Easy to see on route to Castle Hill. I would not consider this a site in and of itself. It is nice and pretty. It provides a nice view point for Castle Hill and the palace. As a result I would recomend walking across the bridge if you are staying in Pest and going to Castle Hill for the day, but probably wouldn't bother seeing it, if the sole purpose of the stop was to see the bridge.

Undestroyable!. Watch out of the bikers, since they try to run you over ;) Amazingly big bridge with quite the story of its builder. The lions protect the bridge and that seem to helped to survive the WW II.
Part of my history. I walked across this bridge to honor my father, who did the same in 1924 when leaving Hungary at the age of 18 for the USA.
One of the symbols of Budapest. Such a beautiful bridge. Lovely at night when lit up, especially from a Danube cruise. Lots of both auto and foot traffic. Right in front of our hotel.
Amazing bridge. Huge bridge and worth the walk to see it. It just so happen to be near our hotel. Huge lions heads on the entrance of the bridge. Wish we had time to walk across it.
Beautiful at night. This bridge was close to our accomodation and most evening found us drawn back there. A useful place to pick up a Ho ho tour or take the funicular up to the castle.

Nice but not a must. Having walked across the Golden Gate Bridge and others of the same magnitude this one certainly is not on the top list. I know most guides recommend you to see this bridge but put in this perspective there are many other great things to see in Budapest.You get some mildly nice views but nothing fantastic.

Wonderful views. A gently 10 minute walk form our hotel (Le Meridien) took us to the Chain Bridge, walk across with magnificent views of the danube, then jump aboard the funicular to the Buda Castle. YOU MUST take time in the evening to see the castles and bridges at night, spectacular
nice old bridge with lions. 2-2 lions take care of the bridge. Check their mouths, they do not have tounges. :) walk across and enjoy the wonderful view.
Walk across. The Chain Bridge was the first permanent bridge across the Danube to connect Buda and Pest. Take the time to walk across and enjoy the views of Buda, Pest and the Danube.
A special bridge.. The most beautiful bridge in Budapest. It has a remarkable architecture. It is a monument that is useful in the same time. Must see.

Great!. Really beautiful view of the city.
Just the walking can sometimes be a problem, because of the cyclists and because the walking area is so tight.
Beautiful old bridge. Full of history. This is my favourie one among the others what they have along the river Danube in Budapest. It worth walking along especially during the night.

Straddle Two Cities. This impressive bridge straddles the Danube between the cities of Buda (the high one) and Pest and is an architectural delight in its own right. Tarry to admire the magnificent bastions and to enjot the views.

A must when in the city !. While taking in the vast river , the Danube , you`ll sites from both sides , Buda and Pest , that sum up the city`s best . Take your time , make it slowly , you`ll stop frequently . By all means make the same by night - it is unparalleled for what this city offers and yes take the camera with you !
Walk it. A beautiful bridge with great views of town, other bridges and both Buda and Pest. Lovely architecture, lions etc.

Don't miss it at nighttime!. Safe to walk the bride both day and night. Very easy to access from the tram or bus 36. Buy a Budapest travel card that allows unlimited travel on all buses, trams, and some riverboats.
Gets you across the river.... Not sure why this is a tourist site. No plaque or any historical significance given. It does a great job getting you from Buda to Pest though!
Amazing!. The view was excellent both to Pest and Buda sides of the city. I enjoyed observing movement Danube as well.
Beauty. In my opionion Chain Bridge wasn`t the most beuatiful bridge in Budapest. In the evening it was beautiful with lights.

Impressive. This bridge connects the Buda and Pest parts of the city and is a main attraction. Walking on it is an enjoyment as visitors can have a great views of the Danube with magnificent buildings on both sides and on the hills. It is brightly lit at night.

Cool bridge. The bridge is nice - offers good views of the city but I think the view from buda palace is better. But obviously you have to cross the river to get there so it is a nice way to cross. Good restaurants on the Buda side near the bridge that offer good views at night.
Must see. It is beautiful in the morning, during the day and the most beautiful is in the evening when the lights are turned on! Go for a walk!
Stunning when lit on evening. It dominates Danube river and is the first hanging bridge in Europe. It will also catch your eye every time you look at the direction.
Easy walking to Buda. This is an easy way to get to the older side of Budapest. Walking recommended if using it for the first time. You'll get a really nice view to the whole city.
Nice bridge. It's a nice bridge with big lion statues and good photo opportunities -especially in the evening. However, I've seen nicer ones.

It's Nice to Cross. Chain Bridge is the oldest bridge in Budapest built in the 19th century designed by a Scottish engineer Adam Clark. When you cross it from Pest to Buda or vice versa you have a wonderful panorama of the city on either side of the bridge. There are two-two lions at both ends of the bridge and it is interesting that they forgot to design (or to build..) tongoe for the lions. All four without tongue...

old bridge but atmospheric.... This bridge looks like a biiiiig bridge.But if u traveling on it with car, u will feel it is so narrow. Tram transportating on it. If tram is comeing all bridge is mooveing! :-) If u walk on it, u can see a big spiders on bridges lattice. Once if u ar at Budapest, u must try it! :-)

Beautiful design. The Chain Bridge is a must see especially at night. The bridge can be viewed from the footpath or take a ride. There is a Hop on Hop Off bus that is available and of course the farmer's market is close.
impressive bridge. We saw the bridge at night first time.. it was all lighted and very nice to photoshoot. very nice souvenir pictures. they are so many bridges along the Danube.

Most Romantic Sight Anytime Night or Day. I have hundreds of photos of the Chain Bridge--daytime, nighttime, spring, summer, fall, winter. It is a great walk from the Pest to the Buda side. Going up the funicular, make sure you sit in the front car and you well get stunning views of the bridge the Clark Square as you ascend. It is spectacular at night as well. I believe it might be one of the most photographed bridges in the world. There is also a movie about Count Szechenyi, called the "Hidember" which may have English subtitles. It tells the story of his life and how he came to building the bridge.

My favorite Bridge. I never get tired of watching this bridge, just beautiful and full of history. Better to go at nightTake your time walking across the bridge and enjoy the details of the stunning sculptures of the lions and if you have enough time take a walk up to the tunel and have a seat with one of the best views of Budapest
Symbol fo Budapest. The nicest bridge in Budapest and probably in Middle-Europe. Highly recommended to visit it if you go to the City.
Iconic bridge. This is an iconic bridge of Budapest and the most beautiful of all - I think. There is a nice square and Four Seasons Hotel at the Pest side of it. You must visit it!

NICE WALK. This bridge is one of the few over the Duna from buda to pest. I walk this bridge so many times, and i never get board. you should walk both sides round trip and enjoy. in pest side you hit four seasons hotel, roosevelt ter and more. in buda side you find the Adam clark ter with the 0 point and the fonecolar to up to the Palace area.
Such a beautiful bridge. Very nice to walk across with beautiful views and great photo opportunities and it puts you right at the action on the Buda side.

A magical view accros the Danube.. I guess this was never meant to be the magical experience when Clarke Adam first constructed this iconic image of Budapest...Approaching from the Buda Side ,a world heritage sight ,one can see the spires of the parliament building and gradually the equally iconic 'Gresham Hotel' built as the headquarters of the Gresham Insurance company and then restored to be renamed the Four Seasons Hotel.on the Pest side..This deserves a review on its own..(Budapest is divided by the Danube into the Buda side and the Pest side..)Approaching from the Four Seasons hotel one will witness the Castle and the fenicular railway that slowly ascends to give the visitor a view over the city until the Palace area is reached...No visitor will miss this cocktail of experiences .It is a treasure of the city and a memory to be treasured.(PS..An exact copy of this bridge in miniature can be seen in the English town of Marlow ,Buckinghamshire ,England which crosses the River Thames)

Convenient walk to Buda hill. The vistas are very nice indeed, but one mainly walks the Chain bridge to get to Buda hill from central Pest. We found the walk shorter than it looked, and well worth it.
Nice view. Viewed this bridge from up on castle hill and then when we went back down. Offers a nice view of the Danube.
Chain Reaction. Just have a promenade across both during the day and at night. At weekends there is usually some music or other activity. Watch out for the cyclists. Regards Gary Saunders
Excellent. Has it all - fantastic to look at from afar (especially at night), excellent views and photo opportunities as you walk over but watch out for cyclists!

Night and day the same great charm. It is a must to walk across of this very first bridge of Budabest, great views for photos, great architecture and excellent path to cross the two sides. Really impressed
Bridge!. Ok it was designed by a Brit, but its a bridge, not the most picturesque nor the worst. A nice way to get between the Pest and Buda sides of the city.
Scenic walk. Walking across the bridge was a good choice on our way to the tram to the castle area. It's a wide walkway, and a good opportunity to take photos of the Danube.
Good looking bridge. Nice to see this bridge as it is modern compared to all the old architecture but seems to fit in. This is Erzebet Bridge near Ferenciek Tere

Beware of bicyclists!. Chain Bridge connects Buda to Pest and is flanked by stone lions at both ends. We enjoyed the views from the bridge as well as the opportunity to watch river traffic from the span. However, one must remain alert for the ever-present bicyclists who at best might spoil your photo shot, and at worst, run you down!
Must do.. Excellent views of the city. Great energy and people watching opportunities. Amazing statues. Vendors interesting and varied.
The most beautiful bridge in Budapest. Compared to the other bridges nearby, this one really stands out. Beautiful lion statues guarding both entrances. Check it out!

Nice bridge, nothing more. It looks nice, but is busy with speeding cyclists and in essence it is just one way to get from Buda to Pest.
Very nice highlited at night.

Exemplary !. It looks massive and grandiose specially in the evening. It is a Definitive structure of Budapest, being the main bridge that links Buda and Pest.it is the busiest bridge considering the flow of cars and buses passing through.

Unavoidable, but nice. At numerous points in a stay in Budapest, a person will walk across, walk by or have in their view this bridge. I enjoyed it best at night, with the lights and castle hill behind it. I thought the lions on the end caps were nice. I would not go out of my way to see it, but you are bound to see it at some point!

Those canny Scots!. The chain bridge so called because it is a suspension bridge with enormous chain links the basic building connectors, although at night it looks chain like due to the lights used to illuminate the structure. The bridge joined the Buda and Pest sides of the city in 1849 and a Scotsman Mr William Clark was responsible for its construction. The bridge is a perfect vantage point to view the city and a walk over night or day is always fun and interesting. We noticed that the custom of lovers to leave a lock fastened to some part of the structure is beginning to take hold here.Hang on to your hat because the wind can be strong here and look out for rogue cyclists who weave around pedestrians at too fast a speed.Superficially the bridge needs attention and the rust beetle is evident along the walkways.

A very photogenic bridge!. The Chain Bridge, over the Danube in Budapest, is just so danged beautiful that you just can't seem to stop taking pictures of it. Kind of like the Sydney Opera House.....oh, I'll just take one more! It's old and beautiful and different from all the many bridges in Budapest....if you like to take photos make sure you stop at the Chain Bridge.

A nice way to walk over the Danube to the Castle District. A bridge is a bridge. The history of the construction, then destruction during WWII and then reconstruction is intersting. I found this bridge the best route to see the beautiful Castle District.

Important and great classic bridge with bike. We biked this bridge several times, because it goes form Pest to Buda with many sight seeings. You fall in love with this bridge, in the evening a jewell in this city. The hotel at Pest side located in a palace building makes the picture complete, next to the old entance of the tunnel at the other side. I lost count passing this bridge by bike.Glad they did restore this after World War II. Great job!

Beautiful at night. Other than serving a valuable purpose linking the two cities the bridge looks fantastic when lit up at night. And I like the bridge as it was designed by an Englishman, which always helps ;)
Chain Bridge. This is a very impressive structure. Took pictures of it in daylight and again at night when it was beautifully lighted and a wonderful sight.

Worth a slow stroll over this bridge. but look out for bikers! great views from here and links you directly between a small open air bar/restaurant that overlooks the river and the funicular on the other side which takes you up the hill.
Amazing bridge. We walked across the amazing bridge. I think it was the first bridge built to join Buda & Pest. Did not like the amount of traffic & bikes. Certainly worth the walk across!
Beautiful!. A gorgeous bridge day and night! Easy to cross on foot. Don't miss views of it from the river as well as from Buda Castle at night!
Beautiful!. An obvious must see...I actually don't you could miss it if you tried. The best view was on the walk down from the funicular.

Best in show in a bridge city. Designed by William Clark, this beautiful suspension bridge has a very old look for such a new bridge. Only 150 years old and rebuilt after WWII, the bridge is the centerpiece of the Budapest bridges. Just behind the bridge on the Buda side, a tunnel awaits drivers (not pedestrians). The joke we heard is that Clark built the tunnel so the bridge could be pulled in for safekeeping during the inevitable flooding of the Danube. Admire it from afar, but walk across to access either Buda or Pest.

Great photo op. A great icon in the city. we walked across it several times to enjoy the Danube as well as to take pictures of the city. It is great to see at night when it is lit with the castle in the background - remember to take a tripod if you are serious about photography.
lovely!. Really lovely bridge, very beautiful, and it is worth to pay for a boat, so you can see it from Danube (we took a boat at 9 p.m.), and illuminated it is really gorgeous!!

A landmark on the Danube. Beautiful bridge over the Danube. All of the spans over the Danube were destroyed in World War II, and reconstructed. The Chain was reconstructed to match the original. It is pretty much the focal point of almost every scenic photograph you see of Budapest, with the castle looming behind it on the Buda side and the Parliament building behind it on the Pest side. There are great views of the river walking across it, and it is a failry short walk from Buda to Pest and back.The Chain Bridge towers reminded me a little of the Brooklyn Bridge towers.

Spectacular bridge and way to get in Buda.. This nice bridge in my opinion is the most beautiful among all the bridges of the city, has its own charm and for its architecture as well as the location in which it is close down the hill.This bridge connects the two parts of the city between Buda and Pest, and it also leads directly near the hill where is located the famous castle.Few steps away from Parliament this bridge is lovely in the evening when the lights on and visible along the bank of the Danube and from many points of the city.It is the spectacular view from the bastions up on the hill.

Connecting Buda to Pest. It provided us with our first opportunity to cross the Danube and watch the flood waters racing below us. There was no traffic on the river, due to the floods, so one could really appreciate the vast amount of water that was in the river. The bridge, guarded by four lions, is an impressive piece of engineering, but I didn't pay much attention to it being more interested in the sights, sounds, views of the city and river. Next time....

hmmm. Although there is no denying the bridge is stunning at night when it is lit up, walking across the bridge itself is slightly underwhelming. The best place to get snaps of this beautiful bridge is from Gellert Hill in the evening.

Best bridge to use. Being the central bridge we found ourselves using this bridge to get across between Buda and Pest. It's pretty and depending on which side you use you get lovely views of the city.

Heritage Site. This was the first Bridge to be built across Danube river on this stretch, connecting Buda with Pest and is a UNESCO Heritage site. It is like any other normal bridge, has great views when u cross it and it has a nice feel to it.It does look like a nice grand imposing bridge when viewed from a distance. It is easily approachable by Tram and bus.
Beautiful. Great views and worth a visit to see the locals dodge the tourists on their journey home at rush hour

Very Neat Bridge. More than likely you will drive or walk across the Chain Bridge if you are sight seeing in Budapest. It connects Buda and Pest. This bridge is lovely and it's offers a lovely view of Buda and Pest and the Danube.

Good engineering, and beutiful bridge.-. This is a subjective review as I like very much engineering works.- Perhaps for other people doesn't have the importance that have for me.- I think that an engineering work, is it is well built, and proper proportions must be considered an art masterwork, and this bridge certainly is.-

Interesting. Although the chain bridge is interesting in its history and also quite nice to look at, it's pretty much just a bridge. I think it looks nicer from a distance. I prefer the bridges that run parallel to it, because then you have a nice view of the chain bridge as you cross. You can't see it when you're on it!

Beautiful. Its a beautiful bridge connecting Buda and Pest and the views are truly amazing! But its also just a bridge. To be honest, I am not sure how you would miss seeing this during your time in Budapest whether you tried or not.
A Budapest land mark. Beautiful bridge that you can see from all over the river banks. Loved the design of it. Nice to walk across on a sunny day.
Good view of the Palace from bridge. Not sure what the attraction is. It is a bridge joining Buda to Pest. You do get a good view from it but it is also very busy.

Beautiful but touristy. Its by far one of the most famous places to go to while in Budapest, and you need to go, but its full of tourist. Also dont try and ride a bike across it, very difficult and with so many people not worth it. Take the liberty or another bridge across with a bike.
You have to walk across the bridge. It is a sensational experience, fun and you can take as long as you want. Full of tourist, musicians, etc.
Nice scenery. Nice bridge to see and walk through! You can see the Buda hill and several buildings. Nice for night and day visits. Wuld prefer night ones.

Wonderful!!. My Goodness, this is such a beautiful bridge. It connect Buda and Pest Together. It is beautiful at night. It was such a great excperiance to walk over this bridge at night. You should walk over it at least once if you visit Budapest.
Beautiful bridge. A beautiful bridge by day, at night it is superb illuminated. It is easy to walk across as their is a safe pavement alongside the road.

An iconic beauty, day or night.. You will see this bridge on everything from posters and T-shirts to coffee mugs, why not see the city from the middle of it? It's a great walk and only the second bridge to begin to span the Danube. The first permanent bridge over the Danube from Buda to Pest was bombed by the retreating Germans and rebuilt after WWII, only the classic pillars survived. It re-opened to the public on the bridges 100th birthday in 1949. 100,000 bolts hold it together a fact I learned on the Hop on Hop Off Green Bus tour which I also highly recommend. I love it day or night. This busy bridge has such an old world glamorous air about it, especially all lit up. For a little something different prior to sunset head down to the bridge, perhaps to have dinner on the top deck of a nearby floating restaurant. Keep your eye on the bridge as the lights (initially installed in 1937 to welcome an Italian king and Austrian chancellor) come on they are initially green, turning white as they warm up. It is definitely an Hungarian icon worth preserving and one of the most recognized bridges in the world.

Climb up the bridge for a breath-taking view of Budapest's finest. I climbed up along the rope of the bridge with my friends.. it was a bit frightening but the feeling of the cars zooming below you and the spectacular view of the Budapest night scene is all worth it.

Take a camera and walk both sides. This was only bridge we used when we crossed Danube from Buda to Pest side and everytime it looked great and especially views from both side. On Buda side right next to Chain Bridge is Funicular which takes you up to Castle Hill
Worthwhile. Lovely views from the bridge - definitely worth the walk across with plenty of photo opportunities. would recommend a visit both during the day and at night.
Great walk. Great for photos of the structure & the river traffic. Walk to the Castle area over this bridge . A great sight when all lit at night time.

Must see!. This bridge is very impressive. The view is absolutely amazing and at night is even more incredible. The sculptures of the lions adds to its beauty. You have to take a second to take in how beautiful everything is whist on this bridge. It is also very romantic.
Photographers dream. great tourist trap and photographers dream, especially at night. luckily we got there after the major flooding.

Good view of the Danube. We walked to the bridge after visiting both Gelert and Castle Hills - the bridge is very impressive with statues of lions at both the left and right entries - very good view of the Danube - it was just receding from the recent floods - the bridge led us nicely into the main shopping area just after the beautiful Four Seasons hotel

Well done, Adam Clark. The chain bridge is the most beautiful and romantic of Budapest's many fine bridges. It is not the bridge's fault that you take your life in your hands when you walk across, because of cyclists using the narrow pedestrian walkway at high speeds, and persistently and very dangerously cutting blind corners.
Eyecatching. One of the main symbols of Budapest. Hard to believe it was completely demolished during WWII and then rebuilt a few decades ago.
Most interesting of all the bridges. Chain bridge was a sight well worth seeing and featured in many of my photos from various places. I thought it was the most interesting of all the bridges.
beautiful. Don't miss the chance to walk, or bike over the chain bridge and, most of all don't forget your camera. You'll love it.
Beautiful at night!. This is a very unique bridge right across from the castle district very nice to walk across and visit both sides of this city!

Worth the walk. A great sight. As one of the other reviewers had mentioned, it is worth the 2 trips, one at night and one at day time. Though many tourists but still an orderly place t walk around and take good pictures. This is one of the stops of the hop on hop off bus which, btw, is a good idea to take as there are many places to see in Budapest that are not walking distance.

Worth 2 trips. Please take my advice and visit it twice....once during the day then at night....dont forget a tripod or beanbag at night to steady your camera as it is illuminated and a long exposure will be required. Fantastic bridge and on the Buda side a few nice place to eat close by....
Lovely at night. Try to do a dinner cruise on the Danube that will allow you to see the city at night as the lights come on. The Chain Bridge and others are a delight to see.
Just because it's there.. Similar to walking the Brooklyn Bridge. Old bridge that is pretty in it's own right and just one of the things you do when in Budapest.
A beautiful bridge. The bridge is very beautiful and should be seen up close if at all possible to notice the architecture.

The river was high. The bridge is overrated.. I walked across the bridge. Watch out for cyclists.On the Buda side next to Parliament- you can find the shoe exhibit.Near the end of World War II, thousands of Hungarian-Jews were shot and thrown into the river by their fellow citizens. Our guide said that Jews were tied together with a long rope and every 4th person was shot and the rest pushed into the Danube to drown.The idea to place a monument on the river embankment to the victims belongs to a Hungarian sculptor Gyula Pauer. The monument has 60 pairs of iron shoes, forming a row of 40 metres. It is dedicated to the victims of the Hungarian fascist Arrow Cross party who shot the people and pushed them into the river, sparing themselves the hard work of burials. The victims had to take their shoes off, since shoes were valuable at the time. You can walk to Parliament which is under construction now- and hard to access.
Make sure you see it at night. This bridge is really beautiful and gives you great views of both Buda and Pest. But it's at its best at night when it is lit up, very romantic.
Beautiful at Night. The Chain Bridge was so beautiful lit up at night. We took a Viking River Cruise and our ship was docked at the Chain Bridge.
Good tourist spot. Hungary has great weather from April to September so it is worth walking across the bridge and take great photos of the scenery.
Walking. Another iconic symbol of the city at the lions of Chain bridge. We were on a walking tour and learned so much of the legend and history of the Bridge. I would recommend doing that.

free. It is a nice bridge, you can visit it during the day and then come back at night, that way you can see it with all the lights on. It's free so not problem there. I like it but didn't feel that it deserves such a big case. I have seen bigger bridges. But nevertheless, it's a landmark so go and take some pictures.

beautiful. during our visit to Budapest we were lucky to have our hotel right near the bridge, we walked across it and was amazed by its beauty and history. we took some beautiful pictures from the rooms at the hotel. its a great walking bridge.. dont be afraid to walk across it..

A Bridge.. It's a bridge over the Danube made with very long chains that are painted blue. Get over it.
If you do you will find Buda. Or Pest. Depending on which side you started from.
Great sight in Budapest. Chain Bridge is a must see, especially lit up at night. It is beautiful and well worth a walk across whether by day or by night.

Beautiful. You don't have to pay a lot in live to see some of the most beautiful things in life. It is absolutely vital that you make a point it to walk over the chain bridge when you visit Budapest both in daytime and at night. It is beautiful. It Connects Buda and Pest and is a very beautiful structure standing.
Incredible. Everyone should walk over the Chain Bridge crossing the Danube River. It is magnificent!! The lions on both sides are a photo-op. The views on both sides completely different.
Lovely Views - Powerful river. Great views of the castle, Parliament. Nice just to while-away some time as the Danube flows beneath you. Impressive structure.

Chain Bridge across the Danube River. This beautiful bridge connects Buda with Pest and crosses the Danube River. No, the river isn't blue but rather "river" color: kind of green looking. I wanted to take a river boat trip along the river to see the bridge from another angle. The bridge is especially beautiful at night when the lights strung across the span are illuminated.

Very pretty bridge when lit up in the night. We walked across from the Pest side to Buda and then went up the hill by the funicular rail to savour the view of the Chain Bridge, the Danube and the city of Pest below. Funicular is a must!
Huge. It's quite an intimidating structure but worth the walk to see it from the middle. Hard to imagine how it was built. Watch out for locals on bikes they will knock you over.

An amazing bridge. This is an amazing bridge that rises to the level of a work of art. I was inspired by the architecture. At night it is even more stunning. There is a fair amount of graffiti on the bridge, much like some of the other building in Budapest.If you visit Budapest, take a walk across the bridge and tide the Buda Hill Funicular to the top.
Wonderful old bridge. Loved the engineering and design of the bridge. Beautiful at night. Close to everything and easy to get to.
beautiful at night. recommend a night time stroll over the chain bridge, very beautiful, good photo opportunities of the danube

Old European Feel. This bridge is a very authentic European monument. it is such a pleasure crossing this bridge and we would have done it by walking if not for the rain. The architecture is great! it drives you back into a dreamy world and makes you live the old days all over again. Worth a peak when in budapest.

Excellent views. Excellent view from bridge.
Worth walking along both sides as the traffic in the centre restricts views on opposite side of river.

Over hyped. Its a bridge and nothing special architecturally, although of historical importance, you will go over it more than once on your trip to get between Buda and Pest so don't make a special effort

Budapest views rival Paris. The main artery between "Buda" and "Pest," the chain bridge is a stunning feat of architecture. Loved the lion heads! There is also a funicular railway easily accessible from one end of the bridge which you can take right up to the castle district, which is helpful because this is a huge city. Had fun going off on my own in the rain one night and taking pictures on this bridge.
Walk across. Walk across this beautiful bridge for beautiful views of both sides do the river- great picture opportunities!

the icon of budapest. move over statue of liberty or tour de effiel...the chain bridge is a icon ...a symbol of the city...best views from the funicular, the royal palace front terrace or and pest side...duna korso...the interncontintal hotel...

good engireering. We were tol,d that many of the similar structures around the world were designed using this bridge as a model. As as cruised the Danube at night the bridge was lit and this with the other structures such as Parliament gave us a wonderful sight to see

Wonderful Bridge!. Stunning bridge..watch out for cyclists as you take pictures oh and beggars of which there were many just crouching inbetween the ironwork.The bridge is a wonderful way to see the Danube first hand from both sides. It was destroyed during the war but is now a remarkable and lovely landmark.

A lovely walk across the Danube. Budapest has some equally lovely bridges but as our hotel overlooked the Chain Bridge and we walked over it a few times, it has become a favourite. You get some great views of both sides of the Danube and it's an easy walk from one side to the other. Particularly attractive when lit up at night, don't forget your camera.

Must see. The views of the bridge and from the bridge are exceptional both by day and by night and it is well worth walking the length to see them. The history of the making of the bridge is fascinating and adds to appreciation of its significance to linking the two cities.

The first Bridge across the Danube 1845. Although blown up by the Germans in WW2 this bridge has been fully restored to its original glory. A nice place to cross the Danube on foot or by car. great views up and down the danube

Chain Bridge crossing. We walked across the chain bridge which is not too far from one side to the other into the old part of the city where we explored the old city and castle and the views across the Danube were terrific.

Romantic Walk. We took a night walk on the bridge and it was a lovely sight to behold. All the illuminated buildings added to the grandeur of the Danube River.
The cruise liners added an extra touch to the scenery.
Drab and Over Hyped. This grey rusting bridge is only worth seeing at night when it is lit up! The nearby Liberty Bridge is far nicer.
Beautiful bridge and great view from the bridge. We enjoyed walking across the Chain Bridge as part of one of the Free Walking Tours on our way to the Buda Side.
Great view. The bridge provides a great view of the buda side. Was a great walk. Only thing I didn't like was the foul urine smell in some spots

Beautiful Bridges. All of the bridges over the Danube in Budapest are just fantastic and full of character and history. I especially enjoyed the Chain Bidge along with the Freedom and Queen Elizabeth bridges.

Wonderful. Amazing - we had a stunning view of the chain bridge from our hotel room and it was just beautiful. It lights up on an evening (until about midnight) and with the backdrop of Buda it really is a stunning view. We also walked over the bridge which was fun - our two year old loved it!

yes, take this walk. its beautiful, especially around sunset. a beautiful historic bridge over the Danuba connesting Buda and Pest, app. 800 meters. take this walk and you will enjoy it especially on a romantic afternoon.
A city of Bridges!. We walked across three bridges over the Danube, the Chain Bridge, The Ezerbeta and The Margaeta (please excuse spellings) A wonderful walk and holiday experience

artistic and a token of ages past. This bridge is very ornate in a very appealing manner. It has lots of "gingerbread" and is the prettiest bridge in Budapest. It is a great place to get more incredible views of the Buda and Pest sides and the boats that cluster at the docks
beautiful. You won't miss it once in Budapest! it's gorgeous and easy to access, perfect for romantic strolls! you can take lots of beautiful pictures on it

The Iconic Symbol of Budapest. Spanning the Danube and linking Buda with Pest, the Chain Bridge is the iconic symbol of Budapest. Stroll across the bridge that has linked the two sides of the river for centuries.
nice to walk on. Nice walk from the castle to the other side. We walked from the hill to the parliament building, about 40 min walk (or less)
Beautiful to walk across.... Beautiful view both day and night. Was a nice walk to get to the other part of the city and it really isn't that long of a walk.

Great for photography!. Brilliant way to walk from Pest to Buda and enjoy the fantastic views on the bridge.
I found difficult to cross the busy road and the busy traffic a distraction during day time. May be best to visit at night!

what a bridge. Very surprised this was by a Scotish Architec we crossed the bridge several times a day as our hotel was on the Buda side. It was very windy and cold but it was February so what do you expect even if you didn't have to cross daily it's worth doing it once to admire the beauty of the bridge and the view of the Castle, Parliment. The funicular is here too so another form of transport. The bridge is lit up at night and is a good focal point to find you way around.

Beautiful Bridge!. My husband and I walked across this bridge numerous times. It seemed that one side was made for one way walking traffic and then the other was for the opposite walking traffic.It was just gorgeous! One thing though, be careful of dog manure. We found quite a bit of it.

Chain Bridge. Lots of history surrounding this bridge, I found it quite odd that despite the fact that it had been destroyed a few times and rebuilt it was still viewed with such reverence.It was the first bridge to be built across the Danube in the city so I suppose that will never change. The tour buses are not allowed across it so it worth getting off and walking across from the Pest side to the Buda side. You can see the funicular railway in the hillside and this will take you up to the Castle district from where you can pick up your tour bus again and have an ice cream at the same time.

Walk This Bridge!. This is a very unusual and beautiful bridge which should be walked to be appreciated. It is amazingly beautiful and a definite must-see. Don't forget to view it from afar at night. The lighting is lovely.
Beautiful bridge. This bridge is beautiful. A stroll across it from Buda to Pest or vice versa is breathtaking. This is a must do for any visitor to Budapest!
great view. beautiful city, great food, great places to see, including this bridge. highly recommended!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
beautiful. i enjoyed the night photography, you can take hours and hours trying to get the best picture of Buda and the parlament
Nice bridge, but same as the others along river... This is the first bridge built across the river, apparently widened when it restored after WW2. Nice bridge but probably just as nice as the others.
Beautiful and great views of Parliament. Is worth to walk it through to have the best views of parliament building as well as the palace and danube river

Great. We had a morning walk from Elizabeth Bridge to Chain Bridge. The view en route was fantastic. It is strongly recommended to jog along the river banks and bridges in the morning. At night, this bridge is lit up and very beautiful.

A must see. A must see if you're in Budapest. Take the time to walk across it and back. It's at the base of the Castle, so take a hike up the stairs to see St Mathias and the shops at the top while you're there. It's a pretty site to see, especially while it's lit up at night- makes for some good pictures of Budapest!
The first dry link between Buda & Pest. This bridge was the first dry link between Buda and Pest and was designed by an English architect.All the bridges were different and easily walkable

Stunning Budapest. This must be the most beautiful city the world has to offer. Fabulous by day, be sure to walk up to the castle and see the most amazing panoramic view of Budapest and the river Danube. Plenty of quality places to eat and drink with prices about the same as England. When the city and the river is lit up at night you will see the most beautiful sights ever.

Most famous bridge in Budapest. We walked across the bridge at night and during the day. Breathtaking. Be sure to cross the Elizabeth Bridge and the Liberty Bridges, and take pics of the Chain Bridge. Love the Danube.

Wonderful at night. Very nice , especially from our hotel at night when illuminated.
Take the time to cross the Danube via Budapest's bridges.

Night shots. Probably the most famous bridge in Budapest, designed and engineered by the British. At night is it lit up given amateur photographers lots of fun with their toys trying to get amazing shots of night time Budapest, well worth walking across, which we did several times during the day and night.

A beautiful bridge in a beautiful city. The bridge is quite romantic and artistic. Be sure to walk across and appreciate how rapidly the waters of the Danube flow. See the bridge in daylight and at evening because these are 2 very different perspectives. The bridge at night is beautiful beyond belief. Long may it reign.
Very pretty at night. A lovely bridge and a must for a visit to Budapest. Very romantic at night and creates a lovely central point to the city.

One of a kind Bridge. there are various statues you along this bridge. Nice way to walk across the Danube. It is a pedestrian only bridge. there were people during the day....crowded but not unbearable.

I expected more. I expected this bridge to be more spectacular, but in my opinion even the other bridge, the green one (Szabadsag Hid) looked nicer. Like other bridges, it's full of people and bikers.

Better at night. Chain Bridge can be very busy traffic wise, also you may have to dodge people shooting across the pedestrian walkway full tilt on push bikes,
We thought it was better at night, all lit up and not as busy.

check the lions. The chain bridge has always been a fantasy... walking along it could only be compared to walking along the cairo bridge over the Nile with wind and sights are just beautiful.... look out for the lion sculptures at the gates to the bridge as they have no tongues.... made so ... so that they do not reveal their secrets.
Stunning. This bridge is a must see during the day however.....at night it is a DO NOT MISS. It becomes the central point of a magical landscape.
nothing really spectacular. nothing really spectacular, just a bridge to get to the castle. be careful when walking as its shared with cyclists.

THE MOST BEAUTIFULL OF BUDAPEST BRIDGES. Chain Bridge or Lions Bridge ,because of the two lions decoration, at each side entrance of the bridge,is one of the most beautifull bridges of Hungary.I felt sorry when i heart from our guide that the creator suicided becauce he forgotten to put the tongue of the lion.I enjoyed it passing with our tour-bus and also walking on it crossing Buda to Pesti, both daylight and at night that is illuminated. It looks fantastic.

The nicest bridge in Budapest, great all lit up!. Although this bridge is sort of a mini Brooklyn Bridge, in that it is constructed of brick and is of a similar style to the New York landmark, it doesn't have the presence of the Brooklyn Bridge--but it is the nicest one in Budapest. At night, it is especially lovely. There is a park on the Pest side near the entrance to the bridge, and the funicular which takes you up to the palace is right there when you arrive on the Pest side.
so beautiful at night. The bridge is very beautiful when lit up at night - walked over it a couple of times over the few days we were there and definitely is best and most romantic at nighttime!!

Great views. standing in the middle of budapest, allowing you to see the Buda side and Pest side. It was a very pleasant walk from one side to another. standing here allows you to see budapest from a different viewpoint. both sides amazing.

Very good especially during the night!. It's just a bridge therefore don't expect too much...You will love it during the night with all this lighting! You can get some pictures as well as the view of the river ir very good!

Built with large bicycle-like chains. Magnificient architecture designed and built with cooperation of a Scot and Englishman. Beautifully rebuilt after sever damage during the seige of Budapest during WWII.

Great views and excellent condition. Weather was good and we enjoyed our stroll across the bridge. We noticed the excellent condition the bridge was in...no rust visible anywhere. Great views up and down the river and of river life below. Well worth a visit.

Nice view. This is "must see" site in Budapest. Very remarkable bridge. Also, you can take a small cruise boat just south of the bridge. The view on the Parliament from Danube is just something you do not want to miss.

looks like Brooklyn bridge in Europe. very nice walk from old city to new city, just make sure to cross the street at the pedestrian crossing. The bridges and the walkways by Danube in Budapest makes a great location for a nice relaxing stroll or jogging
Chain Bridge. Great location to take photos from or to take photos of, but watch out for the cyclists who all cycle (legally) on the pavement.
My Fav place in Budapest.. I cant say enough about this place, If you like architecture and beauty this is the place. You have not been Budapest, If you have not seen this place.

The famous bridge. Have seen this bridge in so many movies, that the first thing we did after checking into our room at the InterContinental Hotel, near the bridge, was to walk across the bridge to enjoy the experience and take lots of photos. We saw the bridge again at night when we had a river boat dinner and cruise in the evening.

beautiful bridge. what a great piece of engineering it is a very stunning bridge and fits into the skyline very nicely.In a city of such beauty it is saying something to put this up there as one of the top sights on the river

the big blue danube!. amazing view of budapest, hopefully everyone who visits budapest will go and see it. brings a picture of the old days and od the empire, really cool if you have kids too. the lions are impressive and the view of buda royal district is amazing. makes you wish to go to the hungarian art history museum by looking at its magnificent building. do the boat rides too, it's worth the money and time.
Nice and beautiful. Really nice through the bridge is not huge, but the design are full of romatic sense. Surely a super place for wedding picture

It's a must to cross the Danube on the Chain Bridge. You should go there twice: first during the day - possibly in nice weather - and then at night. It is one of the most beautiful views you have ever seen. It's the oldest bridge in Budapest. Don't forget about the lions at the two bridgeheads. If you're in Buda, you can continue your tour up to the Castle Hill by funicular (the station is on the left side of the Tunnel).

"best view of Danube River in town". The first time we visited and crossed was impressive, the view of both Buda and Pest been divided by the splendid Danube River takes you away from any thought, just a complete relaxing and joyful moment that was only surpassed by the view at night! what a wonderful and spectacular view of the Chain Bridge full of lights.

A must walk. It was fun to walk the Chain Bridge. You can see how it was constructed and how practical that there are walkways on both sides well out of the traffic. Very easy to get from one side of the river to the other.
Views spectacular. Excellent way to get across the Danube from Bude to Pest, lots of traffic and cyclists on footpaths are a bit of a mither, but great views of both sides
Ok. It is a bridge over the Danube. It is a nice bridge but a bridge. Worth a look and walk over but nothing spectacular.

It's a bridge. I know it's a landmark symbol in the city and if the weather is good or when it's lit at night it makes a good photo but I can't get excited about a bridge. I found this the least convenient point to cross the river as the bridges either side are better served by public transport.If you are one of those people who like to photgraph everything you see, best pics can be taken from the Buda side of the river
Great Views. Walked over it a few times and never tired of the views. Lots of character. Ever changing scenery with the boat traffic.

a fantastic view over the Danube river...especially by night.. great photographs will be taken while on the bridge. Breath taken views are there waiting for you. Have a walk-by night-, and enjoy the charming night of Budapest.

Impressive by day or night. We sailed under it, walked over it, rode over it and looked down upon it . Very impressive! Try and walk over all the bridges if you can as the engineering is a sight to see. It is very sad to think that the retreating German Army blew up all the bridges in Budapest as they fled the city.
Beautiful, old bridge. Amazing landmark. Walking through is a must. Although windy it is worth the pain to see the Parliament building from it. The River down is just amazing so don't miss.

Most Amazing Site in Budapest!. If you're interested in engineering and history this is one of the most amazing bridges in the world. Just read up about it and you'll find out why. It's really beautiful and a great place to see the city from.

Do not miss a night walk. At night the bridge is brightly lit, with Parliament, Buda Castle, and the Fishermen's Bastion as your backdrops. The walkways are much more crowded in the daytime; at night, the tourists thin out, and you get a much more personal experience. It's mostly singles, couples, or small groups passing by with a nod.

A Nice Walk. If you wish to cross from Pest to Buda or vice versa, then there can't be many better ways than to walk across this lovely bridge. Stop halfway across and take in the views of both sides of the Danube. You can also get a good view of the Bridge from the Castle Hill area in Buda.
Be Sure to Walk This Bridge for Best Photos. a good way to get from Pest to Buda and back, or vice versa. Take the walking path and get some great views.

Beautiful by night. must see it all lit up at night. Very big and wide so takes a good 10 mins to walk over it. Walk along the side through the day and see the famous shoes left at the river side from World War 2.

iconic. Well, it's a bridge across the Danube!
The first at Budapest. A classic C19 suspension bridge.
And the reason for Buda and Pest becoming Budapest.

Amazing, especially at night. This is one of the most lovely Bridges I've seen. If you are into photography, go right at sunset when there is enough light to see the surrounding areas, but the lights of the bridge and Castle Hill have been turned on. There is this mystical effect of the lights that almosts transports you back to another era. We also got big photos around midnight and those we great too. Although make sure you come before then - at the end of March the lights turned off at that time!

Chain Bridge. Beautiful both day and night. Check out the museum on Castle Hill to see the photo of the bridge after the bombing. A great historical landmark and the first bridge to connect Buda and Pest.
If you like bridges... Obviously, the views are good day and night, and it has it's historic connotations, but it still is just an old big bridge.
impressive. A very nice architecture and a very nice story behind, that it would be more interesting to hear it from the locals.
Its a Bridge. Not much to say really... Eye-catching but incredibly similar to another green chain bridge which is two bridges along.

The greatest bridge in Budapest!. Thats the bridge right in the middle of the city! In Buda side there's the Buda Castle and in Pest side you can see the Gresham Palace. It is much more awesome during night with all the light! My humble advice for you to take a boat tour during night and be amazed ;)

Iconic bridge!. This is an amazing structure by which you can walk across the Danube. The views in both directions are fabulous. Crossing to Buda the vista of the Buda Castle/Royal Palace is stunning. You also benefit from the great views up and down the river on both sides of the bridge. Add to this the history of the bridge and you have an unmissable attraction. If you are staying on either side of the Danube you are most likely to encounter the bridge anyway!
Nothing that special.. As far as bridges go I didn't think it was that special but you can get a good view so it's still worth taking a walk across.
day and night. i was lucky to be located adjacent to the bridge and it was a visual delight both day and night as after dark it is fully illuminated
You have to cross the Danube. It is a must to cross the Danube on this bridge. The views are fantastic on both the Buda and Pest sides and the bridge itself looks magnificent!
Picturesque. Good photos from it during the day and of it at night. Liked the stone lions at the end! Be sure to use the underpass to get from one side to the other, as the road across is busy.
A Landmark. This is probably one of the most photographed sites in Budapest. It was the oldest bridge and has been restored to its former glory. Don't miss it at night when it's lit up beautifully.

Good views...........especially at night. Not sure which is my favourite bridge in Budapest, probably a toss-up between this one and Liberty Bridge. Interesting design and an amazing feat of engineering when you consider the span across the Danube. Some fantastic views of both Buda and Pest, especially at night when the city is fully illuminated.
My favorite. Since i'm an architect, it's really nice to see the structure of the bridge, as a history freak, it's nice to admire the connector between buda and pest, and the view is just amazing!

A real world heritage site. Who would have thought that a bridge could be quite so beautiful or exciting. It really is beautiful in the evenings when the lights come on. There is a local tale that if you put a padlock on the love tree in the park and throw your keys off the chain bridge that your love will last forever...so after I proposed to my Fiance we did the padlock (with our names engraved by a local cobbler) and then threw the keys in the river...lets hope the fable is true:)

it is just a bridge with good view of buda and pest side. Bridge itself has nothing on it. But while you walk on the bridge you will have good viewof both buda and pest side. There are 2 lions on the entrance of the bridge on Buda side. The funcular to the castle hill is near the edge of Buda side too. This bridge nothing compared to charles bridge in Prague

Impossible to miss as connects Buda to Pest but what is the big deal?. I don't get the fuss about this bridge, but then I have crossed Hammersmith Bridge multiple times, and this bridge is very similar. Since Buda is separated from Pest by the Danube one has to cross by one of the bridges to get from one side to the other, and chances are you will cross by this one. It is situate on a picturesque part of Budapest opposite the Four Seasons Hotel. As far as bridges go, it doesn't compare with Charles Bridge in Prague, Ponte Vecchio in Florence, or Tower Bridge in London.
Object of many pics. Looks very beautiful from Castle Hill,Gellert Hill..Even more at night with lights..Connects Buda with Pest..Took many pictures of it from different places..
A must. Full stop.. You cannot miss such an attraction, it is iconic. Enjoy it in the daylight but don't miss the night view.
Beautiful bridge. Majestic during the day and magical by night. Walk across to get an alternative view from the other side.
