Great View on Danube On This Bridge. This is not a long bridge, it offers good views of the Danube river and connects you from Buda side to the Pest side. It also lets you off close to the lift which you can take up to Castle Hill. Besides the Huge Lions at both entrances I can't say much more. I was at the Charles Bridge in Prague Days before and there is no comparison. Was in awe of the Charles bridge, this bridge was mainly just... a bridge.
FREE BUDAPEST WALK THE ORIGINAL ONE. This was our first tour by "FREE WALKING TOURS" and started with Pest and over the Chainbridge into Buda

They cleaned it up and spiced it up. It was just getting ready for the holiday season and it was beautiful looking at night. I took one of the boat cruises and it was most excellent. It was also a bit safer to cross. My favorite is the cleaniness and the ornaments, everything has been preserved and spiced up. Nicely done!
Bridge that adds a bit of flavour to the city. Wandering over the bridge to see both sides of the Danube is a pleasant experience, each side is different and should be seen
Grand bridge. It'll be hard to miss the bridge as it's one of the main thoroufares over the Danube, it's also the oldest. Graceful and solid, plus it was designed and built by Britons!
This is probably the most iconic spot. Walk from one end to the other. From the bridge you can see many of the famous spots on both sides of the Danube. Breathtaking.
amazing feat of engineering. We traveled over and under this bridge and it is amazing to look at especially given its age, we used the green hop on-hop off which also includes a 1 hour boat cruise.

Pretty walk. Good views, separate pedestrian path, BUT watch out for bikes!At the Buda end, you will find the funicular railway to castle Hill.You will need to buy a ticket, it is not covered by your public transport pass. I really liked the lions at either end.

Lovely vantage point particularly at night. I have so far walked over and back over the bridge a few times on my trip and it is a nice bridge for sure. It gives you a great vantage point for the Danube and the wonderful architecture in Budapest at night with the parliament and castle lit up. What I especially like about it is there is lots of space to position yourself and your camera without getting in other peoples way. I walked over it in a storm last night and it was a real thrill
Lovely at night. Most impressive especially at night. Even during the day, the view from one of the other bridges was agnificent
NICEST BRIDGE IN BUDAPEST. We walked across the bridge at night and enjoyed all the lights of Budapest. When you arrive to the Buda side, you see the Parliament all light up.
chain bridge. walk across the bridge both day and night to experience the real beauty of Budapest, the lighting at night is worth a look

Early Engineering. Fascinating to see this magnificent bridge and to think it was built several years before Brunel's Clifton Suspension Bridge, which I know well, living in Clifton. Very similar in its design from the chain links to the suporting towers. Sad part of the experience were a couple of old ladies with various ailments such as ulcerated legs, begging for alms from passers by as they crossed the bridge on foot.
one of many. probally the main bridge people think of but there are quite a few to chose from we walked over a few.this one maybe stands out more with its design.

fantastic old bridge. great history and while it isn't the original, having been bombed and destroyed last century, they rebuilt it like the original and it's a great looking bridge and just seems to seep history. great fun to walk across even when the wind was blowing cold and icy.
fascinating and beautiful. Fascinating to see how this bridge is constructed when actually crossing it.Beautiful views of bridge from bank and of river from the bridge
Worth seeing at night. Took a boat cruise along the Danube and it really captured the beauty of the Chain Bridge. Perfect at night when all the bridges and buildlngs are lit up.
Its a cool bridge. The bridge is nice. I really like the lions. It kinda looks like a mini Brooklyn Bridge. Night time it is all lit up. You should see it, because you will anyways.
Unusual piece of architecture. Its a big bridge across the Danube - it's looks like its made of giant bike chains. It's worth a visit.

What's all that fuss about that bridge. Our five year old boy was very interested in the chain bridge, and we tried to find the tounges of the lions (because we were told the were missing).
Besides that it was just a bridge, and personal i find the White bridge next to chain bridge more beautiful
Can work !. Easy to walk 5minutes! Some times broken road on bridge.
Overated. It's a nice bridge, but really nothing special about it, I think the liberty bridge just a few KM away was much much prettier.

Don´t miss this at night!. Hungarians have done everything in the last 10 years to brush up their capital- so the Chain Bridge looks as radiant as she did 100 years ago. And the illumination beats everything.
No wonder, that this bridge was in many movies including some Hollywood-pictures.
Beautiful view. The bridge itself is beautiful and the views of both Buda and Pest are lovely. It's nice to stand in the middle on a nice day and look at the boats in the water too.

A nice bridge, if that sort of thing excites you.. The bridge is located below the very picturesque national gallery and offers some good views when walking across. Similar views are available from other bridges though. The Danube is, of course, enormous and it takes a few minutes to cross the bridge on foot. It's not too far for several professional beggars with their hunched backs and odd socks to make their way to town and walk to the centre of at certain times of day. It's worth walking across but I wouldn't put it at the top of the list of things to see in Budapest.
cool engineering. suspension bridge-- but made with a huge bicycle-type chain. Similar to one in UK designed by the same engineers.

A bridge is a bridge but this offers views!. A bridge is just a bridge but this one in particular offers spectacular views of both the Buda and Pest sides. You can see the castle district on Buda side as well as the Parliament on the Pest side. At night you can see the Statue of Liberty (lady liberty) up in the hills. The views are best at night.

The link of the city. I LOVE this bridge. Probably because we walked across it a good five times during our stay in day and night as we were staying on Castle Hill. It was like you were heading home from a busy day on the Pest side to the calm and 'home' of Buda.

walking. the bridge is just a bridge unless you get off and walk across take a look at the links they are like the links in a push bike chain, only a thousand times bigger. and as you get to the end there is th fenicular train opposite.
Amazing view at night. Don't miss crossing the bridge at night, it has amazing view to Buda bank and the castle, and to the Pest bank and the beautiful Hungarian Parliment!

Great bridge for fab views, pedestrian friendly - free. This is basically a bridge, nothing more, nothing less. What's great about it are the views - stunning views of both sides of the city. The middle section is obviously for the cars and running along both sides of the car section is the pedestrian section - there's plenty of room for walking and to stop for photos. Catch a tram and wander across. The funicular to get up Castle Hill is literally opposite the bridge on the Buda side you can jump on that for a ride up the hill - more fab views!

Lions. The original bridge was blown up in World War II and it was rebuilt like the original. Have totally four lions on two sides. The sculptor of these lions said "my lions are faultless, if anyone finds a fault I will jump to Danube". Then one says "they have no tongue", so the artist jumps to Danube. Fortunately he could swim and didn't die...

Pretty view. You can catch a glimpse of the beautiful architecture used to build this bridge and you have a good view of the surroundings. It can get quiet noisy at peak hour and full of people walking, so be careful.
ok. Similar to other bridges. Nice walk but nothing truly amazing. Very busy bridge so be careful of pick-pockets!!

Bridge of Death. As far as bridges go, this isn't a bad little number. The 3 minute walk across it can be a windy one, in windy weather. Beware of the old woman who begs using a coffee cup, i doubt she is actually old at all, or even a woman- more likely than not, it was a child wearing a veil and standing on the shoulders of another accomplice child friend. Seagulls fly nearby and land in the danube which flows quickly beneath the bridge. If you fell of the bridge, you be swept along at a fair pace, just like the seagull. You would probably drown though. Nice bridge overall. Would benefit from a strip club
just a bridge. Not a lot to rave over. Having trouble finding more words to make 50 characters minimum! Possibly good views of the river in good weather.

A stroll across the connection between Buda & Pest. It was nice to walk along the Chain Bridge in the stifling heat in June 2012 while staying Budapest. You get a nice view of the Danube and the breez helps to cool you down.Be warned: The footpath is quite narrow. With tourists and locals using the bridge, you may find you are squeezing past people and suspensions.Take a walk after you have visited Buda Castle.
Picturesque. This bridge is an important connection between Buda and Pest. Makes for nice night time photos. Make sure you traverse this at least once on your trip.
a landmark. go and stroll, it is an amazing bridge were lovers have kissed and others have jump to death as well... takes you from Parliament to the funicular

It's a Bridge!. Interesting bridge across the Danube between Buda and Pest. We were headed to the Castle and it was snowing quite heavily as we crossed. We took a few photos looking either way and went on our way. Went back at night to see it illuminated.

The oldest bridge in Budapest. First Bridge to be build across Danube in Budapest, finally joining the two parts of the city Buda and Pest. Very nice. It takes some time before you reach the other bank of the river, but it enables you to really grasp the huge amount of water flowing beneath you. It is nicely illuminated in the night. Take also a look at Gresham Palace just in front of the Bridge (on the Pest side), one of the greatest Art Nouveau buildings in Budapest (now Four Seasons Hotel) !
Beautiful Chain Bridge. The Chain Bridge is a beautiful bridge, with large statues and very large old world lamp posts. It is a very lovely walk across the bridge on a nice day.

Pretty bridge in heart of Budapest. The fierce looking lions on either side of the bridge could be like the brave Hungarian spirit. We enjoyed crossing the bridge for the view. And it was raining! One can appreciate the fine architecture of the city from here.

We love this bridge, even more since it has been restored.. We've stayed at the Gellert Hotel, on the Buda side of the Danube, five or six times. And it is always a pleasure walking over this beautiful bridge, whether in the morning or coming back to the hotel after dark, or taking a tram if we are heading farther towards the centre.The main reason why we ask for a front room at the hotel is to be able to see this bridge first thing in the morning. A perennial delight.
Nice view. Walked from Buda to Pest here, the sight is really nice at night. Although it was a little cold since it's winter, but can be pretty romantic at summer.

stunning. This bridge has been destructed a couple of times already, and it's amazing to see how well it was reconstructed. The Lions guarding the bridge are an astonishing piece of art and gave some great photo opps

Fantastic piece of architecture. Best seen from the castle area, the bridge is a majestuous reminder of how the Austrian shaped Budapest. Make sure you stroll from the Parliament, cross the bridge, walk up the other bank to the spectacularly elegant Liberty Bridge.
amazing. Budapest its by far one of the most beautiful cities ive ever been.The view from this bridge its amazing. You cant come to Budapest without being here!
Great!. Walked down from Buda and walked across the bridge. Great views up and down the river and lovely to look up at the castle from this point.

Spectacular view. This suspension bridge over the Danube river connects Buda and Pest :two parts of Budapest. This bridge played a huge part in improving economy of the city when It was opened in 1849. It is a very beautiful bridge, especially huge statures of guardian lions.

Very nice. Just look at day time and go back at night the city and the view are totally different. Walk to the market and the Margaretha bridge , There are 10 bridges and all are different at daytime and nighttime .
worth the walk. must walk on the chain bridge at daytime and night time with great views and nice area to take lovely photos of buda and pest side
nice bridge. Outside our hotel so saw it during day and night-beautiful. Fun to walk across. Vendors are there but not aggressive
Beautiful bridge. Beautiful bridge in the centre of budapest. I must have taken 200 pictures of it on our trip to budapest. Very photogenic!
Lovely. A lovely old bridge, central to major areas. A nice walk over gives unobstructed views of the city from both sides of the Danube.
As said before it is a bridge.. A pleasant stroll across the Danube with excellent views and photo opportunities on our walk to catch the funicular to the Castle area

It's a bridge.... The bridge is a nice way to cross the river, with good views of the river and the castle. It is pretty at night when it is lit up, a nice spot to take photos is from the top of castle hill.

Can't say anymore than has already been said on here. We walked down from the castle in Buda across toward Pest. Whilst this was a wonderful walk doing it the orher way around would be better as all the sights are then in front of you.
Fantastic eengineering, you'll be told a million times its British built from steel made in Sheffield. ..
Give it a try
Great Way to Cross the Danube. Best way to cross form Pest to Buda. Great views all the way and takes you to the steps to the castle, or the funicular railway.
very beautiful. very nice bridge and leads directly to palace and castle district area, at night it is very beautiful, but cold during winter.

Impossible to miss..... A stroll across the Chain bridge is a must when you visit Budapest. Make sure you do it at night and in the day, so many different photo opportunities!!!! We walked across quite a few times. But beware when you look down along the bank you may see a man or two doing #2 out in the open....I did! Mamma Mia..... gibsonchop.com

A must-see and must-walk!. As featured in so many Budapest pictures, the Széchenyi Chain Bridge is one of the must-see landmarks of the city. Take the time to walk over to the other side, enjoy the view, and feel the vibrations of the passing traffic. Even better at night, heavily lit, not a single light was broken at our time of visit.

Nice to See. It's almost impossible to not see the Chain Bridge at some point during your visit to Budapest, so don't allot a lot of extra time to visit this attraction. Take a few pictures, walk across it, and continue on your way!

If only one, this one. . If you walk only one of the bridges make sure its this one. As one of the two surviving bridges from british engineer xxx this takes you back to the golden age of british engineering. We stayed on the buda side and so used this bridge a number of times. Visiting any of the historic museums will provide you with the chance to see pictures of this bridge destroyed during WWII. Looking at it today you would never know.

The most beautiful bridge in Budapest. We crossed this bridge twice on Valentin's eve , and truly although it's just a bridge, it is a very romantic one. But make sure you cross it when it's dark to get the right impression. There was not a lot of trafic, the bridge is lit with thousands of bulbs and there is a safe walkway on both sides and very few tourists on them. Crossing the bridge takes around 10 minutes.Definately worth if your hotel is within walking distance.
must go. This is a must go in ´budapest from here you can co to the buda castle by cable car which is a little two expensive or just climb through the park for ten minutes an get there.
Lovely walk. Realiy nice walk over this bridge. Its nice to stand overlooking both sides of Budapest. Highly recommended both in sunner and winter.

My "little" lucky charm.... Chain Bridge is my favourite one in Budapest - my little lucky charm - I simply adore this bridge. Occasionally I walk from Pest to Buda or Buda to Pest (or both :) ), it is beautiful in every piece. In summers, they close it from cars, so you can enjoy a walk anywhere it when you are there. There are programs, music, etc as well. I think since this bridge one of the "items" you know my country, I do not need further introduction.

Great photo opportunities. The bridge is a great piece of architecture which looks stunning both in the day and at night as it spanned the width of the wide Danube. It provided great prictures both of the bridge itself and from the bridge of the Dabube and both the Buda and Pest sides of the city. We took a Panoramic picture spanning both sides of the bridge and the city which hopefully will look good on the wall in our spare room
beautiful. stunning bridge to walk over and when it is liten up at night. lovely view from our hotel of this beautiful structure

Hold onto your hats!. This bridge is architecturally stunning covering such a wide expanse as the Danube. Called the chain bridge as it resembles a bike chain, two lions greet you from either entrance. You can easily walk across in a few minutes and it is totally recommended to fully take in how wide and fast flowing the Danube is. The wind is quite strong as you walk across, so hold onto your hats!
Super views. Ease of access and superb views make this a monument to visit! Make sure to bring your camera along, as the vistas, especially at sunset are magical.

Beautiful. During the day the bridge looks beautiful, but she gets all fancy up at night. The bridge lights up the river and your camera. Nice to get pitcures from both sides, I was able to get one pic with the bridge and the Buda Castle lit up together and one with Fishermans Bastion and Matthias Chuch in the background as well.

Fantastic. In 2001, Hungarian stunt pilot Péter Besenyei flew upside down under the bridge, a maneuver that became a standard in Red Bull air races today. The bridge is featured in the 2002 movie I Spy. Also, in Katy Perry's music video Firework, it is featured at the beginning.The inscription on each side of the bridge is to Clarke Adam, a Hungarian name using Eastern Name Order, one of very few English names that have been placed in that order.A plaque on the Pest side of the river reads "To commemorate the only two surviving bridges designed by Willian Tierney Clarke: The Széchenyi Chain Bridge over the Danube at Budapest and the suspension bridge over the Thames at Marlow, England."

Take a walk across the bridge. My partner and I walked across the bridge when we took our trip last month. It was very romantic and very beautiful. You can see both sides of the Danube and all the beautiful buildings, and they are all lit up at night. Definitely take some time to do this.
Chain Bridge. Definately worth a visit, very impressive and able to walk across into Buda side and back to Pest. Just try to visit on a warm day as the wind blows down the Danube

a beautiful view at night. From the chain bridge you can see both sides, and by night with all the light its beautiful! if you could get a guide og local to tell you all the stories and myths its so much fun!
best at night. very impresive bridge we did not go on to the bridge but saw it from both banks well worth a look especialy at night when it is all lit up
Chain Bridge. Was a nice walk over the bridge and has good photo points. Although it was quite windy when we visited the bridge it was still nice to walk over and see the fine workmanship.
Beautiful bridge. The bridge is impressive and offers beautiful views of Budapest and the Danube. The bridge is especially beautiful when lit up at night.

Lost ??. AS with a lot of Iconic landmarks the Chain Bridge is more of an artery of the city and taken for granted by the locals and indeed tourist who might transit it on a daily basis. This is a major mistake as. as well as its Historic value the design is magnificent .
Wonderfully illuminated at night

Beautiful bridge providing a great view of the Danube. The chain bridge provides a beautiful view of the Danube as it flows through through the center of Budapest. This bridge is especially impressive when lit at night.

History in the making. its another bridge linking Buda and Pest together and never the two will meet fully. People on the Pest side seem to have very little to do with the Bua side and vice versa - However, this particular bridge has histroy on its side and the design and historical value outride the basic facts that is links the two.
Beautiful. The chain bridge is beautiful especially at night when it's illuminated. Watch out for the old lady who is showing her leg to get your money.

Flood lit at night. Fortunately for us our hotel room overlooked the Chain Bridge and at night it was magical. Crossing the bridge takes you to the Palace and the furnicular railway which is good fun and has amazing views.

Chain Bridge. After taking the tram along the Danube you can then cross over the chain bridge which is a lovely bridge and a walk across to the funicular that climbs up to the Buda Palace ruins. Tram number 2 goes along the Buda side of the River Danube. If you are coming from the Buda side walk over the bridge and take the tram to the Parliament Building which is a beautiful building. Well worth a tour. Our own House of parliament and Lords was designed from this building
Beautiful!. Very nice ! ! ! ! ! Especially at night, when there is back-lit!But Danube River little smelled and was dirty.

Engineering at its best. This bridge is a great piece of engineering and looks fantastic especially illuminated at night. Make sure to take a night river cruise to catch it in all its glory. Tip: in order to differentiate it from the other bridges i usually remembered the two lion statues st the end of it!

Nice walk across the bridge at night. At night they really feature this bridge and it is a must see from the far bank. With the rickety tramway trundling across it there is a great sense of the past and granduer of the city here,
Beautiful.... So Beautiful all lit up at night :) and to see all three over the river was just as gorgeous and with the hills and the parliament buildings in the background :)
What a view. Our hotel, The Four Seasons, Gresham Palce, was at the foot of the chain bridge, viewing Castle Hill, the Royal Palace and the Danube, Priceless!
Chain Bridge at Night. Be sure to see the Chain Bridge when it is illuminated at night. We saw it from the dinner cruise boat and it was magnificent!

An absolutely must-see!. We were so impressed by this beautiful and historical bridge that we didn't mind crossing it with every opportunity when strolling next to Danube in Budapest. At night it is even more magnificent! When crossing it, stop and marvel at the architecture and definitely take some photos of it! It is no coincidence that it is a landmark of Budapest!

Feeling of freedom and happiness. Bridges of Budapest are worth seeing! No matter during early morning or daytime or nighttime! Just walking nearby or over one of bridges! One can feel something new in oneself).

The chain bridge. It looks awesome at night . 3 parallel bridges between Buda and Pest . Good to see ! I walked from one side to the other crossing Danube . That was great ! be careful about your wallets !
Beautiful. The Chain Bridge is the most beautiful one of those connecting Buda and Pest. It can be seen almost from everywhere and is a Budapest gem

Another bridge in the city of bridges. Years ago I had driven over it as coach driver and all I can say is that it is a lot busier now. Good history behind the bridge and easily accessible by tram or bus. You will most likely go over this on one of the many city tours.
Illuminating wonder!. Was so beautiful at night over the Danube River- what great architecture! Loved the unique character of Budapest many bridges!

Wobbly!. The bridge is fantastic, especially at night as it is all lit up. It's great for a short walk. I went after each meal at night and it took a good 15 minutes there and back as we were just strolling along enjoying the view. You can see most of the main attractions of Budapest from the bridge. Be careful when a bus goes along though as it wobbles!! Great for photos!
nighrt view is the best. central attraction of budapest,connects buda and pest.most scenic in the night,lovely place to take a walk.
Nice Walk to Castle Hill. A lovely bridge that is the preferred route to Castle Hill and the Buda side. It's also worth seeing at night.
A must do. Great place to take photos, also lots of filming tends to go on around here, Bruce Willis was filming Die Hard while we were there.

Bridge is roaring. Connects the best of Buda with best of pest......The beauty of illuminated bridge has to seen.....Connects the St stephens bassillica to mathias church... we did this walk both day and night and it was simply wonderful....The walk is too good on the bridge and illumination makes it the King of budapest bridges...Keep way for the cyclists though...

Romantic and Beautiful piece of architecture. Romantic and beautiful especially at night, illuminated and outlined with the light bulbs. We crossed it and used the elevator to climb onto the Budim’s castle. From there the view of Bridge, the Presidential and Gresham palaces and the Danube river is great. We loved it!
Take a walk along the beautiful bridge both during the day and at night. No trip to Budapest is complete without a stroll along this gorgeous bridge. The views of Buda and Pest are breathtaking!

When visiting in July..... If you are in Budapest in July, August take a visit to the Chain Bridge in the evening on a Friday, Saturday. The bridge is closed to traffic in the evenings with live music and food being sold.
Great for a walk. It's a great bridge to visit for a night walk around the city. It's stunning when the lights are turned on, and you can see Buda castle from it.

Chain bridge walk. Walked over the bridge Fantastic structure designed in England and built by a Scot. Better to walk over at dusk when the lights go on. Also take the public ferry which goes up and down the Danube and you are able to pass underneath all the bridges. The ferry allows you to see all the bridges with their lights on.

Beautiful bridge. What a beautiful bridge! We enjoyed seeing it from the banks of the Danube, crossing it twice and riding under it by boat at night. Enjoying hearing the history of the bridge as well.

Right outside our Hotel. The Chain Bridge or Lion bridge as I am told it is sometimes called,it has four lions two on either side, was right opposite our hotel (Four Seasons Gresham Palace). A nice place to go for a walk across to the other side, and very pretty lit up at night.
Walk on the bridge!. A walk on the bridge brings one to unforgettable memories and many beautiful photos, day or night. It does get windy, so bring a scarf or something to stay comfortable.
Nice Bridge. Nice bridge. Good to include in one of your walks around the city. It offers some nice views of the city especially at night.

Impressive feat of Engineering.. An iconic looking bridge, situated in a lovely part of Budapest. To get the best view, a trip in the Fernicular, up to the Castle, is required. The cityscape behind/through the bridge is breathtaking!

The Chain Bridge. Crossed over the bridge as part of our walking tour and were given a detailed history by our guide. Really interesting things to relate about the bridges tactical location during WWII

Romantic by nightfall!. We walked along the chain bridge from the Four Seasons (Pest) side across to Castle Hill on the last evening of our stay, and though it was bitterly cold, there was pure romance in the air with the Danube beneath us and the Palace behind us, the whole of Budapest twinkled with the lights and the views of the Parliament and the various churches on the Buda Hills were really good.

Stunning at night time. We walked across the bridge at night time and it was all lit up and looked fantastic. Budapest is a beautiful city and the briges are very impressive, especially when lit up at night time.In the day time it is full of tourists, cyclists and souvineer sellers. Apparently pick pockets work in the area but i didnt experience anything like that.
Photo opp!. Impressive construction, logical placement with practical access to sites. Picuresque night and day with access to walkers and bikers and autos. Fun to watch the boats below.

Stunning. We walked over Chain Bridge numerous times, we really liked the architecture of the bridge and the views of Buda and Pest were brilliant, try and walk over it at night with it all it up its pretty cool.
Monumental. The oldest and the most beautiful bridge in Budapest. It was built by Adam and William Clark. Bridge was destroyed in II World War and rebuilt in 1949.

Best photo spot in Budapest. The bridge is just beautiful. When you take a walk over it or just standing nearby and watching the crowds of people passing by.When it comes to night the brigde is fully illuminated and generates very nice reflections on the danube. Standing on the Pest side is the way better spot because you have the castle hill in the background.

One of the oldest suspension bridges in the world. Although it was tragically blown up during World War2, the Szechenyi or Chain bridge is back to normal, and provides excellent views of the City, both Buda and Pest. Combine it with a tour to the Castle hill, the funicular is at the western end of the bridge. Very popular!

Budapests Eiffel Tower - So much more than just another bridge.. Ok, so it is just a bridge, but it is very special bridge, aesthetically, culturally, economically, for the sheer audacity involved in its design and construction, and of course, for its location at the heart of a particularly fetching vista.It may not at first seem that impressive, so when you walk across it, and you 'must' walk, take the time to appreciate just how ground breaking its design was in the middle of the 19th century. Marvel at how the road, the traffic, the pavements... everything, is quite literally hanging from those outsized bicycle chains. If you're still not impressed, then perhaps you should consider how Tierney Clarkes design, completed only 10 years after Stephensons Rocket won the Rainhill trials and led to the worlds first railway, called for the whole bridge was transported from Britain in bits. This bridge is a marvel, maybe not as technically impressive as the combined suspension and bascules of London's Tower Bridge, or as imposing as the Sydney Harbour Bridge, but you must consider that it predates Tower Bridge by 40 years, and Sydney's bridge by almost 90 years. Given the speed of developments of the industrial revolution, it's a different era, the gap between them as distinct in technological advancement as that between the Sony Walkman and the iPod.It's a work of art, an engineering marvel, and a useful transport link, and what's more there's never a queue to see it and it's free. What more can you ask for?

Adds personality to the city and its night time river view. It is a bridge that lights up at night. So I enjoy it much better at dusk than day. I'd say it is 1 of the icon of the city, A must to drive through to get from Pest to Buda and vice versa.
Memorable. Easy to walk across. Well worth it. Make sure you do this while you are in Budapest. Most of the walking tours will take you across it anyway.

At it's best at night. At night this bridge is lit up and is beautiful both from a distance and close up. It is right oposite the Four Seasons Hotel and is the most central of the bridges in Budapest.
iconic. a great start to our visit in the freezing cold late evening to find this landmark lit up and overlook the Danube....we had no expectations and if we secretly had they were surpassed
Really nice bridge. Really nice bridge connecting Buda and Pest which are separated by the Danube River, it is a great place for taking panoramic pictures of the city.

The link between Buda and Pest. There are many bridges over the Danube but this is probably the most used. It is near to the funicular train that takes you up to the Castle area and the number 16 bus uses this to take you from Buda to Pest on a regular basis.

The biggest bicycle chain. Likes: It was the biggest bicycle looking chain that I have ever seen. I find it hard to believe that they could build a link that big. A very impressive site and beautiful bridge.
Dislike: Didn't cross the bridge enough times.
Nice bridge. Nice bridge and very easy to walk. Try to pass it also during evening to enjoy the city's both sides in lights.
Very beautiful. Worth visiting, best view will be from top, near the castle. Bridge is good for night photography, especially good for long exposure shots with Parliament in background.

View it at night by the Buda Castle. It is best to appreciate the bridge at night from across the river, specifically from the Buda castle. You can get great pictures as soon as the lights go on and the sky is still a bit blue.

The ever gorgeous Lanchid!. One of the most beautiful sights in beautiful Budapest. You'll love the lighting at night!
It is a very nice walk to cross the bridge. If you're staying at any of the hotels on either side of the Danube, it is a must!
Picturesque. Worth seeing from the Gallerth Hill. The bridge is magnificent and also great view at night. Recommended for photographers!
Good views!. A lovely bridge, and a good link to the funicular that takes you up to the palace. Great views of the Budapest skyline too!
Beautiful. Very beautiful. Especially by the night with the lights. It's also good experience to stay on it and look to ther river

Beautiful bridge - point of reference. Having stayed only 3 days in Budapest, I didn't have time to familiarize myself with all the different bridges across the Danube, but one does not mistake the Chain Bridge for any other! Instantly gave us a point of reference. Beautiful at night and I also really liked the lion statues at the bridge entrances, as if guarding the passage.
Worth the walk over. There are some decent views from the bridge but there is also some history to this bridge which the tour guide informed us of.
Great walk. Take your time and enjoy its beauty. I love Budapest and this bridge only enhances the cities beauty. Snow was cleared off and the walk was easy.
Lovely bridge. A nice stroll over this old bridge and it kept the wind off you unlike the Elizabeth bridge nearby where you were cut in two by the cold

Awesome everytime we walked it. This is a bridge worth walking over. We tend to walk everywhere so we had multiple opportunities to cross this bridge. It is ornate, easy to cross, and the views are pretty nice. Don't take a taxi or bus over this one.
its a bridge !!!!!!. It is only a bridge but the history associated with it is remarkable. Perfect for photos with the town of Buda behind it

beautiful bridge. Go to the bridge and look around. The view at Buda and Pest, Parliament. It is a good place to take pictures. The bridge brings you to cable car and in 5 min you are in Buda Hill. Very convenient.

Nice views. Having been in other cities in Eastern Europe this one is not as nice as some of the others. It would have been better if it was a Pedestrian Bridge. It was very noisy and not very secure for people that have small children. The view from the bridge was nice though and we got some good pictures. It would have been better if it had not been so foggy.

It's just a bridge. The Chain Bridge is just a bridge. I'm aware that it has some significance being the first bridge to link both sides of the Danube but it's not something to go out of your way to see (in my opinion). It's not remotely comparable to the Tower Bridge in London, the Harbour Bridge in Sydney or even the Charles Bridge in Prague. It's just an average looking bridge, fine to walk across but not to go out of your way to see.

Enjoying History. We enjoyed our first-hand walk on the iconic bridge of Budapest, taken back in history to the early days when the building of bridges actually changed the course of history. Imagine the significance of spanning the Danube, for the first time connecting Buda and Pest. And we saw first-hand the monumental buildings bordering both sides of the the river. A sight not to be missed.
beautiful. So may pictures of this iconic landmark. We followed Michael Portiloes advice and took the best pictures when on our ride on the funicular , located on the Buda side of the bridge

Misty views. We had hoped for grand views of the Parliament buildings, castles and everything else that this location offers. Alas the misty wet weather of mid December thwarted us, but it was still a wonderful walk from Liberty Bridge to Chain Bridge and back along the Danube.

Sparkle in the night, beautifull at day as well. Newly renovated it's looking like in glorious days, amaising and imposing! Don't forget to take pictures with the lions on the end of the bridge, visit it at night as well - it's worth!

one of the images of the city. The people are so proud of this bridge as well they should be. The fact that Effil (the builder of the tower in Paris) was involved in its erection certainly lends credibility to its excellence

Er.....it's a Bridge!. An interesting one but it is still just a bridge. I know the history (Sheffield steel, British engineering, British project management etc - all of this was explained to me by a brilliantly eccentic violin busking Hungarian atop the furniulcar railway once he'd discovered my nationality) but once you've trekked across town to see it you are left wondering why? Well, in the interest of balance I suppose I should say that the view up and down the river is good.
Nice walk across this bridge. This is a landmark in Budapest and worth a walk across to view the other bridges and the city itself.
Its a bridge. We walked across this a few times to cross the river. It is definitely amazing engineering, but I would not walk out of my way to see it especially.
On the check list. A must do whilst site seeing. Not as impressive as london or broklyn bridge. Gave nice views, but heavy and congested traffic takes away its shine.
Chain Bridge. Lovely bridge offering nice views over the river. It's very windy on the bridge so dress up warm! This bridge takes you from Pest to Buda.
Very pretty at night. You get good views of each side from the bridge. Safe to walk on. Cold when windy. Funicular right at one end so easy to get to castle district.
ONE OF THE BEST BRIDGES IN THE WORLD. Chain bridge is one of the best bridges in the world . Budapest's icon . Golden nicklace around the neck of the danube river .

Where are the Chains?. Any of the bridges over the Danube are an easy walk; the Chain Bridge (no chains that I could see - just rivetted metal) takes you right to the Funicular to visit the Royal Palace area.
An Awsume Sight at Night!. Absolutely stunning at night, well worth looking at it. Take your photo just at dusk and look for the reflection in the river.
A walk over the chain bridge. An interesting walk, though not sure about the Beggars, a bit intimidating. Also it wobbles!! Lovely views up and down the Danube

Of course at least once cross the Danube river via this bridge. Walking across it, taking the night cruise the pass underneath, walking the boulevard of Danube river to catch a glimpse or admire it from above at the Fishermen's Bastion. The story why this bridge was built is great as well ( a count who was in Pest when his father died in Buda. He couldn't reach his father, since the Danube was frozen and ferries weren't crossing. He decided it was time for a bridge).A typical image of this beautiful city, so don't miss it.

Walk through the bridge !. This bridge is amazing, creates very special atmosphere both during day and night. You definitely won't miss it while being in Budapest, but don't take any transpport to see it, just walk through the bridge! You have best views on it from Castle Hill
Spectacular Chain Bridge. The Chain Bridge was so picturesque....we loved walking across it and enjoying the many photo opportunities - it is absolutely spectacular!
Beautiful Bridge. The bridge is so beautiful with the massive lions at the entrance. You really need to park at the nearby park and walk to it for a beautiful photo shot.
The most beautiful bridge of Budapest. Cross it, and enjoy the view of the city, then walk up to the Castle District, and enjoy it even more!

Was that the Brooklyn Bridge?. No, of course not. This bridge on the (Blue?) Danube may remind some of Brooklyn, but it's clearly not. One side Buda, other side Pest. Little did we know the separateness of each side. Bridge.looks great both day and night - illuminated, as is the whote of B/P in the evenings.
It's a Bridge. Use this to walk from Pest to Buda (or vice versa) takes you to the foot of the castle, where you can view great sights across the Danube.
Fresh Air. It was nice to walk over the bridge and see both landscapes of Buda and Pest. You can see Parliament and other attractions from the bridge

Breathtaking Views. Walking from one side to the other of the city using this bridge is a must do. If the day is clear you can see miles down the Danube. Either the views of either side are spectacular and worth it even if it's cold.
Lovely bridge. Walking across this bridge at night was one of my favorite memories in Budapest. The sculptures on the bridge are magnificient and it is nice to walk across the Danube.

Old time classic wonder. Walk on it and let the cold winter breeze wisper to you. I think it is the oldest chain bridge in Europe together with St.Stefan bridge in Prague!? I could be mistaken but still its worth walking on it. Step in the midle of it , close your eyes and listen to the old might Danube.....
Must see at night. Would suggest a walk over + a view from Royal castle. If you are a photographer - do not forget your tripod, will get a few excellent pics for your collection.

Best at night. When lit at night, the Chain Bridge is very beautiful. And, if you have the opportunity to walk across it, do so. It is not a long walk, but you have great photo opportunities. If you are on the Pest side of the Danube, you might consider walking across the bridge and then take the 'vehicular' to the top of the Buda hill...........(this is a "rail 'tram' that takes you up the incline.)
Bridge walk. This is the bridge that leads to the Buda castle and we crossed this several times. Its a very busy bridge and looks stunning when lit up in the evening.

Very pretty bridge. Take a walk over one of the other bridges to get some photo ops of this bridge and then come back over this bridge. The bridge is very pretty and has some tales that go with it regarding the designer. The lions on it are cool.
the famous bridge. i liked a lot the story with the locks on the bridge,the lovers lock a locker on the bridge so the lock their love also.very romantic,

beautiful bridge the beautiful Danube. Budha is on one side with the fantastic Castle hill where you can find Budha castle ,Fishermen' bastion and St Mathias church ( all the district is Unesco Heritage site. ) and Pest is on the other with the fantastic Gresham Palace and the amazing Parliament and of course the Danubein between.It was destroyed during II ww and rebuilt in 1949 .IT' a must to do in Budapest especially for the views but because is also a symbol of this extremely beautiful city.
A road bridge. The chain bridge is the first permanent bridge linking Buda and Pest. Histroically significant but today looks just like an average road bridge. Nice when lit up at night, though.
A must do photo-op in Budapest!. You'll be hard pressed to find more beautiful views than those both of this bridge, and taken of other sites from this bridge. Chain Bridge IS Budapest!
Nothing special. Ok, it's a bridge across the Danube. Offers interesting views of Buda, but nothing to get excited about in itself.
Scottish engineering. Spectacular 'Victorian' chain bridge built by Adam Clark - walk across to cog railway.Great views of Parliament building.
Historic beauty!. Other than is gorgeous design and beauty (it is lit up at night), you can easily walk across the Danube River!
Amazing bridge. It was build loong time ago so people from Buda side could go work in Pest side. Its amazing work by an Irish artitecht.

The chain bridge. I took a tour while in Budapest and found out that someone (sorry forgotten the name) who lived in Buda wanted to go and see his sick father in Vienna but the river had frozen, by the time he got to his dad he had died to decided to build a bridge and hired. Scottish man and bought iron from London and built the chain bridge
nice architecture. we walked along the Chain bridge several times, and there are great photos to be taken along this impressive link between Buda and Pest
Nice bridge.. Its a nice bridge and part of the iconic view of the city in pictures but apart form that it really is nothing to get over excited about.

Another Bridge. The chain bridge is a big thing in Budapest, being the first permanent bridge, replacing an earlier pontoon bridge, taken away each winter because of ice on the river. It looks quite solid and substantial, but in the end is now just another busy river crossing ( expect some days in the summer when it becomes traffic free).
Very Beautiful. Lovely Lions keep watch at this bridge. Beautiful architecture. We saw this from the bus and close up when we crossed it at night. Nice walking area. No fear of traffic.

Beautiful at night. We crossed this daily and nightly, it looks magical at night when the bridge is lit up. Mind the bikes when crossing though, many users do not use their bells to warn they are coming.

walk by yourself!. Don't just take pictures from the banks! You have to walk along the bridge by yourself! Its so relaxing, refreshing and heartful feel during walk along this great bridge! Especially walking from Buda to Pest, walk towards the Gresham Palace. Its an amazing feel! Impressed with the design and the carvings.

The most beautiful old bridge in the world. I visited it almost every day. I loved it best at sunset! It is beautiful to walk across any time! I loved the lions at the end. They say when it rains they push it into the tunnel! :-)

Beautiful!. A very nice place for a stroll, day or night. From the bridge you can see the Parliament and Buda Castle among the other magnificent buildings. In the summer, the bridge is sporadically closed to traffic and hosts many festivals. On the weekends, vendors pop up and sell their wares. If you visit the terror museum, look for the video that shows the bridge when it was blown up and sunk by the Nazis. The man who built the bridge, Adam Clark is also responsible for the tunnel on the Buda side. Legend has it (untrue of course) that people found fault with the bridge as the lions have no tongues...hearing this he was so ashamed that he jumped from the bridge and died!
Brilliant engineering. This bridge deserves a walk over. The views of the Parliament buiding are brilliant. Go when it is lit up at night, the atmosphere is great.
a must see landmark. a great landmark, that's a must see when you are visiting budapest. this suspension bridge connects the two parts of budapest, on the opposite sides of the danube river
Amazing architecture. Walked across the Chain Bridge which is really nice to the Buda side, we also saw it from a boat tour and at the top of the castle. Really nice bridge with great architecture!

My favourite Budapest Bridge. Beautiful bridge, especialy at night with the special lighting. Offers good views of the city and can be quite romantic (for a bridge). Amazing to know it was destroyed in the war, but has been restored brilliantly.
Budapest Landmark. Connecting Pest with Buda Chain Bridge is the famous one of the eight bridges in the city. So beautiful.
What a picture. Great looking Bridge built by a Scotsman, best seen at night all lit up. Walked across it, drove acoss it and sailed under it!
What a Great English Invention. Beautiful Bridge day and night, very busy connecting BUDA TO PEST. Spanning the wonderful throbbing Danube.
Just a bridge. No its not. Walk it in the day time and at night its a special place to be. Its the heart of Budapest.

Beautiful at night. Looks more spectacular at night when lit up by thousands of lights which reflect in the river.
Worth walking across - lovely views up and down the river.
Interestingly - after it was blown up in the war it was redesigned by the same person who designed the Bridge at Marlow, England!
Great walk over the Danube. Pretty views of both banksides of the Danube. Well worth walking up one side and returning down the other later in the day.

Nice walk. Have a nice walk down to the Chail bridge, built Bharat British engineer, and cross then down the other bank to the Liberty bridge equally attractive. It's a trip worth doing both during the day and at night, probably best after dark.
Nice view. The Chain bridge was an easy, pleasant and safe walk from the city of Pest to the city of Buda. It was also CLEAN unlike many walking bridges. Great for pics!

Beautiful at night. Reconstructed bridge of that destroyed in WWII - it is lit up with fairy lights at night and makes for a beautiful sight and great photo op. We walked across the bridge during the day and once at night.
Beautiful bridge. A must see. It connects Pest with Buda and it's great to see the city from both sides. It looks amazing at night.

View from Above and Below. Beautiful structure. Road a bus and took a boat ride under the bridge. Both venues give a perfect portrayal of the entire hid. Stood by area that the movie "The Music Box" had its' revealing and climactic scene.
Walk it!. This is a beautiful, historic bridge connecting Buda with Pest. The views from the bridge, the smell of the Danube carried along by the gentle breeze makes this a "must" bridge to walk.

Beautiful at night. Stand in the middle of the bridge to take in views of both sides of the city. This bridge looks fab at night! At the Terror museum there's some striking photos of the bridge half laying in the Danube after being bombed during the War. It's amazing how beautifully this city has recovered from such a terrible period in history
Linking chains. A most beautifull bridge from all in Budapest. Walk across it, reach the old Buda town and imagine the history.Feel the connection between the hills and plains.
Beautiful. It was beautiful to see at various angles and in both daylight and at night. Never really thought much about bridges, but this one is nice.
Interesting. The chain bridge links Buda and Pest. We walked over a couple of times and enjoyed the experience. It can be crowded so watch your valuables.

Nice views. This suspension bridge was built in the 19th century across the river Danube between Pest and Buda, at the time still separate cities. I didn't find anything spectacular on it except the lovely views from it. It takes about 10 minutes walk to cross the bridge.

pessoal. The Chain Bridge is one of Budapest's most famous landmarks. The magnificent suspension bridge was built in the 19th century across the river Danube to connect Pest with Buda, at the time still separate cities.
You most cross the bridge by foot from Buda to Pest.... Yo´`ll never forget it.

Beautiful both Day & Night time. Take a walk across the Danube! then ride the funicular to the top of Buda Castle,, Remember your ticket is a one way ticket. BUT if you have a Hop on Hop off ticket catch it and ride back down if you like....

Great lights at night. This bridge is a very nice looking bridge, however it merges in with the greyness of the whole town until it is lit up at night. This bridge really sparkles at night and it is worth walking along the Buda side of the river walking so that both the Chain Bridge and Parliament are in view with all of their sparkling glory. Definitely the highlight of our trip. Night views are amazing.
Chain Bridge. This is an impressive bridge that you can walk across to the castle and other sights. It has beautiful stone lions and the view is great. Walk over then take the funicular up to castle.
The lions and their tongue. It is a really good walk along the bridge especially during the sunset. At the end of the bridge is the funicular up to the castle hill.

Erm, bridge review??. Well, Tripadvisor, as a bridge it successfully links Buda and Pest. It didn't collapse and looks good. Whether that makes it a great bridge or an average one is up to the viewers expectations. Flags are nice...
A great city view!. If the weather is nice, a stroll across ome or more of the city's historic, re-built bridges offers ome of the very best ways to see and enjoy both Budapest and Pest.

The bridge that you have to cross by foot. if you come to budapest is mandatory that you cross Danube by foot in this bridge, it's a very pretty bridge and the best way to get in Buda side. It's really the "Chain" bridge because really connects the old Buda city to the New Pest city.

Nothing Special. Just an average bridge, the only point in its favour was the age. During day time it looks ordinary and at night, the lights provide some illumination, but it is more overrated as an attraction
Beautiful. Beautiful bridge to walk over it, at night time you will get some lovely picturees of both it and the city and a view up to the castle,
Great bridge. It was built by a scotsman and was first of its kind in Europe.The locals say that the reason there is a tunnel is so that they could push the bridge into the hillside.
Beautiful. We enjoyed looking at this from the edge of the Danube, as well as walking over it at day and night, and then taking pictures of it when it was lit up at Sunset. Worth seeing every time.

amazing. and historic. Takes you from Pest to Buda, where the castle is. Beautiful when lit at night. Be sure to look to the right, on the Pest side, to see the empty shoes memorial to Jews who were shot on the banks of the Danube for the convenience of their executioners, who let them fall into the river rather than having to bury them.

An interesting bridge. This is an interesting piece of 19th Century engineering across the Danube. There are great views of the city and the river. However, it is a car bridge so you just walk on the side of the bridge. Looks real good at night.
Beautiful 19th century bridge over the Danube. A great place to walk on and look at the river. Even better is to catch it lit up at night framed by the castle and the bridge. Best seen from Pset.
Historic with good views. Enjoyed our walk over this lovely historic bridge offering fantastic views over the Danube. Looks beautiful lit up at night too
Very interesting. It was great to walk the bridge and after visiting Prague, it was interesting to see the similarities between the two cities.

Chain Bridge, Budapest. Just walk the bridge, you'll learn why. The scenic views of both the Pest and Buda sides (crossing the Danube River) of Budapest are amazing! If for nothing else, cross the Chain Bridge to witness the reactions of others as they cross the bridge.

Hard to avoid. It's one of the must see things of Budapest. Beside that it is hard to avoid. It's nice but not the most impressive one in his kind I've seen (London Tower, Brooklyn Bridge). I would recommend to visit at night-time because of the lights. If you want to visit the castle you have to cross it anyway.

Pissy, but I am an engineer. This is not a chain bridge it is a link bridge. Anyone who has ever seen a chain knows that I am correct. It is also a suspension bridge but asking travelers to note that is too much to ask. Still a nice walk just get the nomenclature correct.I also noticed something underneath when we took a tour on the Danube but I have forgotten what that was, one must take notes.
It's a bridge. Chain bridge does look lovely at night when lit up, but it really is just a bridge. It is nice to walk across as it links Buda with pest or you can take the tram across.
Walk the bridge. We walked from Buda to Pest over the Chain Bridge which was lovely. The lions at each end are there to guard.
Lovely Bridge. We travelled over using the bus and saw the beautiful sights from this Bridge. Well constructed and had a lot of history connecting the Buda and Pest sides.

Not a Pedestrian only Bridge. After Prague, the chain bridge was not in the same class as a tourist attraction. The bus loop is at the bottom of the Castle Hill so it was a welcome sight at the end of the day.
Lovely views. Easy to find from where we stayed and a ideal link between the two sides ! The lions are very impressive as you start your walk across
City's main landmark. Old beatifull bridge binding Pest and Budda side. Very frequent by cars and walkers in the evening time.

Chain Bridge. The Chain Bridge is a lovely way to cross the Danube. It links Buda (cultural) and Pest (more modern area with shops, restaurants and hotels) – it is located near to the Castle and is worth taking time to look over the river as you cross it. Nice views of both sides of the river. Nice walk across the river especially at night with the lights
Nice at night. You can cross the bridge by car, public transport, on foot and by bike. The Freedombridge looked as nice as the chainbridge.

Széchenyi Lánchíd -Chain Bridge. Most beautiful bridge in Budapest. Pleasure it is to go on foot, connects Buda and Pest on the most attractive places. Chain Bridge (Széchenyi Lánchíd) is one of Budapest's most recognizable symbols, and also the first permanent bridge between Buda and Pest. Specifically, the two main parts of today's Hungarian city for centuries been associated only pontoon bridge.The story of the origin of the idea for the construction of the Chain Bridge is a bit unusual. Conceived the idea, and will later show and one that is spent in work, Count István Széchenyi, he learned that his father had died in Vienna. Given that this happened in December, the winter was severe and the bridge was closed. It is a protracted departure for whole week and the count has promised to build a permanent bridge, no matter the cost.The works were started 22 years later, 1842nd, and lasted for seven years. The bridge is in some way contributed Buda and Pest, to which he finally came 1873rd year. He also was a symbol of the strengthening of the city, its growth, both in size and power. Budapest has entered its second golden age - the age of the cultural, economic and intellectual prosperity! The bridge is especially beautiful at night when the lights shine down the entire length of it, and the Danube becomes large mirror in which to see the outline of one of the most beautiful European bridges!
Impressive. The Chain Bridge is impressive during the daytime but even more spectacular in the evening when it is all lit up. Lots of photo opportunities!
Lovely bridge to visit. One of the highlights of Budapest is the different types of bridges across the Danube.This bridge reminds me of Brooklyn bridge in New York beautiful.

Buda + Pest. Stretching across the Blue Danube is one of Budapest's and Europe's most famous landmarks, "The Chain Bridge" linking the former Cities of Buda and Pest with Buda being the north side with the hills. Today it is one of the city's busiest traffic arteries. Yes you can walk across the bridge ( be careful of the entranceways which are some distance but on the bridge you will see many of the landmarks of this great city. Take the bridge after dark, Budapest is all lite up at night truly making "a City of Lights" and the "Paris of Central Europe". . Hard to miss and easy to enjoy. Bring your camera.
Chain Bridge Stroll. Nice to walk across and check the views from both sides of the river in the daytime and at night. Too crowded to really enjoy.

Wow. Picture perfect creation.Don't take a taxi...just walk along Vaci utca and Vorosmarty ter, from there you reach the chain brige which crosses the Danube and a prefect the get to the Buda side +the bottom of the castle district.
narrow bridge lots of foot/pedestrian traffic. I enjoyed walking the bridge - watching the boat traffic looking at the buildings on the banks edge, however watch for the bikes...
Take a walk across the chain bridge. The bridge is gorgeous and take sless than 10 mins to cross. If you up up early it can be cool so rug up. Great views from the bridge.

Chain of command. We must have crossed this bridge fifty times while we were in Budapest. Each time it was exciting, especially as you approach the arches on either side. We had read about the bridge before hand and our grandchildren loved the name of it.
Beautiful.. What a beautiful bridge. Went managed to see it being lit up, goes green for 60 seconds then white bulbs stay on, one not to be missed..
Did what it said on the tin. It was a safe bridge to cross the river Danube. What else can I say? Nice views of both sides of the river

A 'must see' after darkness. A nice walk across the bridge although watch out for cyclists; they really do ride fast along the footway. Sadly the bridge is suffering from corrosion and badly needs a 'lick of paint'. However the lighting transforms the whole place at night-time when the bridge becomes a major attraction. A pleasant walk but make the effort to see it at night.

Chain Bridge. Beautiful bridge linking Buda (cultural) and Pest (more modern area with shops and restaurants and hotels) - crosses the Danube near to the Castle. Lion statues on both sides of the bridge. Danube is about twice the width of the Thames. Nice walk across the river especially at night with the lights

Best at night. The Chain Bridge is a lovely way to cross the Danube and is worth taking time to look over the river as you cross it. To see it at it's best you should go after dark and climb the hill to the Royal Palace where you get a superb panorama over the city. The climb looks worse than it is and the views you are rewarded with will make it worth every step

Better than Prague and the Charles. A truly beautiful landmark of Budapest as pretty as the Charles in Prague but without the hawkers, tourist and vendors. Beautiful sights at both ends and absolutely breathtaking at night.
Amazing walk. Walking across this bridge and seeing the two sides of the city was just amazing. The walk is not long but just overwhelming looking out over the Danube.
Interesting architecture. It is more spectacular at night. We liked that is used only for pedestrians so we had time to enjoy the view of the river.
not bad. nothing spectacular but very pretty at night as its covered in lots of lights. It's no Charles Bridge in Prague, but it's still a pretty historical bridge all the same.

Chain Bridge. We were on a river cruise that ended in Budapest (on the Pest side) and had the opportunity to use a walking guide to go over to the Buda side, and Castle Hill. Crossing the Chain Bridge was interesting. It is heavily used by cars, pedestrians and bikes, but the pedestrians and bicyle riders are in an area seperated safely from drivers, so the only hazard for a walker is the bikes! It is a long bridge, but a beautiful view of the Royal Castle, the funicular to go to the Castle area and the Danube make it fun to cross. On either side, you can walk along the Danube and cross under the start of the bridge, which makes it much easier to traverse the shore as you don't have to climb stairs up to the bridge and then down again.....

Majestic and Romantic. Our hotel room looked over the Chain Bridge and it looked esepcially beautiful at night, all lit up! It was like the proverbial phoenix rising out of the ash after it was destroyed during the war. We walked the bridge a couple of times - both during the day and night.

Spectacular bridge. One of Budapest's many bridges connecting the Buda and Pest sides. This one is special because of its lightning, especially during the night. Not only to walk on it is special, but also to walk by it and even to see it from a distance. It leaves a really special character to the city.
A nice walk to the other side. Definitely the best bridge for a walk to the other side. Nice views are promised and the bridge itself is a nice piece of history. Recommended!
great walk. Walk accross this famous Bridge and take the ride on the lift up to the Buda Hill. You can walk to the Fishemans Bastion or go to the Buda Castle...a treat.
Better at night. You see chain bridge on a tour bus or if you are staying close by. i dont think its anything amazing but its nice to look at at night when the lights are on

Go to the Pest bank of the bridge. You will be pleasantly surprised that there are seats - made from pallets, ideal for two people to share. As it was sunny when we went, we had aN excellent time there - except I can only find a CBA (Budapest's equivalent of Tesco) for a beer after a long walk. There is one to the left hand side of the Bacillica!
to the other side. there are many bridges to the other side but its worth a visit. brilliant views. try also a visit to buda castle. while we were crossing it budapest marathon was on.
Chain Bridge Budapest.. This is the most amazing bridge. It devides Buda and Pest. The Danube flows quietly underneath. Watch it lit up at nighttime. You wont want to leave. Truely beautiful.

Beautiful views and beautiful bridge!. We walked over this bridge and it was stunning. The views from it are breath taking. The walk is a lot shorter than you might think orginally-at least for me. The whole city is great for walking. But the metro and bus system is easy to understand.

Easy. When we saw traffic passing over the bridge we were slightly concerned about the safety of crossing the bridge by foot. No problem! There is a strong metal barrier between the traffic and pedestrians so walking across was easy.
One of many bridges. There are quite afew bridges over the Danube a couple are very pretty and ornate, They put the bridges we have over here to shame.

Amazing bridge at night. It is a view worth million Dollar. it is nice and beautiful place to visit :) or it is better to say that it is a must to visit while you are in Budapest. you should never miss

Nice view of the city from the middle of the river. The chain bridge is a popular way for pedestrians and cyclists to cross the river...pedestrians should take care to watch for cyclists however as it is a popular crossing point and can get busy.
The night views of both the Buda and Pest sides are wonderful and shouldn't be missed.

the bridge across the Danube. We walked across the bridge as part of our walking tour. The traffic going back and forth took the romance out of crossing the Danube but it was fun nonetheless. Make sure to take a camera!

amazing view. in fact just walking down the promenade by the bridges the entire view is worth my flight over!!!
lots of platform areas for you to take photos as well!!!
Piece of History. We crossed this bridge several times and were always amazed at its beauty and history. It adds charm to your Budapest visit.

Great for photographers. Great views and angles from both sides of the bridge.
If you are shooting pics beware of the 'shake' caused by heavy traffic. A tripod of monopod is helpful.
It's still just a bridge.... It was nice to walk across the Danube and the effort was worth it. But in the end it is still just a bridge...
trafic. Sometimes it is so scarry with that so many people, I am not used to a big city like this, but the bridge itselfe is beautifull.
Fabulous to see this at night. We arrived on the river at night, amazing light show - well worth coming out at night to see and photograph
big green bridge. nice historic structure, design by a Brit ( i think )worth a walk and some good photo opportunities . Interesting if you are into that sort of thing
Just a landmark of the city. The bridge connecting Buda and Pest. Nothing extraordinary, but a landmark of Budapest, so try to cross it at least once..

Traffic ruins the potential. The bridge is fine but ruined by traffic. Should be a literal centre piece for walkers and bikes. Take the traffic off and you might get a Charles Bridge / Ponte Vecchio effect.
Distinctive bridge over the Danube. The bridge looks good both in daylight and in the evening with ample photo opportunities. The lions remind you of England.

Walk across it for the best experience!. We walked from the Fisherman's Bastion down to the Buda Castle, and then down past the funicular through the winding pathways to the bottom to the Buda Hill, then walked across the Chain Bridge and on to Vaci Street for a pastry at Gerbaud. This is the real Budapest!
beautiful. to appreciate this bridge in all its beauty you need to it all lite up at night it is fantastic ,you can walk across and is danude in all its splendour

Cross the Danube here!. An excellent location for photos of Buda and Pest. Centrally located, linking some of the most popular sights on each side, so you won't have to go out of your way to cross here. Free, of course.
I would recommend going once in the day and once at night, as it is lit up beautifully.

A beautiful bridge!. Our hotel was situated on the Buda side of the Danube and was very near to the Chain Bridge so we used this bridge a lot to get from one side of the river to another.The Chain Bridge is beautiful with great lion statues at the entrance and exit of the bridge. It is good to view from the Danube itself on the boat tours!
busy bridge linking Buda and Pest. Walking the chain bridge is an experience both during the day and in the evening. You have great opportunities for amazing pictures on the bridge and of the bridge.
Worth the exercise.. We walked over the Chain Bridge one sunny morning and thoroughly enjoyed it. It is certainly a unique design with lots of detail. Can't visit Budapest without doing this
A good walk. We walked the Chain Bridge heading to and from the Wine Festival. It was really fun and got some great shots of Buda and Pest.

The Bridge That Ties the City. This has to be one of the greatest engineering designs of it's time. No matter when you view this bridge day or night it is magnificent. To walk this bridge from oneside of the city to the other makes you realize it is one wonderful city.
Great views, romantic or just great exercise. Great views, and lovely architecture, the bridge links the Buda part leading to Castle Hill to Pest. Just be aware of a few beggars.

Impressive bridge. You will see this bridge several times when you are there. No easy to avoid it. For an engineer, it is quite a design. It is well lit at night, one of the highlights on the evening river cruise.
Beautiful. The chain bridge is not the beautifullest place in Budapest but you can't leave Budapest without a night walk on the Danube looking at the Chain bridge

Romantic walk across the Danube.. We make a point to walk across this bridge every time we visit Budapest. On certain holidays, it is closed to traffic and lined with vendors. Either way, we always enjoy it.

beautiful bridge to take a walk. Another famous Budapest Landmark. Walking along the bridge at night gives you an outstanding view of the Buda hill side with churches and Castles. The bridge at night is nicely luminated with many photo opportunities.
Engineering wonder. This is the most fantastic piece of engineering, even someone who knows nothing about is would be amazed considering how long ago it was built

A beautiful bridge over the Danube River. This old decorative bridge provides a delightful walk over the Danube to connect Buda and Pest. A work of art as well as a convenient way to visit both sides!
Great view.... of Buda and Pest. Enjoyed the walk across the bridge. Be sure not to pass up this experience, especially on a nice sunny day.
Takes your breath. When we turned the corner and the lights of the bridge came into view it will take your breath...Just a beautiful bridge...Just in front of the Gresham Palace Hotel
Lions and Lore. Spanning the Danube and connecting Buda and Pest, who can resist a bridge with majestic lions standing guard and the lore of the architect's mistake?

Unless your from central Africa, not much of an attraction. It is after all, just a bridge. It isn't exactly the Milau viaduct. Footpath on either side of the bridge,but be warned there are many tourists on bicycles racing up and down

VERY busy. Don't expect a traffic-free bridge this is a main thoroughfare and not all that stunning - except at night that is - so view from the Buda side of the river when you can get the Orszaghaz parliament building in the shot as well. This building is amazing day or night.

Pretty to look at but a dirty walk across the bridge. I thought it was going to be a nice stroll across the bridge but it was a small walkway, lots a car fumes, and the railing has big openings that made the walk really scary with my 2 and 5 year old. It is better to take a picture from a distance but I don't think walking it is worth it. Besides one side of the bridge has nothing to offer however the opposite side brings you to the bottom of the fanicular to the Castle District.

The bridge is beautiful. It is so romantic to walk across the bridge at night and view all of the beautiful monuments all lit up. Truly magical. You can even get a bottle of wine, hop up on the platforms of the bridges and take it all in. There were several couples doing just that.
Beautiful. This is the major bridge from the Buda to the Pest side of the Danube river. MIt is beautiful to walk on or drive over at night. It is centrally located.

A bridge is a bridge. I would not class this as a visitor attraction, but the main bridge to get you across the river. Is a stunning bridge to look at, and no doubt a feat of engineering, and very decorative, but at the end of the day it is just a bridge ?! Can walk or drive to cross the Danube to get to the castel.
A bit disapointing. Just a plain bridge nothing special, all the bridges do look a bit better when lit up at night. Worth looking at at night but by day time a bit boring.
View from the bridge.. This stunning old bridge afforded some of the best views in the city. This was a great place to take photographs from.

Breathtaking by night. The bridge is really breathtaking when it's all lighted up in the night. It's spectacular! Especially recommended to be walked in to couples visiting Budapest... and to anyone who would keep a romantic souvenir of the town in his/her mind.

Beautiful views but a sad history. This bridge is stunning at night time. If you walk under it either side, the views are so spectacular. It is the ideal spot to take some seriously good photos as you have almost all of the main buildings and attractions lite up on both Buda and Pest . The sad side of it though is the shoes lined up along the walkway, a perminant reminder of Hungarys past during the 2nd world war when so many hungarian jews were lined up, tied together and pushed into the Danube to theyre death.
Shame about the traffic. A lovely bridge but spoiled by the traffic of modern day life. Would be much nicer if pedestrianised like Charles Bridge in Prague.
Bridge across Danube. This is one of 7 bridges across the Danube in Budapest. Well maintained; you can walk across it or take public transit. Lots of history associated with it.

Walk across it. As my friend rode across this numerous times on a bus, she was reluctant to join me for a walk across. However, she was glad she did and so was I. You just get different views walking across it both of the bridge and the area around it. It doesn't take long, so even if you have driven across it, take the extra time for one walk.

A pleasant walk across the Chain Bridge. We enjoyed walking across the Chain Bridge. Great views from both sides. Particularly lucky to participate in our first "flashmob" entitled Genfest 2012 Let's Bridge. What a party!
nice. was great to see always heard much about it but when i saw it ,it was nice but nothing amazing stood out to me ,maybe i was missing the point.

Ordinary bridge in the day but very nice at night. It is a nice historic bridge with a good Danube view. But for a picturesque scene go at night up the hill into Buda and get a glimpse of the bridge and parliament with the nice night illumination. That is a treat.

A great experience. We needed to wolk through the bridge every time we went to Vaci Utca and old town. Nice spot in the afternoon for taking pictures of the Danube, Parliament and old town but not for Buda Castle, the sun in behind. When you walk in the night, take care of the spider and spider webs in the rails.
Excellent views. I crossed the bridge during the city tour bu then I walked on it and I think every one should walk and njoy th view

A bridge is a bridge. As the title. However this bridge has a history, and I won't spoil it for you. It is a trip and a crossing you will have to make for yourself. From Pest across to Buda only a few minutes walk, and the view across, up and down the [not so] Blue Danube is a sight in itself.

Historic - Nice view of Danube. We liked a walk on this bridge. Unlike Charle's Bridge in Prague, this bridge is open for vehicles. Still on either side of the bridge, you have ample space to walk, set your tripod and take pics. Castle hill is very close to Chain bridge.

coolest bridge :). it links Buda and Pest. the sidewaks are spacious, you can stop and enjoy the view of Danube and the 2 sides of Budapest.
it's a 10 minutes walk on the bridge from Buda to Pest.
What a View at night!. Brilliant is the world. It is a dazzling beauty at night. It looks great even during the day. Basically a beautiful design and good looking, rugged construction.
Beautiful Bridge. We saw this bridge at night all lit up and during the day and both views are amazing! Of course the best view of the bridge is from the shore of the Danube!
very picturesque. More people have taken photos of that bridge than any of the 10 other bridges crossing the Danube. It is magnificent by day, at sunset and at night.
Picturesque Bridge. Not a lot to say about it but it is picturesque and looks wonderful when it is lit up at night time.
Pretty Bridge in thecenter. THe Chain Bridge is one of a series of bridges over the Danube the connect the Buda and Pest sides of the city. It is located directly in front of the Gresham Palace.

I recommend visiting the Chain Bridge (Szechenyi Chain Bridge) both day and especially at night. I recommend visiting the Chain Bridge (Szechenyi Chain Bridge) both day and especially at night. Do not miss a trip on the funicular (located nearby).
Stroled across, lots of beggars. It was nice but just a pretty to see from the shore. There were venders trying to sell stuff you can get at market hall cheaper and beggars along the way.
