Magnificent. Had the opportunity to walk accross the bridge on St. Stephen's day. It was a historial day and a very memorable experience. The bridge was closed and thousands of people came to Budapest to enjoy the festivities. Take in this sight and dont's miss it after the sun goes down. It is a fabulous background for a photo.
You need to see it ..... in the day and then at night. Its a little strange at night, I can't say how, it just is different. I presume its the lighting, but surely worth a look.
Nice Bridge. Walk from Pest to Buda or vice versa across this bridge. Good opportunity to take photos of both sides from here
See at night if you can!. Great to walk across with great views of Fisherman's Bastion, Parliament, and Danube. Please see at night if you can -- it is lit up and is a magical sight to see.

One of our favourite bridges in Central Eastern Europe. The Chain Bridge spans the River Danube between Buda and Pest, offering absolutely stunning views of the river banks. We love the statues of the lions guarding the bridge on both bridgeheads - they look majestic, brave and kind. You can cross over to the Buda or Pest side via the Chain Bridge, which takes just 5-10min. Highly recommended!
Spectacular. This bridge is spectacular a must see for all visitors,walk across it both ways to get pictures of the bridge and the scenery.
Oldest bridge. Most beautiful bridge in Europe cannot imagine Budapest without this landmark. This bridge was the first permament link between the two cities of Buda and Pest.
Beautiful. Very old bridge with lots of character. We walked on it everyday to cross the river it's beautiful I will recommend everyone to take walk to cross the bidge
good walk. It was nice to walk by the bridge and cross to the buda's side. the view is lovely and it is an easy walk. I recommend it.
Very Pretty Bridge. This was a really pretty bridge. That's pretty much all you can say about it, since it's only a bridge.
one of several beauties. The Chain Bridge is a beautiful piece of work by day and night. Several of the other bridges spanning the Danube in Budapest are also worth visiting and crossing

Nice bridge. This is the bridge who will bring you closest to Castel Hill. It has a walking area, well protected from cars, so you can safelly stop and take pictures of Danube, castle, and the part you just left behind you...

The green giant connecting Buda and Pest. Great green bridge which could be used for many and various photo and art events. Its old head has its own beauty which not everybody could understand but anyway you have to pass through it if you'd like to climb up to the Citadel.

Very Impressive Bridge. Extraordinary considering the era in which the bridge was built. Ya have to admire those engineers! Of course there's a hoaky folk tale about an attempted suicide off the bridge, but it's more humorous than tragic.
beautiful, of course!. fun to walk across, watch out for bikers! very pretty at night as well. during our trip we went across many times.
Crossing over. If you come on the redline Hop on-Hop off bus you should get off at stop 10 which is the Funicular stop. Impressive bridge!
Beautiful bridge. It is a beautiful landmark and I recommend everyone who go to Budapest to check it out. The lion statues s guarding the bridge are impressive.

Chain Bridge. All the world meets on the Chain Bridge .......we had been here a few years ago and the Danube was in flood, now we had seen it in a heatwave.......still the Bridge stands full of smiles.
Beautiful bridge. Worth a stoll over daytime or night! Great views of the city from the bridge looking towards Buda or Pest.

Very nice for a walk!. Definitely take a walk over this pretty bridge with great views! The side overlooking Parliament is best I think (you can walk over on either side). Do watch out for the bikers who often are going quite fast. Traffic can be noisy as well, but that is to be expected.
One of my favorites. What a beautiful architecture piece.....You need to walk on it from side to side and take pictures from different points, you will be surprised the great pictures you will get.

First bridge over the Danube in Hungary. The bridge is one of the biggest attraction in Budapest. Build in 1849, this was the first bridge which unified the Buda and Pest side of the city. It is still in use today and expose a beautiful architecture combining concrete and steel in a very interesting way.
Most famous bridge in Budapest.. huge tourist attraction, and well worth seeing. Lit up and beautiful at night. Many cruise ships dock right next to the bridge.
GREAT!!. It is the best bridge I have ever seen! Though the Liberty and Margaret bridges are also nice... all bridges in Budapest are different!
Lovely bridge. Easy to walk upon and with great views particularly at night along the Danube when the river front is lit up
The Landmark of Budapest. I think this is the landmark of Budapest. The bridge connects Buda side and Pest site. The view in the evening is very beatiful. Don't miss it if you visit Budapest.
Impressive in the night. really fantastic picture, in the night this beautiful bridge give a really fantastic picture due to a perfect lighting. Lovely!

Perspective is Everything!. A view of Parliament, the Royal Palace, the hills of Buda, the flowing Danube, tour boats and barges, and all the passers-by. We walked over the bridge several times during our one-week stay.
great views. Just walk across. Great views of Parliament, Castle Hill, etc. We went near sunset and got some fantastic pictures in the late afternoon sun.
nice. Nice place to walk alone or with your girlfriend. In the evening and at night nice illuminated. From this bridge there is very nice view on Buda's hills

Just another bridge?. The Chain Bridge is a great piece of engineering and worthy of a visit but like many other bridges around the world it is pretty uninspiring unless compared with photographs taken during the second world war when the bridge was all but demolished.

An impressive way to build a bridge!. Truely impressive for the time that it was built, and to have lasted for as long as it has. The man power, and engineering that it took build this bridge is unbelievable. It truely is a beautiful bridge to see and to cross over on. There is a lot of history there.
The nicest in Budapest. This is a well-designed bridge that takes you right to the funicular in Buda to climb to the Royal Palace. It's a nice bridge to take pictures.

Amazing!. Take your camera and walk over this enchanting bridge to look at this magical city. Every step is an extraordinary picture. I'd suggest taking one trip during the day and one at night. Just watch out for those bicycles!!
a bridge you can walk across. like this bridge as you can walk across it, has great views of either side of Danube, e.g. the Parliament House
Special at night. Spent many hours along the riverside and saw the bridge day and night very nice and special at night when the lights are on
Extraordinary sight. An extraordinary sight, worth the walk across to experience it fully, and it provides such good views of the city, why not?

Beautiful. All of the bridges on the Danube are beautiful but this one is number 1! When the lights are on at night, the view is spectacular. The view from the Pest side is stunning but I'd recommend you see the view from both sides.

Walk across the river. One of the nicest walks takes you from the glorious Gresham Palace from Roosevelt square over the chain bridge to Clark Adam square and further up to the castle. Do not forget your camera.
Lovely bridge. Well worth a walk over the river just to absorb the sights, smells and sounds of Budapest - mainly from the traffic.
Beautiful. A wonderful bridge especially at night with the lights. A must see! We love to walk along the river at night along the Pest side of the river and look across to the Buda side. What a view!
Beautiful. Beautiful - day and night - you must cross it at least once to get the views from both side. Beware the cyclists!!!
Great views. Beautiful views of the city, fun to walk across but very busy with walkers and bikers on the pedestrian section of bridge. Lots of car traffic. But worth the crossing.
Chain Bridge is beautiful. A bridge that is beautiful day and night! Everyone that takes a look at it is in awe. Lighting at night makes it even better.

A must see. A spectacular sight for all to see - wonder across on one side and then on your return take the other side for a different view.
A great view of parliament, numerous boats and Buda castle.

Historic bridge. This is a must see for visitors to Budapest. Walking over and back on different sides gives one a good observation of the bridge, the Danube river traffic, as well as scenic views of both sides of the city.
Breathtaking.. A wonderful feat of engineering and it captures amaging views over the Danube. However most of the bridges are equally amazing.
Beautiful Bridge. Specially in the nights the bridge looks very beautiful with all the lights. Nice details. Didn't have time to walk on the bridge but passed by in a care several times.

Spectacular at night. The Chain Bridge is a significant engineering achievement, since the Danube didn’t have a permanent bridge between Buda and Pest until it was opened in 1849. Because so many of Budapest’s most beautiful buildings are aligned along the Danube, a stroll across the Chain Bridge is a nice thing to do. But, as pretty as it is during the day, this scenic attraction is spectacular at night. Brightly lit, as is all of Castle Hill, the Parliament, and the rest of the waterfront, the Chain Bridge from any angle is very beautiful. Take pictures.

City worth a visit - Budapest. This bridge dates way back - its location is in the heart of Budapest and on the way to the oldest spa in the city so worth walking across! there is a tunnel the far side and walk ways or a lift upto the Palace! Stunning....

Best bridge in Budapest. It was our favorite bridge in Budapest. It can be walked across from Pest to Buda and back as countless others do. It is also the most beautiful during the illumination at night.

Great View, Must See!. If you go to Castle Hill, stop near the bird sculpture and take a good picture. There is a great photo opportunity here. Also, go back and check out the rest of Castle Hill while you're at it.
Great views, nice walk!. We really liked the views of both Buda and Pest from the bridge as well as that it took us right to the funicular to take to the top of Castle Hill.
Gorgeous at night with the gas lamps. This bridge is lit up at night with gas lamps. It is beautiful. You can also walk across to either side Buda or Pest, short walk.

Interesting. Very pleasant walk across this bridge. The weather was very hot so we had a nice breeze walking across to cool us down. Went on the funicular to the castle and had a walk round the market stalls. The bridge itself is very interesting.

Worth taking the walk across.. I believe the bridge was destroyed during WWII and rebuilt. The bridge is a beautiful piece of work and worth going to see and to walk from Buda to Pest, or vice -versa. The lions are quite impressive, but watch out for the bikes. Bikes rige along the bridge as do cars. Take a moment while on the bridge to take in the view. Awesome!

A European Treasure.. You cannot visit Buda, or Pest, without the Chain bridge. It is a symbolic, beautiful, and affords its lucky pedestrians among one of the most spectacular urban views in all of Europe, especially at night. Beyond a must see, it is a must do, a must experience, with time, to watch the Danau, the people, and the amazing architecture of Budapest...a most spectacular setting, in a most spectacular city.
great looking bridge. take the time to walk across this bridge once or twice (day and night). beautiful way to see both sides of the river.
a very nice building. a breathtaking bridge... i am totally cannot believed that it was one of the destroyed edifice during the War. One can still see the bullet holes inflicted on the bridge.

Beautiful bridge with lots of history. A bridge is a bridge, but when you consider the following: it was the first bridge to link Buda and Pest as one, the fact it was destroyed and rebuilt as a symbol of Hungarian determination, the fact that all distances from Budapest to other parts of Hungary were measured from one end of the bridge, the history of the bridge keepers and the way this post is passed down from generation to generation and finally, how amazing it looks at night from the banks of the Danube and from the views at Buda Castle then it's somewhat more than a mere bridge. It's a part of Budapest that you will be extremely hard pushed to avoid! Enjoy the views and take the opportunity to walk across it!
Massive Bridge. When visiting Budapest, you must take a walk across the famous Chain Bridge for amazing views of the city.
A Must to Walk. We used the bridge every day. Great walk because of the view of the river, sites, and the nice people. Make sure you walk the bridge at least once.
Lovely at night. It is at its best when lit up at night and is also quieter. We were lucky to watch a fireworks display which made the whole experience magical)
Great for history, and access!. Used the bridge everyday to access the other side of the River. Lots of history, and even included a film set on one day whilst we were visiting!
Watch the world go by. Loved walking up and down the bridge, looks awesome at night with all the lights on. Enjoy the view...
It is worth to walk through the bride both daytime and during night.. You get fantastic view of the city, which has different beauties during night with all the light around.
Yep - It's a bridge.. The Chain Bridge is indeed a bridge. It's a bridge busy with traffic. It's nothing special, so get out and see Budapest instead!

Impressive and attractive bridge, large walking sidewalk. Attractive bridge connecting Buda and Pest and various tourist attractions. I think I read it was the first bridge connecting the two separate towns making it Budapest...

Long walk well worth it.. Cross the Chain bridge from Pest to Buda side and take the old venicular up the hill to the castle. Wait if you are on the Pest side enjoy the most magnificent view of any city over the river Danube, with the castle on the hill, the cathedral and the Fishermans Bastion, then walk over to enjoy them close up. The walk over the bridge lets you enjoy the magnificence of the city and the river from both sides. Day or night if you have time for nothing more amid the fantastic shopping opportunities and eating experiences this is most worthwhile.
Bus across the Bridge. Actually, my most memorable event was thinking the Brooklyn Bridge was designed after this. Other than that, it was a way for our bus to get across the Danube.
Un sogno sul Danubio. A Beautiful bridge, all made in cast iron, illuminated with sparkling lights that the river reflects creating a magic atmosphere.
Beautiful. Even though it is just a bridge, it is very beautiful especially at night. There are 2 lion statues on each side of the bridge, worth a look.
Just a bridge. Nice view at night with all the lights on. Other than that, it's just a bridge!
an interesting bridge with 2 lions on both ends.. Chain Bridge was an interesting bridge with 2 lions on both ends. We crossed the bridge and went up to the presidential palace.
Scottish Design in the Center of Europe. The Clarks designed it and carried out the brilliant Construction.Favorite location for movie makers from all over the World.
A chain bridge. If you are expecting something like the Charles Bridge in Pargue forget it. This is a bridge made from chains. It's not a cultural hub or a market or anything esle. Just a bridge.

It's a bridge. Ummm.....I liked the Lion statues and the views...other than that the bridge has some history, and gets you from one side of the river to the other...but it's filled with traffic, noisy, etc. It's not London Tower Bridge, etc.

Chain Bridge walk = easy & fun. Walking across the Chain seemed like it would be long and hot but we thoroughly enjoyed it even though we are 70+ years. The views are spectacular. The other tourists and vendors polite. Wonderful to cross and then walk a few blocks to the Infant Jesus of Prague statue Church for quiet. We were there when a side street celebrated Bastille Day with vendors & music. Prague is truly a destination city.
Right out of a postcard!. We strolled across it, and cruised beneath it at night. Keep an ear out for bicyclists who ring to caution you to move to the right, and savor the sights.
Watch out for the cyclists!. You've got to cross the Danube at some point and this is probably the nicest way to do it. Beware of the cylists though (actually this applies to all of Budapest).
Bridges in Budapest. Budapest have several bridges,take your time to walk from Buda to Pest.The Chain bridge is special.

Awesome Views, Cool Bridge. http://gonewiththeguys.blogspot.com/2012/07/high-fives-budapest.html
Crossed this bridge a few times in Budapest, enjoyed it very much. Wrote this short review on my stay!
Amazing view!. You must see the bridge at night time wuth the lights. The view is absolutely stunning! During daytime it is beautiful as well, but it is no match to night time.
One of the Schezenyis miracles. The most interesting thing on it is a personality of its donor - the biggest Hungarian - Istvan Szechenyi. Read more about him.
Great view (of Buda and Pest)!. It's a beautiful view (be sure to walk across at least once and catch the elebvator up to the top on the castle side).

Cool bridge over the Danube. This is the most picturesque and noted bridge across the Danube in Budapest, so it is most tourist's "must see" list. There is room to take pictures of the bridge from both the Buda and Pest sides, as well as on the bridge itself. There are good river views from it. On the Buda side, the funicular to go up the hill is near the bridge, as well as a path to climb up to Castle Hill.

Traffic laden bridge. The bridge is good to enjoy from a distance as part of the Budapest vista. However, walking along the bridge itself does not compare with other beautiful European bridges in cities such as London, Prague or Paris.

Lovely to walk over in the evening. We walked across the Chain Bridge in the evening which was lovely to see Budapest light up as we walked across and then to see the bridge lit up when we got to the other end. Although the bridge is lovely for a walk it doesn't start or end in any place in particular and you need to walk to find cafes and other attractions. However, it does give a good view of Budapest and the river as you cross.
Bridge of love. Better by night and more dramtic than by day but above all else impressive
Lion Statues. Nice picture of Buda Castle can be taken from Chain bridge
Very nice. Very nice Chain Bridge! I like that very much! Everybody shoul see it & took a picture there!

Rebuilt to its' original splendour. An architectural monument which was blown up by the Hungarians and allied Germans to slow down the Russian invasion during WWII. The bridge was re build to its original splendour as seen up to this day.
My favorite place to visit at night!!. I've been to Budapest countless times, but looking at the Chain Bridge lit up at night is still my favorite thing to do! It still mesmerizes me, just beautiful!
beautiful landmark. My hotel had a great view of the Chain Bridge. It was beautiful during the day and awesomely lit up at night.
A must-see at night!. Absolutely gorgeous lit up at night. Don't miss it!
Chain Bridge. An amazing bridge with pedestrian walkways that provide great views of both sides of the city.

Just another bridge. I walked it just because it had good ratings at tripadvisor. didn't expect much, and that's what I got :)Sure, it has a view, but it's crowded, and people are biking there as well. The only good part is that the bridge is rather close to the Fisherman's bastion, and going there is a must!You can't really get good photos of the bridge while you are on it, and the angle is also a bit too low if you want to get good shots of the city while you are on the bridge.

Beautiful bridge. The Chain bridge is wonderful. It is great to walk across the bridge. One gets to see great views of the Danube, the various bridges and the Island. The bridge allows both Pedestrian and vehicular traffic, and hence gets a little busy.
Needless to say ... awsome. Walking on Chain Bridge and around it is just like fairy tales, especially at night, the place is just like dream land, highyl recommanded specially for couples
Beautiful bridge but busy. Nice bridge designed by an Englishman I believe, worth a visit

Visit at Night. Our hotel was at the foot of the Chain Bridge on the Pest Side and in the evening, all the bridges are lit and the view is nothing short of spectacular. We did several evening walks across the bridge and back just to enjoy the views of this beautiful city. You will have lots of company, including intrepid cyclists, so do pay attention as you are strolling so you can move out of the way if necessary. The Four Seasons Gresham Palace Hotel has absolutely stunning architecture and a beautiful bar and restaurant if you want a place to stop and get a bite to eat or drink on your walk.
Great Views. Must see at night with all the buildings lit up.Eat dinner in Buda, then walk back over the Chain Bridge.Bring your camera.

Chain Bridge, Budapest. Great views looking in either direction of the Danube. Whichever way you look, you will see some of the main attractions. If you take a taxi this is a good drop off point. On the Buda side you can take the funicular railway up to the palace. Tip - if possible take a seat at the front of the1st carriage as there are amazing views looking down at Chain Bridge with St. Stephen's Basilica in the background. Make sure that when you get to the top that you go left into the grounds of the Royal Palace. From here you will have the best views of Budapest. Save this trip for a clear fine day as it will be one of your best! From here you have an easy walk to the Fisherman's Bastion and Matya's Church plus there are some fine restaurants in this area.On the Pest side you can walk to the Parliament and you have great views looking back at Buda.
city landmark worth crossing. Beautiful at night -- iconic for the city and one they should be proud of.

Waterfall. From Elizabeth Deak we took the 49 tram to go to the covered market we went past our stop and went across the bridge to Buda side.Then on the coach tour we went across the chain bridge to see a lovely waterfall just as we approached Buda
Wonderful. Wonderful view, especially at night when all the lights are on...

Best by night? . As I visited by day, I cant say about illumination. Apart from that, its a nice bridge but not really interesting by itself. Its similar to the London Bridge, but smaller. You will have a nice view of the Danube and the Parliament.

Truth or legend?. Our guide told us that the lions were sculptured without their tongues and was imperfect! But they were checked out and they did have their tongues. An impressive bridge to cross over to the Buda site.
Walk it at night and enjoy the views. The chain bridge connect Buda and Pest and offers stunning views of boats on the Danube as well as views of Buda and Pest.

An elegant way to view the city. The bridge is beautiful, elegant, simple, easily one of the most exquisite examples of it skind. Walk across in winter, in the early morning, or any time when the sun is just going down. Corny? No. Never that.
Impressive engineering piece. Walk by and cross the Donau (Danube), from Pest to Buda or the other way round on a summer morning.
One of the many beautiful bridges in Budapest. When the Chain Bridge is lit at night - it is truly beautiful. The Chain Bridge is NOT your "usual" bridge!!
Most beautiful when night falls. Try to see it during nighttime when the whole Budapest panorama is covered in little specks of light.
One of the nice looking bridges in Budapest. You will get a nice view of the Bridge and city of you walk up the the Citadella on from Hotell Gelert side.
Must. A must is to walk on both sides and take great pictures
A walk across the bridge. Best seen in an evening when lighten up. Beware the cycles on the path! Views of river and Parliament
Cracking attraction !. had a very nice walk over all the bridges in Budapest & got some stunning photos of the Chain Bridge - what a BRILLIANT City !

Nice bridge...... Chain Bridge is lovely. A little bit of Paris...a little bit of Prague. Not too far to walk across - very nice. Unlike Charles Bridge - there weren't any vendors on the bridge - which was kind of nice.

Execellent illumination. I liked this bridge for it's illumination at night... simply marvellous.. a tunnel on the Buda side of this bridge and the climbing train which takes you up the hill was exciting exeperience.. from the bridge very beautiful view of the Parliament building, adjacent river and the palace is visible..
Beautiful Bridge with Interesting Views. This bridge is really beautiful and ornate and offers amazing views of Budapest on both sides of the river. A stroll across it is highly recommended.
Watch out for the bikes.... Great to walk over as long as you keep your eyes and ears open for bikes (but they don't have bells).
It makes walking a pleasure. It's grand, it has huge lion sculptures on either end, massive chains supporting it. . . .
Must see at night. Takes you to the city center and is 1 block from the hotel

Don't Miss In Budapest. It is a remarkable looking bridge, for sure. Yet, it is also a working bridge, with tons of pedestrians, cyclists and cars, so look out. It really was a thing of beauty. We took quite a few pictures of it and I shared some of mine with TripAdvisor. It is one of those sights that you should include as you tour around the picturesque city.
great views. To get really great views it is best to walk up the hill and monument opposite.

Iconic landmark. A place where you need to look over your shoulder before passing another pedestrian - you're sharing space with pedestrians and very fast moving cyclists. You always have to be prepared to take evasive action in the event of a hurrying cyclist appearing from behind a pillar.The lions at either end of the bridge provide bookends to shots of either Buda or Pest. At night, it's brilliantly illuminated.Face west and look up at the palace; face east and look to the Parliament building.
Especially spectacular at night. Small but perfectly formed, this bridge was particularly magical all lit up at night. Unfortunately half of the lights were out spoiling the photos from one side!

A Must Walk Thru & Romantic. The Chain Bridge is quite an architechure. Check out the steel and pay very close attention to the details of the majestic Lions guarding each end. We crossed it at mid-morning to go to Buda and Castle Hill. Towards the evening, we dined on one of the promenade restaurants and watched it light up the in the night as well as Castle Hill. Thereafter, we walked through it again and strolled along the banks of the Danube admiring the view of the Parliament and the rest Pest from Buda.
Great views. We used this Bridge as a gateway to explore the castle district and surrounding areas. The views were breathtaking. Cycles were slightly hazarderous until we get used to them.
First bridge across the Danube. Great piece of engenering. This bridge is beatiful to look at and offers great view over the Danube and booth the Buda and the Pest side.

Bring the camera. This is a great walk across the Danube. There is a legend that the lions have no tongues and the sculptor killed himself after this discovery. I don’t know if that is true and I didn’t climb up for a closer look. As you walk the bridge, keep in mind that the Nazi blew this up in their 1945 retreat along with all the other bridges. If you walk only one bridge in Budapest---make it the Chain Bridge.
Worth seeing. Danube not blue but interesting bridge to walk across to see the other part of Budapest
Chain Bridge. Chain bridge is amazing as is many parts if Budapest. Beautiful at night! Take a boat down the Danube for a real treat !
great views. It is a nice place to walk and cross the Danube to the way to Buda. At night is all light and is very spectacular as it is the night Budapest.
excellent!. Walk and admire this wonderful piece of engineering.

chain bridge beautiful. This huge bridge links Buda and the Pest side together. Take the tram line either 16 or 2 and get off at Chain Bridge and walk across to the other side. There is a very safe walk way and it is very beautiful. Most peoplle after a day at Gellert Spa walk up towars the lady on the Buda Hill and wait till sunset to take snaps and videos or Chain Bridge and surrounding landscape as its all lit up at night time and is very beautiful. oh and do leave room for an oven baked pizza at the resturant at top of the hill. Only tour buses go up here. If you havent booked atour be prepaired for along walk up but coming down is v easy and leisurley.

Look out!. The walk across the chain bridge to the siklo to take you up to Buda castle is one of Budapest's experiences offering good views of the city(cities?). Watch out though, the walk way is fairly narrow especially around the bridge pylons and cyclists fly past you-even around the blind corners!
Even prettier at night. If you have a good camera and tripod, take night photos of the bridge from all angles with other beautiful Budapest sites in the background.
Beautiful at night. Beautiful place to walk at night when it is all lit up. Very safe. Great view.
Very old and interesting construction. Beautiful bridge with monuments and well l it in the evening

June and August. This is the best season to visit the Chain Bridge, because on weekends the bridge is closed for pedestrians and it´s full with life, souvenir and art booths.
We just walked it in May , with the traffic, and it provides a very different impression, less majestic.
Cross the Danube. Walking across the Chain Bridge is quite an experience, and gives you great views of both Buda and Pest. At night when it is lit up its very pretty.
chain bridge. Nice bridge, good place to making fotos. It is reccomended not to skip.

One of the symbols in Budapest. The Chain Bridge is a must if you're coming in Budapest, being a beautiful attraction during daytime or in the night. The architecture is very beautiful and expressive and the landscapes of Buda and Pest are truly amazing seeing from the bridge.
Beautiful. We walked across this and it was beautiful and the views of the city were amazing.
Pretty bridge. Even better is the sight of the tunnel at the end of the bridge. It was a beautiful place to go.

I know it's cliche' but don't miss out on this. I know it's cliche' but don't miss out on this it will truley be one of the highlights of anyones visit to Budapest. View it in many different ways from either side or on it it offers greta views.Make sure to visit at both times of day... day and night since both will offer very different feels to this magnificent structure

beautiful from every angle, at every hour. As we review our holiday photos, we find that we took more pictures of the Chain Bridge every day we were in Budapest. It is such an iconic image and captures the beauty and history of this delightful city. As you walk, be aware of the bicyclists -- this is a commuter bridge and the cyclists move at speed.
Too crowded. They need to ban the vendors. It's so crowded on the bridge it wasn't fun.
Its a bridge.... I suppose its one of the main things photographed in Budapest - but its just a bridge and not that special really.

Better Viewed from Afar. We were there on a hot June day, just before noon. Seen from a distance, it looked gracious enough, but after we got there, we realized it was just a good old solid bridge meant for people to cross from one bank of a river to the other. The walkways were narrow and very awkward for both pedestrians and cyclers (quite many in Budapest, thumbs up for the locals!), and the motor cars and buses whizzing by felt somewhat incongrous. Too bad they don't make it pedestrian-only. Like Charles Bridge in Prague, for instance. Or build two fancy footbridges on its sides.
you can see all city from there. Good location to take photos and nice walking distance
This IS Budapest for me. I love both the bridge and the views from it. This bridge embodies Budapest for me.
Beautiful and interesting. My husband was enthralled by the engineering and I thought it was beautiful, especially when lit up at night. One of many wonderful sights to see in Budapest.

bridging lone. This is a magnificent sight and a testament to the solidity and purposefulness of Victorian engineering. It's the first and oldest crossing point over the Danube and its approach from either bank of the river is majestic. A landmark in its own right, it perfectly complements the gloriously over-the-top Parliament building and is best viewed from the Castle District at Buda.
Great views. As a steel erector this was a facinating bridge to walk acrosss and guess the number of rivets.
Well worth seeing!. Me and my boyfriend took a stroll alongside the Danube and we went for at drink at Spoons - we sat outside in the evening, the bridge was a sight for sore eyes!

"The" bridge in Budapest. It is not as historic as the Charles Bridge in Prague, but it is also not crowded with vendors & hawkers. It is a relatively short bridge, but it has great views up & down the Danube and also of the major sights in Budapest.

My favorite bridge in Europe. I fell in love with this bridge when I saw a picture of it years ago, and it drew me to Budapest. I think it is simply spectacular and certainly a focal point for the city.
Be sure to look down both sides of the River. You can see Parliament and other buildings looking north and the liberty statue looking south. Take a walk along the river bank after you cross as well.
Stunning. Impressive by day but very special at night whe illuminated

Stunning especially at night. I think my husband and I traversed this bridge every single day that we were in Budapest and we loved it each time. Words really can't express how beautiful this bridge is especially all lit up at night. We stayed over on the Buda side and our hotel room looked out on this very bridge which was such a treat for us. I'm not usually a lover of bridges but you can't help but fall for this one. If all the camera flashes that we saw each night are any indication, I think it's safe to say that it's a must see.

Gorgeous at night. If you go as a couple, then it's definitely worth going to during the evening. Romantic and beautifully lit.It can be more chilly and windy going over the bridge so bringing an extra layer can help keep it pleasant. Also, there can be a number of bikers and some parts are narrow so use caution.By day it's also good to walk over the bridge but at night the bridge is at it's full glory.
Fairytale. Do walk the Chain Bridge by night. The views and ambiance are spectacular...
A beautiful bridge over the Danube. This bridge was bombed by the Germans before the end of the war, but was rebuilt and is the most beautiful bridge over the Danube.

Splendor over the Danube. Beautiful bridge to walk over the Danube. The sun was bright and the breeze was pleasant. We walked the bridge from the Four Season's hotel side, and crossed it over to go to the castle side. It is a magnificent piece of engineering and construction built in 1849! WOW
Must see. Must see if in Budapest. We stayed on the Pest side (definitely the side you want to stay on)

Make it a romantic night :). My husband and I went to budapest for our anniversary and just fell in love with this bridge. Our first night we got a bottle of wine and just relaxed on the bridge taking the whole city in. It was so romantic and beautiful. It was one of my favorite nights!

When you only have time to see one thing. If you only have time to do one thing in Budapest, I recommend that you walk across the Chain bridge as it gives you a panoramic view of the most beautiful city sites: the Danube itself, the Royal Palace and the Parliament. I love to walk across the Chain bridge from the Pest side to Buda and then climb up the stairs to the Castle area. Then walk back across the bridge to the Pest side and walk along the bank of the river past the Parliament. It will be an unforgettable walk.

Chain Bridge - Fantastic. Budapest is city of bridges in its true sense. Chain bridge is my most favourite among all bridges on danube river. You can take a cruise ride for a close and marvelous view of the bridge.
Worth while. Definitely check out this bridge and all the other bridges. You can see them all from Castle Hill
Great. i walked across this bridge many times....be sure to see it at night too. you can walk on either side. Watch out for cyclists
So Beautiful. Takes you across the river and it is a landmark to use to get from one side of Budapest to the other. It is at the foot of the castle so easy to find. Beautifully lit at night also.

Walking across the bridges or running is a must do. The Danube is most beautiful in Budapest, so walking or running across one of the bridges--particularily the chain bridge is something that you must do when you come to Budapest.

A world-class sight / site. To see the lights on the bridge, with Castle Hill light up behind, from the Pest side of the Danube, on a summer night ... is truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Make sure you plan for it.
Exceptionally clean. I liked the idea of all the padlocks of love placed all along the bridge. Furthermore, the cleanliness was remarkable

The Greatest Hungarian. I work as an English teacher in Budapest, and one of my students told me that Szechenyi, after whom this bridge is named, was the greatest Hungarian. Truly he had a unique vision, which included the push to build the first permanent non-toll bridge across the Danube to link Buda and Pest. The bridge is to Budapest what the Brooklyn Bridge is to New York City, both for its beauty and for the achievement its construction represented. On the Pest side sits the Gresham Palace Hotel, and on the other side of the Danube Buda Castle Hill. A perfect self-guided Budapest tour would take the reader from the Basilica, down to Gresham Palace, across the Danube on the Szechenyi, and up the funicular to Castle Hill. You cannot visit Budapest without crossing the Szechenyi Bridge.
One of the most beautiful bridges I've seen.... It is not as monumental as Milleau in France... not as old as Charles Bridge in Prague, Czech Republic... yet, it is awesome.
I don't understand the fuss. It is a relatively nice bridge, but nothing special. I wouldn't go out of my way to see it. Plus you can spot it easily from the Citadel, the Castle area, etc.
why is it a world heritage site. pretty average bridge compared some bridges i.ve crossed, and feels like its rusting apart
Work of art. An engineering marvel. Even my boyfriend who's deathly afraid of bridges and heights managed to get across it. It's more a work of art than a practical piece.
Go day and night. Make sure to walk across here day and night since the city's main attractions are all lit up beautifully at night
Explore both sides of the Danube. You have to make sure you walk over this bridge to explore both sides of the city when visiting Budapest and see the Danube separating
A good walk. Enjoyed walking across the Chain Bridge, view from both sides was amazing. Budapest is indeed a most beautiful city. Just watch out for bikes weaving in-and-out of us pedestrians!
Must see!. A nice bridge, worth seeing. IMO the nicest bridge I saw in budapest.

Very Cool Bridge. You don't usually give a bridge a good review, but this one is very nice, having been recently renovated, and it looks good and makes for a nice stroll from one side of the river to the other.

Beautiful. This bridge is beautiful by day and beautiful by night. Take a moment to just stop and stare. Connects Pest to Buda. IT is guarded by lions but don't be afraid. It is one of the most convenient bridges to cross by foot. Take it to Castle Hill.
Walk across during the day. An easy day walk across the bridge and a good place to sit up on the girders and crack open a beer as quite a lot of tourists are doing this.

Nice walk. It is quite a pleasant walk over this bridge, since you are separated from the traffic, lots of foot traffic and the views are excellent. Just need to stop the cyclists and especially the trishaws.
great nut not too amazing. this bridge for me not too amazing even great... but you must enjoy it
Lovely. If you are in Budapest you definitely need to take a walk across at night
Worth a walk over if you're feeing fit!. Great views over river, lots to see and do once you get to the other side
Great bridge.. I think that the green bridge as nice as this one.

A bridge that connects. The bridge took us to Buda and the walk was interesting because you got a good view of both sides from the middle of the bridge. The lion sculptures were attractive and the river looked full from the bridge. The bridge is lit up at night and it looks marvelous.However,the beggars at either were distracting.

I enjoy bridges.... ...so if you do, then you'll enjoy walking across. Nice views of the city. It's definitely a pedestrian bridge as opposed to a touristy one so make sure you're not blocking folks actually trying to get around (although most would probably just take wheeled transport across the bridge). I love walking, water, bridges so I was pretty content.

Its a bridge!!!!. It has to be good, it takes you from Pest to Buda or Buda to Pest!
Nice architecture and nice when lit up at night.

A nice bridge with lion sculptures.. The views from the bridge are wonderful but if you look for some added value (for example, in Prague they have painters, artists and musicians on the bridge)- you won't find it here... Pedestrians and beggars only... It's a "practical" bridge some would say...
Beautiful monument !. Take a walk from Buda to Pest or vice versa. Beautiful views on both sides, the Danube below. Just below Castle hill.
Pretty night view. Walked across the bridge to get to Fisherman's Bastion

Beautiful bridge. We were lucky enough to have an almost direct view of the bridge from our hotel window. It's at its best at night, when it's lit up very tastefully and shows itself off to best effect. It really is a beautiful piece of architecture.
landmark. we had the luck to have view of the bridge from our hotel room and it was just breath taking...
Romantic at night. We walked across this bridge during the day and at night. It is romantic to take a stroll at night time across this bridge and to see the city lit up at night.
A majestic sight. I'm not big on engineering but even I can appreciate the amazing construction of this majestic bridge - and a bridge with such beauty too.
Fun to walk across. We enjoyed walking across and looking out over the river. It was very crowded but worth the walk.

great. beautiful to see and to walk through
great landscape
A Must. Walking across the Chain Bridge is part of the experience of being in Budapest--in fact it links Buda and Pest. Views are great and watching your fellow tourists is enjoyable.
Its a bridge, get over it!. Sorry, dont see what the fuss is all about. Yes its a nice bridge, but apart from the fact it was designed by a Scotsman and lights up at night, that's it.
Amazing view!. We walked through the Chain Bridge to go to the Castle Hill from the Pest side. It's a magnificent bridge! The view from the bridge for the river is beautiful.
Beautiful bridge. Best viewingpoint was from a boattrip on the river where you can take lovely photos
most beautiful bridge. I cannot much comment on this - one must go and see himself.
Breathtaking. Beautiful to view, especially at night when it's all lit up. Fun to walk over to see both sides of the city.

The 'must see' of Budapest. The chain bridge is one you can't miss but you also shouldn't miss.It's really the amazing structure you expect and gives a bit Tower-bridge like feeling.It is a narrow one and because a lot of traffic uses this bridge cars and buses drive not ot fast here. As visitor you can the best walk it because it gives you besides the views of the bridgesome nice views on Buda , Pest and the Danube. Beacause it is also the shortest way to thecastle hill and or the Royal Palace you'll get there anyway.
Easy walk. This bridge was a nice walk. Make sure you take a walk across it and catch the hop off hop on your on the Buda side to go up to the castle.
Walk across. Walk across to reach the funicular up to the castle

A wonderful structure and view point. Wonderful piece of civil engineering, a great place to view both Pest and the Castle Hill District as well as the busy river below.As a pedestrian, you have to be nimble and alert to negotiate the very many cyclists that pass you by as you are walking and sightseeing!
Walk from Pest to Buda. Beautiful way to see both Buda and Pest by walking across the Danube River.
Underwhelming by day, lovely by night. Beautifully lit up at night and the views from on it are great. A great landmark too to navigate by.
Pretty!. Just a beautiful construction and nice to be able to walk thee yourself without being run over by traffic.
Love those lions!. Love those lions! But, really, all of the bridges have their own character. This is the famous one, they they are all landmarks.

BEAUTIFUL WHEN ILLUMINATED. I have a bit of a bridge fettish so i may be biased but this really is a beautiful bridge, reminded me a little of New Yorks Brooklyn bridge. Looks amazing at night when it is illuminated but also very pretty by day. The architecture is fabulous with the grand lions guarding either end.
Stunning!. Few bridges are this stunning! She witnessed the glory and the gory of Budapest history
Great Views from the Bridge. This bridge offers a great vantage point to see the famous Budapest landmarks. Great place to watch the sunrise/sunset.
Chain, chain, chain.. Walked over this bridge and took about a million photos, not only of the view but the fascinating bridge itself. It really does look like a bicycle chain.
Main Budapest atractions. Walking though the Chain bridge from Buda to Pest is just great
Worth visiting!!!. Nice view, nice bridge full of life!!!!! Very beautiful when lights turn on at night....
Good view. Its not long walk and it offers good view on Danube. And bridge itself is nice piece of modern history.
architecturally great. the chain bridge is really cool architecturally. we walked across it from buda to pest and enjoyed the walk and the whistling of the cars passing us by ;)
good bridge. hmmmmmm not quite what I expected in that it is well maintained and I understand the importance the bridge has played but really not all that spectacular to look at.
Walk across. that's what we did. You can see the famous lions up close to check for their tongues.
The link that binds. This bridge is the center spot and you get lovely pictures. The only problem is the cyclists who ride about and can startle you as you are distracted etc.

Wonderful. Walking across the Chain Bridge from Buda to Pest or the other way round gives you the opportunity to admire the engineering and take pictures of the river and the buildings on either side. You have to be careful of the cyclists who zip across without slowing down though.
Great views at night. The views are great in both directions. Take your camera!!! It is even more impressive at night.

Magnificant.. We arrived in Budapest in the evening and didn't really intend to do much other than eat and get an early night.We decided to have a walk and within 5 minutes found the Parliament, we realised then how close we were to the Danube and decided to carry on.We looked to our left and there was the Chain Bridge we had read so much about - we had to see it up close and were so enamoured that we walked across to the Buda side and back.A wonderful stroll that set the whole tone for the holiday.
Awesome!. Looks fantastic in the evening when it's lit up. I'm not a lover of bridges, but did cross it to get to Buda. Worth a visit.
Lovely bridge. one of the many bridges to buda side. Great view of Rhine River from hotel

Mind the bikes. By day, but even more by night impressive. The bridge lights go out spot on midnight however. A nice walk across but mind all the bikes coming at you from the front and behind on the footpath!!!
Great place to exercise.. The bridge itself is beautiful, and they have space for walking, and bike riding over the bridge.

Breathtaking. Spotted this bridge already from Gellert Hill and as I continued my way to Buda Castle, it just gets greater and greater. Don't hesitate to walk over the bridge. When you're in the middle, stop and take a look around you. You'll be thrilled by what you see.

Easy walk and offers nice views. This was an easy walk between the Pest and Buda sides of the city, and it offers nice views for pictures. Need to cross it twice to get in views from both sides of the bridge since it's used by motor vehicles as well.
nice visit. great visit there, meet some nice people there. will visit it again one day.
Beautiful. Best view is from in front of the Four Seasons in Budapest...all the best sights are in front of you, with the Bridge as the focal point.
Great stroll over the river. The bridge is beautiful and makes for a great stroll across the river with plenty of great photo ops. It looks gorgeous lit up at night!

Classic Bridge-worth a walk over the Danube to take the cable up Castle Hill to Fisherman's Bastion. That first walk over the Danube-well worth it. A classic chain bridge with good views. The bridge takes you over to the cable car to the castle hill and a great day out. Note the egg shaped statue on the Buda side which is the actual centre of Budapest.
Count Szechenyi. He was one of Hungary's greatest statesmen and athe prime mover of modern Hungary. It was this first bridge across the danube that brought Hungary into the modern era.
Had to do it. We walked across the bridge over the Danube. Not sure why it was a must-do, but we did it. Got some cool pics of both Buda and Pest in the process.
lovely. A lovely piece of architecture looking a bit tired, but still grand when lighted at night; seems to always be jammed with cars and buses.
Beautiful. It's the landmark and one of the most beautiful structures in Budapest that is filled with beautiful things. Also very interesting history.

GREAT WALK AND VIEW AT THE BUDA SIDE. This was a wonderful walk included in the free walking tour of Budapest. The views of both sides (Buda and Pest) were great. The bridges itself is interesting and a nice walk.

Paris on the Danube. I just returned from a Viking Riverboat Cruise up the Danube that started in Budapest. Our boat was docked next to the bridge and we walked across it. I felt I had returned to Paris. The stonework looked so much like the Arc de Triomphe. The lions were so regal-looking, we took picture after picture. I walk with a cane and expected some difficulty crossing from one side of the bridge to the other; but very courteous drivers stopped to let my wife and I pass. It was a wonderful welcome to a beautiful city.
a nice historic walk. You have to walk across this bridge~it takes you to so many great places on the Buddha side of the river. It was quite windy though and on a chilly day~it was cold!

Take a walk. Yes, walk over the bridge and enjoy the bridge building art of the old days - even though it was destroyed during WW2 and rebuild afterwards according to the origibal drawings. A must see.
charming old bridge on the danube. our room looked upon this charming old bridge - that connects buda with pest... great place to go for a stroll across teh river.

Beautiful when lit up at night!. The Chain bridge looks amazing when lit up at night and is just as beautiful during the day. If you stand by the Chain bridge, you can see the Castle hill district which looks like there are castles up on the hillside. You can see Fishermans Bastian and the Buda Castle from here and the view of the Danube River is not to be missed.
Walk along the bridge and enjoy the view!. Take your time to walk along the bridge and enjoy its architecture and the view on Budapest it offers. Perfect for a romantic walk with your partner.
Nice, but less impressed I'd thought I'd be.. Nice bridge, but nothing major.The view from and around the bridge is impressive, but the bridge itself isn't wow.

You need to cross the bridge in order to get to the Castle. You need to cross the bridge (either by bus or on foot) to get to the Buda side. We walked and were nearly mugged. Two young girls were trying to open my bag and nearly took my purse while we were taking a photo. When I noticed a slight touch on my back, I turned around and they moved their hands away, then pretended to take photos by my side.I thank God for not losing anything, but will definitely be careful next time.

Bridge over troubled waters. what a great way to get from pest to buda with fantastic views down the danube and across to parliament buildings. you are kept away from the traffic by the suspension chains. beware of cyclists as they approach soundlessly.
Beatiful at night. It is a beautiful city sightseeing, particularly at night when is plenty illuminated. By the side, you can go down the stone stairs and reach the waters.
Cool. Again - not the best bridge i've ever seen but of course you can't go to Budapest without visiting it!

Walk across the Chain Bridge for amazing views of Buda and Pest.. The Chain bridge links Buda and Pest over the blue Danube. Picture-perfect lions guard each end and the bridge is beautifully lit at night. From the bridge you can reach the funicular that easily takes you up Castle Hill. On the pest side, the Chain Bridge leads you to Szent Istvan's Bazilika. Definitely worth a visit!
Worth the walk. An amazing bridge that takes you from Buda to Pest across the Danube river, stand and watch the boats go by. (be careful of cyclists)
could not see the joint.. Nice Bridge over the river good views of the Castle above as you walk over it, its hard to think it was built by a English man and the Germans blown it up in the war.

Chain Bridge. Nice construction but so are the other bridges in Budapest
Amazing view on Buda and Pest
Beautiful. When the lights come on around 7:30 PM, it is as if the whole river comes to life. have your camera ready and on low light settings. You wouldn't want to miss this.

Nice bridge but nothing to get excited about. It was a nice looking bridge and nice to take a picture of it as part of the city landscape. It was also a pleasant walk. But still I wouldn't say its something I got excited about.
The Restored Bridge. The Chain Bridge is one of several across the Danube River. Knowing it and all the other bridges were destroyed by the retreating Germans, it was rebuilt.
Good view. Beautiful spot to take pictures of both riverbanks - Buda and Pest, including the Castle and the Parliament house
Stunning and Beautiful. This bridge has to be walked along at night - bring your sweater and enjoy the beauty of the wonderful bridge

It's fascinating. Chain Bridge is really enchanting. Two statues of guarding lions are located on both sides of the bridge. From this bridge it's nice to enjoy in the view of Parliament building and beautiful Danube as well.
I like it.. Good connection between Buda and Pest for walkers. If you are close to it, understand it's name.

Really A Must-See. The Chain Bridge is one of the iconic symbols of Budapest. A walk across it will take you from the wonderful food and shopping of Pest to the Buda Castle area. The view of the bridge is spectacular and well worth the trip.

Great views. Crossing this bridge was one of my favourite parts of our trip, with both the views of Buda and Pest. Plus the magnificent views the bridge created in an evening from the Fishermans Bastion made our trip extra special.

Watch out for the cyclists. Everyone visiting Budapest will no doubt walk across the Chain Bridge with superb views of the River Danube and Castle District, Parliament etc. But do watch out for the cyclists! Try and walk to the side and be careful on the blind corners as some of them zip round at speed.
fantastic. view are stunning, highly recommended , especially at night

Chain Bridge. This is the bridge that takes you from the Pest side of Budapest over to the Buda side (did you know that Budapest is made up of two places?). It's huge, well constructed, and interesting especially if you don't offer see bridges or have to cross one
Iconic. Perhaps one of the most beautiful bridges in the city. Go at night when it is lit up for a particuarly wonderful sight
Very pretty, especially at night.. My hotel was on the Buda side of the city, so I enjoyed having to walk across the bridge at night to get back.
A great view. We walked across the chain bridge from Buda to Pest. Very interesting watching the happenings on the Denube.
Amazing. This is a MUST see. And not just during the day, it needs to be visited at night its awesome I spent quite a while here.

impressive bridge in budapest. An impressive bridge and a must whilst in budapest. It is located right in the centre of the city and useful when wanting to cross the river. A bit windy but a great place to snap some views of both Buda and Pest.

Lovely to walk & cycle. People were stopping to take photos, some were cycling.
We had lots of fun just walking, chatting and taking pictures on the Chain Bridge and at the banks of the river with the chain bridge behind.

Scottish Chain Bridge. Yeah it was built by a Scotsman.Adam Clark.He has a street named after him at the bridge too.Watch out for cyclists though as they don't use the roads but come up behind you at a ridiculous speed on the pedestrian walkway.

Really nice one. As other fellow reviewers have pointed out, yeah, it's only a bridge. True, but this one is especially majestic and really stunning. Try and take a stroll, especially if you're heading for the Castle Hill. You won't regret it, if only for the photo of the giant lions guarding the bridge.
Ok bridge. but prefer Szabadsag Hid, which is closer to Boheme Art Hotel, and is very pretty lit up at night!

A bridge-with nice views. The bridge itself isn't anything to write home about but you get some lovely views from it and as you'll no doubt be walking around anyway then this is definitely a place to come-especially at night.

A great walk. Iy is a great walk to cross the Danube by the Chain Bidege. From there yiu can take the funicular to the top of the Buda Palace, but be awrae of the closing times, otherwise you will need to walk oyour way up to the hill
Well... It is large and nice bridge. So what?. It is too long for travel between Buda and Pest sides by feet. Better use fine modern air-conditioned yellow tram
Not to miss. Well, no one can miss this one! Famous bridge over the Danube river.
a bridge. it is only a bridge,it is surely nice but just connects two borders. i liked it because is old and stylish.
just a bridges. Very important to budapest, but at the end of the day, it's just a bridge

Live up to its name!. The Chain Bridge is the first permanent stone bridge that connects Buda and Pest and truly is an important landmark of the Hungarian capital. It accomodates vehicles as well as a pedestrian walk on the sides. Photo tips: Take photos from the Pest side and the bridge is exceptionally pretty during the night when it is lit up with lights. You can't miss this when you are in Budapest
Looks like Hammersmith Bridge!. I think this is pretty over-rated until night time. Best seen lit up from the castle - magnificent!

It's a bridge but beautifully lit. It's a bridge. A fine bridge, but a bridge none the less. If you visit Budapest you can not help but see this bridge, and it helps to define a beautiful view of a beautiful city. It is conveniently located, and is safe to walk upon which is handy to do for touring and taking photos. During the evening it is lit to perfection, acting like a linking necklace of light between some of the major sites of the two sides. It's a handsome bridge with some nice detailing, one of the boxes to check for Budapest, but nothing more.

The little big bridge. It's not simply crossing the bridge, it's the great arm that joins the regions of "Buda" and "Pest". If you are making it by evening, you'll be struck it tracking but will not regret it for the view from the bridge. It's amazing and gigantic to experience how big the bridge is and the huge pillars that welcome you into it.
Can't even see the damage. The bridge is in excellent condition considering it was blown up by the Germans. We walked across it twice.

Every city seems to have a bridge.... If you are visiting many European cities, one thing that you will notice is that there usually is a river flowing through the middle and a grand bridge is crossing it. That being said, I absolutely loved this bridge. My friends went to the bridge at night and it was beautifully lit, and the lions at the beginning just add something special.

Beautiful view and a nice walk. walked from the high street in Pest across the bridge and to our hotel in Buda. A very nice walk, it's good to be on the Buda side for sunset as the setting sun lights up Parliament nicely...good photo opp! Right at the base of the bridge in Bude is the funicular up the hill...
Lovely at night. This is even more impressive at night when it is lit up!

Great night time scenery. The bridge is beautifully lit at night. Wrap up warm as the breeze on the bridge really hits you. Seems to be a top tourist spot as many there are many Chain Bridge souvenirs available while I was shopping in Budapest. Definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful, especially at night.. Walk over on one side and back on the other, especially at night - views back to Castle Hill, over to Gresham Palace, Parliament, all lit up at night.

Easily the most beautiful bridge of the known universe. It's very, very nice - and not very long! So you can cross it in no time, and if you enjoyed, you can do it again. When it's raining, this bridge is pushed into the tunnel under Castle hill, so it doesn't get wet. (Rumours in Budapest. :-P)

not so much. It is ok and useful since you cross the river on it to go to the fisherman and palace uphill but there is nothing that breathtaking about it. Let's just say it is not a Golden gate nor near to it.

So pretty!. So pretty a shame about the grafitti, loved the fact that it was walker and bike friendly, no one seemed to be in a hurry. Day or night the views are spectacular. Don't be put off by the subways at the ends of the bridges, they are well lit and well used.

A nice walk over the Danube.. I crossed this bridge in order to get from Pest to Buda's Castle Hill. It's a 5-10 minute walk where you can get great views of Buda, the Danube River, and Pest. I believe this is the first bridge to connect Buda and Pest.
Great bridge design by a great Scottish architect. Wide paths on both sides allowing room to stop and take photos
Not to be missed. Views are fantastic.............bicycles tend to fly by a lot though and you get a few stares from those that obviously own the bridge and resent you using it!

a walk into the past. It was an experience walking over the Chain Bridge as it is so wide and offers views of Buda and Pest that cannot be had from one bank. The walk also allows the Danube to be seen as a working river with lots of boats and sightseeing craft plying their trade. If possible, take the water bus that goes on land and into The Danube, an amazing experience.
Lanchid. It is instantly recognizable, like the Tower Bridge in London or the Brooklyn Bridge in New York

Beautiful bridge in Budapest one of the oldest. Budapest had several bridges crossing the Danube and this chain bridge had 2 loins at both end of the bridge. One of the oldest and possibly the first to be build, cars can go through and you can even walk across. I read that the light on the bridge won some awards for using the best eco saving lights that shone along the bridge. Everyone can reconise this bridge from the others.
Large and beautiful. This bridge connects the side of Buda and Pesta. It is infront of Four Seasons hotel and it is amazing during the night.

Crossing the Beautiful Chain Bridge. Friends from the U.S. were visiting me and we spent a day walking by the Danube and crossing the Chain Bridge and going into Buda for lunch. Took many wonderful pictures of the area and fell in love with the crossing of the Bridge. Just wonderful views of the River, Buda and Pest as we crossed and took pictures. Just totally relaxing.
Main point of interest - beautiful at night. If you have the chance, take a look at the bridge and the castle at night.

Worth the Trip. I had wanted to see the Chain Bridge before getting to Hungary and I was not disappointed. I walked across the bridge on a daily basis and found the views on either side of the bridge as well as on the bridge were amazing.

The best bridge. There are several bridges across the Danube, this is the oldest and has the most interesting architecture. From the Pest side this is the most interesting crossing on the way to castle hill.

Worth the Trip!!!. We went to Budapest for three weeks. Spending time visiting every attraction, and soaking in the culture, food, music, and especially the red wine for me, and the Stella beer for my wife.Because we were visiting from Saudi Arabia, we perhaps indulged in the "Spirits" more than we should of. (Alcohol is forbidden in KSA, yet everyone there has it!!) We walked from our hotel each morning, and would do three to five mile excursions, up to about lunch time. The walk to Chain Bridge took us through the town square and across the river Danube. The bridge is a work of art and an architectural marvel. This is one of the very unique things about Budapest. Each bridge across the river has a story and was monumental for its time.Well preserved and maintained. Breath taking views of it can be had from the castle/fort on the pest side.Adorned with statues and works of art, all along the walk to the bridge, every step was another opportunity for a photo.I would place Budapest as one of the top ten cities to visit in the world.Great spring weather, with no humidity and low amounts of people crowding.Be sure to NOT SNEAK onto the buses. They are cheap enough with an unlimited weekly pass. The fine for getting caught is higher than three weeks worth of passes!!
Just a beautiful bridge.. A beautiful quaint bridge filled with foot traffic, bikes, and cars overlooking the Danube River with gorgeous views of both Buda and Pest.
nice to see. a nice architectural work that can be a good resting point for taking photos while crossing the danube river

Lit up. Much more attractive at night. In day time gives a relaxing view of Danube, boats moving around, etc. but at night it is all lit up, you see the birds flying towards the lights, gives it an eerie sort of feeling.
Cool. It's a nice bridge, you have a beautiful view about the castle

Nice bridge. The bridge's both side has nice views and try to cross at night. When it lights on, it's so romantic and amazing. Summer, you have to wait after 10, cause day time is long and winter after 6.

Beautiful Bridge in the Centre of the city. It's a very beautiful bridge in the centre which is pretty to look at in both night and day. In order to fully appreciate this engineering marvel you really do need to take a walk on the bridge. Views from the bridge itself is very nice.

A Chain of history. One of the most beautiful of the bridges across the Danube, absolutely stunning when lit at night. The annual air race has the planes flying under this bridge requiring much skill and precision.
wow. It was beautiful to look at and the sheer magnatude of the construction of the bridge.
Don,t miss this!!!. Brilliant this is such a unique bridge - you can get some wonderful pictures from it and of it
OK,but other good things to see. The bridge was interesting, but there are other attractions and things to see in Budapest that I'd rate above it.

It's a bridge. you have to cross the Danube somewhere to get to castle hill area, so it may as well be here. It has pedestrian paths on either side that are open to cyclists and walkers alike, so it tends to get a bit crowded. Factor in a few beggars and it can get quite congested. If you want to take photos from the bridge, you might have to make it quick. The walkway is narrow and stopping will be another thing clogging the walkway.
What a beautiful bridge!!!. The bridge shows its true colours after dark.It's simply the best looking bridge over the Danube.
Beautiful landmark. Especially lovely at night, when lit up. Walking across, gives opportunity for a great view of the Danube.

The excuse for the tunnel behind it.. My friend told me that one of the rationalizations for the tunnel under Castle Hill was to store the Chain Bridge during the rain.
I also have a picture of my mom and I on the bridge in 1960.

Historical Landmark and Must-See in Budapest. For me, walking across Chain Bridge was a must as this bridge is a historical landmark in Budapest's history and spans across the Danube to link Buba and Pest together. It has a pair of huge stone lions on either side of the bridge - very impressive! From Chain Bridge, the view of the Danube and the landmark buildings on either side of the river is breath-taking. I walked across the bridge on my first morning in Budapest to get to the Buda side and see the attractions there. The next day, I took a bus from Roosevelt ter on the Pest side to Holy Trinity Square in Buda where Fisherman's Bastion is located in order to visit St. Matthias Church. It went across Chain Bridge and I got to see the panoramic views once again.On the Buda side the bridge leads to Clark Adam ter which is named after the bridge's builder.
Useful crossing.. Nice bridge to walk from Pest to Buda to take the funicular up the hill.

Walking across the bridge we could see the Danube – wonderful !!!!!. The Chain Bridge is a must for every visitor to Budapest: the bridge is significant in Budapest's history. Have wonderful sculptures , lions , my favorites.Walking across the bridge we could see the Danube – wonderful !!!!!And on the Buda side the bridge leads to the tunnel on Clark Adam - another significant sight and the - square - is named after the bridge builder
Lovely views from bridge!. It is a very pleasant walk across the bridge with beautiful views.
I love the chain bridge. The chain bridge is a lovely land mark. You can walk or take a bus across.
Not to be missed. An excellent structure shows how British technology once spanned the world

Outstanding feature. Walking across the Chain Bridge is a must for every visitor to Budapest: the bridge is significant in Budapest's history. And on the Buda side the bridge leads to the tunnel on Clark Adam ter - another significant sight (and the ter - square - is named after the bridge builder.
Brilliant especially at night.. We were delighted to see the Chain Bridge lit up at night and just sat and admired the wonderful view and then walked around the surrounding area of the Palace.
Beautiful. Lots of Artists. Lovely area. A must see. Check out Clock nearby. Worth the walk.
Inviting to cross. So inviting to cross because of the warm, romantic radiance
Gives a scenic view of the whole inner city. It's really nice, classicist bridge. Beautiful when illuminated at night.
must walk across more than once. nice view up the river to see the parliament, the castle and the hunted 4 season's hotel ;)
beautiful bridge. great bridge that span across the danube to link Buba and Pest together. It seem very well built and strong to handle the hustle and bustle of the traffic back and forth.
Gorgeous Bridge. This bridge is marvelous in both the daytime and in the evening. I loved exploring Budapest and discovering so many gems!

Excellent landmark. I crossed this bridge on foot several times and found it to be a nice experience as you can see both sides of Budapest. This walk is especially good at night with all the lights on in Buda and Pesta parts alike. The bridge is in excellent condition and the vehicle traffic is not a bother at all. Definitely recommend it!

Lovely!. Just walk the length of it or cycle! Get to the other side and walk or take the funicular up to the top of the castle hill. Better still take a free walking tour and discover the city with a guide!
Best at Night. One of the many bridges they have but gorgeous lighter up at night! ;)

Just walk!. We walked thru this bridge to many times to go to the Castle area. It is very crowd with tourist but it isn't a complain! Just too many admirers here and it was so hard to take pictures without these people on the back ground. Beautiful at night...very beautiful, Could stay at the bridge all night to enjoy little breeze thru your hair. OMG, whatelse do you ask for!

The romantic bridge. I happen to live next to the Brooklyn Bridge. So, me and bridges get along very well. The Chain Bridge is one of the more romantic bridges and picturesque bridges I have visited. The chain plate structure is interesting to see how they solved the problem of long spans before inventing spun wire cable suspension bridges. Gorgeous to look at and to look from.
The main landmark in Budapest, well worth a visit. The chain bridge connected both halves of the city and was a lovely walk from the hotel
Fantastic at Night. At must see on your next trip to Budapest. Especially at Night!!

One of the bridge. Ideal way to walk from/to Buda or Pest.
Good opportunity for taking pictures

A Beautiful Bridge. One of the most classic and beautiful bridge in europe actually, our local guide said that it would be soon closed for any vehicle crossing to maintain the condition and because it is actually to narrow. But I can say it is just as beautiful as classic bridges in Paris as example.
walk over it. a brilliant piece of engineering, visually stunning
Beautiful bridge. Walk across the bridge, especially at sunset is a must do.

First Buda-Pest link. Said to be of significant symbolic importance of linking the east with the west, the chain bridge was the first real permanent crossing between the two sides of Budapest. It clearly marks the time of industrialization with its many details in cast iron. It's a nice bridge to walk on and the best one to choose if your'e going up to the Castle area - preferably using the funicular on the bank at the Buda side.
amazing bridge. amazing bridge, really wish they had one in my town :)

Good but not Great. Nice bridge but on the scale of pretty European bridges this one ranks average to above average. It is smack in the middle of everything so you don't really have to plan to cross it. You just do. There are sidewalks that make it safe.
very nice.... gives that special shine to the city... great place to watch new years firework from...
In chains. We crossed it at least 4 times while in Budapest and had our New Year's Eve there!

Enjoy the breathtaking views of the city. Walk across the river on the chain bridge and enjoy the splendid view of both parts of Budapest. The mist creates a magical scenery. There's a great view of the Parliament from this bridge.

A Gem. The story of lanchid is famous enough and the bridge itself is stunning. It is one of the many unique architectural elements that makes Budapest one of the most attractive cities in Europe, despite the immense damage from WWII.
Nice view. Took the incline up the hill had a great view of the chain bridge.

excellent.... wonderful to see at night time with the lightings..a great piece of postcard for Budapest.... i think its the best of all the bridges that are on Danube.... i think Budapest scores over Vienna in this respect that Danube cross right in middle and that has given birth to such great bridges...

Great Morning Run. Did a Morning jog along the Danube, across the bridge toward the Gellert Hotel and back over the Chain Bridge to the Kempinski. One of the world's great bridges...free and worth walking across just to savour its magnificence...as well as views toward Pest and Buda.
Awesome. A Must see and Walk destination that has to be experienced during the night and day!
Nice for photo in the late afternoon. It's nice to cross the bridge after your visit to the Castle. Instead of taking the bus; walk down to the bridge and make a nice stroll to the city center.

Just along from the Carlton Hotel.. The buses stop at either end of the bridge so exploring is easy. The funicular railway and castle district are at one end and the city is at the other end. The bridge is impressive enough, but more when the sun goes down and it is lit up.
What's so special!. Just a suspension bridge using chains instead of cables - we've got those in Britain....

The most romantic place. The most romantic place to visit in Europe during winter, mostly at X-mas time, with all its stunning lights and the two lions at the beginning of the "promenade".
Highly suggested for a walk with everyone who you love (lover, family and friends!)

Surprisingly walk-able treat with great views at night!. This bridge, which connects the shopping areas of Pest with the Castle Hill area of Buda is remarkably good for walking back and forth. I stayed at a hotel at the foot of Castle Hill and would walk over to the shopping areas and as an easy way to get to the center of the public transit system.On the Buda side, the bridge terminates at the entrance to the funicular tram up to the old city area or, like me, you can easily take the walking paths that zig zag up the hill.Definitely take your camera with you at night and see the spectacular lighted views of the Parliament, Buda Castle, etc.

What a view from the oldest bridge. the bridge, the most magestic of several, links Pest and Buda. I crossed the bridge several times on foot as it offers a great view of the Buda and Pest areas on each side. The bridge starts near the Four Season hotel on the Pest side and lands on the Buda side near the lift which takes you up to the many Buda attractions on top of the hill.
i can look at it 24 hour a day.... at night the bridge with the lights on is extraordinary.......At midnight the lights are closed......

brilliant night time stroll. You get beautiful views all the way across the brigde both of buda and pest, "photo oportunity!" my favourite time at night when all the buildings are lit up. You get a good view of the bridge itself from the river cruise also good at night time.
Free and safe. Free. easy to get accross. Wide sidewalks. Things worth seeing at both sides
It's Easy. Don't miss it. It's a short, easy walk. The views are spectacular.
Wonderful. A very nice bridge between Buda and Pest, with a fantastic view on both parts of the city
Cool bridge. Pretty bridge in the heart of the city crossing the Danu. Great place to take pictures of or from.

Do Not Attempt When It's Wet - Slippery. Like the title. It was wet and cold and I took a couple steps onto the walkway and I almost slipped. Not feeling like a cold watery death I slowly walked back and took the metro. But it makes good pictures, of course from afar ;)
