The most beautiful bridge of the Budapest. It is the most impressive of the bridges of Budapest. It is very nice to see and have some photos of the bridge it through a river trip.
Night feature. Lit up at night, a beautiful sight but extremely cold to walk across in winter!

Good views of Buda and Pest, though the bridge itself is not extraordinary. Opened in 1849, it's historically important as the oldest bridge joining Buda to Pest, and the twisted chain cables holding up this suspension bridge are rather unusual. However, the views you'll get of both banks of the Danube are what make this bridge noteworthy. The bridge itself is overrated as a tourist attraction; for example, the stone lions at the end of the bridge, while large and well-sculpted, aren't unique in any way. As long as you don't get your expectations up, you'll enjoy walking across this heavily-trafficked bridge, which joins tourist-friendly portions of Buda and Pest. There is no fee for pedestrians to cross the bridge.

Fabulous. Unbelievably beautiful to cross over, especially at night. Safe and such a part of what is Budapest. Our first stop on our visit to this beautiful city! Great views of the Danube when crossing it.
A view you'll never forget. Take the time to check this bridge out. Actually, ALL of the bridges joining Buda and Pest are beautiful. Walked them at night. Great pics. Great memories
Neat Old Bridge. Loved to Lions guarding the bridge, and the story that the tunnel on the Buda side was built to bring the Chain Bridge in out of the rain!!!
Drive on it every day.... It never ceases to amaze me, no matter which direction one travels, the view is stunning! I am fortunate to be working in Budapest and am blessed to have this view daily!
Impressive. Impressive bridge with views up and down the Danube and both Buda and Pest sides of the river
very impressive. great to walk over, superbly lit up at night the view up and down the danube lovely
Green bridge. Very green indeed, could be use as one of navigation points
nothing great. just a bridge crossing danube river. a few shots and of you go

A Budapest Icon - Not to Be Missed. A trip to Budapest is not complete until you walk across this gorgeous bridge. The views of Buda and Pest are spectacular, and once you reach the Buda side, a darling funicular takes you to a vantage point with views up and down the Danube.
The site of many films. You must have seen the Chain Bridge in a film at some point. It's a pretty bridge that stretches between Buda and Pest and leads to the Buda Castle.
One of Budapest key highlights. Nice to walk over to reach Buda or Pest. Beautiful at night. Provides a strong character to the city
Especially Beautiful at Night!. Great place to get from the Pest side to the Buda side. It is especially beautiful at night!

it's a bridge. We walked across the bridge but it really is just another bridge. What was love
Y for us is that there is an identical bridge in Marlow in the UK albeit smaller.....Nice to be able to say I have seen both

Simply Beautiful!. You might want to read the history of this brige and its importance. Distroyed during the 2 world war because connectying the Est of Europe with the West, You find it just across the main Bazilica and very close to all the other nice attractions of Pest (Parlament, Liberty sq and much more) Visit it because it is worth it!!

Beautiful. Go after dark, when it's all lit up. For a good photo-op walk into the tunnel, be careful of the traffic, then shoot the bridge framed by the tunnel, preferably with a tele to make the bridge appear closer.

Nice Bridge. I'm not really sure how to rate a bridge (unless it's a shopping bridge), but this one is nice enough. Ample walking paths on either side make you feel safe, and it's a pretty stroll across the river. It does look very nice lit up at night.
Nice from a distance. Looks great from castle hill. Nice to walk across for the experience of walking acorss the Danube

Magnificent by night!. The bridge itself spanning the Danube is worth the visit. Very classical look.
But what makes this bridge the visit is the look it has after the lights of day go out. Its color looks magnificent with the floodlights bringing out every magnificent detail it has to offer.
Nice walk. Nice walk. At night it is stunning and quieter. Great opportunity for photos.
The lion bridge. Proud lions stand either side of this bridge, which was badly damaged in the war. The link between Buda and Pest.

A nice stroll. This bridge is a nice stroll from one side of the city to the other. On this visit we walked from Castle Hill and across in the evening and it provides a nice view of the city and back up to the hill.
Give it a look.
Massive and beautiful!. I loved the lions! Be sure to walk right up to them!
Beautiful bridge, during the day and during night. This bridge connects both parts of the city, Buda and Pest. You enter two different worlds, by using a beautiful bridge.
Great views!. Excellent bridge to either walk or run over, with great views of the beautiful city of Budapest.
First time is stunning!. Amazingly gallant bridge with pompous lions. Don't miss it by night, it shines beautifully over the Danube.
Link of Buda with Pest. Looking at the bridge from distant and close up never ceased to amaze and astonish us. We loved it day time and evening espcially when it was lit up.
Amazing!. I love this fabulous bridge! It's an engineering wonder.

It's a beautiful bridge at night when it's lit up. It offers a great view of the buda castle and the fisherman bastion. Worth the walk. It's one of the icons of Budapest, beautifully lit. And not too many pple

Over rated. Perosnally I didn't think the bridge was too interesting or beautiful. It probably looked best at night when lit. If you walk over it beware of the cyclists who whiz past on the shared footpath.

The best. We walked the bridge during the day and gazed at its beauty at night when it was lit up. Our cruise embarked from Budapest and the site of the Bridge lit up was one of the highlights of the entire trip.

a little disappointing. This bridge is regarded as the 'jewel in the crown' of Budapest's bridges, but in fact we preferred some of the other bridges - it was nice enough, but not stunning, as we'd expected!

Walking over the Danube. We took the rail that go from Buda castle down to the Danube and than passed the river over that bridge. It was kind of fun and we took beautiful pictures from the bridge of both sides of the city.

The Chain Bridge - Well Worth the Walk. Experience the Chain Bridge by walking its length...the views of the city are beautiful and you can see the detail of the bridge, which is almost a smaller version of the Brooklyn Bridge. If you are walking to the castle, etc. the funicular is at the foot of the Chain Bridge.
Nice walk. A bit of a long walk but worth it when you get to Buda
with 4 lions. This is the oldest bridge of Budapest. It has 4 lions, 2 on the Buda side, 2 on the Pest side. The miniature verion is somewhere in England. No stone lions in England...
Chain Bridge. A must to walk over. Fab views up river. Would have liked to have taken a river cruise but ran out of time.
Great Bridge connecting Buda and Pest Sections. Very interesting bridge connecting the Buda and Pest sections. Especially interesting when viewed at night from a boat on the Dabube.

a must walkway across the danube. by day by night, it's always a pleasure to walk acroos the Chain bridge, the colours change with the time of day, but a must at night when lit and the city buildings lit also
Not a big deal.. Like some others who have seen many, many famous bridges throughout the world, I found nothing remarkable here. Sorry.,
Iconic Landmark. A beautiful practical structure with so much history and it's still in use today. Fantastic to look at from a distance or walk across(Just be aware of the cyclists).

Legend has it.... that the architect/designer of the bridge, was so proud of if, he said if anyone finds anything wrong with it, he would kill himself. Turns out that all 4 lions at each end of the bridge are lacking tongues. It is unknown if he actually comitted suicide. But it is a cool story my Auntie told me once. One of my most favorites sights in all BUD. Not to be missed at night. Go to one of the other bridges to get the full view of it. Amazing. I lived in BUD for 5 years and was amazed every evening on the ride home of the beauty of the place.We were fortunate enough once to be able to climb to the very top of the bridge, we have a friend who does pyrotechnics, and they were setting up for a show, he took us up. Unfortunately this was before cell phone cameras became so popular. It was awesome.

main attraction to view both side. nice to make a trip here different time of the day , day and nite to view the scenery from both side, also the place to take the short tram ride to the hill top of castle.
Walk across an old bridge. which is not really original, since the Nazis destroyed it in retreat. I'm sure it meant a lot in the economics of the time, but we simply needed to get to the other side.

Lovely Walk. To walk from one end o the other seems daunting at first, but once on the bridge, it is an easy stroll with photographic opportunities. This bridge connects Buda to Pest and is also a must for evening photographs.

Stunning at night.. Loved Chain Bridge illuminated at night, loved the Lions, the river just magical.Definetly to be seen at night very romantic and do take n 2 Tram u get amazing views of the bridge from it and the river.
View is Fantastic. Nice romantic walk with great views over the Danube and Castle district
Beautiful bridge. Crossings on the way unto Castle Hill. Great views of Danube

Great Location and Lots to See. We stayed at the Four Seasons hotel which is all of a 30 second walk to the bridge which was very handy for us. A number of reviewers have said "it's just a bridge" and it is & the design is not overly impresseive. What makes the Chain Bridge special is it's location which links Buda and Pest and whilst on the bridge you have fantastic views of a number of special sites that you will probably visit whilst in Budapest.Do visit at night as well as daytime as all of the prime sites are lit up and the views are rather special especially if you are a romantic.
Beautiful. Nice place to walk, connects Pest (Roosevelt Square) to Buda (in front of Funicular, who brings you to Castle).Not very impressive, but very beautiful.

It's just like the one in Marlow - but bigger.. Yep, as some other reviewers have said, it's just a bridge but let's not forget when it was built which makes it a pretty good example of early engineering. Definitely worth walking across and if you know the Marlow bridge across the Thames, worth comparing the two. Don't forget to check out the tunnel entrance on the Buda side, also desinged by Mr Clark. There are prettier, more impressive bridges around the world but it's still worth seeing.Here's the history lesson if you're interested: Tierney Clark designed four suspension bridges: at Hammersmith, Shoreham, Marlow and, the largest, at Budapest. Only the Marlow and Budapest bridges survive. The Budapest bridge is known as the Széchenyi Chain Bridge and is named after Count István Széchenyi who, in 1839, invited Tierney Clark to design and build a bridge across the Danube. It was the first permanent bridge across the Danube below Vienna since Roman times. Destroyed in World War II, it has since been faithfully reconstructed. The main span is 666 feet long; for a time the longest in the world. A plaque (unveiled in May 1998) on the Széchenyi Chain Bridge commemorates the link with Marlow Suspension Bridge
a really pretty place to stroll and take photos. This is such a pretty bridge, very unique and yet strangely familiar, with great views - I really don't care that it's a reconstruction!

Nice bridge, but better to look at from a distance. The Szechenyi Chain Bridge is a bridge that spans the Danube linking Buda to Pest. The bridge was built by William Tierney Clark, a Scottish engineer, in 1849, but was severely damaged in the Siege of Budapest, and reopened in 1949. This is a nice bridge but I think it is better to look at it from Castle Hill, or along the Danube. You get quite a good view of Parliament, but it is better to look at it from Castle Hill. It was also quite windy on the bridge. You can't really see Budapest without going over this bridge, but I didn't find it incredibly spectacular.

The Brooklyn Bridge of Budapest. Budapest's Chain Bridge, designed by Scottish engineer Adam Clark, is a breathtakingly beautiful bridge across the Danube at a gorgeous spot between Buda and Pest. (This is of course the second version of this bridge. The original was blown up by the Nazis during WWII. Fortunately it was rebuilt faithfully to the original) This bridge is very pedestrian friendly and is particularly beautiful at night.

Lovely. I was in a hotel just beside it, so i really enjoyed the walk across it, with people biking along it. it's amazing! don't forget to walk the hill (do not take the expensive finikler) there are stairs after it that take you take the top of of the hill where you can continue walking to the castle.
It's a bridge. Maybe I have been spoilt by the bridges in London but this is not what I was expecting. Some lovely views but not massively impressive

Why such hype, bridgewas completely rebuild after the war and is not that impressive.. This experience seems highly overrated to me. The bridges over the Danube were all blown-up during the war and have been rebuilt. The lions were not on the original bridge before the war and don't really add much. All in all cross this as you will need to go to the castle but not worth spending a lot of time.

Impressive bridge. This is a very impressive bridge and it is really worth it to walk on it. Make sure you won't miss the view during the night from the Castle district and don't forget to take a photo next to the huge Lions.
Romantic especially at night. Lovely view on the Castle Hill and Gellert Hill. Only a short walk from Pest to Buda. Choose the Southern side as it is not that windy.
Fun to walk across!. The Chain Bridge is fun to view during the day and at night. The bridge is open to vehicles, however, there is a path for pedestrians to walk between Buda and Pest.

Pretty. The bridge itself isn't spectacular because it is open to traffic so there aren't vendors or anything along the way. But you get great views of the city. The bridge itself is great to see from different areas of the city. More importantly, it is the most convenient link for Buda and Pest. You will probably wind up crossing this bridge many times when you are in the area.
Beautiful at night and walkable by day. I don't think you can miss it if you go by the Danube.

So Picturesque. This bridge is walkable and provides great views. Many times there are festivals or people selling things day or night. Walking in Budapest is a great way to get around and see the city. Make sure you plan a night-time stroll along the Danube and across the Chain Bridge.

Great view, walkable.. Buda to Pest is a short walk. We stayed in Pest, and walked right over, and then took the furnicular up to the Castle District. If it's crowded there isn't much walking room at times. Go early, or late and you will be find. If visibility is good, you have a great view of Parliament and the National Gallery. A beautiful walk no matter which direction you are travelling.

Oldest chain in Budapest...worth the walk!. Even before leaving for Budapest, I couldn't waited to see the Chain Bridge. Is the oldest bridge over Danube and Impressive!!! Take a photo with the lions at each end and have fun walking while watching the city. If you go up the Castle Hill, you can catch a beautiful view of the Chain Bridge as well.
